reviews.review: Reach airport in 30 Minutes. Best way to reach airport from the heart of the city at only 40 Bhatts. Peak hours will be hectic to travel

Highly efficient, clean, and safe. Bangkok is certainly a rising supercity and it's train system reflects this. Fast, very clean, security guards easily spotted and low fares. Plus their in-carriage system of showing where you are on your journey and what stops you have coming up are brilliant!
Very good value. Used the rail link for the first time on this trip - impressed with how cheap it was. Was able to change to mrt at makkasan station and get to sukumvit easily.
Fast and easy to use. Very easy to use the ticket machine and its a great way to use your change up! Staff are friendly and answered my questions in English.

Best way to get out of the airport . Regular clean and cheap, the 3 words that come to mind when I think of this train, if you are staying in bangkok, even though only limited stops, it will get you thru most of the traffic and even if you have to get a taxi at the other end will save both time and money in getting to your destination, it links with the other 2 modern rail systems mrt and bts so most places a tourist would want to go are reachable... it's also nice to see that there is no premium or increased fares just because you are leaving the airport.. on the negative side though the ticket system is different for each of the 3 rail networks so if you need to connect with one of the other lines you would have to buy 2 different tickets, this we are promised will be amended by mid 2017...

Super convenient and very low fare. Super convenient, terminal to terminal only THB45, 30 mins ride. After exiting the custom, just take the elevators down to the lower level, and the train station is there.have space for large luggage. There are two stations can transfer, to city metros, one for metro underground and terminal station for BTS.
cheap, efficient airport to city transportation. modern, affordable and clean transportation system connecting the airport to the city center. trains go within a reasonable time frame

Fast and hassle-free way to get downtown. It might be a long walk to finally get on the train, but if you don't have too much luggage to haul around, def the easiest way to get downtown. Especially if you can get easily irritated by taxi drivers after just landing after a long flight

great service from the airport. I only took the rail link from Bangkok to the airport but it is economical (45baht one way) and took about 40 minutes. It does get a bit congested with all the people and their suitcases but well worth it.

Best way to travel to the city. Ive been travelling to Bangkok for 6 years now and I would always use the Airport Rail to get to BKK.Its cheaper than a cab and quicker.Download the maps to your phone before you go to show where to get your connecting train if you are heading to Sukhumvit for example.Dont be scared. Do it once and you will be fine with the Airport Rail
Cheap and nice. Its cost about 30-40 baht per person. Station was normally not full with seats available.. ( at least during experience)

A convient cheap alternative to taxi to/from Suvarnabhumi Airport.. I tend to avoid taxi's in Bangkok. I use my own motorcycle traveling around Bangkok. The MRT, BTS and Airport Link are great ways to travel around town. The Airport Link does not have great directions for tourists, but Thai people are generally friendly & helpful. I have used this train a few times, I catch it at Rachadaphisek Rd (Phetchaburi Station) and it ends inside the basement of the airport terminal.

Crowded. This costs an extra 45 baht (about €1) to use. It goes to Suvarnbhumi, but there are seven stops on the way. It looks like all the students live at the last stop before the airport, it was that crowded!
No Hassle. the cheapest way to go to bangkok. so comfort. I stayed in pratunam ..walking this distance to all shopping mall.
Works on timr. Trains are clean safe and on time. Beats using a taxi unless you are overloaded with luggage. Excellent value for money.
Beyond expectation. When I tried the buses in here, I expected the Airport Rail Link to be the same (sticky atmosphere, hot, and old facilities). However, it was totally opposite and very punctual.

Quick to avoid traffic. Not suited to large amounts of luggage but suits single or couples with a hotel close to Makkasan or MRT or BTS station. They run about 4 to 5 trains per hour so reasonably frequent if somewhat crowded with large amounts of Thais taking the train at the first stop. About 25 minutes to Makkasan station which connects to Phetchaburi MRT after 5 min walk.. Convenient

Convenient and very affordable. Convenient and very affordable, I will definitely use again and again, if you go to center of Bangkok, you can take this Airport Rail Link first and call taxi later, faster and also cheaper..

Fast transport between the Suvarnabumi airport and Bangkok. This was a very cheap and efficient way to get from the airport to the city and back. The train is very clean and comfortable with enough room to take your luggage. It takes about 35-40 minutes between the airport and Phaya Thai station where you can take the BTS to other parts of the city. I stayed at a hotel in SIlom and getting there cost me BHT45 on the Skytrain and BHT31 on the BTS to Chong Nonsi which is a lot cheaper than when I took the taxi the last time which cost more than BHT400. The travel time was less than one hour which was shorter than the taxi ride which was about 1 1/2 hours. This is definitely a fast and efficient way to travel between the airport and the city.

Easy to use. I travel to Bangkok frequently and always use the Airport Link. Yes, there are times when it is crowded but somehow people always managed to make room for others. I think the cost is very good and would recommend this to anyone who wants to travel quicker.
quick mode of travel to most areas of Bangkok. This isoften the quickest way to get from the airport to central Bangkok ( dense traffic jams occur in the city)

Cheap and fast. Only 45baht and 30min. from Suvarnabhumi to the center of Bangkok. Very easy to purchase tickets from automats.
Be sure to keep your token with u all the way - You will need it when you exit the station.
Easy as getting the bus!. Used this to travel to and from the airport rather than use the taxi's as the roads are constantly gridlocked, found it easy to navigate and get around. Superb.

Cheap and efficient at to Bangkok.. If only my fellow countrymen could learn from this state owned transportation. London to Heathrow almost twenty tims the cost and not as good. Buy a token and thirty mins later you are in Bangkok. When getting to the airport, remember it starts at 6am, also can be busy in evenings around rush hour so factor some extra time.
Quick and clean. Able to travel to airport on your own is a big bonus! Travel was quick in a clean train. Best way to go from and to Airport.
Save money take the train. I have used the train from the airport on my last two trips to Bangkok. I find it easy to use and is quicker than a cab plus saves some Baht for the trip.
Best way to get to the city. I'm always lazy and wanna take the cab, but considering the traffic this is the easiest way to get into the city.
Nice. Cheap, easy and comfotable way to get to the city. Espessially if you have big luggage on your back.

A fast and i expensive way to travel to central Bangkok. Just a very easy way to get from the airport to central Bangkok. You can access the train inside the airport terminal. If you go to the sukhumvit area, stop at Makhasan station.

Faster and cheaper than a taxi. Very efficient service to the Suvarnabhumi airport starting from Phraya Thai station. Self-explanatory ticket vending machines but there is also a counter where you can get additional information if needed.
Wouldn't spend money on a cab if you can get to the airport efficiently for 45 baht per person.
Best way to move in busy city. Doesn't matter if you are in a budget trip or not. Is the best way and very easy to learn or by map.

Very convenient way to get to and from the Airport to the City. Easy and convenient to use. Clean. A little crowded since the stops are a little longer than BTS, but for airport goers, it's easy and convenient.
Fast. I already ride this train for 3 times. Is fast, better than bus because we don't know traffic is unpredictable.

The most fast, convenient , safe way between Airport and city. This the best way travel between Airport and city without worry about the super heavy traffic in Bangkok and the dishonorable taxi driver!!
Highly efficient, only insufficient seats.. Enjoy the bliss travel on the Rail Link. Love the fusion announcement on the rail. Will return again....

Quick way to get into City. Nice clean and reliable train service to Bangkok center . rather than getting struck in Bangkok traffic, its better to take it to Phaya Thai station and then make your way to your destination.
Ticket costs 45 Baht from end to end (Phaya-Thai to Airport).
Convenient but a little crowded!. The fastest way to get to the city, it took about 30min only. The train cart is a little crowded when everyone is bringing a luggage. Other than that, it's all good.

Perfect transport from airport to Bangkok centre.. A perfect way to travel from the airport to Bangkok centre. Cheap (THB 35 - 45 p.p), clean, fast and with good connections with the Metro and skytrain. Easy acces, also with suitcases on wheels or backpacks. More crowded after a few stations

Quick and cheap way into town. When you're booking a hotel, booking near this line will make your life easier.
It start at the airport and is easy to use.
It's a bit of a shock to the system to see Bangkok for the first time outside the station in the city, but we had a short walk straight to the hotel.
Very easy. Handy, clean and very easy, it takes you about 40 minutes to reach the airport without the transfer.

Super efficient, very cheap. Travelled from the airport to Phaya Thai (the last stop in the financial district) in less than 30 mins. Was super quick and clean. Also easy to buy tickets at both the airport and Phaya Thai. Can switch to the skytrain at Phaya Thai to go on elsewhere if you need to do so. According to timetables I saw online, it runs every 15 mins, but honestly the 3 times I took it, it didn't feel like I had to wait ages for it although still worth checking out the timetable if you need to ensure you get your flight on time. It's a massive shame it just isn't longer and goes near the tourist hotspots in Bangkok.A one way ticket cost us 45 baht each - unbelievably cheap!
fast and helpful. It will be more helpful if connects (not going out the building anymore) to both mrt and bts yet it still efficient and fast.
Ride to Bangko. A cheap and quick way to enter Bangkok. Better than taxi for first time travels here. A great place, but it does take a few days to get used to this fast massive sized city.

excellent rail link. This is an excellent link to Downtown Bangkok from the airport. We stayed in Pratunam and we were there in no time at all. It was the same on our return. Well done Bangkok. I have previously spent hours in Taxis sitting in endless traffic.

Easiest & fastet way from / to the airport BKK. Just walk down from the arriving hall... it's that simple! Pay 45 Baht for the slower or 90 Baht for the faster train with less stops. Usually the train first leaving will arrive first. If you go to the center of Bangkok, just take this train to the last station & take a taxi from there. It will be much faster & cheaper. Insist that the taxi uses the meter... Never take a taxi driver who is hunting tourists...

Airport Rail Link. Well if you dont mind hassel of luggages or arrived early in Bangkok or budget concious, you can opt for the Airport Rail Link. It will take you to Phyai Thai where you can transfer at the interchange by BTS or other mode of transport.

The easiest way into BKK by far. Having never used the Rail Link in all my travels, I was convinced by my colleague to try. He was right. Descend into the bowels of Swampy and buy a token (with friendly staff to assist). The trains are every few minutes, clean, but can be busy.Once in town it is easy to jump in a cab to your final destination and much better than messing around in terrible BKK traffic into town.Worth doing, and will save hours in time and effort.
Good connection to downtown Bangkok!. The best way to reach down town Bangkok, quick and cheap,single ticket is less than 2€$. The train is new, clean and with AC.

Fast, reliable, cheap. This is a very good way to travel between downtown Bangkok and Suvarnabhumi Airport. I recommend not to use the airport link if you have heavy or big luggage as some carrying may be necessary at the stations

fastest way to central Bangkok. Airport rail link is good way to get to city, it 's on the basement of the airport, buy ticket from ticket machines or at the counter less than 40 baht depend on the station. It clean, cool, fast and less expensive than taxi.

Better than a Taxi!. Airport Rail link is on the basement level of the airport. Ticket machines are automated and trains leave about every 15-20 minutes. Trains are clean and quick - way better than the traffic of Bangkok. Crosses two interchange stations.

Great to go to the Koh Sam road. When arriving at the airport just follow the signs to the train. Go to the terminal station ( if you have a bit of cash around 100 bath it is enough over wise change at the airport) when you arrive take the pedestrian bridge to exit A then at the bottom cross the traffic light turn left direction to bus stop 800 yards take the 79 or 511 30 baths then stop at the columns after the temple on your left inside , or ask the driver they know , then cross the road and walk forward to a tragic light , take the busy little street on your right and first on the left then you're arrived good luck

Fantastic public transport system.. Sky train direct from the international airport into central Bangkok, fantastic system. Half hour trip into the city centre all for less than a pound. Clean, cool, fast and efficient public transport, puts the Heathrow and Victoria Express systems (and London underground) to shame in almost every respect. It connects with the underground system that will take you further afield in Bangkok. Not been to Bangkok for over 20 years but the expanding public transport network has made a huge difference, is first class and exceptionally cheap to use.
Fast and Easy. This is absolutely the cheapest, safest and simplest way to leave the airport and to return to the airport.

Cheapest way of getting to town from the airport. A taxi will charge you about 600 Baht. The airport rail link costs about 150 baht to get to the heart of Bangkok. You would have to change trains at junction(s), but it is really easy and convenient even with large suitcases. And safe. Runs from 6 a.m. to 11 p.m.

Fast & Reliable But No Lonnger Express. The relative Airport Link is a breeze to useThe line was designed to run two services1. Non-Stop Makassan Airport Express 15 Mins2. Local stopping service 20 MinsBut these days only a stopping service is provided ( Despite still being advertised)A perfect alteritive to Bangkok TaxiJimHill

There are 2 Rail Services. This can be a bit of a trap. There is a fast non stop service but it terminates at a station that lacks connections.Then there is the all stops version (at a fraction of the cost of the fast service) that connects to the Skyrail.But you need to schlep your luggage between end of airport line and Skyrail, and buy another ticket at Skyrail ticket office.
Easy and Convenient. Easy access transportation from airport to city vise versa. and it is clean, cheap fare and nice. friendly staff

Perfect rail link. Trains are modern, very clean and frequent.They are easy to access and the stations are well sign posted.When you are on the train they are very imformative.There are 2 lines and trains.The 1st stops at all the stations from Bangkok city to the airport <--> and the 2nd is non stop from the airport to Bangkok city <->

Quick way to centre city: air-conditioned, clean and fast!. It is a very fast means of transportation to centre city: air-conditioned, clean and fast! If your hotel if far from a train or BTS station and you have heavy suitcases, it is still better to take a taxi from the hotel, as a long walk with heavy luggage in the Thai heat might negate the benefit of getting into the city centre rapidly.
Quick and convenient. Quick, clean and easy to use. About 40THB from the airport to the city centre. Air con and signs and announcements in Thai and English.

It's ok if your on a short layover. Ideal if you have a few hours to spare waiting for a connecting flight. It's a hassle with luggage if you need to change trains to go to other parts of Bangkok. Better to take a taxi if your staying a few days

Very much convenient than other transport.. We used this airport rail link to go to our hotel. It requires to interchange to go to Sukhumvit but it's very cost effective, cheap. And also we enjoyed the journey with carrying the luggage through the stairs. Because that was very tough job.

Cheap fast alternative to airport. To get to the central area of Bangkok travel from airport to station Phaya Thai for 45 baht , change to the BTS line to station Siam (you need to buy a separate ticket ) from Siam you travel to other BTS stations or get a taxi

Convenient mode of transport from Suvarnarbhumi Airport to the city. We had been using the airport rail link a few times already whenever we go to Bangkok arriving at Suvarnabhumi Airport. It is cheap and convenient. It's costs 45 Baht from airport to Phaya Thai station and from there transfer to the BTS. On our recent trip we had to alight at Chidlom BTS and the one way trip from Phaya Thai BTS to Chidlom BTS costs 25Baht. For each passenger traveling from the airport to Chidlom costs a total of 70 Baht. For 2 pax is 140 Baht so that is so much cheaper than taking the taxi, minus the traffic jam. However the only downside is most of the BTS in Bangkok has no escalator to the street level so we have to carry the bags down the flight of stairs. Arriving into Bangkok and taking the train is okay as the luggage is still light. However if you are departing from Bangkok and after a shopping spree, taking the train may not be too convenient as you have to carry the heavy luggage up the stairs to the BTS station and maybe platform.

Easy ride to the city. Because my son arrived a day ahead he had researched the train to downtown. It was no trouble to find our way late night to downtown the train is clean and quick. Good directions as long as you know your stop comfortable and safe and inexpensive

Great way to get into Bangkok to avoid peak hour traffic. The Airport express train is no longer running but the standard trains which are regular and stop at a few stations (to both to connect to Sky train and MRT) are a very convenient way to get into Bangkok especially during periods of heavy traffic. At normal times Taxis can get you to downtown Bangkok in little over half an hour but in busy times this can take hours. The sky train gets you to the MRT or Skytrain in less than half an hour. Service is efficient and regular and very cheap! Trains are basic but work well
Easy and Cheap. I think it's the best way to reach BKK city center. Good trains, with air condicionated. When I went, the express line was closed but no worries, the red line is very fast too.

Fast, clean and no traffic jams. Straight from the airport into the city with no fuss. Fast, clean and no traffic jams. Inexpensive too. At Phaya Thai there appeared to be no integration with other public transport which is a pity.
My preferred way to travel to town. Safe, clean and cheap travel. 40baht and 20minutes to get me to pratunam area. No more traffic jams.

most cost effective way to arrive in Central BKK. The rail system in BKK is excellent. Starting from your arrival to BKK. No need for a Taxi. You sit in traffic just like you would Tokyo, New York, London or Paris.. The AIRPORT LINK is clearly marked located at the bottom floor. Easy to access. Local's are very helpful and speak English and several other languages as well. Once your off the Airport link you can catch the BTS (skytrain) or the MRT (subway). Get you within walking distance to your hotel. Quick and Cheap! Best way to travel in BKK

Fuss free transport. By far the easiest way to get to the city from Bangkok airport. The trains start from the lower floors of the airport and you are in the heart of the city in approximately 40 minutes. It's cheaper to take a cab though if you are a group of 4 people.

Its good, fast and an alternative to a taxi....BUT..... The Airport link is a welcome alternative to travel from Suvarnabhumi (BKK) to the city.Its fast, clean and cold war Eastern European comfortable. Yes, its NOT that comfortable.It also stops at a number of stations where commuters board the train, so sometimes, particularly after a long flight, you just want to get to your hotel and the stops become frustrating.There is also an unbelievable lack of escalators and elevators, so IF you have luggage that you may struggle with carrying up or going down stairs, take a taxi.Finally, whenever I travel out of BKK (often) I very rarely use the ARL. Its just simply not that convenient and the cost of the taxi makes it a more comfortable alternative, even with traffic problems.

Way cooooool. You need to be "on the ball" to work out which train to take, the language barrier sometimes is frustrating but ASK and you will be helped by very friendly locals. Cool train ride - did this a few times and worth travelling each time.

Easy Access to the City. It makes access from the Airport to the city easy and fast. There are times it can get crowded, and so I think they need to increase their capacity. Nevertheless, it makes things faster, easier and cheaper.

Airport rail link. The airport rail link was easy to locate and identify by the large signs available along the airport walkways. It is located at the basement of the airport. On the way down, there were food outlets and a Seven Eleven store. The place was wide and spacious.

alternative way to get downtown. I have used this several timesGood part is that it is inexpensive and keeps you away from freeway/road trafficBad part-if you have bags, transferring from the express train to the Skytrain isn't easy due to lack of escalators..you have to care the bags down a flight of stairs to get to the transfer point

Easy to use. I flew in from Koh Samui and used the airport rail link to get into downtown Bangkok and then connected to the BTS Sky train. It stops 6 times before it arrives downtown and costs just 45 baht. It takes about 40 mins. It tends to be busy and no storage space for luggage. I would use again in a heartbeat, when returning to Bangkok.
Bts to airport. Oh its a very nice public tranaport service we can avoide traffic jam and can reached airport in time without any tention

Great way to get into town. It is perhaps the most convenient way to get to the heart of the city. Because it is a regular commuter service, the trains could be crowded but sure it beats wading through usually clogged Bangkok roads.
mrt. the mrt ,underground airport rail linjk meets with bts skytrain and is rapid clean comfortable and has adeqate seating

Easy and cheap way to get to centre of Bangkok. Easy, cheap and very straightforward way how to get from BKK airport to city centre without being ripped off by taxi drivers... Train runs every 15 minutes and takes about 30 minutes to get to city centre!

Fast and cheap. We once again picked the rail link to take us in to the city and having discovered a stop closer to our hotel it made even more sense than a limo or taxi. The station is easy to locate on the lower level at the airport. Fee is nominal and last train leaves station at midnight. We got off at Mattawan Station found a cab stand at ground level and were at the hotel in less than an hour from the time we left the airport. Very smooth and successful. If you wanted you could also have connected connectted with the Metro or Sky Train. Very fast, safe and efficient way to get to the city.

Convenient. 1st time taking Airport Rail Line to Westin Grande Sukgumvit. It's much convenient than what we expected. We usually take taxi to hotel. But there was long queue for taxi. So we thought we tried rail line to Makkasan and transferred to MRT. Costs are much cheaper than taxi and no worry for traffic jam or being over charged. We'll take Airport Rail Line from now on.
Fast and Comfortable. Great way to get into the city from the airport. Cheap, fast, and comfortable. Strongly recommended. Much easier than some cities' rail links.
Train every 15 minutes. Takes approximately 30 minutes on the city line from airport to phaya thai station. Very clean, fast and efficient.

perfect. This is the fastest, cheapest and cleanest so as safest way to move from town to airport. I can not understand why people take expensive taxi including rip off guarantee instead of taking the much faster way with airport rail link. This is easy to hop on and off and always right in time with no delay.
Airport trsnsport. Best alternative to taxi from airport. 6am till midnight all indoors so no worry about rain. No tipping. And it connected to BTS and MRT
Good. Easy to access many locations from airport. The price is cheaper for transportation. Suggest to take map from metro or in the airport before you travel. So you can plan your trip easy.

Fastest cheapest best way to get to and from the airport. If you are not being picked up and you have only one bag/suitcase then this is the fastest way into the city. From there you will have only a short taxi ride to your hotel. Only use metered taxis and never use tuktuks as they are all part of a criminal scam to prey on tourists. Tuktuks are also expensive with a minimum fare of about 200 baht to cross the road.

conforable from airport to bangkok center. I think it so conforable. I took the Airport link to the hotel at airport link rachaparong.
just 20min from airport.

Best option to take. It's cheapest, fastest , most convenient, avoid traffic jam of the city. However, please be advised that you should consider taxi rather than Airport Rail Link if you have heavy luggage and traveling alone.

Bangkok Airport to Hotel to Airport. I used this rail upon arriving at the airport directly to my hotel in Pratunam. Everything was a breeze. NO hassle in traveling from the airport to hotel and back to the airport. As long as you have a handy luggage, no problem walking from the rail station to the hotel. I would definitely use this rail again when I go back to Bangkok this November.

Crowded and slow. Its been a few years since we have been to Bangkok and we were very disappointed the express train from the airport to Makassan station has been discontinued. Although cheaper, the city line is very crowded and stops at all stations. Taxi may now be a better option, despite the gridlocked traffic.

So easy to use!. After visiting Bangkok for so many years, this was the first time using the Airport Rail Link. It is very easy to navigate, clean and inexpensive. Typically we pay up to 400 bht to get to a hotel, the link cost 90 bth.

Expedient means between Suvarnabhumi Airport & Bangkok City Centre. Clean, cheap, convenient and an expeditious means to get to airport or from the airport with more predictable travelling time from the heart of Bangkok city centre. However, the airport rail can be crowded. In addition, transfer to/from the Bangkok BTS may be more challenging if you are travelling with large suitcases.
Airport to centre of BK. Clean, efficient, easy to work out and fast. What can I say, it's a train, but its a good one I guess.

So easy peasy. I decided to forgo a taxi and try my first time on the train from the airport to Nana where my Hotel was. Its so ready to navigate and cheap as chips. $1.50. You get tokens to feed the barrier and you're away. Fast and regular. All the train systems right to the river work this easily.

Use It. This is the fastest and most efficient way to the airport. Taxi's will rip you off. An average cost from the Sukhumvit area by taxi is 500 baht. On the rail it will be approximately 50 baht. Avoid the taxi's if possible.
Tedious. Not enough frequency and jam packed during peak hours for people not even travelling to the airport. Phaya Thai station can't even accommodate the rush hour commuters.
Fast, easy and cheap . Really a fast and cheap way to travel from or to the airport. I have been several times in Bangkok and used the rail many times, it never disappointed me.

Slow and unreliable. Unless you have a plenty of time, just take a taxi. The service is ok and at a reasonable price if you travel solo. Waiting time might be up to 30 minutes and the station is not air conditioned.
The airport link connects to the convenient BTS line, which is the only reason why you might want to use it.

Easy way to get in city. This the most fastest and easiest way to get in city.only drawback is it doesn't operate during night time.So if ur reaching bangkok after midnight u have to take a taxi.or else this is the cheapest way to get in city as compared to taxi fares in bangkok.
get a day ticket. however few journeys you make a day ticket is much more convenient as the queues are less and you do not need coins. The elevators are at the end of the platforms
Like Bullet train. Amazing experience from airport, very fast just few minuted to city center. And very cheap. If u have 1 luggage can go try right from inside the airport.

Convenient. Convenient way to travel to and from the airport. Very inexpensive. You can connect to the MRT and the BTS Skytrain. The frequency also is a plus. The trains are very clean the stations as well.

Save time and money from Airport to Downtown.. Airport Rail Link is a modern over ground railway to take you closer to your destination if it is a hotel in the downtown area. It only costs a $1-2 and is very fast albeit it has a few stops (4-6) before arriving at a junction so you can change trains to get closer to your hotel. Makasaan is the name of the station where I always changed train for the final mile to my hotel (Red Planet).

Busy. By using this service you are saving money and with unpredictable traffic also time. But it can get very busy and standing for 50 mins after a long journey wasn't my idea of fun.You then need to change to a bts train so if your caring luggage of any weight I'd opt for the taxi.Otherwise it's clean efficient and easy to use.

The link between the Airport and downtown Bangkok. For tourists who arrive at Suvarnabhumi International Airport and get to the downtown Bangkok is the best cheap and safe way as many airport in the world. A short ride to and from the airport coming every 10 minutes I guess.
was good. That was easy for take this transport and faster than bus .we are take the train from bangkok to border .

Ease of use. Only started using the Airport Rail LInk very very recently so am unaware of how it has performed in the past, but it is simply FAB! Und eminently affordable: A ticket from one end of the line to the other is 45 baht.

Smooth, Easy To Use, Convenient. Staff were friendly and helpful.
Ticketing system is easy to use. Just need to know where you're heading to.
Ride was smooth.
Just not enough space for the luggages.
Complicated. Emailing them before i traveled to find out some information and they were unhelpful, rude and even their website is not updated. I ended up booking a car instead.

Fast and cheap. If you do not want to get stuck in a traffic jam, then take this train. A ticket cost about $1.50 The train will take you to downtown Bangkok. You can transit on both BTS-lines at the endstation Phaya Thai. If you continue with the BTS, you have to buy a ticket first.

Fast and Cheap. Arrived at the airport and took a taxi, as was unsure of the sky train.. On the way back took the train. It was fast and easy.. A little crowded as very popular. The best way to get from the airport to the city centre...

Very convenient if your Hotel is closeby to Makkasan. For around B40 per person, it's much cheaper than a taxi to Makkasan as we usually stay at Asoke Residence for short trips as there's a link to Petchaburi and then a five minute walk to the hotel. Convenient if travelling with less luggage and beats the traffic jam too.
very fast way to tairport. we took it took airport railway link from ratchapraprop station. it only 25 minutes to reach the airport. really fast.

Fast and Convenient. This by far the best value for money mode of transportation from and to Suvarnabhumi Airport. it is hassle and free and most importantly you won't stuck in a very bad traffic congestion which is a norm in Bangkok street.
But, study your route before taking the Link. Cheers

So easy!. So easy to use! Not crowded at all and way cheaper than a taxi or uber. Our cart wasn't over crowded and it announced all the stops clearly so even if you can't speak Thai it is easy to navigate. We road it through till the Phaya Thai station and it was a cool experience! Would definitely recommend using it.
Fast and easy. I was pleasantly surprised by the number of trains. It was a snap getting into Bangkok. Just make sure your luggage has wheels.
Better alternative to taking taxis. Very convenient but rush hours could mean being sandwiched inside. Try avoiding the rail link during rush hours if you have luggage.

easy fast comfortable and enjoyable. Fly to suvarnabhumi airport from anywhere,clear customs and immigration,go downstairs on the escalator go to the vending machine buy a token and you are on the skytrain and on your way to anywhere in bankok

A better option than taxi. If you need to go to a sukhumvit or Silom hotel this train is cheapest option. Easy to find at lowest level of international airport. Less than 40 thb to makkassan station, connect to Asoke Bts by mrt subway 16thb. Beats traffic but some stairs involved.
Great service. This truly is the way to move around in Bangkok. The trains are clean and the frequent number of trains make it easy to travel quickly.

Best choice ? Ummm .. . Better waiting long time for taxi , cheaper & fasten to downtown directly without traffic jam , exercise your legs along the way but not too hard for seating as well . Oh , u can enjoy food & beverage (a bit expensive) and get good rate of money exchange rate before grab the train . Come , come to Bangkok. The 1st of best destination voted by MasterCard 2016.

Clean, fast , reliable . Very nice, convenient, clean and fast way to get from airport to central Bangkok and other way around . Price is fair. Very good a/c and there is free wifi available too. Better option than taxi or bus . Have fun , be safe and enjoy your travel.
Best way to travel. This is by far the easiest and cheapest way to get to and from the city. This service connects directly with the BTS for easy connections.
So easy to use. So easy and quick to go centrum in Bangkok. And very cheap.i use this always when arrive to Bangkok

So conveneint. No need to waste time and money with taxi when you can use this great facility to connect with city center ; better to not have a lot of luggage with you, depending of the time in the day it can be faster than using a cab and much cheaper - very convenient, clean and safe
Easy way to get to BTS. Easy to find, it's on the bottom floor of BKK. Easy to get a ticket. Faster than going by car. Sometimes it's a little crowded during peak hours.
Cheap and Good. a 20 mins ride from Phaya Thai BTS station, covered walkway for all weather. Cost is only 45 Baht, so much more affordable than a taxi ride, and it is fast, safe and no traffic jam !
Easy way to connect city line BTS. From Airport station to downtown is very easy route, MRT is connected at Makkasan station and BTS is connected at Phayathai station.
Quick and Convenience!. This is very convenience transportation to go around Bangkok and avoid its terrible traffic. Open from 5:00 AM to 11:30PM

Fast track to Suvarhnabumi Aiport at a budget. A pleasant 30 mins train ride from Ratchapraprop station to the airport. The cost was only 40 baht per way per pax minus the traffic jams or unscrupulous taxi drivers. I would recommend anyone to just catch a tuk tuk or taxi to one of the airport rail stations and catch the train to the airport.

Airport to Piya Thai rail connection - excellent option to taxi. You can take train to to its last station, which cost 45 Bhat per head, then you can take taxi to the hotel. You can avoid traffic jam and at the station, their is a desk to help you in finding taxi without any additional charge.

Wonderful. This is really cheap way to get into town and it avoids Bangkok's notorious traffic jams. It cost 40 Baht...to Makasan and a taxi is 500. If you have mountains of luggage you might struggle.

Very fast and efficient travel from Airport although lacking connections to Skytrain. I managed to coax my very big suitcase through the airport and buy a ticket at The Airport rail Link. I was told that the closest connection to Sukhumvit Road, was to get off at Makkasan, which I did. It proved however impossible to get a taxi on a friday night at 8 PM! A very kind security guard pushed my giant suitcase to the street corner and stopped the traffic so we could cross in safety! He also stopped a Tuc-Tuc and I started to negotiate with the driver. I managed to reduce the asking price from 500 Thai Baht to 250. I gave the kind security officer 30 Baht, which made him happy! After some coaxing, I managed to sneek on board the Tuc-Tuc and we sat off in the heavy traffic. I was very happy when we finally arrived at the excellent Hotell Hope Land! I would strongly advice the Bangkok Transport System to Improve the interconnections beetween Airport Rail Link, Skytrain and the Metro. Now, it is simply not good enough!

a very good 1.5 dollar option to city center instead of 20 dollars taxi even with a luggage. after passing passport controla and receiving your luggage you will find yourself in front of the exits to the street.just do not exit and use the electrical stairs to go one level down .buy a token to the city center .the price will depend on the destined station.the maximum price is 45 baht about 1.5 dollars for the last station. very quick and clean and efficient mean of transport to city center even when you are coming with a heavy luggage.

a perfect choice during the peak hour. a good service with frequent time departure. good price. if you have many belongings. bags is not so comfortable cause in the city station is few lift and not so international organization. need to improve to serve the customer.
Very convenient. Loved how fast and clean the trains are. The regular schedule means I don't worry if I miss a train, just take the next one!

Fast, comfortable, inexpensive. The Airport Rail Link from Suvarnabhumi Airport to Bangkok City is fast (about 30 mins), reliable and at 45 Baht (2017) per person to Phaya Thai Station, the last stop on the line, relatively cheap. For those going to hotels in middle Sukhumvit Road: get off at "Makassan" where you can connect to the underground line MRT at Phetchaburi (about 3-5 mins walk between stations, separate tickets).Those going to Khao San Road area get off at Phaya Thain (final stop) and catch a taxi (avoid touts waiting at the station), Get one that just offloaded passengers, have your hotel adress in Thai writing on hand and insist on using the taxameter! Also to the Silom Road and lower Sukhumvit area stay on to Phaya Thai and change to the BTS skytrain (separate tickets). When travelling in groups of three or more, a taxi directly from (or to) Suvarnabhumi Airport may be more economical and saves dragging your bags around.Especially during rushhours however it can be much slower too...
convenient. Airport metro link is very convenient , fast , comfort and cheap specially during office hours connecting downtown Bangkok to Suvarnabhoomi international airport in 30 minutes.

so helpful to have the airport link. I love when airports have organised transportation to the closest metro or other means of public transportation. The airport link is very easy to use, clean and inexpensive.

It works well. We thought we'd give it a go instead of catching a cab from the airport as was told it's efficient.Our hotel was near Victory Monument, which meant taking the airport link to the end of the line (Phaya Thai) & then jumping on the connecting BTS.It worked for us but it just depends where your hotel is located.Also your hotel may provide a (complimentary) shuttle bus to an airport link station & if so, suggest you consider this option as it may be a quicker & cheaper option than a taxi.
Good airport rail link . Easy to navigate from service to service, reasonably priced, clean, regular service throughout the day. Does what it says on the tin really!

Great way to get to main station in bangkok , . A little tip when waiting to board stand at the sides of the doors as you must let people off first, I got an official blowing his whistle at me and said some thing in Thai Lol
better optoin to reach the city. cheap and best to travel via airport rail link to the city. Need to change the platform to catch another train
Cheap and Best. Airport link very convenient way of travelling from airport(i used it from suvarnbhumi airport) to travel to city and viceversa. Remember it is closed between 00:00hrs to 06:00hrs.

Fastest Way into Bangkok from Airport. If you don't have a lot of luggage in tow then this is the way to get into town from the airport and vice versa. Air conditioned and connects to the BTR and Metro lines in town.

Excellent Airport drop and very cheap. Many people dont no than this Airport is in Bangkok and take taxi, this Airport li k is a very cheap solution for o e or 2 peoples but for more ots better to take a taxi

Good, Cheap link to Bangkok. We used this to get to Bangkok, my husband and I were trying to find Khao San Road. Getting on the train was easy enough and staff at the sirport are very helpful. When we got off the train it was difficult to find anyone who could help us as obviously our Thai was limited and the staff we found had limited English.We were told to go to a bus stop to wait for a number 23 (I think) to Khao San, we waited a while and several Tuk Tuks stopped to try and get us to take a ride, we declined. However both very tired and jet lag kicking in the next Tuk Tuk that arrived we bartered with and took a ride to Khao San!! The train is a great service and a hell of a lot cheaper than a taxi however if you are unsure of where you are going / u7nable to navigate / know your next means of transport it may prove a bit tricky!
Was very comfortable and starts early morning.. Took the airport link for our hotel at 6am. Paid around 40 bhat for one person most economical than taking expensive taxi from airport to hotel.

Fastest and cheapest from the airport.. A very good mode of transportation from the airport, with link to BTS somewhere along the line. You can always check at the information counter your destination.

Great way to get to the city. Be aware of people in blue shirts standing not far from the cashier. The will say to you that your train station is closed and will offer you to take a 'taxi' which costs 900 BHT. The train cost 35 BHT and stops at all stations that are in the map.
Beat traffic!. I love the airport link! Anytime I fly in/out of BKK, this is the best way to get to the airport. Traffic in Bangkok can be brutal, and this is cheaper and faster. Love it!
Easy to use. We used this only once when flying in from Bangkok, but had no problems at all. Very easy to use, also for foreigners.

Going to to correct airport???. The rail line is very clean and efficient to BKK Traveled on a Saturday so not very busy. So excited we got to Suvarnabhurri Airport (BKK) way before our departing flight to Krabi, Thailand. We were at the wrong airport!!! We needed to be at Don Muang (DMK). 30 miles away. That isn't part of airport rail link. Can be 30 mins to 2 hours away. Traveled link again to head out Internationally. Much better experience.
Efficient and cheap. A modern, cheap and efficient rail link, it does exactly what it says and is easy to use. We took it to phaya Thai to save money on taxis.

Excellent quick fast link. If you are traveling light then this is the way to enter Bangkok and avoid some of its legendary traffic jams. From the airport to the city takes about 30 minutes and I got down at Makassan station from where my destination Sukhumvit was just 5 minutes by taxi. Excellent choice
Easy and cheap. Cheap way to get from the airport to the center of Bangkok. Prices are ridiculously cheap compared to the Taxi.
Superb! . Super fast way from the airport. Thanks to interlinking with MRT and BTS you can get very fast to virtually any place in Bangkok.

Quick Way to Reach the City!. A convenient and quick way to get to the city from the airport and vice versa. You can connect to the BTS or MRT line depending on which part of the city you want to head to.

Good and cheap way to go to town. Cheap way to go to town with not too much luguage. The direct connection to the BTS Sky Train and therefore the access to a great number of hotels, mskes it a good alternative to taxis.

Best way into our out of Bangkok. This train is the best way to travel from the airport into Bangkok. With a taxi it can take easily an hour because of the heavy traffic, the train +- 1/2 hour. On time, clean, airconditioned - perfect.
A must. Super fast and efficient . Spotlessly clean .. From the airport to the city links . Sky train etc . underground networks

fast train very slow. It is the fast way to reach the airport ( compare with taxi time) and also the cheapest(45 bath against 300 bath taxi fare) Butif you compare the time with BTS go very slow during all tripand take time to reach airport and vice versa ( more than halfhour ) for 7 stop.also frequency is quite different from BTS:in any way is the best for reach Airport

Efficient, safe, clean. The most efficient, cheap and probably also quickest way to get in town. Each time the train arrives at the airport its cleaned, it has A/C and always seats available when you enter at the airport.
Very convenient. The rail link ends at Phaya Thai station and from the station, it is very convenient to go by BTS to many places in Bangkok.

Good and cheap way to get to the city. This link is a great option to use even when you have a lot of luggage with you. The tickets are not expensive and you will reach the city centre in about 15-20 minutes

Connects to BTS. We used this mode of transport to get access to the BTS Sky train. It was really easy, quick and efficient. The train took us straight to one of the BTS Sky train stations from which we could easily get to our hotel.

Safe, easy, quick mode of transport. Safe, easy, quick mode of transport for locals and tourists. Well connected to BTS Sky train. It not only connect airport but other part of the city too, so you can too-and-fro city without getting into city traffic and very very good place to meet local public. it terminates at Phaya Thai and you can take another metro train from there for rest of the city.Fully AC. Great mode of transport in-and-out bangkok.

Best way to get from Airport to CBD. Love using this mode of transport, is absolutely the best way to travel from the Airport. Costs 45 Baht which is $2 AUD and gets you to Phaya Thai in about 25 minutes and you can then swap and go two stops to Siam in a few more minutes.It's very convenient if you have a few hours stopover at the airport!!!Only reason I am not giving 5 stars is because the express line has been out of service for a while and was annoying during my stay. Also I wish it opened earlier than 6am for those early morning flights.Highly recommend to anyone visiting Bangkok.

A good way to get to the city centre. Airport Rail LinkThe rail link is like just another MRT route which the locals use as well. It links Suvarnabhumi Airport to Bangkok city centre with a total of eight stops. As the train frequency is not as high as BTS/MRT, the train could be very crowded at times. However, it is still a convenient and cheap way to get to the city centre. Please note that it operates from 6 am to midnight. My suggestion is to alight at Makkasan Station or Phaya Thai Station and then catch a taxi from there. The main reason is that the BTS and MRT stations in Bangkok are generally not luggage friendly.

Excellent connection to MRT and BTS. There is extra space for luggage if you are coming or going to the airport. Very Fast and convenient. Be sure to check connection point to the MRT and BTS and your destination. We took the MRT from the train station at Hualamphong, connected to BTS and then took the Airport rail link to our hotel. We have used the airport rail link all the way to Suwannaphum airport in the past, and it was a super easy way to get through town.

The best way to get to and from the airport!. It didn't take me too long to discover the convenience of the airport rail link. I'll never ever take a cab to or from the airport if the train is running. It's a great way to take in the scenery too. Extremely affordable and predictable plus you can connect with the other rail lines in the city. I once got into Bangkok at midnight and just slept on the benches until the train opened...this saved me a 400 baht car ride into the city and a hotel room.

DO NOT USE ANY OTHER FORM OF TRANSPORT FROM THE AIPORT. This is the 5th trip we used the Airport Rail Link. Clean, fast and efficient. No time spent in traffic. Be aware this service only starts operating from 06h00 to 23h00. Woiuld never use a taxi to and from hotel to Downtown Bangkok.

extremely slow and bumpy. using it for the first time it was a very disappointig experience. whereby the sukhumvit skytrain runs smooth and fast, the airport link is incredible slow and at times bumpy which is scary

fast and Efficient. This is an easy hassle-free way of getting from the main international airport into town. The train is cheap and takes around 25 minutes. One can use the Makkasan Interchange (its quite a long walk but now under cover) to the Petchaburi MRT Underground station which is just one stop from Sukhumvit/Asoke and also continues south to Silom and Hua Lampong railway station. The airport link line terminates at Phya Thai with another short walk to the Sky Train on the line from Bearing to Mo Chit making access to the main shopping areas of Siam Square easy. There is plenty of room for storing lubbage in the compartments and the trains run every 15 minutes or so. Tickets can be purchased in the machines at the turnstiles or from the kiosk and the same applies to the Sky Train and Underground.
Best way to enter to the city. Best way to enter to the city. Comfortable, no issues even if you have luggage. fastest mode of travel
Fast and efficient. I like this rail system which connect Bangkok international airport right to central Bangkok. The train is fast too, less than 30 minutes for the whole journey.
Excellent. Very convenient and excellent service. Easy to locate, spotlessly clean and so efficient. Gets you to the city in double quick time and air conditioned comfort
Somewhat Convenient......................... The objective is to reduce travel time to the airport. I have used the airport link 3 times and each time it was slow with way too many stops to suit me.

cheap way to travel from airport to the city. it was an easy ride from airport to city within short time since bangkok face terrible terrible traffic jam, but f your carrying heavy luggage then have to opt for taxis which are not so costly either.

Very easy to use!. I arrived at the Bangkok airport at 2100 hrs and walked directly to the Airport Rail Link train. Purchasing the ticket and stepping on the train was very easy! Great price and ease of use going to/from the Bangkok airport.

Not recommend to travel during peak hours.. The airport Rail link will be crowded during peak hours in the morning and after work. There are a lot of local passengers traveling using the airport rail link to get into town and out of town. Passengers should step inside the train for not being obstruct at the entrance door.From airport into town, Half of the passengers will get off at the Makkasan station.And from town to airport, very crowded passengers will get into the train on their way out of town.

Useful Depending on where you need to go. I rather take the shuttle to Khao San. There was no A/C meaning that I was roasting, I thought I was saving money and time by taking the train to the last station and then a taxi to khao San, but in the end I spent the same time, but with extra burden of having to walk and change modes of transport, and no A/C. I guess if you have to go to Silom it's very convenient, but not to Khao San

Easy & Convenient, but Still Time Comsuming. The Airport rail link is an inexpensive and convenient way to get to the city from the airport, but I find taking uber still better. The train is quick and comfortable, but the fact that the ticket is cash only is pretty challenging when first arriving into the city.

Fast, comfy and inexpensive. Instead of rotting in a car stuck in Bangkok traffic and spend Baht 500 commuting, the airport rail link costs Baht 45 takes me to town in 30 min. The train is comfortable and definitely beats the traffic jam. It is well connected to BTS at Phraya Thai and MRT as well. Very very convenient.

Good idea if you don't have a lot of luggage. Great idea - so much quicker and easier to get to the airport without having to deal with the traffic. The only problem is that you have to get off this train and transfer to the skytrain to get to your hotel. This meant carrying suitcases down stairs and then pulling them a fairly long way to the skytrain where you had to purchase another train ticket. Escalators or lifts are needed at the train stations to accomodate travellers with luggage.

Zip into town with convenience!. The airport rail link connects you to the city centre of Bangkok via the Metro and BTS train networks. It is very convenient and affordable to use the train networks to get to your hotels if you are travelling alone or with a partner. For groups of 3 and above, it will be better to take a taxi as the total travel cost is comparable.
Super simple. Very convenient connection from bats and very simple and inexpensive to use. Very clean and convenient drop off!
Best way to get to airport. It was a great transportation to link in between city center to airport Suvanaphumi Int'l Airport. It was great price and quick.

Easy and cheap, but good luck with luggage when exiting BTS. The train is a fine option into the city. It's fast and much cheaper than a taxi. The problem is handling luggage when you exit a connecting BTS Skytrain station. Many don't have downward escalators. If you can manage your bags, go for it.

Standing Room Only. We could tell by the crowd waiting on the platform that the train would be full, and this was at the first station. Fortunately, we had been waiting a while for the train and were close to the front of the line so were able to snag a seat. By the third station, there was barely room to squeeze another person into the car. It is a popular mode of transport to the airport!

Bangkok has Three Excellent Urban Train Services. I'm a huge fan of the Airport Rail Link from Suvarnabhumi Airport to Bangkok proper (cheap, very reliable and avoids horrendous traffic), and there's another airport link being constructed at the moment (Sep 2016) to service BKK's other major airport at Don Mueang. The Airport Train provides great access to and from the basement of Suvarnabhumi Airport - a great world class service that gets you as close to the airport as a taxi does, and there's an interchange station with the BTS Skytrain or MRT Underground Train stations.The Airport Rail Link is in very good company with both the BTS Skytrain and MRT Underground Train - all three provide public transport to a world class standard.  If you're staying within close proximity to one the BTS Skytrain or MRT Underground Train stations, they should be your primary transport whilst in Bangkok - if you're not staying within close proximity, I suggest you should consider relocating! If the Skytrain doesn't get you to one of the must-see attractions around Bangkok, the MRT likely will - and vice-versa.Skytrain offers the views of BKK whilst perched above the ground in air-conditioned comfort, but MRT stations provides a reprieve from the heat whilst waiting for air- conditioned trains to come along.

Wow I love it. It's fast, cheap and simple to use. It gets you next to the airport. It's just a short walk from there in a tunnel protected from the rain. Better than a taxi as long as you don't have big heavy bags
very useful!!!. it has great connections with skytrain that helps u to reach ur destination for a cheap price without making u obliged to use taxi which is waaaay more expensive...

Shame they stopped the Express Line.. When arriving and going to the lower floor, don't get confused, they stopped the Express Line and it's just the Local Line now.Just as cheap but can be crowded, so pick location carefully so your not blocked when you want to get off.I use the airport on most visits and can easily get a linking train to me hotel.
Good. Gets you to and from the airport without any hassle. Works really good and a ticket is affordable. Ideal for tourists.

Take this if you don't want to get stuck in traffic. Rail link is awesome thinking of transportation between airport and city. The price is just 45 TBH till the end Phaya Thai station. The connectivity with other trains in the city is so seamless that you will get to your point faster than taxi.

Quick!!. When I arrived at Bangkok, I used to be downed to think about how to go to my accommodation in Bangkok by bus or cab. But finally I could say bye-bye to the feeling in this summer! The railway is very nice as easy to go to midtown in Bangkok from airport. Also it's clean.
Nice. I love thailand's train transpo..it's fast,clean and easy 😊... It's very convenient...i hope we have this here as well.. you definitely need to try this

Great and time saving way to go to airport.. One of the best ways to go to heart of the city to and from air port is Air port link of BKK. It takes you right in the air port building or right in the heart of city. Saves you huge amount of time to travel through the city traffic and is virtually less than 10% of the cost of taxi. I use this option maximum time, as I go to BKK almost every alternate month and every time travel ONLY through Air Link. I usually need to get down or travel through Makasan station on Airport link, and some times getting taxi here to go to your hotel can be an issue. about 10 min of wait is usually required to get a taxi or Uber to arrive. During peak Hours, the trains are crowded and so if you are travelling in family or a large group with lot of luggage, allow yourself some extra time as you may have to wait for 2-3 trains to pass which may mean a wait time at station of around 15-20 min. Over all a great way to travel from city to air port. I always use it.
quick and convenient. What to say, it is a public transportation. No sightseeing, but you get a nice impression on the way to downtown, better than by taxi and quicker.
Excellent value and efficient. We trsvelled in form the airport and found the train to be really good value, efficient and easy to use. The security staff were very helpful.

Easy to get but you have to waitng. - Good option to go to Suwarnabhumi airport (Main BKK airport). take time around 40mins form 1st station to the airport. To avoid disappoint thing you should have the train schedult becuase if you miss you have to waiting for next 20-30mins.
Express broken. 100 baht if express 20 mins from airport to prath thai. Or 45 baht if you take regular bts 7 stops about 40mins.
Fast efficient. This is the only fast efficient way of transfering to and from the airport, with interchanges at MRT and SkyTrain stations you can travel any where .
Good. Good transportation. Not only for going to the airport but also to other places. If you have one roller bag and no children then this is good for you.
Reliable and reasonable. The airport link train system is reliable and very cheap between the airport and downtown of BKK.

fast , easy and conviencet way to and fro from airport to city. Use this train to go closest area in city where you planned to visit , Then take taxi if necessary
This train link has good connection to underground and sky train station ,w at cheaper than taxi
super efficient. fully air conditioned smooth service, thoroughly enjoyable. Took a little time to work out routes given language barrier but simple thereafter.
Effective travel. This a very good and effective way to travel around Bangkok. Easy to use, safe and very clean. And the trains are air conditioned.
Super WOW!. It so clean, fast and convenient. I don't have to worry. It made my visit memorable of trying something new to me and different from LRT and MRT in the Philippines.
Amazing!. I highly recommend using the link as a cheap and quick way to get into the city from the airport. You're bypassing all of the traffic and it links you into the BTS.

Safe,punctual,economical and hassle-free. Very clean, safe. on time. Easy to access from airport to connect with BTS Skytrain cityline.
recommended number 1 conveyance from airport.
Holiday in Bangkok. The best way to travel from the airport into the main station of Bangkok. All the members of staff are very friendly.
Convenient Airport connection. Easy transport to and from the airport. You will see may travelers on board. The cars are set up with less seats and room for your luggage.

Convenient mode of transport from the Suvarnabumi International Airport into Bangkok city. We have used the Airport Rail Link several times now and found it to be a convenient, comfortable and cheaper mode of transport in getting to Bangkok. Take the ARL to Ramakhamhaeng station and transfer to the MRT to where you wish to travel to in Bangkok or in the event the MRT does not take you there, you can transfer at a MRT/BTS interchange station and transfer. To take a taxi from the airport to Bangkok will cost around 500 baht but via the ARL and the MRT/BTS will cost you about 100+ baht.

Airport link. Airport link it actually the best and fastest way into Bangkok no matter where you stay in Bangkok if your plane arrives in the morning or else with a taxicab you will get stuck in the morning traffic and 1 other thing to it is cheaper and it is easy to cross to bts (Sky train) or mrt (metro) don't be afraid to try thai people are helpful just ask and you won't get lost.....

Airport Rail Link -Fastest and Cheapest way to Suvarnabhumi airport. The best ,cheapest quickest way to reach Suvarnabhumi auroort Bangkok is by Airport Rail Link, you may have to change from Sky Train To Airport Link at station depending on where you plan to book hotel, always try to find your hotell near skytrain stations or airport link. The airport link statuon is inside airport. When you buy ticket just ask for station map or take photo with mobile of maps on the wall.Book your hotell and write find skytrain station near hotell.You change from skytrain/airport link :Airport Link : Airport station to Ramkhamhaeng station(Nasa Vegas Hotel) to Phetchaburi station (15 baht) pay more Phetchaburi - Sukhumvit station (16 baht) and stop Sukhumvit. You can choose hotel anywhere close to these lines.They speak next station name on english in train. You can also follow line posters inside train wall -Have a nice stay in Bangkok!!!

Cheap way to get to/from Suvarnabhumi Airport. Best way to get to/from Suvarnabhumi Airport.It is reliable and the time for the journey is always the same, something you can't say about taxi.It costs less than 50 baht, which is nothing compared with taxi.From some stations you can connect with MRT (metro) and then BTS (SkyTrain aka "Ice train").
Recomend. Airport Rail Link really recommend if want go to airport or arrival in Thailand, because the Airport Rail Link not far from airport.

Great way to get to the airport. If you have a minimal amount of luggage, there is no better way to get to Suvarnabhumi airport cheaply and quickly. You can connect to the Airport Rail Link from any BTS line, just follow the maps posted everywhere in the stations. The BTS has announcements at every stop in both Thai and English. Get off when Airport Rail Link is announced and proceed to the train. It is really cheap and easy and you avoid all the traffic in Bangkok. My only reservation would be trying to get a lot of luggage on. I am 63 and only do this with a carryon. A younger person can probably manage more!

Cheap and efficient. I'm a fan of public transport systems and this one works well. I got the MRT from Hua Lamphong station to Phetchaburi station for 30 Baht. Plenty of signs within the underground concourse of Petchaburi direct you to the walkway and sky walk across to Makasan station on the airport line. No problems with wheeling luggage apart from a very short set of steps. The fare from Makasan to the airport was 35 Baht. The tickets on the two systems are not interchangeable but it's easy to buy them on the platforms from the vending machines. The sky train gives you a good view of the outer city on the way to the airport, so an added bonus.

Convenient, cheap and fast. Anyone looking to get into the city quickly from the airport should take the Airport Rail Link. You can be downtown in 30 minutes using this. It gets very crowded after the 2nd stop so get a seat early. This is far superior to getting cheated by a Bangkok taxi driver and having to smell what he had for lunch all the way to your hotel!
Great. I used the train to get to the river ferry's and the people were so helpful, the trains were fast, clean and safe.
cheap and efficient. Cheap and convenient transportation from the airport.But with only one suitcase. More than this- the connection to skytrain ot metro is difficult... Take a taxi.

Fine. The Airport rail link is convenient for you to go to Suvarnabhumi Airport! its not so expensive but if you want to go to the city you have to change to subway at makkasan station and the then change to sky train at Asoke Station. Sometime are more difficult if you have many luggages.

Best way to get from Suvarnabhumi Airport to downtown BKK!. Cheaper, safer and faster than taking a taxi. I always use the train. No waiting in the taxi cue in the heat, no getting stuck in the never ending traffic jams and no haggling prices. The train is simply unbeatable!
Affordable way to go to the city. Easy to navigate and connect to bits to travel to many parts of Bangkok. No rack to store suitcases.

Flying visit to Bangkok, avoid crawling to the airport.. The airport link is located near to the main hotels on Sukhumvit. It's not an easy walk, from the main hotels on Sukhumvit Road, hot and on very busy roads. However at peak traffic times this could be a godsend if your hotel is pretty close. It avoids horrendous traffic on all the main roads and will get you there in a predictably short time. The main short coming is that it will require at least a taxi ride to get there from nearly all hotels. On clear roads it would be tempting to just ride the tax all the way to the airport; Sunday a.m and Saturday before 10 a.m. would be good times to avoid the skytrain as traffic is quiet then.
Aiport Rail Link. Very clean and easy to navigate, there were signs everywhere to direct you where you need to be. We did not have any problem finding our gate.

Usefull & Fast. To be bottled in Bangkok traffic is a life experience you may spend one hour in the same exact place. So a fast and sure way to reach your international flight is a must. The rail is underground so it is easy to reach without exit from airport

very easy way to get from airport to city centre. every time I fly to BKK I use the airport link, getting off at Makasan you are a short motorbike taxi to all the centre attractions & Sukhumvit hotels. The Airport link is fast, not expensive, easy to use, clean & usually not to packed with people.

Best way in and out!. Very easy to find and use, and only 45 baht! There used to be an express service, but that seems to be cancelled. If you have a lot of luggage, it may be a bit more difficult as the train gets jammed packed as you get closer to downtown. It took half the time to get to the same hotel, and much cheaper!
Convenient. convenient to reach airport from city within no time .. highly recommended to avoid Bangkok City traffic during peak hours.
Best way to get to the airport. Waiting interval times could be slightly long but it is the best way to get from the city to the airport

EXCELLENT WAY TO TRAVEL INTO THE CITY FROM THE AIRPORT. This trip from the airport to the city was great - very comfortable and quite cheap - although quite crowded. The full trip takes around 40 minutes and connects via walkway to the local Skytrain network once at the end of the airport line. Taxis and tuk tuk drivers are everywhere if you need to get to a hotel once out of the rail link area.

You scare to miss your airflight take the airport link. If you are close to the airport link rail don t hésitante one second is the most fast and safe way to go suvarnabhumi airport. Terminal to terminal 30 min 100% garantie. The fee is 45 thb from payathai to airport . Fast , safe , cheap and you arrived in the ground of airport directly , you just need to take escalator or elevator to acess departure or arrival zone.Enjoy your trip ....

Easy & Fast. If you're staying at a hotel within distance (walking) from the Airport Rail Link, then this must be the best way to zip into town without the hassle of haggling taxi drivers and the fear that you'll be stuck in a traffic jam, forever.It's cheap, it's fast and it gets you from Suvarnabhumi to the city center (where all the tourists are heading to) very quickly.

Train to Suvarnabhumi Airport. There were times it took me almost an hour in the station to take a train. The express line isn't working and should be fixed very soon to serve the riding public. Generally, the service us acceptable.

Good Idea. The concept of a public transportation link to a city's major airport is good, but this one falls a bit short. First of all, you have to get to the transfer station at Phaya Thai BTS Station. At non-rush hours with light luggage this is not too difficult, but between 7:30AM - 9:30AM, or 4PM - 7PM it can be nasty. The other issue is train hours. It is not a 24 hour service so you need to match your arrival/departure times with train operating hours.Personally I only use this when I go to the airport to meet arriving or departing friends. Taxi service is ubiquitous and cheap in Bangkok. A taxi fee of $12 U.S. will get you anywhere, and usually it is less. Rush hour is a pain whether sitting in a taxi or fighting to board BTS. One note of caution - do not expect your taxi driver to understand much or any English. Have your destination written down, preferably in Thai.

The easy way in or out (of Bangkok). BKK traffic is can be hard and tough and during rush hours the city almost comes to a complete stand still but not if you are clever and take the Airport Rail Link toward BKK city. From there you can seamlessly access the BTS network. Oh and before I forget, 45 baht, slightly more than €1,00, yep, ONE Euro! (grin)
shopping and eating. From suvatbhumi airport to centara watergate pavillion hotel, we use the airport rail link. The train is clean, comfortable and fast

The only way to go when in Bangkok, Thailand. We spent everyday moving around this great town on the Sky Train and found it to be clean, air conditioned, fast and inexpensive. We found directions in English posted every where to all the areas that we wanted to go.

Good Service . I have used this service many times, its fast easy and cheap. If you choose a taxi into Bkk you are looking at between 400 to 500 baht as a posed to 34 baht, but saying that if you dont travel lightly then a cab would be the better option.

crowded during rush hours. can be impossible to board during rush hours especially with a heavy luggage. what we did was to take the reverse direction train to the last station ( lucky we were one station away from the last station) .
Easy and efficient. Ver modern, an excellent condition. Easy to navigate. Much cheaper than a taxi and takes you right to the heat of Bangkok. Connected to two other public transit lines.

Quickest way to get to Suvarnabhumi airport. This is by far the fastest way to get to Suvarnabhumi airport from downtown Bangkok. I would have taken it more often had I not been a bit lazy... It's true, it's more comfortable to just go out of the office and take a taxi directly to the airport instead of taking it to the nearest airport rail link train station and then change to the trainBut it's fast and good, no doubt about that

Quick and inexpensive. As long as your accommodation is close to a station this is great transport and a lot less stressful that riding with a cowboy taxi driver. There are taxis near the Bangkok terminus, but it can be a hassle dragging luggage down to street level.

Excellent Public Transport.. Decided to try the Airport Railink to take me on the first leg of my journey to Sala Daeng Stop on Silom road,the ride was smooth and comfortable in air conditioned carriages,the announcements were concise and clear,at the end of the line i transferred myself and luggage to another line,this was made easy as there were moving stairs and elevators,after 2 stops i transferred once more (also made easy) to a train to get me to my final stop (Sala Daeng) there are no facilities here to get to street level,it was a heck of a struggle to get down the many stairs to the EXIT. Inexpensive,but hard work for the arms at Sala Daeng. Alun.

Easy way to reach Airport. Its probably the best way to reach Airport if one has to travel in busy traffic hours..The only problem I see is that, it is not connected to all major parts of the city.. From Sukhumvit 22, to reach airport train , one has to use BTS first & walk 5 mins, then take MRT subway.. walk again for 5 mins to reach the Makasan station.. bit difficult for anyone with loads of baggage..
Fast way to get to/from an airport. This is the best way to get to/ from the airport. The first train is around 6am weekdays. With AC and lots of space for luggage.

On the move. I travel in and out of BANGKOK very often. For the last several months I have started using the Airport Rail Link. I find it unbelievably convenient when I fly into Suvarnabhumi . The normal cost for a taxi to mid town is 400 baht but this train is only 39 baht. You will need to catch another train, taxi, or motorbike from your stop but that should only be another 50 baht and less time in traffic. I believe it takes about 40 minutes from one end to the other but that would be the least amount of time in a taxi. This is a very good option.

the best way to get to the aiport, BUT not for air asia. A great fast way to get to the airport. depending were your hotel is , check out before if it is close to the airport link, otherwise a taxi could be more convenient

A fast way to travel. This is a fast way to get to Bangkok if you want to save time and money traveling by taxi,there are also buses which go into Bangkok but depending on time of day it can take a considerable time to reach the city.Traveling by train is on the other hand a convenient way but only if your luggage is manageable,you need on both ends too walk to or from the airport link and that is not always easy specially in peak hour but its cheep and will get you into the city or airport fast.Don’t forget once you get into the city you need either to change trains maybe twice that in it self can be a nightmare, I usually only use this mode if I have minimal luggage with me.

Great way to get across town. We flew into the airport late afternoon and had limited time to get across town to get a night train to Chang Mai. The train was crowded but was quite fast and was a much better way to travel rather then battle with the peak hour traffic.

Easy access to downtown without BKK traffic!!!. I am a frequent visitor to Bangkok but this was the first time I took the Airlink into downtown! If you dont have alot of luggage I recommend this! 45 Baht and forget grid lock traffic! Clean and fairly fast

stuffed like sardines in a tin. definitely a convenient and cost effective method of getting to the airport. but since the rail link serves other stops, there are so many people on their that there was literally no space to move, not even an inch. it was only after the stop before the airport that most of the locals had disembarked and there was space to breathe.

Best way to get into downtown. I use the ARL daily to get from the suburbs to City center. The trip is very short when compared to any other type of transportation. If you arrive at BKK airport then the ARL is certainly the quickest way to the city hotels. Just bear in mind it is usually crowded.

Beats taxis and traffic jams. Cheap and fast and served well. Got it from Phrom pong station which is very near where my mini bus to victory monument stops in fact they dropped me at the steps as the traffic was jammed
Easy transit to BKK city.. We used service connect to city line for shopping during stay at hotel near airport. help you on saving time and many people use that.

fast link to airport. If you know the train timings in advance, this is a very good option for airport from busy sukhumvit area. Actually, the train station is Makkasan, which you can go from Phetchburi BTS station, about 300-500m distance. The BTS and MRT are well connected , hence making the airport rail link easiliy accessible. Once you get in the train, it will take you to airport (Suvarnabhumi) in 20 mins and in most convinient way.Only be very sure of the train timings, as gap between trains may be about 1 hour and it can be a serious problem if you need to catch a flight.

Transport. First time user of this mode of transport in Bangkok and wanted to try. Pleased I did as was quick and easy, no traffic congestion! Managed to take BTS to Phaya Thai then ARL (airport rail link). Cheap, many locals and travellers. No issues.
Easy to use!. 45 baht per person . Very convenient and worth the cost. So easy to use this form of public transportation
Take the train, dont get into bangkok's traffic. During the day, it could save you a lot of time and some money, take the train near your area and a taxi from there.

Better and cheaper than a taxi.. We originally planned to take a taxi to the airport, but our driver didn't have time to take us there. We ended up taking the skytrain and switched trains to get to the airport rail link. Fast, easy, and inexpensive!
Very convenient and reliable. Their railway system and airport link is very modern and convenient. Theres no way youll miss your flight.
