Very efficient and on time!!. Great service, easy to understand and use!! i hadn't planned my journey from the airport to my hotel in bangkok but this was so easy!!

Fast and reliable. Provided your hotel is near a metro station, this is great way to get to the city from the airport. It is fast and clean.
Tip if you are arriving to Bangkok, I found the best exchange rates at the Airport Rail Link station (much better than those upstairs and slightly better that those in the city)
Short Cut to the City. Cabins are clean and the waiting time is short. One of the best way to get from the airport to the city. BTS and MRT connectivity along the route as well.

Convenience. This is the best way to travel to hotels on Sukhumvit from the airport. Take the train to Phaya Thai and transfer to Sukhumvit Skytrain. Ticket machine take coins and bills up to B100. Otherwise, use the ticket booths to receive an electronic token to go through the turnstiles. About 24 mins to Phaya Thai from the airport.

Fast and efficient . I would always use this when travelling at rush hour if you only have one bag. If your carrying more your going to get in others way but it takes at least 30 minutes off your journey at rush hour and is very cheap.

Straight into town and cheap . This train is Fast and takes you straight into town. As it starts at the airport, you will always get space and most likely a seat- this might be different though when you need to connect for example with the sky rail. Good alternative to a taxi
Fast and easy. The staff were very helpful and we got to our hotel very easily! The rail link was easy to find and easy to use.
Great transit from airport to downtown. The rail link is fast, frequent, clean and safe. Great way to relax after arriving at the airport. Easy to get tickets and lots of room for luggage.
very good & efficient. very good, inexpensive & efficient mode of transport in bangkok, with good connections to most popular places around bangkok.
Dont waste your money on a Taxi. Unless you are carrying a ton of Baggage, you can take this cheap Airport Rail link directly into the heart of Bangkok and vice versa.

Very fast. We took the ARL to Pratunam area. It is very affordable and the train is very clean and spacious. There is definitely space and seats when u come from airport. there are lifts at the station stops but the road to the hotel might not be very smooth as there's pothole etc so please note if u have bulky luggage other than that, all is good
The ARL is the best way to travel from the BKK airport.. The Airport Rail Link is the best way to go from the airport to the BTS and on to the Sukhumvit Road area, avoiding traffic.

So easy to use. I was going to take a cab to the airport until my Thai friend told me not to, since there are so many issues with drivers ripping off tourist, not to mention, the awful Bangkok traffic. I was worried that I would get hot and sweaty on the way or get lost. But, using the airport rail link was so easy!

Too many bad experiences I quit using it.. Packed, jammed, hot, humid, long queu, I can list them all day, better take BTS Sky train, MRT and taxis for travelers. Dont try using to catch a flight during peak hours.
Good but not the best.. it is definitely the fastest and cheapest way to get to central Bangkok from Suvarnabhumi airport. Unfortunately it is still not very well connected with either BTS or MRT.

Convenient. Easy and convenient. Very well connected with the BTS sky train. We had to go to SIAM. Only problem we faced was with getting the tickets. At the ticket counter they gave us the coins to put in the ticket vending machine to get the tickets. And again we had to stand in the queue to get the ticket.

Rebliable and cheap form of transport. Great way to go into the city for tourists explorers who wish to venture into explorations of Bangkok. Map on areas around stations can be more explicit so that tourists can be well guided.

Best way to travel into Bangkok. This train is undoubtedly the best way to travel from the airport into Bangkok. It terminates at Phaya Thai, which connects to the Bangkok BTS (sky train) from which most of Bangkok is accessible. It's also just B60-90 (depending on the traffic) to get to Khao San area. If this is your first time in Bangkok and you do continue your journey by taxi, make sure the driver uses the meter. Some (though not many) unscrupulous drivers will ask for a flat fee, which invariably runs at B150-400.At the time of writing, a one-way journey on the train from Suvarnabhumi to Paya Thai cost B45 and took around a half hour.

Awesome !!!!!!!!!. I Traveled recently Airport to Pratunm round trip ,very comfortable and good price i paid 40 Thai Baht for each way and you have to pay more than 500 THB if you travel by Taxi and takes minimum 30 minuets.
Cheap airport travel. If your hotel is near a BTS or MTR station this is a good cheap alternative to taking a taxi from the airport, about an hours trip to sukhimvit with transfer
from hotel to main airport. This new airport rail link connect the Phaya thai station with the subarnabhumi airport of Bnagkok, price is: 45 bhats, from 6.00 am.
cheap way of going to your hotel directly from the airport!. cheap, efficient and comfortable. This takes you to your destination in bangkok easy,peasy lemon squeazy!

The quickest way to the Airport. Really cheap and easy. We should have used this from the beginning but when we arrived to Bangkok after 6,5 hours delay we just took a taxi to Silom without doing any research. Airport Rail Link is faster, cheaper and more cozy way to Phaya thai and from there to Sukumvit and Ta-daa, you're in Silom! Heavily recommended
Fast, Good and affordable. The airport rail link is definitely a very quick and affordable way to get to / from Suvarnabhumi airport. It is extremely useful during traffic jams.
Great. Great way to get from the airport to your place of stay. We had to change stop once to connect onto another line. all done without to much difficulty. Every where well sign posted.
Easy to use, convenient and cheap. It's very easy to use, even with foreigner first-time in Thailand like me. Thanks to rail link I saved money for taxi or tuk-tuk
Great journey to Suvannabhum airport. Travelling to Bangkok from Suvannabhum International airport try Airport Rail Link to save your time on the road

Very cheap!. Compared to other countries (even my own), the price from airport to phraya thai vice versa only cost 45 thb each way. It is a very good and efficient transport especially during traffic jam. As the price is cheap and it also stops 6 station, you would expect a lot of people taking the train. Whole trip would take about 30 mins.

Seriously the best way to get downtown if not in a group or lugging big bags. Seriously the best way to get downtown if not in a group or lugging big bags. Fast, no jams to contend with and 2 options - really fast express or slower (but still faster than car) commuter (also much cheaper). Once you get off at town stations - buy a BTS or MRT ticket to final destination. Easy and Fun
fast and central. Great Connectivity to the heart of the City and aslo several good connections on the way to the Thai Rail System. one can easily get from the baggage area to the train in a jiffy .

The Queue and timespan between trains.... I am a almost daily airport link traveller. Throughout the years it has gotten worse and worse in my opinion. During rush hours you are squeezed worse than in the bts because people will go to any extent to NOT have to wait up to 10 min for the next train. I highly suggest tourist to take the train at times that arent rush hour if you are planning to go to the airport.

Used once. I tried this to try to avoid the traffic - I found the train was very slow to leave - it was over priced and left me in awkward part of the city. I needed two more separate MRT plus Skytrain trips to get me to my hotel. Also the walk to the MRT was huge.Suggest you take a metered taxi from the departure area - about 200b plus tolls - as it costs the same, takes the same time but drops you outside your hotel.

Cheap, Fast, Efficient, Clean, Connectivity. The reason I prefer to fly into Suwannaphum International Airport is the City Link train service. From the airport, you can take the train to link with two other metro systems (the BTS and MRT). Actually, there is an express service which doesn't stop at all the stations along the way. The City line is the cheaper - only slightly slower service. From beginning to end, the trip takes only around 30 minutes. A lot faster than taking a taxi and soooo much cheaper. You can haul your suitcase and carry on with you into the train - no problem. No trolley though, which could really help for travelers like Beyonce or Kim K. But they probably booked a Limo anyway so...The end of the Line for the City Line is Phya Thai Station which links with the BTS line. If you are traveling to the Suwannaphum airport, you are bound to find a seat (if you move fast enough) at this station. At the next stops, the cars will begin to fill up.Fortunately there are escalators going up. Going down is the problem. You would have to haul your precious belongings down several flights of stairs - but then be comforted that you might be able to take on that MMA fight in the octagon after your journey.Love the City Line. Be thankful it is there for you.

Solo visit August 2016. The Airport Rail Link is the way to go if you do not have a huge amount of luggage and you want to get into Bangkok city. It is much cheaper than by taxi. A taxi into the city will cost around 600 to 700Bth including toll fees. The train will cost under 100Bth.If you arrive at peak hour in the morning and afternoon be aware the trains are 100% full so getting your luggage on the train may be difficult.

Easy, cheap, efficient. I will not take taxi to/from the Suvarnabhumi airport ever again! Because this train connection is brilliant! It is cheap (40bahts/ride = 1€), clean, safe and on time! Remember that the first train will start operating around 6am, so for those flying earlier it is unfortunately no-go. For others, enjoy the beautiful skyline of Bangkok!
really good. great to get from the airport and back if staying in bangkok,,cheap too,,and no hassle of getting stuck in traffic in a taxi,,,

Smooth ride. Used to take taxi from airport to downtown Bangkok whenever I visit Bangkok . No need now as I pick a hotel where the airport rail stations are located n save hours on the chaotic Bangkok road traffic. Can plan my travel time n also escaped the smoky roads.

Wow. What a refreshing change.... trains that are clean and on time.People respected the order and in ran beautifully. No eating or drinking on trains so they even smelt ok too...the UK can learn sooooooo very much from these guys!
Fantastic and quick to the city. We stayed near the stop at Easton hotel and it took only a few minutes from the airport to Makasan near the hotel. Journey was pleasant and quiet.

Convenient. The best mode of transport to go to the heart of the city from bangkok airport. Its very cheap as compared to a taxi and there is direct connectivity from the airport terminal. But it will be very difficult to find a seat!
Accessible and on time. One of the things that travelers wants is a very reliable fast transportation that will bring them to their destination and hotels
Economy way to go. Im not sure I would do this again. I think I would stick to a taxi if I have more than a small carry on
Convenient. Good connection from the airport to the city. Cheap and efficient it prevents you from spending 2hours stuck in traffic.
Transport from Bangkok to Suvurnabhumi Airport. Very easy, inexpensive and comfortable service to travel from downtown Bangkok to main Bangkok airport. Trains run every 15 minutes or so.
Fast and efficient way to get from the airport. Airport Rail Link was easy to travel with, you buy a token and use it to get into the train. They keep the token after you exit the train system.

Speedy efficient low cost access to Suvarnabhumi Airport. Once you actually board the airport rail link, the trip is smooth and fast. If you arrive by Taxi or Uber my experience is that the drivers do not know how to get to the auto entrance of the station. My Uber driver told me that GPS was finished and that I should walk from the car, across a two lane road, climb a concrete barricade, cross two sets of tracks, climb another fence, cross yet another road to get to the terminal. Even of I were not handicapped, at my age of 72 it would be unlikely that I could actually reach my destination via that route. On my return, i found the directions to a taxi stand ambiguous, and was finally told one had to call a taxi. This was a challenge to my ability. I could and did summon Uber. You can opt to take the city line or the express line.. In my experience, timing is everything. I have paid the express premium, but they leave less often than the city line, and with the extra wait it actually took longer to take the express. Boarding at the main station, Makkasan, at rush hour often means squished standing room only for several stops. Boarding at Suvarnbhumi gives you a much better chance at getting a seat. Thais don't always respect a queue, and when the doors open there can be a bit of a stampede. The biggest downside is getting to and from the rail link station in Bangkok. The airport end is efficient, well marked, and easy to use.
Very cheap. This train is hard to find, but worth looking for, connect to BTS easy , quick and very cheap.You do not want to mess with the day traffic, trust me.

Good link to airport. The airport link is a fast and super-affordable way to get into the city, and from here you can link up to the BTS and trains without fuss. Roads are congested at times, so the airport rail link is a great way of getting to and from the airport.
Convenient, Easy and cheap. Links to BTS (Sky Train). Very easy to get into town using this. Just look at the transport map to see where to change to BTS. AC so a cool journey

best way to get in the City. Airport rail link is the fastest cheapest and the safest way to get into the city of Bangkok from the international airport.As the taxi charge around 1000 bath one way from airport to the city but same can be achieved for only 80 bath from airport rail link so its surely the best way to travel.
easy to go with. Airport Rail Link was easy to travel with, after a few minutes of reading how to do to get a ticket so we were on the train to Bangkok

One of the fastest option to use to travel from airport to town. Train comes almost every 15 minutes for the non-express line and the train is always congest with people from airport and people in the residential area near by. If you looking for traveling without pleasure or comfort but fast here it is.
Handy!. I used this service and it was easy and within the airport and cheap . I would use this service again.

Best Way To Beat Jam. This is the best transport to beat the jam if you are traveling against the time from airport. But the train can be a bit crowded during peak hour, be prepare to stand all the way from one station to another.

Metro Train. Airport link railway is like metro in Mumbai and delhi. But little beat costly it charged 40 bhat for 30 km. Also main pont is it is just inside airport. So no need to go outside and took texi. But see nearest station to your hotel
Good link between airport and city. The airport rail is a cheaper way to go from the airport to the city. It connects to the MRT and BTS line making is a very convenient way of travelling.
Quick way to get into the city. Great rail system that links you to the BTS and Metro lines. Staff are exceptionally helpful. Trains and stations are clean. Transport is very cheap.

Convenient. Very convenient, quick and cheap (120 THB for 2persons means 3euros), we took a taxi from our hotel next to the phra phanong bts for 60 THB to Ramkhamhaeng Station then we payed 30THB per person for the airport link. it takes about 30 min to reach the Airport it's very convenient to avoid Bangkok trafic and 500 THB of the taxi ^_^

Cheap, quick and efficient. We use this sky train every time we fly to Bangkok for the reasons mentioned in the title. For less than a pound you can get to many places in the city itself without having to ensure the massive traffic jams you would inevitably be in otherwise.Even if you aren't staying near one of the stops, it makes sense to get as far as you can on this train and then get a taxi to your destination. It is clean, on time and very safe.

good way to get around in bkk. I like taking the sky train but try to avoid end of work times cause then its really overcrowded. I Think prices are not to much and the trains go to the main shopping areas

Great way to avoid traffic. There is a great online map for your travel planing. Use the BTS to save time and avoid traffic. Try to use the BTS turing off-peak times as it does get crowed during business rush hour.

Much too slow. My expectation to a fast airport rail link is more like "speed" and be there in a better time then other transportation - no way. Too many stations, too long trip. At least 1 train every 30 min should stop max 1, 2 times instead of 12 or 15 like today :-(

Fast and good way to get to Suvarnabhumi Airport. Suvarnabhumi airport is pretty far from city center, but luckily there is ARL. It will take you only 30 minutes via city line and 15 min via express line (from Phyathai).
The sign are somewhat confusing, but you could ask the staff there.

Vers convenient. Although taxi's are good, forget about the traffic hassle and avoid the uncertain length of your transport with the fast and reliable Airport Rail Link (and benefit from the lower price as well).

Best way to beat the jam from the Suvarnabhumi Airport. It was my first time travelling out from Suvarnabhumi using the Airport Rail Link. Strongly strongly recommend this option instead of the taxi and you'll end up getting caught in horrible traffic. Took us about 40 minutes from airport right to Sukhumvit / Asok Station. I think it is about 130 baht for a ticket which is realtively cheap compared to any other Asian city with airport train.

A handy cheaper alternative but poorly signed. The airport rail link can be accessed from the city of Bangkok however you have to change trains at least once or twice and the signage is extremely cool there isn't any sign indicating way to go not even an aircraft icon.When you purchase your original ticket to travel from various parts of Bangkok nobody bothers to tell you you have to purchase an additional charge and when she did the transfer to the airport rail link.It's okay for a satellite traveling but if you have three or more people it will be cheaper and far more convenient to get a taxi.

Incredible. Fast and cheap way to beat the notorious traffic jams of BKK!! :D 40Baht from the airport to ratchaprarop station. The trains comes quite frequently and the waiting time is not long. Bad choice if you've got loads of stuffs because the seats are very limited.

Great Service. The much-awaited Airport Rail Link (06:00-midnight) that connects downtown Bangkok with Suvarnabhumi International Airport is a smart alternative to the airport’s express buses or taxis. The City Line makes six stops between downtown (Phayathai Station) and the airport, completing each run in 30 minutes, making this a quick and convenient transport option for getting in and out of Bangkok.The Airport Rail Link connects you to the MRT underground at Makkasan City Interchange Station (MRT Petchaburi Station) and the BTS Skytrain at Phayathai Station. Please note, the baggage check-in at Makkasan Station is no longer available. From Bangkok International Airport (Suvarnabhumi), the entrance to the Airport Rail Link service is on the First Floor.
very good way to get to airport. much faster and -depending on how many you are- cheaper than taxi, you can pay at the station and it runs every 15-20 min

Fast and solid. I love using this rail link as it is fast and superbly well built unlike the BTS sky train. This system however does not run 24hrs making late arrivals and early departures problematic. I get off where ever my street is nearby and take a taxi the rest of the way. This is a preferred method as it saves money and in many cases it saves time.

Always use the airport link.. At such a cheap price and availability why mess around outside with smelly taxi fumes in the stonking heat?! Its cheap and its fast. Just whip down a couple of floors from arrivals and youre on the way.
To airport. This is the easiest way to get to the airport from Bangkok. I use this service often, and will keep using it. Besides being convenient, it is time efficient.

Short and Comfortable Ride. Was taking the airport rail link from Pratunam area to Aiirport and back. Only 40baht per way and it is convenience. Need to kow that they had posted security officers to scan all luggage and bags towards the airport. Also they would be a security sweep before allowing the people to board the train at the both end of the journey.
Convenient, safe & reasonably priced.. Quickest mode of travel between the airport & city avoiding the hassles of haggling price & traffic.
Easiest way to airport. Fastest and cheapest way to go to airport or to some other connecting areas like Petchaburi BTS where you can take to go to Chatuchak market.

No rus, No jam, Just On-time. A great way to travel to & from airport by Airport Rail Link. Clean and comfortable ride. No problems for ant foreigners with all the English signage around in the Airport to the Rail Station.

Efficient and effective system.. Airport Rail link provides a very easy and efficient service from the main airport in Bangkok to the city, The service is clean, efficient and gets you into Bangkok in about 30 minutes. Trains run frequently, there is a local service which is cheaper and used by locals, this can become crowded, there is also an express service which is more expensive but faster and only stops at the Makasan station which you can use to connect to the subway system or you can obtain taxis at this station. Security is employed at the stations and baggage maybe "checked".

Best way to get through town avoiding the Bangkok traffic. Strongly recommended to get through town easily. All major shopping malls are linked with the BTS. In order to avoid the cues get the Orange Rabbit card. Easy, convenient and cheap way to get through town especially during rush hour.

Great way to travel to or from airport. Quick and easy to board. Buy a token from a machine for the tollgate and you are on board. Can be crowded at times because of the low fare and popularity. Arrivals and departures at the lower level and easy to find. Connects with MRT and BTS rail for onward journey to many city stops.

Easy Access to Bangkok from the Airport. ARL works great its easy and fast to get from the airport as long as where you want to stay or visit is near one of the stations.You can also get a cabout side the station if your destination is too far to walk.Cuts down on the time in a cab if you dont mind your luggage taggin along.

Amazing. This rail lick is fantastic. On time, and inexpensive. It brings you right into the main sky trail hub, or I like to stay at the inexpensive and pretty nice Nasa Vegas hotel. Great name. Just a few stops from the airport.

Easy and cheap. This is the easiest way into Bangkok! Catch it all the way the BTS for about 45baht pp.
Air conditioning, air conditioning!!! Bloody brilliant
convenient. good choice for travelling from airport to downtown, not a good choice if you carry heavy luggage, since there is no escalator / elevator connected with BTS (from downtown to airport)

Awesome sky train. This is a great sky train. I usually get off at the MRT stop Petchaburi, which is Makkasan on the airport rail link. The only thing is that if you have a bunch of bags, then you bump into a lot of people. Most people use this for their daily commute, not for travelling to the airport. Taxi is usually faster, but this is a lot more fun.
Cheap and quick. Very handy for getting you into town from the airport and if your hotel is near a skytrain or metro stop it'll save you loads compared with a taxi.
fast and simple. If you are staying near a bts or mrt station this is the best way to and from the airport. It is fast (especially compared to taxi during rush hour) and very cheap, only 45 baht!

Reliable and quick transport to and from ther Suvarnabhumi. It can be somewhat crowded at times but it is an efficient, cheap and reliable method of getting to and from the airport even with a couple of smallish suitcases.Links to BTS which is great.

Fast, convenient connection . Probably one of the best airport train connections in the world. Fast, very comfortable, inexpensive and running at high frequency - taking a taxi is completely out of question with such infrastructure in place.
Get there early at rush hour. Good service. Lots of trains so the queue wasnt too long. Wait was around 10 minutes as trains were all busy.Clean cool and quicker than a cab

Great way to miss traffic and be on time. Forget the heat, madness, and crazy traffic patterns when you can ride in ease and more comfort (and not watch your watch every few minutes and worry about getting to a hotel or an appointment).

Unbelievable Trip To The Airport for only 40THB!. Normally, I pay RM60 to RM90 to go to the Airport in Malaysia (550THB TO 800THB) via taxi. Even via train it is RM40 (350THB).With this, I can conclusively say that Bangkok is one of the most economical cities to live in when it comes to mass transport.

Cheap but crowded and not very accesible with allot of luggage. The system in itself is a great idea if you are travelling light. The prices are very cheap compared to taxi or other ways to go from the airport to the city. The problem we encountered is that we were travelling with allot of luggage. The train was very crowded and we barely fit in. People gave us allot of evil stares for taking up so much of the space with our suitcases.
Very efficient. The best way to reach the city center from the airport. It can be crowded at some times but it is clean and fast.
excellent. very easy to get, perfect air conditioning, clean. Cheap and you don't need to bargain like with the taxi drivers.
Awesome. Nice clean Fast Reliable always in TimeI recommend this method for transport if you need to go back and forth in Train
Best mode for to and fro from airport. it took just 45 baht and 30 mins to reach siam from airport, had i taken taxi, i would have paid atleast 700 baht and 90 mins.
Really cheap and convenient. Open from 5:30, really cheap and you can transfer to other serbvices, MRT or subway really easily. Good service

Efficient, air conditioned and cheap. I was arriving during peak hours so decided to take the ARL as I needed to get somewhere by a certain time and if I took a taxi could've been stuck in traffic! The signage was quite good to get to the stations. On board is air conditioned which is a relief from the humid weather. All in all a seamless and efficient trip and cheap too to get into Sukhumvit. If you have lots of luggage though you're probably better off catching a taxi unless you don't mind lugging it around.

So easy cheap and convenient. Got on at National Stadium, changed at Siam then one more, easy to navigate and helpful staff to ask directions if unsure, 70bht all up to be dropped in the middle of the airport, does need another carriage though

Long Wait times. Long wait times. Very very long for a train service like this. 15-20 minutes per train. The entrances aren't really designed to for heavy baggage, so be prepared to do some lifting. But once you get on, you do get to the airport very fast.
easy for the travel. easy for the transport from hotel to Suwannaphumi airport and 30 minutes and the cheaper more than taxi
Efficiency Plus. Very clean airconditioned and efficient transport. Very cheap and runs on time about every 12 minutes or so. Can be quite crowded.

Best way into the town. This service takes you to and from the main airport and connects with all other rail links in the city.
Easy to use and inexpensive without the stress caused by the Bangkok traffic

Not ideal with luggage. Although it looks good on the map, the interchange at Makkasab is a long way and down lots of esclatoes, simarly (although closer) the interchange at Phayathai. Gets crowded in the peak hours. Not suitable for lots of luggage!

Travelling light perfect. Take to a central stop and then use other means of transport.
Very cheap and efficient, not meant for travelers who cannot manage their luggage alone.

Check my review of BTS. But this i cool. only new and works better than BA. I have waited for years for this. And it does not disappoint. Clean, cheap, easy (don't be scared, just ask a local). You will find once you try, it really allows you to start a proper traveler experience, not a tourist one
Sky train . Felt like in mumbai metro. Good conectivty anyone can travel u have detail map and people are good to help.

Don't be tempted to go by taxi....... .....use the airport rail link instead. It's cheap...max 45baht and connects with other rail routes at some of the various stations. Ticket machines are in Thai and English..take notes and give change. Announcements on the trains are in Thai and English. Trains can get very crowded depending on the time of day so could be difficult if you have a lot of luggage. In the airport, you need to follow the signs down several floors to the trains. The trains don't have meters that aren't working and don't take a circuitous route either and are much much cheaper than a taxi.

good way to get into bangkok. The trains are located in the basement of the airport. The cost is pretty reasonable. The train is setup a bit different from the trains in Bangkok and help to accommodate suitcases and baggage. The train is quite fast but probably about the same time as it would take by taxi during non-rush hour times. One thing i noticed is that a lot of thais especial thai youth use this train to get into the city. Because of this the train can be crowded and difficult to exit with baggage. The stations are conveniently located with connections to other transport lines within bangkok. I would use the line again.

Quickest and cheapest way to get into town!. The airport link is a very convenient way to get into town. No hassle of having to find a taxi and run around with you luggage. It connects to BTS and MRT at different stops as well as the ferry. Once your in town you can still change into a taxi, you've just already skipped about 20 minutes of traffic minimum!

Quick, easy, reliable service from the main airport to the city area. A cheap, fast and reliable way to get to the airport. Especially useful in peak hour and rainy weather to beat the traffic. It is clean, the only problem can be getting to a station

Great...but...... Excellent way to get out to the airport, no surprises....nice view en route. BUT...BUT..BUT...only FOLDING bikes allowed! Which is crazy because there are special large LUGGAGE AREA standing room cars on each train that would be perfect for a regular bike. They have an Airport bike track surrounding the airport...23.5 km, yet you can't get there on the SkyLink!!??!!###&*!1!!Someone not thinking...the smaller Skytrain allows regular bikes at least at certain hours!
wow. Its a good and different way of traveling and so neat and very discipline people i have saw .And different way of taking a ticket counter .
Airport raillink. A cheap alternative to taxi so long as you know which station to get off at. It is well signposted at the airport so do homework first with station required and it is easy.

A must for getting into the City. I always use the airport rail link to get as close to my hotel as possible and then get a taxi or tuk tuk for the last part. It's ridiculously cheap , air conditioned and fast as the traffic in Bangkok is usually horrendous. Google map first and look at the different routes and options as some train lines go in a big loop which wastes time . For example if your going to Sukumvit it's faster and cheaper to get off at Makkassan and get a taxi then do a big loop and swap to the BTS train line.If only my home city of Melbourne had such a great train service for less than $2 each way.
Good and cheap. Cheap and easy way to get from surva-airport to almost the city centre. just stop at pattaya and get a taxi from there to your hostel.

Fast & easy way to access city center... You should definitely contact with information office to access the ariport rail link. If other agency catch you, they will definitely force you to go by taxi or bus. You can also contact with your hotel abour roadmap . But airport rail link is easy, fast and cheapest way to go city center from the airport. But it only have for suvarbabhumi airport. CheersErnur
Great public transport. A very quick, clean and cheap way to get from the centre of town to the airport with a frequent service.
i love saving money. it just takes 40 - 45 minutes to reach airport.it is the cheapest way to reach airport.fast, quick and economical.

Great and easy link between terminals. So easy to use to get between terminals. English signage which helped me understand. Well organised and maintained. Clean and efficient way of getting around a massive airport.
No traffic!!. fast way to get in and out from Bangkok. I really recommend the airport link from the airport into the city especially in the morning and afternoon traffic.

The fastest way into the city. The rail link is 45 baht one way and runs frequently. It's on the lower level of the airport - take escalators all the way down and get what looks like a poker chip token from the ticket window. The train cars have plenty of room for luggage. Taking the train all the way to Phaya Thai takes about 30 min. If connecting to the BTS, having large suitcases, or multiple suitcases may be more challenging to navigate since some of the BTS stops do not have escalators. The rail link will avoid the traffic of Bangkok and get you into the city faster even if you need a taxi from the rail link, or BTS station.

Really Convenient!. The cheapest and fastest way to get to the airport, you can check the itinerary online and go to the station (it is crowded so be aware of that if you are carrying lots of lugagge)
Clean, efficient and great value. Would recommend for all, easy to navigate, friendly staff and great value. Travelled from BKK to the city and then over the following days across the city.
Great way to the city. You save a lot, and I mean a lot, of time and money if you use the service. Fast, frequent, cheap. Excellent alternative to taxi.

Best option to central Bangkok if you are adverse to local taxis.... An efficient and really very cheap but safe way to get from the airport to downtown - a basic taxi will cost you 10 times as much!The service stops around midnight unfortunately and the express train no longer runs making the journey time around 30 mins with 6 stops.... still quicker than a taxi!
Very convenient. Took this link to the airport from my hotel in downtown Bangkok and it was quick, easy, very econonomical and an easy fast way to get to the airport.

Easy to use. Cheap and gets you were you need to go. If I didn't have a baby, stroller, backpack and carry-on I'd have used it for airport arrival/departure. So I used it when I had to go out and change a ticket. So much cheaper!
Faster and cheaper to reach Airport. Its connect to Airport and faster and cheapest way to reach from Airport to City and also connected to BTS which is kind of Delhi Metro or London Tube

Practical Time efficient trip. Took the train from airport to Phaya Thai then change to BTS downstairs. Cheap if you travel alone and wants to avoid bangkok's famous traffic. despite its connectivity, it will be a challenge if you bring heavy baggage.
Great way to get around. Cheap, fast, clean, on time, air conditioned. Best way to travel around Bangkok. Don't get stuck in traffic......take a sky train.

Glad they have it, but bureaucratic to use. I am glad they have this now, unlike at the old DMK airport. The process is pretty bureaucratic. Ticketbooth, agents, rules, chips and then you have to go through a security checkpoint. At the station they make you line up like at the military academy. But, it is a good way to get into town. Its 40 baht. An Uber directly to the hotel is 300-400, so if you have 3-4 people, this is a better option

Fast and Easy. If you travel without heavy baggage I would suggest using this ARL extremely fast and Easy i go from Makkasan station in just 20 to 30 minutes i already in Airport! Dont waste your time stucked in Bangkok traffic jam!
This ride it's an atraction itself!. It was just a blast to enter Bangkok this way! Modern, convenient and safe and on top of it a real look into Bangkok's local life!!

Very convenient and faster way to get around. Our hotel was situated 300 metres from the Nana BTS station near the Sukhumvit area. From the airport, instead of taking a taxi we had taken the Airport Rail Link as we were not sure about the city traffic. We changed train at the Phaya Thai Station and took the BTS Sky train. We were three of us and the total cost of reaching the Nana area from the Airport was less than 200THB.
Good. very convenient for travel within the city and I think fastest mode. very easy to negotiate with names in English.

Good . Good way to travel around in Bangkok and adjasunt suburbs. Cheap and much faster than using taxis due to the traffic there. The train most of the time is full but you will always manage to find a spot to sit or stand up among lovely Thai citizens. Recommended.
Must use it.. The road traffic in Bangkok is very bad so the only quick and reliable way to the city is on the train. Very efficient service.

typical thiland!. The airport Link from Suvarnabhumi to/from Bangkok has to rails, the fastrack which does not stop between points and the ordinary line which stops about 9 times between points. HOWEVER, in the last 12 months the fastrack has not been working and you are forced to take the alternative.

Best way to go to the City. From the airport to Makkasan MRT station to link with the Metro and to Phaya Thai to link with the BTS. Fast and doesn't depend on traffic: get a taxi to and from the next station to your hotel and void the traffic jams.

Fast and cheaper way to commute to the city. This is a good means to travel to the city if you are travelling alone with minimum baggage. Costs about 45 THB to Paya Thai which is the last station from where you can take a cab to your destination. On the taxi stand, there is some staff manning the place to arrange a taxi and they do it free of cost. For safety reasons, they note down the Taxi number and contact number along with the destination where you are heading. You pay the taxi driver purely on meter which is good.

Excellent way of going from the Airport to BKK. This is by far the cheapest and most easiest way to get to your hotel or destination in Bangkok. If you stay in Sukhumvit or other areas connected to the BTS Skytrain then this is the solution for you.

A great idea poorly executed. The airport link in bangkok was initially a great idea due to heavy traffic congestion but the fact that access with luggage is challenging that link to the sky train are not easy and that taxi access is a nightmare I would not recommend anyone with more than mobile hand luggage to use this
Waiting area. No express line. Very hot waiting area. Do not use at the prime time because it's very crowded at that time.
zip into city. Quickest, easiest way into the city and the great mrt/bti system. Avoid all those traffic jams and fumes.

Not worth it. Even if you are a shoestring traveller, I would not recommend using airport rail link unless there is a massive traffic congestion in Bangkok City. In most cases, taxi would bring you into the city area in less than 40 minutes and probably 70 minutes during peak traffic hours. Airport Rail Link takes at least 70 minutes. And unlike airport rail in most other countries, Bangkok Airport Rail link runs very slow. Even slower than the MRT. The only good thing about it is the US$1/- fare from Makasan to Suvarnabhumi Airport and the consistence timing it takes.I rather take a risk with taxis.

Airport link. An outstanding economical facility's I used it with my family for thrice it costed us 35 bth from airport to makassan station and from their you can change the train and go to bts train stations . From airport to makassan it takes 25 minutes approx

Cheap way into town. I used the train to get to my hotel in Ploen Chit. 45 Baht, Plus I think 18 for the BTS. Be aware if travelling with heavy luggage! There is quite a bit of walking in between the stations/stairs when transferring to the BTS.
It works. Got me to and from the airport on a budget, ran on schedule, and was clean. What more can you ask for?

Fuss-Free. Can even be faster than Taxis due to the massive BKK Jam.. Cheap and Good. Not recommended if you're travelling in a huge group or with heavy luggage. The airport links to the BTS. Added Bonus!
Cheap n Convenient . Is always the best choice to take airport link BTS to town sides towards Paya Thai or via vesa to the airport. The ride about 30 - 40 minutes cost between 20 - 50 bahts.

cheap way to Airport especially if you solo traveler. Its really a cheap way to Airport especially if you solo traveler. You can't share your taxi fee with anyone after all this public transportation really useful and helps you manage your budget. Make sure your flight arrive and depart to/from SUV so you can enjoy your new experience with this service.
Wow. The quickest (especially in rush hour) to get to anywhere in Bangkok. Cheap and hassle free. Buy your ticket from the platform machines and get on and enjoy the ride.

Fast and Cheap Way of Getting to Suvarnabhumi Int'l Airport. Train stops running at midnight-ish so if your flight is before then, awesome way really of getting to airport. If you are near the BTS, take it to Phayathai BTS station, where the airport rail link connects. Or if you are near the MRT, take it to Phetchaburi MRT station where it connects to airport rail link Makassan station. The ride is 30 mins approximately from Phayathai (first stop of airport rail link) to the airport. And it costs about 45 baht. So dirt cheap and fast. Only concern would be there have been the rare moments when the train has stopped working, which would be a nightmare if you are trying to catch a flight. But rare.
Quick and convenient. Easiest way to go to and from the city. We still managed to squeeze in at 5pm on a Thursday afternoon rush hour from the airport to the City.

Avoid the Bangkok traffic ... take the ARL. The Airport Rail Link is very convenient if you are travelling in small numbers, if it's rush hour, it's raining, or you are running on the cheap. If there are 4 in your group, I recommend taking a taxi as it reduces the amount of lugging bags.Hope you never have to travel on Friday evenings when it's raining!!!The Airport Rail Link is at the basement of Suvarnabhumi Airport. You need to just keep going down the escalators until you can’t go any further. Then you need find your way to the centre of that level and you will find a downward slope towards the ticket office and gates.This is also where you can change your money. There are several foreign exchange counters in this area, and although you can’t play one off the other, you can work out which one is offering the best rate and plump for that one. You probably won’t get such a concentration of foreign exchange dealers in one location anywhere else in Bangkok. Also something to bear in mind, these guys like big notes. If you are travelling with large denomination bills, you will see on the electronic boards that they offer better rates for those larger notes.The line that you currently have no choice but to take the the commuter line. This also stops at Makkasan and Phaya Thai BTS stations, but also every stop along the way. The service runs from 06.00 – 24.00While I can’t give you the exact prices for all the stations, to get to Makkasan it costs THB 35, for Paya Thai it is THB 45 (about 60-80p in real money) for about a 30minute journey. As a point of reference, a taxi could cost around THB400 (£7) and might take longer if it’s rush hour or/and it’s raining.You can either use the machine (which will be in English or Thai) or you can go to the counter. Very broadly, if your hotel is near an MRT station, you will need to go Makkasan, if your hotel is near a BTS station you will need Phaya Thai.In exchange for your THB45 you will receive a little token in the shape of a large coin — either yellow or red in colour if I remember correctly.Once you have gone through the gates, you make your way down the escalators to the platform. Usually there are people already queuing up at the doors. This not the opportunity to show how clever you are, and try to sneak to the front. Thai people are generally non-confrontational so probably won’t say anything, but you will certainly get other visitors making comments to you such as “get to the back … buddy” or, if you’re really unlucky someone just punches you one… no no … I jest, but there is reason there is a queue, people got there before you! If you happen to have arrived just as a train has left, you will find yourself at the front of the queue. This does not mean stand right by the door. You will need to stand behind the line. If you don’t, you will soon hear a blast of a whistle when the security instruct you to retreat — bear this in mind, as it happens at all BTS stations. If you’re wondering why the whistle is blowing, it’s probably because of you!When the train does finally arrive, don’t dash on before everyone has got off. Firstly, this is bad etiquette anywhere in the world (just because you left your home country doesn’t mean you left your manners behind:)) but secondly, yes you guessed it, it will lead to a blast on that famous whistle. The security guards will visually sweep the train to ensure that there was nothing left on the train, or that there is nothing suspicious (other than tourists). Once they give the all clear, you can go ahead and board.Bear in mind that this is a commuter train so you will be sharing the carriage with many other people. Yes, when you first get on it is likely that there will be plenty of space. However, as you get to more and more stations there will be many people boarding — especially if it is rush hour and/or raining. Remember how you feel when it’s rush hour? Yeah, you get pee’d off when people take lots of space, so think about others. Keep your luggage close and don’t take up those extra spare seats for your hand bag.
Going to the airport. If you are going to the airport the airport rail link is not the fastest or the most comfortable. It is however very easy and affordable.
Easy Rider. This was by far the best way to get to or from the airport. From now on I will book accommodation near to a station. Traveling by car can take forever but this was hassle free.

A crush. This train no longer runs non stop from the airport to the city and stops at the suburban stations on the way. It was most inconvenient for us with our luggage on the crowded train. I would recommend a taxi

Use this link for a great start in Bangkok holidaying!. The Airport Rail Link is connected at Phaya Thai Bangkok Train Service (BTS). It costs only 40baht between the stations from the Suvarnabhumi international airport! From Phaya Thai BTS, you can hop onto a taxi that can bring you pratically anywhere within 100 baht.Happy holiday!
Airport link to bangkok city. Airport link is very well connected to Bangkok city and you have to change at Phaya Thai to any location in bangkok. Announcements are made in both in Thai and English.

the easiest and cheapest way to get to the center of Bangkok. train is really fast (just 25-30 minutes from the airport), also it is quiet cheap (40-45 BAT per person). Also all trains are equipped with air-conditioning, so you are not suffering from heat. Comfortable and easy way to get to the city center.
Skytrain. Take this to get to the city. It's much better than a taxi, only 70 baht! Air conditioned and easy to navigate. It's on the bottom floor of the airport.

Way to AIrport. That was a great experience travelling to Airport without any traffic congestion. Thats really good to have a Direct Rail Link to Airport as it saves time and also provides a perfect journey.
Easy way of travelling and cheap too. The connection to the last stop (starting from the airport) costs 45 THB per person. This is so much cheaper than a taxi!

Very easy to use . The rail link was 5 minutes walk from our hotel Indra Regent and we used it frequently to connect us to phaya thai where we could catch the sky trains on the other lines. Though we did not use it to go to the airport we saw that it's very much used by tourists and has all facilities needed like lifts for luggage and staff to guide people the right way. Very clean and user friendly. I would recommend to ensure that staff understands english as its an airport rail link and they come across tourists all day long. Staff not knowing English are not helpful to foreigners.

Good but not great. If you are travelling light and are rushing to be at someplace and it is the peak traffic hours then this is a good choice. However it your are carrying heavy luggage and your hotel is far from the station then this is not for you. Also if you have 2-3 other companions who can share the taxi then you leave this option and go for taxi.

Amazing fast transit! Easy to use. I have used this many times. Coming from the Bangkok airport you go to the lowest level, and follow the signs, pretty easy, it is just around the corner from the escalator. Pay for a token at the booth where they have live people. Price depends on where you go. The line is pretty straight, but it does have stops. I take it all the way to the end - Phaya Thai. It is air conditioned and fast. Before you board at the airport, they do have transit police that search the train when it arrives before they let anyone board, then they let people in. You use the token to enter the station area where you descind to the platform area. The trains run very frequently. This part is handicapped friendly, a lot of the stations are not however. Depends on where you go. some have elevators to the ground (or escalators) many stations only have stairs though. Phaya Thai station does have an elevator to the street.

Easy ride to the City.. I have use the Airport Rail Link several times and happy to it. The only problem is when you have big luggage or more than one luggage because it is hard to move specially you link it with BTS. By using this you can save time and money on your travel to and from the airport.
Best way to reach the city . Take the Airport Rail Link instead of a taxi. It's easy to book, cheap and fast and you have perfect connection to the Skytrain for further destinations in the city.

Train from the airport . So easy and simple to use. Asked tourist police for guidance only cost around £2 each for the train from the airport to the nearest station to our hotel. We then got a tuktuk straight to our hotel door for 100 bht

it's Convenient and safe. The rail link in Bangkok is convenient and safe, cheap.The tourist can take this system to go from Suvarnabhumi airport to the center of Bangkok. however they can increase more the turns of this system.

Best way for airport transportation. The airport rail link is cheap, air-conditioned, clean and very user-friendly. I'd definitely recommend this over the taxi drivers who are over-charging you. Our ticket was only 70 baht and taxi drivers began negotiating at 800 baht and with the traffic jams you never know exactly how long it would take with a taxi?

Excellent Airport Link. The services are comprised of 2 lines, non-stop Express services and City Train services. Both lines operate from 06.00 am. – midnight.
Facilitating the tourists and commuters to travel to other parts of Bangkok, both lines have interchange station at Makkasan Station for MRT (Underground train) at Phetchaburi Station.

Best way to travel into the city!. If you just arrived at Bangkok, Thailand(BKK) or plan to go to, use the Airport Rail Link. It is the BEST method of transportation to go to the city. The Airport Rail Link stations are very close to other train lines, so you can mount and dismount easily and keep on moving through the city. It's way cheaper than taxis and way faster. Remember that traffic is insane in Bangkok.

Quick and easy way back and forth to Suvarnabhumi. The Airport Link is an excellent way if you like to go by yourself and not take a taxi. The end station in Bangkok is close and Connected to the BTS system for easy transfer other places in town.

Affordable Way to get to the city. Affordable way to get into the city if you don't have lots of baggage with you. the airport link connects BTS in Phaya Thai and then you just have to walk 5 mins to reach the BTS but there are lots of signs to guide you. Highest fare would be 42 THB from the Airport to Phaya Thai.

Got us into the city from the airport.. A very efficient and cost effective method of transportation. We were staying in a hotel near the airport on our last night in Thailand and took the train into the city.

Fastest Ride from the Airport. The airport link is awesome! Imagine a ride from the airport that can actually take you in the center of the city (or vice-versa). I usually take this ride and go down the Makkasan station and with just a few minutes walk i'm already in downtown Sukhumvit area! What a breeze for travelers!

Very convenient!!!. Its fast, on time, main thing is you dont have to sit in the Bangkok Traffic!! The price is a little expensive if you take the direct train, but if you take the indirect one which have around 4 to 5 stops in between barely takes 45 minutes and its very cheap!!

Fast and cheap. If you want to see the sites above the hustle and bustle and save on taxi fares this is the way to go. A/C and comfortable. At airport end something of a mystery tour to get to level 3 however you will note food court and bus station when you alight from train. Cheap eating option compared to level 3 (departures)
Good alternative to taxi. You can save both time and money by choosing the Airport Rail link. However it can be very crowded at times.

The Best path . Since they built it, We always used it.Without a doubt it is the best way to get the Center of Bangkok in less time. At the begining there was two sky train lines. Non stop and the other one, now there is just the one wich has diffrent stops. But it is ok. In 30 minutes You will be there. In a taxi coulb be two hours. You must check wich is the Best stop to take another line or the subway I always enjoy the trip looking through the window, looking how different is this country. I love it

Nice Rail System - But, Visa on Arrival at Bangkok Airport is Very Bad. Airport rail link is good option to reach the city. But, Visa on arrival at Bangkok Airport is very bad.Its advisable to apply visa for Thailand before your journey. Few tips:1. You need to spend 5 hours in the queue standing (without any food / water option) to get your visa stamped (even though you are ready with all your documents)2. Better you carry Thai Bhat or accepted currency for exchange, before you land, as there are no ATM facility before the immigration lane, in Bangkok Airport.Hope you make use of these tips.

There is no longer an express service. This is a great service, but only if you use it right. If you have luggage or children its not a great idea to use the train in either direction. If you are on your own, have little luggage and your destination in Bangkok is near one of the airport line stations then the train is the best way to go: it is very cheap in comparison to a taxi and is much faster during peak hours. However if you are going from Bangkok to the airport then ONLY use the train if you are getting on at the first station - Phaya Thai. If you get on at any of the other stations you will struggle to get on and will certainly not get a seat.
Faster and cheaper than a taxi. Take the train from the airport, and get on the BTS from there. If your hotel is in Sukhumvit, it souns like a detour,but during rush hour it will be much faster!

Best Mode of transport. We could not expect any better mode of transport. Very convenient, clean and safe. Even though the fair for kids and adults was the same, which was surprising. Every one in our group loved traveling in the Rail Link and the metro
Easy way to transfer. Airport rail link is a very good way for airport transfer if you are a light traveller. It has regular service and reliable and cheap.

Best option in bangkok. This saves a lot of time! Loved using the service. It gets crowded but if you don't have any check in luggage this is a great option. Best used by those traveling light without small kids

Airport link (uses different payment of BTS & MTR). Total time of full train ride from airport to Praya Thai (linked to BTS).Airport link at Mayasan is also linked to MTR. All these 3 services use their own payment systems (which is the only bad point about city BKK trains)
Perfect to go downtown. Very easy to use and not expensive. Advantage, you know exactly how long it will take to go downtown. Connected to the skytrain

Fastest and cheapest way to travel from Bangkok Airport!!. This is undoubtedly the fastest, cheapest and most convenient way to travel from the Suvarnabhoomi Airport into Bangkok or other way around. The trains are really fast, spotlessly clean, and very punctual. At 90 Baht per person one-way, they are dirt cheap, and a fraction of the 1200 to 2000 or more Baht that any kind of Taxi will charge you. There is enough space to keep all your luggage, and mostly the train is half empty. It's even got a clean toilet inside it.
Very on time. It's very near to my hotel so I use it to connect to BTS. The service serve untill mid night 12am. I stop at Ratchaprarop Station.
Best way to avoid bangkok traffic jam. Although the speed of train was not fast, it was still the best way to avoid traffic jam between airport and Bangkok city centre.

Fast convenient service. It's easy to get from the Suvarnabhumi airport to the city with this fast and regular train service, but it doesn't go to the other airport, Don Mueang. When the Skytrain is extended you'll be able to get to Don Mueang that way. If you need to travel between the two airports, use the free shuttle bus.
Airport - BTS. the best way to get connected to city. cannot avoid the heavy traffic of bangkok. it is reasonable and healthy to walk..

Transit from airport rail link to their BTS or MRT.. Since it was my first time travelling there. Had doubts of taking the Taxi's. So my friends and i decided to take the Airport Rail Link. Might look like there only a few stations but the journey from one to the other station can be quite long i would say.

Great and inexpensive way to get into town from Airport. Least expensive way to get from Swampy to downtown. If your hotel is close to a station its a perfect way to save a bundle. If not then you will still need a taxi so best to grab one on the lower level and insist on a meter.

FROM THE INTERNATIONAL TO THE METROPOLIS IN EASE. Just go to the lower lever of the Suvarnabhumi International Airport and use the RED LINE or the BLUE LINE to transport you in convenience and air conditioned ease to/near the BTS skytrain (depends on what your location may be).I use this to/from the airport every time I go to Bangkok and would always look out and see the horrific traffic and confusion as I easily traveled to my near-by destination.Great using this service and since I lived in Thailand for over 11 years. IT IS THE BEST !!!

A great addition to the BTS system.. I have visited Bangkok before this link was added to the BTS Skytrain system, and I was always forced to take a taxi to Suvarnabhumi Airport. This link saves my money and especially time getting to the airport. I still take a taxi, if I have a lot of luggage, because it is difficult to haul luggage in and out of the Skytrain, but for shorter trips, when I only have one bag and a carry-on, this is the way to go.

Quick and easy during busy street traffic times. . Took me 35min on a Friday morning from Asoke station with a short transfer on the metro then on to the airport. No complaints. Would certainly do this over the far more expensive taxi if you are staying centrally on the BTS or metro lines.

Rail link travel. The airport rail link is useful as a convenient way to beat the traffic jam in the city centre.However when it goes into the city, most of the stations do not have escalators or lifts so carrying a heavy suit case is difficult to move down the stairs.Otherwise the sky trains are a blessing to go to all the shopping malls which are conveniently next to or link to the stations.
Airport rail link. Excellent service from the airport to the city of Bangkok. Easy to understand and use. Plenty of space for your luggage. Very friendly staff. Excellent value.
Convenient and VERY Reasonable. If you have little, or no, luggage, at 45 baht for a one-way ride into Phya Thai this is the best deal in town!

Great way to the city. The last time I took a cab from Suvarnabhumi Airport to Sukhumvit, I paid almost THB500 without any jam. The ride only cost THB200-300 usually so this time I tried the Airport Rail and it was great. Although it wasn't clear - I followed the crowds and got to my hotel without any trouble. If I knew how to take the express train, it would have been better but I only paid Less than THB100 for 2 pax - had to stand and squeeze with the crowds with my luggages (if i only known where to stow) so no complaints!
easy to use!. fast and convenient way to get to and from the airport. many stops connect to MRT and SRT rails so as long as you stay near one of those systems, it's easy peasy!

Convenient. I don't quite understand what's the difference between this rail and the sky train as it's pretty much the same. It's a convenient, affordable and easy way of getting into the city centre from the airport and vice versa. You can connect with the Sukhumvit sky train line.

Perfect n easy transport. Highly recommend to take this Airport Rail Link, it's so easy, cheap and stress free. Just buy the ticket at the vending machine or at the counter. Then proceed one floor down to catch the train to the city and it takes about 30 mins. No traffic congestion Frm city you alight n buy another ticket if you want to transfer to BTS train.

reliable, fast and safe. I was a bit stressed as it was my first Bangkok experience and travelling from the airport is always a big issue. But this train service is excellent, always running on time. However it can get really busy during peak hours.

Best way to go to the city if you are traveling alone or two. I've been using ARL over two years now and I love it. YYou can easily transfer to BTS or MRT. I always use ARL every time I visit Bangkok. I hope it would be great If there's free or paid shuttles to major tourist's hot spots during certain hours so that stopover tourists can easily enjoy the beuaty of Bangkok.

This is good if you have no big bags. . The new rail link is a good thing if you have small luggage, and not to early or to late. The rail is very cheap, many stairs and much walking distance to get to the rail from most places.

Easy access to and from airport. Want to get to city fast and cheap ? and it's very convenient !
Get to the city from the airport within 45 mins,; no jams no toll fee and usually no crowded trains.
Great for solo tourist and it costs only up to 45 bahts to get to Ratchaprarop, which is near Pratunam .
Easy connection. Very easy connection between the airport and the city of Bangkok. It's cheap and fast, no trafficjam.

Best way to get into or out of the city. If you are new to Bangkok you will certainly be ripped off by cabs. Don't take a cab out of the airport. Get on the airport link and it drops you off right in the middle of the city. You can change to MRT or BRT to get to wherever you need to go.
great accessibility. great transportation to choose from other then taxis from airport. gets u to most hotels in downtown bangkok.
Efficient. The signs in the airport are very clear to lead you to the station. The payment details are also very clear. It goes directly to the station for you to change trains to town.

Clean, fast and good. Clean, fast and good public transportation.
Buy daily pass if you travel alot. worth the pay than paying each trip every time.

Efficient and Speedy Service. Having arrived and experienced the Bangkok traffic at first hand, there was no other sensible choice to ensure timely arrival for our return flight. The train journey was fast and efficient and so much quicker than a taxi; the sensible choice!

Pros and Cons. If travelling light with no kids it can be a good option to avoid traffic
Pros
- Avoid traffic
- Reasonably priced
- Fast and reliable for timely arrival
- Clean
Cons
- Changing terminals is a long walk
- Buy new tokens for subways(this one is wierd)
- No baggage racks
- escalators did not work (for me atleast)

Not bad. 1. The customs check takes a long time, you have to queue for a long long time. You would be worried if you would miss your flight. Their work efficiency should be increased. 2. There are friendly staff members there but the express airport city link has been out of order for quite some time (according to the staff, it has been damaged since last year), so if you want to go to the city center in a cheaper way, you can only take the mrt or bus. 3. Quality of the taxi drivers outside the airport should be increased because one of the taxi drivers said he could not give us any change as he didn't bring any extra money with him, which was quite absurd, kind of forcing us to give him lots of extra tips. 4. Overall, it is quite a new airport with good duty-free shops but some progress could be made in the near future. 5. Bangkok is a place worth visiting again as it preserves its traditional culture and heritage well. 機場的效率應該再提升, 但是曼谷是值得再去的城市。
very convenient. if you arrive during rush-hour be prepared for the crush of people at the first station.Wish the ticket vending machines accepted credit cards.
Screw the tuktuks. BKK train and tube system is quite good in some parts of town. I recommend using the train to get from downtown to the airport, because sometimes it is hard to get a metered taxi.
good service. Can get very busy at times but its clean fast and cheap travel and takes you right into the airport,

Hassle-free transportation from and to the airport. Since it was my first time to visit Thailand, i was really glad to have found this airport rail link which was very easy to use. The translations inside the stations were also very helpful. Maps were everywhere except for the toilets. But the stations were really safe and reliable, clean and almost on-time. I think the train is usually packed not just by thousands of travelers but also of the locals so make sure that you can bear to stand for some time depending on where you're getting off. I guess in some stations exits were confusing so make sure to find someone to ask to before you go anywhere. There were stations that do not have air conditions also so be ready during summer time. Nonetheless, it's a great help for tourist alikes. I bet it is safe, too as i did not encounter any bad or alarming issues during my almost couple of weeks stay in Bangkok where i only used trans and trains and trains. Happy travel!:)
Fastest way to reach Airport. I feel very comfortable to use Airport Rail Link to go to Suvarnabhumi. Mainly the stations are easy to access by BTS Sky train.

Most efficient mode of transport from airport to city. I have taken ths transport a few times and can say when you are to travel during peak hours, nothing can beat airport rail link. Though, reaching till that point in BKK traffic can be an issue at times!

transfers. very easy to use if you get stuck people are very willing to help just ask, so much cheaper that private cars. We stayed in Siam and had no problems getting to and from our hotel on the train and cost less than $10.00

Amazingly Easy. We got off our plane and were newbies to Bangkok. It was approximately 10pm at night. We walked outside to the cab rank and my goodness, the cue, it was so long. My husband and i just looked at each other and decided to take the train. At first i was slightly apprehensive, as we didn't have a clue of the vicinity of the hotel from the train station and we didn't have 3G so we couldn't check on our phone, however, any apprehension that i had quickly was gone, because once we got to the the train station, it was so very easy to navigate. We got to our hotel with ease and for 40 baht each as opposed to a 600 plus Baht trip via taxi, so win win for us. It is such an excellent transport system, and so clean, it would be great if Melbourne Airport had one!

Good if your in a rush. This is a bit expensive so unless your in a rush I'd take the taxi which should cost you about 800-1000 bt.The taxi will get you there in better comfort and does door to door, unlike this choice. It takes about 30mins

Useful if in a hurry. This is a useful way of getting to and from Suvarnabhumi Airport, but only if you're in a hurry. The reason is that the train inevitably gets packed, and that makes for a very UNCOMFORTABLE journey. Catching a taxi to/from the airport is still relatively cheap (providing you insist on them using the meter) and obviously much more comfortable.

A good way to the airport, but could be better.. Pros : cheap, air-con, stops at MRT subway and BTS skytrain.Cons : I don't know what the STATE RAILWAY OF THAILAND is thinking. The train takes almost 1 hour to get to the airport from Phya Thai BTS station, with many stops including the one at Lad Krabang where KMITL is located. A huge number of passengers adds to the ARL here and I found it was terrible. I could barely breathe with the sweating armpit of another passenger in front of me. Many luggages and bag packs kept everyone stuck in their places. And yes, we have to stand all the way to the airport (there are seats but very little amount). Another issue I found annoying is when I departed from the airport to get to the city. I understand the security reason that the security needs to check for any abnormality left in the train but the way they communicate is horrible. They shouted and blew the whistle at the passengers like some homeless dogs, to stop them from getting into the train before the inspection. Why don't they close the doors while doing this ?
Airport Link. Just on more station from the hotel and connect with airport like to Suvarnabhumi airport. No worry for traffic.
Fast and convenient ride from the airport. Take the ARL to Bangkok if you want to avoid traffic and have an air-conditioned experience. Otherwise you can take a taxi or a tuk- tuk.

The rail line is the BEST way to get around Bangkok.. We had too many bags for the rail line, but we were happy with the service none-the-less. One tip, have someone write your hotel destination (name) down in Thai. Taxi drivers simply don't understand or read English.

Best Transportation alternative from SuvarnaBhumi airport to Paya Thai.. the train helps a lot to get access until paya thai station. you can take another train link depend on hotel location. the train will stop operation at 11.30 PM. so if you arrived in bkk before that time, you can get the train till the downtown. the train will operate 6.30 AM in the morning. in the between 11.30 PM until 6.30 AM you need to take bus or taxi....the train is very comfortable and cheap....recommended.
Most economical way to reach downtown from Airport. Strongly recommended for young tourists to Bangkok. Easy and cheap to use. Clean and convenient as well.

Fast and efficient. What a way to be ushered into the country !! Upon arrival just proceed several levels down you get to hop into clean, cool coaches. It brings you straight into the heart of bangkok. Terminals are so clean and the cost to is very affordable!

Fastest, safest and cheapest way to the Bangkok center for a backpackers. Well, this IS good not only to backpackers really, but for people, who don't carry tons of belongings and wanted to save money and time with reasonable comfort.Traffic jams are terrific here! And expect, that taxi drivers will charge you more than agreed if you are stuck in a jam ( if you use taxi with meter you know, that you _will_ pay for each minute in jam ). So, in metered taxi the best case you pay around 300-500 depending on traffic conditions to reach the very center ( Patumwan ) , in nonmetered the price is random but it's not uncommon to pay 1300-1500 if you are unaware. In contrast, you will pay 80 THB to reach Phaya Thai BTS station if you will use Rail Link ( and be delivered within a fixed time ).Traveling here is very safe, don't expect rude crime here ( and anywhere in Thailand )

fantastic. it just takes 30 mins to come in city via airport rail link we had 5 baggage still managed very well to come by train in just 115 baht where in all taxi drivers outside of airport will ask from 600 to 1000 baht

Best option from the airport to town. If you are arriving at Suvarnabhumi airport and staying in Bangkok then this is the easiest option. The train makes several stops with connections to the other travel networks. Termination at Phaya Thai station its an easy connection to the BTS. Cost full length trip is 140 THB and takes about 25 mins.

The Best & fastest way to the heart of Bangkok. The Airport Rail Link is similar to the KLIA or the Airport Express in Hong-Kong and Malaysia respectively. It connects the Suvarnabhumi airport to Phaya Thai with 6 stops in between.The service is fast, prompt and efficient. The trains are clean and maintained well.

Good to use. I used this train from BKK airport to Payathai. It opens at 6:00 AM and it takes about 30 min to Payathai. The train is somewhat cool but comfortable. It costs about 55 Baht.
We can carry our luggages. Many local people get on the train and soon becomes full.

Great even with bags. There was 4 of us with our bags and we had no trouble buying tickets and getting our suitcases onto the train. Got you into the heart of Bangkok with no hassle. Recommend it especially at peak times, it probably is quicker then the road

Too easy!. So easy and quick to access the airport line in Bangkok. Clean cheap cool and efficient. Great way to beat the traffic and arrive on time and cool! Really easy to navigate and to get you to and from airport!
Cheap, easy to use. The airport rail link is a quick, easy and cheap way to get from downtown Bangkok to Suvarnabhumi airport.

Convenient, fast, and safer/less hassle than the taxis. Great way to get from airport to downtown - though once downtown will likely need to get another train to hotel areas, or a taxi. Also if you have lots of bags, be prepared for long walks to/from platforms, and up-down escalators or lifts, or sometimes only stairs. Quick and cheap way of getting into the city without taking the terrible rip-off and dangerously fast taxis.

Value for money. I can't believe our hotel tried selling us an airport transfer for almost 1000THB when the Airport Rail Link is SO much cheaper, easy to use and probably just as quick. A very easy connection to BTS Skytrain makes this the obvious choice for getting to/from BKK airport.
most convent tranpostation in/out of suvanarnabhumi airport. cheap and convenient. best way to avoid bangkok traffic from town. but will be packed during rush hours. connected to payathai BTS station

A reasonable option but not frequent enough. This is one way to avoid Bangkok road congestion when travelling to or from the airport. Unfortunately the services are just not frequent enough to make it compelling ... and then there is the problem of no excellent interchanges to the BTS system

Not during peak times. This used to be good when it ran express to and from the airport: now that it has reverted to multi stop service the value has been lessened.It's stil *ok* for off peak trips but during peak times it is so overcrowded and unpleasant: the aircon struggles to work, there is insufficient seats, limited space for luggage.It works fine if travelling with hand carry only but not with large luggage.Maybe when the express comes back in line in 2017 the service will be better for tourists again.

Time managment in most jam city.. Sufficient time management in heavily traffic jam of Bangkok. This journey choice can throw your trouble away from traffic jam when return to Suvannabhumi International Airport.

Best way to get to the airport if you have a daytime flight . We took the airport rail link to catch a domestic flight and was by far the easiest and cheapest way to get there. Bangkok roads are mayhem and often full of traffic jams which can take up to an hour to clear on sections. Not to mention the taxi meter ticking along while sitting there. I got a taxi to the airport previously and it cost me 400baht and I nearly missed my flight due to traffic even though leaving with enough time. The sky train to the airport was 45baht. So a huge difference, especially if your running out of money at the end of your trip. The platforms also have mini shops on them were you can buy tea and coffee and even a McDonald.

Fabulous transport. Boy does Bangkok have the best train system.. Stayed in Bangkok 5 days (used the train) then onto Phuket.. On our way back to Australia we had a 10 hour stop in BKK so we hopped on the train at Airport, then connected onto another train & went to Siam/MBK for shopping, stress free, easy as, no traffic & was brilliant..

Supper efficient to the city. Arrived the airport around 11 am and straight to the custom. Passing through successfully and go downstairs without any suitcases. After that, there are pretty clear sign to direct you to reach the BTS. It’s clear to instruct you how to purchase the metro ticket at the entrance. The hallway offered some food stand, but it’s forbidden to have any food and drinks inside. Please be aware that. It only took about 20 minutes to be in the city. I will say it’s easier to reach the city if you have only carry on. Highly recommend.

Extremely good! . This is the way to travel to the airport in Bangkok. No guarantees the cabs will get you there on time because of the traffic jams wishing Bangkok city. This rail link brings you directly into the airport so is vary convenient. Even if you have older people or big bags, lifts will take you to the different levels very smoothly. Don't make the mistake of taking a cab to the airport!!
Cheap and easy. Great to use , easy, cheap and quick. Very helpful staff at the airport just follow the signs. Cost about 50 cents to get to Bangkok from airport

They urgently need to add at least 2 carriages to the train!. Some years ago, as it has started, it usually was empty or evenings only half full.
