Meanwile, despite the cutting the gap between the trains to 15 minutes, they are fairly full even on weekends or at the day time. In rush hours the trains are really overcrowded! There is enough place on the platfrom ov every station to let the train be at least double so long as it now is. The railway company urgently needs to increase the amount of carriages in every train to at least 5, better even to 6.
cool, efficient and fast way into town!. Love this transport to get into town very quickly in a cool carriage.Clean and comfortable.Only down side is that Makkassan rarely has taxis waiting outside.

Great means of transport, especially if travelling alone. Safe, fast and totally reliable. When running short of time, this is the best possible way - 25 mins from Phaya Thai station to airport (inside of the airport)Very reasonable and you get a seat (if you are standing pretty ahead in the line)Very good if traveling to or from the airport during weekdays (too much traffic in the city during the weekdays)

Cheapest airport option. Seems like there used to be a non-stop line from Phaya Thai Skytrain stop to the airport and vice versa, but it was suspended. The "local" line was running, but very crowded. If you don't want to spring for a taxi, this is easy and there's plenty of English signage--with friendly staff members lurking nearby to help.Just one thing. Skytrain uses the "Rabbit" stored-value cards and everything about this setup makes it look like the Airport line should seamlessly connect with Skytrain. But it doesn't. You either buy a new token or you get a separate Airport stored-value ticket. (Compare, for example, with Hong Kong and the ever-convenient Octopus card.) And the times I used this train, it was crowded. Many people had no seats because it serves as a "local" line.Final tip: if going to the airport, don't try to use the lift from any floor other than the lowest level. There are escalators (that's good) but the lifts will be full.

Don't be Intimidated!. So unbelievably easy. So cheap. Sooo much faster than a cap. Ticket machines have English option and signs into the station below the airport couldn't be anymore in your face. Spend 30 seconds to see which stop is closest to your lodging and save yourself a headache and some cash.

Cheap and Best. Connects airport to bangkok city and it's metro services. though the stations are not well air conditioned, but are clean non the less.tickets can be bought from the counter or the ticket vending machines. the rates are cheap and the security in the embarking zone is good to look out for overstepping kids and adults alike. the train itself is clean, well air conditioned but to get a seat can be a luck you can wish on, in crowded days.saves money. taxi ride will cost anywhere about 600-1000 bahts, the rain and the metro will cost about 50-70 bahts. so if you are not carrying much luggage, hit the station and save some money for a couple of beers, later.

use from airport. perfect way to get into town.Easy to buy ticket at airport.All is in Thai and English language.Disadvantage train was full full after 2 stations.And the arriving station Makkansan it is not really help full in a fast get in other public transport or directions given. More direction signs would help.
Good way to town. fast from airport to town and early to reach at airport within 30 minutes. Not expensive and better that taxi

very slow journey. we set off 1 hour to get airport early,the train stopped at every single station,some times would stay between stops for 5 mins,got to airport with only 25 mins to check in and check in desk was closed so we missed our flight and had pay for 2 more tickets,not happy with slow train ,if you need get airport fast i suggest u get taxi you get there in 24 mins not over 1 hour for train

Airport rail link. It was not the express line that I thought it was . It stops at about 5 stops between makkasan and the new airport.Certainly cheaper than taking a cab to the new airport which can be about 500TB.Waiting at the station was extremely uncomfortable due to the warm and humid weather. No fan or air conditioning at the stations.
The cheapest way to go to the airport. One of the best if not the best transportation means in between the new airport and downtown. Easy connection withMetro and taxis.

Great To The BTS, Then What?. Taxis into central Bangkok are about 250 baht ($9 USD). The train is much cheaper to the BTS. Then the hassle starts. Steps and uneven pavement surfaces are a night mare. We always see tourists struggling with their luggage, trying to guess which direction is to their hotel. Many intersections you can't cross. Up 40 steps, across walkway bridge, down 40 steps.My advise, spring for the little $5 USD extra and take a taxi to your hotel front door. You don't need the grief after a long flight.

Best way to travel from the airport. This is the best way to travel to the city center or your hotel if it is within the route. It is very reasonable, 30 or 35 baht depending on where you are going. Do not take a private transportation or taxi because the traffic is so bad if going to the city center.

Best place to exchange currency. Ground floor of Bangkok international airport, only 45 baht into central bangkok, takes about 40 minutes to BTS station.Only standard train runs, there was an express train for 90 baht but it doesn't seem to run anymore.In airport the exchange rate was 48.8 baht per pound, on ground floor opposite the ticket machines there are currency booths, best was 51.65 baht per pound.
Easy-cheasy. I think it's the fastest way to go to the city centry / the closest metro station from the BKK airport. Cheap and efficient.

Easily accessible . The airport link is located at level Basement 2 of the airport main terminal, so it is easily accessible.This train is part of the Bangkok subway system, so it is crowded with commuters, especially during peak hours. Furthermore, there are no compartments for luggage storage, so it will be difficult if you are traveling with big luggages and squeezing among the other regular commuters.The fee of the ride is THB 45 per person and the travel time is 40 minute to Phaya Thai Station, which is in the city center. From there, you can change to another train line or take a taxi. If you are planning to take a taxi from Phaya Thai Station, watch out for taxi drivers waiting at the station, who are asking for ridiculous taxi fares from tourists. The alternative will be to wait by the road and flag for empty metered taxis, which are passing by.

From the airport direct to city centre.. This train makes getting from Suvarnabhumi airport into Bangkok central (or vice versa) extremely easy. Taxi drivers will often try to charge you 500 baht without running the meter, but you can do the full length on this train for 45 baht. A great service, and they are currently busy building one for Don Mueang airport, too.
What to expect. Try to avoid peak hours as usual and change for more coins as many stations do not have the coin changing machines notes which can be changed only at the counter with long queues.
convenient way to travel to the city. The Airport Rail is a cheap and convenient way to travel from the airport to the city. Sometimes it can get very crowded
BKK Airport Link. Quiet a good way to get into central Bangkok! Might take at least 45' and then there's connection to BTS and MRT!
Excellent service. The only way to travel - especially peak hours as roads in B can clog up - reliable trains with frigid aircon - easy to navigate - downloading map will put you ahead of the game

Stressless. The airport rail link is simple to use and cheeper than taxi. If you use it you can be sure that you will be on airport on the time, no matter if there is rush hour in the city or around. Great choice!

Very crowded during rush hour. This is a great way to get to and from the airport. Try to avoid it during rush hour if possible because it can get very crowded. You may have to wait for a few trains to pass by or just try to squeeze on. It can be difficult with big bags, so if you have a lot of stuff, maybe a taxi may be more convenient (but you will have to face the traffic).

Smooth and pleasant journey. Took ARL because the taxi queue was ridiculously long when I arrived.Turned out to be a smooth and pleasant journey. About 30-45 minutes to reach city area.Connect to some BTS ad MRT stations, but separate ticketing.Okay if you don't have bulky luggages.
Effective . Best and cheapie way to getbto and from the airport. It was clean cheap and fast. It was not over crowded and had god security.

SO EASY. Highly recommend using the metro to get to BKK! We flew out of BKK and were struggling to find an inexpensive option to get to the airport. Traffic in Bangkok is terrible, it is a big city afterall, and we weren't trying to spend $30 to get to the airport (it was the end of our trip, so we had run through most of our money). We decided to give this a try and I'm so glad we did!We walked to our closest metro stop, which was less than 10 mins away. We put in our destination at an automated kiosk at the bottom of the station. You don't need exact change. We were given two tokens, one for my boyfriend and I. We were a little confused going up, but one of the guards helped me go through. We waited about 10 minutes for our train, which was running like 2 or 3 minutes late. We had 7 stops to get to the airport. It was air conditioned and not very crowded, though we just found a spot to stand in the corner. We were dropped right off at the airport. Seriously, this is the way to get to/from the airport! It's cheap, easy and by far the fastest method of transportation. This metro definitely beats the on in Washington, DC on cleanliness and timeliness, so if you're from the States you will be pleasantly surprised.

Pretty handy if you're traveling light. The only inconvenience being that if you are traveling with luggage it can be inconvenient as you have to change trains to get to the city and the BTS sky train can get pretty crowded.But a quick option to beat the traffic.
Good to know !. Discovered it this time.. Will surely use it for Airport travel next time. Can use it if u dont have too much of lugguage.

An alternate and cheap way to travel to Suvarnabhumi Airport . The Airport rail link has two stops in and around Sukhumvit. You can board the airport rail link from Phaya thaya BTS station or from Makkasan to reach Suvarnabhumi Airport. It's the cheapest form of transportation to reach the airport. Both stations have interlink stations with the Sky train and the MRT.

Effective !!. This was my first time as a single traveller to Bangkok and instead of taking a taxi I thought of experience Airport rail link to city Center. I was highly impressed with how seamless t is for a traveller to visit this place with English written signs everywhere.Just go to level 3 below departures and take a train as per map available at information desk. Simple!

Definitely worth it. you can take a taxi into town or you can hop on the airport rail - absolutely one of the better ways to travel. The only challenge is changing trains midway through to catch the BTS. Worth the ride!

Beat the traffic if heading to Sukhumvit. The rail link is a good option if travelling at peak morning or early evening rush hours. It takes us around 45 minutes to get home which is near to Sukhumvit metro station (change at Petchaburi). There is a five minute walk between metro and airport rail link. Rail link trains run around every ten to 15 minutes and the metro 2 to 5 minutes. Taxi is quicker with no traffic for us butt there is hardly ever no traffic!

Best way to travel from airport to city. Fast, convenient, value for money way to travel from city to airport and back. You avoid traffic of bangkok and can reach in 40 min from Phaya Thai airport link to Bangkok Suvarnabhumi Airport. Phaya Thai skytrain station is across the road and not well connected. At airport the connections are fine.
Best way to get to the Airport. Cheap and affordable way to get to the airport. The service was efficient and coaches were clean. The view of the city was splendid as well!

There is no more express (red line). There is no longer an express red line. Only the blue line which stops at a few stations along the way. It cost me 45 baht from Phaya Thai to Suvarnabhumi Airport. Still good ride about 30 mins by train to airport.Suggest you take the train here at Phaya Thai because if you take it from one of the stops, the train may be crowded and you will be left standing tiredly with your huge luggage.

fast and cheap!. Cheap and fast way to get to/from the airport to downtown. The only downfall is if you have lots of luggage, it is difficult when you have to interchange from the Airport Rail Link to the BTS SkyTrain at Phaya Thai Station.

quick and easy. A really easy mode of transportation from airport to the city, then an easy swap over to the BTS for us to reach our hotel near national stadium. Can be quite busy in rush hour.
Best used for travelling with small amounts of luggage.
marvellous. Brilliant method of travel, guarranteed to be on time no fuss no harrassment from crooked taxi drivers, juat relax and get out at the airport, brilliant so easy.

Cheapest way to airport. I use this every time traveling to Suwannapoom airport. Never have a problem. The train run usually every 15 minute interval from 6am to almost before midnite I guess. Just be careful that it can be very crowded during rush hour because many local commuters also use the train to various stops before the airports. I usually jump on Ratchaprarop station and within half an hour the train reaches the airport at price of 40 Baht which is unbeatable. Normally taxi from city centre will cost you >300 Baht to the airport. The only complaint is that the connections to skytrain and other public transport are not convenient. But as a local, I don't hv much problem. So if you are budget traveller, this is difinitely the best choice to airport!
Travel to Airport by rail link and bts. This is a very cheap and a very fast way to get to and from airport. Clean, tidy and efficient...only thing missing is free wifi...

Perfect if only the seats could be large enough. An other excellent public service absolutely full of locals rather than passengers but offering very good value and an efficient service.Access from airport is perfect it is not really easy nor simple from Makasan station when commuting from MRT the metro without BTS nearby.

What could be easier?. What could be easier? You skip the taxi haggle and the bus squish for a modest 3 dollars. Just follow the signs after immigration and as long as your destination is somewhere in the vicinity of a sky train station you're as good as gold. Even if it's not you won't pay more than a few extra dollars to get to get there!

The quickest way to go!. The Airport to Bkk rail link is by far the safest , and quickest way into town , it is true you may not always get a seat but let's face it you've been sitting down for some 6 or 7 hours at least so 30 minutes on your plates isdisd not going to kill you :-) the trains are clean and fast and here's the best bit CHEAP !!!! Less than a pound all the way .No rip off taxi drivers or the airport sercharge to pay

Very convenient way to get in and out of central Bangkok. For only 45 baht, great way to get in and out of town - especially if you're travelling light. Trains are large and comfortable.Do note that there quite a few stops in between the airport and the final, westernmost station in town (Phaya Thai) and these are heavily utilized stops off and on peak hours so expect a constant crowd and be prepared to stand. Phaya Thai is also connected to the light green BTS line, which is excellent for getting around to the Sukhumvit area.

Express Airport Link Temporarily Closed???. I had no idea that the Express AL was closed and walked all the way to the entrance to be told that it is temporarily closed.... Then i had to walk all the way back to the normal link which was PACKED on a Friday around rush hour at 6:00pm. Had to wait till the fourth train to get on. In conclusion, I was exhausted after it. Ideal during normal hours, better to avoid during rush hours... best yet is to avoid any kind of public transportation or travelling during rush hours... too exhausting.

Convenient and quick!. With this rail link you will save; time, money and stress.
You don't need to go outside and find expensive taxy, always they ask much more money.
You will arrive in the town very quick.
Be careful when you get out, you are going to crash into a wall made of humidity and super hot.

Exceptional. I don't need to take a taxi to Bangkok city centre as ARL is much faster and cheaper and comfortable. Traffic jam is no longer a problem.
From Suvarnabumi to Makkasan is about 20mins and follow by a 5mins MRT ride to asoke and you've reach Sukhumvit..
There aren't much of these train services around in the world.

Airport Rail Link. Staying in city central and taxi driver advised us to take train to avoid the jam. Took MRT and BTS. Very clean train and convenient for tourists with bug luggages. Helpful counter staff for inquiry.

Fast w/a ViEW. I'm from San Francisco. To get from my San Francisco home to SFO airport I took public transportation. Let's just say that the Airport Rail Link is much smoother & has a better view. Very impressive.
Perfect. Always on time, but can get very crowded, better than sitting in traffic. Very cheap . Ideal for sight seeing.

Good, clean, cheap and convenient. As stated in the title, I have nothing to add! I would definitely recommend to travelers who had reserved hotel along the BTS or subway line with 1 piece of luggage traveling with you.

30mins for 45Baht. Bargain!. This is a really cheap way to get to the airport if you have like one luggage and no children. (Even with children it would be easy though, maybe not if you have like 5 babies). Anyway, by taking the BTS to Phaya Thai station and they switching to the airport link is the easiest way to use this. Half and hour later you're at the airport! And because you get on at the first station, you almost always get a seat!

What a line. It's one of the most ridiculous train linking airport and big city as Bangkok. It would leave every half an hour for high speed train and at the end of the line u have to walk so far to connect to another local train. For another train that leave airport more frequent, it would stop by every local stations. I suggest to take taxi rather than this air port link line.
Easy to use. Cheap and efficient, was crowded but hey...there's a lot of people to move!! City line cheaper, but slower than express line

Could use more signage. While it is a nice way to get all over Bangkok and to other destinations, the signage is lacking and could take a lesson from the mtr in Hong Kong. Difficult to know exactly where you are and also getting out of the station. But would ride it again to avoid crazy Bangkok traffic.

Convenient. Airport Rail Link can be connect to BTS Station or MRT Station. If you get off at BTS Phaya Thai station, you go out the gate of BTS station and walk only a short distance to the Airport Link station- Phaya Thai. It is more short distance and convenient if you bring a lots of luggage with you. Or you can choose to transfet at MRT Phetchaburi station where you get out BTS station and have to walk around 5 mins to Airport Link station - Makkasan, here is longer distance

Best transport from the Airport. This is the easiest way to travel into Bangkok from the Airport. Direct links to both the BTS and the Metro. Stand near the door if you have large bags as it will be easier to get off.

Easy way to get into town!. Nice way to get into town. I've taken a taxi from the airport a few times and this is faster. I've been taken for a runaround by a few cabs as well. This way, you know where you're going, and if you have to, you can still take a taxi from the closest station.

Not your typical airport express link. unlike the airport express trains of Hong kong, Tokyo, KL, this one had several stops from city to airport. During peak hours, its most standing room only. I boarded at the Phaya Thai station in the city and had to stand all the way to the airport. Given that it was during the peak hours of 5pm but as a foreigner, the experience fall short.

I Come from San Francisco. Fabulous train. (1) I first visited Thailand in 1985 when the only way to get around as a backpacker was via PRIVATE BUSes that didn't cooperate w/ea other. That was slow and confusing. (2) I come from San Francisco. I had to catch a bus and BART to get to SFO from San Fran, a distance shorter than this Airport Rail Link. It took much longer AND cost $2.25 for the bus and $8.50 for BART. Thailand beats San Francisco hands down.

Does the job, very safe, beats the traffic.. This airport link is INVALUABLE when there are traffic jams in Bangkok. It can take a long time to get through traffic by Taxi when there's a bad storm, a lot of rain or just rush hour traffic. I always consider the rail link for the airport as a backup incase there is a huge traffic jam. Always know your nearest stations on route to the airport, which means you can ask your taxi driver to just drop you at the rail link if it looks like you're going to miss your flight due to extreme traffic.

You can't beat the Airport Rail Link. For speed and ease, skip the taxi stand and take the rail link. The fare is really reasonably - so inexpensive I have even forgotten what it was. Runs directly from BKK to Phaya Thai where you can connect with the rest of Bangkok.
easy to find. Just followthe signs inside BTS and you'll find it. Drops you off at the airport and other stops too but not too hard to figure out.

Great for budget travellers. We took the train from the airport to Bangkok City centre. The ticket only cost 45 bahts and could be easily purchased from the vending machine or service counter. The train was crowded but still quite comfortable with nice air-conditioning. It had a few intermediate stations but could still brought us to Phaya Thai terminal station in around 40 mins. We could then connect to BTS sky train quite easily. Highly recommended for budget travellers without lots of luggage!

Good for those travel to and from airport during rush hour. There used to be express train and local train but nowadays they operate only local train which stop at every station but the information on media and printed matter was not up to date. I have been asked from tiurist from time to time whether they get on the right platfrom for blue or red line.The company should fix this. Also at acertain point along the route there would be a loud noise as if something wrong with the train. It is so loud that I thought those passenger who has heart diseases could be shock from the noise. Other than that it shorten your travel time from Suvanabhoomi airport to downtown to 30 minutes amidst the heavy traffic especially on friday evening.

easy airport access. get's you off the hassle of missing your flight due to city traffic. It's fast, clean and comfortable. Though some station could be better by putting more ventilation fans to make the air move in their open platforms.

No direct connection with Metro or BTS. If you travel with light luggage, the airport link will be you good choice to Bangkok city hotel. Once you have large luggage, you should well ready to take you luggages by carry up and down in order to catch transfer to the Metro or BTS. There is no direct link from the airport link with either Metro or BTS.It's fast and relative lower cost than taking meter taxi to the town.

25 minutes to airport from Phaya Thai (city centre). Good choice if you're not carrying really big suitcases. Coming from the Skytrain where most escalators only go upward, the walk down the BTS platform can be quite a strain. Once you get to Phaya Thai, sign lead clearly. On the floor where you get tickets, proceed to the counter--it's faster than dealing with the machines. At least here, there's an elevator to the platform--which can get very busy and crowded so watch your wallets. When you move in, enter to the righthand side if you want a seat. Too bad they've forgone the express line that takes you straight to the airport.If coming from the airport, line up properly and don't try to jump right in after the people have gone down. Security needs a minute to scan and check the train. It's 45 baht one way, versus at ten times that on a cab. If you're alone or a couple, Airport Rail is a good idea.

Smooth but crowded. Though its a airport rail, its still a normal train used for public transport. Thus do not expect extra space for luggage. Very pack so expect to squeeze a bit. The ticket look like a token, v interesting. Pait 35bat to travel from S international airport to Makkasan stn.
Slower than snail.. Slower than snail.Crowed.Not designed for travel bags !?! (WHY???)Hot and very slow.Not cheap like expected.Should improved.
High speed link to airport.. A high speed link to and from suvarnabhumi. Always on time and in good condistion. 45 THB is worth paying for.
Efficient and effective. Easy to find, fast to city centre and any exchangeairconcomfatablecheapwhat more do you need?does whats needed.

Great service. This is a great service only sorry that the budget airlines for International have been moved to Don Maeung. It is much better than sitting in a taxi to get into the centre and much cheaper.
Way to go!. Forget taxis, dump the Limo, leave the bus stop and grab this - 40 THB and it is the FASTEST and most comfortable journey into the city (and return) Just brilliant!
Super fast. This is a high speed transport, almost every moment is had forgot to take a breath. If you want to try I think you should as you will receive a lot excitement.
Best and quickest way from airport. At only 45bht a ticket, you can't beat the price as an airport transfer. I would bet to say it's the quickest way in to town as well, skipping traffic!

An inexpensive way to get to the airport. Ij you don't have too much luggage with you, the Airport Rail Link is an inexpensive and rather convenient way to get to the Suvarnabhumi Airport. Take the BTS to the Phya Thai station, and switch there to the Airport Link station. It takes some walking (5 min), and sometimes a 15 minute wait for the next train

Busy on the train. Busy during peak times, better to take the BTS if you can.
other than that, good way to get around. s

Simple way to get from airport to the city!. I get the Airport Rail Link every time I visit Bangkok. Its really simple to navigate, has AC, is really clean and comfortable and doesn't take long...unlike a taxi! Also its cheap, what more could you want!

the independent rail..... the train is good... clean and goes to many parts in town.
connects at the end to the BTS and the MRT at Makkasan Station.
1 reminder thou, the BTS uses 1 type of tap card, the MRT uses a different type of tap card and so those the Airport railway.

very busy squeezed like sardines. after 2 stops from leaving the airport all the thai people starting coming on it was treble, everybody squeezed inn, lucky i got a seat from the airport but my bag was tight between my legs to make little room, wouldnt be doing that again , nightmare trying to get off with luggage.

Airport rail link under repair. In Bangkok yesterday and Airport Rail link under repair . ...city line still running but not sure how slow it might be (we ended up getting an airport transfer minivan 900 bhat each way for 5 )
Not sure how long it will be out for

Airport rail link. There's a lot of walking......with luggage its quiet inconvenient and painful...the taxi service in bkk is quiet inexpensive...and with highways and bridges its quiet fast to get to the centre of the city Moreover by Airport Rail Link one has to get off at makkasan station and take a taxi from there...which may have you to wait for about 15..20..minutes and than go through the city traffic ...I recommend a taxi ride rather than Airport link

Great if you have no luggage.. System is great if you have no luggage, because Phayatai and Makkasan (to Petcburi Road BTS station) have some heavy walking issues to contend with. Many commuters do not appreciate getting round slower tourists!

Over crowded but convenient . Took this train from ratchaprarop station with 3 adults and one infant.....Has lifts so don't worry about the luggage...## during peek hours placing and standing with the luggage is quiet uncomfortable both for you as well as other commuters..## 40 bhat to airport... Very affordable and main thing is very very fast compared to bkk- traffic.... Easiest way to get to airport as it goes straight to terminal....

Easy to use. This is easy to use but you need cash. It accepts thai baht. However the stations are not well connected to the other lines. So some walking is needed. If you have big bulky luggage it will be annoying. During peak traffic hours the train gets packed, so becomes difficult to manouver out with even small luggage.

Quick and easy route from Airport to town!. We always used to get a taxi from airport to town but sometimes you really risk "life and limb" with the ways these guys drive. So we decided to take the airport link which is a regular train service from the airport to points North and West of Bangkok Central. For those traveling to the Sukhumvit area catch the train to Makkasan and then walk over the bridge (around 100m) to Phetchaburi MTR. Then it's only one station to Sukhumvit/Asok. Fare from Airport to Makkasan is Bht 35 per person. One stop on the MTR is Bht 26.

Very convenient. My hotel advised how to reach hotel from Airport and highly recommended travel by Airport link express. Convenient and reasonable.45 Bhat for one way full journey.Only problem is while returning specially during afternoons and evening when local commuters use service in great nos.Suggest during peak hours one coach is reserved for Airport travellers with luggage.will be of great help.

Good transport to city. . It's good way to get to the city, but why so few wagons on the train. This day I have use it, it even full when we leave the airport, so at the next station not all people get on it. The station is big and they can have more wagon on. But I like it, you don't want to get I the taxi and the heavy traffic jams on the road.
Travel from airport to shopping mall. Very quick and cheap way to travel to downtown and shopping mall from airport. Scenic. Would recommend.Traffic is very congested. Best use of time is rail link.

If you still need to take a Taxi, just get the taxi on the airport. it is convenient for the passengers who do not need to transfer by another taxi after out of station. But if you need to have taxi to get your hotel anyway, I do not recommend that you take airport link to save money for a shorter taxi distance. Because you may not save much money in total but spend a lot more time and difficulty to get your hotel. You are even hard to get a taxi by meter at rush hour for short distance. Trust me, don't make trouble for saving couple boxes on such only one time consuming.

A little plus from Suvarnabhumi Airport. From Suvarnabhumi Airport you can choose this type accomodation to the heart of Bangkok. Clean and Comfy...don't worry about luggage as long as you can carry and drag this place have lift.. This ARL also more cheap than you go by TAXi if you travel alone or two..

40 baht!. This is the only way to do it when landing in Bangkok, much much better than grabbing a taxi, much quicker to. Right into the heart of the city, with no traffic problems and all the onward travel options/connections you could want

Very handy way to get into town. For Baht 45 one way you are transported from airport to a station on the Sky train route and from there most places in town easily accessible..The train has several stops but all required info. is clearly ser out on train. Just a pity you cannot use your Sky train stored vslue card on the airport train - you must buy a special token - all pretty easy.
very fast, very reliable. By far the cheapest and fastest way to get into bangkok from the airport...why sit in a 2 hour traffic jam when you can be in the heart of bangkok in 30 mins

My only issue is dragging luggage on the streets to switch lines. Trains are clean. Travels fast and intervals are not long.
My only issue is dragging luggage on the streets to switch lines.
Airport Rail link is the cheapest option to go the center!!. It definitely is! Only 45 baht and you can have a comfy aircon ride to the center of Bangkok. You can pay either by coins or paper money.
Pity the direct line is not available anymore.. Really helpful, really modern, really fast. This sums it up the best. Tickets are cheap, trains are on time and the service is very reliable.
best option to get to the airport. big city mostly have a bad traffic jam and a quite far airport from the city. but by this ARL, all becomes easier. it takes only 20 mins to get to the airport

Easy way to get to the airport and back. I took the train several times now to get to the Airport and back. You change from the BTS at Phaya Thai to the Aiport Rail link and the signs will lead you directly there.45 baht for the way to the airport and it takes you around 30 minutes. Pretty convenient since you will arrive directly inside of the airport!
Snail of bangkok!. The Airport link is the slowest of the 3 lines. Also with the fewest stops. Only good thing about this line is that you can take it to and from the airport.

The Best way to travel.. As long as I arrive at BKK between 0700 and 2200 this is the way I always get to (and from) my hotel. No hassle, just follow the signs, buy a token and get on the train to Phaya Thai. There I change to the BTS and quite independent of traffic, I will be in my hotel on Sukhumvit Soi 29 within an hour at a cost of well under 100 Baht.The only downside is getting luggage from the Airport Rail Link to the BTS - there are some steps in the way. Just wonder why escalators were not installed at this most significant junction.
The best way to go to and leave the airport.. Very convenient. Located on the basement of the airport. No need to take a taxi. Just take the ARL especially if you are a backpacker.
Very good and cheap. I used it to reach Nag staton and its the cheapest and fastest way to reach bangkok city. CLosed for 6 hours in the midnight.

Convenient to connect from the airport to the city centre. The airport rail link is a very convenient transport from the airport to the city centre and vice versa, especially the road is always jam with vehicles. It take about 30 mins ride from one end to the other. Without an airport rail link, I will be bound to miss my flight as it really take about 3 hours from the city center to the airport by car. One disadvantage is that the train is always very packed like sardines.

Stops running at midnight... Found this out when my plane from Shanghai was late..it is very clean and punctual, but when you have a big luggage..don't know if you want to be hauling it around either up and down escalators or stairs and long walks

excellent facilities but unde-rutilised. The original idea was to check in to your flight down town at Makasan and take the train to the airport. Sadly this didn't catch on with the airlines and it is now just a train connection.

Fast, clean and cool.. The best way to get into Bangkok from the airport, easy to use and cool even when busy. Most taxi and tuc-tuc drivers will take you via their friends to get measured for a suit you don't want, some even turned off their engine whilst they tried to talk us into getting out and into a shop they had just diverted us too. Also be aware of helpful strangers telling you that attractions or the place you are going to is closed so they can divert you to another place....in a tuc-tuc or taxi they have parked around the corner. Let the train take the strain, although please note that none of the rail links go into the heart of the old city. Most hotels seem to be outside anyway so it shouldn't matter. The airport is quite some way away from the centre of Bangkok so don't be worried if you still haven't arrived after 20 minutes, just enjoy the AC.

Good Mode of Transportation. The airport rail link stops at places outside of Bangkok execpt for the final stop which connects to the BTS inside the city. The trains take quite a while to arrive with an average interval of 10 minutes between each train. It usually is very busy during rush hour between 4-7pm. The tickets are easy to buy and are sold at a cheap price. Overall, a good way to get from the airport to inside Bangkok.
Easy and cheap.. Very cheap, easy and fast way to central Bangkok. Much faster than taxa. Is closed fra 00.00 to 06.00 am.
All too easy.. This is just such a wonderful cheap way of getting to the city and all that is Bangkok,all you need to do is ask in English at the terminal
Convenient . Frequency was a little Low and gets crowded with each passing station. However, it serves as a great link to the other lines in Bangkok.
Amazing for budget travellers. The airport rail has connectivity from the airport and also the its very reasonable considering the high charges charged by the taxis.

Nice airport, full of thailand culture. Nice and clean. Only take 375 Baht to get there via Uber. And only take you 30min if you take train.There is a 24-hour food court in 1/F called Magic Food and the food there is very cheap and unexpectedly delicious! Please get there and take a meal before you pass through the passport control. Better not to have your meal after the passport control - standard airport price inside.Also got a Family Mart there and the price is reasonable.

Great if you only have little luggage.. It is cheap and quick and connects with MRT at Makkasan and BTS at MRT at Phaya Thai. Buy a ticket/token and activate it when entering and have it ready when leaving.

SO So convinient. Straight from the airport to downtown Bangkok - wish all cities were this well organized ! As first timers we were a bit lost but the staff made it easier , I guess we weren't the first clueless travelers :)
Awesome . Lovely experience. Worth a try . Wanted to do try something different rather taking a taxi. Lived up to its reputation

Excellent Connectivity. If you ever come to Bangkok , then Airpot rail link is the best way to connect from the city . You can take a airpot rail link from 6am till midnight . The rail link starts from airpot at 6 am to Phaya thai and the last rail link to airpot is at 11:30pm from phaya thai . Thailand infrastruture is good when the topic comes about connectivity .

Best way to get to the airport . The airport rail link is a great way to get from central Bangkok to the airport. It is quiet a busy train and is used by the locals for other stations so sometimes a little bit squeezy if you have a bit of luggage. It is cheap, around 45B per person or almost $2aud but is so much better than sitting in the traffic. It takes around 20mins. Would never taxi to or from the airport again.

comfortable ride, easy to navigate. this is a good alternative to taking a taxi if you're accommodation is near to the MRT/BTS and you do not have excessive amount of baggage. the ride on the airport rail link itself was still pretty okay as the crowd is significantly lesser compared to BTS and MRT. the real problem comes when you need to change to the BTS or MRT as they're actually not very well connected. you'll need to exit the airport rail link station, walk a distance and then enter the BTS/MRT station.

Perfect way to go downtown.. Perfect way to go downtown.Perfect way to go downtown from the Suvarnabhumi Airport.It links directly with the BTS sky train station Phaya Thai where you can go in all directions and the best part would be if you have a hotel, hostel, guesthouse in the near of one of the stations it's the perfect way to travel in Bangkok.

Fastest transportation to reach in middle of Bangkok. After reaching Suwarnabhumi airport at 3rd floor, take "City Links/Airport Rail Link" from basement. You can reach Ratchaprarop in 35 minutes by spending 40THB. From Makasan station of Airport Rail Link you can catch city link which will take you to Sukhumvit.
Easy and inexpensive. It is very convenient to catch the train to the city. no traffic jam and at a fraction of the cost for a taxi.
Cheap and fast. Within 30 minutes you can be in the heart of town without any traffic problems and with good connections to the underground and skytrain and it will cost less than a pound sterling

Slow and unstable schudle . Always delay and changes time table what ever they want that good for avoid traffic onlyIf you have plan ahead a time you will use it If you have more than 2 ppl suggested call Uber or Grabtaxi

Getting into Bangkok fast and easy. As you arrive at Bangkok Suvarnabhumi International Airport (BKK) you will be faced with several options of transportation into the city. Limo services will start to ask for your business as early as the baggage pickup area. and in the Arrival Hall. One floor under the arrival hall is the taxi departure line. As in most cities you want to make the ride on the taxi meter and do not negotiate a price. The basement of the airport holds the best option for getting in the city: the Airport Rail Link. Take the elevator down and follow the signs.  It is expected that you will have luggage to manage but reason needs to come into play. One large piece with a carry-on and personal bag is about all one adult can manage on the train. People in Bangkok have learned to take the Airport Link for normal transportation but understand the purpose is to accommodate airport traffic. It can be crowded so try to sit near a door to make getting off easier.  The Air link connects with the BTS Skytrain, and the MRT subway system. Generally you only want to have a carry-on bag on these two systems as they are for general population transportation. If it is early in the morning or late at night, then a larger bag can be taken.  Obviously I use the Airport Rail Link often when traveling from the city to the airport. A little common sense makes it a very useful tool.

Convenient if alone and witouth luggage. Fast and cheap, but not very convenient with luggage or when in a group. A taxi to anywhere in central Bangkok will cost around 10 USD, and will drop you in front of your hotel. Going by train involves getting on the BTS/MRT (and deal with the guards that insist pretending to look into your luggage), then drag the luggage around the station, then around the airport.
Cheap & fast. If you're traveling light and are less than a party of 3. This is definitely the way to get into the city.Its cheap, and you don't have to deal with Bangkok traffic.
Good acces accros the city. Easy fast and cheap. By times overcrowded at peak hours but still the wasiest way of transportation.

Efficient way to travel. The Airport Rail Link is an efficient form of transport from the airport. Situated on the lower level of the airport, access is easy. The trip is reasonably fast and the last stop is in the centre of Bangkok. From there you have the option of either catching a cab to your hotel or connecting with other forms of transport. My only warning is to be aware when catching cabs from the last stop as we were caught out. My cab trip included expressway fees and a fee that was equivalent to my cab fare back to the airport!
Very easy . Cheap and first . So convinced to go airport . Take from Paya thai station is take 15 m to airport . Price cost less than taxi .
Fastest and cheapest way. if you don't have a lots of luggage, it is the best way to go to heart of BKK. it will cost you 45 bhat and 20 min.

Cheap, quick and convenient Link. It is direct access raiway link right to bangkok internation airport. The train is clean and with air-conditional. Most importantly direct to airport without worrying of any traffic jam.

Easy transport to heart of bangkok. . This is the easiest way to get to the heart of bangkok. The fare is reasonable and you don't have to go thru the infamous traffic jam. Station is clean and very convenient.

Quick way from airport. If you have the taxi drivers whose condition and skills you always can´t be sure of, this is cheaper and more comfortable way to travel. At airport just walk downstairs, buy ticket form the machine and go.

Cheap convenient link to Bangkok. Direct access from the lower floor of the airport, links to other mass transit systems in Bangkok.Tends to run quite full as there is quite a time gap between trains, this is offset by the benefit of not having to sit in traffic as you approach central Bangkok. Not expensive compared to a taxi, however you pay per person so a group may find a taxi fare reasonable, although taxis often have gas tanks in the boot which reduces luggage capacity.

NO traffic Jams!. NO Thai skills beyond Sawadee-Krab no guide, little time spent in Bangkok and little money left at the end of our trip - I needed to make it back to Silom Soi 18 to pick up my tailored suit on our last night in Thailand..NO problem - we easily figured out how to purchase tokens on the kiosk at the airport station and were downtown in 30 minutes for 90 Baht (Less than $3) - no waiting in rush hour traffic, no worries about car fare, drivers and meters, the cars were clean and not overly crowded.. I am only a fan of mass transit in VERY large cities, they don't work everywhere (not enough riders, easier to drive) but in Bangkok, esp. during a rain storm, just take the train..NOTE: We got on at the airport station - I liked how the guards swept/inspected the cars at the end of the prior run before we all got on - I have never felt safer and more civilized on any form of public transport.

Best way for a light solo traveller to get into bkk. If you have a few people or too much luggage a taxi might be a better deal. For a light solo person the train is the way to go. Just a small learning curve and you can get around BKK easily and cheaply for the rest of your visit. The rail link merges with the subway which merges with skytrain. It sounds complicated but in reality isn't that bad. Use it, you won't regret it.
Fast but .... It is fast and efficient in central Bangkok however you need a taxi or bus to get to most of the tourist attractions and shopping destinations.
So practical. Extremely clean and easy to figure out. Used it to and from the airport without any trouble. Nice veiws of the city too!

Convenient way to and from airport. If you don't have a big group nor a lot of luggage it's a good idea to take the airport rail link into town to your hotel if it's located in central Bangkok. The time taken is comparable to a private transfer. A couple on the same flight who took private transfer to the same hotel arrived at about the same time we did.

best way to reach the city. depend on what time you arrive at the airport, bangkok is a very busy city. the airport rail takes between 30 to 40 minutes to reach the center, and then you can catch the btw to go to your final destination.price is 45 bath

Fast and economical. I have been several times to Bangkok .airport is fast,economical comfortable and clean.it runs every 10 minutes at a cost of 45 Bhat almost $2:00 US dollars per person for trip.Then Take taxi from there to your hotel,it is better than taking a direct taxi from the airport .It is . The direct train is not available but the regular train has only 6 very fast drops.it is more convenient,faster and more economical

Very convenient link to central Bangkok. Highly recommended to anyone travelling to and from Suvarnabhumi Airport. At 45 baht per person per trip, you avoid the traffic jams on the road if you arrive or depart evening time. However, the trains at peak hours are very crowded, so may be difficult to manage if you have a lot of luggage.
Great. Great, This was one of the best train i ever traveled in my life. Hope to ride again in the near future
Good for time management. As Bangkok traffic is so unpredictable, taking airport rail link is the best choice in getting to the airport on time.
Airport Rail Link to Hotel. We took the Airport Rail Link to our hotel. Not to bad as experience. But during peak hours, the rail is very packed.

cheap and easy. Easy to get to from the sky train and a short journey to the airport. I suggest this to anyone thinking about getting a taxi this will save time and money not to mention the 2 toll fees you have to pay on top of your taxi fare. From the centre of Bangkok I paid a total of 70 Thai Baht and the taxi cost me nearly 400 Baht

Convenient . A milestone in Bangkok's infrastructure. Reaching airport gets challenging in rush hours. If you have minimum luggage, this airport rail link is very helpful to escape Bangkok's crazy traffic congestion. However, dragging too much or heavy articles of luggage on train is not practical. The major plus point is, it takes you to the airport within minutes. It's comfortable, clean and safe. For a single person it's very economical. Majority of Thais are very courteous and offer their own space to you to sit if they see a foreigner standing.

Fast, punctual, clean and comfortable . It's the fastest way to reach the Suwarnabhoomi airport. May not be cheap compared with taxi, but definitely lot faster than any road transportation. Available till late night and safe to travel alone too.

My First Time But Not My Last. I have been to Bangkok many times and always taken a taxi from the airport. Due to the time I arrived which was rush hour I thought I would give the train a go. The best decision I made. I could clearly see the freeway traffic heading towards the city and it was heaving with cars. I had to swap over to the BTS to get to where I wanted to go. I think my trip was about 40 minutes which I have no doubt would have been 3 hours in a taxi. Plus I didn't have to deal with the suicidal driving some of the taxi drivers subject you too. Plus it was far cheaper than the taxi.

Efficient way of getting to airport. The Skytrain and Airport Rail Link is the most cost efficient way of getting to the airport from Bangkok. Make sure you do leave earlier though as peak times can affect the time you arrive at the airport. (between 4pm and 7pm are the peak times. Comfortable and cost efficient!

Convenient. Comfy and convenient. Makes me wish we also have one in the Philippines. takes you to the airport from the city OR to the city from the airport in the most practical way. Less hassle i should say, fast and cheaper than a taxi cab.

Great way of getting to and from, but avoid peak times if travelling with luggage. When I arrived in Bangkok I thought I would try this route rather than use a taxi, plus I was on my own so I had no one to split the fare with. Well the system is good, although I did have a large bag with me - which wasn't very good when I had to get off after several stops where lots of people got on. This must of been about 730 in the morning, just as people would be heading in to the city. I did get on at the airport and there wasn't that many passengers on, although by the time we made a few stops on the way to Bangkok, it got very full.The fare was great value, about 35 baht if I recall correctly, which equates to about 70 pence. I was sat near the door but it was still a squeeze to get off! Personally I wouldn't use this method again when carrying luggage, otherwise it would be fine. Maybe I should of just parted with 500-600 baht for a taxi ;-)
First metro in Bangkok. It was my first train in Bangkok is airport rail link which quickest way to go to city. We have been this rail and good experience.
Excellent train system. On numerous trips to Bangkok we have taken the ferry and the train into the central system. It is a very organised and efficient system, highly recommend.
Clean and efficient. Great way to get from the airport to the city. The service is air conditioned and was clean and efficient.
Gets you there . This system is hot and overcrowded but will have you at Suvarnabhumi airport in half an hour for 45 thb and is very reliable.
comfortable. Make my trip in Bangkok more easy and fast. Most of tourist attraction point can go by sky train. But in the rush hour quite busy and cloudy of people.

Cheap and fast way from the airport to the city. Bangkok now has a train link to the city. It links up with the skytrain to give you cheap fast connections.
Depending on where yoy are going you may need to buy two separate tickets and change trains even a few times.
Cost is low especially relative to taxi charges and the traffic that they need to overcome

Made it easy to get to any hotel!. Would definitely recommend as a cheaper and more scenic route than a taxi from the airport. I would look up the closest train station near your hotel then go from there because this train links to all the other lines so if you don't have too much luggage it's usually easier to take the train then taxi to your hotel.
Easy Ride. The Best ride you can get from Airport to Hotel in City center, Bangkok. A must have experience for every one.

If travelling light it's a quick and cheap way to the Suvanabhumi International Airport. Do not get confused, this goes to the Suvanabhumi Airport not the Don Mueng Airport. You must get to the Phayathai Link which connects to the Airport Link. During rush times it gets very ful so allow some time. The intervals are around 20 mins each.

Fast way to get into town. This was great, hopped on at the airport and off at the end then got a train to Central World Plaza, this place is so big and there are 3 different buildings to get through. There is all sorts here to do and see, Madame Tussaud's and the Sea world are here also and a huge cinema. Lots of shopping and eating outlets also, great for filling in long lay overs at the airport. It only takes about 20 min to get into town but be warned it takes longer to get back out and very overcrowded if it is peak hour, it will amaze you how many people actually squeeze on at these times..
value for money. Only the second time I have used it...but the easiest hassle free way to get to the airport....much less than a taxi fare...
Convenience and connectivity. Cheap and fast way to travel between Suvarnabhumi International Airport and the city(Phaya Thai Station, connected to BTS Sukhumvit).

Time Saver. Take this train from airport to reach the City Center. This is quite affordable mean of travelling and takes very less time to reach the city. One can catch the train from The basement level of the Airport and can then get off at any of the stations in city.
Suvarnabhumi. Cheap, fast and reliable. My choice of transport to the airport. Beats sitting in the rush our traffic wondering if you going to make it to your flight or not

It's a bit slow. It's a cheap and convenient way to travel to and from airport
But it is quite slow so if you have a plane to catch don't leave your hotel too late . No place to sit during peak hours

Much faster and cheaper than a taxi. Super easy and fast transport into town, possibly combined with a tuktuk if your destination is not close to a stop. Just look-up before hand which stop you need to take to get close to your destination.
Not good enough. Good to have airport link but need to improve facility, train condition, time schedule and etc. Hope it will be better shorlty

Best way in busy traffic times. If your hotel is near a BTS station, this is a good way to get into the city. If not, you might well be better with a taxi. Airport to town, you can get a seat. Town to the airport does not guarantee a seat.

Quick and easy. Quick, cheap, easy - sums it up really.The ticket machines take notes which is useful as most travellers would be unlikely to have coin to feed into the machine - buying the ticket was a quick, easy process. Gets you to Phaya Thai station (stop 8) in about 20-25 minutes, at which point you can then transfer to the BTS for connections onto the rest of Bangkok. If I remember rightly, stop 6 on the line was where you could connect into the Bangkok Metro also.

Okay but needs a lift in some of the transfer station. Went from Siam to Suvarnabhumi and surprised to see there was no lift at Phaya Thaya (where I transferred to the Airport Link). We all had to lug our big bags down the stairs which were not few. Coming to the city is ok, as there is an escalator but going to the airport is challenging. I also did not see a ramp for PWD.

Always the transport of choice to city centre. The airport link has been very useful and convenient getting into the city center. It's definitely faster than the normal ground transports especially during rush hours or Fridays. Most of the times the rail link's AC isn't as good and can appear warm in the cabins.

Airport Link Train - Bangkok. This Airport Link Train is really cost saver for solitary traveler, the ticket price is 40 BHAT and well maintained.
To reach to PRATUNAM MARKET , get down at MAKASAN station

Convenient and cheap way to get to and fro from the airport. This is a great way to get from and to the airport however this is only to the Suvarnbhumi Airport and does not go to Don Muang airport so it's only for the full service airlines unfortunately.Even if you are not along the airport rail link route, you can stop at the nearest station and get a cab from there.Note: sometimes meter taxis don't use the meter here in Bangkok so beware and know the fare, negotiate before boarding the taxis.

The best way to get to the airport. The Airport Rail Link is definitly the cheapest and could also be the fastest way to go to and from the airport. You will definitely not be caught in traffic. It may get crowded during peak hour when everyone knocks off from work.

Rather disappointing.. I've been waiting to try the rail link from the airport for ages and I was somehow disappointed by it.First of all, it's too crowd for comfort (forget about getting a seat).Secondly - it's too slow.Last but not least - the ride is bumpy to an extent several people simply lost their balance and fell during some turns.Still, it beats the Bangkok traffic jams.
Use it a lot. The train transportation (metro, trains, skytrain) in bkk is easy fast and secure. Use it as my main source of transport.
BKK-Airport Rail Link. A great way to save money, and quickly get around town, in this case zip out to the airport. This system is one of the worlds best! Convenient, fast, direct, efficient.
Quick, cheap and very easy. As long as you dont mind lots of people this is by far the easiest way into the city it takes about 30minutes to Phya Thai station which links with almost everwhere else
better than a taxi!. when you understand Bangkok all the rail systems are the best way to travel. No hassles, extremely inexpensive, and avoids the crazy drivers and congested roads.

Fastest and the Cheapest way to reach the airport. Fastest and the Cheapest way to reach the airport if you are single and are not carrying much baggage .It connects you to Bangkok in all directions if you are visiting .
Convenient and fast. Easy to take from airport to town. Better than getting stuck in traffic but the cabin is smaller with lots of people during peak hours.

design to make your days more easy to travel around bangkok. clean and when i use this train there's a officer which make us more safety cause she standing at the corner, watching everyone and help the tourist to manage their luggage and make sure not make blocking the door so people can get in and out easyly. i do think this ARL need more signage and will be more easy if every thing is write in english.. cause not everyone can't read in thai.

Convenient direct cheap transport to BKK. easy to find , easy to use , direct link to BKK city centre , air conditioned , comfy seating , go straight from arrivals down straight to station direct to BKK
Good. A great way to reach Bangkok downtown directly from airport in a short time then you can take the BTS to reach your hotel.
Molly. Safety,fast,good takecare from staff, and very comfortable.Sure, that u can go to your destination .

frequent convenient and inexpensive. The airport rail was 45 Bhat one way...you just can't beat that! yes it can sometimes be crowded and a hassle with your bags if you travel heavy, but usually faster, frequently more comfortable (air conditioning) and always much cheaper than taxis or tuk-tuks.

Quick, economical, with good views.. We used the skytrain for getting about so this was a logical connection to that for our exit from the city. A bit crowded at first but much better views than our drive into the city.

Airport Link. This is the special Metro service from Bangkok city to International Airport of Bangkok. Suvarnbhumi Airport. Much cheaper than Taxi services in Bangkok. Only drawback, it is not in operation late night or early morning. If you have flight to catch around 2 AM you will not be able to use the services. operations hours are from 6 AM to 10 or 11 PM.

Use this during rush hour periods!. I normally take a taxi into town from the airport, but that is not something you want to do around 8 am or in the evening between 4 and 7 pm. Instead use the rail link to get into town. It will take you about a half hour.. It can take you well over an hour during rush hour by taxi. Maybe 1.5 hoursHowever, this is best if you have a small amount of luggage with you. If you have a whole lot of bags, don't take the rail link. Also, the train can get quite full during rush hour, but since the airport is the starting point, you shouldn't have a problem getting a seat.
Convenient link to airport. convenient link to the main shopping areas. From the train stations along the route, it is just a short walk to the hotel. The fare is considered quite affordable.

Beat the airport-Bangkok road traffic. Train runs every 20 minutes from the international airport and takes about 30-35 minutes to central Bangkok. Price is $1-2USD so excellent value. Only thing that was odd is why they would make an airport train with such small seats and hardly any place to put luggage. Obviously poor planning but efficient.
Saves you great time. Saves a lot of time. Get to the city and take connections on other lines or simply use a taxi. Tad slower with more frequent stops.
Very convenient. Very convenient. And reasonably priced! The only downside is the train gets a lil stuffy due to too many passengers in the train. Aircond is not really working well.

Great for airport to near Victory Monument. 45 Baht for the entire one way trip.
You might book a hotel near the last stop and them be much closer to many tourist attractions.
Amazing connectivity. Had arrived at rush hour at the airport.. was so easy to travel in city to makkasan and took a taxi back home in silom and took less than an hour.
Fast. The best way to travel from the airport to the city. Quick and quiet. Well marked. Easy on and off. Clean

Cheap and easy. The most convenient and cheap way to go to town from and to the airport and avoid the crazy traffic
Clean train , air conditioned , since it is in service I never used another transportation and never had any trouble with it

Easy to get to and use. Very easy to get to from the BTS and then subway system. All are connected via footbridges or tunnels that are well lit and safe. There are no roads or traffic to cross. The train stations used touchscreen systems which accept both notes and coins and there was a countdown clock next to the train line on when the next train would be there.Be warned that the train station is open air and so not air conditioned. The inside of the train is air conditioned.
A great service! . Affordable and fast! The easiest way to get from BKK to downtown. Closes at midnight. It's very safe and you can use this to easily connect to the other rail lines.

Quick and Inexpensive. Skip the Taxi. Especially if you only have carry on items, don't think about an airport taxi as you will easily pay 600 BHT or more. The Airport Rail Link City Line is inexpensive (45 BHT to end of line Phayathai station ). Simply, get a token at the entrance from an automatic dispenser or buy the ticket from the ticket booth. The train is air-conditioned and will make six or so stops along the way before reaching Phayathai. Here you can exit and take a taxi which will be much cheaper since you are already in the city. As a second option, you can board the MTS train at the Phaya Thai station as well.
Great value, clean, fast and efficient. I found this service fabulous and recommend it as a great way to get to and from the airport into central Bangkok.Very good !

Why would anyone take a taxi to the airport". We choose a hotel to be close to a station. A taxi ride to the airport can cost you an arm and a leg and lots of time in traffic. The link is less than a dollar and gets you to the airport in half an hour at most. The train is airconditioned and clean. What is not to like?
FAST AND SAFE. Highly reccomended - better than a private car - no strees - no problem - no traffic - no delay - cheap

No brainer.. If you are organised and check your hotel locations, you can't beat this. 40 baht and you are in the center of the city within 30 minutes.
It is used by other commuters so expect to stand. It's cheap and efficient. You don't have the same variables with time when you have to make your flights.
just easy to travel to town. A lots better than take a but to town. The AC are nice for the hot weather in Bangkok. The train are on time and I don't have to wait long for it to come.

Airport city link for less than a quid!. 39 baht.....about 80p to get into the city at the first BTR interchange.
Remarkable value.
Fast. Reliable. Airconditioned.
Definitely worth using.
Travel to Airport. It is very clean and fast, ticket fare is also low. but it is crowded as kots of people travel to airport for eatries and fun everyday.

Only way to to and from airport. This is a faster service to and from airport.
No need to take a taxi and sit in traffic.
Very good service, from airport to downtown. 6 stops takes 30mins.
6am to midnight.
Very clean.

save on traffic. Use the service quite regularly to travel to and from Airport to Bangkok, service runs frequently and is always on time, very fast transport both ways and always faster than a taxi if you know what the traffic is like in Bangkok, cheap and reliable
Easy travel. 35 Baht for one way ticket. Taxi costs around 300 Baht to city center. If you travel alone or as a couple you can easily use it.
Getting to the city was a breeze. Getting to the city was a breeze! It pays to spend five minutes familiarising with the routes and you don't have to get caught in a jam on the road.

Better Option. We rode the Airport Rail Link on our second visit to Thailand going to Pratunam wherein we dropped of in Ratchaprarop Station. I find it a good option better than riding a cab due to heavy traffic and cost, Normally going to Pratunam will take an hour and a half, but with the train it took us only 20min plus it costs 40 baht only. I would recommend this to those who do not have to much luggage.

Excellent, Avoid the traffic, get the train. I normally take taxis when abroad for the ease and convenience. However, decided to take the train as recommended by a friend.AdvantagesEasy to use and figure out how to by a ticket,Easy to navigate / well sign posted,CheapNo quesAvoid grid locked roadsConsNone

A definite plus for every visitor to this lovely city. There are 3 different types of airport train to the city. Express train to makasan- depart every 40 min which is the most expensive and the least of my favourite as getting a cab from the station is difficult. The 2nd express train to phaya Thai is a nonstop route . If you need to go that part of the city, a definite plus. I think they depart every 30 min. The last and also my favourite is their city line, the most economical and connect to their MTR in some stops. They departs every 15 min and the whole route is about 30min- 45 min depending on time of day. This train is not only for tourists, their local also take this as one of their option. They run from 6am to 12 midnight. I think the same as their BTS. Bangkok's traffic is a nightmare, no matter what time of day. If you are coming from the international airport, definitely take their airport train then BTS or MRT, then perhaps a little taxi ride to your final destination. Highly recommended.

Great way to get around. . The airport rail link is a fast and easy way to get to/from the city. The rail seems to always be running on schedule, so you don't have to worry about delays. It is also very affordable and clean, making it a great alternative to taxis.

Time and money. It charges 45 bhts between airport and downtown, and takes 30 minutes; it is good value for a single passenger, whose destination is nearby the station. If you are a group of 2 or 3, and away from the station, the better choice is take a taxi directly from the airport.

Convienent and Economic. This is a economic and convenient mode of transport from the airport to city area but don't expect to have a seat as it is usually crowded and packed with tourists and locals.

So much better than using taxis!. I stay in Pratunam area within 5 minutes walk of Ratchaprarop Station and always take the train to Suvanabhumi Airport. It is so cheap and much faster! Very easy system to use, just buy a token at boarding station to enter and exit through the turnstiles. There are always staff there to help if you get confused!

Cheap and cool way to Central Bangkok. We used the Airport Rail Link from Suvarnabhumi to Phaya Thai and it was fantastic. Such a great way to get to Central Bangkok for 45 baht for a single ticket (the equivalent to 90p). It is a safe, fast and efficient way to get around and would fully recommend it. I just wish they would reinstate the express service and this would dramatically cut service times.

A good vehicle. As same as BTS we can avoid traffic jam by using this vehicle but i think there still have some problem you can see from the news that sometime it doesn't work while people are using it.
Positive impression. Excellent connections in either way. Clean and fast. Very good service and cheap. Thanks of the many airport links, reaching Suvanaphumi is very easy and convenient.

cheap, easy, direction quite clear. it is very cheap, just thb45 from the bts station to the airport. there are staff to help you to buy tkt in the station. the direction is quite clear but just you have to take lift to the departure floor after you come out of the rail link.
Escellent. First time I used the airport link train. Was easy and cheap. Only thing I would suggest is that you time your trip away from peak hours, it gets very crowded.

Best way to and from the airport. Cheap and quick compared to transfers by taxi on the often busy roads.
Well signposted,
Takes about 30 minutes each way. Elevators to and from platforms. Great if you can manage your luggage.

Getting more crowded as time passes by. It is still the best way to get around but has become quite crowded at almost all hours of the day. Specially 9'sh am and 6'ish pm. Reminds me of a Japanese bullet train where you have to shoe horned in.
Not the best to ride during raid. Brakes are not very good

Excellent. Use this, do not take a taxi or tuktuk in Bangkok, guaranteed you will be quicker and pay a fare price, comfortable! Used Bangkok as our base and did a few trips bank and forth from BKK and DMK, used city line BTS, sooo easy, only 40 baht!

Stuffy and not enough seats. The station itself is super stuffy , you really feel that you can suffocate especially during rush hours. There is no clear marking on the floor to tell passengers where to queue so people just stand all over the place to wait for the train. If it is really an airport transit, how come there is hardly any space for passengers to put their luggages? Honestly, it is one the worst airport transit that I have ever been. The only plus point is that it is a cheap.

The only way to travel... Into Bangkok. Flying in business class into Bangkok we had some hefty luggage to take into town to our hotel. I was a little concerned that, having also damaged a knee before heading out on holiday, take a cab would be a better option but we decided to try the airport rail option having heard so much about how bad the traffic was in Bangkok itself. The reality was that the train couldn't have been easier. There's very simple to use ticket vending machines in the airport and within a couple of minutes of clearing arrivals we were heading into town at about 10 on a Monday morning with no fuss whatsoever. The sting in the tail was the then planned swap to the monorail system, which is equally clean and efficient, to get to our hotel was made a difficult task with cases due to the apparent absence of either lifts or escalators in most stations. Definitely recommend the airport rail but if you do have a lot of luggage then perhaps grabbing a cab once in town is worthwhile and save the monorail and other (very cheapens excellent) public systems for when you're luggage free. P.S. Having headed down to Hua Hin we did get the chance to compare in contrast with taxiing in and out of the city. Definitely take the Airport Rail!!

The old express trains have been suspended. The Airport Rail Link is an average experience which could be an excellent one. i rode this train on day 2 of its operation a couple for years back: a slick 15 minute ride from Suvarnabhumi to Makkasan city terminal with no stops. Trouble was few people used it. at 100 Baht it was only a couple of dollars cheaper than a taxi and Makkasan Terminal was too far to walk to Sukhumvit and too close for a taxi to want the job. So the SRT punted it to local commuters with great success - so much success that they needed the underused express train sets to cope with the demand. The result was that when I used the service from Ratchaprarop station to the airport a couple of weeks ago, I found standing room only and nowhere to stow my suitcase. Effectively the airport users have become an inconvenience. On the plus side it only takes 25 minutes which is quicker than a taxi, at 40 Baht it must be one of the cheapest airport links around, and it is clean and air-conditioned.The SRT needs to invest in new train sets. But when this will happen is anyones guess!

Clean, Fast and cheap. I thought only Singapore that has great Train System in South East Asia. Turned out I was wrong. Bangkok beat it! Very helpful, especially for 1st timer in Bangkok. Do not use Taxi from airport. I repeat, do not use Taxi unless you are with locals.

Quick and cheap. If you are going to the airport I would recommend taking the rail link. It is so cheap compared to a taxi and stops right inside the terminals so you don't have to walk far to check in. The train is quick and reliable. Very easy to use.

Cheap and fast!. An easy, cheap and fast way to get onto Bangkok and you can avoid the aggressive and dishonest taxi drivers who drive the longest route and try to take you to a different hotel than you booked because it is "better".... Finishes around 11:30pm. Starts around 4am-ish.

Quickly gets to the airport. Fast and cheap.. I took the airport rail link both directions between Makkasan and the airport several times. It is fast and cheap. There is room for some luggage but not too much.

Fast, Efficient and Cost Effective UNLESS. Assuming you can get to an Airport Rail Link station with your bags, this means of transportation is excellent if you are leaving Bangkok, especially during rush hour, ASSUMING you are not over-burden with too many bags, luggage or too many children.Allow enough time to get to the station and transit in the airport along with the mandatory security time waits.It is also a great way if you are alone and meeting someone at the airport

Great rail system but hard to find taxi at makkasan station. This service is fast and efficient. The trains and the station are spotless and you will definitely be on time to catch your flight BUT when returning from the airport to Makassan station, it was impossible to find a taxi

Easy and helpful staff. landed safety and we choose to take the public tranport . at the 1st place , its quick difficult for us becouse this it our 1st time . but end up its become more easy after u understand what to do . :) card Kiosk only accept coin , so please prepare a small changes . if you dont have or not enough changes , you can changes with their counter staff . they will help you .

Doesn't do much for me. It would be good if it connected to somewhere useful. The majority of people just prefer to grab a taxi because that's much easier.I think things will change when they connect it to Don Muang airport.

Fastest and Cheapest way to go. Unless you're coming in or departing after hours (11pm, I think), this is the way to go. You avoid the crazy BKK traffic and the cost is a fraction of what a taxi costs. It is very easy to locate at the airport. It gets you to a BTS station so you can transfer to BTS or take a taxi from there to your final destination.
Reliable and quick transport. Easiest way to reach hotel/airport. Connects both BTS and MRT lines which give us access to reach almost all places...
Always Airport Link. Everytime I go to the airport. I take the airport link. I make me transport faster and easier. The price is not expensive.

Cheapest and traffic-free way to get to the airport. We happen to stay in a hotel near the airport rail link so we experienced first hand how amazing it is to take the train to the city from the airport than to rent a cab and endure traffic. It was a comfortable and stress-free ride back and forth. We only paid less than TBT 100 for two when we took the city line.

Convenient , faster and cheap as compared to using a taxi. Used the airport rail link to get to the city. It is so convenient to use and really fast as compared to using a taxi. It is pretty cheap too. We got off at Paya Thai station and took a short cab ride to our Hilton hotel. If you have minimum luggage, you can take the BTS from Paya Thai to a convenient BTS station close to your hotel.
Fastest link to the city. Very convenient transportation from the airport to the city & vice versa.Attached link to the mrt stations around the city.

very good easily accessible cheap. took the sky train from Airport to china town. Very easy followed directions changed train at Maaskan easy hassle free. Very cheap for a family of 4 we paid 280 baht to get to china town as opposed to a taxi wanting to charge us 1200 baht
Beats the gridlock. Great way to transfer form the airport. Easy to navigate, super cheap and keeps you kurt of the gridlock traffic that is Bangkok.

Most efficient way to reach airport. The junction at Phaya Thai station is a little long (several levels to climb) and not very convenient with a large suitcase. Then it is worth using the train as you avoid traffic which can be terrible in Bangkok. The trip is around 30min. If you take it during the peak hours (early morning and around 5/6pm) you will have little space for your luggage as many Thaï commuters are also using this train.

One of the most convenient and hassle free mode to get you to heart of Bangkok.
