Will people who look for a convenient mode of hassle free transport.this is the best option.No need to be worried if you over paid the taxi driver.no hassle of trafficcomfortable air conditioned with relatively low ticket cost.enjoy entering the city with fellow travelers from round the globetime just 30 Mins which would pass just like that.

Great way into the city without the hassle of expensive taxis. Suvarnabumhi airport is crowded, have to wait in line to get a taxi. Can be hellish on a hot day. The Airport Rail Link is a great way to get to the BTS Skytrain. Not expensive and very comfortable. Highly recommend.

Potentially a good service. In the future when the airport rail link is completed it will be an awesome service but currently I have found it to be a bit of a mission when you have relatively heavy luggage on your homeward bound journey. We have used the service twice and upon arrival both times thought it to be very convenient to our hotel (Mercure Siam) although this also meant a couple of station changes for the correct line. Carriages were full but not jammed in like sardines. However when changing stations things did get a little funky, not too out of control but we were still travelling pretty light at this time, that is why I say arrival is a good service.Departure the first time we used this service was Ok we seemed to be ahead of the crowd and the carriages were relatively spacious and stations seemed less chaotic, however last time and it will be the last time for awhile, it was a struggle with our 2 heavy suitcases plus each with a small but full back pack. The carriages were packed and the stations were crowded, it made moving through people with our luggage very difficult and a nightmare to handle in the crowed.On the plus side though if you are travelling light and at times that don't conflict with work hours then it is the best option so you don't miss your flight by being stuck in Bangkok traffic.
Easy and Convenient. Check with your Hotel concierge for the connectivity from your part of town to the nearest point.Easy and cheap way. From Silom to the Airport in 25 minutes.

Brilliant to get to the center for 45 baht! . So easy. Quicker and safer than a taxi and you don't get scammed by being taken around the streets.45 baht token from airport and then take the sky train or then take a taxi from the centre to your hotel. Much better than a taxi in traffic all the way around !

Quickest way there and back again. I was pleasantly surprised to learn that Bangkok airport (Suvarnabhumi) now has this link - I had to take taxis in the past which, with Bangkok's notorious traffic, take a long time. It cost only 45 Bhat, or about US$1.50 each way to get to the downtown core. The only drawback is that it is not completely integrated with the BTS Skytrain, although they do share stations, you have to exit the airport train zone and purchase another ticket for the skytrain and not all skytrain stations have escalators - something to consider if you are carrying luggage.

Efficient and clean. The signboard from the airport to the rail is very clear. The counter can speaks English.If there's one thing I want to complain:- I can't find the lift access! How do the senior citizen or those with poor health travel? Hmm

Fast and well worth the money. This a great way to get from the Airport to a kick off station down Town in Bangkok, the train connects the Metro and Skytrain at certain stations, keep your ears on alert s the stations are announced because the maps are hard to follow. A let down on the service is that it is used heavily by students getting to Uni between 7-9AM and can be a bit of a problem to use if you have luggage at these times, the Thais are mild mannered but a person with Three big suitcases annoys everyone during rush hour.if you are staying out near Phaya Thai, the last station, splurge the extra 20 Baht and take the express train directly to that station, it takes half the time and no students to contend with, ever..Other than rush hours the public system is great in BKK, easier than first glance.

Very convenient.. When we visit Bangkok we always make use of the Airport Rail Link, because it is clean and convenient. If you consider the amount of traffic on the roads in Bangkok, this form of transportation offered, is absolutely fantastic. Especially, after flying with a very busy, three year old little boy, the Airport Rail Link is fast and gets you to your destination in no time. It is also very affordable, if compared to what you would have to pay for a taxi to your hotel.Jeanette Victor

Watch the operating hours. We arrived a bit before the scheduled arrival time at Bangkok airport at about 5:30 am and headed direction Airport Link.The place was nearly deserted... We then learned from a small sign that the first train starts at 6:00 am.We advise you to check the timetable on the internet in advance, as the fast train also runs only once an hour.

Great facility for travellers. This is a great facility for travellers. It takes you to the city in a short period of time. Though expensive it eases you with the hassles of changing trains or different means of transport. Has Wifi too.
Fast and easy. This is a very good way to get from Suvarnabhumi to central Bangkok, especially in the morning, when there are a lot of traffic on the highways.

So easy to navigate, comfortable and so affordable.. Faster than so called BTS (skytrain) and cheaper as well. There is only one line (Phayathai-Airport) with about 8 stations in total. I prefer it to the regular Skytrain and prefer it to the Subway system also. I wish the Express Line will re-open soon so airport becomes even more accessible and faster (from the city).
fuss free and cheap. it's convenient and a cheaper way to beat all odds. (the never ending traffic jam)it's fast and safe. 40baht to most station

Very good, fast and safe way of transportation . It's good if you can make a connection with one of the metro lines, but if not, you just drop off at last station and take a cab, than from there to the Khao San Road ex. It's about $100btsThe train ticket is about $45 bts

Fast transportation to city. This was a really fast way to get from the Suvarnabhumi airport to the main part of the city. You can purchase a one-way ticket at the airport rail link station for about 45 baht, depending on your destination. We travelled to the end of the line. Be sure to know where you need to get off before you purchase a ticket.
Very handy. You would wish many cities had one of these, really good for getting to the airport. Very modern and handy

Airconditioned, 45 min ride to Bangkok's International Airport. What a great idea! Airconditioned, comfortable ride straight to the ground floor of the International Airport. Unfortunately very few of the Sky Train stations have lifts, some have escalators to the ticket turn styles but require you to then carry your cases up another flight of stairs to the platform. Another tip is to allow plenty of time as there is no longer an express service and also avoid peak times as commuters travel to and from work.
Cheap & Fast Ride to City Area. Waiting time was reasonable and train was rather spacious. Aircon was also sufficient for the hot weather. Before I knew it, reached city centre. :)
Quick and inexpensive. If you don't have a lot of luggage, this is the quickest way into town and very cheap too. Easy connection at the end of the line to the BTS Sky Train.

Highly recommend. If your arrival corresponds to the operating hours (06:00-00:00) of the Airport Rail Link, I would suggest taking this instead of a taxi.Traffic is highly congested in Bangkok, so this is a much faster way into the city & about 10% of the cost.If you have a lot of luggage then don't bother, there are quite a few stairs to navigate especially if you are connecting to other forms of public transportation along your way.

Fast and easy to access. For those who stay near BTS or Metro station, airport rail link is the best choice as you no need to bargain with those taxi driver. I have been to Bangkok for over 10 years at least twice a year and recently found that the taxi driver from airport to hotel will charge unreasonable high. If you ask to charge by meter then they will let you have a Bangkok city sightseeing for a long time till the meter price they felt comfortable, if you choose to a fix price, they will not go by highway which will delay. So airport rail link is the best choice from airport to hotel especially your luggages are empty!

Best travel option to/from airport. My only complaint, if any, is the not all stationset have escalators/elevators which can be tricky if you have a lot of luggage. Otherwise it beats Bangkok traffic any day!

Little or no point to using it.. Firstly it works fine. It is clean, frequent and safe...and no traffic que of course.But then it fails in all of the realities of travel....airport to final address.With luggage it's a nightmare and once you have had to change from airport link to one of the standard lines it is a real pain. Then you have the arrival at whatever BTS stop is near for you...stairs are a nightmare as is walking even a short distance with your bags family etc etc.Getting a taxi is not always easy either. ..too short a fare and the taxi'service don't want to know. Getting one at the bottom of the station exits is also far from easy.I strongly suggest you get a cab...sit back relax and watch Bangkok life go by your window direct to your address. ..Yes there is traffic but it's air-conditioning in the cabs and the cost is around £7.00....simply not worth the train hassel

Constant Breakdown. I used to like taking the Airport Rail Link because it was efficient and convenient. But it has made me missed my flight for 3 times in 6 months when it constantly break down and causing me extra money to buy new air tickets. The efficiency needs to be improved tremendously..
Quick and convenient. If you are alone and know how to get to your destination by the airport rail link then definitely its easy and convenient plus no traffic jam and cost effective.
A Fast Connection from Suvarnabhumi to the City Center. An inexpensive option to get from the airport to downtown with both not-stop and a few stops options.

Easy Transport..!. .... Don't take a backpack though! We had to go from Bangkok to the airport to fly out to Chang Mai and although it's easy enough to get a cab there from most parts of Bangkok and the actual line is easy enough, it does have alot of walking involved to get you to the platform you need.The train itself had air con which we needed and goes right into the airport but make sure to ask people working in the station where you need to go to make sure you don't end up on the wrong line. Remember there is little to no English wording at the station and Thai is very difficult to read!

Very good service. If you ready bkk with one suitcase n handbag, you can happily take ride on the railway link as the taxis will ask you to pay THB400 to 600 depending upon how good you are at bargaining! Its a smooth ride that goes right upto the city and very reasonably priced. You can also take the first glimpse of the city if you arrive during daytime!

fast inexpensive link from suvarnabhumi to bts network. fast inexpensive cheap, direct from airport to bts network, better than any taxi. There is security at each station who check the train for packages that have been left behind. Great experience

fast and easy to get to the city center. The best way to beat the crazy Bangkok traffic during peak hours to reach the airport or the city center. Economic as well as faster than a taxi.One might have to walk a bit to the train station at the airport. If you have too much luggage then better take a taxi

Best and most reliable way to get to and from the airport. If you do not carry too many pieces of luggage you should always consider the Airport Rail Link into Bangkok. For 45 Baht the train gets you to Phaia Thai in the center. take the MRT train from there (another 15 - 40 Baht, depending on your final destination). Train ride lasts 30 minutes and can be much faster than a cab ride at some times of the day with heavy traffic.

Very accessible. This airport rail link was just amazing. I got back from myanmar for 3days trip and I need nee to change my ticket for early morning flight going to philippines. It wasn't easy since its weekend and already late in the afternoon, travel agencies were already closed. I am grateful there's airport rail link! It was amazingly easy for me to go to airport to change my ticket. So fro Soi 4 to terminal 21 was just a flash away because of the airport rail link. No need for taxi ride and be stocked in the middle of traffic.

A Breeze. You go to the basement floor from the arrivals hall and there is a train ready in no time at all .A swift trip to Phyra Thai station then a change to the sky train on a separate line upstairs.You are in the centre of town in no time at all-40 min at most- for a couple of dollars Aust

Streamlined access to and from the airport. I was staying close to Siam Paragon, so access from and to the airport was super fast, about 20-30 min, and super cheap 40baht. I had been to Bangkok Lat Sept. And my group took a taxi which took much longer to reach the same destination. Finding the rail link in the airport is good due to pretty clear signage. I only had to wait about 10 minutes. The scenery is wonderful going from rural, to suburban, to urban density. The train can get crowded, but is for the most part clean and comfortable. And so much faster and cheaper than a taxi.
Great!. Definitely the best and cheapest way to get into town from Suvarnabhumi airport! It's clean, has AC and is fast and reliable. Don't be scared! It's really a great option!

Not really to be recommended as a Airport shuttle train. People of western states very often make the big mistake to consider that train shuttle as as part of a commuter system on big airports in Europe or other big cities.It is run by State Railway of Thailand (SRT) and is that company has no connection to MRT (Mass Rapid Transport) or the BTS skytrain company.If you still into saving money after your arrival please take the fast red train which terminates at Makhasan Station. From there you have to go 10 minutes to find the Metro Station Petchaburi. And this is definitely no fun after a long flight and the tropical heat gives you a hard time.So you better take the blue City-line which I think has 8 to 10 stops until it terminates at Phaya Thai Station. From there walk down all the steps and after 10 meters walk up all the steps of Phaya Thai BTS Skytrain station. Buy a new ticket and then good luck to get access to the train with all your luggage and find almost all trains packed with people.Rather often the blue city line can get stuck on the tracks near Ramkamhaeng Station because of the very weak Ramkamhaeng power Station. During March a morning train got stuck on the tracks for 1 hour. The doors were not be opened and the air condition went out of power too. People collapsed and some had serious problems because of that.So please think twice before you do are confronted with rather big transportation problems after your arrival in Bangkok airport.

The best way to commute to the airport. One of the best transportation system reaching this busy Airport. Amazingly clean and on time for me the fastest and safest way true the international hub. Coming from Switzerland this is indeed a compliment but I have to say they have done an excellent job and I feel very safe commuting back and forwards.
Very convenient . Its the easiest way to go to the city during the rush hours and the cheapest way to go.. About 15-45baht per trip depandind how far you go..

Fix the time for the flight. Airport Link is the best transportation in Bangkok, I can fix the time between the place to the airport , it's not over 1 hour for taking the train from Asok to Suvanabhummi airport.

Organized and Safe. The best, quickest and cheapest way to get safely into Bangkok and your hotel destination. Check the maps, though. The city is a sprawling mess. This choice, though, is worthwhile.

Easy to reach Suvarnabhumi Airport. Cheap and fast for transportation between BKK airport and city. The price around 35-45 bath per person and it was comfortable. Recommended for travelers with light luggages.
Easy and cheap. Its the fastest and Easiest way to go to the city from the airport. However bit of a walk from airport link to the BTS station . Best for Solo travellers

Efficient and on time.. This rail link is efficient and on time, clean as weel. You will see a lot of security personnel around. They are guarding the link to ensure that no one breaks the rules. No eating, drinking on the train. There is a fine if you break the rules. The link gets you right at the airport,you don't have to walk around when you get off. Highly recommended

inexpensive and easy connection. If you are travelling alone and do not have big luggages, it is a very convenient way to get to center of Bangkok. It is actually quite good if your hotel is near the train stations.

Fantastic service safe reliable clean timely.. This service from Suvarnabhumi Airport to central Bangkok is cheap, fast, clean it also links with the BTS (Skytrain) at Phraya Thai station and the MRT( subway) at Makkasan station. A much better option than a taxi as you don't need to battle Bangkoks congested roads or gouging taxi drivers. Only problem is the hours 6 am until midnight.

Both City line and Express line work well.. If you want a comfortable trip in a seat, the express line is worth the extra expense, and you gain an overview of the city from above. The express is not always running, but city line is always running from early morning until about 11:00 PM.
Seats are too small for Farang to sit. Not sure why, but Thai's made the seats too small to sit on. Not comfortable for Farang size ! Other than that, experience is okay.

faster and economical. its a better and faster mode of travel from Bangkok airport to the central city areas of Bangkok and vice a versa. during the peak office hours , its better to travel in this than a cab. Travel in it from Bkk airport to Makkasan station and from there u can take MTR to any location.

Best way to get TO or FROM BKK airport.. I love this link option if it is running during you travel times. It only runs from about 5:30am until midnight so be sure to check your arrival and departure times and also consider your check-in time at the airport as well as delays with baggage and customs upon arrival. I find it's the best way to get me to downtown Bangkok upon arrival at BKK, but it does NOT go all the way through to DMG airport for a transfer. Be sure to check out the website for schedules as they may have changed since November 2015.

Zoom!. It's easy, it's convenient, it's cheap and you get to see the surrounding areas of Bangkok. I recommend taking this train if you're arriving during the day, you'll enjoy the views more. 20 minutes of bliss.

Only Slow Train Available. When I needed a quit express trip into the city from the airport, the express was unavailable. Nearly a year for maintenance. Unbelievable. So, the traveler's only option is a slow 30-40 minute trip by the local train that makes a 6-7 stops along the way. Cheaper though.
Good link. This is a good cheap option when travelling from the airport into Bangkok. It was very easy to use to get to our destination

A Great Time and Money Saver!. There was a long queue at both taxi stands. And I need to get home fast. I went inside again and proceeded to the Airport Rail Link. Half an hour later, I was in the place where I was supposed to be. And grinning....

Mostly not crowded. Took the Airport Rail Link on my way back to the Suvarnabhumi airport. during morning time. The metro was not crowded and I found to be a convenient and economical option that a taxi..

From Airport to town (budget traveller). Like in the other big city, Bangkok also provide trian from airport to town.Don't get bored and upset with the cap and their charged.Make it yourself by take airport rail link at the cost less than 2$ to downtown in 45 min.Get off at Phrayathai station to connect to other train, the BTS sky train to Sukhumvit area or strat chasing your luck with the cap here to Khoasan area is much more easier.Feel free to ask me if you need help...

The way to go. I caught this train for the first time in May 2016 after catching taxis for years. For 40 baht I travelled from the airport to Pratunam shopping and hotel district, about a 20 min ride. No traffic jambs.
Nice. We took the ARL to the airport and found it clean, inexpensive and very efficient...just like BTS but uses a token instead of a plastic card. Way to go!!

standing room only. You may be hard pushed to get a seat but for sheer speed and convenience you can not beat this service. Especially during the rush hour in Bangkok which lasts from 5am to midnight. Plus it's not expensive

escalator closed. when catching the first train of the day the station gate opened but the escalator was switched off so i had to pull my 25kg case up a flight of stairs and it was a very hot morning however the journey to airport was fast comfortable cool and very cheap all considered a safer more predictable final trip
link. The transportation is very , very fast and very cheap and very easy to koriscenje.karta very inexpensive maybe 1.5 euro

Cheap and quick. We have just arrived in Bangkok after a very easy train ride from the airport on the city train. Why the city train and not the express? By necessity we used the city train when the airport express was out of service on our last visit and it is far cheaper and only stops at a few stations. A good tip is to get a train map from the airport train station and plan your route from there. Ticket machines are easy to use and have english options. And the biggest plus was watching the congested traffic barely moving on the road.
Fast to airport~. Though there are not so many trains to the airport a day as BTS, and the position of those stations are a bit weird, it's still a fast and comfortable way to the airport!

User friendly airport express. Rail service between Bangkok downtown and Suvanabumi International Airport starts from 6 am and ends at 12 midnight. No need to queue up for taxi. Express line or cityline can be chosen to suit your timetable. Rail carts are clean and spacious.

Fast and cheap. The airport rail link zips from Suvarnabhumi airport to the city. There is a nice supermarket selling Royal Thai products at the basement of the airport, same level as the airport rail link.very convenient for buying gifts for friends on the way home.

Best transport from Airport to Bangkok city. This Airport Rail link is easy transportation to get to the city. Its is recommended if your hotel is near or next to any BTS. If you have a very big and heavy luggage can be a huge challenge, it can be a weight lifting exercise program, when u see stairs. Not all BTS have lift or escalator services.

In the city in no time. Traffic from the airport to BKK city can be a nightmare. The city link takes you to the BTS in BKK City in 40 min. So I advise to take it when your plane arrives in BKK early morning or after 4 pm.

Connect Us from Suwarnabhumi Int Airport to the Center of Bangkok. This is the best airport connect transport system in Bangkok.
The train is so clean and it's better for Us to go to our hotel by using ARL than Taxi. The price is so cheap.

the fast way to the city. fast with a reasonable charge, you don't need to buy your prepaid sim card in the airport, you'll get it from any convienent store, just get straight to the station, but be careful when you pass the gate, it'll spank your butt.

Cheap convenient and easier than a taxi. The last few times I've past through Suvarnabhumi Airport the queues for taxis have been awful. Instead I've taken the Rail Link train into Bangkok and switched to the BTS at Phaya Thai. The train is cheap, clean, always busy and very safe. It's also a lot less hassle than the taxis and traffic of Bangkok.To find the station at the airport, simply go down one level lower than where you get the taxis.Give it a go, it's highly recommended.

AIRPORT TRANSFER A+. If you are traveling Bangkok on a budget or you want to experience the city like a local, most travelers and locals use the Airport Rail Link to connect them to the BTS Public Transportation Train line. From the BTS, you can go on whichever way around Bangkok you like. The Airport Rail link is reliable, affordable (cheapest transfer) and safe. I highly recommend.

Quick, cheap, clean and easy!. Using the train to reach the city from the airport was so easy - the map was clear and the cost to travel was very small. The carriage was very clean and the ride very comfortable. Is definitely recommend this option!
Efficient and clean. Took this mode of transport almost whole day. It was efficient, clean. An effective way to stroll in Bangkok.

Convenient and good experience. Once you arrive at airport, dont need to go out in search of taxi, this ARL is very convenient. Of-course only if the hotel you are staying at is nearby the ARL stop. ARL Saves time

Great and cheap way to travel at 35B. From Sumbuvimbi Airport, the saving grace is really this railway. Easily accessibly at the lower levels, it connects to BTS and MRT at the end of the line. Cheap alternative to taxis which may cost up to $500. I took a taxi from bangkok bus terminal (around Mochit area) and it came up to $500 with tolls (75B)

Fast train. Fast train which was very convenient. Air condition works so well under hottest month in Bangkok. Price is very cheap but it can be crowded and take long time to wait for a train. If you have a flight, need to spare time to make you won't miss it.
fastest link to city. fastest link to city ... takes only .....30 mins to reach city...and also very economical...as taxi will take 1 hour plus with 4 times fare

Amazing and fast!. Despite being very crowded the train was air conditioned and so quick. Th train was clean and well lit. The people on the train were very friendly and every one helped move suitcases for each other so the trip to the airport was peasant.

Better option than taxi, if the timing works. Easy, inexpensive and convenient way to get to the city. Used it to connect to the BTS. The only drawback was having to haul luggage across levels to switch trains,but better than dealing with the Bangkok traffic.
best way to travel to airport. it saves a lot of time to travel to the airport in Bangkok. however, if you have a lot of luggage then it may not be practical.
Straight forwrd. Can get a bit crowded but easy to use and cheaper option than taxi. Also quicker than taxi or bus due to traffic. Easy to use - staff helpful
excellent. Clean,air conditionned, fast and very easy to use to get to central Bangkok...and only 45 Baht..can't do better than that

Fastest Way To Airport, Even With Check-In Luggage. Traffic in Bangkok can be a disaster. Using the ARL will get you to the Airport quickly. I have clocked it a few times, and from you arrive at the ARL till you are actually at the check-in counter or self-check-in, it takes roughly 35-40min max.At my last ride on ARL, only 36min from entering the station till I had self-checked-in, and was PAST the domestic flight passport control and security. Cost for a trip is a mere 35bht.I can highly recommend using this mode of transportation vs taxis when destination is Suvarnabhumi Airport. And even with big luggage, this presents no problem at all.

Quick, reliable, green, cheap. Wonderful service! Have taken many times and will always do so in future. Loses a star for having no elevator or escalator down from the BTS Phaya Thai to the Airport link station one floor below . Shocking. Still four stars though! Shows how much o love it overall because that was some inconvenience with a stroller , baby and heavy bags . Moronic design.Will take again every time regardless
Cheap and convenient. No more taxi queue when arriving or leaving Bangkok now.Guess it is bad for taxi drivers but good for budget travelers and frequent visitors

Easy access to the city. Traveling from the new Suvarbhumi airport to the city has never been much easier; it is only 5 stops away to reach Ratchabharop station, and you can conveniently step out to connect by BTS sky train to all other parts of Bangkok.
If I'm traveling alone, I will likely take this route to get to the city.

Easy way to get to the airport. This is a quick and easy way to get from Bangkok centre to the airport. However it is not so convenient if you have a large amount of luggage due to the long walks and escalators at some of the stations

Very fast into center of Bangkok!. When i am flying to Bangkok i always choose the Suvarnabhumi airport because i can go with the Airport Link in town! It is very cheap and fast and cool (airconditioned)!! Highly recommended!!
Best option to connect Airport and the city. It's a quite cheap option to get to the city from the airport (and the other way around too). Fast and clean, with air con. Totally worth it.

Convenience, Cheap ticket and Comfortable. Have it all. Compare to taxi, ARL time to airport is predictable.. Approx 35mins to or from central Bangkok. Taxi always take 40 mins soonest, not much of diff.. Yet ticket price and comfortable make some diff.I love it.. The only downside compare to taxi is you get taxi at any roadside while for ARL, you need to find your way to one of the station.. I mean if you have couple of big size luggages.... It might not be too convenience to move everything from your hotel to the ARL stations.
SMOOTH RIDE TO TOWN. Very good connectivity to many stops along the way and so it isboth convenient and cheap to travel.For other routes it may bebetter to use van or bus or taxi
Quick & Quiet. Possibly the most reliable way to get yourself to Suvarnabhumi Airport on time, avoids any traffic jams down below that's for sure. Quick & quiet, clean & cheap.

Convenient . From airport basement to hotel located to the city center area is so convenient and only cost around 5usd for one way. Eliminate long taxi queue by using this airport link and connect to local MRT or sky train is easy. If you don't carry so much luggage then this is recommended transport from airport to city center area.

Convenient Airport City Transfer . Upon exiting from the Suvarnabhumi Arrival hall, proceed to the basement for this transfer to the city. Token can be purchased at the machine. Just select the station and pay accordingly. There are stations to alight for transfers to the BTS Skytrain or MRT. An easy connection transfer to the BTS Skytrain is at Phya Thai.
Excellent service. Good security. helpful staff to direct you to the appropriate platform etc, lots of signage to get you from the arrivals down to the train. Nice airconditioned trains.

Simple. Really easy, just go downstairs to the station, get your ticket at the machine, if you want the change to hua lumphong get off at the 2nd last stop, if you get off at the last stop the security guards outside will hail you a taxi which was so helpful.

Convenient and cheap. Fastest and Easiest way to go to the city from the airport. Train schedule is mostly on time. Well maintained train and staff promote patience and orderly when boarding or alighting from the train. enough space on the train and alloted area to accommodate luggages. However, there is a bit of a walk from airport link to the BTS station.

Cost effective way to get into the city. Cost 2 off us 90 baht to get to Phreya thai from where we got onto the BTS Skytrain to our final destination. This journey would have otherwise cost is 550 baht.
Easier than expected. Exactly what it says on the ti a fast air coned rail link to the airport cuts a lot of traffic time out. No problems

Great to get to airport. Good way to get into town from airport, maybe not with too much luggage tho, easy to connect to skytrain then good to go, train is very easy and before you get on, trains are inspected in case someone has left anything on, when u get on it a good 30 + mins so try get a seat, trains are very clean.
Traveling round Bangkok . This is the best way to travel round Bangkok it removes all the stress from traveling in traffic and cheap to travel around

Cheap and fast way to go to airport. It is the cheapest and fastest way to go to airport. If station is nearby then using this saves time and money. If station is little bit far also, taking Tuk-tuk to station and then using this train will be more effective. But this service is not available in all the places. All the station are clearly shown in the google map and its very easy to refer.

Fast and Cheap to get to the airport but give yourself 60 to 90 min to get to BKK. I travelled in the Bangkoks rail link and mrt this past 3th of may and i have to say that many travellers use it. It is fast and cheap it costs around 60 thai bath which is around 2 US dollar SINGLE TRIP to get from different stations to the Suviranami International Airport. From the airport to the last station it takes around 35 to 45 minutes of travel. There are few seats so prepare yourselve to travel standing up with you luggage also travel light or keep your lugagge ready to inspecttion because in the mrt and airport rail link there are like security checkpoints and you have to open your bags.Above that remember to give yourselve also 60 to 90 minutes of travel dependen on where are you located because you will need to use the mrt or trian or taxi to get to the airport rail link stations. but definitely a more secure and cheaper and fastest way to get to the airport than a taxi.Will use it again when returning to BKK

Regular user. Very cheap and reasonable. Reliable. Every 10 minutes or so. You can go to either of two central Bkk stations and avoid the traffic. Phayathai links with the Bts. It can be a bit crammed. Locals use it as a cheap commute as opposed to travellers to and from Suv Airport. Avoids the traffic and the communication issues with taxis.

To Airport from Sukhumvit. we travelled from Soi 13 sukhumvit using BTS and Rail link for airport and the travel time was less than 1 hour which was fully air conditioned travel without any hassle and was super experience as one can enjoy the aerial view of the bangkokstill think can reduce travel time by reducing the number of stops or increasing the speed for efficient use

A very interesting wau to get to the city. the trains aren't very reliable, but it is an amazingly cheep way to get to the city. Traveled to Don Mueang International Airport from Phuket, the train station is very badly sign posted, but if you ask locals they will point you the right direction straight away. Cost of the ticket was 4 Bath.

Similar to Sinapore's MRTS. Very comfortable and very easy to access and navigate. A great way to get downtown from the airport then a short Taxi ride to your hotel. Very modern and reliable, usually not too crowded. My fav way to travel about Bangkok!

NICE CLEAN SERVICE. Excellent fast and prompt train service in which very clean and nice too. This service provides people to travel within the Air Port from terminal to terminal without much tiredness.

fast cheap and easy. Used this airport link to get from the airport to central Bangkok and it couldn't be any easier - usually a taxi in to BKK from 5the airport would cost 400bhat but by taking the airport link the 2 of us paid 140 baht. that's like $3 NZD each and no having to haggle with taxi drivers who don't want to use the meter - obviously you need to consider how far your hotel is from the station when deciding to use this as walking to the hotel with luggage can be quite a challenge especially when its 39 degrees

The only traffic you face is Human Traffic. And honestly, it's way easier to deal with human traffic than the infamous, terrible thai traffic that we've always been hearing about. It cost me around 500 THB to take a cab from Suvarnabhumi airport to Sukumvit and about 40 THB for the Airport Rail Link. It was fast, spacious, efficient, straightforward and inexpensive!!! of course, as a popular option among backpackers and frugal flashpackers, you might have to squeeze a bit during the peak period.
Very convenient, fast and cheap. Since I discovered it, I'm using it each time.Very convenient, fast, clean and cheap.No headache anymore with taxi drivers.Really like it and recommend it to all
Really good and cheap. Used this in the morning at about 615. Really easy to access and a short walk from the platform to the airport terminal.

Good way to avoid the congestion. We took the 18:02 train and arrived at the airport after about 30 minutes. On the way we saw congestion everywhere and felt lucky that we didnt have to wait in there. The price is also very attractive, 45B brings you from Phya Thai to the airport. The only drawback may be that there are not many seats, you may need to stand through the journey/most of the journey.

Cheap Transportation to and from the city. Cheapest and fastest mode of transportation to downtown Bangkok from the airport. The line ended at Phaya Thai station then it's a short walk to the BTS train line.

Best transport to Suwannaphumi airport (for small group). It took only about 25 minute from phayathai to airport. It is very convenient and not expensive. Best if travel in small group less than 4 persons.

very easy to use - never full and if you are near to it - just use it - best and most economic way to airport. I used it from Asok - it was empty and most eco to airport - very clean and fast - brings you directly to the terminals !
A quicky way to be at airport. The best way to go to airport from bkk. Fast and cheap. Can see the lanscape around the link. Simple to get this line...

Good if you only have easily carried luggage. This is a cheap and fast way to get into the centre of Bangkok. Do not use the Express service as it is more expensive and trains are less frequent! Note transfers at the City end are not luggage friendly

Every city needs one. One point off for not running later at night. But a frequently operating train will always be the best way to commute to an from an airport and a busy city. Except maybe automated heli-drones of the future but they don't exist yet.
Fastest way to the airport. Acheap and fast way to get to the airport.Comfortable, clean airconditioned trains and only cost 40 baht avoiding any traffic jams

Could've Been So Much Better. Compared to virtually any other modern air-rail link the BKK system is really nothing short of an expensive disaster. But that is to be expected, so was Suvarnabhumi itself. The problem is that this is not an "airport express" taking you quickly and directly into the heart of the city, it's a commuter train that happens to terminate at the airport, and thus is used by the locals as such, making it extremely crowded. What is needed is an actual "airport express" that takes you straight to the city, and would thus not be of any interest to daily commuters. The train is also mysteriously short of carriages - three - and does not make the best use of the what little space it has.That said, if you are staying near any of the major stations or the connections with the BTS stations, and are on your own with minimal baggage, it's a decent option and substantially cheaper than getting a taxi. If in a couple or a family with several items of luggage, then it's advisable to get a taxi.
the most convenient way to travel.. Only way to reach on time and happy - is the skytrain & the BTS. The cab & tuktuk drivers are getting irritating by the days just as the traffic.

Convenient to/from the city. Very convenient to travel from Suvarnabhumi airport to Bangkok city in about 30 minutes. The Airport rail link operates to/from Phaya Thai station in the City. From Phaya Thai one can take BTS train on one direction to go to Mo Chit station. From Mo Chit, Don Mueng airport is just 20 to 30 minutes by Airport bus. On the other direction from Phaya Thai one can go to Siam, Sukhumvit shopping areas by BTS in 10 minutes. Airport rail link is cheapest and fastest from/to Suvarnabhumi airport.

The best way to go to airport.. Forget taxis. If you have the right spirit, use airport rail link to teach airport. Inexpensive, time saving and convenient, it is linked to BTS. Station in the basement of swarnbhoomi airport Bangkok, it is very easy to go to arrival or departure terminals.
recommend. easy to use, not too crowded but full. stations are very clean and well designed for luggage (all escalators, paved walkways and elevators

Convenient way to get to the city center and the airport. It is a convenient way to get to the city center without any hassle of traffic jam at the city center. Yet, no A/C at platform/concourse, so it is very hot while you are waiting.
Fast, efficient. What more can I say? Easy to use, fast, clean, efficient (compare with Heathrow Express - ugh). At off peak times you may have to wait a little.

Good value for tranfert. Good value for a transfert to or from your hotel.
Price is very cheap and all is clean and secure.
Go ahead ..better choice if U stayed in Bangkok few days.

Excellent way to travel to the city. Convinience and very economic, cost 45 bath to get to the city then take either BTS or MRT to your destinated station. Total travelling time could be much quicker compared to taking taxi, especially during the rush hour. The train is clean, comfortable, smooth and quiet. I was happy to try this transportation mode, very efficient.

Most cost effective and reasonably convenient way to get to/fro Suvarnabhumai-City Center. The Airport Rail Link is by far the most cost effective way and reasonably convenient way to get to the city center and then you could either take the BTS Skytrain or MRT to get to your exact destination or close to it.However it would be awesome if a single Pass should be usable across BTS, MRT, BRT, RailLink and Ferries. Apparently there only one Train that plies now with stop along the way.Some of the maps show two non-stop services to Makassan and another station but when I was there, they were not running.You can easily get the token and some change at the ticket counter.
Very fast travel to Sukhumvit (Asok BTS).. From airport to Makkasan then change to MRT to Sukhumvit (Asok BTS).The whole journey takes less than an hour.

Cheapest option into Bangkok.. The train is by far the cheapest way to get into central Bangkok. (B45 at the time of writing) take about 30 mins to Phaya Thai where you can connect to the bts system. The air-conditioned carriages are a nice rest bite from the heat of Bangkok. The service runs from 6 am until midnight.
Clean, reliable, air conditioned!. A smooth air conditioned ride, 25 minutes to city centre. Reasonable price, and avoids Bangkok traffic!

Cheap way into town. Very convenient way into town from the airport, especially if carrying light luggage. Usually much quicker than by road. Can be awkward with heavy luggage. Trains are air conditioned. Signs easy to follow both on the train and when selecting your exit from any station.
smooth; the fastes option to get from airport to the city centre. smooth, cheap and so much faster thean other ways of transport (including taxi). Airconditioned and fast.

Could have been planned better. It is quite economical and quick way to link city center with the airport. The greatest challenge is being user friendly. Generally people commuting to airport will have bags that may be on a heavier side. Neither the trains nor the connecting elevators/ escalators have are suitable for that. Recommended only if one travels light

The sure way to get to Bangkok city (almost). We arrived on the late evening on 29th April and by the time we exit immigration and gotten our luggage, it was almost 9pm on a Friday evening in Bangkok. All the taxi, AOT (airport taxi) were sold out. In the end we have to walk about 150m to the Airport Railink within the airport to take the train to Paya Thai Station in the city. There were suppose to have an express train but it was unavailable. In the end we took the normal train for 45 baths and it took us about 45 min to reach Paya Thai Station. Overalls it still beats taking taxi which will cost about 500 baths and there were a big jam in Bangkok that can easily take more than an hour compare to when we travel via BTS. Overall BTS is a sure bet to travel between airport and city if you do not have huge luggages. If you do, look for elevator to move between floors. Be prepare to wait though as there are usually only one or two elevators available at the airport and at the station.

No more nail biting rushes. Getting to the airport in Bangkok in the old days was a nail-biting experience. The traffic was so bad you might not even make your plane. Thank goodness for the Airport Rail Link, now you can be certain of getting to the airport on time. It's well worth the fare, which is quite affordable.

Save money and free of traffic. If you would like to save money and no more headache about traffic like me.I recommend you take airport link to International airport.It's only 45baht per trip however don't go during peak time as you will be shock to see the crowd.The train took around 45mins to reach airport but if you go around peak time, be prepare you might not have a change to hop on the train.

Not the best way to get to the airport. Firstly this link only services Suvarnabhumi Airport, not Don Mueang which is still used for some flights and airlines. If you have only carry on I guess this is an option, although you still have to get to a link station either via the Sukhumvit BTS line or MRT to Makkasan or by a taxi. The price is right to as I believe 45 baht as of now for a single ticket. I have used it once from the airport so I am really not an expert, but have spoken to others that have. You can no longer check-in bags at Makkasan station (which was one of the main selling points) so you need to hump them from your hotel up and down stairs at the various stations. From the main tourist/business areas I still believe you will reach the airport more easily by taxi (using the meter) and in a better frame of mind and spend not much more for the total trip say 300 baht as opposed to perhaps 150 or more depending # of persons and with more strain muscles.

Good access to the centre.. It comes in every 15 mins and 35 bhat to get into the central.Very clean carriages, everything is written and told in English. Should have more space for luggages but still fine.
excellent. it is the best transport from airport to city, the terminal is well connected with the metro, making the whole ride very easy

Only way to get to and from the airport.. It is so much easier than getting stuck in traffic. The only downside is if you have multiple bags it can be a bit much to deal with; while one bag and a carry-on are no problem.
Best way to get home. Ditch the tuk tuk and cab ride in traffic. This takes 30 mins, even from the first stop. It's even cheaper.
Easy access to Bangkok. A fast and efficient service from the airport to Bangkok. Regular service is great and well priced but can get busy at rush hours and seating could have a little more comfort.

Perfect transport solution from the airport. For THB45 you can go all the way to downtown. It misses the Suhkumvit area so you will have to change at the last station to link on the BTS network. Great to miss peak hours traffic after 17:00

Great if you are a Backpacker. I think it took 35 bahts to reach to the other side of the town from Sukhumvit Airport using ARL. It was awesome. The taxi would have taken at least 300 bahts along with 2 hours. If you are visiting as a backpacker, i highly recommend that you take this rail to leave from airport. If you are a family, count the cost. Each person will cost around 35 baht to reach the last station from Sukhumvit using ARL.

All the way to Bangkok for 35 bath.. This is the way to travel to Bangkok from the airport. Costs 35 bath per person and then you change to the subway for another 30 bath. Go to the station closest to your hotel and from there you don't have to pay more than 100 for a tuktuk. The scammers at the airport tried to offer us a taxi for 1400 bath. Go to the bottom floor at the airport and follow the signs to the trains.
Awesome. Want to get to the cbd area near MBK and other shops - take this from the airport and you will not be disappointed at all.

Effective and Efficient, and yet Economical!. The ARL not only gives tourists an economical mode of transport to and fro Bangkok Suvarnabhumi Airport, it is a way to escape from the traffic congestion. Moreover, it does stop at connecting points that bring tourists to the usual shopping belts in Bangkok.
Nice journey . A new experience to travel in this train from elevated tracks over viewing nice views Bangkok and a great relief to travel to airport without struck in traffic

Airport rail link. I would recommend taking the Airport Rail Link as its fast, convenient and cheaper than taking a taxi to the airport. It costs Baht 45 per adult and the entire journey takes about 45 mins

Around 30 minutes from airport to final stop in the city of Bangkok. Perfect and cheap way to arrive in the city centre. From there , you can then take the Sky Train, even if I would not recommend it if you have heavy luggages with you, as most of the stop don't have elevator or escalator. Better the taxi.

cheap and easy transportation to airport. it has 2 line, express line and city line. I usually take the city line, its cheaper, only 45 bath from Suvarnabhumi Aiport to Phaya Tai. Sometimes its always full but this is the best public transportation from airport to city, or from the city to airport
Fast. Fast and regular and cheap way to get to downtown Bangkok. About $1 usd. Tickets are available at the platform machines.
Fastest mode of Communication. Its the best mode of transportation from and to Airport in Bangkok. It will take only 30 minutes from town to reach Suvarnabhumi Airport

A great way to travel.... Once you know how busy Bangkok can get at certain times, you'll be more than happy to use such a train without the usual rush hour and all day long traffic problems. Riding on a motorbike can be extremely dangerous.
Finally, it's cheap and a very good way to get from point A to point B.
Great value. Used the airport rail link and BTS both ways from the airport to our hotel Anantara Siam found service very easy to use clean fast and very economical

Much better than a taxi!. When we arrived at the airport on a Friday afternoon, we were told that with the traffic, a taxi would take at least 1.5 hours to get into the cities, and would cost us accordingly. So instead, we chose to travel by public transport. Unfortunately, the rail link uses a different ticketing system from the MRT (which is different again from the skytrain), but it's easy to buy a ticket from the ticket machines, with 20, 50 or 100 baht notes (the ticket is between 30 and 40 baht). You'll get a token to use at the barriers. The train's come regularly, and announcements are in English as well as Thai. Altogether (with airport rail and mrt), the trip to Silom took about 45 minutes - definitely better than by taxi!

Useful Link. The link is easy to reach from other public transport; the express link is not in use as I write but the 'non-express' train is equally as efficient - just takes a little longer. The link arrives in the airport and it is 6 floors up to reach departures - just know thisif you have suitcases to carry.
Fast way to reach airport. I used the service many times. Because from BKK to Airport, it takes about 30 minutes. The price is still cheaper than other large cities in Asia.

Great transport. great transportation that serves the city well, clean and air conditioned car , price , really to use Bangkok as there is lots of traffic on the roads and a big waste of time in the car .
Great Ride. We used the airport link and BTS to get to our hotel in Krung thonburi. It's very tourist friendly, clean and cheap. A must try to every tourist.

Perfect way to get into the city. The rail link from the airport is by far the best way to get into town. Road traffic can be hectic at times so avoid it by taking the airport link. It is cheap, fast and airconditioned. Tickets are easily purchased and there are clear maps in the carriages.

avoid the traffic. This is a great service, a cheap and quick way to get from the airport to the city, the airport rail link has connecting stations with both the MRT and BTS, so you can access a lot of the city easily while avoiding the traffic snarls

Fast and easy train from airport to centre. Airport Rail Link is easy and very affordable way to travel from Bangkok airport to the city. The train is very convenient and easy to find. Train was very full, which made it a little bit uncomfortable sometimes since we had luggages with us. Still, with this price there isn't too much to complain about. Would definitely use again!

save money and faster. It will bring you quickly and safely..... ☺ very reasonable prices buying a token is easy and hassle, best way to beat the traffic and get to or from airport,we stayed at nasa vaga hotel airport rail link more close to the hotel and very easy to travel with our bags, it was really good and save our money, it is great service,

Great transportation. Great way to get to town no questions, the a/c felt great and it's super cheap, now a word of caution, if you're getting off at Phaya Thai be careful, people will approach you with seemingly good intentions and will appear that they are just starting a casual conversation but they work for the travel agencies and will find a way to send you to one of their offices with the guise of "tourist information", its a scam that involves a person in phaya thai station that will be " helpfull and send you to a bus station or taxi to the centre, once there someone else will approach you with more good intentions and they will send you to a tourist information point. Then they will sell you a trip, the point is that what they will sell you will be more expensive than one planned by yourself. Just a heads up. Safe trip

nice. i really like the airport rail link the bts and all mostly because the staff at the stations was really really kind. everything seemed to be in great order and people were really friendly and helpful.

Fast, fast, fast! And inexpensive!. When we arrived in Thailand, we took a taxi to our hotel. When we left, we used the rail link. MUCH cheaper (I think less than 50 cents per person), and faster. Win/win!!
Best way to the City. If younstay in Bankok City, take the Link! Forget slowly and expensive Taxi! Airport basement. Very clean, good AirCon and quickly!

easy and cost-effective. Easy and cost-effective way how to get from and to the airport. You can either swap to metro or to BTS Skytrain if needed. Better than any taxi or tuk-tuk. Always consider the massive traffic you have in Bangkok. Being new to the city we took a cab only once for a distance of 2 kilometers. It took us more than 30 minutes to get to our destination. Always travel with Rail Link, BTS Skytrain or Metro.

A great way to get to the City!. We used the Airport Rail Link to get back to Bangkok Suvarnabhumi Airport, Its very easy to get to from around the City either get on at Phaya Thai or Makkasan depending where your staying in Bangkok. It will cost around 40 baht for a trip to the Airport which takes around 30-45 minutes. We only wished we had known about it when we arrived into Bangkok as it took 2 hours in a taxi! Plus its very easy to find in Suvarnabhumi Airport as its well sign posted!
Downtown faster and cheaper than taxi. Great service. It takes you downtown Bangkok in 30 minutes (taxi can be more than 1 hour during busy hours) spending 30thb. Amazing!

saves my life. before the Airport Rail Link , i was subjected to long lines and high fares at the airport . Well, not any longer !!!! it's fast and very reasonable with great AIR CON and gets you to the BTS in about 45 min. it runs from 6am to 12 pm , so don't miss it ....peace johnny o

Painful. This was being built in 2006 finally started operation 2016. I used it this month as though yes finally an easy way in to town with no traffic I did not expect getting on the train to be a major operation waiting for one to come not regular Then many many stops later we reached end of line to change to BTS which is a lot better The hassle with suite cases just not good unless you have a very small one and don't mind the stop stop stop stop and stop Don't do it with lots of luggage

For me : NO NEED OF A TAXI for the airport !!. In the airport, you just will have to go to the lowest level to get access to the trains !For 40 Bath (in average) it will bring you QUICKLY and safely in about 35 Minutes to a lot of different points in town from where you than will be able to hop on a public bus to bring you where ever you need to go in town.Including this bus transfer, your highly probably even still quicker than catching a taxi at the airport.The trains self are clean and air conditioned.You ask me : No alternative to it from and to the airport !A big, big plus for it !

The best way to get to the city. Quick and convenient way to get from the airport to the city. Air conditioning in the train works exactly as it should - the temperature is optimal. Very reasonable price. Buying a token is easy and hassle free.

Airport Shuttle Train. Inexpensive and efficientYou will in the Bangkok BTS system within 45 minutes.If you have 2 bags or less and get good directions to where you are going.This is a cost effective alternative.
Take the train !. Taking the train is definitely the best way to get into Bangkok, it's cheap at 45 baht each plus it's clean & quick. When you arrive just take a Taxi to your hotel.
Most quick and efficient way to ride from or to Airport. Best way to avoid traffic to move between terminals and main locations in the city. Cheap, reliable and fast.

Best way to get to the airport. For just 40 bath you can get to the airport from pratunam in just 20 minutes..Most convenient way to get to the airport. Although we had 4 bags of luggage we were able to manage. the staff is extremely helpful..

Easy Airport Transfer. Quick, easy and cheap way to get to and from the airport with no hassles. Trains are very clean and ride is very smooth plus the air conditioning is refreshing in the heat. Best way to beat the traffic and get to or from the airport

convenient, time and money savings. Best transportation in BKK. I use Airport link from work(suvarnabhumi) to home(Phraram 9). Train leaves from each station every 10-12 minutes. It's convenient and hassle on traffics etc
Why can't we have such efficiency in USA. How easy it is to get from a main airport to the center of a vast metropolis like Bangkok. Clean, efficient, roomy and worth the money

It is the best way to get to the airport. Took less than 40 minutes from the Asia Hotel to the international airport at 7 pm on a Monday. Price is fantastic: 60 bt total. I did not have to stand once on the Airport Rail Link; did have to stand on the Sky Train portion. It is safe, fast and air conditioned. I believe it runs until midnight, but the sign at the Sky Train says it runs until 11 pm.
Clean, efficient, cheap!. Loved it!! Super easy to get to the airport and much cheaper than a taxi. Spotlessly clean, good aircon, easy to navigate.

quick, cheap,and no traffic chaos...... Excellent transport system, ideal way to get "backpackers" into BKK center,and/or Khow San Road Area........I use this every time on my visits to Thailand....(taxi is very expensive, and can be a rip off(if you get the wrong driver)......cost from airport, think was about 40 baht,(you get a token), get off at " Phaya Thai " Station, down to street level, get a " tuk tuk"......not a taxi, unless your sharing with 3 others,,,,,,tuktuk costs vary, approx 200 baht +tip........to Khow San Road.......runs early to late......

Most convenient way to get from airport to Bangkok city!. Suvarnabhumi Airport can be some distance from Bangkok so to beat the always unpredictable traffic, the airport rail is probably the best bet. It is affordable and easy and can be found at the basement of the airport. You will be in the city in under 1 hour and can either take a city at the terminal station or link up with the BTS service to get to the other locations in downtown Bangkok. Clean, affordable and hassle free in my opinion!

Cheap and fast way to get into town. The Sky Train will take you direct from airport to a few central locations in town.possibly worth even taking it to town and then continuing with a cab to our destination. ride to town is ~40b.

Nice mode of transportation. The Airport Rail Link is good service. Frequency of running is good. They are clean. It is better to take this service than hire a taxi while visiting the main business areas, it saves time.

convieniant. A cheap and easy way to get to the airport and to avoid the Bangkok traffic. The train is air conditioned but can sometimes be very crowded but the trip is short and you will be in the airport in before you know it.

best way to enter bangkok from airport. The best and cheapiest way to enter bangkok ,good connection to center and fast and easy ,aircon on board and I have always a seat ,takes around 45 minutes to citycenter and 45 baht

best way to travel from the airport. I highly recommend using the Airport Rail Link. It's located in the lower level of the terminal, you could purchase the card or tokens from the machine. As long as you know where your hotel is located (you can find out at the Information stand at the airport), it is a very good way to get to the city. Just remember, it originates at the airport so the cars are empty but they get very crowded, try to stay close to the doors for an easy exit.
Fast and cheap. I used it one time and it was cheap, convenient and fast then the other transportations since I had a big luggage and coming from Phuket to Khaosan Road.

Best way into Bangkok . No traffic, no hassle. 45 baht and you are going into Bangkok like a local. If you don't have much luggage it's a breeze to take and connect to the MRT or the BTS.
If you have a lot of luggage, take a taxi or uber.

No worth to ride. If you are alone and have only backpack, it's ok to ride. You are 2 or more, have suit caese, I don't recommend because taxi cost not much different fro 2 person train charge.You can reach to your hotel easily without carrying big suit case. From the air port to down town main station you can reach fast.But you have to transfer or pick taxi up. You Have to move with big suit case.

Very convenient and cheap. The Cheapest and fastest mode of transport between downtown Bangkok and the Suvarnabhumi International Airport. THB 45 for 30 mins ride with 6 stops either way. The express route of THB 150 which covered the same distance in 15 mins has been suspended indefinitely when i visited in April 2016.Comparisions ( other modes between Suvarnabhumi International Airport and Downtown Bangkok) :Uber :THB 575 to 600Grab Taxi : THB 500 to 600Normal Taxi : THB 400 to 500Buses and minivans : THB 100 to 200If you are landing or flying out of Bangkok via Suvarnabhumi airport during its operating hours ( Morning 6 AM to Midnight 12 ) then it is the best and cheapest and fastest wayStarts at Paya Thai BTS and ends at Suvarnabhumi International airport

Airport Rail Link. This is I think, an underrated service. Connecting Suvarnabhumi airport to Sukhumvit station...which then connects to the Other Skytrain lines and also the MRT lines.Super service, and a change of scenery from the usual skytrain lines travelled.Cheap and clean, fast travel. Better to the airport, than a taxi in peak hours.
good service and friendly staff. Its very fast and simple to reach airport in short time.If you try is very convenient for all as well.

Quick and Convenient . Most fastest and convenient way to get to the city or Sukhumvit. Cheaper than a taxi. It's convenient for solo travelers and travels with Carry on bags. Could get little hectic for travelers with luggage but lot of people manage to get to their destinations with big bulky luggage. If you are group of 4 or family or has many suitcases... Might as well take a taxi. It will me much cheaper and convenient.

Good and easy access to the airport.. This train gives you very easy access to main airport. Journey takes approximately 45 minutes. The only advise I would give is to make sure that going to the airport, you will board the train at the first station as it tends to be quite busy.
Cheap, fast, comfortable.. Very easy, cheap and quick access from/to Bangkok and Savurnabhum airport. Well conditionet wagons with toilet.

Cheap and convenient. The Thai government made the right decision to build this infrastructure. Simple, economical, no frill mass trains network that link Suvarnabhumi Airport to the city. Great for travellers that are fed up worrying with taxi drivers that will charge exorbitant fares instead of the meter. The only complain I have is; the train can get very crowded during peak hours because this network is used by the city population for daily transportation. Otherwise, I will give this a thumb up.!!

Cheaper alone and no time constraints. Usually I take the taxi to go to Suvarnabhumi airport, but if you are tight in time or short in budget this is a very good option.The connection at Makkasan station with MRT Petchaburi station is a bit long and without air conditioning.You arrive directly in the terminal, so you do not have to walk too long with your luggage.There is no express.
Better then taxi . I used it first time this month, prior to this I always took a taxi. The train was 60 baht per person and takes you to the city center in less then 30 minutes.

Fast and cheap. Excellent access from the airport and very cheap (45-50 THB). The best choice to go to downtown Bangkok and avoid traffic chaos. Approximately takes about 45-50 minutes to the last stop (Paya Thai).
Nice option Rail Link for City. This is a good option to travel fast to most of city center of Bangkok and its convenient with connections to MRT and BTS.

Cheapest way to reach the city. The airport link is good and cheaper way to reach the city of Bangkok. But if you have plenty of luggage isn't the best way to go. Taxi is a bit more expensive and is your best bet to goThe airport link is on B level take the elevator from arrival terminal, the line choice is depend of where you want to go, you can connect afterwards to metro or skytrain

Very convenient . The fare is cheap and very convenient. It links to many BTS stations. But you are carrying heavy big luggages, please take taxi. There is no lift or escalator in most of BTS stations in Bangkok. You have to carry you heavy luggage down or up using staircase.

Best, cleanest, coolest and convenient way to travel from airport in Bankok. Whilst this mode of travelling is much cheaper than a taxi into the centre of Bankgok which is great it is also a much better way to travel. It is very clean, the air conditioning is amazing and it runs often. I have never waited more than 5 minutes for a train.It's only downside is it is very crowded so if you have a lot of luggage be prepared to squish in. Even with this downside still better than a taxi!

Fast, inexpensive and safe. We took the airport express train to Phaya Thai, where we caught the BTS to our hotel. The 2 trains are separate and you have to pay separately as well. It was fast, clean, safe and inexpensive. Much better than sitting in traffic! I believe it cost us about $5 per person vs. $35-$40 for a cab.
Rapide et pas cher. Airport to central bkk en 30 minutes. Coach very clean and central station quite clean as well. Take it instead of taxi. You will avoid traffic jam

Easy, quick and cheap. Will always travel this way when visiting bangkok. Staff were so helpful as this was our first time. I originally thought to take to the shuttle bus but having spoken to a few locals they recommended that we did the rail link and am very thankful for their input. You get to see some views on the way and towards every stop you are given information of a change so you know where to get off if you need too.
Best way to reach your destination . Very fast and a good mode of transport at a very affordable rate. Highly recommend if you a light traveller. Better to collect a map from the airport itself.

fast way into the city. This is the fastest (above taxi) way into the city. On top it is cheap (45 THB pp = 1.14 EUR in Apr 2016).
Go to the last station from there you can change to the BTS network.
Highly recommended. Very very convenient, easy access and you can just book it on your own. cheaper option than your taxi services.
Ontime & Clean. Bangkok is a good city for all traveller, one reason is airport link. unfortunately no air conditioner or fan inside the station. in the summer as it is now very hot.
Best and fastest. I would recommend this as this is the best and the fastest way to get to the city. We travelled as a couple and it was so easy and cheap.
8 Nights in Bangkok and More Nights in the Future. It's clean and very inexpensive. Ticket machines have English translations. And a great way to travel around Bangkok proper.

Just what a traveller needs. Great system that takes you into the heart of Bangkok quickly, efficiently and at low cost ( THB45 ).Also connects to other railways at different stops.We took the link to Phaya Thai station. Could have hopped onto the BTS there if we needed to transit somewhere else but out hotel was a short (1.2 km) walk around the corner.The carriages allow plenty of space for travelers with luggage and are easy to get in an out of. The trains run very regularly.Would recommend for anyone whose hotel is close to a rail line.
best and cheapest way to go down town. if you arrive in bkk, then this is the best and fastet way to go downtown, takes you about 20 minutes until you reach the subway or the BTS

A welcome convenience into Bangkok. Having moved from Thailand after seven years living there, I still must make bi-monthly trips for business in Bangkok. The Airport Rail Link is the perfect transportation to and from Suvarnabumi International Airport the heart of Bangkok whether for short or long jumps. Gone are the hassles with taxi fraud, shuttle bus confusion, and the minions with signs looking for a name. The ARL cuts the 25 km ride into town down to a swift 15 minutes to my regular destination at Nasa Vegas and off to wherever I want to go in town. Within minutes of clearing Immigration I am checked in and ready for the exciting sights, sounds, and senses of Thailand's glitter town. The descent into the train station is quick. The space allowed for baggage on the train is ample. The cost to get into Bangkok is unbelievably cheap.What makes the ride even more enjoyable is the incredible 30 baht (less than 1$ USD) fare. Exiting at Ramkhamhang station I can use the overhead walkway directly to Nasa Vegas or any of the convenient stations where hotels abound. Rather than a harrowing or anxious 200-300 baht taxi ride (if I am lucky enough to get an honest taxi driver) I can sit back and enjoy the short ride while watching the serene tropical landscape quickly pass by. Even if there is a crowd and I don't have a seat (which has happened to me only once) the short ride after the flight is worth the benefits of taking ARL.My May trip is in two weeks and I am looking forward to, once again, enjoy the cost and convenience of moving quickly through the distance between the International Airport and the City of Bangkok.
Timely and easy. The train runs from 6am to midnight. You can connect to other train stations. It is 45 baht (as of April 2016). A great alternative to taxi or bus.
quick and easy. quick and easy. another good optional transportation. but maybe delay if you did't go in prime time.
Nifty. Honestly try to use this rather than struggling with taxi drivers if you can but watch out with times and schedules!

Easy to way to travel. use the rail link without getting airport transfer if you are not traveling with kids. check where the airport link goes and book a hotel where you can walk to the hotel getting down from the rail link. its so easy and cheap

Great way to station if you have no bags. This is a very easy way to get right into/out of the airport terminal. However as you need to connect over a footbridge in town at the metro exchange it really serves travellers with little or no luggage.
It is incredibly cheap!! it cost me less than £2 one way
Cheaper to travel by taxi. Not that great and no cheaper than using a taxi especially if there are more than 2 of you. Plus you need to walk at the other end still.

Best way to connect to the airport. If you need to connect from Bangkok to the international airport, the Rail Link is the best way to do it.Despite a good availability of taxis and cheap taxi fares, traffic can be a challenge sometimes.The Rail Link is a convenient, stress-free high-frequency way connecting the city with the airport. Tickets are very cheap, too. The link ends near the city center and connects with other lines of the city public transport system which makes getting to your final destination easy.

It's convenient.. Somehow it's convenient especially if you are travelling solo or there's just two of you. The fare is reasonable, airport to phaya thai bts station is just 45thb compared to a taxi fare that might cost you 200-300thb. It was not that crowded when I tried it maybe because it was songkran week. well, let me check how it operates on normal working days.
WHY WASTE YOUR TIME ON THE STREET. Seems to be the best way to get off from the airport to downtown of Bangkok and to connect to either BTS and MRT. Reasonable price and fastest way.

Reasonable and time saving to travel Airport. The cost of travel doesnt save much while traveling to the Suvarnabhumi Airport, but one would surely opt when running on a specific time schedule. This is because of the unreliable possibility of Bangkok traffic, especially when one travels for Friday evening flights.

Sky trains in Bangkok and surrounding area. Excellent, excellent and the only way to efficiently get around without spending hours in traffic. Only problem is that it does not run late night, early morning, Definitely 5 stars except for this

good but..... If you have no luggage then it is very convenient as you can avoid the trafic jam.If you have a lot of luggages avoid this one and stick to the taxi option.This airport link is fast but you must usually use another taxi to get to your final destination.
Cheap to get into BKK. Great to get into Bangkoks and the BTS, if going to Sukhumvit you need to get a taxi but a lot cheaper than from the airport

Best way to go to the airport. If you are already in bangkok, you know trafic is really heavy. So the train will make your travel to the city really smooth and happy, Remember the vigilance in the entrance will ask you to open a little the bags, just for a quick check, and you will need to walk, so try to carry your bags in confort way.Enjoy it.

Great transit from airport to city.. The Airport Rail Link is certainly the fastest and cheapest way of getting from the airport into Bangkok. Make sure you know the closest station to your destination as your fare will reflect where you get off. All train stations are service by Taxi's so you get straight off the train and into a cab for the last hop to your hotel.

Best way to connect with BTS skytrain. If you are heading to downtown area, touristic places or business area, this is how you want to connect from the airport. Is the best way to get to the BTS (that can take you to so many other places in the city). It has a few other stops but the last one is connected to Phaya Thai BTS station. Check exactly were you are going and which station is closer to your destination.
Airport Rail Link. Very convenient and cheap mode of transport for linking the airport and city, just need to change once for BTS or MRT.

Extremely convenient service, but needs more ticketing machines. The Airport Rail Link is a great way to get into central BKK, although the express service is currently suspended. Intersects at various points with the MRT, BTS, and state railway lines. It's cheap and efficient... unless the power (31/03/2016) goes out! Time to invest a little in the maintenance, Thailand!!!

First try . The line doesn't go right in to the city centre so for many travelers you will need to transit to another line. This involved lots of stairs and going outside in the heat with all the luggage... Not fun. But cheap and quick if you arrive in the morning or evening rush hours and want to avoid along sit in a taxi.
Best way how to get from the airport to the Bangkok city. It's quick, cheap, clean, good connection to metro and going into other parts of the Bangkok. Much better than taxi.

Cheap and easy way to and from BKK.. By far the cheapest and easiest way in to the city/to the airport. The airport link takes you directly from inside the airport to the middle of the city centre and vice versa. Because of the connection with the BTS and MRT routes it also makes getting to most destinations in Bangkok very simple.
Cheap, easy and efficient.. Dont spend 500tbh in a taxi, get the train for around 100tbh (depending where you are) it takes you right there, it has air con, its spaceous, no traffic, no hassle.

Good timings for an out of the city airport link.. Its good to have an airport link specially one thats close to avail from Siam, but for an airport as busy as Suvarnabhumi, this link should be upgraded to a 24X7 service.

Finished too early. Very convenient to reach the town from the airport which located in nowhere plus airport taxi are very good at taking advantage. This one is recommended as trustworthy! Only few problems that bothered me, it's stop too early which it's around midnight and secondly it takes long time to cath the next one.

Traveller. I used the service from Bangkok airport to Makkasan station a quick trip. It was I think only 35Baht about $1.30 Aus, it was easy access to Sukhumvit SOI 21 by a short walk on the overhead bridge.There was a money changer at the entrance to the Airport station that had great exchange rates much better then the Airport changers in the terminal
Quick and Cheap. The quickest and cheapest way to the airport if you have less luggage and no kids :D But clean and fast.

Cheaper way to and fro bangkok city. From Silom i took uber to phaya thai it just cost me almost 55 baht and the airport link at phaya thai to suvarnabhumi just cost me 40baht. Huge save from taking taxi.
Easy. Avoid the terrible traffic and take the train, only 35thb, easy, airconditioned and only 25 mins to town

Cheap travel to reach Phaya Thai . The airport rail link is the cheapest way to reach the main city and to switch to BTS Sky train to reach all locations of Bangkok . You are allowed to carry luggage on the train .
Fantastic. Highly recommend using this for of transport to get to and from the airport as well as around Bangkok. Very cheep and so easy to navigate. Very safe and clean.
