Easy to use. We used this mode of transport for the first time this year, rather than taxi, as we were arriving during rush hour which can double your time on the road. We found it very easy to use and half the price!

Easy breezy trip. Easy to get to, and the skylink has a very convenient ticketing system. Cab drivers are very familiar with the stations, but it helps to keep a map with the station name in Thai handy.

Fastest Way To The Airport During Peak Hour.. Apart from the 15 minute intervals between trains, this service is a god send especially if you're rushing to get to the airport and the roads in the city are choked with traffic. Select from Makkasan or Phaya Thai station within the city limits. Makkasan can be accessed via a connecting bridge from Petchaburi MRT and Phaya Thai is accessible from the BTS line towards Mochit. At 45 baht per person per trip, you stand to save quite a bit on transportation especially if you're travelling alone. A normal taxi ride into the city is around 250 baht or more.

Only 45 baht to the city. Last time I was in Bangkok (20 years ago) the traffic was a snarled mess always and you never knew if you would make your flight or not with all of the delays. Now you can travel from the airport to the city centre quickly and safely for only 45 baht. Forget the taxi and take the airport rail link! Easy to buy tickets via the ticket machines.
Awesome rail system. This is the best way to get from the airport to downtown. Cost about $4 Canadian dollars per person.Clean, efficient and great signage to find it in the airport.

Good if you have no baggage. It is cheap and fast, that is true. The point is the time you are going to use it and the principal thing - if you have couple of bags with you or even one. In last case I wouldn't recommend it as it is very crowded and it might be really challenging trip.

Not convenient if you have a lot of bags. This is a good transit system for locals from that area heading to downtown and vice-versa and it is good for tourists that want to get downtown or to the airport if you are travelling fairly light or at non-peak times. However, if you want to connect to the BTS you can only do it at Phaya Thai station. If you have a lot of bags it is a bit of a jaunt to the BTS platform otherwise it is no problem. Then if you want to go to Silom you have to change trains at Siam. The only problem with this system is if you have a lot of bags and you hit the BTS at peak times (mornings and afternoon rush hours M-F) then you won't get on the train and Siam itself is chaos...and if you do, you will block everyone from getting off. If you have a lot of bags, take a taxi but if you are travelling light...this is the best and cheapest way to go and you should be riding the rails every time.
Great link. Great way to get into the city and very cheap and so clean. Found it very easy to use been using it for years .and it's so much better than we have in the uk
Fast and on time. It took me 20 minutes from Sukhumvit to Suwanaphoom Airport.Worked half day but still on time for the flight at 3.00pm.Great

EASY AS ABC. A great way to reach your flights/ Bkk whilst saving money.Whereas it could cost you dearly if you use a taxi or tuk tuk which are highly dangerous ,irritating and exorbitant- this is so easy.Just get on it or inter change from another. Makasan is a good place to i/change.But a wee bit of english could make BKK greater...just a thought King... just a thought...Thank you Bkk.

Your Way to Bangkok from Airport. It's easy to get into Bangkok city by this Airport link,Just keep walking to underground of Suvarnaphumi airport, Getting the tickets for train.You will be in Bangkok at your hotel within 35-40minutes.MikeBangkok, Thailand

Airport transportation. If you visit to thailand , and you haven't rent a car or arrange pick up service from the air port , you can using this public transportation (Rail Link) from the airport to your destination , staff or rail link can speak english language and very helpful to give us information
Perfect. The best way to go between the airport and the city. It is fast and clean. Like all public trains in Bangkok, it is easily accessible, modern and well maintained.

Quick, clean. The easiest way to get from airport to town. Quick clean, it can get quite busy however. I hugely rate Bangkok's public transport, namely the trains. It's new, fresh, well maintained, easy to use, well policed. Plus the people who use it are polite and quiet.

Very good value for money. Really cheap transport - added bonus was the air conditioning.I didn't find things clearly enough labelled for tourists - most staff were VERY helpful apart from the person in the airport who was giving us our tickets... I wanted to find out how to get to my destination and she was obviously annoyed by my stupidity of not knowing. The helpfullness of all other staff more than made up for it.
Excellent!. We used the train to come into the city when we arrived at BKK airport. It was really clean and useful! It wasn't expensive either.

Good but not directly connected to City Center. The link is fast, clean and cheap. However, most of the hotels are near Nana, Chitlom and Siam Area. You might need to change 3 trains from Airport to your destination. If you a number of bags it would become a problem since there are no lifts in the BTS stations.

Best mode of travel from the airport to Bangkok city.. The airport rail link is very easy to use. Buy your ticket apon arrival and travel into Bangkok City can not be easier. Much quicker and cheaper than a taxi.
One of the good things about bkk. Used a few times, its cheap and quite good, connects to bts so no hassles really, there can be some walking involved
Convenient way to and from airport. It only took 30-45mins to our hotel destination around Siam area. A way to avoid the heavy traffic jam over there
best means of transport..!!. Best means of transport to avoid heavy traffic and reach the epicentre at a cost effective and to save time.

Easy to find and use. Easy to find and use and very cheap. Only problem we found was getting off to find connecting bus service...we ended up having to get a taxi as we could not find it. Comfortable enough with air con. Very busy but that's what you would expect as it was a weekend when we arrived.

Airport Rail Link to get to my hotel "The Mandarin" on Rama IV. I used the Airport Rail Link to get to my hotel near Lumphini Park. I didn't want to pay the taxi fare. I found the system understandable and well-mapped. They accept only Thai Bhat so get to an ATM in the airport before you attempt to buy a ticket. I found people very helpful in giving directions to a first-time user. Having my luggage was a bit of a strain on a crowded railcar but seeing Thai people in their daily activities was worth the extra effort. I did need to grab a cab after I exited at my station but it was a short ride (60 Bhat) (about $2 USD).

Fast link to central Bangkok. Cheap and fast link to central Bankok where you can link to the Skytrain. Not ideal if you have lots of baggage or kids but otherwise great for travel to and from the airport
Used it once only. We used it once only a few years back. Taxi is so convenient in bangkok. We did not bother using that again.

Convenient, but express trains cancelled. The Airport Rail Link was definitely cheaper than a taxi or hotel shuttle, and was only slightly less convenient. But I was disappointed that the express trains were cancelled, so the trip took about 15-20 minutes longer than otherwise. I took the Airport train to Phaya Thai station and then took the BST to my hotel.
Easy. very easy way to get into the city - its a long journey so try and get a seat if you can. It is also very cheap 45 Baht

Reliable and fast. I should have known about this train earlier. When there was a traffic chaos in the city and my friend and me needed to get to the airport quickly, we found out about this train. And, once we got to the station we were at the airport quickly. However, it would be nice if there were a station of this line at Khao San Road as well, because to get there a taxi ride (or a very long walk) cannot be avoided.

Easy to get downtown to Sukhumvit . Follow the signs and take the escalators down to the basement and keep going till you get to the ticket machines. It was 45 baht I believe and 30 min to Phaya Thai where I transfer to the green line.The machines have English so easy to understand. Take the train to Makkasan or Phaya Thai which is end of the line. I did the latter cause I heard it's easier to transfer with your luggage. It's still a track even with a carry on and a small duffle especially since it feels like 109 degrees. At Phaya Thai you will have to buy a token to get on the next train around 25 baht. It's good to have small bills . The Asoke stop is tight next to the Westin, Sheraton and Sofitel which I stayed. If I had small children, a whiny gf or wife and lots of luggage I might consider a taxi. With so much traffic though in the city though, you might still be upset sitting in s cab for 1-2 hrs. On return I took a cab for 400 baht but it was 5:30am and 30 min ride with no traffic.
Airport Train. Great, cheap way to get near the city center and other bus terminals. A little hard to find on out first visit to Bangkok. Go all the way to the lowest floor in the airport.
Best way to get in/our airport!. Cheap, realiable, fast. Everytime in Bangkok, this is my way to move in/our Airpoirt. It also connects to BTS and MRT, so you can almost get anywhere in the city!

Cheap and fast. If you want to avoid the crazy driving of Bangkok taxi drivers and traffic jams, the airport express is the way to go. You can then either get a taxi to your final destination or transfer to the MRT underground train.

thailand. Vry clean and fast from teh airport to the city centre but you have to carry your cases along way and there is no where to get a taxi when you get to the city.. Travel light or have a rucksack..

Waste of time. This service is ridiculous at best. Poor poor service, incredibly inaccessible and kind of hit and miss when trains will turn-up. How the Malaysian system KLIA to KL can work so well and our system be such a failure (after a promising first few years) I don't knoe
Bang On. Don't bother wasting money on cabs to reach airport! Airport link is connected to BTS as well and is very spacious for you and your group along with luggage to take you to the airport

Efficient. For cheaper and efficient transport from airport to the city. This is the best way. Though it get crowded during rush hour, but it is still organize, clean, and efficient.It interconnects with the MRT and BTS Skytrain, and from there you can change station.Unless you have a big or a lot of baggage, It is a better choice than taxi, bus and limousine.

A shame in public transport / Closing for Repairs. The rail link is falling apart and will be closing because things need to be fixed to run the rail link safe & someone forgot to order parts for train breaks etc. In addition poor planning when it was built because you can't link with the sky train BTS or MRT, you arrive at a building that is not attached to other forms of public transportation.
You might not get a seat.... If you like trains and public transport, this is a fun ride. But it is very crowded, so be prepared to stand for the half-hour trip.
Worth using to get to the airport. I have tried this one last year and provided you don't have too much luggage, it is a quick and easy way to get to the airport at a reasonable cost

great transport. This transport system is remarkably well marked, easy to use, clean, and efficient. The lines and stations are printed on your ticket as well as displayed on both TV screens and a light display in every train, as well as being announced in both English and Thai, and stations are chronologically numbered.

Excellent public transport!. from different countries I have visited, I find the public tranport in Bangkok is one of the best, especially the MTR service and the airport link. Best economical way to travel to the Swarnabhoomi airport. Though we changed 2 lines from MBK mall with small luggage, still the travel was hassle free.

Easy, sensible way in and out of BKK. You can take the most convenient and less demanding route - i.e. the very helpful Airport Taxi system or you can just go by train. The train doesn't get stuck in any traffic jams and is both clean and fast. It's the winner for me!

No express line. I just a arrived two days ago and when I went to buy a ticket for the express line I was told that it has been cancelled. Through the language barrier I'm not sure of this was temporary or permanent. Don't worry though! If you're trying to get into the heart of Bangkok, take the city line from the airport all the way to its final stop. From there you can join the Sukhumvit line. To get to the interchange station (Siam Station) where the Sukhumvit and Solim BTS (Sky Train) lines meet, buy your ticket and proceed to the Bearing track. Siam will be the second stop. From there you can get on the Silom line if you need.

Much better then taxi service. Travel from airport to Makkasan station is fairly hassle free and less costly compared to regular taxi service. This station has escalators and elevators to lower levels for local taxi service in air conditioned environment without having to hike over to the Petchaburi MRT station to make a connection. Returning this way is a bit of a problem because either the taxi is trying for a fare to the airport or because they don't know/believe about the access method. Pretty good chance to get a seat from the airport; but, a toss-up about getting a seat to the airport. System did have a power malfunction leading to a stalled train to the airport for about an hour which became a matter of management controversy in mid-March with improvements to follow??????

"Save time & money". It's very convenient between city and airport, easy access and short travel time, it's just 40 Baht to famous shopping center area from airport, it's very convenient cheap, to skip heavy traffic. I always use the airport rail link.

Best Way To Go To Airport Directly. Even though the frequency of the service is less,this is the best way to go to Suvarnabhoomi airport.Had to wait for 10 minutes for the train.There's a luggage rack to keep your luggage and it took just 20 minutes from ramkhamhaeng to airport.The price was just 25 bahts per person.The Coach was clean and was a bit crowded but I loved the service.
Very Handy. To or from airport no hassle cheap travel on a flat fare. Avoids all the traffic takes about 40 mins slow.

Saved us. Used this to get to downtown. Great option that we discovered off a billboard in baggage check. Google maps has all the lines and the stations, so remember to plan the right transfer points.
Easy, cheap and fast. This is easily the best way to avoid the terrible Bangkok traffic. It's easy, fast, cheap and has the all-important aircon!

Alone or with 2 people worth to save about 200 -300 Baht to a Taxi, if you have time and no big luggage 3-4-take a Taxi!. Alone or with 2 people worth to save about 200 -300 Baht to a Taxi, if you have time and no big luggage 3-4-take a Taxi! Time consuming 1 hour or more and long ways to walk too! If you more people 3-4 per Taxi, not worth the afford.

Easy public transport.. We travelled by airport link to Phraya Thai station. Then connect to BST for Nana station. About 80 baht. Easy to buy tickets and to make connections. Many stairs to carry bags up and down though at stations. More should use this.

Bangkok Airport link. An important improvement to be made is the frequency of the trains. Try to avoid to take the airport link in the rush hours. You will be packed as sardines and still you have a chance you will not be able to board the first train that arrives at the station.

Useful. Good service, and fast despite the express line being discontinued. The line is however quite a distance to get to with a heavy bag with no wheels as trolleys aren't allowed past a certain point. If your bag doesn't have wheels, the taxi services may be a faster and definitely will be the hassle free option that I would rather suggest.

smooth journey. i would use this if i was alone or with my partner. if more than two people than a taxi is the cheaper option to get to the airport. if you like to be in control of your time, be assured that the train is regular and punctual and you dont have to deal with the uncertainities of bangkok traffic
Quiet, quick, best way to travel!. Quiet, quick, and so efficient. If traveling from the airport, take the airport rail link! Suggested way to travel

Easy to use. Follow the signs from the airport. The ticket machines, 45 baht, are at the bottom of the slope. The express wasn't running when we used it, but the other stopping line was, and it was fine. Good service. Beware at the end of the line - after descending via escalator we were faced with a big flight of stairs to get our bags down and a lack of taxis. We flagged one down, but you must get them to use a meter and not set a price as it is much cheaper. Sometimes they wont take you and drive off but lots of taxis pass by. Unoccupied taxis display a little red light in their front window.
Quick and easy. Regular service, clean and tidy trains and very cheap fare. This is the quickest way to travel to Bangkok airport, Hassle free.
Good transportation system. Easy to find the BTS stations, easy to find the right way, quick & reliable transportation system, saving time from/to airport

Brilliant. Would not go any other way , easy to use , cheap & not stuck in traffic in a taxi ... As a foreigner don't be afraid to use only downer usually the lifts don't work when you get off at your destination

Hassle Free. Just a few minutes walk within the airport you find the ARL. reached Pratunam at a quick pace, and the announcements are very clear so you can get ready when your desired stop is nearing. Would recommend all travelers to use the Airport Rail Link.
Useful. My other hotel was situated at Lat Krabang, so I took the Airport Rail Link most of the time. Fast and cold. Perfect!

Efficient Airport Link. Airport link is very efficient. We dropped at Phayathai and would take around 30 minutes from Suvharnabhumi Airport. This is ok to ride when going to the city but if you would be going back to the airport with lots and lots of baggage and shopping then just take a taxi/ van instead. Fare is just 45baht one way so this is really a cheap way to reach the city. Train station is just at the basement of the airport.

No Good!. The location of the airport link station is not convenience at all. Most of the time you will need to transit and not many options available. Too many people on the train and sometime it's difficult to get on.
Best way to get in. Super easy and cheap way to get to the city center. Also, the cleanliness, air conditioning, and timelin

Better than a taxi. If you're lucky enough to stay in a hotel nearby a station this is a thousand times cheaper and faster than a taxi. It can be crowded at peak times but twice as fast as a taxi, so if you're in a rush to make a flight, this is the way to go. I had only one bag and it was standing room only - it would not be a good option in rush hour if you have lots of bags - but otherwise there are plenty of luggage racks. Really helpful attendants everywhere to tell you how to get to and from your station. Don't lose the token. You need it on both ends of the station.
Cheap and efficient.. I was heading From airport to makkasan st. Bht32 for a single ride of seimens train. Much cheaper than hong Kong airport express.
Mbk. Place is good and many types of things are available branded shops and electronic products but i have noticed there is same quality products are available in different price in stalls

Quick and cheap way to reach the city from the Suvarnabhumi airport. There is no faster way to reach the city from Bangkok's main airport (those coming on budget airlines from Don Muang would need to take the A1 express bus for thb40 to Mo Chit BTS station or grab a taxi, there is a new train line that is under construction as of April 2016 so there will be another option later this year). Makkasan Station (near to Petchaburi MRT) only cost thb40 per person and the end of the line Phaya Thai Station is only thb45 (to connect with Phaya Thai BTS). Takes around 30 minutes to get to the end of the line and can get crowded with locals stopping at other stations along the way. Boarding from the airport will usually mean you can get a seat but those with a lot of luggage will struggle a bit. It is far cheaper than most other airport rail links in other cities.

Try this - Avoid taxi - Save money. A regular taxi will charge you around THB 1000 to get you to main city (any place). I strongly suggest to take this which will charge you around THB 40 only to get you to main city center. Then take BTS which might take some THB 20 to get you to any destination within the city.Very modern train. Comfortable, clean and fast.

Terrible crowd. There are a terrible crowd most of the day and we have to wait so long between each train.I wish they will sign any contract to add more train soon. This is the new essential transits of people now.
great. fast, secure, trains every 5 minutes. The easiest way to move around bangkok, i would love to have one of theses in my home

Cheap and easy, just don't fly out of town after midnight. This train stops running midnight to 6 am, making it a pain. If your flight is early in the morning, you're gonna end up taking the last train out at midnight and sleeping on a bench at the airport for a while. They need to run the thing 24 hours, even if only every 2 hours in the night. Otherwise, 45B to get to the airport smoothly and hassle from from the Phaya Thai BTS, is a no brainer

Best way to get to the city center Bangkok. I always use the ARL when I fly into Suvarnabhumi Airport. Go all the way to the bottom floor of the airport and buy a token for 35 baht. All trains head in the same direction, towards the city and Phaya Thai station. You have two options of connecting to the BTS sky train from the ARL. You can take it all the way down to Phaya Thai then walk about 5 mins up to the BTS Skytrain station, or you can get off the ARL at Makassan station, walk a few minutes to the Petchaburi MRT station, and from there go to the Sukumvit Station by MRT. Once you get off at Sukumvit station, you can walk up to the BTS skytrain station. Keep in mind you will have to walk up some short flights of stairs, so if you have a lot of luggage, or kids, you might want to just get a taxi from the airport for about 350-400 baht to the city center. Using the ARL, MRT, and BTS will cost around 60-80 baht to and from the airport depending on where you are headed in the city. It can also be much faster then taxi too, since traffic is horrible once you get into the city.
Best way to airport. If you have a little extra time you can save big money and avoid traffic sing this service. Its easy and cheap.

Use it whenever you can to Suvarnabhumi. Avoid taxi's to the Suvarnabhumi as they are costly (over 1000 Baht) and he ride takes 1,5-2 hours sometimes. This rail link takes than half an hour and is much cheaper. Of course getting to one of he stations can be hard, but there are various metro and Skytrain connection points.

Great clean, fast, cheap service . Super efficenct. Easy to use, felt very safe, was clean & a cheap way of getting to/from airport. First time using it was a doddle. If you have any queries there are attendants there to explain how to use ticket machines. Get your token, go through the gate, down to platform & get on next train. Switching to other train lines is easy too but if you have lots if luggage this could prove hard as not all have lifts, it was a work out with just a small suitcase but if you're not in a rush & can take a breather when needed, it's cool
Busy but cheap . Don't bother with ripoff taxis. Get the train into town its cheap but busy and takes 30 mins. Air conditioning on board and felt quite safe.

best way to avoid traffic. Fast and convenient transport from town to airport - avoiding traffic problems. Takes 45-60 minutes from town to airport. Allow 5 minutes to reach check in area from station.

Easy Access From Airport. This will take you to the city center cheaply and quickly (Bangkok traffic does not move) and there are decent hotels there. However, it will not take you too close to Khao San Road, if you book there. It may still be better to take it to the end (Phaya Thai) and then get an ubiquitous cab.

Efficient and fast. if you are arriving before midnight, try this to reach your hotel in the city. It's cheap, clean and fast. Just about 30mins and you will be in Pratunum, no more changing of train. Just a short walk and you will be in Central World, tuktuk is also available downstairs. Taxi is cheap, this is also an option.

A new asset for Bangkok. Spare a thought for the taxi drivers of Bangkok... But seriously, this new extension to the Skytrain network (although it is essentially a completely separate line) was the least of their worries. Successive coups seriously damaged the tourist industry putting many of them out of business. If you want a cheaper but less convenient ride into town then go for it, but for me I'll stick with a taxi. It's clean and has never been too crowded, but by its nature everyone has several huge bags with them, so prepare for some discomfort.
Crowded. Used it to the weekend market. Easy but crowded like in Tokyo? Still very quick and easy to interchange (between the two lines).

Fast, Efficient and Convenient. Traveling to and from the Airport can be done in just a couple of minutes sparing the commuters with the hassles of experiencing Bangkok traffic! The stations are very clean and organized to some extent . Though the coaches tend to be packed specially during peak hours its still the most convenient way of traveling from Bangkoks impressive gate way to the country.

Safe Travel. This is an affordable safe clean service that beats the traffic and very high cab fares. The train takes about an 30 mins whereas the cab takes over an hour. The drawbacks are that if you have lots of bags then you could have a problem. Secondly the stations in the city are few and your hotel might require you to have to taxi from the station to the hotel. Thirdly the stations only open 0545 making an early flight connection stressful as you would not like to miss the first train arriving at the airport about 30 to 40 mins later. Fourthly the trains are very fullduring peak hours.
Easy and convenient. It can cut travel time down substantively, even if you have walk a few yards after riding. Do it once, and guarantee you'll be back

Best way to get to the city. I'd say it is the most convenient, reliable, comfortable, safe and affordable way to connect between the airport and the city. It gets you straight to the centre where you can easily board a BTS or MRT train. I always use it when I visit this beautiful metropolis.
Very convenient. It is very convenient and reasonably priced , hassle free mode of transport from the airport to the city center.
Quick, efficient. One of the best ways to get from the airport to downtown, in relative comfort and at a low cost. Only runs during the day, so check the time before planning to use.

Convenient to the max. Easy to use and makes reaching town a much easier task to complete. With that in mind, you might also want to consider staying near the main stations that this Rail Line services.
Efficient and so much better from the ones we have at home!. We just paid B40 to get to the airport. Hassle free. Seats are comfortable even if you have a lot of baggage with you.

An Ease to use. The transport network is easy to use stress free, clean and cheap. Easy way to get around Bangkok . Word to note the network runs overhead there are quite a few steps to negotiate getting to the platforms. Lifts are there for disabled/elderly people.

Good to escape traffic. Took the airport rail with mom. If you have more than 1 luggage better not as you have to drag it around with many people on the track and difficult to switch train, but we managed.

Dam good connectivity. This is one of the best things in Bangkok which happened to me (Airport Rail Link). Its very cheep and easy to commute in Bangkok without having any traffic hassles.
Its also easy to understand the route for an outsider.

Easy to get to Airport. So easy to get to and from the Airport with their rail link. So easy to get to point A to point B and the tickets are so cheap. We had the transport system all worked out in no time at all.
Convenient. This is a cheap convenient and easy way to get from the airport to the centre of Bangkok...but you will probably have to stand, it gets VERY busy.
Efficient, Clean, Cheap. Only used this service once, however it was efficient, clean, safe and cheap. Would use again on next visit.
Fast and convenience. This is the core different between Survanaburmin Airport and Don Muaeng Airport.Fast, convenience and very suitable price.
great ride. has place for storing big luggage by door comfy seats a little audio dial so you can listen to radio in seats has a map that shows you were you are on the track and fast

Almost missed my flight. I'd been told the train starts running at 5AM. From the transfer station at the end of the line, it begins running at 6AM. Minor little detail that almost caused us to miss our flight. If traveling internationally from Bangkok, you really need the full two hours arrival before your flight. Because we'd been given bad info, we only had 90 minutes and just barely got through check in, security, and immigration in time to get to our gate.

Cheap, but Crowded. Frequent service with about 6 or 7 stops before you reach central Bangkok. While air conditioned, there are limited number of seats where you might end up standing for the 30 minute ride.Cost a very inexpensive 45 baht (Mar 2016). Connection to the subway (MTR) at Makassan requires a good 10 minute walk along walkways and escalators which in the heat can be uncomfortable. The connection at Phaya Thai to the Skytrain is more manageable. However, depending on your time of arrival and departure, taking the MTR or Skytrain will be extremely crowded, and not recommended. Taxis are plentiful however.

Good Rail link to City. Easy and comfort ride. Very Convenience. It cost only 45 baht per person to the city. Rail staffs are very helpful and there try to speak English which is easy for foreigners / tourists to understand. Good Job, Keep it Up!!
Quick to airport!. When you go to Suvarnabhumi-airpot, use this airport-link. Much quicker and cheeper than taxi, good connection from Skytrain

Quick, inexpensive, and reliable.. As an introduction to a city, the airport train link is a shining example of how tourists should be greeted and transported away from the airport. The cost is around $2 and has a few stops into the city. trolleys are few and far between for people carrying alot of luggage. Great service and safe.

Very Efficient. We have taken the airport rail link a number of times on trips to Bangkok. For 45 baht, roughly $1.50 US, you're taken to Phaya Thai on the BTS. From there, three stops on the BTS gets you to Siam and six stops to Asok, where you can connect with the MRT. You can pay a little less and get off two stations earlier to connect with the MRT, but it's a less convenient connection.I'd recommend it only with carry-on luggage, as you have to walk down a long stairway at each BTS station and heavy luggage is a pain. But, of course, once you're in BKK, you can get that pain massaged away!Good alternative to the taxi mafia if you use it right.

Victory Monument to the airport... Airport link for sure!. For all those moving between the airport and Victory Monument, you will not be disappointed taking the Airport Rail Link. Clean, inexpensive and regular... the easiest way travel between the airport and the city. And once in the city... it connects directly with the Bangkok Sky train.
lift. There is no lift. It will be user friendly to have escalator rather than just stairs. The frequency of the train should increase as the train is very crowded

Thumbs up !!. Best way to cone to the city from the airport. Helps to reach quickly and comfortably. Take this to avoid the Bangkok traffic and especially if your hotel is situated near a BTS station.
Ok beats the traffic. A great way to beat the horrendous Bangkok traffic.The only problem is the traffic to the Stations.A mix of metro then the Airport link is the quickest.
BTS to Airport link. The ARL links the Suvarnabhumi airport to the BTS Phaya Thai statuion. It is the best way to commute to and from the airport and the quickest as well.

Great Alternative when Rush Hour on the Highway. Perfect alternative if you want to skip the rush hour in bangkok which is normally between 7am-10am and 3-7pm. Also it is cheaper and quite easy to use. Just make sure you know the closest BTS Station to your Hotel

Cheap ticket with poor quality. Normally to go for Suwanaphubhumi airport with very cheap price and not encounter with traffic jam. I hove to see more frequently train round from airport direct to centre city. On the train I hear a lot of noise from railroad. while train moving. I have no idea why?

Fabulous way to get to the Suvranabhumi airport.. When planning accommodation in Bangkok, find some on the BTS Sukhumvit line along Sukhumvit road, then you can avoid all the taxi hassle. Comfortably from airport to hotel and back.

Easy transport to city centre with links to metro and BTS. Direct access to the rail link from the airport buildings and very inexpensive way to travel to the city. Links to BTS and metro systems within the city centre. Due to the traffic in Bangkok this is faster than using a taxi.

Efficient Transport Option. A very efficient option to get to the airport. The air conditioned cars provide a nice relief from the Bangkok heat. Just be sure to give yourself sufficient time to get to the airport and be aware that this train does not run 24 hours.
Always on time.. We always use the airport link when possiblw. It's cheap and always runs on time. Average price is approximately 40 baht each way.
Very convenient. Very convenient and affordable. Clean also. Connects you to the town and city area and also their bts. Highly recommended
A fast, cheap way to get to downtown Bangkok and back. For only 45 Baht you can get close to downtown Bangkok. A much better deal than the 500 Baht or more taxi ride!
This gets you from the airport to the downtown. You buy a ticket from a ticket machine, board the train and then alight at the correct station. You can change lines.

Very convenient . Exceptionally convenient, clean and easy ! The signage everywhere in English also made everything clear for us. Airport staff was very helpful too and assisted us when we had questions.

good transport link into Bangkok. The Airport link is a fast and cost effective way of getting into Bangkok, follow the signs to the lowest level at the airport (you can catch the lift or use the escalators) the cost for a single ticket is around 45bhat and takes 30 minutes to reach Phaya Thai (note there are six stops on the Airport Link) which is the last stop in the centre of Bangkok and is a short easy walk to the BTS (Skytrain) which can take you to many other parts of Bangkok. Check with your hotel to see which BTS station is the closet to the Hotel. This is cheaper and faster than a taxi and remember there are a lot of traffic jams in Bangkok.

A excellent choice to get to the City Center an Back to the Airport. I would highly recommend this form of transport to and from the airport, the train is on time, clean and easy to use. an it is a killer deal compared to a Taxi.

Dont need a TAXI anymore from Airport into City. The Airport-City link is in the ground floor at Suvunabhumi International Airport, unfortunately there is still no airport link to the old Don Muang Airport wich is the Domestic Airport for most Thailand based Airlines like AirAsia, Orchid, NokAir etc. Bangkok Airways is the only Airline serving Domestic and International Flights from Suvunabhumi, so always check which Airport is the correct one for your airline...:From Train in the International Airport into the City its just about a 20-30min ride, depends on the station you need to check out. Most hotels are around Sukhumvit and Silom, Backpackers still like the KhaoSan Area.....i never understood this :D :Take the train to PHAYA THAI Station and change there into BTS Sukhumvit line to BEARING, there is another option too but then you have to change trains twice and i am lazy, time is about the same, check attached mapIf your destination (Hotel) is at Silom Road, Take the Train from Airport also to PHAYA THAI Station, change to BTS to BEARING to but check out again after 2station at SIAM Interchange and take the BTS train to WONGWIAN YAI and check out after another two stations at SILOMYou can also check out at PHETCHABURI Station and use the blue MRT line but like i wrote, its the same time... Sounds more complicated as it is, its really easy... Do not make the mistake and think there are TAXIS at Phetchaburi Station...the TaxiMeter Taxis do not like to drive in there, its just not worth waiting there for them a driver told me last year

Efficient way to the airport. You can easily use the Rail Link. It connect with one of the BTS Skytrain.
To me, this is the cheapest and fastesr way from center to the airport and back.
The Rail Link is also very new, clean and fresh.
better no traffic. Bangkok is traffic jam city. if you were traffic jam time should take air port link. but the early morning time and late night time, also more 3 people, better take taxi.

Cheap, Fast and Comfortable. Airport Rail Link connects the Suvarnabhoomi Airport to Bangkok City Center (Phaya Thai). The entire journey takes just 30 minutes with six stops in between. It also offers two non-stop services directly to Makassan and Phaya Thai stations but these are apparently suspended for the time being.The trains are comfortable, air-conditioned and cheap with tickets starting at less than fifty cents and a ticket to the city center costing less than two dollars. It is connected to both the MRT and the BTS so travelers can carry their journey onward to other locations in Bangkok. Services are frequent and not too crowded and the link operates from six in the morning till midnight.The link a cheap and comfortable way to travel between the airport to the city and should definitely be used if you whether you are arriving or departing from Bangkok.

Efficient and Clean. . Not sure why this is listed as a tourist attraction but hey ho! Good efficient system linking from the airport directly into the city. Seems to be on time and clean too, it's better than the MRT system but I guess that's because it's used far less.

Good alternative to taxi . We used the rail link after we got out of the cab we were already in because the driver tried to rip us off and denied to use the meter. However depending on where you stay you will need to change to BTS at the terminal station.
Best and safest way to go to and from Airport. Clean, fast, reliable. Only use this when it is raining, it might save your live. Btw., cheape! No use to take fast train

Quick, efficient, convenient and punctual. Probably the speediest way to get from the Airport to the centre of Bangkok. The trains are frequent, clean and whilst they can get somewhat crowded at times, there always seems to be sufficient room for large suitcases.Very efficient air con carriages get you away from the heat and humidity for a while and unlike the roadways, there is no grid lock.The price is a fraction of a taxi hire and without doubt quicker.
Best way to city. No express service at this time owing to maintenance but still quite efficient. Clean and cheap.45 Baht from airport to Praya Thai in central Bangkok.
Fast. Easy to use, dodge all the "you need taxi?" bother, enjoy the air conditioning, don't risk getting an insane driver, avoid the traffic lights that stay red for nearly 5 minutes.
Best Value To and From the Airport. Convenient if you don't have large luggage. Some station elevators were out of service so some passengers had to carry their bags up/down the stairs.
Very convenient!. Bangkok Airport train is so effective to travelers and very convenient transport for tourist. Connection from BTS stations is a strategic ideas.
Should be good but broke down this week. This mode of transport should be good and safe but broke down this week and passengers left stranded for hours last Monday morning peak hour.

best way to get into bangkok from the airport. Why take a taxi and pay much more and be stuck in traffic when you can zip into Bangkok in a matter of minutes. The best and fastest way to get into the heart of Bangkok
Airport transfer. This mode of transport was equally as impressive as all of Bangkok's transport. Fast, cheap and clean! Really easy to use as well.

easy way to get to main airport from town. The trip takes about 30 mins from airport to town - BTS Rachthevi. Then you can connect to sky train easily.
You can choose non stop train or regular train and it's about 10 mins time different. The cost is not much different.

Best way to go and back to Suvornobhumi Airport from Bangkok city. Best way to go and back to Suvornobhumi Airport from Bangkok city. If you take taxi it will take more than 02 hours in heavy jam. But with Sky train need only 30 minutes.

Best way to get downtown, provided .... ... you travel "light" ...Using the ARL (Airport Rail Link) is great, as you avoid all traffic jams - that are common in Bangkok. Now - the walk from the terminal to the train station is not that short. And you would most likely have to connect with BTS (Skytrain) or MRT (Underground) to get to your hotel, what is another walk. Easy, as you can use elevators or escalators almost everywhere - but it is two walks that I do not recommend to do with heavy luggage. If your hotel is not next to ART/MRT/BTS I can not recommend using the ARL at all. You would need to hit the road - in best sense of the word -, call a taxi and get to your final destination. Overall connecting two times might still be the fastest connection from the airport downtown. But you might want to decide to take a taxi from the airport straight away. With heavy luggage it is worth while paying the additional money and relax while driving to the city.

easy and cheap. Airport Rail starts from Suvarnabhumi to Phaya Thai where you can connect to city rail (BTS). It take about 30 minutes and only 45 baht (City Line) while taxi could cost around 250-400 baht (depends on destination and traffic). Operating time is 6am-12am. **better stay away from the train door**
LOVE THIS!. Depending on traffic this service saves not only MONEY, but precious TIME. It does not run 24hrs, so be prepared to take a taxi if it's past or before operating hours.

Fast Way. Airport rail link is the easy and faster way to get to Suvarnabhumi Airport. They have express train and normal train. If you pay for express ticket this train will not stop, it will go all the way to airport.I took airport rail link most of the time. This is the best way when I am in hurry because there's no traffic.

forget about big luggage. maybe cheap and quick way of transportation, but they told us that our luggage (box with a bike) is two big to take to the train. first they told that bikes are not allowed .. so maybe it was about (packed!!) bike, not big luggage......

simply easy cheap and quick. easy train quick and cheap from svurnanmi airport clean acces
within 25 minutes in city center
can be busy
Quick and convenient. ARL provides very nice connection between the airport and the core of the Bangkok city. Fare is relative cheap also.
Cheap transpiration to the town. two time already visit bangkok, happy because easy the transpiration to reach town, hope to visit here again soon

Does what it says. So easy to use as a connection between the airport and central Bangkok. Staff were helpful and the ticketing system is an automatic machine with instructions in English (and other languages)

Quick Way To The City. We arrive around 3 pm and I knew traffic will be worst so we decided to just use the airport link to our hotel we have big luggage but we didnt had a problem at all. I highly recommend it if you want to get to the city quick. its cheap fast and efficient.

Best man of travel through the city of Angel for solo or couple traveler during rush hour.. Best man of travel through the City of Angel for solo or couple traveler during rush hour.
There are two current lines, one with high-speed, basically less stop than the other.
If you travel more than two, consider taxi could be a bargain.

Cheap but packed. It was nice to take the link to Makkasan and then a taxi to our Hotel near Nana BTS station. And, Luckily we were the beginning of the stops so we got the seats. However, as we were getting closer to Makkasan, we realized people will keep flooding in and barely exit. It was hard to shuffle through to get off of Makkasan, It is not elderly or handicap friendly, and can be tiresome with flights of stairs at the end of stations. Again, good to have change!! When you shop save change!!

Brilliant, convenient, economical. Taxis are all very well and good, but at peak times it will take hours to get to (or from) the airport. It is fast and economical transportation that we've used countless times. A great alternative to sitting in a cab.
Broke down due to power issues . Travelers were left stranded. Took a while for people to be evacuated with ladders Easily become a death trap in this summer heat
Fast train but.... Fast train but long time of queuing to get the next train. If you are using ARL to go airport, suggest to catch the train earlier before 17:00 during weekdays to avoid the crowd.

Wonderful Public Transit. I am from Houston where public transit is sadly lacking. So, you understand my hesitation in traveling to a foreign country and then attempting to use public transportation. Luckily the airport rail link and the BTS Skytrain are a breeze. I just used google maps to know which stop I had to get off at for my specific destination and the rest was really self explanatory as to where to get on/off at. Very cheap and easy to use, I highly encourage everyone to just try it. Especially if you're like me and rarely use such things in your hometown.

Quick and Simple. This turned out to be a great way to get into downtown during rush hour. Can be a little confusing and the walk to the train with luggage maybe slight a pain. Also, if you are going to go from rail to sky train, make sure you have the right shoes on.

Avoid traffic jams. If you're traveling light, I would definitely recommend the train as you'll be able to avoid the massive jams. Also much faster then cabs. I would say the train would take about 30 - 40 minutes to reach Bangkok city. A cab could be 30 minutes to an hour plus depending on traffic.I only wish they did not shut down the Airport Rail Express Link. The Express would take between 20-30 minutes to reach Bangkok city.
Smooth ride. Half an hour ride to the last station and it is a smooth ride. No fear for the crazy jam and peak hours
Well connected!. Rail Link is very well connected to the Airport. Guys in Bangkok will always advice you to go by Taxi. Don't listen, trains are much fast, cheap and enjoyable.
Ease of use and connections. This was a great mass transit service. We took it to several tourist destinations and the airport, enjoy the cool and the ride.
Convient and Cheap. Would easily use this again to get from the Airport into down. Was really cheap, clean and efficient.
Great to save time and money!. For 40 baht you can't beat this! Traffic jams say goodbye! From one end of the station to the next 23-27 min.

quick and eazy to get to weekend markets. we stayed in the pratanum area in bangkok and caught the BTS at Petchburi 18 station and travelled 6 stops to Mo chit where the weekend markets are oposite straight forward and easy.Be aware that when buying your ticket at the station as we did twice ( Sat: and Sun:) that the rules seem to change depending on who mans the ticket office. The first time we asked for 2 return tickets from Petchbouri to Mochit return which we were sold and it worked perfect, the next day went to the station ticket box asked for the same and were told cant buy return ticket and were given change to go to vending machine on patform to buy tickets.!!!!!!!!! which we did but be aware of putting right stations in etc. overall very fast way to get around Bangkok, train can be crowded.Station stop announcments on train are done in Thai and english.

Airport to sukhomovit . Very.nice service by
Metro airport to city
This is the best transpotaion
And we'll maintain service by
Bangkok authority
City of life bangkok
Super fast and cheap . Great way to reach city from airport for only 70BHT which is around 2,2eur or 2,6$. It takes 30minutes only. Ticket machines are easy to use and on English too.
Say way to travel. Great way to travel around Bangkok . Friendly staff speak English and will help you out. Crowded, but no problems.

Great easy way to get to the airport . We took the sky train/BTS to the station that connected to the airport link. It was 45 baht for just the train to the airport and took about 25 mins.
It was not as crowded ad the normal train line which was nice. (at 630am at least haha)

cheap alternative but a hassle. to get to or from central bangkok you have to cheange trains to sky srain or and underground which involves a good kilometer of walking somin you in bound from say england and a 11 hour + flight its just not worth the hassle get a cab from 1 level below arrivals near gates 4 or 5 via a taxi ticket area which is staffed, and taxis metered despite people saying it costs 500 B the last 3 times i have used it it was under 400B door to door. amd same journey time.the staitions all have lifts so this is wheel chair friendly..

Cheap and easy to use.. Used this rail link three times in all, it is easy and cheap to use. It cost us a total of 50Bhats (about £1.00) one way, to get from the airport to our hotel in the middle of Bangkok.

Clean and easy. I think even a novice can figure out this metro line. Above the doors the lights show where you are and when to get off. It gets very crowded beginning about 3pm. It's a great way to get across town and then hop a Tuk Tuk or walk from there.

Good if you have lots of time and want to save money. The airport link is good for those who want to save money and have lots of time. To get into the city it costs around 60 baht, then depending on where you want to go within Bangkok another 40. Per person. A taxi will cost roughly 350 by the meter plus 75 in toll way. If you are staying at Khao san road, then the rail link is not for you.
cheap and easy to use. the airport rail link is cheap and easy to use. there are free maps, and the ticket machines are also in English as well as Ehai
Cheapest, simplest way to the airport. Airport Rail Link was great. MUCH cheaper than a taxi (~48 baht), really easy to get to (Phaya Thai BTS), drops you off right at the airport.
Easy and cheap. Best way to get to the city center. Air-conditioned and elevated so you have a nice view along the way

Quick, Easy to use, and an Efficient system. Anyone who has ever visited Bangkok will tell you that the traffic can be a nightmare, all hours of the day and night. So after your flight into Bangkok, I recommend using the Airport Rail link to get into the city. It's quick, easy to use and also really cheap at between 30 baht to 60 baht, depending on your destination station. (taxi costs between 350 baht and 600 baht).The Airport link is part of the MRT (train and subway network), and links with the BTS (skytrain network) at various points, and this makes getting around Bangkok very cheap and very easy.
Excellent. This service is frequent and clean and tidy and is simple to link up to other train lines fairly in expensive too.

Meeting . This is good for those who are not having heavy luggage as its restricted at rush hours its fast track 2 reach your hotel or destination not recommended with children as if it's your first experience as mostly signs are in their local language

Pretty fast to bring u into mid town . We took this 2x n the second time this year we noticed that they have linked the express station to the mrt station with a sky bridge. Even though u have to get out from the express station to change its pretty easy with the link bridge. It's good especially if you can link up to the city through the mrt. However if you can't and need to use bts, then probably not as u have to change the trains multiple times.This is excellent to beat the traffic jam during peak hours and it's pretty affordable
cheap. This will cost you less than a pound to get into the city centre, so a no brainer really. Cheap clean and efficient
Excellent rail, easy and clean.. Hassle-free, and staffs are helpful to direct you accordingly if you are 'lost'. English signs are helpful. Comfy and fast!
Efficient air conditioned and cheap. Running every fifteen minutes between Bangkok Centre and Suvarnsbhumi airport in air conditioned comfort for a maximum of 50 Baht
Excellent!. Clean, fast, very affordable! Highly recommend! Easily directed from your arrival flight, Just purchase some Baht to buy a ticket, ATM's available.

Good Alternative to a Taxi. This is a quick and easy alternative to get into Bangkok smoothly. The terminal is inside the Airport and well signposted. It is cheaper than travelling in a Taxi if you are solo or a couple.If you have tons of luggage it can be difficult but if you can walk wheeling your luggage it is good. In the Airport train terminal buy a ticket from a machine, there are normally English speaking staff to help you standing by the machines.BEWARE to make sure that you board the direct train as it is faster and not so crowded as the one that stops at all stations.Once you are at the end stop there are Taxis waiting to take you to your final destination.This method of getting into Bangkok can avoid frustrating traffic jams on the Toll way.

Economical service to Main AIrport. Excellent service connected to MRT system by aerial footbridge. Price is very reasonable in comparison with taxis and tolls. Service is only to main airport, NOT Don Meaung airport. There is a bus from DMK to Chatuchak MRT station direct from the front of the International Terminal.
Busy busy busy. Don't use this if you suffer from claustrophobia. However, on the plus side a Filipina maid groped me in the crush :)
Clean and Easy!! . Board it from airport to our hotel. Its clean but a little bit small as compared to Singapore Mrt Trains. Easy/fast way to travel too.. Save on transportation cost!

Pretty Convenient. Very convenient mode of getting into the city from airport without incurring as much expense when compared to a taxi. Gets you to Phiya Thai station, which is well connected by BTS skytrain to other parts of the Bangkok.

Decent...Convenient...Reasonable speed.. . Tried aft hearing my friends saying it's convenient and cost efficient... not too bad... decent cleaniness... reasonable speed... will use it again the next time i go...
Easy and fast!. The Airport rail link takes you to or from the Airport in a mabye crowded but efficient way. There are conecting Points to MRT and BTS along with a myriad of busses!
Airport Rail Link. Very convinient transportation from or to airport, fast, on time, cheap (if you come alone or both).
Reliable Airport Link. Efficient, reliable and cost-effective way from & to airport, overcoming the unpredictable Bangkok traffic
Get to the airport. The Airport Rail Link was a 15 walk from my Hostel. You buy your ticket when you get to the station. Inexpensive and fast way to get to the airport.

Affordable transportation. Pretty straight forward transportation into the heart of Bangkok.
Pretty cheap too. Prices are according to the distance. You could buy the tickets/token at the station self serve machines. Try to bring small changes.
very good and easy way to reach airport. very good and easy way to reach airport. and very cost effective also compare to Taxi. as Bangkok traffic is very bad. this is the best option.

Convenient transport. Just love a train from the airport to get you into any major city and this one did not disappoint. Quick, clean and always great talking with other travellers about where they've been and giving hints as to where we've gone.

Best way to reach town. Use this rail to reach the city centre. For about THB40 and 30 minute you will be delivered by a BST station and be able to reach any destination. Much cheaper than taxi. Train is clean and announcements are in english as well. I would suggest to use it on arrival and departure not to run into any traffic jams and reach the airport on time.

Excellent transportation . City line for 45 THB pp, 6 stations, very clean, fast, quiet. The only con is the aircon, it's set too low I would say. Directly from the airport up to almost the city center. Nothing to say against.

neccessary for time keeping. if you are going to the city from airport by car you dont know when you will arrive, but with the airport skytrin its for sure.normally I stay at Hilton Sukumvit and with walking and BTS and transfere to Airport train till check in it exactly 1h.maybe in the night with car its faster, but during daytime youll never know
Easy experience. Once arriving at Bangkok airport follow the signs to the rail link on the basement level. Price to the city centre is around 60 baht (£1.20) and trains run every 10 minutes or so.
Cheapest way to the airport. If you're catching a flight, it's best to take this train. It's very convenient and cheap. You can stay away from traffic if you take a taxi.
Hassle free connection. This is by far the best way to get from the Airport to the centre of Bangkok. Prompt service and spotless trains. Very cheap too.

A hidden way to get to town. If I hadn't had a head's up from a friend I might just have taken a taxi from airport to town. Only 45 Baht and quick, clean and AC. Very very busy from second station after airport. Last station connects with Skytrain
fast, affordable and convenient. fast, affordable and convenient link between downtown Bangkok and the airport. Trains are new and frequent.

very conveninet, especailly if you are going to Sukhumbit area. fast and easy way to go from airport into town without the hassle of having to bargain with taxis. if you are travelling alone this will be much cheaper than taxi

Great Transport from the Airport. This can get you to and from the Airport in no time, There are loads of space and enough for your luggage.
It has lots of space and very clean.
Price of it is reasonable and main thing is you dont have to worry about traffic.
The connecting bridges to the other stations help with escalators
Easy to use. . Very easy to use and only 31 bhat to my stop. I will however, not use it again with lots of luggage. There were many elevators at the stops I needed!

Very efficient way to go to city. I arrived during rush hour and I took the train to the city. It was not the express one but very easy reach the my hotel by transfer to light rail. Better experience than taxi and failing uber rides.
Nice Airport Rail link. This transfer had comfortable I"m enjoy solo sidetrack traffic jam then very good overall I"m so happy.
Efficient. Clean, fast, reliable and cheap. Runs every twenty minutes ending at midnight. A much cheaper alternative to taxi's which run around 600 bhats
Convenient and swift. Better than a taxi. Clean, swift, cheap price and reliable. The best way to go to the airport definitly.

Always a convenient option for solo travellers travelling light. Always a convenient option for solo travellers travelling light. Fast and frequent way to get into the city and connect to BTS or MTR transport systems all at the bargain price of 45Baht. Not such a good choice if you have heavy bags as the connections to BTS and MTR aren't that user friendly.
Easy to access. It is highly recommended for those traveling Thai. It's really easy to access airport to city and its really easy way to travel

Dead easy. This a very useful rail link that is a valid and inexpensive option. Also quicker than a taxi, especially during rush hour. Helpful staff to enable one to purchase the correct ticket. No problem.

Great way to travel from the airport to Sukhumvit area.. I used this train to travel to the Sukhumvit/Asok area. Very smooth, safe and comfortable. Easy to work out how to get tickets. Very low cost compared to taxis. I suggest you pre-plan your trip using the maps on the internet ti understand where you need to change to the Skytrain if you need to.
Cheap, Fast and Comfortable. It's a very pleasant journey after flight. A wonderful view to the city going to Bangkok City Centre. It reaches almost all the tourist place with connecting BTS.

Great if luggage is light . Great service if little or no luggage. Fast and affordable and easier than taxis.
If a lot of luggage the stations end route are very difficult to negotiate so better to take taxis.
Very quick. Much faster than road traffic, easy to use card system to use for single trip or day/week pass. Great way to get around/

Avoid the crazy heavy traffic jams in Bangkok by Airport Link Train. I live in Bangkok and frequent go to the airport and back by Airport Link Train. Suvarnabhumi Airport is approximate 10s km. from the center but the unpredictable traffic jams in Bangkok, sometime it takes about .. 1 - 1.5 - 2 - or 3 hours. esp. before long holiday or rainy season.The train station situated at Suvarnabhumi Airport (underground level) and it takes about 40 mins. to Praya Thai BTS, then you can change to BTS or take a taxi to your hotel. However, there's not many trains .. so there are lots of passengers and each train takes about 10-15 mins. for waiting. By the way, it's cheaper and faster than take a taxi directly from the airport.. save money, save your time.
Best way into the city from the airport.. If you are staying in central Bangkok, the rail link is the most efficient way to get to and from the airport.
airport - center bkk in 15 min. if you stay in center of bkk and need to get to the airport , this is the fastest and cheapest way to do one euro /person

Rundown as disgraceful . Limited bogies peak hours are nightmare. In spite of city terminal but limited access not convenient to go and commute by train to airport. It was totally wrong implementation.

Useful. Airport is best choice for you. It's quite cheap and convenient for the people that arrive or depart from airport.It is also really the best way to get around to some place for both local and foreigners.Just take time to get knowledge on various stations and start your travel.

Excellent connectivity. This is an excellent way to go to town or the airport. Its cheap fast and an excellent alternative to the local taxis. In a place where you could be struck for hours in traffic, this is a boon.

Cheap and effective . To make a long story short: The best and cheapest way of reaching Bangkok city centre from the international airport. I think it only costs something like 45 baht. Tends to get a bit crowded, though.

Clean, on time and reliable. The airport rail link is very useful in Bangkok because it is well connected to the BTS stations. It ran on time as well the two times we used it, so we had a good experience. As with all other airport rail links, make sure to check the time table beforehand since the trains run at a frequency of twenty minutes or so, and are not as frequent as the BTS trains. To make sure you make it to your flight on time, ensure you leave a buffer of twenty minutes or so to catch the airport link.

35 minutes from BKK to Asok/Sukumvit. I took the Airport Rail Link from BKK to Makkasan (35 baht), then an easy walkway to Phetchaburi MRT followed by one stop to Sukhumvit MRT station (15 baht). And that was after 20+ hours of flying from Canada. I couldn't have been easier. I actually took the ARL again on my return to Bangkok over 2 weeks later at the end of my stay in Thailand.Tip: if you are getting off at Makkasan station from the airport with bulky luggage, position yourself near the right-hand doors (in the direction that the train is going) - they will open on that side and the train will get increasingly more crowded, making it quite a chore to get off. You'll thank me later ;).

Efficient, cheap ride into the city. An efficient, clean and direct Suvarnabhumi airport -> city train connecting with the Skytrain/BTS in Bangkok at a taxi-friendly stop. The only practical option except for taxis which can face traffic jams and are 4/5 times the price. Extremely reasonable compared to other international city -> airport links, but not ideal for passengers with bulky, heavy luggage; not wheelchair friendly, and not operational 24/7.

Very handy at peak times. Use the airport Rail Link at busy times to by-pass having to deal with Bangkok traffic. Very cheap and on time. You can then use the Skytrain or Underground to get to your final destination.

A quick, cheap way to get from the airport into Bangkok. A taxi from the airport into the city is going to cost anywhere from 300-700 baht, roughly $9 to $18. Going by the airport rail link will get you there for a couple of bucks, and then you can even use the BTS (sky train) or MRT (subway) public transportation systems to get where you are going.

Fast and Easy.... Avoid the endless traffic jams that plague Bangkok by taking the Airport Rail Link, the BTS, the MRT to get almost anywhere you want in Bangkok... forget about taxi and buses (unless you have all the time in the world to be stuck in heated pollution).

The fastest and convenience way travel between airport. It takes less than 30 minutes from airport to downtown/shopping area of Bangkok. You can connect the BTS and MRT Subway from Makkasan and Phya Thai station. Cost only TH$45.00

Great way to get to / from airport. The Air Rail was a great way to get from and to Suvarnabhumi! Took taxis before that and spent 300-500 baht. Ticket is only 35-40 baht. Runs from 6 am - midnight with vending machines for tickets. Runs 4-5 times an hour depending on whether its a peak time. Doesn't go to the tourist districts. But you can get a taxi or tuk tuk from the end of the line. Used by locals so if you have a lot of luggage, it can be difficult. Also, if you have multiple people in your party, it probably isn't as economical since each of you has to pay the fare. But for a solo traveler with just a backpack, it was perfect.

Best transportation to Suvarnabhumi Airport. Cheapest and probably the most convenient way to travel to Suvarnabhumi Airport. I ride the ART whenever possible on my way to the airport. No traffic and fast.

Good hub between airport and city centre. Although the station area is unnecessarily large and could have been planned better, it's a great way for travelers heading to/from the airport to connect with the city center. The metro (Phetchaburi station) is only 3 minutes away, and there's also a handy connection to the Saen Saeb river ferry (Asok pier) for those who don't mind a slightly novel way of traveling to Siam (Pratunam pier), Khao San Rd (Phanfa Leelard pier) or Thong Lor, among many others.
Very convenience way to city . You pay less with this transportation compare to taxi. Fast and easy way to reach the city and escape from the traffic jam.
fast transport from and to the airport from city center. great and cheap way to get to and from the airport to the city center. going lots of train each hour so easy to hop on.

Best way to get from Suvarnabhumi Airport to the city. By far the easiest way to get into the city.We were staying at the Baiyoke Sky Hotel so took the ARL straight to Ratchaprarop station and walked around the corner to our hotel.If you are staying more centrally, such as on the Silom Road or around the Siam area, you can change at either Makkasan station which will take you onto the MRT line and then change from the MRT to the BTS line at Asok, or if you stay on the ARL until the last station at Phaya Thai, you can change here onto the MRT line which is 2 stops from Siam station.
Cheapest and easiest way in from the airport. Having been burnt by taxis before when visiting Bangkok airports, this is a great low cost way of getting into town!

Definitely the best way between the city and the airport.. I came to Bangkok a little over a week ago and made the mistake of taking a taxi to/fro the airport. The traffic was woeful and the trip took around an hour each way. Now I'm back for a second trip and I decided the train was worth a try. It's a big improvement on the taxi, simply because it's not subject to traffic delays.Note though, if you're travelling with a lot of luggage it isn't so convenient getting around the stations, and the train I came into town on was quite full.

Great way to get into town. By far the best way to get into town, and so cheap! So easy to use and understand,it takes only about 35 mins to get into the heart of Bangkok , where you can change onto the BTS system
Best Bangkok Airport transportation. The best way to go from the airport to Bangkok vice versa without being bothered by the traffic jams.

The easiest and most hassle free way.... From the arrival floor, take the lift or the escalators all the way to the bottom floor and find the Airport Rail Link. Train to Phaya Thai is about 40 min and it saves you for the horrendous taxi ride from the airport to where ever you're going. Having said that; from Phaya Thai you can connect to the BTS Skytrain (metro) and from Makkasan you can connect to MRT (subway). Absolutely worth it if you are going to Bangkok.

Best transportation from Suvarnabhumi Airport to BKK downtowwn. The City Line could be packed during rush-hour since you have to travel with the locals (the government has suspended the Express Line). The train wasn't run very often like BTS, so it might take times waiting for the train. The staircase and escalators were quite narrow. That's might be challenged for heavy baggage.

Efficient!. We took the train and the BTS to get to Our hotel. This was much better than taking the taxi in this traffic clogged city.
Do the most you can by public transportation?
There is a water bus on the Praha river and it is well worth it!
High five for the public system in Bangkok.

City to airport in only 1.5USD, amazing !. Very cheap and convenient to beat the traffic. Spacious and runs on time with very smooth journey and guards at every step guiding us. From MAkassan to the airport its 35bh (1 USD) and you are 5 minutes away from the center of the Sukhumvit already. Taxis cost around 300-500bht and can take longer at times...go for it if you dont mind standing also for 15 minutes !

AIRPORT RAIL LINK. Very quick and convenient to get to your hotel, a lot cheaper than organising a taxi and getting stuck in Bangkok traffic, so don't have to put up with the air pollution, much cleaner.

Quick and cheap. Tried this for the first time after many many times in and out of BKK. Will not hesitate to use it again. Easy to get to, only 35 Baht to city centre, versus 300 for a taxi, quick and convenient regular service.

Cheap transfer to/from airport . One of the cheapest method that transfer you from airport to Bangkok city. About 50 mins journey. However if you traveling with big luggages I would suggest to grad a taxi for you convenience.
Not to be trusted to get you there on time!. We just visited Bangkok and found out that the train oftenmalfunctions. Especially the link to the airport. Be aware.
Fast but not timely. we checked the internet regarding the train's timing. It wasn't on time but this mode of transportation is quite good especially as we avoided the havoc traffic at the peak time.

Reasonable time and fare. You can't beat the Bangkok Airport Rail Link with equivalent of A$2 on air conditioning train travel for over 30 kms to the heart of Bangkok less than 30 minutes. Hassle free if you travel with one big suitcase and a cabin bag. Shame that the express schedules which would take only 15 minutes were ceased to offer.

Saves time and money. If you are near a BTS station, then this is the way to get to the main airport. The elevators are not reliable so you may have to tote your luggage up the stairs to the BTS station. The transition to the Rail Link is easy with roller luggage.

very slowly, quite expensive for this country. it is slowly for a Sky Train, quite expensive for this country - 45 baht for a personthe system with yellow plastic coin ticket it is very bad, old fashionthere is a lot of people travelling and the train is small, lot of people don't have a place to seat

Very convenient transfer to the city. If you have max 2 big luggages and is still before midnight, airport link is a convenient mode of transportation to the city. It costs about 45baht per way for a 45 mins trip. If you are staying in Sukhumvit 1-57 stop at Makkassan Station. You dont need to stop at the terminal station Phayathai if you will stay in Sukhumvit as its far out. From Makkasan take a taxi. It should not cost u more than 75baht.

Very convenient and cheap !. Should use this transportation to go into the center of Bangkok ! (If your bags are not too large to carry or too lazy.) Just only 45 THB (maximum) and you can get taxi after that (if you still need to take it) They open till midnight only(should check the schedule on their website.) If you still want to take it to Suvarnabhumi airport for late night/ early morning flight. Just take it and stay at the airport before midnight.
Easy, convenient ,fast. Saves a lot of stuck-in-traffic stress! Have been using this service frequently. It's cheap and a great addition to start a nice couple of days in Bangkok.
Convenient. Best way to reach Suvarnabhumi Airport from Central Bangkok. The ARL has link connection to Central Bangkok at Phaya Thai Station (BTS)

Best way to get to and from the airport. This is by far the best way to get to the airport. While the journey to the city center still takes about 45 minutes, you're assured of the time taken and not subject to the unpredictability of Bangkok traffic. The trains are clean and comfortable.
Save Time, Fast to travel. Airport Rail Link gives great experience. Its save time to travel downtown from Suvarnabhumi Airport. Best choice & Save money.
Great. This is a great way to get from BKK to Bangkok. Very fast and cheap. I think it took about 35 minutes and cost about 35 baht.

Fast and cheap. From airport to city centre in 20 mins . Much faster than via taxi . Air conditioned . And cheap . 40 bhat to my stop, second to last on the line. Elevators to platform if you got luggage,and tuk tuk outside stations to take you to your final stop.

The best way of getting to and from the Airport. We've tried private hire and taxis and this is 45 Baht and at least 3 times faster. Put up with the inconvenience of carrying luggage and a bit of walking, it's worth it in the end.

The cheapest way between city and airport. The names may be confusing, but Skytrain (BTS) and the Airport Rail Link (ARL) are two separate systems (though they have adjacent stations at Phaya Thai). The ARL also connects (with some walking) to the underground Metro (MRT) line from ARL's Makkasan station. Stations have ticket machines, all accepting coins and some accepting notes. These issue a plastic token, which must be touched on a card reader at entry gates, and fed into a slot for collection at exit gates. In practice the system is easy to follow, with English signage and announcements as well as Thai. Fares are low (less than 50 baht end to end in Feb 2016) and the line is a quick and easy way to the city centre or via connections on other lines. It can get busy with non-airport travellers, particularly at peak times.
Super Easy Option. We were lucky to catch the last one into Bangkok at a fraction of what a cab or taxi would cost. Look up the maps and timetable online before your trip. Super easy and convenient!

Very easy map to figure out.. We used the airport rail link from BKK airport to transfer to the BTS skytrain. From there it was a 3-5 minute walk to our hotel. During our stay in Bangkok, we utilize public transportation with ease and only paid for a taxi once to get to the DMT airport. If you're wanting to explore in the heart of Bangkok, the Airport Rail Link and BTS Skytrain will fulfill your trasportation needs. Place we explored using BTS Skytrain: The Grand Palace, Weekend Market, Terminal 21 Mall, Siam Center, Madame Tassauds, nightlife off "Nana" station, and Chao Phraya River.
Convenient way to get around. This is the most convenient way to go to and from the airport, and get around Bangkok and avoid the crazy sticky traffic. The best deal in town.

Easy, competative if good connection with your destination address. In airport Suvarnakabumi, easy, ticket machine available next to platform. More economic and faster than taxi, provided one of the train stations is well connected to your destination.
Convenient. Great way to travel into the city and beat the traffic. The train is clean, fast and well maintained.

OK If No Luggage. The Airport Rail Link is not a good option if you are traveling with one or more suitcases, especially if you plan to transfer to the BTS (SkyTrain) at the Phraya Thai end station. There are several long flights of stairs that have to be navigated, which can be very problematic with luggage unless very fit. The same is true at many BTS stations in Bangkok. You can't exit without going down steep flights of stairs.

Frequent and easy. The airport rail link (city line) runs from the Suvarnabhumi airport to Phaya Thai stopping at a few stations in between. I got down at Makkasan because it connects to Phetchaburi MRT station which i used to go to Sukhumvit. The trains are frequent and runs from 0600hrs to 2400hrs.
airport rail link. it's very convenient and cheap way to get from the city t the international airport, just make sure t be there before midnight because they close by that time.
Airport is now not far in Bangkok. The fastest way to reach the city from airport is also the most cost effective way. Felt great. It is fast and convenient
Fast, clean and with AC. Offers a good alternative from the normal cab / taxi from BKK airport given the traffic in Bangkok is normal very bad. It's clean, fast and very reasonably priced.
Excellent service. Very convenient and reliable service takes you right from the airport through the city of Bangkok. Inexpensive and way faster than any taxi or car ride would be.
There is no cheaper and faster way of getting into town.... 40 bht and you are in krung thep...get off at makkasan or phyathai to change for mrt or bts..runs every 10 minutes

If only it went all the way.... Great service, clean, fast and direct. Great views over the city because it's so high. The only minor point about it is that it ends at Phya Thai, from where it is still a 10-15 minute taxi ride to f.e. the Khao San area or around it.
