Fantastic rail link. Clean, efficient and cheap. Connects with the BTS so you get good access to lots of areas of Bangkok. Beats sitting in the traffic - what more could you want?

Sort of convenient. Depending on where you want to go. Connects, indirectly, with the subway - and that connects, indirectly with the sky train. Would not try this with heavy luggage as you have to walk a lot to get to alternative transportation for the "final mile"

Very convenient to go to city centre by Airport Rail Link. I enjoy riding this rail service whenever I landed in Bangkok. It's the fastest and convenient to go to city from airport by its rail service.

Convenient, avoid heavy vehicle traffic.. Rather than take a taxi that will most probably be caught in the heavy traffic in Bangkok, we took the Airport Rail Link to our hotel which is walking distance from a station. Timing more predictable and convenient.

Great way to reach City fast if you do not have too much luggage!. This way of reaching Bangkok and especially Makkasan area is very good if you are travelling light. As usual if you have too much luggage it is of course better to grab a taxi.

Great way to get into town from the airport!. We stayed our last night at the Novotel Hotel at the airport and found this link to the MRT to be invaluable! It was easy to use; remember to take the city train that makes stops if you want to connect to the MRT (which we did) as opposed to the express line. Afforadable and convenient.
Fast, but a little bit of work. Certainty the fastest way into the city. You will have to transfer at least once to the BTS or MRT to get to your hotel which could be tough with luggage.

fastest way to the city. at 45 bahts this is the fastest way into the city...train can be crowded as times, but the crowd eases off as stations go by...last stop is the Phaya Thai, which is close to the wholesale market...best option to reach city in morning hours to avoid road traffic...

Great to use. This service saves a lot of hassle at the airport,it is easy to use and cheap.One thing to make sure of that your hotel is close to it,or you will have a hard time getting a taxi from the MRT station to your hotel.Trains run once or twice and hour depending on the time of year and check as some do not stop at all the stations
Pure pleasure. Coming from London it's an absolute pleasure to use this service. It's organised, has air conditioning and is run professionally and reliably.

Safe & fast. Thus is a great sevice that runs very frequently and has a very easy link to the BTS system. It beats sitting in Bangkok traffic by a long shot. Trains are spotlessly clean and well air conditioned. They are also security checked at the end of each line so feel very safe.

Cheap and fast mode of transport. I was travelling with my wife and a child. Taking the airport rail link turned out to be much cheaper than a taxi - I was going to pratunam area. However, carrying the bags from the station to hotel was a but of a hastle. I think locals are taking the normal rail instead of the airport rail link - the only difference is that the airport railink has fewer stops and has space to keep your big bags. But the normal trains are 25-40% cheaper fares.
Easy, and stress free. This is hands down the best way to get into central Bangkok. It's reasonably quick, cheap, and connects with the BTS skytrain.
Basic but fast. basic but fast why use a cab in this traffic congested city?So ensure you have currency on or after arrival
RARE!!!. We will never take the airport link again! The train come once in half an hour and the time is unpredictable. The train itself is small as it is a fish can

Cheap but lengthy. The rail link is a really cheap way to get from the city to the airport and vice versa. Be aware, however, that it is quite a lengthy journey so give yourself plenty of time if using it.

the best 45 baht you could spend in transportation in Bangkok. From Phaya Thai BTS station to the Suvamabhumi International airport costs only 45 baht! It's on time, fast, and there is NO TRAFFIC! If you ever got stuck in the Bangkok traffic in a taxi cab or worse a tuk tuk, you know what I mean. Take this instead!

Great value. This train is a great reliable and fast way to get out of the airport, trains run about every 12 min so one is never far away. Although limited stops it does connect with both mrt and bts (underground and skytrain networks) so u can get most places easily. 1 negative is need different tickets for each rail system and at some stations the lines can be long, but if going to be regular user can get prepaid cards that save a lot of time. Like all trains in Thailand it is cheap to use and really saves a lot of time compared to taxis.bi have put a pic on too of the 3 prepaid cards for the different train systems in Bangkok

Quick & Efficient. Usually we take a taxi to downtown bangkok. costs around 450 baht but now, feeling adventurous, we took the Airport Rail link. 45 baht per person and is quick, efficient and takes you right into town where you can change to the BTS. Keep in mind not all BTS stations have elevators or escalators all the way down.The Airport link is an excellent alternative to the taxe and potential horrific traffic jams on the way in or out of bangkok to the airport.
Excellent!. I took the ARL train from the Makkasan ARL station to the BKK airport in 30 minutes. The ARL train was nice and clean.
Do it.... The best option to get into the city. Don't give those rip off taxi drivers your coin..Its clean, quick and cheap..
Cheap and fast. Great cheap and fast way to get to the city of Bangkok. Can easily change to MRT at Makkasan Station.
Most comfortable mode. Best connectivity to airport at cheapest of price. Rail Link was next to our hotel and does sorted out the issue of robbing taxi drivers in Bangkok
Express train between airport and center not functioning. Surprised to see that the express link to the city centre was not operating at all. So we did not try it.

Best way to get to the airport from the city of Bangkok. Used this for 3 flights during our month long stay in Bangkok. It costs less than $1.00 one way and took around 30 minutes from the Makkasan station. Announcements are in both Thai and English. While it gets crowded, you shouldn't care because it's fast and cheap. The biggest criticism is that it shuts down from mid-night to 6 am. This makes no sense for a city and airport that are busy 24/7.

Cheap and easy.. By far the quickest way to travel to Bangkok from the airport. Traffic congestion has now become almost prohibitive to use the now over priced taxi services given the time it takes to drive to the city. Word of caution however, be prepared to connect to the MTR afterwards to get close to your selected location and then walk. Tuk Tuks are fewer by the day, not easy to find, hence if you have big luggage, still take a taxi for ease.
Very Fast and Easy. I took it to and from the airport. The maximum bill accepted in the token vending machines is 100 baht, so you'll need to buy a token at the window if you only have larger bills.

Super Fast Rail Link. Took the city line rail link to our hotel. The station had elevator so that we didn’t have to drag our luggage down & up the stairs. The only issue is you purchase a ticket according to distance.

Avoid Airport taxis. This was very easy especially if your hotel is on the Sukhumvit or Silom BTS lines. Catch the airport link to Phaya Thai (last stop) just to make it easy to transfer for Sukhumvit. Catch the 4th stop for Silom/MRT. Avoids the hassles of a taxi and only costs 1 to 2 USD

Fast & Easy - just the way I like it!. the Airport rail link is a wonderful way to save money as you enter or exit the Big Mango. Even if you still get on a taxi at your destination stop you're still saving a good chunk of change -- although the new ticketing system for taxis at the BKK airport does make getting ripped off a lot less likely....

Very cheap and convenient during rush hour. Bangkok traffic can be terrible so a massive advantage of flying to Suvarnabhumi airport (BKK) is the option of taking the airport rail link, especially if you're landing during Friday evening's rush hour.It's just THB 45 to Phaya Thai and takes about 30mins. It does get quite busy, but it's air conditioned and I'll take this over being stuck in Bangkok's infamous grid locked rush hour traffic!

100% more economical than CAB and lightning fast. Airport Rail Link Bangkok is best option to reach city from Airport and Vice Versa. It's drops you at 2-3 major locations like Makkassan and Phaya Thai. Though always overcrowded, still too useful.In peak hours, Taxi will cost you sometimes upto 1000 THB in evening hours from Sukhumvit to Airport. While this one is just 70 BAHT. so it's heaven for those who want economical transport to Suvarnabhumi Airport

Take easy way to go. I use the Airport Rail Link from the Airport to Siam Square after give up the quite taxi waiting.That's easy way to go and cheap. At the Airport, you can down stair and buy the Ticket (from tickets machine). Choose the route from the Airport to Phaya Thai Station (the last stops of Airport Rail Link) just 45 baht/person. And walk a few minutes to Siam Square, please.Good luck to you guys,

Great way to get to the Sirport. Took for the first time, Great cheap way to get to and from the airport and far faster than being stuck in traffic. I would say its not easy to get to if you have lots of luggage. Perfect for those who pack light. As of Feb 2016 the local Rail Link was just 45 Baht each way ($1.25). Comfortable and Quiet

Overcrowded. Suggest people to take the Airport Rail Link in the morning, otherwise don't bother. The train will be overcrowded. I feel the train seriously need maintainence work done and they need to extend a few more cabins.

Airport rail link Suvarnabhumi. This long awaited connection to the BTS skytrain network is proving invaluable for both travellers arriving and departing from the main airport. It takes approx. 30 minutes to connect to the main BTS network and is accessed from the ground level at Suvarnabhumi. Trolleys are not allowed all the way, so must be carried on the final stage.
Fast and efficient. For sure the best way to travel in Bangkok; avoid hours sitting in traffic and get to the airport safely and in air conditioned comfort. Highly recommended.
Fast. it is very fast and cost only 40Baht to be in bts line in Bangkok. I was use it last time 2 times to return back in only one afternoon

Start from Suvanabhumi to Phayathai station. I alway use Airport link on office hour. So much crowed during 7.00 - 9.00 am. and 17.00-18.00 pm. It is not comfortable If you must to carry a big travelling bag. But It is cheapest compare with call taxi from a hotel. (for Taxi you must ask for use meter only!!!)
very convenient,staff very helpful and accomodating. recommended for tourist because its convenient and you would not get loss, the staff are very accomodating, approachable and very helpful
Easy mode of transport. Easy to travel with the airport rail link. Its very cheap too. Eg, from airport to ratchaprarop cost only THB 40.

Clean, cheap, fast.. Clean train, clean station, frequent, easy to find and easy to navigate. I highly recommend buying tokens directly from the agent(s) behind the windows unless you speak Thai though because the machines made no sense; they were good at understanding my butchering of the station names too. A ride from the airport to the center of town was ~60 baht but seating is very limited so be prepared to stand...and it gets full fast so there is no such thing as personal space, if you need that you'll need a cab. They have an easy system of scanning your token to go through the turnstile to enter and dropping your token into the slot when leaving through the turnstile.
cheap and fast way to get to bkk airport. I would recommend using this over the taxis in bangkok. It is cheap fast and very easy to get from the heart of Bangkok!

So crowded in the blue line, but waiting too long for the red line train. So crowded and poor air-conditioning in the blue line. If you choose the red line, you have to wait for a long time for the red line train.
Easy way out. Airport rail link is safe,comfortable & easy way to reach from airport to the heart of city up to Asok

Best way to get to airport during rush hour. You can get there without having to take a taxi (BTS or MRT). Clean, easy, and cheap option to get to the airport when taking a taxi might be questionable with traffic.

Metroplitan Bangkok Railway Connection. The Airport Railway Link is a quick, air-conditioned, comfortable and regular service from Suwarnabhumi Airport with connections to the BTS (Bangkok Transport System) and MRT (Metropolitan Rapid Transport) network of inter-city stations.The Link originates from Suwarnabhumi Airport, running at regular intervals, and connects to the MRT line at Makasan Station by way of a short walk to Petchaburi Station. The MRT extends to Hualongpong Station where you disembark and walk to Yarrowat Road in 10 minutes and enjoy the sights, sounds and flavours of Bangkok's Chinatown. The MRT (only) also offers a discount for seniors (anyone over 60, including foreigners). Just ask for the 'senior' fare. Can't be bad!Alternatively, disembark at Sukhumvit Station and take a very short walk to adjacent Asoke Station on the BTS Line. Asoke will pitch you into the heart of Sukhumvit Road with its extensive range of restaurants, bars, hotels and night entertainment. Keep on the BTS line for shopping (Chidlom and Siam Stations) of for the river Chaopraya (Saphan Taksin) and cheap river taxis - a great and cool way to see the city. Or, keep on the Airport Link and connect to the BTS at Piyathai Sation which will take you to Mo Chit and the famous weekend market.It's a great way to connect to many interesting and entertaining sights of Bangkok without the chore of driving and the hassle and expense of taxis.The only drawback are the crowded stations at rush hour times - times to be avoided - as its difficult to get on a train due to the volume of human traffic and limited number of carriages.You may be surprised just how good it is! Enjoy.
Fast but stuffy . A good service, got to phaya thai fairly quickly. However the air conditioning may as well be non existent as it got very stuffy, especially as the train filled up with passengers

Convenient. The airport link is located at the lower level of the Suvarnabhumi airport. There are clear instructions on how to get to the airport link. We rode the train going to Phaya thai station to BTS station, since our hotel is located near terminal 21 in Asok station. The fare is approximately total of 90 baht per pax. If you have a heavy luggage and is not using a trolley, this mode of transportation from the airport to your hotel might not be suitable for you. Also, we rode the train at around 10am which is not rush hour in Bangkok. The train gets packed during rush hours. Some of the taxis in the airport will charge you 300-500 baht from airport to Sukhumvit area. Overall, this is the most convenient way to and from the airport since traffic in Bangkok is horrible esp during rush hour.
Airport Rail Link. Perfect and cheap way how to get from Bangkok airport to the city. Fast, clean, airconditioned with a view on the city. Riding above the streets.
Hopeless.... Slow, terrible design for anyone with luggage (er, everyone), leads to nowhere convenient, better take a taxi...
Thank heavens for airport link. Bangkok is known for its traffic jams (esoecially diring rush hours) so i always take this link whenever i go to the airport or to another place in the city

Great addition to Bangkok. We hopped on the Airport Rail link and then the BTS sky train in order to get to the Landmark Hotel, it was an adventure and much quicker than driving in the heavy traffic. The Landmark was just a short walk away from the BTS sky train stop which was great.

Rushhour saviour. The Airport Rail Link is by far the most efficient way of getting to/from Suvarnabhumi if traveling light. I do not recommend using it if carrying suitcases, but if traveling with carry-ons it is a good alternative. During rush hours the Airport link easily saves you 1hour. It also connects to both MRT and BTS.
Go for it. The fastest and cheapest way to get to/from the Suvarnabhumi int. airport. 43 THB (if I recall well) only, clean, air-conditioned but not freezing inside.

Airport to downtown in record time. Quick and easy way to get into Bangkok from the main International Airport. Be sure to check the operating hours before you travel - Shuts down late night to early morning so not available for many flights arriving from and going to overseas destinations. Located in the basement of the Airport makes for easy access. Bangkok stations have connections to both the MRT (Subway) and BTS (Skytrain) Operated by the railway company so neither your Subway or Skytrain tickets are usable for the Airport Rail Link.

Not comfortable for travella but quite cheap. You can reach to center of Bangkok with this city train from Suvannabhum Airport with not so comfortable so much. Makkasan station and Phyathai station are both top destinations from Airport that you can connect to BTS that bring you to your hotel.

Fast way to the airport. Its realy nice beause you will get to the airport in no time you shold still take it if you travel with more then one person it is realy cheap clean and gets you to the airport in notime

Fastest Way To/From the Airport. The Airportlink is a fast and reliable way to get from the airport into the city and vice versa if you do not have many luggage and you will avoid all the traffic jams. Plus it is very cheap compared to a taxi.

Convenient for reaching central Bangkok. I travel this line frequently and find it good value and efficient for getting from Bangkok airport to central Bangkok. The trains run every 15 mins from level B1 of the airport to many stations. Get off at Makkasan to change to the MRT lines and Phyathai for the BTS. Quicker (avoid traffic), cleaner, cheaper and safer than other forms of transport to central BKK.

Mixed Review!. Yes its a great service, but if you have suitcases or a lot of luggage, it can be kind of hard or time consuming. When you try to carry suitcases on the stairs, you need lots of muscles. Sometimes you can avoid the stairs, but not always. It used to be, that there was one train going straight to the airport, which had place for luggage, now, they one commuter train, and one train that has been torn apart to try to make room for commuters. When they tore it apart, they took out most of the chairs and most of the luggage storage. Now both of them are commuter trains, They are a bit crowded in rush hours.

Sure beats taxis. I am tired of the Swampy taxis usually refusing to use the meter, until I ask in Thai for the third time. The train link is fast, not crowded, and affordable. The down side is it's hard to find the elevator if you have suitcases, and you may have to transfer 2 or 3 times to get to your hotel.

Fast and efficient. This is part of the sky train programme. Taking you into the city from the airport and avoiding traffic. However, if you don't know where you are actually going when you get to the city, I would advise you take a meter taxi from the airport instead! Remember it must be a metered taxi or you will get ripped off!
Easy. No hassles. Cheap.. Better than a taxi. Faster, more convenient, clean, good connections, Airport to City Center 30 minutes.

Difficult to get to and the express link is no longer offered. Took us ages to establish that the express link no longer works. If you're staying near one of the stops with connection to MRT, then it might be worth taking, but it took us 90mins to get to Patpong vs 45 mins by Taxi. We usually use public transport, but for once, taxi worked better.
Beats Traffic!. Better than sitting in horrible BKK traffic, and it connects to BTS system that brings you almost anywhere you need to go downtown.
Faster & Less troubles with taxi drivers. This is the fastest transportation to the city, you can avoid the cheating taxi drivers and also avoid the heavy traffic jam.

20 mins from plane to city centre. best way to get from plane to city.
another fantastic part of Bangkoks great transport network
80BHT one way
if only it went into siam, instead of changing trains

Comfort and easy travel to and from the airport..... This is the first time I have availed this train service... and It was the very first visit of my teenage daughter to Bangkok. She enjoyed it as her first ever experience....the mapping and location directions are nicely places on each station.... its cheap for solo or couple travelers. If you are travelling in a group, I would advise to take prepaid taxi services. it will be cheaper compare to train.

Airport Rail Link. Well very good link, cheap ( 45 B a person ) a taxi would cost you a 1000 B, easy, and takes you right in the airport,sometimes buses are full and they want you to wait several hours, but withtthis train you get near the victory Monument where you can catch a mini-bus right on, amazing link

Perfect way to get into the city. Don't search for a taxi that let you pay way to much. Next to that you're also avoid the traffic into the city. That could save on rush-hours at least an hour. The most convenient way to get into town is the Airport link. Check where you have to get out and take from there a cheap taxi or travel further by BTS or MRT (underground). Best way to travel around in BKK city. And the best thing; it cost you not over €2,50!

Good cost effective way to get to and from the airport. I used the link in both directions and found it to be clean, on-time/regular and cost effective, it also links in well with the MRT service for your onward journey. One slightly disappointing factor is that the carriages are similar to an MRT / tube-type system so little in terms of 'specialist' areas for luggage and limited seating (unlike the KLIA Express, for example). Other than that it does what it says on the tin (note that I used it to/from BKK airport, not sure whether it goes to DMK).

Easy. Forget car, bus, taxi, or any other form of transportation – this is the only way to get from the airport in to the city. Bangkok is huge, and the train is quick. You can easily get a taxi (cheap) from the end station to your hotel.

Avoid Taxi Hassles. I love the ARL. I always choose a hotel near a BTS station, so getting to Phaya Thai station for the transfer to the ARL is a simple matter. I abhor the hassles that Bangkok taxi drivers perpetrate on visitors, so unless I have a huge amount of baggage or I arrive too early or late in the day, I will always use the ARL to get to and from the airport.

Easy if you're travelling light or if you don't have to change train lines more than once. I've used the link several times to get to the airport to meet friends. It's quick and convenient, and you avoid all those nasty traffic jams Bangkok is renowned for.I wouldn't recommend it if you have to change train lines at peak time with a big suitcase, because the interchange stations are frantically busy. Also if you are travelling in pairs or more, it may be just as cheap to get a cab from the airport, depending on your destination.On Sundays and public holidays the streets are fairly quiet, and getting a cab makes sense. Also if you're travelling late at night or very early in the morning, the roads will be ok. However if you arrive at peak times, the rail link will be much less stressful the going by cab, but you may need to get off at the other end and hop in a cab anyway to reach your final destination.

trip #1 2016. This is a good service to the airport from Phayati, You can get here by using the BTS trains from various locations around Bangkok, Take the regular service as its much cheaper option, Fast and clean, better than the crazy maniac taxi drivers trying to show off their skills on the expressway,
Excellent. Took the Rail Link to the airport for trip to Cambodia. Quick and a lot cheaper than a Meter Cab. Takes a little longer.

Very convenient . To avoid the traffic you d better use that
40 baht per person . Direct access from the airports take 35 min to get at the terminal
Easy. Pretty easy way to get from town to the airport. If you take the regular train instead of the fast one it will take slightly longer and cost much less.
Quick and Easy Airport Connection. in Feb 16 the cost was 45 Baht per person to the city BTS station. It is a faster way to get into and out of the city especially on M-F
best way to go around. the only real and honest choice to go around Bangkok...forget taxis and motorbike...with few quids you go around everywhere...
First . Best and first . Less money get on time to airport . Only 45 baht for only way . Much cheaper than local taxi .

Good mode of transportation, if you travel light. The airport link is a good way to get to the airport, if you do not have to carry a lot of luggage and if you stay close to one of the stations. The main problem is the long way to get from the BTS station to the airport rail link station via several levels through the two stations. There are no seating arrangements on the stations and the trains can be crowded. Hence if you need to use the BTS or MRT first to get to the airport rail link, so it can be quicker and not much more expensive to use a taxi especially for families!
fast & safe. The best and safest way to get to town, if your hotel near one of the stations. Also there is a lot of traffic jams in Bangkok. So it saves a lot of time

Less stress. If your Hotel or Guesthouse is downtown, I would always reccomend to take the Airport Rail Link. It´s fast, save, cheap and comfy. And much less stressfull then take a taxi. No traffic jam.

Avoid the Bangkok traffic jam. I always take taxi from airport to downtown and it cost me around 600 baht and takes 45 min. To 1 hour.This time I i tried the airport rail link and wow it cost me only 75 baht to get to my hotel in Nana station. It was brisk, fast and convenient. Try it and you will be more than happy.

Best transportation to and from Suvarnabhumi Airport. Very cheap.. very convenient as its connected to bts skytrain.. easy to use , easy to understand the map linked to other transportation.. no traffic intense at all.. great!
Great system. This is the best way to get to Bangkok from the airport if you are travelling light, cheap, quick and reliable

Fast, efficient and only a $1!. A lot of western cities could learn from Bangkok's answer to getting to the airport on time. I wish there was one of these in Sydney. This train is linked to the MRT system so is easily reached from anywhere in Bangkok and runs above the congested road system below. No need for taxis. Just book a hotel within walking distance of an MRT station and let the trains do the rest.
EASY TO USE!!!. If you are travelling light, this is an easy option for getting to and from the airport, from the sky train.(I personally hate dragging big suitcases around...but you can do it here)
Cheap and fast. . It's cheap, fast and best for people without much luggage. My trip to the airport was only 40baht from  Ramkhamhaeng Station and took about 30 or 40 mins

Dirt cheap easy service to town. Make sure that you have some small Thai currency, before descending to the airport lowest level and then an easy cheap efficient service will take you into Bangkok.If arriving late evening/night, only go to the final main terminal as taxi service may not be available elsewhere

Best option to City Center. Airport Rail link is highly recommended for those seeking affordable and quicker traveling from to airport to the city center.. Can't be better option than this if you really want a convenience traveling after s long flight.. It's affordable,fast,safe and easy to use,cost only 45bht for one way journey. Do not hesitate to ask for assistant if you unsure about anything to the Railway customers service assistant who are always eager to help you with smile!!:-)
Easy. Public transportation in Bangkkok is good, they all have in english and staff speak fairly good english too

Fast and economically way to get to Bangkok airport. A convenient way to/from Bangkok airport without traffic. However, there should be more elevator/escalator in the skytrain system that connects with the Airport Rail Link to help with passengers who have luggage. In addition, more trains should be added during Bangkok rush hours to accommodate people travel along the route.

Quick, cheap. At the moment they only had the City Link, which stops at all stations. Not a problem for us, but some seemed to miss the quick connection. A bit crowdy, but efficient. And cheap, we paid 40 baht per person to Rajpraprop station, which is close to Baiyoke Sky hotel.
Cheap and fast transport to city. This is one way to beat the city traffic jam. It is not only convenience, it is not expensive and a good transport if you are staying near to a station.

Airport to town.. Only trouble with airport link is the express one has one stop and doesn't connect with skytrain line. Therefore when you use the non express it stops at every station and becomes very crowded but does connect with skytrain line. Very cheap and avoids the 4-00 pm traffic jams in a taxi.
Perfect transportation. Good to go to the international airport not using taxis. Cheaper, friendly and better than taxis. Fast and eficient, really recomend.

Not good if you arrive near 11pm. The Airport Rail Link is the inexpensive way to go between The Bangkok Skytrain or Subway and the Suvarnabhaum International Airport. It is not good way to get to Bangkok if you plane arrives after 11pm as the Airport Rail and Skytrain and Subway close at midnight. But luckily there is little traffic at that time of night and a taxi quickly gets into town cheaply.
Great. It's cheaper and more environmentally friendly than a taxi. It costs 45 Bhat one way and is well worth the money. Beats the traffic too.
best way to transport. Really convenient to get around the busy city of Bangkok. Traffic is 24 hours so its just great to have to avoid all of this

The best way to get to and from the airport. Simply put, this is the best way to get to and from the airport. It links with Skytrain and the metro, both a must (and easy) to master if you are staying in Bangkok.Rail Link is much cheaper and faster than a taxi would be, so ... a no-brainer. Just use it.

Easy way to get to Suvarnabhumi Airport. We traveled from Rachaprarop station (second from the end of the line at town end) to Suvarnabhumi Airport. There apparently is an express train, with fewer stops, but I was unable to find it. Even with the regular commuter run, the trip time was about 30 minutes. The train platform rises several stories above ground level and escalators rise to the top level without problem, though handling more than one piece of luggage plus having small children in tow, could be a problem. There is a very small elevator, but it was "locked out" for some reason, and token purchase (THB40) must be made on a middle level, with the escalators needed for access to the train level. All-in-all, the rail link is preferable to surface travel

Faster than the highway during the day.. I used this once when traveling to hotel on the Sukhumvit in Bangkok. It gets crowded as the trip goes on at rush hour. Traffic is bad in Bangkok. This is the fastest way to the Sukhumvit. Nice views of the city.

Vacation . Arrived at the airport and from the airplane window I saw traffic jam in both direction. Later I saw hundreds of people wait in line for the taxi. Good reason to try the rail link to the city. Fast cheap and easy to escape the traffic jam.

Convenient and inexpensive way to get to the city centre. This train is a convenient and fast method to get to the city. My flight arrived early, so I caught the train at around 6am. Since it starts at the airport, I got a seat which was great as at the next station many commuters entered and it got quite full. Nevertheless, the train remained very clean and people got off and on in a very orderly fashion and handling my luggage was not a problem.

Fast & reasonable. Getting to the heart of Bangkok from the suvarnabhumi airport is very easy & has various options to connect to the bts and getting to various locations. It saves a lot of the travel time especially during the peak hours. Only available from 0600 to midnight. Best way to beat the traffic.

Good Service - had a great experience as foreigner. The service is very good, on time and very clean. I visited in November and explored the city. One of the best medium for trousim and travelling in and around the city

fast, efficient, reasonable price. For those who are in a hurry or in tight budget and do not want to stuck in traffic, airport link is the best choice. It's very efficient and the ground staffs are also helpful. Like it!
Very good. Very good, you can reach khaosan quickly end very chip. Service is on time. The best choose to avoid traffic jam
Fast and easy. Fast and convenient. If you're staying on Sukhumvit, taking a cab to the nearest airport link station will save you time and a couple hundred baht.

Great way to make it to the airport!. I use the Airport Rail Link to make it to the Suvarnabhumi airport. It was cheap and fast, really convenient option. It´s a little hard to walk the stairs with the luggage but nothing impossible.
Better way to get into town. Always a seat, comfortable journey. I find the airport link and then the BTS a much quicker way of getting central if im ever at the airport.
good link. Relative fast and cost 45 b. No especiell crowd. Around 7 stations before you reach Patunam. Always take this link.

A real deal if you aren't packing much stuff and want to go where BTS or MRT goes.. This is a clean, fast, smooth incredibly cheap way to get to town IF you arrive during operating hours (last time I checked it stopped at midnight). you can find the routes and time schedules online. Also if you take BTS or MRT to the closest point to your final destination you can catch a taxi at that station and save a bunch of bucks over airport taxi. BUT if you arrive tired or are packing more than one medium sized suitcase forget it. All stations don't provide a lift (all do have escalators) and trains are packed in AM/PM rush or after school.

Great and fast. If you're going to and from the airport with very few bags, I would recommend this form of transport than a taxi. If you take the express it will take you 15 mins from downtown Bangkok to the Airport. If you're going on the regular line it takes about 30 mins. Save yourself the sitting in Bangkok traffic in a cab.

Right Inside The Airport. What an efficient a great way to link up with the downtown area and the airport.
Cheap, on time, fast and it all starts or ends right in the airport to the city center where it hooks up with the BTS ..sky train.
Note that service can be express or not and that I believe does not run until 6AM
Great service inter links with sky train. A great train system in Bangkok for getting around the city the service is well organised and the trains are clean and fairly easy to organise your trips

The best way to get in or out from Bangkok . The traffic is really very heavy in Bangkok. Especially on the morning and late afternoon hours. The airport link leads you to Makkasan station where you can change for other transportation, like MRT ( blue line in Phetchaburi ) station. Round trip is 150 THB.

Easy. Getting around on bts ot mrt is very simple
but if your more than I person cab (meter) is usually better option, traffic excepted

So easy. The airport train is excellent. We have been to Bangkok 4 times, we've done battle with taxi driver's on other trips but the last 2 trips we've used the airport train. So much less stressful. Depending on when you arrive, you will avoid the traffic jams. Travel time from Suvarnabhumi to Phaya Thai is 17min at the cost of Baht90 per person (AU$3.60) one way. There are numerous stops along the way. It also links to the BTS skytrain. Even with our cases it was easy getting from one platform to the other. Can't wait for the new airport line to be completed Don Muang Airport.

Easy and inexpensive. Worth saving money to get into town, just be careful w the taxis when you exit the station as they will most likely rip you off bc they fight against putting the meter on! Not the best welcome to Bangkok but really liked taking a cheaper and easy ride into the center.

fast connection inner-city / airport intl.. Terminal is easy to find at BKK-Airport. The fee is less than any tipp. Train is new and very clean.Attention: be aware of the Location end-terminal and distance to your approx. Hotel.

Quick and Fuss free. We took the ARL from National stadium BTS station. It was cheap, fast and easy. Good connection to Priya Thai station where we boarded, so we could get seats and put our luggages in the overhead compartments. No worries about traffic jams and bargaining with cab drivers on the fare. We arrived at the airport in good time. Highly recommended.

Stright from the Airport into the heart of Bangkok. This is the best way to get from the airport into the city without getting hassled. Walk to the Basement of the Airport and buy a ticket from the Vending Machine or the booth. The AL intersects with the BTS and MRT. There are no tolls to pay and the prices are standard.Can't bring your bicycle on it is the only downer.

Best way to and from Airport. Fast & Efficient way to beat the infamous BKK traffic jam and get to the airport on time. I like it that the train is cleaned each time it arrived at the last station both ways before they allow anyone to embark. This ensures train is clean all the time. It can be quite packed and difficult to get a seat but it is alright as you get to the airport real fast. All at only 40 baht.

Fast and Cheap ways to Center of Bangkok. To avoid notorious traffic jam in Bangkok, this transportation system is highly recommendable. It is faster and cheaper to access to Bangkok rather than any other public services.
the centre of Bangkok

Easy way to hop out of Airport and visit City with in a short transit Visa. Airport Rail link is easily accessible with in the suvarnabhumi airport at the basement level and it reaches to the two major stations (Phaya thai, Makkasan). If your requirement is shopping i suggest you take the Phaya Thai stop which costs you exactly 45 THB and it is near to the below placesTerminal 21 (Asoke BTS station) - 30 THB from Phaya ThaiMBK centre ( Siam station) - 31 THB from Phaya ThaiSiam paragon and centre ( Siam station)If you are looking for partying you need to take ticket to Nana BTS station which costs 30 THB from Phaya Thai station.So take the transit Visa come out of that Airport and have funFrom Airport to Phaya Thai it will be 30-40 minutes and same for the return from Phaya thai to Airport

Pointless. Poorly integrated into the Bangkok BTS and rail systems. Why bother lugging your own luggage around, changing trains and having to cope with the hassle when a private taxi from the airport into central Bangkok is only about £7 for up to 4/5 people and you get door to door service.

Great system. I arrived in the evening and the taxi line was very long. So i chose the rail instead.I love the new train. The seats everything. It was not expensive and fast too. The only down side was i had to walk about 800m to my hotel. But its ok.
Convenient way to go Downtown.. To use Airport Rail Link is very convenient way to go downtown. Easy to take from/to airport. Less than an hour to downtown.
best way to BKK. Punctual, safe, clean and green. Taxis are for the birds. Longest wait time ever was 15 minutes, connect to BRT and MRT easily to get anywhere in town.

Airport Link. Best way to travel from and to the airport. Cheap fast and you have a choice to go straight to the end station or take the train which stops on every station and choose where you get off.
The best way to travel solo .... If you are not in the mood to sit in hours of traffic to get to your hotel then I recommend the rail link as your transportation to the hotel.

Cheap and fast way into the city. If you want a cheap option to get into city from Suvarnabhumi Airport and staying close to the BTS or MRT station, this is the fastest. From the arrival hall, take the escalator down to the basement.You have to buy your token from the machine or the counter. The machine only accepts 10, 20, 50 and 100 thb and there may be a long queue, so be patient.If you take the commuter train, the train will stop at a few stations, and there are people boarding and it may be crowded in the train.If you take the express train, it is much faster and not crowded at all.I find taking the commuter train is more fun as you get to see interesting passengers onboard.
Avoids the terrible traffic. Very good rail link, easy to find, easy to use and avoids the delays on the roads. Highly recommended
Easy. Using this was so easy. Far quicker than a taxi and so cheap. At the end of the airport rail link we hopped on the skytrain to get to our hotel.

Great high speed connection. If you are trying to save money for the airport taxi then this is the right way to do it. BTS and Rail Link interconnect on few places but the tickets are bought separate.
Prefer it over any bus. Cheap and fast way to get around. Very clean and user friendly. Stations are well marked and in exit stations are near hot spots.

Most reasonable and efficient way!. The airport rail link is a gem of Bangkok and fairly easy to navigate. For our departure trip we needed to take two Skytrains and transfer to the airport link. It was all straightforward and easy to navigate. A taxi to the airport runs around $50 and depending on the time of day you might be hung up in traffic. The total for the Skytrain and Airlink was about 85 baht or less than 3 USD. Travel time from the Silom district is 45 min to an hour. A great deal.The link takes you right to the bottom fl

Awesome, quick money saver!. Bangkok is a traffic nightmare and a taxi out to the airport can run around $50. We traveled from the Silom district, which has a skytrain -- we did have to do a couple transfers, but most all of these were easy to navigate, people were helpful, and costed about 85 baht (about 3 USD). When at the airport traveling into Bangkok just proceed to the bottom floor following the escalators near baggage claim. The train picks up right inside the airport. Couldn't be easier!
Bts. Very easy to use. Depends how long your staying for it is worthwhile getting a rabbit card if you going to use for every day use.
Fast but more pricy. Airport rail to downtown is fast an efficient, but more expensive than the bus service. Some bus, for a little extra, drup you at your Hotel.

easy to travel to the city. once in about 10-15 minutes. quite good. The ticket machine is easy to use with English menu. you can buy several tickets at the same time (Can't do that for MRT!!). however, it doesn't accept 1000B. you better prepare smaller paper banknotes.

First time user.. After taking the taxi every time in bangkok, i have discovered the skytrain and the metro. And last year, i have decided to also use the brand new airport link as it is also now properly connected with the BTS. No need to carry your luggage outside to transfer. A good addition to the services provided by the city to the tourists. I love it. Well maintained and on time. Totally recommended if your destination in bangkok is near a metro or skytrain station If not, will still recommend the cheap taxi unless you want pull your heavy luggage in the heat.

Really fast & amazing,. I used to Bangkok to downtown it was so easy to me. So clean & safe. Also good value to use. Most of travellers are using from airport to downtown Airport Rail link. It's easy to travel for forgieners.
Good alternative for the taxi. If you don't want to travel by taxi from the airport to the city of Bangkok, The ARL is a good alternative. Easy, affordable and comfortable.

Convenient Way Into the City. The airport rail link is an excellent and fast way to get into the city. The train will bring you to the MRT system where you can then get almost anywhere in the city. The only issue is that it is a bit confusing on how to get from the Airport Rail Link station to the actual MRT station. You will also have to buy a separate ticket to board the MRT.

Quick and Predictable. I have used this service for years on a regular basis for commuting and it's let me down once. It punctually arrives every 20 minutes (I think) and I was always able to perfectly time my morning routine and arrive for the airport link 1 or 2 minutes to spare before it arrived. Clean, good for commuting quickly from the center to places near Hua Mak and Lat Krabang and it's reasonably priced for its convenience.

Very clean, cheap and fast.. The fastest way into downtown Bangkok. After each round trip the already spotless train is swept by a cleaning team in the airport station. Wheel chair friendly. About $1.50 one way.

Fast track to city. If you are not carrying a heavy suitcase and want to get into the city, or to your hotel fast, take the airport rail line. Leaving from the basement of the international airport Suvarnabhumi, it's a great way to travel, and cheap, no haggling with taxi drivers.

the fastest and most reliable way to and from the airport. the Airport Rail Link connects Suvarnabhumi AP with the inner city. Without Highway fees, traffic jams or other hassles. Every time i used it, it was clean, felt safe and brought me where i wanted to on time. Of course, if you do have a lot of luggage, a taxi or an uber is more convenient, but you will have to plan sufficient time to get to your destination, depending on daytime and rush hour traffic. The Rail Link works reliably

Cheaper and faster than a cab. In cities like Bangkok, mass transit systems are the only way to get around. If you like sitting in endless traffic jams, watching taxi meters ticking up, then get a cab. If you're like most other people, get on the fast/air-conditioned rail link. Oh, and did I mention it's $1 each way?
Very best way. This is the easiest way to transport to airport without spending lot of money on taxi. can easily take luggage also.
Easy and cheap. We saw tons of tourists taking other forms of transport from the airport. This is easy, reliable and affordable. No brainer - take the rail link.

Faster than taxi. If you travel just with handcarry luggage it is the best way to get to BTS and MRT. The 40THB are reasonable, the schedule is good and the cars are excellent. Unfortunately there is only a skytrain connection to Suvarnabhumi and not to Don Muang.

Convenient. We have used the ARL a few times as it is a safer means of travel to and from the airport than taxi. The main issue is getting a taxi at the station to take you to the hotel. A second issue is getting out of the train with baggage as the trains tend to be very crowded with commuters. If you are getting out before the last stop, be sure to start moving to the door well in advance of your stop.

very convenient. This is a very convenient mode of transportation if you are traveling to Suvarnabhumi Airport. It is connected to the BTS. You can get to the airport really quickly. If you are traveling from Silom area, it takes an estimation of about an hour to get there.

Good and cheap. Although the metro is not so smooth, it is a cost effective and faster way to travel. It costs only 40 baht to travel from ratchathewi (platinum mall, Indra mall, Baiyoke hotel) to suvarnabhumi airport through rail link.

good. From airport to Phaya Thai bts 45bahts. From there to Nana 31 baht. Comparing that to 350 bahts taxi on meter(with tols and 50 for airport tax or something).You can make as many combinations as you like it's still way cheaper. During rush hours it's also much faster way to get to your location. You do need to know where are you going and which lines to use. Maybe not best for first timers in Bangkok.

Great to beat the traffic and pay less.. Easy and fast transport to and from the airport, especially during peak traffic hours. It can get a bit crowded and can be awkward if you have lots of luggage but sure beats spending lots of taxi money stuck in Bangkok traffic. Take a taxi to the train or underground and get this link to the airport. At the airport it is easy access to flights.

Efficient and on time transport. This train is very effective and on time. It's a great choice to leave / going to the airport as traffic to get to the city center is horrible (very heavy). It's easy and you pay per travel, You can't buy a a city pass, or at least I couldn't find the way to do it.

Modern efficient light rail. Much better than sitting in traffic!. Used the Airport Rail Link to get from a location near the airport back to my hotel downtown. Wished I had used it on the way out instead of sitting in a cab in traffic!

Stellar! I wish more airports had this in the USA!. Easy to get downtown Bangkok, and switch to the BTS. Highly recommend if you are traveling to Bangkok, and want to catch a hotel away from the airport.
Efficient transportation. This connects to the airport, which gives travelers and tourists a good, cheap, and efficient transportation going to it.

I save $40usd. for 66B (about $2usd) this is one of the real values in Bangkok, an equivalent taxi ride, with tolls would cost about $40usd. No traffic, quick and very efficient. Just follow the signage at the airport, it's more of a trip downstairs as opposed to a long walk. Trip back to the airport is just as quick. Assuming that you're getting off at Asok station, the sidewalks are wide for luggage until you enter into the soi's which are best suited for small pieces of luggage or backpacks.
Better than taxi during peak time. Better than taxi during peak time But be careful! I heard it's been broken few times. So beware of that.

Easy way into the city. This is our preferred route into Bangkok from the main airport. Easy to find and clean fast train which links with the MRT and BTS in the city. Inexpensive and no long wait I queues of traffic. Recommended.

Safe n easy n super quick. Bangkok airport rail link the best way to travel to and from the airport without being stuck in bangkoks crazy traffic jams and being overcharged by the citys taxi drivers. This service starts at 06.00 till midnight and travels 6 stops ending at phaya thai which connects with the bts skytrain. cost to phaya thai is 45 baht. The service takes less then 30 mins and can be taken from the ground floor of the airport just follow the signs. And straight into the airport on return. The trains run every 12 mins and taking large suitcases onto the train is no problem. Yes the trains can get busy at times but the service is fast safe and easy with a map of the stops clear to see inside the trains.Fantastic service.

Easy Peasy! Clean and way inexpensive!. I used the rail to go from city center to BKK airport. I paid like $1.50 and I would use this again. I recommend this if you don't have too much luggage and may just a carry on.

Efficient, though very crowded these days.... It's great people are using this service now. Think they were having trouble for a while. Now they need to start running more or longer trains: the last few times we were packed in like sardines. Seems to be used as much as a commuter line as an airport link these days, which is fine but again, as I said, need to increase service or number of cars. The biggest advantage remains predictable (and fast) time to the airport vs. taxi which is dependent on traffic. Also used to take to avoid huge taxi line at airport, but that seems to have been solved at least for now. OK connection to Skytrain.
Cheap and quick. Great way how to get from airport closer to the city center. One way price 45B or sth like that and train is going in reasonable intervals

Convenient and fast. Took the airport rail link from the airport to Nana in the morning around 11 am. Very convenient and fast. Signs and maps all around make it easy to understand and at the time I had been, the train was not even close to being full

fast & Furious. traveling on the Airport rail link can be crowded during the day, although there isnt a specific " peak hour" as such. getting to it from the airport is quite easy, although we found that the lifts at Phaya Thai were quite small, and a little crowded with the cases and people. I didnt find it easy to use the stairs with suitcases and backpacks so waiting for the lift was the only other option. It is not part of the BTS system so an extra ticket has to be purchased.

Super cheap and efficient. A colleague went by taxi and spent 4 hours getting to the hotel. We went by rail/BTS and did it in less than an hour for a 10th of the cost. It's a no brainer. Get on at the airport, get off at the BTS station and then use the BTS for whichever way you're going. Both are super safe, super cheap, air-conned and don't get stuck in traffic. They do get busy - but the airport is the first stop so you get a seat....
Fastest way to get to BKK or to the Airpot. This service is great, cheap fast and frequent, easily the quickest way to and from the airport specially from central BKK.

Good if alone. As with all rail links it starts to get expensive when more than one of you and the taxi becomes more convenient. However it's comfortable, quicker than a taxi (as long as your destination is close to the sky train).

Cheap and very convienent, can be crowdy during the day. Beats getting a taxi. Can be crowded, as they have stopped the express service due to rolling stock shortage. Every train is a slow train, which stops at al stations. So a lot of Thai commuters use it.

Safe and feel secure. compare with BTS, it had to be wait longer sometimes but feel safer and quicker to get to air port. The price is cheap and can enjoy the great view of bangkok so one must try unless have many packages.

The best way to get to and from the airport. Travelling by car/bus/taxi is at best unpredictable in Bangkok. You can be in traffic for hours..... Literally! Unless you arrive late at night, use the airport link....it is by far the best way.

The airport Rail Link is a, cheap and in-expensive way to go to and from the airport. The Airport Rail Link is a much better service than the normal rail link. The train is super fast to and from the airport, and much less cost than taxis. Be very careful of the low cost hotels in Bangkok as they charge as much as $58 usd to and from the airport, which is a good distance from downtown by the time you pay the hotel shuttles or taxis you could stay in a nicer hotel with free shuttle and/or take the sky train to and from the airport.

Convenient way to travel. I've taken this train 2x now to the international airport. It was super clean, super easy to use and very easy to connect from the BTS station in our area. From Chit Lom station it took about an hour. It was well worth it; I'd rather be on sitting on this train than sitting in traffic. We will be happy to use it again and recommend it highly to friends.

well price. efficient ride at very low cost 45 baht compared to KLIA Express whose price had shot up to $55Ringgit. Signage and direction easy to follow and a very cheap way to get to town. Coaches are celan roomy and not too crowded.Trip to city about 30mins with no traffic chaos

Price is right.. easy to buy tickets. safe to ride. better than an untrustworthy cab driver. Remember to hang onto the plastic disc you get as you need to put it in the exit gate when you leave the Rail Link Station.
The only way to go. If you are tired of taxis and toll charges and airport surcharges and traffic. Take this option definitely.

Crowded, but efficient!. I cannot have more to web the other said about this transport in Bangkok... It is getting more and more crowded every year, but it is still in one of the best way to go around!
Airport Rail Link. Convenient and smooth travelling to airport from Phaya Thai Station. Only 7 stations away(approx. 30- 45mins). Better than taking taxi to avoid traffic jam.

Excellent. Used the airport link on our first arrival ever in Bangkok. Extremely easy to use, clean and so cheap compared to haggling for taxis we found this so convenient. Would highly recommend if your hotel is close to an airport link station. We did it with 4 of us and huge suitcases with ease.
Best way to get into the city. Cheap and easy. Located on the bottom floor of the airport. Less than 100 baht, cheaper than any taxi.

Efficient Airport to Bangkok Link. Bought a ticket from the machine which gives you change and a travel token for 40baht, less than a £1 for a fast efficient and clean ride to the centre of Bangkok. Because the train track is elevated you can admire the views on your way

Fast way into central Bangkok. If you want to get into central Bangkok from the main international airport, don't waste you money on taxi's. Its just 2 US dollars on the rail link whereas the airport taxis will cost you 70 Bucks. Now that an expensive taxi ride. Use the airport link. Its very fast, very clean and amazing cheap. It connects with BTS Skytrain, which allows you to get to most parts of Bangkok.

Must use!. Do not let the feeling of using a train in a foreign country scare you. That's what the taxis want and because of this you are overcharged by a taxi.The train is new, clean, relaxing and so cheap.

High safety regulations, fast way to the airport.. Airport rail link can be connect to skytrain at PhayaThai station of BTS and Makasan station of MRT. It comes every 10 - 15 minutes and take 30 minutes from the city to the airport. There is security checking before we going in the train. The cost is very cheap, only 45 THB from city to airport.
Great!. Very cheap and clean. Easy way to get from the airport to the center of Bangkok, instead of spending a lot of money in taxi. Really suggested!

Super cool! great for budget travellers. Currency in notes is accepted at the ticket booth. unlike other stations where only coins have to be put in.safe..and time saving...and cheap if you are a budget traveller and wish to use a less expensive mode of transport from or to the airport.

Great if you're not too tired when you get to Bangkok. We decided to try the airport link instead of getting a taxi from Suvarnabumi Airport Bangkok and we were pleasantly surprised. The airport link runs to Phaya Thai, where we changed to the Sukhumvit line. There wasn't a problem with any of it, and within about 45 minutes we arrived at Nana, where we got off to go to the nearby hotel. If you haven't got too much baggage, and aren't too tired after a long flight, I would definitely recommend it as it's very cheap and probably quicker than a taxi. But we were shattered, had two heavy suitcases which we had to lug up and down stairs, and it was boiling hot. In those circumstances it might be easier to get a taxi.

Mindblowiiiing . It is such a mindblowing journey to the airport which takes only 30 minutes on city line and 15 on express line. Everyone should take this to avoid the traffic which takes almost 2 hours to get to airport
Best way to travel! . Very clean, comfortable and cheap! Easy to get the airport without traffic jam! Also can see the city. Nice to be here 2 times!
Super efficient train service!. The skytrain in Bangkok city is so simple a 5 year old child could use it (and afford it!). It is better than any train in my own city (sydney).

cheap and fast way to get to accommodation in bangkok. it cost us 100 baht to get to the furthest stop on the railway, and the service was easy and fast. would definitely recommend instead of taking a taxi as it is cheaper and avoids all of the traffic
Forget airport buses and taxis - this is the way to get to BKK city. Cheap, fast, comfortable, reliable. Beats traffic and high taxi prices. I'd take this EVERY time. Connects to BTS at Phayathai.

"Fast, convenient and cheap". I had used the airport rail link from Phayathai station to Survarnabhumi airport and found it as a very convenient way to go to the airport. The service starts at 6 am till 12 pm and it leaves every 5 minutes (on time) from the station. It took me about 30 min from Phayathai to Survarnabhumi. The price is cheap (45 thb) compared to the taxi and also considering the distance. Also, there is some space for luggage inside the train. Bottom line: Consider it when you don't have many luggage for faster and cheaper ride to the airport enjoying magnificently beautiful view of Bangkok.

quick rail to the city from BKK airport. This is a no brainer if you have a Bangkok layover and want quick access to the city and the BTS subway system for a quick tour. The BTS goes right to the Chao Praya River tourist boat station for a multi-stop way to see the city highlights.
Mr Jayanta Sen. A very excellent communication between the airport and the city. The magnificent view of the city from the train is breath taking.

Fast, easy if you don't have many bags. Fast, clean and easy however it can very crowded with local travelers as you get closer to true city. If you have more than one bag crowds can be a problem. More often than not you will still have to catch a taxi to your hotel from your destination station.If you have just landed after a long flight take a taxi to your hotel. With two people it is about 100 THB more expensive( ( 3-4 USD or Euros ) and you will be taken directly from the airport to your hotel without the hassle of changing trains and then transferring to a taxi to get to your hotel.
up above from the traffic. traffic in bangkok is horrible in rush hour . luckily they have airport metro which takes half the time to reach your destination. it is fast and cheap and runs frequently.

Super Convenient Fast Cheap From Airport to City. The Bangkok Airport link is the way to go if you are looking to save some money getting into the City. The Bangkok airport link takes you Phaya Thai Sukhumvit Line and takes around 25-30 minutes to get from the Airport to the Sukhumvit BTS Line which will take you practically anywhere in the city. If you have a couple of large bags no problem as there is space on the train for them.
The Great Escape!. We used the link to quickly get out of the airport area due to auto traffic. Worked out very well. Traffic is tough in Bangkok

avoid taxi mafia by taking the Airport Rail Link. Great connection between Bangkok and the SuvarnabhumiCheap and quick, no hassle with taxi mafia or other who want to extort your money. The only downside are the jammed hallways when people try to get on and off the train to the escalator- big mess and crowded, not well planned. but overall great thing
Quick and Affordable. Easy to access and fuss-free in the morning. Arrived around 10am. Cost 45 THB from the airport to Phya Thai district.

Avoid the traffic jams to get to Central Bangkok.. For single or couples or families traveling to Bangkok, most inexpensive means of transportation. The Airport Rail Link takes you into Central Bangkok and connects with the BTS.

Excellent way to get to and from the Airport. This is a really quick, convenient and economical way to travel between the airport and the city (and points in between). There is plenty of space for luggage too. I often stay in the Huamark area and can get there from the airport in about 15 minutes at a cost of around 30 baht (about a dollar).It certainly pays to have a hotel close to one of the stations. The Nasa Vegas in Huamark comes to mind, and it is actually connected to Ramkamheng station by a covered overhead walkway. Can't get much more convenient than that.

Fast and good price to access city. You can use Airport Rail Link to come to Bangkok city center area from Suvarnabhumi Airport. This is the fastest and cheapest way. Morning and Evening it is very crowded with local day to day office travelers.

Convenient. The airport link was a great way to get from the airport to near our hotel, we were lucky our hotel was near the stop, but anyway think it connects with the skytrain network to go over areas.

No Express. I moved to Bangkok, deliberately close to Makassan Station in 2014, when the Airport Link Express was available. Sadly no more. In place, you can travel to the airport via the City Line which runs along the same route. However, the City Line makes several stops. There are 5 stops between Makassan and the airport, with a journey time of around 35-40 minutes.The cost is very low, only 35 THB one way so much cheaper than a taxi.The bad news is that hundreds of cummuters use the same train, so if you are traveling with suitcases, allow a LOT more time, especially if you plan to take the journey at peak times. Chances are that you will NOT get on the first train you are waiting for. The train does stop inside the airport, so not too much more traveling - apart from getting from B1 level to Level 4.

Fun and Exciting. I was on a short trip to Thailand and happen, since its my very first time to be in Thailand I wanted to treasure every single moment I'm there. First, i wanted to try the culture and the sights. To be able to reach Siam Center where most of the sights can be seen, I had a trip with the rail link. It was cheap, fast and very convenient. I has a passage right inside the their International Airport. Accessible and comfortable. And it is very easy to get to where you wanted to as Rail itself has operator with english and thai speaker.It was very fun and adventurous for me as a first time traveler in Thailand.

So beats a taxi to Suvarnabhumi. I was fortunate enough to stay at a hotel very near a BTS on the Airport Rail Link line and getting to the airport couldn't have been easier. Or cheaper at 30 baht. I might even let it influence my hotel choice on my next visit as getting back and forth to the hotel was just so darn easy.

Best way to go to the airport!. This is the best way to travel to and from Suvarnabhumi Airport. It's very cheap, you will be able to avoid bad traffic (shorter travel time), it's is connected to BTS Skytrain so you can go around the city.

Airport - City.. A good idea to beat the traffic jams, especially after a long flight. Easily accessible, cheap, and definitely the fastest way into Bangkok city centre.
Integration with the BTS system could probably be improved further.
Very easy to use to get from the airport to Bangkok. Very easy to use to get from the airport to Bangkok for only 35 Baht,if you get of at Makkasan it is quite easy to switch to the Metro.

Reliable and more convenient than i thought. forgot to book a taxi to go to the airport for my flight in the morning. decided to try out the airport link. was not packed and was satisfied with the price. if you dont have a lot of luggage, i would recommend this.

Easy Access to City and to Airport. I used this transport from my hotel to the city.
It has connection to city BTS system at Phaya Thai station.
The train itself very clean and information provided inside is great because it is in dual language (Thai and English).
The fare is not expensive though.
Fast easy and efficient . Excellent service. Very cheap and fast. Security check each carriage prior to boarding which is reassuring.
Always reliable, quick, comfy, though overcrowded at times. Always take the Rail as it is timely, though overcrowded at times but better then taxis waiting in traffic jam

Good way to go to the airport. In my personal opinion this rail link is better than a taxi because you won't get stuck in a traffic jam, and I hate getting stuck in a traffic jam when you need to catch a plane. My GF doesn't agree because often (depending on your hotel) you have to transfer from the BTS or Metro to the Rail Link, and with luggage this can be a hassle.
Excellent facility. The rail takes you directly from Suvarnabhumi to Bangkok. Very very convenient and cheap. Only during rush hour faced inconvenience but that can't be helped. Cheap and best ! :)

Efficient means of transport from airport to city. Very convenient and efficient transport from the airport to the city. Only 45 bahts for one way. Train is clean and punctual and takes half an hour to reach the Phaya Thai station where you can take the BTS. Only problem is that many of Bangkok's train stations are not user friendly because there are no lifts or escalators, only stairs. Its a challenge for the seniors and those with loads.

So cheap!!!. Compared to the airport train service in KLIA, Airport Rail Link in BKK is waaaayyyy much cheaper, faster and more convenient. Truly impresses as this was my 1st time using this service in BKK.
Easy access from airport to hotel. quick easy efficient way of getting into central Bangkok from the airport, cheaper too and air conditioned

Easy Way To Get To/From The Airport. This is by far the best way to/from the airport. I took a taxi the day I took several trips to/from the airport via taxi- all of my drivers were either lost or expensive. The one day that I had enough time to plan it all out and figure out my travel was the day that I actually used the Airport Rail Link. It was 42THB to get from the subway to the intersection with ARL and 15THB to get to the airport. Less that $2 USD and I actually got there in time. It was a little crowded but everyone was polite.
easiest way to get to the city. From the Airport to city center is maximum 45 bath and about 25 minutes! take the elevator at the airport to B (-2) florr there is the Airport link station.

The most convenient and fastest way to and from Airport - Bangkok city vicinity. I took Airport Rail Link in my recent biz trip. It was hassle free and cheap. Most importantly I was able to avoid chaotic traffic jam during the rush hours. Highly recommend this way of traveling during the rush hours even though where you stay doesn't have one station very near you. You should just take taxi to the nearest Airport Rail Link station for a fast connection ride to the Airport.

Easy and cheap. Best way to get to central Bangkok to avoid traffic. Used this on my recent visit and found it really easy to get to Sukhumvit area (via one change). Cost about £2 in total. Found it got pretty busy during commuting times. Clean, easy, cheap, avoids rip off taxis that charge a fortune and most importantly gets there quicker as no traffic!

Good way to go to the city. Every time I visit Bangkok, the worse part is to take taxi because it seems I was always have the luck to meet some drivers with "character", such as sending you to shopping place rather than the address you asked for, or bargaining with you about the taxi rate in the mid of no where rather than charging by meter. Airport Rail Link is my favourite means of transport if I'm not travelling with a group.The connection between BTS and Airport Rail Link is easy and direct, they don't have elevator/escalator for the "down" direction within the station though.
Excellent. Most convenient and quickest way to get to the city. Runs regularly and is priced well. Lots of space and air conditioned.
very good !!!!. the ride is short ,nice and comfortable. it was nice to see another side of bangkok , with aera that i didn't see befor
Great service. Easy alternative to get to all BTS stations. 45 baht per person one way (less than $2 AUD). Great way to travel.Air conditioned and a great way to get a look at Bangkok.

A worthwhile alternative to Taxi's. We have always taken a Taxi from the airport until the last time when a queue of around 200 people made us consider the train.
We were very surprised at how easily taking the Airport Rail Link actually was and have decided to always take this as a complete alternative to Taxi's.

Best way from airport to the city!. It's a lot cheaper than using taxi and no traffic jamming but make sure you check their schedule first because it takes quite some time for each one. But the sound of the door is super loud and scary, plus the seat is not so comfy yet it's okay compare to the price :)

Best way of travel in Bangkok. The BTS train is the best way to travel in Bangkok. It avoids
major traffic jams and frequent stalled traffic. Available to most parts of the city
Excellent way to get into town. The train wil take you inte the centre of Bangkok in about 30 minutes. It connects with both Skytrain and Metro.

Easy and cheaper than a taxi from airport!. Very easy to use. Simple neded 45 baht. It is spacious and air con makes it very cool. Exits at end station could be a little clearer or where the exits lead to. But overall a useful service in Bangkok!

Fastest access to Suvarnabhumi airport. Excellent mode of transportation in going in and out of airport. The airport rail link is located right inside the airport terminal (at lower level). Very easy to find. Just follow the clearly posted signs inside the airport.

Takes Longer Than You Expect. I decided to try the train going back to the airport to save money and see how well it worked. Even though I was in the central business district I had to make 3 changes of trains. The other passengers look at people with baggage as a nuisance. You may have to drag bags up stairs in several places because there are no elevators close. I just barely got to the airport in time to catch my flight - it took 1.5 hours. If you want to use the train stay away from rush hours, like 8-10 am and 4-7 pm.

Great way to get to hotel from the airport. Just ensure you have THB handy to buy your tickets as no Credit Card accepted..really clean, handy and regular service. Easy to access. Pity we couldn't get the train back from city to the airport due to a very early flight, so just check operating hours. Good value if you can manage.

aware traffic during peak rush hour. early morning and after 5.00pm - 7.00pm are not suitable to get in unless your destination was from airport directly to Phayathai station. Lots of local are get into downtown as well as you are. Big luggage may not fit to get in the train.

Quick and efficient but not especially comfortable . Trains are quick and inexpensive but if you are traveling with luggage it isn't particularly suited. Very few seats and when you transfer to MTR or BTS you have to deal with lots of stairs. Taxis in Bangkok are very inexpensive so unless it's prime rush hour I would go by taxi.
Good Transport. The Airport Rail link connects you from one to the other end of Bangkok in the BTS station. was extremely useful!

Very Modern and clean. I am very amazed on how clean their trains were. It is very fast and a great way for some tourists with a tight budget. It also connected from Airport to Central. Main attractions are usually near the station
Recommended for traveller. I recommend this because is easy and fast from Airport going to heart of Bangkok this is the best unlike the Taxi cab it takes forever.

Very fast and cost effective.. If you are staying downtown and need to travel to the airport during the day, then I would recommend this as a good money and timesaving option. You can avoid the traffic during the day and the train is usually pretty empty. So it isn't much of a hassle with luggage. I think if you arrive at night, then a taxi will be just as fast, but cost more than 300 baht to the airport.

My first trip on this train.. whilst taking a friend to the airport I noticed the enormous queue of traffic heading for Bangkok and so I resolved to take the Sky Train on the return journey.It's all relatively straight forward to access although there could be a little more instruction on purchasing the token ticket from the kiss.The train was clean and very quickly becomes crowded as it progresses towards the city. To Asok it was only one change and very smooth although I wouldn't want to be lugging heavy suitcases with me.

Very convenient. It is very accessible from the airport going to my hotel in the city to catch the airport link train. Its costs 45 baht from the airport going to phaya thai station. From there is a BTS station which will bring me to my hotel. VERY CONVENIENT...

A direct link to the airport.. From Phaya Thai which is very close to Victory, the rail link takes around 30-40 mins. It costs around 45baht to reach the airport from there. Train comes at regular intervals
Regular, efficient service. I have used this line a few times in the past month and have found it to be a clean, efficient way to travel around Bangkok.

Easy to use, quick and pleasant way to get into Bangkok. Clean well run and low price light rail service into Bangkok. Sometimes there are express trains with very few stops into Bangkok - so it's a quick ride.

Easy, cheap way to travel to City and Airport. Forget the roads! Just go the train! It was like 19 baht and 30 mins to get to the end of the line to Phaya Thai station. After customs at the airport just follow the signs for the Airport Rail Link. You can connect to the BTS lines at a few different stops. The Airport Rail Link and BTS aren't part of the same system, so you'll have to buy tickets for BTS separately.

Avoid the traffic . Bangkok's traffic is notorious for its congestion. By taking the airport rail link you get to the city in about 30 minutes. It's easy to use,but can be crowded. It is easy to find a taxi near the station to your final destination. It does link up with other public transportation but I'm not certain what I'm links up with.
Fast service. Travelling on ARL enable us to get to our hotel within 20 minutes which to me is a bonus. So you can certainly avoid traffic by taking this.

What a great alternative to taxis. We were always stuck with taxis and limos and now with this mode of alternative transportation, you can get to the airport at a fraction of the cost. If you aren't carrying too much luggage this is the way to go.

fast and rapid. the best way to travel in the crowded streets of Bangkok. fast, safe and no traffic jam. the best way from and to the airport and all for just THB 35. the taxis is much more stressful and slower. take the airport link and catch a taxi if needed downtown.
Quick way to reach city center. I have stopped using taxi....little taxing to change stations from airport link to MRT or BTS with heavy luggage else quickest way.

Price and Time Efficient commute. If you are traveling light and are not very far from Bangkok city, then the Airport link is ideal, it may not be necessary the cheapest mode but if you have a lot of time to wait and on a very serious low budget then maybe there are a few more options but again the Airport link is the way to go and come out of the airport to reach several regions of the city.Best wishes

Quick Cheap and efficient. Arrived at Bangkok airport and was easy to follow the signs to the rail link, we used it to Ramkhamhaeng and it took around 15 minutes and cost around 30 THB I think - I would use it again
It's good. It's fast, clean and on time. If you want to avoid the traffic in Bangkok during rush hours, this is not a bad choice at all, especially to get to Suvarnabhumi Airport.
slow but a good day. the train was on time leaving but construction made my trip slow, the ride was a good experience traveling around Thailand, slow but sure I suppose
Excellent. It is not well advertised in guidebooks, but it is the best way to get around! Very fast and clean. It is way faster that taxis and cheaper!

Faster than a taxi and lots cheaper.
