I have been to Bangkok quite a few times over the years and have been waiting for this to be up and running.I was there again in June 2015 and took this Airport link for the very first time. It links up with the BTS in central Bangkok so that you can speedily arrive to most areas in Bangkok straight from the airport at a very cheap price.It is very easy to find from the main BKK airport and there are very regular trains all day. I was in my hotel half an hour after stepping of the plane. If I had done my usual transfer of using a taxi, I would have had to queue up at the taxi desk for an official taxi chit, (so that the price is fixed and you don't get ripped off), and then been in the taxi for some 20 to 30 minutes to reach central Bangkok and then another 30 to 40 minutes sitting in traffic trying to reach my hotel through the all day, everyday, gridlocked traffic.Well done Bangkok, this is a very usefull and helpfull transport system.
Perfect way to travel. Easy, cheap and fast, what more to say!We always stay in the area around PhayaThai/Siam on our visits to BKK just because of the AirPort Link and the BTS

A hard airport rail link. Bangkok ARL is a crowded airport link, every station had a lot of people alighting and boarding, if you carry a lot of luggages, oh, you'll become a can of sarden. I don't think it's fast, but it's cheap. It took 1.5 hours from SUVARNABHUMI Airport to MBK, when I left Bankgkok, just 45 minutes by meter taxi. Also, 90% stations were no elevator or a only a out of service lift. We need to take our luggages stairs up and down. What's a wounerful airport express ?

Cheap and fast.. We used this train but not to airport.But from our hotel to main airport in Bangkok only took 20 mins.Trains run very frequently from airport into down town bangkok and are very clean.

Why fight the Bangkok traffic when you can travel by train?. this is absolutely the best way to get from the airport to Central Bangkok. It is fast, efficient and cheap. I have done the trip all the way to National Stadium with an 18 kg backpack and another bag and had no problems. Heading back out to the airport you are almos guaranteed a seat.

A quick link into the city. First time I used the Airport Link and it was easy to get to, well signposted, cheap to use and faster to get into the city than getting a taxi. A good option if you're happy to carry you're luggage with you.

So easy to use if you are going downtown. To go the entire length is 45 baht, a taxi about ten times more.The self serve ticket machines are easy as long as you can read a map and determine which station you need to get off, be sure to tap English, if you can't read Thai . And the staff is generally pretty good if you need to buy a ticket or ask a question
Cheap and easy. Takes about 20 minutes to get to BKK to connect with Sky Train. costs about 200BHT but if you have bags there are many stairs between interchanges.

Avoid taxis. The public transportation in Bangkok -- BTS and MRT are super. We took the airport link from the airport to the BTS nd it was very easy and convenient. We will take this train back to the airport as well.
Fast and clean. Had a short ride on the train, it took us around 45minutes to reach the city center, fair enough for the price.

The only good thing is the journey time. The only good thing is the journey time... in the sense that you can calculate around 35 minutes from end to end.The express line has ceased operations and only the city line is running, meaning stops at all stations (which is ok) but still quite fast.The problem with the city line is that the platforms and trains have not been designed to bring people to the airport. There is no way to get your suitcase from the street or bts level to the train and vice versa.... The Airport link has a lot to learn from Hong Kong in terms of accessibility...Furthermore the getting a taxi from the end station (Phaya Thai) is not so easy. The taxis waiting at the taxi stand and Airport link lady which assigns you a taxi are corrupt and refuse to use the meter. Its not a 1 time case because it has happened to me 3 times already. Its best to drag your suitcase to the street and hail a passing taxi.Hopefully Bangkok will improve all the trains BTS, MRT, and airport link to be more airport passenger friendly.

ONLY if you are on a supreme budget. If you have luggage, you will take multiple sets of long stairs (4) and escalators (5), have to walk outside in the heat to transfer stations (they do not connect directly between the BTS, MRT and Rail Link!) and then find that it is standing room only for half an hour or so, and often packed to the gills. Then another long trip up escalators to get to your airlines. Truly horrid.

Inexpensive and effective way to avoid rush traffic. If you arrive or depart at time of day with lots of road traffic this is a perfect way to 'fly' past all traffic jams. Absolutely worth it and even if you do not get a seat it is still a quick and convenient way of getting to/ from Suvarnabhumi Airport. From now on I'll think twice before opting for a taxi.

Great connection to the city. Taking the Airport Link makes the trip to the city of Bangkok quiet fast. The final stop of the Airport Ling is a BTS train stop, close to the Asia Hotel, which is a great place to stay by the way.In earlier times I used cabs from the airport to the city but now only the Airport link.

Brilliant way to get to airport.. This is a cheap and brilliant way to get to the airport particularly during the road traffic busy times. The only downside is if you have too much luggage which is difficult to manage on potentially busy Sky Trains before you join the Airport Rail Link.

The best way!. We used the Airport Rail Link (also called Citylink) numerous times during our trip, and found it to be an excellent resource.It probably takes about half an hour to travel the whole length to Phaya Thai, but must be so much quicker than car travel. It costs 45 THB (less than £1) to travel from end to end, and is so easy to use. It does get very busy, so get a seat when you first get on, and if travelling with cases you do need to keep them beside you.

Fast trip to airport. If you don't have a lot of baggage this is a fast and easy way to get to BKK airport. Very easy to transfer between BTS Skytrain and rail link at Praya Thai Station. Much cheaper than taxi, only about 90 baht from PrayavThai to airport, and just as fast or faster than a taxi to downtown.

Super convenient!!. Bangkok's humidity can be so cruel. Thanks to this transport, getting to the city from the airport is easy, breezy and cheap! Reminder though to future BKK travellers, make sure you arrive not later than 10:30pm coz last trip is at 11:30. Just like the trains and subways in the city, Airport rail closes at 12midnight and opens at 5:30am. FYI

Fast & Efficient. The Airport Railway Link was fast and efficient for people to get to the BKK Airport. It just cause a little to get to the airport compared to getting a cab. The speed is really amazing fast. Really enjoyed it. There's also plug built in inside the train at some corners which allows people to have their gadgets charged when they are on the train! Cheers!

not super quick, but is super cheap!. Getting from the airport to town can be costly by taxi. This is a good option, if you don't mind riding on the train with your luggage and if your hotel is easily accessed from the train, like ours was.
Best option to reach city from airport. We took the ARL from Suvarnabhumi airport to Makassan. It is fastest, convenient and cheapest way to reach the city. Good trains and stations.
Fast. When arrived at Airport, just go down, then buy a ticket. Faster and cheaper than taxi. Even If you have a huge luggage.

No Taxi needed. You don't need a taxi in Bangkok. They are to slow due to the traffic jam in Bangkok. Use instead the train. Fast an cheap. Before you begin your travel go and make a screen shot or download the map with all lines available. Helps you to plan your travel. Identify before your travel begins which line you have to take after leaving the Airport Rail Link after leaving it at its final station in Bangkok. Doing so will help you to spare money.

Fast, value for money and efficient.. Good mode of transport from airport to town. It can be alittle crownded therefore if you have big luggage it s a bit squeezy. Easy to get on from airport however from makassan at peak hours could take you 1 or 2 trains Because its crowded. Usually frequency every 15/20 minutes wirh a journey of 25/30minutes if u take the multi stop train. The train arrive at one of the mrt station and you can connect through the mrt and bts subsequently.

Excellent mode of transport to airport. Its a great way to get to the airport if you don't have too much luggage. It takes about 30 minutes to get to the airport from Phayathai BTS station, especially during the day time when traffic can be manic. This is however only to Suvarnapomi airport!
Used Several Times. I have used the Airport Link several times to get to the airport to meet people. It is a little longer than a taxi but very convenient to the Skytrain and not expensive.
Give it a try. Best way to travel into bangkok.It is so easy to follow the signs buy the ticket and get to bangkok central in 20 min.No need to bargain with the taxi drivers..

A great way to travel to the airport at the start/end of your holiday to Bangkok. The airport link is always busy. Add in normal computers with travellers and their luggage and it can get chaotic but wow it's a great way to start your holiday.Cheaps and quick, and cleaner than B500 that would will be changed by a normal taxi.
Best way to get the bkk. Must do. Skip the taxis and head for the arl. Cheaper and quicker than any other way to bkk. All rail lines are quick cheap and clean.

dont bother with a taxi. I have been coming to Thailand on and off for 25 years and now the newer airport is built it has become nearly impossible to get a taxi from suvarnabhumi. everytime I get into the taxi area the queue is back into the airport .so get yourself down to the basement and catch a train .for 40 baht you get to the skytrain terminal.no brainer really

Easy to use but a ways to get to it from the airport. I chose the City Line Airport Rail Link when I saw the ridiculous length of the taxi line. It's easy to use 45 baht to the end where you switch lines. You have to walk a ways to get to the train and then also the restrooms which are on the same floor but at the very end, since it might be a long trip depending on where you are going. Escalators the whole way until to exit the train and switch lines.

Still alright. In comparison to the airport link in Hong Kong, this one is considered so-so. If you are on a budget and not in a hurry, take the airport rail link. The train is not the fastest but it get's you to the city. Seats are a little on the small side and with passenger's luggage, it can get a little cramp. Other than that, great for travellers on a budget.

On time and Cheap and Safe. use Airport link to down town, Bangkok, it take about 45 Min, for about 40 - 60 Baht per Pax, it will arrived on Time, and if you take Taxi , if you Luck will take you about 300 - 400 Baht, by metre, if you met a bad drive will cost you 2,000 Baht. or more.
Faster way to entire City. It is very easy way from Airport to City if you not have more stuff on your trip. You can take Airport Rail Link only 25-30 minutes to City...

Efficient transportation to/from airport. If you're traveling to/from Suvarnabhumi airport, take the airport link instead. It's so much cheaper than taxi, much faster during peak hours, and pretty convenient when you're already inside the train. The stations are easy to navigate and there are lifts for your luggages too. The taxi in the station left nothing to be desired though. They will ripped you off big time! They will try to go the long way round even though your hotel is only 3km away from the airport link station plus they will add 50baht into the fare. I'm not sure if that is correct or not but i felt ripped off because i paid 3 times as much in fare between going to the airport link station and returning from the airport link to the hotel (50 baht going to the station and 180 returning from the station). The driver was a hoon too! He drove so fast and the music was really loud boom boom thing!
Speedy and cheap. Best and cheapest option for solo travelers or couples without a lot of luggage to get into the city from Suvardnabumi airport. Choose a hotel near a City Link station.
Pretty easy to use & quick. The taxi line was too long, so decided to take the train - it was pretty easy & fortunately deposited me in front of my hotel after changing trains to the metro
only way to travel Bangkok. Best way around Bangkok and beats the trafficVery clean, cheap,train every 5 or 10 minutes,stops at all major attractions and easy accessible

Great Way to Get Around Bangkok. The BTS stretches right through the middle of Bangkok. You also have access to the MRT (underground subway) via the BTS. We traveled from one end to the other on a daily basis. There is a map of the stops at every station and you can purchase tickets through the machine or ticket counter.

Good and quick way to get to and from Bangkok to the airport. 1st of all, this is not an attraction. It is part of the transportation infrastructure. If you're looking for a inexpensive and quick way to get to and from the airport AND do not have a lot of luggage, definitely give this a try. The airport station is located at the lower level of the international terminal. Although there was/is an express train it is not always running and quite a bit more expensive. Take the City Train and get off at Makasan Station or continue on to . It's about a 15 minute to 20 minute ride with all stops. From Makasan Station, follow signs to the covered walkway leading to the MRT (subway Petchaburi Station). It's a bit of a walk but easy and safe. The MRT connects to the Skytrain (BTS) one stop away at Sukhumvit Station. Please note you will need to buy a new fare when transfering from the Airport Link to either the BTS or MRT but fares are very reasonable.
Great connection to the city. I spent around 45 Baht, and it took me about 20 minutes to get to the city. It also has a great connection to the BTS and MRT.

Convenient and cheap. Airport Rail link is the most convenient and cheap way to reach city/airport with the hassle of traffic and tolls. We used the city line and got down at Makkasan station and then took MRT to Sukhumvit to reach our hotel .
Airport Rail to City Bangkok. Take to train cheaper and faster then taxi from Makkasan or at the end of the line or just connect to other line
Very Nice And Clean Transportation....... We took the Rail Link 2-times and the experience was very pleasant. Very clean and safe. Not your typical New York Subway.....
Easy access to the city. it takes about half an hour from the airport to the city, it's easy and convenient, but they used to have an express line that would only take 15mins, now it's stopped.
Clean, efficient, easy to use - cheap. clean efficient and easy to use - best part is that is is cheap!!!Also links to other train lines that are close to most major hotels that tourists stay in

Mr . Efficient and effectively convenient. Very affordable . Makes getting around very much a possibility. The station was well positioned for me to get off and walk to my hotel located on the same road.
Fantastic service. Its a very good way to reach the city and very user friendly. You would just need 10 baht to reach your destination.

Best way to reach downtown from airport. Arrived late at night in Suvarnabhumi Airport so I decided to stay and take the first Airport Link at 6:00am. Very convenient and quick, only 20 minutes and I arrived in Makkasan Station to transfer to the MRT.

Great train system!. Have used this train a few times now. Fast, reliable service from the airport. The only downside being that there doesn't appear to be a lift at the connecting BTS station at Phaya Thai, which gets you to down town city, so if you have lots of heavy luggage, bear in mind that you'll have to carry it up about 60 steps to the platform level. (If I'm wrong on this can someone let me know!?)
Quick, Easy Trip to the City.. Quick, Easy Trip to the City without having to worry about the Bangkok traffic... you never wait long for a train they are always clean and have Air Con... and cheap :)

Crowded but fast. The airport link connects the airport to the main skytrain line. It is very crowded, with tourists carrying bulky bags and suitcases. It is also costlier than the other skytrain lines. Still, it is the fastest way to and from the airport.

Convenient and quick. The ARL is easy to find at the airport and must be the quickest way into town. It is also cheap relative to similar links in other cities. Trains run every 15 minutes and take about 25 min into town where it connects (a bit convolutedly) to the underground and monorail
Skytrain connect to the airport. this Skytrain will take you to the airport and inner Bangkok and it's take about half an hour to travel.
Best way to reach the airport and avoid Bangkok traffic. Cheap and traffic free way to reach the airport. Starts from Phaya Thai BTS station on the Sukhumvit Line.

Cheap and excellent. Great signage at airport to find this station; easy to use; cheap; fast; the only way to travel into Bangkok especially if you choose a hotel located close to one of the stations on the City Line
Easy to use. The airport rail link is an ideal way to get from the airport to your hotel as Bangkok traffic is usually pretty bad. Relatively cheap and easy to navigate.
Great way to travel. Recommended best way to get to the airport from the city. Connects to the sky train. Air conditioning and some racks for bags. Limited seating but plenty of space for standing

Easy commute into the city. Easy walk, clean, efficient and inexpensive. Luckily our stop was near the hotel we checked into Pathuwan Princess so we were able to avoid a taxi ride in the congested streets.

direct way to airport. This is the bast way to go to the airport quickly and cheap because there is the walkways link to the airport, so it's convenient for you to carry your bag and walk into the airport instead of paying higher cost on taxi.
Best way into and out of the city!. Don't bother taking the taxi and pay exorbitant prices to get into the city. The rail link takes you in under 30 minutes with no jams! The price - under 2 USD!!

Very quick but busy. Went to fetch my sister from suvanabhumi airport & decided as I was on my own this would be the quickest & cheapest way to get to the airport.the price is 45bht.from phaya thai skytrain station but I would not recomend it if you rush hour time as there are many comuters & there is not much room to put your lugage.

Good way to get in the city during rush hour. The airport like is connected with both MRT and BTS so you can get in the city in less than 30 mins during rush hour.At Makkasan station, down on 1st floor there is staff who will help you call the taxi without charge. You dont have to walk to the main road.
Quick and cheap . It's so much better to use than a taxi if you can as it's quicker and cheaper and gives you a better view coming into bangkok!

Fast and efficient transportation to and from the Airport. The Airport Link is a fast and efficient way to travel into Bangkok. This rain system connects to the BTS in Bangkok, which can take you all over the city. Bangkok is presently expanding this rail system, which will make it even better!

Why get ripped off by the Airport taxes, take the Airport Rail Link. On our second arrival at the airport (this time after our beach destination) we decided to try the Airport Rail Link into the city. We only had one bag between the two of us, so taking the rail link was easy to maneuver. Tickets can be purchased from vending machines before entering the station and the language can be switched to English. Our trip into the city cost only 35THB/person (Makkasan). The end of the line to Phyathia cost 45THB. Since we boarded at the airport there was no problem getting a seat. One item of note: after the arriving train empties, you will likely hear the security staff blowing their whistles advising people not to board as a security/trash sweep is made of the train before anyone is allowed to board, then the ‘all clear’ is given to board. It’s a hassle-free transport into the city. Also take into consideration if you need to transfer to BTS/MRT and/or where your hotel is located.{**Don’t get ripped off……If you are traveling with lots of luggage or have more than a few people in your party, then the taxi is likely your best option and if so demand a meter rate (as the dashboard meter is likely covered with a towel). This is what we experienced on our first trip from the airport as I tried to advise my friend of this scam, but he did not listen and this was the incident that transpired for us. The driver may give you a laminated card with price quotes and these are ‘suggested’ non-metered rates ( ie..450 charge+75 tolls+50 airport fee), but don’t settle for this either. You have likely already loaded your luggage into the taxi, after waiting in the taxi line, and now proceeding on your way out of the airport. If the driver still states no meter, then simply mention anything about contacting the Airport taxi police and ‘Walla’ the meter shows up and he will ask you to pay the toll fees and the airport service fee which is correct. Our actual taxi fare to our hotel from the airport was 230+75+50THB. Yes, this may not seem like a big deal, but the savings basically paid for a one hour massage!}

Fast, easy and cheap way to get from the airport and back. I was amazed at how easy it was to use the airpprt rail link service. It's easy to get tickets at vending machines, all announcements are in English. Convenient ramps are at every station. Lovely!

Excellent transportation from airport into the city. Excellent transportation from airport into the city. Very easy to buy the fare and take into downtown. Clean and quiet and tourist friendly. Provide good first glimpses of the city if you're just arriving. Easy connection to the Skytrain.
Why wouldn't you use this? !. Excellent transport link from airport to central bangkok. Cheap also. From there you can change to go where you want or get a taxi once in central.

Great way to get in the city . At 45 baht per person this is a great way for a small group of people to get into the city. If there is more than 4 of you the price is about the same as a taxi. I would also recommend this only for people with a small amount of luggage as it gets quite packed and especially if you need to transfer to the BTS.It is fast and efficient with services running every 15 minutes.I was also impressed that a security check was done in the train before we were able to board
save time. use the BTS to go anywhere in the city. saves a massive amount of time compared to taxis. Stops at midnight though...
Fast, easy and cheap!. Although the express train to Makkasan is not operating the train goes through there. Cheap and quicker alternative to get closer to town.

Fast, efficient, cheap . Why would anybody take a cab from the airport into central Bangkok? The train is a fraction of the cost and much much MUCH faster than sitting in traffic jams for hours. Only down side; no integrated ticketing with MRT or BTS.

Great Service, but you will need to purchase another ticket to ride BTS. Great service, quick and easy !! once you depart you will need to purchase another ticket from BTS to travel the other systems, but still easy to navigate.
easiest way to get to the airport. very convenient to get to the Airport all the time of the day and night you don´´t have to worry even on rushhourb

Take a yellow cab fron/to the Airport. The train journey is great once you are on the train but the service, express to Bangkok city centre is not very frequent as not many people use it. It leaves you at Makkasan Station which is difficult to manage and then you have to get a taxi in the traffic to your hotel anyway so doesn't save any time generally. If you take the MRT with you suitcases is very difficult as always full and when you reach your destination there is often no escalator and then you still need a taxi. Just get a taxi from Airport direct to Hotel, normally about 250/300 baht so not expensive. Trust me you will wish you had!!!
Quick and efficient way to transfer to/from airport. Trip from downtown Sukumvit took roughly 30 mins. Way faster and more efficient that taking the taxi during rush hour.
its cheap and convenient. it's thousand times better and cheap to take airport rail. avoid taxi and chose this mode of transportation

cheap and quick.. we used it on our way back from city center of bangkok to subkumvit airport and it was really good. you got to see also the poorer part of thailand on the way. on our second trip to bangkok we would use the train again instead of taxi.cost with taxi was 650 and with rail link 90.
Efficient. Definitely beats the jam. Signs and directions are clear, and it brings you strong to the airport. What more can you ask for? (:
Much better than a taxi. Its a much better way to get too and from the airport if you are staying in or near the city center and its definitely much cheaper and stress free.

Convenient!. Airport Rail Link system is a cheap, hassle free and easy way to travel from Bangkok Subornabhumi Airport to Phaya Thai, via transit at BTS to reach the city centre by avoiding the horrible traffic in Bangkok. It has several stations and stoppages to reach the final destination and crowded also. It’s convenient for you if don't have too many big bags.

No fuss straight to Downtown. Very convenient train from the airport to downtown, with NO traffic or rain surprises in your travel time.Most likely you need to connect to the BTS.Ask the lady at the information desk and get a map to mark your getoff station.Remember that you will need two tickets, one for the Rail link, the other from BTS, this latter you buy at the BTS station.
Best Way To Get To and From BKK. So convenient, so fast, and so inexpensive. If you get in before midnight and after 6:00 AM, this is T H E way to get to (or close to) where you need to go!
Easy and Economical. The Airport Rail Link is easily accessible and a very inexpensive mode of transportation from the airport into the city. It is easy to use and understand.
Fastest way to reach Airport. It takes approx 30-40 mins to reach Bangkok Airport from the city center area of Pratunam.They charge 80 baht and its the best way to reach Aiport
Convenient and quick. Very easy access that gets you directly into the airport by avoiding the crazy traffic in Bangkok. The price is reasonable and the ride is comfortable.
The fastest way from the city . Fortunately we decided to came to the airport by Link train the traffic was very bad I love this train The cabin is clean and he service is on time

Cheap way to travel from BKK airport to city. Cheap and convenient way to travel from BKK to city centre, via transit at BTS or Bangkok Metro ! fare is only Baht from BKK airport to final destination of Phaya Thai !
Excelent. This is the tipe of train that you wish for.Fast,ckean and with wifi ,i was very impressed about it.I give 10 of 10

Easy to use and cheap. Learn how. It will save you alot of time and money otherwise spent dealing with taxis.
I was delighted to get around town for 20-35 baht. Mix it with the city busses and you can avoid aggressive and overcharging taxi drivers.

Give it a try if staying in Bangkok. We've done this a few times now as we were getting fed up with the taxis outside the airport appearing to be regulated and then refusing to put the meter on and charging what they think they can get away with. It was clean, fast cheap and efficient with connections to the MRT and BTS systems in central bangkok being the biggest benefit f you know where your hotel is in relation to where you get off. Good if you don't have too many large bags and not far to walk, otherwise the benefit is eroded and you might as well take the taxi

Take a taxi!. They really need to have this better connected and with some lifts (people will undoubtedly have luggage it's an airport link!)If you need to head downtown you will need to change into the sky train BTS or down into the subway MRT. Changing over stations with luggage is a headache in Bangkok.If your in/out on business with no luggage and don't mind a walk then go ahead. But really for 300-400 take a taxi and get dropped at your destination. They have to make improvements.

Cheap and crowded- you get what you pay for. This is not an exclusive line that gets people from the airport to the city. It has stops in several other stations before you get to there. Coming from the airport, it's not that crowded but once you get to the stops, the train gets fuller and fuller, and this wasn't even rush hour. If you have a lot of luggage, it will be a hassle. But it only cost 40 THB compared to 400 THB for a taxi, so you get what you pay for.Just follow the signs at the airport and it's a pretty long walk but you'll get to the station. There was an attendant helping the people navigate the payment system. Just a note on the stations in the city proper: just because it was easy for you to maneuver your luggage around at the airport station doesn't mean it would be easy doing so once you're in the city. Crowded, uneven pavement await.
Easiest way to leave the airport!. If you can avoid taking a cab and the various fees attached to it, do consider the Sky Train. 40 bahts will get you in the city center in no time!

Fast Transport to the city. Two main points about the Airport Rail Link. 1. it's much cheaper than a taxi and 2. it's twice as fast as and other ground transportation into the city. I don't know how often it runs as I have never had to wait more than about 7 minutes for the next train.
Great Way to Get To The Airport. We used this with ease and it is very cheap. My parents and I travelled to our hotel when we arrived and returned back to the airport at the end of our holiday.

Just wonderful.. Check starting time for early check in. But clean and quiet. If you come from airport sometime hard to get a taxi - they just pass you if you go to faar in trafic jam time. Tack video ore picture and give police... One time a policeman helped us when he se 3 taxi not accept to go 8 km.
Efficient train system. Pretty affordable train connecting major train stations to the airport. Fast and efficient. There used to be an express train in the past.

Crowded, fast, and cheap!. I took the BTS to Phaya Thai then transferred onto the Airport Rail Link. It was really use to find and there were lots of signs. The cost of the train was 40b which is really cheap.There's 8 stops on the train, the last one being the Airport. The platform for the train was totally full of people. For the first three stops, more people just kept getting on until we literally couldn't move anymore on the train because we were so packed in. But the last two stops before the airport seemed to be where everyone was getting off. The last segment of the train ride was totally empty.If you have a lot of suitcases and you're heading out during rush hour, you might be better off getting a cab or Uber. When the train gets crowded you have to hold onto all your luggage the whole time to make space for people. As for carrying a backpack, a lot of people put them on their fronts to make sure no one can steal stuff out of the back of it.The train advertises as taking 30 mins and it really does take that exact time! Its a pretty fast and cheap way to reach the airport if you don't mind being crushed between a bunch of sweaty strangers.

Predictable timing, but calculate the overall trip time. Went in early Dec, but for some reason the "Express" train (skips stations) wasn't working, so between walking to station, buying ticket, waiting for a train, stopping at all stations, the time didn't feel much different than going for a taxi into the city. I honestly wouldn't mind paying 350thb for cab vs 50 thb for the airport link, although the time would be much more predictable during rush hour.

Downtown train. Fabulous, easy, clean, cheap, safe all as the previous report on the BTS public transport it can also meet at a specific BTS transport station to allow this switch of train line just download a map to assist your early navigation needs.

Great option for reaching your hotel. The Rail Link is good option for reaching your Bangkok hotel.Buy a small plastic token from the ticket booth and use it to get through the turnstile. That will take you to the Phaya Station, where you can transfer to a SkyTrain for onward travel to a station near your hotel.You'll need to buy a separate ticket for the SkyTrain (attendants in the booth can advise (in English) which ticket you need to purchase from the machine.

Very convenient and chesp. We travelled with 2 older teens & lots of bags to National Stadium. Regular trains, cheap, easy to use. Easy interchange at Phaya Thai to BTS Skytrain. But Skytrain terrible for disabled and prams. So many stairs. Maybe there is an elevator though - I didn't check. Recommended.
Airport trainlink. Beats taxi service by miles, fast and convenient link to the city. Fares are cheap, just a pity it only runs from 6am.

Fast, Cheap, but not for Lots of Luggage. The Airport Rail Link runs about every 10 to 15 minutes and is downtown in less than 15 minutes. During rush hours this is a big plus versus a taxi which can take up to 75 minutes. It is cheap for Hong Kong or western standards and naturally clean and comfortable. The only real problem is when you get off and want to get you hotel. You then have to switch to the metro or BTR port both. You may still have to tale a taxi. The logistics of changing from one system to the other is a lot of walking. You also have to pay again. Frankly, with luggage either have a taxi take you to/from the Airport Rail or skip it. If you are traveling light, no issue. It is not up to Hong Kong.
Efficient and Fast. if you're traveling in a group of 4 or more it is preferable to get a taxi.but if you're traveling party is less than 4 it is more convenient and more cost-efficient

Pretty busy link. The air conditioning was great but it was too busy on the train. It only runs every 15 minutes so check the schedule to be on time. They could benefit from a longer train with more seats.
A Great Service. Fantastic to have this option and easy connections with the BTS. Now please just get a similar service running to Don Muang airport!
Just go for it against the cab. This would take you from the airport to center of the city. Its very cheap and fast as compared to the road traffic

The more economical way to get to Bangkok's downtown area. My family of four would often choose the Airport Rail Link instead of taxi.We usually put up around the Pratunam area, and metered taxi fares from the airport to that area cost about 350 Baht, all-in. The Airport Rail Link to Phaya Thai will take about 45 minutes, at half the price.The direct non-stop train is permanently down until further notice - we have not seen that train in years.The journey to Phaya Thai is often crowded with locals who commute using the Airport Rail Link, as such getting a seat with your luggage may be quite a challenge. The train frequencies are at 15-30 minute-intervals, so make sure you allocate plenty of time. Most stations are not properly linked - Phaya Thai is the one that's connected the best - to the Phaya Thai BTS. We took once to Hua Mak and realised we had to perform an illegal crossing on the railway tracks to get to the nearest bus stop.That said, we found the Airport Rail Link to be bearable if we were to travel from Phaya Thai to Survanabhumi. We secretly wished that there would be greater improvements such as better connectivity, and increased frequencies (now that tourist numbers into Bangkok are steadily rising), but for the time being...we will choose this mode of transportation over taxis.

Great! . My hotel that I stayed at the beginning of the month was right at the Ramkhamhaeng station, and to go from there to Ratchaprarop was only 20 baht one way, and took only about 5 minutes. Was only 25 baht from Ramkhamhaeng to Phaya Thai. From Phaya Thai to Suvarnabhumi is only about a 20 or so minute ride, costing only 40 baht!
Take it!. Best way to get to Bangkok if you are staying along the BTSlines. Probably faster than a taxi, connects well to BTS at Phaya thai station.

So convenient . I stay just near Makkasan station and it only takes me approximately 20mins to get to and from the airport. There are still no express trains but that really isn't a problem. It's very cheap compared to a taxi and there's no need to put up with the traffic.

Much Better Than Taxi. The airport rail is super easy to use and a nice chance to see the city as you come into it. Also it's super cheap and easier to use than dealing with the Thai taxi drivers which can be very annoying and difficult. Only down side is you'll need to do a bit of walking, take a taxi or transfer to another train to get to your final destination, but well worth it considering how much you're saving.
efficient and cheap. Runs every 15 minutes and is the best way to go. It is faster than taking a taxi. We took it to the end and then paid a taxi to get to our hotel.
Very Easy And Tourist-Friendly. Navigating Bangkok from the airport is made much easier and stress-free because of the train connection.

Efficient mode of travel. What a great way to get to and from the BangkokAirport. It is efficient and inexpensive to take the airport rail link to connect to the Sky Train:It is a smooth 25-30 minute ride. No need to take a taxi from the airport.

Great way to get into city. The rail is located at the basement of the airport, easily accessed. Just to note not to board the train when it arrived immediately as there will be security check. Only thing is the train stations are not located very near any BTS station for transfer to hotels etc. nonetheless, better way to get into town.
Express Train Still Out of Service. Fast and cheap. From airport to Sukhumvit takes about 45 mins with changing to BTS at Phaya Thai. Better than to be caught in the famous traffic jam of Bangkok.
Excellent City Line Train. Amazing ride to PHAYA THAI station both ways. It only costs 45 Bhatts each way. The trains are very clean and on time services.

Convenient, Economical, Comfortable, Fast, Connectivity & Safe by Airport Rail Link. The Thailand Airport Rail Link is my preferred choice of transportation between the Suvarnabhumi Airport and downtown in Bangkok. It is most convenient, economical, fast, comfortable and safe to travel via the airport rail link to towns. The train station is right at the Basement of the International airport. With just THB 35, I sit comfortably from the Suvarnabhumi airport to Makkasan station in 20min journey without worry of traffic jam on the road. It is extremely easy and convenient to connect from the Makkasan train station to the Phetchaburi MRT station with just a short 5min walking distance under the covered link bridge. Very clear signage along the way!Generally, passenger need to pay THB 120 for the highway toll fee plus THB 250-300 taxi meter fare from town to the Suvarnabhumi airport thus using the Airport Rail Link not just saved you extra THB but more importantly you can easily manage your Travelling time on your journey between the stations without any worry and anxiety of caught in the heavy traffic jam on the road!My strong recommendation to use the Bangkok Airport Rail Link for your travel between Suvarnabhumi Airport and town in Bangkok!Jason
Fast and comfy. Fast, reliable, cheap and comfortable way to get from BKK airport to the center. Terminus is also a bts sky train station so you get anywhere. Taxi to khao san max 100 bhat

convenient, fast, efficient. Airport link connected the international airport to the city. It is really fast to travel from one place to another. Phaya Thai station is the last stop for the train and passengers can take BTS to travel to major destinations like Central World, Siam Paragon etc. Airport link has the connection with MRT also, from Makasan station, one can go to MRT station and could go to Asoke, Ratchadaphisek etc.

Extremely convenient!. The Airport train was great. I took it both ways and it was really easy to figure out. You can pay at a kiosk in the airport and get a token. If you go to the end of the line you'll be at the BTS SkyTrain and can easily transfer to other stations around the city. Very easy to use, and lots of floor space for large baggage.

Best way to get to the airport!. This is the easiest and cheapest way to get to the airport. It connects directly to the BTS and does't have to wait in traffic. Its fun to soar though the sky and watch the city go by!
Really good . Really good train service on time and get you to your stop fast best part is you can ride it to the airport so amazing for travels

Convenient method of transportation. The presence of the Airport Rail Link makes transportation more convenient, not only to and from the airport, but also within the city as well - not as much as the BTS, however. The only complaint I have is that there are not enough trains, and as most people are probably on tight schedules, you end up with too many people on each car.

Family Adventure. The express train was not in operation when we were visiting, but the city line is only 15 min extract to city centre. The train is clean and comfortable. The fare is reasonable, 45 baht from the airport to city centre.
Easy to use and very cheap. Must use if you don't want your throat slit (metaphorically) by taxi drivers. It's faster, about 360% cheaper and very very clean. It rivals the MTR in Hong Kong

Efficient and cheap!. This is THE method of transportation you should be using if you want to get into Bangkok proper from the airport. Be warned, though, depending on the time of the day, it can be a sardine can inside.

The most efficient way to airport or to city. Nothing compares to the well managed airport rail link Bangkok; cheap, always with traffic controllers around to manage the crowd movement, clean, efficiently interconnected between airport and city centre.
very easy access.... Airport Rail link very easy to access,, It's situation airport basement. I was stay near Pahya thai station,, Very easy & convenient access.. I love airport link... love..love

Best way to head to Central Bangkok fast. When I arrived in Bangkok I decided to take the City Link Airport Rail Link to the City Center, getting off at Makkasan station in less then 25 minutes, the price is very reasonable less then 65 Bahts or $1.82 US.
Service is timely and efficient, the trains are clean and secure.

Very cheap and efficient. Great option to get into downtown Bkk for about 45 Baht to the BTS Sukhumvit line....Train will crowd up very quickly after the first two stations if arriving at the start of the day with work commuters so be prepared...know your stop and be close to the door especially if you have large luggage

Airport rail review. Direct train to Phaya Thai bts station
When we were travelling no direct service available but it was not too bad half hour or so trip.
Easy way to BTS. We wanted to experience local traffic and used this shuttle train to BTS sky train. Easy to use, easy to find from Bangkok Suvarnabhumi airport.

Nice & convenient way of airport transfer. Nice, convenient, reasonably priced. One should use this if not many luggage are there because Bangkok taxis are unreliable and can ask for any fare for airport transfer. Besides Bangkok traffic is infamous - it can let you down any moment. RailLink is the way to go.
Fastest and cheapest way to get into city. It is fastest and cheapest way to get into city. It is very convenient and is interconnected with BTS
Great Effective Public Transport. Is a great way to get to Bangkok city from the airport especially for those who are traveling alone and during perk hour.

Ease in transport to and from the airport. The best way to go into the city from the airport. There are a few stops along the way but it's a nice way to get to see the locals as you enter Thailand.
Unfortunately their express train which goes directly from the airport to the city (one stop) is not yet ready.

Very efficent and inexpensive. This is the best solution for Thai taxi problems. No need to haggle and get ripped off. The cost is merely 60 bt from the airport to the center. But you if you have lots of luggage it may not be so comfortable.
Fast but packed. For the upgraded price to the regular metro it was still to packed whit people. Maybe we had a bad timing.

No more Taxis for me. I visit Bangkok at least 3 times a year. I use to just book a limo or jump in a taxi but than I became adventurous and decided to stop taking easy options and try what backpackers would consider as the most inexpensive way. However I discovered that not only was it inexpensive but it was also nearly as quick as road transport but quicker in peak road times. I have found it so easy and fun(you see more) that "No more taxi's for me".

Perfect altenative for Taxi.... or better. For the first time we used this link to return to the Airport. As we were stuck in the city traffic, we asked to drop us at one of the Airport Railway stations. Train was crowded, but very efficient alternative for only 49 Bath!
Gets you fast to town. Cheap and fast if you have a Hotel near the raillink or shukumvit area. Taxi takes much longer during rush hour.

Works well. Easy to access and affordable, took the train out at 5:30am and arrived in record time to the station and beat the busy rush hour traffic, highly recommend as your way to reach the city, will save a lot of time
convenience and reasonable rate. Fast, convenience, reasonable rate, no jam, on time, no argument with taxi driver about taxi fare. But only for to Suvarnabhumi airport.

Excellent transport. Cheap, efficient transportation. Road traffic is near permanently gridlocked, so this is by far the best option to get to and from Suvarnabhumi. Pity there's no train to Don Muang (yet).
Good value for money. Speedy connection to city and bts trains. Inexpensive. Ends in Oriya Thai where you can connect to the bits sky trains

Ok train, bad services, bad waiting time.. It was the most worry free transportation from airport to BKK. At least, we don't have to encounter bad taxi.
Still, bad services and long waiting time totally killed the experience. I waited for 20 min to see the first train going to airport but I got on the second one after 40 min of waiting.

Airport Link from Airport to city of Bangkok. I have only travelled on this once but found it easy to use, at the other end when you need to change to sky train it is a bit of a hike with luggage and can be very busy but an efficient way to travel as there can be many traffic jams.

Great thing! . It's full to an extreme and really not so comfortable, but the alternative I. E. Being stuck in Bangkok's eternal traffic jam, is sooo less appealing. It's a little slow, too, but it takes you where you want to go without being choked to death from exhaust.
Fast and budget option to reach the centre of Bangkok. We paid 35 baht/person from airport to Massakan - fast and cheap. From Massakan you can easily reach MRT (there are signs where to go).
wonderful. I just reached Suvarnabhumi within 20 minutes and 40 bahts ..it is amazing beacause the taxi do nt charge less than 350 bahts
From Airport to the city. Cost of approx 45 Bahts per ride from the Airport to the city outskirts, where other means of transport shall be taken.
Fastest way to get to and from the airport at rush hour. The trains are clean and fairly fast, the only negative is they can get full and you can feel like a sardine.

Excellent mode of transport. The Airport Rail Link provides an excellent form of transportation from the Airport to my destination Pratunam which is at Ratchaprarop Station.
Definitely save costs if your travelling in a small group or solo. But if you are travelling with an infant, I'd suggest you take a taxi as the train can get full at times.

Easy access to Bangkok. So convenient to get off plane,collect luggage and the 45 mins later you are in the City.
If you have no Thai Baht on arrival,use Super Rich on the way to ATR-they offer the best exchange rates.
Easy and Awesome. 35 baht from the airport to the city. Best way to get out of the airport without being ripped-off by the cabbies.

Best Transport in Bangkok. Very convenient and price is reasonable to travel to downtown from Airport.
Would suggest people to take the Airport Rail is they are travelling in light travel baggage.
Easy to use. Half hour away from the city of Bangkok, easy to understand how to use it and where to get off. Also very cheap, also avoids any of the heavy polluted traffic!
Excellent fast way to get into city.. We travelled to Ratchaprarop from airport then used connections from Makasan during our stay. All had escalators and elevators
Convenient. The train is clean and comfy. The signboard makes it easy to understand. If in doubt, ask the personnel at the ticket booth, they are very helpful.

Great connection from airport. Tried to use less taxis this year and go native so arrived and got this link from BKK to downtown. No issues at all with service and all clearly marked and announced stations so hard to go wrong. I did get a taxi to Don Muang for some internal flights and it looks like the link is being extended to cover both airports so this will be a great improvement on waiting on a taxi at DM..
easy way to downtown. except taxi. from the main airport this vehicle can bring you to bangkok downtown easily and effectively.

Really? Review the useless Airport Link?. OK, TripAdvisor for whatever reason suggests I review the airport link. I'll do it. Here we go:Just. Don't. Use. It. It's overpriced. Taxis get you from door-to-door for the same price. It's badly connected: It doesn't get you anywhere, drives sufficiently far away from major populated areas to be useless, requires you to drag your luggage far distances from other public transport - and from most places that you would stay you need to take a taxi anyway to even just get to the airport link. Maybe one day taxis get so expensive that the train is cheaper. Maybe one day they extend the line to where people actually live. Maybe one day they make proper interchange stations. Maybe one day the sun comes up in the West. Maybe rain will fall up to the sky. Until that day comes, you will most likely be better off taking a taxi. Enjoy.
Fast abd easy. The easiest way of transport from the airport to Bangkok. Don't have to look for anything else. Easy to find
Public transport that reaches the airport. I honestly use it simply to commute downtown. The only problem I have with it is that trains run rarely, every twelve minutes.

slow but direct. The airport rail link is very convenient to get to and from the airport. The link is easily accessed from the BTS Line and walking distance in the Victory Monument neighborhood. It is very direct, but the service is much slower than the BTS and MRT lines. The trains are less frequent as well. Ensure you give yourself plenty of time to travel using this line.

Great option to get downtown. The rail link was clean, inexpensive and quick. Announcements are made in Thai and English. We rode it just prior to rush hour so it wasn't too crowded. As we were riding to Phaya Thai station we could see the infamous Bangkok traffic and knew we made the right choice. Changing to the BTS is easy but if you have a ton of luggage be warned, there are a lot of steps to climb. The BTS is also very crowded and the locals will not appreciate the room that your bags take up.

Good idea, badly executed. Avoid this method of travel unless your hotel is adjacent to the stops en route. It terminates inconveniently and the pedestrian transit to adjoining lines is a right pain in the rear.

Hard to find but worth the effort. We arrived at the Airport and wanted to leave our bags at the left luggage area at Hua Lamphong Railway station for the day. ( 70 baht each bag and pretty secure for non valuables ) We figured there must be a rail link. It is poorly signposted and even with the minimal help from the helpdesk we found it. Take the lift to the second floor, it looks like it only goes to a hotel. Follow this across the covered walkway to the station. Train takes approx. 1 hour about the same as a car.Private car 1000 baht for 4 persons --- Train 5 baht each. it takes the same time is incredibly cheap and you meet some real Thai people. The breeze through the open windows locals selling food. We've arrived in Bangkok !!

One line running. Of the two rail links (Express and City Lines), only the City Line was operational. And the line has limited hours of operation with the last train at midnight - a real shortcoming for the many tourists who arrive on international flights at the dead of night. That said, I've found the staff helpful and the line to be of real use during operating hours.
Excellent Travel Choice. Best way to get out of the airport provided you don't have bulky luggage to carry. You will be able to avoid the not so honest taxi drivers.....

Fast & Cheapa. The rail link is the best way to get downtown from the airport. It's a good way to avoid getting in to the awful downtown traffic. Also it is the cheapest way to get downtown ( 1 trip is 45 baht). It can get really crowded sometimes.
Fast and accessible. Got us to our destination quick. Even if I'm visiting Thailand for the first time, didn't get lost and didn't get us worrying for airport transfers
travel to the heart of Bangkok. Just take this train, it takes you to the center of Bangkok where you can take the skytrain to the area of your hotel. Much nicer than a "rip you off taxi".

Easy Trip to the Airport. I personally wouldn't take the Skytrain if I had to drag more than one bag, but if you can handle the luggage, this is probably the quickest way to get to the airport, as you by-pass the sometimes bumper to bumper traffic. There is some walking involved, but really not a bad trip. Very convenient access via the BTS or MTR. I would recommend it over street transportation, anytime--except as I mentioned if you have too many bags to wrestle with.

Convenient and cheap travel option.. We took this train to Chatatuck market in Bangkok.It wasn't far from the Indra Regent Hotel,in fact we walked to the station. It is very clean and safe. Much better option that a tuk tuk or taxi . You have a short walk once you get off but even that is fun as you'll be walking with many people who are also on the way to Chatatuck market. Very convenient way to get around.
Fast way into city centre. Great way to get into city centre of Bangkok... Only 45 baht. Takes approx 25mins, and air conditioned. Grab a taxi on arrival to your local hotel or transfer to BTS lines.
Efficient & simple to use. Well signposted and easy to locate at the airport.System was easy to navigate.Tickets can be purchased at vending machines at the stations, machines do give change.

Best way to get to/from BKK airport!. Best way to connect to just about any destination in the city. May need to connect to another BTS/MRT/Taxi to reach your final destination in the city but so well worth it.
Beat the traffic. If you are traveling light, then this is your best connection to and from Bangkok downtown. Transfer with MRT at Makkasan.
World Class. A world class service. Easy for foreigner to navigate upon. Cheap, fast, and clean service. From Bangkok airport right into the heart of the city. You can't go wrong.

Easy and convenient travel. This is a great way to travel away from the nightmare roads. The travel prices are quite good. Trains generally clean and tidy, as with all trains can get over crowded at peak times
Fast n' easy!. The airport rail link is the cheapest way to go to BKK. Just follow the signs at the airport, pay 40baht/person and enjoy a nice view while you head into Bangkok!

There is no other way to get to and from Suvarnibumi. Getting the ordinary train from the airport to Makkasan and then picking up the MRT at Petchaburi couldn't be more simple, fast, easy and cheap.You can be in the centre of Bangkok within 40 minutes for less than 70 bahts each!

Sometimes a great way to get to the airport. The Airport Rail Link is an inexpensive and quick way to get to Suwannaphum Airport, but is not for everybody. If you have a lot of luggage, better to take a taxi. And it is still a long walk from the airport station to the actual airport.
Convenient. Convenient even with luggage. Far better than getting stuck in traffic. We traveled as a family of 5 with two small children and they loved it.

Cheap and easy!. I prefer taking the Airport Rail Link over taxi's. It is fast and usually isn't too packed. The only downside is when you transfer to the BTS at Makassan or Phaya Thai. The BTS is public transport and isn't really suited for luggage and is often much busier. Also depending what exit you take at the station, you might have to lug your bag down many stairs. If you are a light traveller (or strong!) none of this will be a problem.

Avoid the traffic. This was our first visit to Bangkok. We were warned by many friends NOT to take a taxi to the center of town, particularly during rush hours. Thankfully we heeded the warnings. The trip to the center of the city takes about 20 minutes. One can take along all their luggage. Our cost to travel one way was about 45 Bhat. Once we got off the train , we took our luggage to the street level and got a taxi easily to the hotel.
Must use!. Very clean andfast way to get from the Airport to the heart of the city in under an hour. Very cheap compared with the taxi and free of traffic.

Poor show. Today I used Airport Rail Link and the train broke down. This incident showed a lack of any plan or preparation by the operator for dealing with a crisis. Staff lacked any information to help passengers and no one knew what was happening or what to do. There was then no one on hand amongst staff who could speak English so as to deal with the many tourists. It was a shambles.

Easy & cheapest way to reach airport. As every one is aware that Bangkok is capital of Thailand and the traffic of Bangkok is world famous ! Once you get stuck in traffic then god know how long it will take to reach to airport or other destination

rapid link. Rapid link for airport to Bangkok .2 modes are available , the quickest only stops once and the 2nd has various stops , so depending on where you go limits your choice .Most stations have no lifts or escalators so bear that in mind if you have lots of luggage .Taxis also have limited boot space due to lpg tank stored in boot so again space is limited .
Best way into the city . For 50 baht you have a fast ride into the city, there you have connection to other types of mass transportation. It saves one the haggling with the taxi drivers.

Good service. Used this for the first time this year (2015)Why I didn't I use this before? So much easier and cheaper than getting a taxi from the airport to Nana. Nice and easy to use,clean and nice air-con trains. Will use again from now on.

Convenient and efficient. As we arrived in Bangkok during the evening peak hour and did not have very large bags with us, we chose to use this mode of transportation to get to our hotel which was located in the Siam district. It was easy to locate and helped us to bypass the nightmarish traffic jams Bangkok is infamous for. Switching to the BTS at Phaya Thai was also quite easy although it may be a bit of a squeeze at rush hour. Very easy way to get from Suvharnabhumi airport to the city area of Bangkok where many hotels are located!

Excellent way to get to/from BKK. Avoid the horrible Bangkok traffic - if you can, take the Airport Rail link to BKK.
Plus, it costs less than $1.50 US to get from Phaya Thai station to the airport in less than 45 minutes.

fast and cheapest way to airport. This is the train from bts phayathai to suvarnabhumi airport. it take over 45 minutes and 45 baht. it is the cheapest way to go to airport. but if you are group of 3-4. i think taxi bill be cheaper ARL
Watch out for peak times!. Easy to use and cheap but not practical if you have large rucksacks and the school children pile on - felt like I had half of Bangkok pushing against me at one point!

Clean and limited. To get to the city it is a very cheap way but you need to transfer to get downtown by BTS.
It is also clean a d the announcements are clear. It's great. Not your handicapped accessible traveler but it's good
Really good would recommend . Really easy way of getting into the city from the airport and back, not too expensive, they sometimes get a bit full but all have air con so not too hot inside

Fastest & Cheapest. The fastest and cheapest way to get to the airport. A cab fare from Sukhumvit costs me minimum 400 bahts with the airport rail link I spend 75bahts only. During peak time its best to take the airport rail to avoid the Bangkok traffic. Only drawback is with too much luggage it becomes difficult to access the rail.

what a great way to miss bangkok's traffic. I was lucky the hotel i was staying in was a 5 minute walk to a skytrain station and it was on the rail link.so it took me 25 minutes to reach the airport instead of maybe 1 hour. Also it cost me B40 instead of B300. will always take that in future
Bankok Suvarnabhumi airport to city. How simple could it be - 45Baht, a spotless air conditioned metro-style carriage and 30minutes later you are at Siam, perfect!

Best way to get to town from the airport if you are alone. It is easiest to catch this and get to a central location like Makasan before you take some other mode of transport to get to your exact place of stay. For a light traveller there is not better option! If you do have heavy bags it still is a good option. Just make sure you catch a corner to sit with your bag so it doesn't come in anyone's way.
could've been better. pretty convenient to get from city to the airport. it takes around 40 mins from Makkasan station. They used to ran rapid line which takes about 10 mins.

Convienent. Super easy if you are coming into through BKK airport. Really this is the way to do it. Good price and easy as pie. If you come through DMK its a whole different story... much more difficult.

Fast and not too expensive. The airport link is fast way to go to Bangkok city . within 20mins. and is cost about 150 bath if not mistake. If you would liek the cheaper airport train. which will stop at each station about 45 bath. Is depend you time of urgent. Need faast, take direct train, plenty of time, take normal train.

Easiest Way to get into Bangkok from the Airport. I work in Bangkok so when I have to travel for business I make sure that I take the Airport Rail Link. Compared to the 400b (minimum) that it will cost you to get into Bangkok, the Airport Rail Link is a steal at only 45b. It is not 24 hrs. so you have to check your arrival/departure times to make sure that you are able to catch it otherwise you are taking a taxi. I believe it only runs from 6am to 11pm, but I have never had a problem catching it since I don't mind hanging out in the airport for a little bit longer for the convenience. The end of the line connects you to the BTS Skytrain and from there you can pretty much get to any hotel along Sukhumwit.

Super easy transportation . We were going to get a taxi from the airport to our hotel along the river until my husband convinced me that we should take the rail and subways. It was cheap, scenic, and well air conditioned. So easy!
Economical and convinient to and from Airport. Recommend this only who has one check in bag and small hand carry bag.If you have more than two bag, then better to take taxi.

Reliable fast cheap. Why bother with traffic, when you can run right into the centre by train. Direct connection to subway or still to a taxi in case your hotel is too far away. Bear in mind: there is always a lot of traffic in the city, hence always a delay somewhere.
Convenient . Used the airport rail link to victory monument 2nd day in thailand. And used it back to bkk on departure aswell. Very cheap and easy and convenient.

Very user friendly!. This is the cheapest and quickest way to get into the centre of Bangkok from the airport, and is so easy to use. All of the notices are said in English as well as Thai, so travellers that speak English will find it a very easy experience. It is a very comfortable and smooth train, and there is a good view of the entrance into Bangkok.

Quick and easy way to get into town from airport. There are two rail links (express and cityline) that links the airport into the city. The city line is by far the better choice since it is connected with the BTS where you can get to other parts of the city easily. The cityline is slower as it stops at multiple stops, but its cheaper. From the train signs in the airport and you can find the airport rail link station easily inside the terminal.

Airport link. When it works it is very good - problem is it does not work enough - sometimes you have to wait for 30 mins - worth getting off at Markssan and taking MRT - particularly if you going ASOKE area -
Easy & cheap. Good experience with link train. Fast and always keep you away from busy road side in Bangkok. Neat & clean & overall superb service.
Convenience. It is very convenience if you would like to connect yourself from Suvannabhumi Airport to town as it is only take up to 30 minutes to get there.

Very Convenient. I stayed in a hotel just under the BTS station and with just 2 transit I can reach hotel without the traffic jam. First take the rail link from airport to Phaya Thai station. Transfer to BTS & drop at Siam station. Transit to National Stadium line and get down on National Stadium. Mercure Bangkok Siam is just few steps away.
Very good but . The airport rail link is very good and convenient if you are travelling to Bangkok as it joins onto the bts

Express train. This airport rail link is so commendable. If you want to avoid the traffic jam on your way to the airport for your flight, this is the sure way not to be late. It is very much cheaper than the taxis and a comfortable ride as well

Really easy way to get to/from airport. Caught the airport rail link to and from the airport. It was easy, cheap, clean, ran on time. Would recommend this alternative rather than being stuck in Bangkok traffic in a taxi.
Good , quick and cheap way to get into Bangkok. Used this one and was quite effective. Quick and easy and efficient. Good price too and I beat the traffic getting into Bangkok.
Friends. I took train once went I came to Bangkok to the hotel and it was convenient, chip and accessibleIn the central Bangkok I used with tok tok and taxi. .
comfy for every people. comfy from every person but i think need add more station maybe is better cause have a lot of people use it.

A masterpiece of non-sensical planning. Most Bangkok residents regard the 'Airport Link' as the biggest white elephant in Thailand. Inaugurated in August, 2010 the Express train is already out of operation due to poor maintenance and lack of spare parts. The Terminus is located at Makkasan and consists of a huge, cavernous, under-utilised building in the middle of a swamp with poor connections to anywhere and taxi drivers loath to service passengers there. Due to the lack of rolling stock it has been reduced to a commuter train for workers living in the east of the city and is usually packed stopping at six stations en route to the airport.If you feel you must use this mode of transport then buy a ticket at Suwanabumi Airport to Phaya Thai Station which is the end of the line, two stations beyond the Makkasan Terminus. At least here you can connect to the BTS Skytrain system but this is where your real problems begin. You have to cart your luggage down narrow staircases and then walk a fair distance to Phaya Thai BTS Station. From here you can get to several parts of the city but a long walk/taxi ride to your hotel is often necessary from the nearest BTS station.If you have luggage and are with one or two friends then spare yourselves the agony and share a taxi directly to your hotel. Using the express way will get you to Bangkok city center in half an hour and in comfort. It's worth the extra money. Consider the train only if travelling very light, are prepared for a great deal of inconvenience, and are in no hurry for that hot shower and meal!

Easy to take... Easy to take and get you from Airport to your destination..
as long as you don't have too many suitcases…… otherwise better a taxi
Clean comfortable cheap and quick.. I used the rail (not express) from Ratchapraport to the airport which took less than 30 minutes. The fare was 40 Baht which is lead than AUD2.

Just over 1 Hour from Asoke Sukhumvit to Airport. We were staying at Sukhumvit near Asoke station and needed to get back to the airport.Change at Phaya Thai and then get the airport train.The cost of the airport train from here is 45B. Trains busy but air conditioned.Some stairs involved at station change.This seemed a safer option to us than getting a taxi and risk getting stuck in traffic.

Much Better than Taxi!. Catch this rail link from airport, much faster than the taxis, especially during rush hour, also much less expensive. There is a good map next to the token machines downstairs that will help you choose the proper stop closest to your destination and plenty of Taxis or Tuk Tuk to finish the journey when you get off.

Cheaper Transfer from the Airport to the City. Amazing clean train system with a fixed schedule that you can set your clock/watch around it. the servie connets the city to the airport and vs versa; works from 6am to midnight.

Lovely, Clean, Easy to Use. We used the Airport Link several times on our last stay as we were staying at the BKK Airport Novotel. We found it inexpensive, clean, modern, and quite easy to make connections anywhere where the SkyTrain runs in Bangkok. Make sure you do some research on your stops before you use the system - it can get EXTREMELY congested and difficult to look at maps in the stations. Otherwise - awesome and easy to get around.
Best Ride to the City Center. Easy cheap and fast if one wants to get to the city center. Hassle free travel from the airport with good connections to every corner of the city.

Best option to Suvarnabhumi!. We were leaving Bangkok during the last day of Songkran and decided to go by taxi. After getting stuck for ages in the often notorious Bangkok traffic we had to ditch the taxi and get out at the closest rail link station. Definitely the stress free option!

Remember the need for connections in the city!. There are two different forms of service, the express line from Phaya Thai in the city to Suvanaphoum Airport, with two stops on the way, for 90 baht one way and the commuter line with multiple stops for 45 baht. The latter gets very crowded at peak travel times and can be unpleasant, especially if you have significant luggage. That said, the trip is less than 30 minutes so it is tolerable.Getting to and from the airport end is a breeze, but at the city end you still need to get to your hotel, one way or another. The link with the BTS skyway is simple, but you need another ticket and many stations require you to carry luggage up and down steps. The BTS trains are often full and luggage can be a hassle. And finally, you need to get from the BTS to your hotel, sometimes on sidewalks which are not all that suited to wheeled luggage.So you need to consider where you are staying before choosing the link.
Excellent, fast, efficient!. The best view of bangkok you get from this train. For 40 baht it takes you to the airport. And the soldiers are there to salute the train at every station!

Save Stress, Time and Money. One of the quickest and certainly cheapest ways to get into town, but requires one change as opposed to a taxi straight in which runs a bit over 400 baht to Khao San Road, the Rail Link misses most of the traffic and cosrs 45B + another 70 for a taxi. The adventurous can walk 800 meters to the Jim Thompson House pier and pay 8B for the canal ferry, or a total of 53B. Yes, that is what I do.

Speedy. It is an excellent form of transport from the BKK airport. For the price, I think it is worth it and it saves us on a lot of our transport cost. 45 bhat for 1 ticket versus 400 bhat for a taxi ride, which will you choose?

Perfect. Cost effective way of getting from the airport to Bangkok centre. I would suggest better without a lot of luggage but still doable. Likely need a taxi ride from the get off station. However about 1/8th the price of an airport taxi

Comfortable - but please have ENOUGH time in hand when taking this. We used the rail link both the times - when we reached BKK and we were flying out of BKK.While getting into BKK the ride was comfortable with no hiccups and it really didn’t matter as we were on our way to the hotel.However, on the way out towards airport - when we were time bound to catch a flight - we JUST MADE IT IN TIME.. because the train stopped twice for about 10 mins for some technical snag and was chugging slower than what it should be.So, if you plan taking it - would recommend that you account for at least 1:15 mins from Paya Thai to Suvarnabhumi Airport.

Occasional, short and over-filled trains. This train could be a serious alternative to taxis and traffic jams. It is not. Trains run not very often and are therefore mostly overfilled. A basically generous baggage are is hence full of people standing. Announcement of stations is drowned in their chatter. Also, despite the fact that the stations could accommodate longer trains, the current ones are just 3 or 4 carriages long, too short. So you there you go: an expensive but totally underused infrastructure, which would have a lot to gain fro better management.

Fastest way from Suvarnabhumi Airport to the city. It is only a half hour trip from the airport to Phaya Thai station where you can catch the BTS. The train station is located on Level B2 of the airport and costs 44 or 45 Baht depending on whether it is the express train or regular service. This is great if you have manageable luggage.

Rail Link. A quick and easy way to travel between Suvarnabhumi airport and the city. Single journey ticket to Phaya Thai is 45 Baht with 6 stations in between. At Phaya Thai, one can transfer to BTS skytrain.

Needs More and Longer Trains. An elevated rail line linking the main airport with the city. It has an express route from the airport to the city, as well as an all stops twin commuter route. You can actually use either, although the express trains are more suited to luggage.You can link with the subway (MRT) at Makkasan station, and the Skytrain (BTS) at Phaya Thai terminus - although with luggage it is a long hike at both stations.Very crowded in peak hours and service frequency has been cut for several months whist carriage maintenance has been carried out and more carriages are ordered. But trains still run every 10-15 minutes on either the express or commuter routes.Only the one line, so hard for anyone to get lost, and cheap and clean.

Cheap and conveninent. If you are travelling to a destination nearby a station then my advise would be to take a train. It's cheap, it's fast and you will not be stuck in traffic. Be aware that not all stations have working elevators

Forget it. Take a taxi at the taxi counter, you will be 100 times better off. If you are a frequent traveler like me you have probably learned that airport rail links are often if not almost always the best, safest and fasted way to connect downtown and the airport. Well, forget this, it doesn't apply in Bangkok. The downtown stations of the airport rail link are very inconvenient, not located near major hotel or business areas and worse of all, not user friendly at all for passengers with luggage.... Yes strange as it may seem, they seem to have forgotten that passengers travelling to and from the airport are quite likely to have luggage, even sometimes big luggage. Try to interchange between the airport link and the BTS and you will need a good deal of strong muscles on your arms to carry your luggage up and down endless stairs as there are no escalators or elevators. All this for a price that is not worth it. Take a taxi at the public taxi counters outside the arrival hall. Price is by meter (guaranteed) with an airport surcharge of THB 50 and the expressway toll to pay. In other words for 400 Baht all inclusive you can basically go to any hotel in town, in the comfort of your taxi, door to door, without having to carry anything and without sweat.

Airport rail link in Bangkok. This long overdue link to Bangkok's main International Airport is long overdue, but now fully in operation, it is an absolute blessing for travellers arriving at or departing from Suvarnabhumi. It is not expensive, and connects with the main Sky train system in BKK itself. Luggage is easily accommodated.

fast & awesome. Great train ride that links the BTS & MRT...fast & safe...you just have to brace yourself for a long walk from the arrival to the airport link & back if your going to use it for departures.

The only meaningful public transport to the city center without hassle with taxi fares.. For less than two USD, you can get to the city center. The rail join with other mass transit system which going at any end of the mass transit would still be less than 2 USD. You have to buy tickets again. But I think if you are on a budget and do not want to get stuck in traffic. This is the only choice so far.Drawback, some trains stop at every stations. So use express. The door close loudly and it leaves every 15 minutes. But still better than get stucked in taxi.
Fast, efficient and cheap. Brilliant especially for those that live or need to be close to the BTS and all this for 40 Baht only. It beats any taxi drive and no toll ways and traffic jams.

Very good and fast connection. Very good and fast connection from the airport to the city center (and back). 45 baht/person also cheap. Outside the train station that were taxis that use the Taximeter (between 50-100 baht), you can go to your hotel.
Great way to get to the city.. This is a great alternative to a taxi to get into BKK, if you want to land near the skytrain (BTS) or underground (MRT).
Best way to travel in Bangkok. Normally i would avoid this type of transport at all costs...but it couldn't be simpler, cleaner or more efficient.
Efficient transport from the airport. Hands down the best way to get to the center of Bangkok from the Airport. Don't get stuck in the city's legendary traffic. Use the trains!

The best way to get into town. Traffic from BKK airport to the city is a bear, especially during the day. If the train is running, it is the fastest way to get between the airport and town. Unfortunately, the express line was not running the two times we tried to take the train. But consider that the cost is still less than 1/10th the cost of a cab and it is likely faster during the day.
