Rail trip was worth the price paid. I used Airport rail link to go to Patong night market and i think i spent around 90 bath only to go the destination ...it took less than an hour... i had to change the trains 3 times but it was worth ....the trains are very clean and people do follow rules
Great for getting into town quickly. Good value and very easy way to travel into town. There is no need to take the express train which is only slightly faster but more expensive.

Efficient way to get from airport to your location. Stayed in Pratunam area, so had to drop at Ratchaprarop station... It is the second last station on the route... Journey takes about 25-35 minutes.. Cost-effective and time-saving method of transportation

Sleek off peak. very convenient station in the basement of the Airport, 2 lines (express and standard) but the express was not running with enough frequency. Some stations there are not enough Taxi to get you away to your destination .. Makasaan the main exit had issues so check ahead.. otherwise for not much more go by cab then no need to haul luggage in and out of stations
Convenient to use. We use all time since been build 2010, connected to BTS Sky train. Very nice, clean and Better than taking taxi. Inexpensive fare
Impressed!. It's very convenient, quick, clean, cheap, well maintained. It does connect to BTS and MRT lines. Four stars, because it's not 24x7.

Efficient, clean, air conditioned, inexpensive, safe - use it!. Taxis and tuk tuks get stuck in traffic. If you are looking for an inexpensive way to get from the airport into the city, take the Airport Link as close as you can to your destination. Jump on the BTS from there or, if you must, take a taxi or tuk tuk to your final destination.

Cheap and clean. If you want a safe and cheap transportation to get to the main city this one is right for you. It's easy to find when you go down to Magic Food and grab something to eat. Although it's a bit slow to wait and it gets crowd all the time. You should give your sit to the kids and elder people.

Took this to connect to the BTS. It was the best way to get to the city from the airport. Much better choice than taking a taxi. We purchased our coins and were on our way. 30 min ride to the very last stop where we transferred. 45BHT/per person.

Great rail system , clean realible & safe.. Used this last week when I got to Suvarnabhumi Airport, leaves about every 15 mins I think ? after ppl get off going to Airport , you cannot get on until staff do a "security sweep" of the train. Clean and fast going into town , no luggage storage space , but if only 1 bag/suitcase each is ok, I will defiantly use again , was less than 100b and not stuck in traffic , was abut 30 mins ? mayb less

Quick And Efficient. A great way to make it to your departure time, even when rush hour traffic has the city bogged down to a crawl. Simple and affordable, you can connect from the MRT and BTS public transportation systems and make it a simple journey to the airport.

Clean and cheap to go to city. Located in basement of the airport, very convenient. It takes you 400B (~13$) to go to Sukhumvit by taxi, other place is higher, so Airport link saves a lot of money for you.
Best way from the airport to central Bangkok. These trains run every 15 minutes and are fast and easy to use, costing only 45 baht it must also be the cheapest.

Except for price it is great. When you get in subway you usually expect a good price.
you will be disappointed here but other than that i think it is the best way to get to City.

Fast, clean train that will help a lot. That's most likely the best way to get to Suvarnabhumi International Airport. You won't be stuck in traffic, and there's enough room for bags in every train. The only problem is it doesn't come as often as the other train lines, so you will probably have to wait at least 10 minutes until you're able to board on the next train.
Speedy service direct to the airport. Ww stayed at the Baiyoke Sky Hotel which is just round the corner from the Airport Link station. Airport to hotel in 30 minutes!
Easy and cheap. When you have hand luggage only! Not easy if you have to carry big suit cases to the airport. Easy access by MRT Makan stattion from BTS Asok stattion.
Best way to airport. Airport Link is the best and fastest way to get to the airport. It is also very cheap and comfortable.

Quick, good currency exchange boots nearby at airport. I used the rail link three times over the past four weeks and overall found it quite convenient. Those with larger pieces of luggage getting off at Makkasan will find elevators (lifts) both at this ARL station and the Petchaburi MRT. However getting out at Sukuhumvit MRT station meant hefting my wheeled bag up and down some stairs.HINT:If arriving Suvarnabhumi airport use the currency exchange booths (Yenjit, Super Rich1965, Value Plus) on the ground floor adjacent the rail link office. Rates there are at least 6% better than those on the 4th floor. Value Plus stays open the latest, closing at 11:30 pm
quite fast to get the bangkok city center. quite fast to get the bangkok city center but not so convenient to change the station to BTS station.
WConcert and shopping. Very easy and efficient to use and very cost effect. It is clean and quick to get to all parts of Bangkok.

If you like carrying your luggage. From the airport(BKK) to the train no problem, stairs, escalators and lifts, but when you arrive at Phaya Thai station only ONE very small lift 4 for people with luggage(not too much) and NO escalators ONLY stairs.The trains are always overcrowded.
Good service. Useful for getting to/from airport. Trains not that frequent, so can be full at peak times. Trains don't go that fast but its better than using a bus.

underground to the airport. What a brilliant underground, fast, cheap, safe, easy! I took it on my own for the first time using the maps and directions posted in multiple languages with pictures. It couldn't have been easier and it meant paying 60B rather than 1,000B to a cab!
Life saver. Traffic in Bangkok in the office rush overs are deadly. if you want to get in to the airport in a traffic time this is the best option.

I had a great days in Thailand. Actually was not my first time here in Thailand for holiday, I love Thailand, people here are so polite, wherever you go they will greet you with passion, you feel being connected to their tradition...not only that they are nice people, humble people.. and for buying things you can negotiate try to go MBK a famous for souvenirs.
Great way to get into city centre. This is a great way to get into Bangkok city at a low fixed price. Trains ran on time and were spotless.

Best and cheapest mode of transport from Airport. I always take the airport link from Suvarnabhumi airport. Taking a cab is costly and takes time due to the never ending Bangkok traffic. You can reach the city centre Phaya Thai in 45 baht which is about 1.5 dollars very comfortably.

Loooove it!. It was very convenient. I hope my home country has this, too.
Railways in Bangkok open at 5:50AM but the trains don't come until 6:00AM. It runs until midnight.

Easiest way to reach suwarbhumi airport Bangkok. This link is from suwarbhumi International Airport to Payathai n centre of Bangkok city , with interlink at many stops such as Makkassan n others around thr r total 7 stops or so to reach Payathai which has link to Bts which runs all over city thr r good hotels near Payathai like susokol hotel, Pullman hotel n others n before tht station ratchaprop u hv many hotels like Biaoyke Sky , Indira Regent hotel n many more . It's easiest n fastest way to reach during office hours n cheapest in 40 bht
Easy. Easy clean and quick connection between airport and city . Can get a little crowded during peek times but is still easy cheap travel either way.

Fast & Inexpensive!!!. Great ride, Fast & Frequent. Only problem is its not a 24hr service so if you have a very early flight as we did you'd have to catch a taxi but being so early theres hardly any traffic so it makes a pretty quick cab ride.

Excellent choise. This is excellent choise between international airport and downtown. Traffic on street level is nightmare so it's nice to travel with cool, quiet, fast way over all that traffic. It goes every 12-15 minutes and it have good connections to local subway and skytrain lines.And it is CHEAP... Try to use taxi once and you will know how expensive is use some other travel method than public transportation.

Great way to transfer from BKK!. If you fly into BKK airport, this is a great option to get to your destination quicker and save a little money in the process. The last stop is at Pyathai station. Many get off here and then take a taxi to their destination or transfer to the BTS train. Tickets are 45 baht to get to the last stop. For any backpackers staying near Khao San Road area, get off ay Phyathai and then a taxi there is about 100 baht. Just know there are a ton of stairs to get down. Not sure if there was an elevator. If you want to head to MBK mall or Siam Center for major shopping, get a transfer to the BTS train after getting off at Phyathai. BTS takes you on local routes within Bangkok.

Great Help, Great Escape of Traffice in BKK and Reach Intl Airport in time. It's such a wonderful way to go the airport if you stay in the downtown of BKK or from the airport to the downtown. SAVE a lot...a lot of your time and your feelings! The route is between Suwannabhumi Intl Airport and Phaya Thai station and it takes about 30 minutes to the airport.City line will run every 15 minutes. Express Line will run every 30 minutes. Fair is between 15 - 45 Baht depending on the distance travelled, and provides at the ticket machine or the countor. Operation hours between 06:00 am till midnight. At the airport just take lift to underground...look at the sign anyway..it's easy to find.Some rail link train also connect to BTS skytrain and MRT subway, please ask the map or check it..It's a great way to reach your destination without annoying feeling about bad traffic in BKK...
Fast and good. Took the rail to our hotel in Pratunam. It was a fast and cheap way to travel. No hassle and security check is a breeze.
World's Best airport transport EVER !. Really fast, cheap, comfortable and frequent train to the city center ! Costs only around 70 TBH to the center.
I wish we had this system back home. The train system is integrated into public transport making it much easier to travel back and fourth from the airport.

Cheaper, convenient access without traffic . If you stay in the hotel in the city center of bangkok, airport link would be a good option to move from suvanabhumi. Enspecially for those who stay near the stations of the airport link, you don't need to think about traffic jam. You will get there on time. Even for those who have to transit to BTS or MRT could be a choice. Phaya thai station is easy to transit to BTS. Makkasan for transit to MRT is still ok but not so as convenient as Phaya thai since you have to walk a bridge. And, if you bring big luggages with you, I don't recommend the airport link so much. You have to take anyway taxi or transit to another line with luggages. And, there are local users on board as well as tourists. I wonder why currently there's no express line(stop only makkasan and phayathai) running, but only city line (every stop).

convenient and fast airport line.. it's nice to have this airport line, fast. convenient, and cheap!You can transfer to other city lines by this line. Also you can find lots of hostels along this line.We save lots of time and money by it.
Fastest Way to reach City Center. This is the fastest way to reach all corners of Bangkok from Swarnabhumi Airport. Its economical too. more convenient for solo travelers

So convenient and inexpensive. The airport rail link will get you from BKK downtown to connect with the subway and skytrain. Super easy and convenient to ride to and from BKK. Best way to escape the hassle of taking a taxi!
Good Railways to connect to Aiport. Its connect from Suvarnabhumi Aiport to City. You have to change to BTS if you wan to go to Don Mueng Aiport

Good trains but poor connectivity. Good trains but for some reason no one planned for ease of connection to the rest of the train network after arriving from the airport to the main station in the city.
Cheap, fast, clean. Took the airport rail link instead of a taxi and turns out it was a lot cheaper and faster. Super easy and clean. Skip the scamming cab drivers and go for the train!
From airport to city. If you arrive from the airport, you have to get the train, it is very low cost about 90 baht for 2 person instead of 1100 baht for taxi to bring us.

Pretty standard but nice public transit. I can't really understand why so many people are rating this like it's some sort of ride? It's public transit, and is nice but also it's just public transit.
I would recommend using it though! To get around town.
great metro. one got to be happy you can travel by metro any where , it is safe secure and well organized plus ,fast and not wait in traffic
Reasonably priced. Well connected to airport from where services are available. Much faster and economical mode of transporting to/from airport.

Reliable and cheap service in comparison to taxi services. Myself and wife used this to service and had no faults really. Recommended!! The trains are fully air-conditioned which helps with the heat of Bangkok

Quicker than taxi . If you don't have a lot of bags with grab a train into BKK from the airport.
It's twice a quick and such a great option
Remember to check distance from your closest stop to your hotel as bags may make the walk difficult.
Enjoy BKK
from airport to city centre. From Suvanarbhum airport to Makkasan station then you can walk through the path to Petchaburi underground station (MRT). From Mrt you can travelling to skytrain.

Best way in and out. Forget the obvious price difference between cabs and the Airport express. All the other reasons like traffic chaos, speed, reliability and safety make this the only sensible way to get to and from the airport.

Easy traveling from BKK to near city center. Hit the airport rail link during rush our as we flew back in from Samui. Instead of getting bogged down by traffic in a taxi we tried the rail link for the first time, and it was a great choice! First, its cheap! Second it was clean and reasonable well paced (speed). The direct express was closed, so we still had option B, the 8 stop commuter train, we got off at stop 6 (Makkasan), whereas we switched to the MRT to Sukhumvit/Terminal 21 line.
Cheap, fast and convenient. Cost and time-efficient way of getting to the city. Not to forget, it's also very comfortable and hassle-free.

Quick way to get to the airport. The Airport Link is a cost effective, quick and efficient way to get to the new international airport. It is easy to get stuck in traffic with a taxi if you are flying at peak times so it ensures you get to the airport on time. Maybe not the best way if you have a lot of luggage though but there are lifts at the station.

Cheap and Convenient. Beat way to travel out of Servanabhoom airport is to use the Airport Rail Link. The charges is depending on where you get off the most expensive is to phaya thai connecting to the bts station cost about 48 bath if i am not mistaken. It is way cheaper then taking a cab.

Worst Airport Link Ever. First off, they only run the non-stop service to the airport once every hour. Imagine your frustration if you just missed it by 5 minutes and you have to wait 55 minutes for the next one. Totally a waste of time using this service.

Perfect transportation!. Using the rail link takes you fast and efficient to or from the airport for a very low cost. This is the way to get into central Bangkok if you arrive at Suvarnabhumi. Direct connection to the BTS at Phaya Thai station. Ticket is 45b.
convenient!. So convenient. Avoid the traffic and take the train!The staff are very helpful at the airport, and will help you purchase tickets. There are computer kiosks...so easy.

Great way to get to bangkok. Used the rail link when we flew into BKK. Did not have to wait long to get on it. Cars were clean, ride was smooth. If you travel light that is the way to get into Bangkok

Airport Rail Link. A very budget cost transport travel from airport to hotel. Avoid traffic jam...
You can purchase a day or 3 day MRT card which allow you access to MRT unlimited times per day

Budget friendly, cheaper alternative. Forget about taking taxis, rail link provides you the better comfort of traveling into BKK staright from the international airport. Fast,efficient and cheap too. It links with the MRT and BTS line too although you'll have to transfer and pay seperate fares.

The fastest way to go to airport and back. I booked a room in Baiyoke Boutique Hotel and just went by wark to go up Airport Rail Link, it took about 5 minutes to go the, and about 30minute to Suvanibumhi airport.
Fastest way to the City. Avoid the expensive taxis and time delays into Bangkok's City Centre by catching the Aiport Rail Link. Very easy and fast.

Airport Rail link to Suvannabhumi Airport. Fare is very Cheap, Clean, Fast and very convenient way just take the rail link to Suvannabhumi airport.It's suitable for the rush time to flight by the express Rail link.

Cheap and Efficient. I had taken a taxi to my hotel in the past and as it was too early to get to my hotel I decided on trying out the Rail Link. After hunting for it I found it in the basement of the airport. The link seems to run every 30 minutes, which is quite convenient. The fair of 45 Bhat is quite a bit lower then the $500 bhat the taxi's charge. There are ATM type ticket dispensers located outside the station and really friendly staff to show you how to use it. Be advised that the train is getting popular and anything more then 3 pcs of luggage per person would be a challenge to manage as it gets crowded fast. The train's final destination is Phaya Thai which connects to the BTS system. This station also has ticket booths for BTS passes. Be advised that although this train station has elevators to assist with the luggage the BTS system does not. As such the prudent thing to do from this station would be to get a taxi from here to your hotel. Naturally, not being the wisest, I went on the BTS system and navigated the seven flights of stairs downward with three pieces of luggage, something, after having done it, I really would not recommend. I also took the Link back to the Airport. As a side note I got the feeling that a lot of taxi drivers are quite disgruntled by this system as many would not take me to the Phaya Thai station from my hotel and were trying to convince me over and over to use them to go to the Airport. As the Link runs within certain hours, this option is the better of the two as you avoid all of the traffic, provided the flight schedule allows for it. By the way the train was quite empty at the Phaya Thai station, easily accommodating the luggage.

Airport Rail link in Bangkok. I usually just call a taxi, but the traffic was worse than normal and we were in a bit of a hurry, so we took the airport link for the first time and it was cheap, fast, clean and easy! Excellent service.

1 day pass is great value!. Here's another great place to find air conditioning when you are ready to melt in the high heat of Bangkok. We used the BTS system to get to our apartment rental and to tour certain parts of the city. Great value for the 1 day pass; English is on all the stops and loud speakers and the ticket office speaks English too! The taxis are cheap but the support mass transit, it is really more efficient and environmentally better!

very cheap and fast mean of transport from suvarnabhumi airport. Airport link starts from 6 am in the morning. Now only cityline is working. fare of Suvarnabhumi airport to phayathai is around 50 BHT. it is very convenient option. from phayathai to suvarnabhumi last train is at 11.50 pm

Great alternative to taxi, but be prepared for walking quite a distance. This is probably the cheapest option getting from the airport to downtown Bangkok. The connection is at the basement level in the airport and takes around 30 minutes to Makkasan where you can catch a connection to the subway MRT station in Petchaburi. Obviously you can continue on as well, but I was headed for Sukhumvit, so this is where I got off...The ride was quite crowded - was lucky getting on in the airport so I could have a seat and be in control of my suitcase. And the connection to the MRT in Makkasan is a really long and warm walk. Probably not suited for everyone .... but it is there and if you know the route, it gets the job done.
Great way to get there & away. Most of the times the best way & cheapest to get to the airport fast & cheap. It conects to the bts so it takes you mostly everywhere

Best way to travel from Airport into the city.. Comfortable, fast, clean, cheap.
Great value and you save a lot of time.
Lovely view over Bangkok too both day and night time.

Convient way to get to the airport. If you're anywhere near BTS Skytrain or Airport Rail Link and you need to get to the airport quickly, Airport Link is the way to go!! Saves you a lot of time by avoiding the traffic to the airport.
Very handy !!. If you are lucky enough to be located close to the skytrain , you will be able to experience so much more of Bangkok. Easy to use , clean and inexpensive.

Love it!. I love it when major cities build a train to the airport and don't listen to "Taxi Maffia"!This train can be taken a few floors below the airport and goes straight through Bangkok's center. If you are not staying close to the stations, it is still wise to take them as close as possible, then getting off at a station, then catch a taxi (tell the taxi driver, "Meter" and point to the meter, or you WILL be screwed). At the End of the line, it meets the green line at Phaya Thai.In Nov 2015, it was 45 baht from Airport to the end of the line.If you are staying at or around Khaosan Rd, you need to go to the last stop, then catch a Taxi from there. For some reason, no trains or skytrains go to Khaosan Rd (probably the Taxi Maffia blocked it!)
Amazing service. By taking this service you save money and you don't waste your time inside a taxi in a traffic jam! Last time in bkk I spent almost two howers inside a taxi . Never again ,

Cheap n Fast . Given the awful traffic in Bangkok, the airport rail link is a good way to get into the city.The link drops you off at Phaya Tai from where you can get connections to various other lines. Can get quite crowded at rush hour and can be a but if a pain if you're lugging a suitcase around.

Express link out of service!. The express link is out of service, the regular one with several stops takes approx 30 mins. It is clean & efficient, but very crowded & no seats available. Thank goodness for the airconditioning!

Cheaper and faster way to/from airport. Definitely the faster way to go/from the airport especially during peak hours. Cheaper and faster. It was quite crowded as it gets nearer to town but it's better to stuck in the traffic.

most efficient transportation. it's best way to travel from airport to downtown esp. on peak hour. It only takes you less than 30min for 45B. Schedule is quite frequent running every 15min. The termination station- phaya thai is directly connected to BTS station.

excellent. Checked baggage in with Singapore airways at train station, thought we would have to lug bags through train, very handy to check bags in all the way to Adelaide from the train station. Train was fast, few stops and very comfortable.

hard if you have to much luggage. we tried the sky train to the airport this year and found it to very good,cheap and efficient,cost was about 130 baht, and there was 4 of us,so price wise there is no difference but time wise it took about 30 min,[ taxi peak hour about 1to1.1/2 hours.]worth a try..happy traveling ....

Wonderful A train to te aiirport. Cities that often regard themselves as a being a cut above Bangkok (for example, Melbourne, Australia) quite often have no link to the airport, while Bankok has this wionderful train. No more traffic jams and jitters.
Unreliable and packed in rush hour. Train sometimes do not arrived as scheduled and made passenger need to wait for train too long and packed when arrived.

Clean a must . I enjoyed every day drip on the train. The people working at the station speak better English that the ones at the hotels. They are professional and willing to help and assist. The trains are super clean and the ac is fantastic
Terrific Way of Travel. They make it so easy. A 45 baht disc and in a few stops you are joined to the bits skytrain system. Beats taxis!
Great transport. Very fast and efficient transport to the airport. On time and very clean. From the airport to the last stop at Phaya Thai it is 45 bhat and takes 30mins tops.

Very good service. We used the airport rail link on our first visit to Bangkok. It is incredibly simple to use. It is also efficient. It is very clean. Before boarding at the airport the guards check the train so remember to wait until they tell you to board. You will get a token to use as you go through the rail barrier. You need to keep this and use when exiting the train station. The fare to the end of the line is only 45 Bh. We then had a simple walk to our hotel. Changing trains is also very east.

Best, cheapest and fastest way to get from Airport to the City. RailLink is the best, cheapest and fastest way to get from Airport to the City. At the end station you have a connection to BTS and somewhere in the middle is a connection to the subway. So you have a perfect connection whereever you have to go. In case you have a hotel at the river check if they offer free shuttle boats to the bts station (most hotels offer)
Awesome and Fascinating - a real Thai experience. Efficient and simple! Best way to exit Suvarnabhumi airport especially as you don't want to face traffic after a long flight!!

Efficient train service. Very easy to commute, good ticket price, able to avoid traffic jams endemic on the BKK roads. Also, able to see a part of urban BKK landscape from the rail track: interesting.

great way to reach the airport. This train is really great. you are in the airport in just under 30 minutes. no traffic hassles. and cheapest way to reach the airport. Very neat and clean. I don't think any other way of transport can be better than this if you want to go to the airport.

Easy & Inexpense ride to the city. to me this is the only way to go. with bangkok traffic, one never knows how long a trip can take. we jumped on at the airport and took a taxi from our stop to the hotel. easy, fast, inexpensive
Very convenient!. Extremely fast and convenient way to get to the airport! Very much recommended in this busy bisy city! :)
Fast, comfortable, efficient, on time. The best way to beat traffic in Bangkok. If you travel with 2 persons or up, a taxi can be cheaper though.
efficient and preferred!. it's efficient and simple! my preferred choice of exiting suvarnabhumi airport! doesn't make sense to battle the horrible Bangkok jam on road!

Perfect way to travel to and from the airport. The Airport Rail Link is a very efficient and economic way to travel to and from the airport. Upon arrival, we arrived we took a taxi from the airport into Bangkok. The taxi was metred and we had absolutely no complaints at all with the service received. When leaving Bangkok, we decided to try out the Airport Rail Link. We were not carrying loads of luggage and we discovered that it was not only a very pleasant and comfortable way to travel but it was also cheaper than the initial taxi trip. Saving a few Baht is really neither here or there but the Rail Link gave us an opportunity to comfortably see a bit more of the outskirts of Bangkok. The trip back to the airport seemed to take less time than it did in a taxi.

Alternative mean of transport . I always take Airport Rail Link from Suvannaphumi to Phraya Thai station if I arrive in the afternoon or at busy traffic time in Bangkok. It is only less than 45 minutes. And it is quite comfortable. Then from Phraya Thai you can take BTS to other parts of the city. Since I stay at Intercontinental, it is only 3 stops after Phraya Thai station. There is NO direct transit anymore but stop every station. But that's OK. It is still acceptable because it is only less than 45 minutes.

Air conditioned comfort and no traffic. We have used this service before to get to the airport but this time we weren't flying. We wanted to get to a bus that leaves from the airport going to Hua Hin and from our hotel in Pratinum, this was definitely the most convenient way to get there.

If it goes near your hotel it is worth taking. I usually just take a taxi from my the airport to my hotel. Well, my hotel on this trip was right on the Sky Train line so I thought I would give the airport link a try. Worked great. Easy to understand. Easy to get you to the city. Depending on where your hotel is it may not work. I also don't know if I would recommend it if you have a lot of luggage. I travel with just carry on.

convenient. Used this all the time as our hotel is just outside one station (nsa vegas hotel). Very convenient to use going to and from airport as well as to different bangkok attractions. Not to mention that fare is cheap.

transport back to airport for going home. Trains were clean, but the transfer point was quite a distance to walk with luggage, and very confusing, next time I will book a taxi, worth the extra $18! This was included in the tour

Very Fast Cheap Safe Travel Direct to Airport. With connections from the BTS Skytrain, Metro, and bus system, ~1 Euro to the Airport. Fast, clean, safe, A/C. One of the best global city Airport transport I have been on!
Cheap and fast. An easy transportation from airport to silom which took us about 80mins. A cheap and quick way to travel into Bkk.
super connection to town. fairly easy to find at the airport, this is the best link into the airport. price is good. note, you nerd to go down two floors from arrivals.

Fast travel to and from the airport. The airport link is from the city and there are at least10 stops. The average waiting time for the airport rail link is around 10 minutes each way. Try not to get on the rail link during peak hours in the morning and afternoon, you will get off the train feeling like a sardine at a convention. Prices are very reasonable for the tickets.

fast and convenient way to go to the center of bangkok. one of the fastest and most convenient way to go into the center of Bangkok from the airport is the the airport link. if you are going to nearby places it saves you a lot of time and money. The different stops link with the main places of Bangkok and the last station is at Phaya Thai where you can ride the BTS to any where you want to go to. This is a very easy means to go around if you do not have a lot of luggage or bags to deal with.

Best way to and from airport. This is by far the cheapest and fastest way to and from the airport if your hotel is near one of its stations or another BTS or MRT stop. That is I only recommend transfer without heavy luggage as it is not convenient due to many stairs and the hot climate. Another plus if you arrive, the money changers directly at the airport link station have very competitive rates. Super rich for example offers the same rates like downtown except their two head offices. I always change my first batch there and never regretted it. It is safe and fast as there are few people.
Very practical way to arrive in the center of Bangkok. If you are not full of havy luggages this is the best way to go to the center of Bangkok. Cheap and fast...

Fast and Punctual. It's only 5 mins from my house to the nearest station, regular trains to Phaya Thai and back. Excellent service faster than a taxi but for a group of people more expensive. The downside, always standing room only.

Way better, faster and less expensive than a taxi into town.. Way better, faster and less expensive than a taxi into town. I take the rail link from BKK to Sukumvit area. From there you can connect easily to Skytrain. If you have a lot of baggage, would still take a taxi for the convenience. But it will take longer. Always ask the taxi to take the toll road. You will have to give him cash for the toll booths but will save you 20-30 minutes travel time.

convenient, good price, but often crowded. I have taken this the I report link several times and I find it very convenient however is often also very crowded and difficult to find a seat. The price is cheap at 80 baht but it stops at many stations. I still preference it to the taxi though.

Fast transfer to the city. Very fast and cheap way to get to the city. Firstly you need to take Airport Rail Link, then you can transfer to BTS. It's very fast at the rush hour. However taxi is faster at the weekend.

City Line is crowded and Airport Express line is not operating. Sometimes I take the Airport Rail Link when my time allows, and I am not in a rush to check-in to the hotel in town. Ok, so first off, the Express train from airport to Makkasan station seems to have stopped operating for some time now. So, the City Line that stops at every stop is working. It seems to run about 15 mins apart, so expect an average of about 8 minutes (10 minutes from experience) by the time you reach the platform to board the train.Each station is roughly about 5-7 mins apart, and it can get crowded, so try to get a seat if you can, especially with luggage. Its not the most comfortable, if you compare with Singapore, Hong Kong or London, but it gets the job done and airconditioning is good. The average time from airport station to Makkasan is about 25-28 mins. Add about 7-8 mins for PhayaThai. Its not superfast, but during peak hours could be the best way to get from airport to the city hotels. The only issue is that the interconnecting BTS trains don't really have lifts inside the station, and sometimes the lifts in the Makkasan and PhayaThai stations are under servicing, so be careful lugging the heavy luggage down the stairs. You may fall if you are not careful down a long flight of steps.

Great way to avoid heavy traffic. This is not my first time catching airport rail link to hotel. It was a great way to avoid traffic jam during peak time in Bangkok. Just a short distance walk from the station to my hotel. It's convenience; not too long ride, cool air-con and reasonable cost.One negative comment on how to purchase ticket, it should be a better way. Right now you have to get coins from station teller booth and then go to a machine to buy tickets. Hence, you have to line up twice; one to get your change and then buy ticket. Note that only station from Bangkok back to Airport. I think from airport, you can get ticket from the ticket booth

The Best Way to get to the Airport. Cabs during busy traffic hours are not the fastest way to the airport. The raillink is very convenient and fast. I get it from the Phraya Thai BTS stop, and I am at the airport in about 35 minutes.
Perfect way to get from the airport!. The Airport Rail Link is excellent. Just wished that the information people were more helpful for us first timers to the city!
Airport to city. The airport link was great..cheap...and fast. I googled my hotel area...found the closest station. The rest was easy..walked the block or two from the station.
fast and reliable way to get from airport to Bangkok.. clean trains, clean stations, fast, cheap reliable, easy access to BTS and MRT. Quite busy during rush hour.

Only way to travel. So easy from the airport particularly if you are staying as many thousands do close to a BTS station.I always stop in Sukhumvit and a 47 baht ticket from the Airport to Phaya Thai and then get on the BTS line which is so easy.Another 30 to 40 baht later and only around 25 minutes you are in Sukhumvit.All carriages are so clean and tidy as no drinks or food is allowed to be consumed on board and all in the luxury of AC.The train is below the main airport from just go down the escalators and follow the city train signs
Excellent service. This airport link is so easy to use, so quick to get to the major airport of Bangkok. Runs every 15 minutes or so, and value for money.

The transport system is very efficient. The Rail Link connects to various parts of Bangkok. Even if you have to exit the train and catch a connecting train it is all very efficient. The people on the platforms, whether they are security, police or just locals are all very helpfull. It can get very crowded but be patient and polite. Always wait for passengers to exit the train before you get on.

Best to avoid traffic on the road, and inexpensive. As it costs only 45 Baht from Suwarnabhumi Airport, it is a lot less expensive but a lot faster than a taxi. I always take it until Phaya Thai, but you can also get out at Makkasan for downtown, or other destinations in the city. It is easy to get a seat from the airport, but the train fills up fast after that, as it stops at each interrmediate station.
Easy and quick. Cheaper way to leave the airport. Easy and Quick. Departure from the underground of the airport (-2)
Nice Transportation. When you visited Bangkok, as a traveler this transportation is worthed.But remember not to used this transportation in the middle of work time.
20+ stops on the way to the airport. Usually over-crowded and standing room only. Rush hour is a nightmare. Many stairs to manage in case you have a suitcase to carry. Not advised for seniors.

Easy to use, don't waste cab fare!. Used to get into Bangkok centre on arrival. Great clear signs and helpful staff all with great English. Cheap to use and runs often. Express wasn't running when I arrived but regular service was just as good. Would definitely use again.
Cheap way to get from airport to hotel. cheap easy to use getting from the airport to your next location. Try not to go during their peak hours with a lot of luggage. Can be a nightmare

Well managed rail link service. No wonder why Thailand is a preferred tourist destination for people around the world. The services for tourists are so good that one is naturally drawn to this country.. Airport rail link is your best alternative to high priced taxis. No matter where you are staying, you will find your way into the city with airport rail link.. And the officials present at the stations go out of their way to help you. A big thumbs up to Thai government for maintaining this so well!

excellent to get to the city. clean, safe, affordable service, what else to ask for? Euroe, please learn from them and take care your system much better and try to make it as good as they do in Thailand

Cheap and reliable!. Couldn't fault it, easy to understand and cheap. We got it as far as Phang Ga and another train from that stop.
Cheap and safe.

Fast transport from airport. Very handy train link to get to the airport - fast, efficient and very clean.
Definately the way to get back and forth from the airport to the city..
Simple and cheap. Taxis are pretty cheap in Bangkok, but the airport rail link is an even cheaper option. Easy to use and you'll be in central Bangkok in about the same time as a taxi.
Fast and covenience. Since I had some time on this business trip, I decided to take the train from the aiport into town. What a great way to travel! Cheap and very enjoyable too.

Functional and cheap. If your hotel is near a train station or BTS station, this is a great way to get from the airport to central places. Having been to BKK many times, I wonder why I never tried this before. Not slick like HongKong or London's dedicated airport links, it's nevertheless reliable and cheap. During traffic jams you can look down at the poor people who didn't think of this.

Conflict. Seriously Avoid office rush hours here-each year it gets worse and worse. Conflict may occur because local Thai workers going to and from work cannot get through your luggage bags. If you are going to the airport in the Rush hour you may have a serious problem trying to get on with luggage. Most Thais now use the airport link to go home or to work

Real deal Rail. Even though this is our first trip to Bangkok, we were gung ho enough to take the airport rail to our apartment. Thanks to my husband's endless googling and preparatory work prior to our trip. It was relatively hassle-free to locate the rail from Suvarnabhumi Airport station. It cost only 90 baht for one way trip that ends at Phaya Thai station where you can get a connecting trip on a BTS Skytrain.

Easy to use, gets you close to the city center. Title says it all. Just buy a ticket at a vending machine or at the cashier's at the airport. In traffic hours, it will be your fastest choice for getting into the city. However, often you will need to get a taxi from the train station, anyway.

Quick and cheap but think twice if you get off at Makkasan. We got off at Makkasan as it was the closest station to our hotel. We had 2 suitcases and it was quite a long trek down from the station down to road level in the heat - a mixture of ramps, escalators and stairs. Be warned that Makkasan is a chaotic major road junction and it was VERY difficult to get a taxi as there was nowhere for them to stop for long enough to get two cases in the boot/trunk. It took us about 45 minutes to find a taxi after walking to a smaller street - this was at 8.30am so it may be better at other times of the day, but I would suggest people consider that Makkasan is not the easiest place to transfer into a taxi if you have luggage.

The cheapest way to travel in to downtown bangkok. Fast, clean and at 45 baht one way this must be the cheapest airport transport link ever! If you have multiple pieces of luggage or young kids, the changes in levels might be more of a challenge, but with a rucksack or a single suitcase it's easy.
save time save money. From the city to the airport convenient.Traveling alone save money. Fare 45 baht it cheaper. If I take taxi about 250-300 baht. But the door closed loudly

Quick. A quick and easy way to get to and from the airport to central Bangkok. Still have to get to your hotel though. If there is 2 or more of you it may be better to get a taxi that gets you straight to your hotel.

I must say Thanks!!!!. Thanks to Airport link service. It just made my trip to Bangkok esay. you can get trains that link airport to the main city from suvarnabhumi airport. just take around 20 min to reach downtown Bangok
Excellent. What an airport rail service should be. Easy access. Lowest level at BKK, easy to choose, buy, pay, quick service to city center whether express or local.

Very clean and on time. The rail in Bangkok is full of people who line up in orderly fashion. No food or drink allowed at the station or in the train. The trains run on time and are very clean. Felt very safe.

good service. went into Bangkok by sky train and found it very fast and cost effective. only down side is no lifts or escalators once in Bangkok so if you have a lot of luggage then have a think first

Excellent. Quick, airconditioned, easy to use and only 45 Bath to get to Airport.
Have interchanges with all other transportation methods in Bangkok especially the BTS.
A taxi will cost ~500 Bath since they are trying to do easy money.

A fast and cheap way to get to the airport. Instead of paying 600/700 bahts for a taxi to the airport, experience the airport rail link. The cost is 90 bahts for 2 people and very clean and comfortable. Will always use this transport mode.

Best option to travel from BKK Intl Airport to the city. I have been several times in thailand, and the best option to travel from the suvarnabumi airport to the city center is the airport link.
It is cheap, fast and brings you in the city center where you can connect easily with MRT or BTS Sky train.
Fast way to get to the city center. It take up to 30 min to get to the city center, cost 45 THB. Starts from the lowest level on Bangkok`s airport.

This is a very useful link to Bangkok city. I have used this rail link quite a few times and I was impressed to find a taxi desk on the roadway under the train station which tried to find taxis that would actually use the meter to take foreigners to their final destination. Even though I got a taxi there, at the desk, managed by Thai staff, I still had to insist on the meter being turned on. I will be using it again in Dec 2015 so will try it again.
Easy, clean, cheap. For 50 baht you can grab the link to the airport. The cars are big and clean. The ride is fast and drops you right off at the airport.

Cheap and efficient.. This is the by far the cheapest, safest, and fastest way to get to the center of Bangkok and the connection with the Sky Train and other transport systems makes it ideal for further transfer to other places in Bangkok.
Good service. As far as possible, use ARL in Bangkok. The last option must be travel by road. To go to many places, you can also use boat service. Very cheap and fast.

THE CHEAPEST AND BEST WAY TO GET TO BANGKOK. We have used the train on a number of occasions and find it the cheapest and best way to get to Bangkok. We go to the end of the line and a cab from there takes us to the Vie Hotel for the cost of 100 baht.

Great link from BKK to downtown. They have a city line that has a few stops and an express line that goes from airport to downtown where most of the tourist hotels are then take a taxi to hotel. The traffic is very bad here and can cost a lot in a taxi as you are in jams all the time except during the early hours 1am-5am
slow train for the big populations. trains are running too slow for the size of population. but clean and well maintain for big population at bkk

A great way to get to the city..... I landed at BKK on October 5th and since it was a trip on a budget, I decided to take the ARL to get closer to the hotel before getting a taxi. It was a very nice experience. Follow the signs from arrivals to the ARL. I had looked at a Youtube video to see how to pay and it was as easy as it looked on the video and you are off. Looking around for our first look at Bangkok and before we knew it we were there. Then we exit go down the stairs, there was a taxi counter and off to the hotel. All the estimates I got for the taxi from the airport to hotel were in the 400-500 baht range, But with the train and taxi, it cost about 225 baht for 2 people total. Since this was a budget trip, it was a great start. Plus it is clean, not too crowded (around 10 am) and rapid. A very nice experience from start to finish.
Fast, cheap and efficient !. Great way to come and go to main international airport. Easy connection with MRT subway and BTS Sky train.
Quick and easy. The best way to travel from the airport to the city and to avoid the famous trafic congestion of Bangkok.

Fast and cheap. This is the cheapest and by far fastest way to get to and from the airport when taking into account how congested the city is. The views from the train are also interesting and give you an interesting view of the city.
Good. . If you are on your own then get this into the city then take a taxi or subway or sky train to your hotel. If there is a few of you travelling then get a taxi, probably work out the same price
so easy to reach city center. great service and all the stuffs are very kind, they help me so many times with my crazy luggage... lovely people!
Much longer wait then Skytrain. Although they state its for airport, and yes it goes there, the general public use it, and its crowded. if travelling in a pair i would still use a taxi

Skip the taxis and Go Rail. Arrived at the BKK International Airport at about noon on Wednesday, as a solo traveler, I decided to start my SE Asia adventure by skipping the taxis and instead use public transportation. Took the Airport Rail Link to the Phaya Thai station where I transferred to the BTS SkyTrain to the Siam station then a second BTS SkyTrain to the Sala Daeng station which was only 500 meters to my hotel. I was pleasantly surprised on how easy it was. The ticket and information agents and even the security people were very helpful in guiding me to the proper platforms & stations needed and ticket purchases. The trains were clean, not crowded, quick, and very affordable. Being elevated you get a great view of the city. It was a good decision to avoid the taxis and go training. But I do need to try a Tuk Tuk sometime during my stay.

Excellent transportation. The traffic in Bangkok is terrible-- so that it can take 1 1/2 hours to 2 hours to get from the airport to the Hilton. This is an reasonable alternative. Clean, quick and on time.
So convene to use. Just so easy to use.And if station is close to your hotel it makes it even simpler.And I always find someone friendly on the train and willing to assist .
Very convenient airport connection. At 45 baht from Suvarnabhumi Airport to Phaya Thai, the airport link is the cheapest way to get to your hotel.

Convinient way to reach Bangkok City. It starts from B-2 level of Suvarnabhumi Airport. A one-side journey to Phaya Thai costs 45 Baht only. From there you get connectivity to rest of the city via BTS. In comparative terms, taxi to Phaya Thai would cost you 350-400 Baht.
very good ranch cheap. this train is very cheap and very fast, is better to take this, because usually in bangkok there is a lot of traffic

Easy and fast to Phaya Thai last station.. Really great way to get to the city centre from the airport. Tickets are cheap it goes every 20minutes, doesnt stuck in the traffick jam and its last station is Phaya Thai so if you go to the place that is not near you must take tuk tuk or Taxi to get there..they are waiting on the groud where you will leave sky train.
easay reansport. The best way to get around Bangkok, only minus is, no where to park a car near any of the stations.They are on time, safe ride and easy to figure out.

Take a taxi instead!. So iof you want to leave BKK, and you are NOT directly next to the train stain, you have to take a taxi to get there already. Arrived at the train station you are facing to carry up your traveling luggage upstairs manually as escalators are not existing or not working temporarily. Train cost around 100 THB per person plus the taxi to the train station will cost you another 60-80 THB approx. If you take a taxi from downtown to airport by taxi it costs you 240 THB plus 75 THB highway fee. So if you are traveling not alone, to safe money by taking a taxi, and if you are traveling alone, you still safe nerves, time and energy (carrying luggage the stairs)… Your call!
exellent ad fast. fast and clean ,every 15 minutes take off and they have a service 24 hours from a well known location

Great way to go from and to the airport if you travel light. The trains are clean, cool, quick and efficient, they are also very cheap. Plenty of room for luggage. But it gets trickier if you have to connect to the BTS system at Phaya Thai with large suitcases as you have to carry them up and down the stairs in most stations. Only recommended if you travel light, otherwise stick to taxis.
Good choice. Not too many people in rush hout compare with BTS-MRT, which is good.The train not coming late, always be on time.

Best way to avoid the notorious taxi driver and jam to the airport.. Best way to the airport, cheap, convenience and comfortable, without the headache of bargaining with dishonest cab driver and fighting their jam!flip side... long walk from BTS station and longer than usual waiting time, but overall beat all other transport to the airport hands down!!!

Better by far than a taxi ride. I regularly use this link when travelling in and out of Bangkok. It's reasonably frequent and quick, the price is cheap, and it's air-conditioned. Beats kamikaze taxi drivers in cabs with the seat belts tied down so that they cannot be used!I normally change trains at Phaya Thai station. It's a little inconvenient that you have to drag bags quite a distance, but apart from that the transfer works OK. The only time I have tried leaving the Airport rail link at Makkasan station was also the last. This place might work for some, but I found it very difficult to understand and to get around. With these few provisos, it's a good service.

Excellent fast service !!!. We (Me & My wife ) used this Train during our visit of Thailand on October, 2013. The service was so fast, comfortable, great. I recommended everybody for this. It save time & money
Fast way to travel in Bangkok. One can get the Airport Rail Link right from Suvarnbhumi airport. It also connects to BTS skytrain which can then be boarded to travel further in Bangkok.
Easy and cheap. Take this train if you want to go to the center, go,s raster then staking a taxi because no Traffic jam. At the zending station there are taxis waiting to take you to your destination

Easy, fast, fixed fare price!!. I definitely agree that Airport rail link is the most convenient transportation you can use to get in and out of Suvarnabhumi Airport which is like 20 plus kilometers from Bangkok center. Airport rail link Suvarnabhumi station located just inside the terminal, super easy to find. Instead of hours traveling in crazy Bangkok traffic, Airport rail link allow you to travel back and forth in less than half an hour. Also the fare is fixed depending on the distance travelled.  Although, Airport rail link doesn't open 24/7. The operating hour is from early morning 6 am to midnight.

Airport Rail Link. This is the 1st time that I had ever took a Airport Rail to the city center. It was a nice experience, the staff at the station were very helpful. The journey was smooth and fast. If you are two persons or alone and on leisure holiday , I would recommend this mode of travel to the city , is convenient , fast ,smooth and cheap. Is only and $35-45bth. Is the cheapest that I have ever paid for a train service to the city in any country that I have been before.One can connect to the MRT ( Dark Blue Line ) at Makkasan to many places such as Patpong at Sala Daeng Station , Huai Khwang station where the famous Sooboom Seafood are and the night market and further north you can find Chatuchak weekend market. You can also connect at Phaya Thai to light green line and explore the shopping belt along Sukhumvit such as MBK near Siam and Siam Paragon , Central World etc.Most important taking the Airport Rail line, you are sure of the time reaching town center. Traffic in Bangkok can be really terrible I was once caught up with traffic Jam for more than two hours from Airport to Town. That two hours could have gone to a good foot massage and shopping or some cold beer somewhere. Trust me traffic are really bad in Bangkok , always take the subway.Best of luck travelers

good to connect you. IF you wish to go directly to the main city of bangkok this a must choice very simple and easy to use once ur on it.To those who wish to save more an use better its a must to bound to be on board. can get it from level one of airport basement. come out of C-exit move downstairs grab some breakfast or meal at the food court below and set on the link covers distance to main places in half an hr., frequency is good and very cheap to use.
No Hurdle. airport rail link is the best way to reach the centre in bangkok without any traffic jam and it is the way cheaper than any other means of transportation in bangkok.

More cars and more frequency needed. Airport Rail Link provides more than city to airport transport. It is also a time saving commuter link. More frequent trains and more cars per train would ease overcrowding and shorten waiting time. Enclosed air-conditioned stations would make waiting for trains more comfortable.

A great cheap way to travel. This rail link is great . Coming from the airport it goes to the interchange station. you will have to change platforms for further travel & you will need to purchase another ticket to travel on the normal Skytrain. If you intend to travel to the airport do not attempt to go in the afternoon peak time .The train is modern clean & air conditioned is is a great way to avoid the famous Bangkok traffic jams.

Fast Easy and Very Convenient.. Had to rush some documents out to the airport last Friday so took the Airport Rail Link from Ratchaparop Station. Delivered us directly into the Terminal and took the lift to Level 4 Check-in to meet the passenger. Reverse to Makkasan Station back in to city. Forty Baht each way waited no longer than 11 minutes for the train.

Fast way to reach City (without jam). Chose to take this city line from airport to hotel (Centara Watergate Pavillion Hotel). It took us about 25mins to reach the Rajprarop station and after 10mins walk we reached the hotel. As you know Bangkok traffic jam can be quite bad...taking the train really save us so much time.

The only way to get from/to the airport. We took the train from the city to the airport one morning around 9am. We embarked at the first station Phaya Thai and managed to secure a seat for the duration of the trip. Interesting view from the train and it was clean, quick and efficient. Definitely recommended as a hassle free, cheap way to get to the airport (and in time for your flight).

Alternative BTS. While the name is airport link, it also served like BTS. We took this train from Ratchaprarop to last destination which linked to BTS. However we can't use rabbit card, so need to buy single trip ticket everytime.
quick transport. nice cheap and quick public transport from airport to the city center :) you have nice view from, :):)

Smart & faster way to get to the city or back. This is the most convenient and cheapest way to get into Bangkok city from the airport or vice versa. We used the Airport Rail Link for the first time last week while in Bangkok. We found the service fast, cheap, and efficient. Better than annoying and expensive taxi any day. Makkasan is the junction where you can go from the airport to connect with other rail lines. Inside the airport it’s easy to manage, just follow the signs. It's well marked. Doesn’t take more than 30 minutes to reach. The train stops at 3-4 stops in between and you can see locals traveling in it as well.
I like the airport rail link. Very very convenient to goto from airport to Pratunam , fast , nice and clean environment and half of the price of the taxi , must go with airport rail link

Quick Easy Cheap. We commuted from Airport to other Shopping destinations through Airport link and BTS. Gives you a upper view of Bangkok and is much cheaper and faster. Saves you from the Road Traffic. All you need is a map which you will get in plenty at hotels and you can commute at nominal cost.Although it was crowded at night return trip to airport, locals were kind enough to give us seats considering our infant in hand. So our total experience of Rail Metro was excellent. Also you don't feel cheated, because the Cabs charge high, unless you know what to pay. Ticket vending machines are very easy to use.
Easy. Most convenient and cheapest way to get into Bangkok from the airport. Avoid the annoying taxi drivers and get on the railway.
good train. Nice connection between the city & airport. Better than taking a taxi for the longest part of your trip into town.

Amazingly poorly thought out. The Rail Link should be the perfect option for getting downtown. It should drop you right by Sukhumvit and Central World. Instead, it doesn't connect to the BTS (sky train) or MRT (subway), it requires you to lug your suitcases up and down stairs, and because it was so poorly planned, it doesn't get much business. Someone should be fired.

Cheap way to get to the airport ( or reverse). Very good alternative to a taxi. I used a taxi to get from the airport to my hotel because it was my first time in Bangkok but when I left Bangkok I choose the train to save some money and it was the right decision. Cheaper, cool, no traffic jam.

First-Time Rail Link User - Very Impressed!. I used the Airport Rail Link for the first time last week while in Bangkok. I found the service fast, cheap, and efficient. Picking up the Rail Link at the airport is easy - just follow the signs down to the bottom floor. It's well marked. I believe it was about 45 baht to take it from Suvarnibhumi to Makkasan Station in the middle of the city.The ride itself was smooth and relaxing - more relaxing than dodging Bangkok traffic in a taxi. A stop in we picked up a load of school kids who were heading in to the city, which caused the train to fill right up, but even then it was an easy ride.The only small hassle is if you have a lot of luggage and need to carry it from whatever station you get off at. For me, it wasn't a big deal and I will use this cheap and efficient option on my next trip to Bangkok, for sure.

Express wasn't running either time - good job City Line was. I was concerned the journey on the City Line would be much slower and packed with local commuters. Fortunately it wasn't and it didn't take much longer than I think the Express would have done from Makasan to the airport. It's all very modern and efficient. For one or two people it definitely has the advantage over getting a taxi and sitting in horrendous traffic.

Quick and cheap. Costs 45 baht from the basement level of the airport to Phaya Thai Bts station connecting you to most of the city. Just check your hotel is near a bts station and in the likely event it is you have fast inexpensive transport to and from the airport.

Easy and comfortable Airport access. Built by siemens, this is a great and fast airport transfers facility in the busy city of Bangkok. Plus, its not just a normal metro line, its Sky Train, you will love the view.

Affordable, convenient. Affordable way to go down town. Easy access from airport to airport rail link platform.Took it from airport to phaya thai then change BTS line to national stadium. 45baht And doesn't even need an hour to reach.

Clean and super easy to use. I was pleasantly surprised with how easy it was to buy tickets for this Airport Rail link.Station is located in the basement of the Airport. Buy tickets/disc from booth and hold disc over yellow spot to enter station. One way ticket cost 45 baht. Ensure to walk along the platform rather than stopping atthe bottom of the escalator as guards will blow the whistle at you.Hop on the train at platform 1 or 2 both head into the city. I missed the first train as I was waitinb on the wrong side. Trains come every 15 minutes or so.Luggage carriers in train. I couldnt find an escalator so I had to lug my case down the stairs this is thd the only pitfall.

Cheap, fast and easy way to city. Really friendly and helpfull workers even tough it's really simple to hop on and of from the train. Bit irritating to open your bags for security personals when getting to stations. Locals don't need to do ir.But very simple to use and furthermore really cheap way to travel

cheap and fast. The link is fast, low price, clean but it's quite crowded. Air condition works very well and the train run smoothly. Just half an hour from Payathai station to get to suwannapoom airport. This is the best way to avoid Bangkok heavy traffic. One thing if I want to complaint is there is no lift at payathai bts station to connect to airport rail link.

very good. Airport Rail Link (06:00-midnight) that connects downtown Bangkok with Suvarnabhumi International Airport is a smart alternative to the airport’s express buses or taxis. it is better because you safe time and avoid traffic jam and money . howere it is not work 24 Hrs.The Airport Rail Link connects you to the MRT underground at Makkasan City Interchange Station (MRT Petchaburi Station) and the BTS Skytrain at Phayathai Station. Please note, the baggage check-in at Makkasan Station is no longer available. From Bangkok International Airport (Suvarnabhumi), the entrance to the Airport Rail Link service is on the First Floor.The ticket is 45 Baht.it is bad idea if you have heavy luggage.

Fast cheap way to get downtown. The airport rail link is the best way to get downtown. From the airport to Bts station right downtown costs, 90 baht or roughly 3 dollars. It takes about 25 minutes and you can go wherever you want from there. Don't take the taxi out of airport as it costs 1500 baht to go downtown and is a scam! The train is downstairs in the airport and is easy to use.

Convenient. Skip the traffic and reach airport on time! Cheap and the best option. Very convenient to use. Bangkok traffic could sometimes be very bad and hence this could be a very good way to reach airport on time.
Very Good Service. Airport Rail link is a very useful service provided by the government to easily avoid the heavy traffic from Airport to the Central Bangkok, very punctual.
That Just skytrain not interesting. If you want to go to airport this is a good thing, if you have any big luggage you have to carry it on stairs It that the bad thing
The best transport from Airport to center. The best transport from Airport to center. Ticket from Suvarnabhumi to Phaya Thai is 45THB and it's take about 25-30 minutes.

WOW... Efficient, Fast & much cheaper... Used the Rail Link for AIrport transfers & was amazed to see the cleanliness on the train.. Its a very efficient medium to reach the city from Airport & offers a great first look of the city from the elevated tracks...takes about 50 bahts to reach Makkasan where a normal taxi would take about 300 bahts easily...
fast and cheap. Skip the taxi and take this train from the airport, is safe especially if you are traveling alone. Its fast comparing to taxi.
Best way to downtown.. From arrivals at Suwarnabhumi, down a couple levels and elevated train right into Bangkok. Phayathai, 300 metre walk and I'm at my hotel.

Easy transport. The entrance for the rail link is hidden 2 floors down in the airport but clearly marked.The price is 90bath which isn't much cheaper than a taxi and the train gets very full during rush hour.A bit confusing for first time visitors also that the rail link and rest of skytrain network operate differently and you need to buy ticket again after switching from rail link to sky train.Still clean, fast and easy way of traveling though.
Terrible. It used to be a quick and inexpensive way into town. Now IMO it's a pain in the backside and far better to just spend the $10 and get a taxi straight to your door

excellent to use without having luggage to roll. I tried it last year and always look for the map and ask where are you going ..the bad thing is that they don't have a sliding wall for rolling the bags or a wheelchair...they don't have electric stairs...

Fast and Cheap. If you are traveling solo or as a couple this is the best way to get to the city from airport. Not only that this is cheapest method to travel to the Bangkok city from Swarnabumi Airport. It cost me only 45 THB last time I came to Phaya ThaiIf you are coming 1st time to Thailand I recommend to use this because cab drivers can rip you off.End of the Red line you can connect to the BTS trains and that will take you to most of the places in Bangkok city (check for my BTS review)

Quick and easy. Just go down to the basement, get on the subway and ride downtown. You don't have to worry about traffic or taxi drivers trying to deceive you. Until you get to the end and they have a taxi service where I ended up waiting about 30 minutes to get a Taxi... They have a guy working and he asks where you are going and they call a taxi for you, but not many go there I would suggest walking to the road which is right nearby, many empty taxis which will take you where you need to be for a few extra baht than the normal fare.

Fantastic way to commute to the city. When I travel to bkk, which is 4-5 times a month for business/leisure... This is the only way I will ever consider to the city! Not even a free limousine ride can tempt me to get stuck in a 3 hours jam. And BKK is notorious for their jams. For 90 baht (iirc), you can take the train from airport (basement level, look out for the signage) to the city in about 25-30 mins. Trains are clean, seats are available. Ample space to have your luggage in front of you if you dont trust putting your luggage at the luggage bay areas. What I usually do, take the train to Phaya Thai (last station) and change to the BTS to reach Siam station or Chit Lom station. If I am too lazy to change to the BTS, I will just exit at Phaya Thai and take a cab, which is quite cheap. So yes, this is the only way to travel for me.
Easy and convenient . The airport link is easily understandable, efficient and fast. It is much more cheaper and convenient, without the risk of traffic jam as compared to taking a cab.

Don't tell anyone!. It takes a total of an hour airport to hotel door, including changing to the local BTS for the last leg. So it's massively better than Bangkok traffic. But keep it a secret so it doesn't get too busy.
Fantastic. In a different league to London! Clean, plenty of room, frequent service. Helpful staff if you need any advice but route is easy to plan and to find your way around
Fantastic . I cannot believe that more people do not use this. It's so much quicker and cheaper than any other way into Bangkok.
Fast, clean & efficient!. Having visited Thailand for more than a couple of times, it was my first time to use the ARL. I was totally impressed.Saves you a lot of time and very affordable!Splendid!

Great travel option. Took taxi from airport into city centre but driver unsure of how to get to my final destination so that caused a little bit of stress on my part as I had a deadline to meet. Traffic congestion quite a problem too. On return trip I took local taxi to railway station and then airport rail link - much better travel experience despite time it took to get to railway station due to traffic congestion. Would do airport link / taxi combo in future as cheaper, faster option especially for a solo traveller.

never use a taxi again. the train ticket is less than 100 Bhat why bother using other forms of transport .The last stop is Phaya Thai .so from there its easy to get to your hotel . I always use this safe and clean mode of transport

Bangkok Airport to downtown. This is of great conveniency to go to and from the airport to the city and vice versa. Although it could get really packed during before and after office hours, it's still a good choice to avoid the hectic traffic on the road.
economical and efficient. Economical and very efficient to get to and from the airport. Can get very busy and quite a tight squeeze at peak hours when the local commuters get on.

Fast transfer to the center of Bangkok!. While taxis in BKK are cheap, taking the train is a great alternative during peak hour traffic. But only without too much luggage, trains tend to fill up fast after the first stop on the way to Phaya Thai station. A taxi from Suvarnabhumi airport to Silom is around THB 450 in relative "normal" traffic (including airport surcharge and highway tolls). The train is only THB 45 (City Line train), but if you have to take a taxi later to get to you destination, you do not save much, especially if there are two passengers!

Best Way To Connect With the Sightseeing Places. This is one of the methods I always prefer to use when I travel. Infact, the public transportation systems were also created with this aspect in mind; to provide easy access to its travelers across the traveling country. The same thing applies here too. As you pass through the exit doors of the Suvarnabhumi Airport, please make it a point to collect the metro connectivity map as a reference to move across in the city. Not only is it the cheapest way to connect with the various sights in the city, it is also hassle free, safer, and cheaper. I practically did not have to 'ask' anybody out along the entire way as I traveled here. The metro map is well updated, and the information is laid down for an easy to understand language for the travelers. Buy a metro card and you can hop in and out into any part of the city at your own pace. Try also to use it to interconnect within the transportation systems such as the waterways and buses. In one simple word, I can say, it is your perfect 'MONEYSAVER'.
Sooooo much cheaper than a taxi. The airport rail link so easy to use and its so much cheaper than a taxi into Bangkok, highly recommended for cheap easy access to downtown Bangkok

very simple transfer...very cheap...far better than a taxi battling the bagkok traffic. this is definitely the way to get to and from the airport....no traffic to sit in and extremely cheap..and air conditioned!

Very convenient to go from down town bj!. It took us about 35 minutes to go from national stadium. We had to change from the sky train! It was a good choice to go to the airport! You don't have to worry about the traffic congestion!

Not a must try experience. To use the airport link makes only sense if I would know the traffic on the roads is terrible and I would miss the plane if going by taxi.Along the line there are actually not many hotels, so you have to change to another line or go the last miles in bkk by taxi. As the taxi costs 300 to 500 THB from and to the airport, it's not a big deal to use the train.
Avoid during rush hour. take a ride from Phya Thai station and very congested during peal hour 6-7 pmavoid this rail link if you have luggages

Easy, fast and cost effective!. Why stand in line in a taxi queue, with all the frustration of haggling with a taxi driver when you can take the Airport Rail Link at a fraction of the cost and time to the heart of Bangkok??The Airport Rail link is easy to get to ( one floor below the public taxis ) and not over crowded and is between 35 and 65 baht for journey. There is also ample suitcase and baggage space. The Rail link goes to Phraya Thai and from there you can connect to the BTS easily or get a taxi from the centre of the city. Very clean and efficient!!

Grat way to get downtown from the airport. Great way to get from the airport to the city instead of being stuck in traffic. Be prepared to change train, switch to skytrain or take a cab to reach your destination. Not suitable if you travel heavy.
Link. I love airport rail link, that so help for new tourist who dont know where to go and afraid to get lost coz dont understand the langguage.

Poor system and time table.. It is not recommend to take Airport Rail Link to get to town and airport. The express line is once per hour. The city line was also a long wait. Taxi is much more reasonable and more time management.

Very good option. Much cheaper than airport taxi service to the airport. 25 minute trip with approx 6 brief local stops in between. Arrives directly inside the airport terminal.
During peek traffic periods travel to airport is slow and the airport link train is the best was to go.

May not be worth the hassle. The Express Link is a quick and economical way to get into town from the airport. It travels express from the airport to Makkasan station. However, my personal experience is that the Express Link is often out of service which forces one to rely on the City Link. The City Link stops at a couple of stations, where locals get on and off. During peak hours, the train carriage is so full of people that I found it difficult to get my luggage on/off the train. At Makkasan station, one has to walk 100-200m to reach the subway system (MRT), which involves stairs, some escalators and security checks. If one has to change to the BTS skytrain system at BTS Asoke, more stairs and escalators will be involved. In my opinion, if you can afford it, go with a taxi. It will be around 400 baht (less than AUD20) to get from the airport to the city centre. It's not much considering all the hassles you will avoid (carrying heavy luggage in hot weather, buying tickets, security checkpoints, following maps, stairs, cramped train carriages, etc.).

First time with the Airport Rail Link instead of the Taxi. being many times to bkk, I always took a taxi, which as well is pretty convenient, but this time we tried first the Airport Rail Link and it was very convenient and fast, and of course as well much cheaper than the taxi. Highly recommendable if your hotel is somewhere close to a stop of the Link

easy way to commute to Bangkok. the train is easy and fast way to travel to bangkok without a hassle of using taxi or bus. it is convenient during peak traffic hours as there is no congestion . Also it is affordable , you can choose to travel with a speed or just a local train (more stops and less expensive).

Convenience to into the city. Airport Rail Link is convenience for all traveler. When you arrive Suvanabhum Int Airport, go to the underground floor (there is sign for direction).You can buy ticket at office box or buy from machine. The cost is 45 baht/ person (around 1.1 Euro or 1.2 USD) You can enter to the city within 40-45 mins. The final station is link to BTS (Pha Ya Thai station). It's good choice because it's saver and quicker than taxi.

Very convenience way with cheap price to reach center of city. Airport rail link station is in ground floor of Suwanaphum airport. It's very convenience ad and cheap price THB 45 or USD 1.3. With this train, you can arrive center of city (Victory Monument) in 30 minute. Moreover you can connect with BTS at Phayathai Station.

Right to the airport doorstep!. I took the airport rail link on a Monday evening. It was crowded, which was not unexpected. But it was pleasant too, if you don't have too many pieces of luggage. Many people take it like the BTS and drop at the stations along the way. At 45 baht, it's a ridiculously cheap way to reach the airport. It takes about 30-40 minutes to reach the airport from Makkasan station, so plan accordingly. Once it reaches the airport, the directions to the various halls are clear so it's hard to go wrong.

The ONLY way to get to Suvarnabhumi Airport. I don't go to Bangkok much through Suvarnabhumi, but when I do, Airport Link is the only way to get to the city.I hate traffic and I hate Taxis. Airport is simple, cheap, quick and efficient. However I don't know how packed it gets around peak hour times.

A good alternative to taxis for accessing the Suvanapumi Airport. The rail link connects Savanaphumi Airport (BKK), the main international airport for Bangkok, with the sky train public transport service at Phayathai station and the MRT subway system at the MRT Petchaburi station (a short walk from the Makkasan stop on the air rail link). Note that the 'express' train system has been suspended partly because there were too few passengers willing to pay the premium price (the majority of travelers on the line are workers at the airport or locals using the line for transport between stations) and partly because of problems with rolling stock. The fare from the airport to the BTS is 45 Baht (about $1.25 these days) and takes 20-30 minutes. The major disadvantage is to transfer from the air link to the BTS requires going down a long set of stairs and with bags that is a problem. Going up from the BTS is on an escalator so that is not so bad though having more than carryon bags still is a hassle. It is not crowded and usually a seat is available plus there is space for bags on the train. A good choice for getting into the city if you are not laden with luggage.
