A quick journey to Airport avoiding busy traffic. One of the best option to reach quickly fro Airport to mid of the city without getting stuck in traffic and spending more.A comfortable journey in very less prices.

The quickest way to get into town.. The airport link is fairly new and a most welcome addition to the transport service in Bangkok. The main airport is a long way out of town and with the horrific traffice situation can take over 90 mins to reach there by taxi. This train service will take at least half of that time and is a clean and affordable alternative.

Best way to get to bkk. Even if you have backpacks, it is super simple, fast and easy to use the airport rail link to the city. It only costs around 1 euro per ticket! you can then get a tuk-tuk or taxi once you get to the center. We tried to use buses, but we end up walking since it took forever for any bus to stop!

Quickest access to the BK. Airport Rail Link is at the basement floor of Suvarnabhumi Airport, Bangkok. This has two categories such as City Link and Express Link. Express Link directly runs to the Makkasan Junction without stopping. City Link is the normal rail link. This service is very cheap if you are travelling with few people with few luggage.
Fast and cheap direct way to bangkok city. Just 45 THB to phay thai BTS station, however, you have to carry your luggage upstairs and downstairs

45 thb why use anything else?. This link is THE only way to travel in bkk. The roads are soooo congested it takes hours to get from BKK to Sukhumvit by taxi. Plus taxi is 400-1000 thb this is 45 each way with no congestion direct from airpprt. No brainer especially if solo like me.

Safe, cheap, and convenient airport transfer to Bangkok. Only 45 Baht for a 30-min. ride to Phaya Thai BTS station, which can be used to connect to major hotels in the city for another 28 Baht or less. No traffic nor hassle to worry about vs. taxi and is much cheaper than taxi (could be >400 Baht plus tolls)
Great way to run a train!. Everything you want. Fast, inexpensive, clean and it stays on schedule. Best way to get from the airport to downtown.

Efficient way to travel from airport if you're a small group with few bags. Very efficient way to get from the airport to wherever you are going. I don't recommend it if you have a lot of bags.. Otherwise, it's a great way to get to and from the airport. Trains seem to arrive every 15-20 mins. Less often than BTS or MRT but it does go further so it makes sense. From airport exit there are clear signs - you just go to lowest ground level and find machine to put your coins in - hitting the button to where you are going. It will tell you how much it costs and give you a little bingo chip thing that you use to get past the security marker. Simple!
V nice. The best,fastest, Easy and quick way to get from the airport .And its awesome if your hotel is near to any BTS line.
Quick way into the city. It was a quick and easy way to get into the city, it links up to their subway system, and not too expensive.

Just do it into town.. Just do it into town. No traffic, safe and clean. We then transfer to BTS or Metro, don't confuse the two City lines. download map in advance, find elevators to levels if you have luggage.

Nice choice to get into the city center without traffic jam. The Airport Rail Link is a good option (esp in the rush hour) to get into the city. 35 Baht (1 Euro/ 0,8 US$)/each and app 30 min does it take.
Trusty transportation, bye bye taxis!!. A very good and efficient way to get from the airport to the heart of bangkok. Works if you are arriving before late night

Best way to connect to city centers. Just the connection required to get to the city centre and also for easy access to the city centres. Arriving at the Suvarnabhumi airport one can take the elevator to the level 2 to access the rail link. Tickets are available easily , maps of the links are also available. The trains are announced promptly keeping exact time.

Fast, budget and confortable. We used The Airport Rail link on our last trip to Bangkok. This is a budget, fast and efficient way to get to the airport. In the future I won't consider a taxi as an option for airport transfer.

Cheap, Efficient and Quick.. The airport rail link is absolutely amazing. It is the quickest, the most efficient and cheapest way to travel. Especially if you're traveling with limited time in Bangkok from the airport and wanna ignore the lousy traffic, airport link is an amazing choice.

Air Conditioned & Cheaper than a Cab!. Before you fly out to Bangkok, learn which district your hotel is in & if the airport rail link is near your hotel. Please mind that some train stops do no have lifts/elevators, so pack lightly if you're on a budget. Bangkok is relatively safe and thus far nothing negative has happened to me whilst traveling on my own--bring your street smarts!
very useful. available from airport to city center. good value. took this airport rail link then took a tuk-tuk to hotel
best way out of airport into bangkok. Only way to. Get to and from airport if in bangkok cheap and effective way to travel I just cannot imagine what bangkok would be like without this

A really efficient mode of transport to/from Survarnabuhmi Airport. I've always taken taxi from airport to central Bangkok hotels since its really not King's ransom (around 300 Baht), but this time, I thought I'd try out the ARL system. To my surprise, it is really great - its only 45 Baht to Phaya Thai Station, and from there, you can hook up to the BTS system. The journey is a mere 30 mins with 8 stations inbetween. You can at least budget your time on ARL whereas on Taxi's, you know about the famous traffic jams in Bangkok..... If you're travelling solo, take the ARL, but if you travel with 2 or more, the taxi might be your choice. Also depends on where you stay. If your hotel is near a BTS station, then ARL plus BTS would be a great option. Another downside is that you might have to lug your luggage around a bit whereas on a taxi, it really is point to point.

Avoid traffic!. If you're staying in Bangkok near a MRT or BTS station, getting a connection to Makkasan airport rail link is a piece of cake, 3/4 of a taxi price if not more, and traffic independent! Look at a map for MRT BTS stations to plan ahead and be prepared.

Best way to airport. I took the airport express for go to Sukumvit area from the airport. Frequent service with low prices makes it the ideal mode of transportation to reach airport. It cost me just THB35 to reach makkason station.
The only way to travel. A brilliant and efficient service which delivers you from the city right into the international terminal (and return) for less than $AUD2 per person.

Good value when you compare to taxies.. 45 bht per person vs starting 400 for an entire taxi - I recommend it if you don't have a lot of bags and kids, otherwise it night be easier to just take a cab, pecans on the price you get. On the way in we used it, but not on the way out.

Economical & Fast to Bangkok city. This is the best option to reach the city from Suvarnabhumi int'l airport.Go to the airport basement & take the Blue line (city link). This is the slow train stop at all the station up to phayathai station.But it took only 40 mins from airport to Ratchaprarop station & THB 40 to each. we traveled in the morning time so not crowded.everybody seated.Makkassan express is THB 90 but non-stop between Airport & Makkassan (Red line)I suggest not to use Express because slow train (Blue line) is so quick.
No need taxi. After five years of service, I do like to take it every time when I go to the air port, save cost 'cause you don't have to take stupid taxi and there's no traffic.

The fast and cheap way to get to the airport. The road between Bangkok and BKK airport can become very congested. You need most of the recommended 3 hours at the airport before departure and travelling by road can add a couple of hours and be very stressful in this situation. The rail city airport rail link is very modern, fast and although stops at six stations, is still cheap, air conditioned and the best way to make this journey. (The express link is not running at the moment apparently due to a lack of carriages (?) but this line does very well)We got on at the Makkasan terminal, an enormous mostly empty building in town, using a taxi to get there. All was easy albeit you have to walk round a bit to find the actual rail link, but people will guide you if you get a bit perplexed! We would use it again as our first choice of travel to and from the airport in Bangkok.

Good value. Easy to reach from the airport and a fast way into the city. You might want to take a taxi from the station (not exactly at the station but catch one a bit away) afterwards since they are really cheap. Ask for a price before you jump in or ask for taxameter. You can go from one side of town to another for less than 200 bath with a taxameter so have that in mind if the price sounds high. NO TUK-TUK!!!! They'll rip you off or drive you past shops. If someone said the TUK-TUK gets free gas from the government and tries to drive you to multiple locations beware of elaborate sales tactics from strategically placed people. They will try to sell you something in an upcoming shop. Do not buy travels at "tourist information centers". They are just travel agencies that will rip you off.

GOOD. THB 42 to Airport. Airport express link service was discontinued.
City link is crowded from 4.00Pm to 7.30 pm.
Better got to Paya Thai (origin station). You can find a corner to rest your luggage.

Easiest, fastest & cheapest way to town. Wonder why the fastest yellow line express, i.e. Direct from Airport to Makkansan, was not in service. Can only take the blue (or red) line to town and take much more time.

Great way to get to the city.. Great way to get to and from the airport, you will save a lot of money by using this service rather than a taxi. Regular trains including an express line tonget you there supee fast, sometimes you may not get a seat but its no bigdeal as there is lots of space.
Best transportation kode. Best way to go get back and forth from the airport. Cheaper than using the taxi services if you are travailing light

fast, convenient, easy, manageable even with suitcases. fast and convenient. the express train to phaya thai is closed though. we took the slower train to phaya thai instead, and it was a easy transfer to the BTS to chit lom. w
Easiest way to get to the city center in Bangkok.. Very economical and the fastest way to get to the city from the airport. Most of the hotels are on the route so you save money and time both.
Could be much better.. Not sure why but it seems like the management of Airport Rail Link fails to maintain proper care of their fleet.

Easy to use. The Airport Rail Link is so convenient to use from the airport into the centre of Bangkok. Easy to locate within the airport. Fast to buy the tokens from the self service kiosk.
We didn't wait long for a train and the train was clean.
Nice and cheap way to travel into Bangkok.

Good, cheap and best way to skip traffic. Excellent! Easily accessible. However connectivity to other major stops is needed specially when major hotels are located by riverside. To travel to Bang Rak I had to take train that goes to Makkasan as city line was not operation for some reason. Even if city line is working it is not the best route. It only takes to two more station further than Makkasan from where you need hire cab or move to another train line which can be a problem if you have lot of luggage. Overall quite helpful to skip airport traffic.
Saved Me. Due to Airport rail link train it was possible for me to catch my flight on time, rather i would have missed my flight
Easy & Cheaper Access to City.... Convenient & cheaper way to enter into the city. Follow the instructions on the walls or contact the info. desk for clarifications.

Poor infomation about this. As i walked out of the airport i looked around for an airport skytrain, but could not find any directions or signs to get to one. As i wasn't sure an Airport train exists i booked a uber cab. I'm sure this must be nice and convenient, but the airport authorities need to put proper signage to guide people to it.

Just Wonderful!. An East/West rail line located above the city that covers a lot of area. One line is an express line to the airport, and the other has multiple stops along the way. Not nearly as crowded as the BST and much better way to the airport than taxi.
Cheap way to travel between airport and Bangkok. I loved traveling vai Airport link as it was cheap 45 baht and it took almost 40 mins to reach phaya thai. I did manage to get seat so I was happy.

easiest way to travel. The Airport Rail Link provides an easy and cheap way to get to and from the BKK airport. It connects to the Skytrain, which I managed fine despite having a large bag during rush hour.

Very frequent and convenient. We took this end to end from the airport to Phaya Thai station (45 THB).Frequent service, announcements and signs/ maps in Thai as well as English.Journey time approximately 20 mins, automatic ticketing counters are plenty, and there are a couple of manual ticketing counters as well.It is possible to choose either English or Thai at the ticketing machines. The notes that you can pay with are mentioned on the screen, and you get a poker chip like token with which you can navigate through the gates, Very easy.Beware, the machines give back change only in coins of 5 and 10 THB, no currency notes.Compared to being stuck in Bangkok traffic, this is a breeze. Highly recommended.

Efficient. Airport Rail Link most probably is the easiest way to reach center of Bangkok fast and without to much sweating. If you are going from the airport you can take this air-con train and be in the center in 35-45 minutes.
Fast and cheap way to travel to and from airport. Fast and cheap way to travel to and from airport. Prepared coin to purchase the ticket from vending machine.
Really Nice System. I really enjoy using this rail system. It is convenient and most of all it is safe and appears to be very well maintained. The stations and the trains are clean and modern.

Take the train if you have hand luggage. The Airport Rail Link is a great idea done wrong. First off, you have to connect at another station (and buy another ticket) to get to downtown! Sure you can take a taxi from the first downtown station --- but then you might find yourself haggling with a taxi driver ("meter broken").The other problem with having luggage and children in tow are the number of stairs involved in making the transfer at the first downtown station.Far better to grab a taxi (with working meter!) at Bangkok airport or use a private transfer service (as I do). I recommend Dawin of transferbkk. Read my review on transferbkk elsewhere on this site.BTW for travel within Bangkok I recommend Uber or Grabtaxi. Both apps can be downloaded online and you'll know exactly what the fare will be BEFORE you leave your hotel. It does not get better than this!
EASY. Connected to Sky Train from airport easily. Easy to navigate. Lots of English signs and information booths.

Airport Rail. cost 45baht to travel till the end of the station before hoping on to the subunit line.
would certainly recommend to take the rail and transit to bts than to take cab in view of the traffic jam that can be for seen especially during peak hours

Fast and cheap. This is by far the best mode of transport from suvarnbhumi airport to city center.The taxi charges for the same travel amounts to around 500 baht.The express line was not operational on the day we traveled and we took the city line.It cost us around 100 baht for two persons and around 20 minutes to reach makkasan station from where we changed to BTS station for our travel to NANA BTS.
Best way to get to your hotel. Just use the Airport Rail Link for travelling from Airport to Hotel. Way cheaper than Taxis. Directions for the stations are well placed. So you would not be lost.

Excellent transport service avoids traffic snarls. Excellent service and a viable alternative to using taxi during rush hour or holiday traffic. For single persons it will save money although not an essential consideration for most as all transportation options are relatively inexpensive.What I like is the ease of train access from city or airport end, cleanliness, and speed of transit. I often use taxi for the final inner city trip from Train stop to hotel by which time heavy traffic has been avoided and taxi driver has more local knowledge.

Great Mode of Transport. Cheap and very convenient mode of transfer to and from the international airport at suvarnabhumiTrains are on schedule and stops at least on stationsthe non stop train to and from the airport has been ceased
Reasonable way to get there. Great transportation. Easy to use and gets you there fast. I would not hesitate to use this Rail Link on our next trip.

Cheap and air conditioned.. Nice way to get into the city if traveling light. Otherwise consider taking a taxi. The Bangkok stations aren't in the city center around Siam or Silom, but are rather a short taxi ride away. Trains are very clean and air conditioned which is very nice if lugging bags.

Best way to get into the city. After arriving at BKK airport, grab your bag and head down to the underground floor. You will meet the slope path to the ticket booth. I think it is the cheapest and the most convenient way of transportation to get into the city. It costs you only 45 THB, (around 1.05 EUR, 1.2 USD) Only 35 minutes it will bring you to the destination, Phayathai station!(You could buy a ticket from the automatic machine or the counter.)And once you reached Phayathai station you could connect to the BTS sky train easily!Previously, they had the express line which would escort you from BKK airport direct to Phayathai station but they has stopped the service for a while. City line is still very okay tho, just 5-6 stops before you arrive destination does not bother you that much.So next time, if you do not have too many bags and don't want to have an argument with taxi driver. Airport rail link would be the best choice.

Great Service!. Wow! it is simply superb, you arrive at Suvarnabhumi airport, go to basement section and board the train which covers a good half city area, It is quick, cheap in price, great comfort, and time saving. I recommend it to everyone.

Another choice than Taxi. In case of traveling from Suvarnabhumi International airport, Airport rail link is a fair choice. Friendly for travelers with huge luggages, even on peak hours. You can take from the basement floor of the airport to the heart of city with 2 price types, rapid and normal. But you have to take very long walk to transit to MRT or BTS

Good and cheap. Better than taxi. . Highly recommended to use instead of the costly taxi services. We were between 500 to 1200 baht taxi rate to our hotel and train was for both of us 140 baht including connections.

1/2 the time and 1/6th the price of a taxi. Faster (max 40-min, vs around 50- to 100-min by taxi) ) & cheaper (max (40-THB vs 230- to 350-THB by Taxi/toll) to get from the airport to the city. the two last stations connect fairly easily to MRT & BTS (but they are not as accessible if you have more than 2 bags). Always got a seat. Lots of room for luggage. You need to be able to carry/roll all luggage yourself.

Great way to get to the airport. Bangkok is a very busy city. The traffic at rush hours is unbelievable. The rail link therefore is a line of life in such situation. Plus it is nuch cheaper than some of the greedy taxi drivers. For around 50 baht you reach town and then connect to BTS to your hotel. The whole journey will cost you less than 100 baht, a bargain.
Best traffic from airport to downtown. It's the best, fastest and cheapest traffic from the new airport to downtown, and you can transfer to MRT in Makkasan station.

Good service fast but close to early. I really like the airport rail link.it make transfer to city so convinient. Its fast,clean and ok priced. The only limitation which i always run in to troubles with is the schedule.the service stops at midnight.my flight usually arive around that time so i end up missing the last train quite often. I hope they can extend the schedule in the future as the airport looks as busy as always also during the night

Cheap, convenient, and comfortable way to get from airport to BKK. This is a great way to get into BKK easily and quickly straight from the airport. It's cheap (roughly $2 per person, depending on where you get off), clean, air-conditioned, and you get to see BKK on your way into the city.
difficult to get to.. The taxi or BTS to the airport link takes as long as a taxi to the airport from most areas in Bangkok. It only connects to one BTS station and you need to buy a seperate ticket

very helpful ........ saves time and money. When you book a hotel, know your nearest BTS or MRT station. Go to the lower basement of the Airport and take Rail link to Makasan Station and change to your MRT or take taxi to your hotel. Airport Rail Link saves a lot of time, energy and money.
Best way to go to the airport. The best,fastest and cheaper way to go from the city center to the airport and come back. cheap thicket

ok until you have get the taxi waiting at the base of the phaya thai station. with the stoppage of the express trains, the normal city trains are almost always full. so it is not really good for people with huge luggage. there's nothing good or bad about the train, it is a normal train. it costs 45baht from airport to phaya thai station where you can transfer to the skytrain or take the taxi. aircon can get weak when the train is crowded. i tried to take the taxi waiting at the side of the phaya thai station thinking that they have some sort of control over them as there was a proper waiting station and guard. i was wrong, the driver attempted to charge me 300 baht eventhough i told him to use the meter. he dropped me at the next major intersection where i got another taxi and it just cost me 60baht to my hotel.
Quick way to bangkok. Easy and quick way to get from the airport if you have hotel close to BTS line. quick switch at phaya thai over to the BTS and you're set for reaching your hotel in no time.
its cheap!!. cheapest way to get into the city from the airport!! but quite fast wont take more than half an hour also the frequency is also quite good
Good. Good to have this experience. Suggest not to buy travellers card if you are travelling not frequently.

Great option to travel to the City. I was staying at a hotel in Lat Krabang (near the airport) and went to the city by Taxi. It cost me around 330 Baht ($10) including the toll road and more than an hour (without the toll road the time would be double). However, while coming back I took the Airport rail link back to Lat Krabang with a fraction of the taxi fare. It was not crowded and people can easily take their luggage with them and save some time and money.

just save time and money. only very small elevator provided,not every station.If you do not expect anything is ok.No special fare offer such as round trip ticket. You have to buy ticket for each time you take the train.If you are 2 or 3 persons in a group with not many luggage,take taxi is not so different.
Easy if you travel light. With the growing traffic in Bangkok, the ARL is a convenient way to get to the Airport. Not recommended if you come with your holiday luggage.
Clean , Eficient , Cheap. Easy to use . Get a card at the kiosk to miss the lines at the ticket machine . Can be very crowded at morning and evening rush hour . Very well run and safe

Airport Rail Link - Convenient, save hefty cab fares and best transport. The airport rail link in Bangkok helps tourists to save on hefty taxi fares, very convenient, to the city centre hotels. i travel to bangkok twice a month, i would use the airport rail link to the nearest mrt station closest to my hotel, or a station to interchange to BTS or MRT to my nearest train station closest to my hotel.

High up in the sky. Fast and straight way in to the city centre, clean trains, air-conditioned, crowded on rush hours. Annoying that you have to buy a new ticket (queue!) to change to Sky Train. Signs and spoken info in stations and on trains in Thai and English.

GOOD FOR SOLO OR COUPLE WITH NO BIG LUGGAGE. Good if you don't have big luggage as you have to go up and down the stairs from the station, and also a short walk to the MRT subway station. Good is your avoid the traffic congestion specially during rush hours.

How to get to the City centre easily. Ac quick and easy to use mode of transport into the City centre and above all helps avoid the Traffic congestion if using a Taxi or the Bus. Very cheap when you consider the distance to the Airport from the City centre.

Escape the Bangkok jam with this train. The notorious Bangkok traffic jam can be very annoying if you are on a tight schedule and need to get to the airport fast. I take the train to the airport during my business trips to circumvent the jam in the city.

The best choice for Airport!. The cheapest way to travel from Airport! If you don't want to deal with taxi or traffic, this is your best choice for sure. The only thing that I don't like is if you missed the last train, you have to wait about 15 mins for the next train!

quick access from city to airport, cheap.. This service is great if you not have to much luggage with you. It is not starting from the city centre. Hence you will need to use the normal city BTS and connect to the airport rail link. If you wish to avoid taxies and not have much luggage you can use this facility

Excellent means of transportation. All routes are clear sign in English and help is provided clean and fast way to get to the city. If you have a lot of luggage and 5 person you may consider a van to the hotel.

This is a great service but slow. Love the airport link. I took it for the first time this week. Waited a bit for the train but it came, eventually. Took me right to Makkasan then a walk to MRT then that train to Lumphini, about 1 hour from airport to hotel in Sathorn. What a great service, inexpensive way to get to the city center! Better than dealing the rip-off thieving taxi's and BKK's irritating traffic. There is quite a bit of walking to get to the rail express from arrivals and the walk from Makkasan to the MRT is a bit of jaunt but not too bad overall. I only had carry-on luggage so if I had full luggage it may be more arduous but still doable - it's the savings that make the journey worthwhile.
Very efficient . Reasonably priced and very good service! This is one of the reasons Bangkok is easily reachable from the airport.

Get to Bangkok Airport quickly & comfortably via the ARL!. The ARL is an affordable way to get from Bangkok city to the airport. It is air-conditioned. A smooth ride that takes you to the airport quickly, definitely avoiding traffic jams and crowds. There is ample room for luggage on the train. Very comfortable ride!

Most convenient and cheap way to go to Suvarnabhumi Airport. I live close to Makassan Airport Link and it is so convenient, very cheap way to go to Suvarnabhumi Airport in just 40 minutes. Best way to avoid Bangkok traffic and for only few baht compared to catching a taxi which at times you might need to go to express way where you need to pay toll, making your trip to the airport costly. Timing is very convenient, usually every half an hour interval.

Do not hesitate, reach Bangkok with this instead of using a taxi.. One of the best and cleanest means of transport I've ever been in all my life. Fast and safe, easy to reach the center of Bangkok in less than half an hour.

Anything that keeps you out of Bangkok traffic is a good-thing:). If you are not encumbered with too many suitcases this is a good way to travel to/from Suvarnabhumi International Airport, as it interlinks with the BTS & MRT. I live on Sukhumvit Road, Bangkok and it takes me less than one hour to travel to the airport via BTS & Airport Rail Link. The total cost is about $2.50 one way; versus a Taxi that can go between $6-10.

read all visitors. hey during my trip to bangkok my one regret is that it took me 2 days before i used the public transport. the public transport is very good around BK and based on the traffic i would say its the best way to get around Bangkok. It took me 2 hours to get from the airport to Silom and I wish i had got the rail link as i would of got to Silom in 30-40 min.... So this is a must.
Fast seemless. A great and cheap way to get to the airport. Links with the bst and mrt. Easy walking distance and is a fast way without the traffic of Bangkok to slow you down.
cool. so, from suvarnabhum airport, use this al to go to phaya thai then go to bangkok, its very cheap than using taxi,
No need to use taxi. In my opinion you do not need to use airport taxi when your destination is to the downtown. Step in one of them and then plan your route with a conjunction skytrain or metro.

Faster and cheap. If you have small luggage with you then this is the best option to move on Bangkok city. It’s very cheap and you never need to wait for traffic jam. Service is very good. And you will have so many shops around the station, never feel bored.

Convenience (mostly). This is one way to avoid the almost unavoidable taxi rip-off, however with a caveat. You can get TO the airport train via an escalator/lift (good news for those with luggage or disabled), as well as lifts at the station that connects to the skytrain (Paya Thai), however once you get on the skytrain network, or get off the airport link, there will be a time you need to lug your luggage down (or up) quite a length of stairs. I am unsure of the arrangements for disabled tourists in getting down the stairs. While Bangkok is largely a non-disabled friendly city, they are making some inroads with lifts etc. The footpaths are another story though!

OFICIAL THEFT BY RAİLWAY STAFF. airport -ratchapatrop 40 baht p/p but the staff sells tokens ın 19th of september 2015 ; 7 am ın the morning took another 80 for single journey ! had to pay 80 baht p/p but staff took extra 80 baht ! so ıt costs 160 thai baht for 2 for single journey. We went police at airport but they send back to railway link office; no luck to get Money back. so beaware of staff who steals your money ! so my advice get 100 baht give it to staff to take100 baht in coins and use machine to get your token ; machines gives change back. we used machine from same station to go back airport on 27th of september 2015.thats how we realized we had been cheated oficially.

Good price and easy to use . I live in London where I have a lot of experience with the tube there. The ARL is just as easy to use with clear sign posts everywhere but at a fraction of the cost and with the trains being in far better condition.

The fastest way into the city from the airport. The city express is very easy and much cheaper than any taxi or hotel transfer. I paid 45 Bhat to get from the international airport to the city. Good air conditioning, so you won't even get sweaty
Cheap and fast at the right time. Cheap fast and you get to see some of the outskirts of Bangkok. Avoid rush hour.....it's a bit too cramped with big bags and cases.
Cheap and fast transportation . Cheap and easy way to get from the airport into the city. There was nothing to complain about. Service is every 15 minutes.

Fast connectivity to Central Bangkok. Want to escape traffic from airport to central bangkok, hop into Airport rail link a fast, comfortable, affordable means of transportation. Took Airport rail link from Suvarnabhoomi airport to Phaya Thai station, trains run every 15 minutes. Coaches are well maintained and comfortable.
Quick, easy trip from the airport. Very quick easy trip from or to the airport. Clean and well air-conditioned. Can get very crowded though!
nice airport rail link. good rail link to suvarnabhumi airport, clean and nice train but from starting station to suvarnabhumi station need more than 25 minutes

Fast and cheap but.. The airport link comes every 15 minutes and in rush hours you can wait 2 or 3 Times for the train which can be 20 to 40 minutes in the boiling hot stations, especially makasan. There's a lot to work on so it will be convenient like the BTS and MRT.

Got mass transit. Very easy to use, gets you round the main areas of interest. Fast and cheap, can be crowded. Worth buying a travel card so you don't have to always que up for single tickets. Gives you a real sense of freedom to explore

Only way to go at Peak hours in Bangkok. 45 baht from airport ground floor just follow the signs. 30 minutes to CBD. Very clean and efficient. Lots of room for baggage. Once arrive at Thai Paya can access the BTS or Taxi to your hotel.

Use it if you come from BKK airport!. Seldom I've seen such an efficient means of transportation to go from an airport to a major city in a country. This recently built ARL is perfect to get to your destination quickly in Bangkok.

airport to pratunam in 40 minutes at 40 bahts!!. the best way to travel from airport to major places like pratunam, most economical and no traffic woes. truly comfortable and convenient in all respects.
Loved it! . This is by far the best and cleanest train system I have ever taken. Fast and efficient, people at the stations are helpful when you are trying to figure out how to pay

Best way back and forth to Bangkok City.. Best, fastest and economic way to go back and forth from Bangkok International Suvarnabhumi Airport, specially at rush hour when you can be stuck in traffic for almost 2 hours.

Do not hesitate to use it! Cheap, easy, clean!. First time in Thailand and we used this to get to the city and transfer to the BTS. #1 - not a real concern, but don't lose your chip. It is clean, quiet, fast, easy to use (machines and instructions have English translations), and cheap. It is much faster than a cab and WAY WAY WAY cheaper. Definitely the way to go. And no sitting in traffic!!

Easy access from Airport to city. Direct from airport to the city connecting major public transport like BTS and the MTR. Very convenient even with luggage. Spacious and clean. Almost a seat guarantee right at the basement of the arrival hall. However you must know your destination to connect to the rest of the public transport!
Best option. Best option to travel from airport to the city of Bangkok. Good and prompt service. Easiest way to reach the city and back to the airport.
Very convenient. Very easy to find in airport, also very cheap and very convenient. Don't be afraid to use. Find the nearest station to you hotel on the maps and go ahead.
Easy travel between City and Suvarnabhumi Airport. Such an improvement over taxis or hotel pick-ups between the city centre and the main airport. Only 45 Baht each way at time of writing.
Airport Link train - ARL. Airport train from BKK ariport, below standard service and the train is small for airport train. Hard tofind seat or carry your luggage.

Clean, Efficient and Recommended. Available only from the Suvarnabhumi airport. Located at basement B. City as well as Express line , based on time taken and number of stops. If you are not travelling with lots if luggage, then recommended. Take a cab from the stop closest to your hotel.

Excellent, Inexpensive, Fast. Unless you're in a large group, this is the most sensible way to get to the airport. And it's fast. I suggest avoiding the more expensive express option and taking the local (90 vs 35 baht). The local only takes a few minutes longer.
Easy way to get into the centre of Bangkok.. Very easy to use and only 45 baht to get into the city whereas a taxi might cost at least 10 times that amount.

Prefer using the rail link to a cab. using the Airport BTS was quite comfortable, and faster than the car ride i had the last time around. highly recommended, saves time and effort.
Only caution, recommended for light travelers with a single hand carry.

Fast. Fast, direct, easy, cheap, direct connections to Skytrain and subway, and large suitcase-friendly. What more do you need after a long flight? Remember, the Link does not run from midnight to 6:00 am.

Fast, speedy, economical and reliable. Fast, speedy, economical and reliable. This service is surely good for a back packer but my family of four found it equally convenient. Our children enjoyed the fast train ride too!!!

Save money and time. This is a life/money saver when you arrive at BKK airport for the first time. I had no idea how to reach my hotel which was around 30km from the airport and this train helped me reach my hotel in very less amount of money. Later I realised that it saved my time as well, since roads have heavy traffic near Sukhumvit and other places which were part of the route.

good service. very good quick service into the centre of Bangkok.about 5 stops on the city line.easy to find on reaching the airport just follow the signs.cheap under 50 baht per person to phaya Thai (end of line) station.
Easy, quick, and clean. Easy, quick, and cheap (about 35 baht one way) option to access common areas from the airport. It is easy to understand as long as you know what stop you need to get off of.

Very easy and cheap to get downtown. From Suvarnabhumi airport, most of the times i grab the Airport Rail Link to get into town. It is cheaper, and no chance of cheating taxi drivers. At the other hand, if you want quick, and you arrive on a time where the traffic is not too bad, i can be a lot quicker to take a taxi to your hotel.
A great way to go. After making the initial connection from BTS, it was a painless and efficient way for my party to zip to the airport. The price.... more than fair!
Airport-connected. As the name suggests, this train system is connected to the Airport. The station going to the city center is Phaya Thai. This is where all the other train systems connect to.

Clean, fast and scenic!. This is definitely your best bet to get to and from t he airport. We took a taxi the first time and would not recommend that. Do keep in mind that there's no bathroom on this thing.
Easy access. access from airport easy to find, cheap and direct to main city transport links. Ideal if staying in city. No drama with luggage as most other passengers same issue.
Very good with quirks.. Can be hard to get to in town, this a quick and chewp way to get to the airport. No direct connecition to the skytrain, you have to go up and down stairs.

BKK airport transport. This train starts from underground floor of airport. Ticket price ranges from 15 to 45 bhat depending on length of journey. It is super fast way to reach city center from airport.

quick. Got off the Airport to learn that we can now travel to the city from the airport rail link, however it was not easy to understand which is the right station for us to get off, as the attendants could not help us even after showing them our booking.
Used it when we landed. Easy way of getting from the airport to center of Bangkok. Connects with MRT and BTS a few places towards the end of the line.

As easy as!!!. Sorry but late in the day. I used the ARL into Bangkok yesterday and back out again today. I bought the token downstairs in the airport building. I lined up with my bags, I got on ok but at the next stop half of Bangkok got on as well. I got yo Makkasan and followed the crowd to the transit link with the MTR. No worries, Today was easier, less crowds and I prebought my tokan at ASOK. A breeze to use and air conditioned. Note MIND THE GAP!!!!

my visit was mainly a rest and shopping.. I traveled by airport city link to Ratchaprapop railway station last year. Things were very well organised. Every station was announced in English too. I found it very easy to find my way to my hotel in Pratunam.

A choice out of the traffic. I have tried tavelled in the cheaper line in 2,3 years before. This is a good choice if you just need to get to the airport from the poorest traffic hours and area. However this is chappenging for traveler with luggage if you need to connect through BTS, as most station need to climb very tall stairs. Taxi still better if have luggage's.
Value of your Money.. Great service, great value for money. Good connection allover the city. Fabulous and very impressive fair chart.

nice. very nice and better and faster than taxi and also cheaper
i think only 65 THB you can go to Phaya Thai station
Efficient. Easy for backpackers or singles with light luggage. Saves you from BKK chaotic and erratic traffic jams

Cool airport transfer. We used this as we trying to go to our hotel (there were 6 of us, so taxi would be hard to look that can accommodate us with luggage). At night it would be less people, so it would be easy for you to have a seat and have a room for your luggage. It will go to the center of the city as we needed it to be.
Convenient mode. Was very convenient, to avoid the notorious bangkok traffic, and had many entry points in the city..
Efficient . This was a cheap, easy and fast transition to the airport. If you don't mind being stuck in the crowd for a little while it's the way to go

great airport transportation. quick and efficient rail transportation from airport to city center. note: express train is suspended indefinitely as of 2015. local takes around 20 minutes longer. may not be quicker than taxi, but if its raining or rush hour is a good choice to avoid traffic.

Budget and not so convenient option.. Budget choice for people wanting to avoid taking the taxis, but I would suggest taking the taxi still if your hotel is not within 100m around any of the stations.

Easy and Cheap. Good and Cheap way to get to the city from the airport.The time is accurate according to schedule.Just make sure to follow the security details instructions.They will make a 1 security minute checkup prior departure and we are not allowed in the train before they finish.
highly recommend. cheap and accessible for those staying connected to hotel. as we are staying in asia hotel, we find it is very convenient.

Great and inexpensive way to get to the airport. The airport link is usually not to busy, sometimes you have to stand but it's a great way to get to and from the airport and can be good way to avoid traffic jams
Great way of travelling from the airport. Great way of travelling from the airport. Comfortable, clean and very fast. Trains were quiet too. :)
OK. This is good only if you are travelling alone and without bags.You have to take a taxi from the station to your hotel.Its better to take a taxi from the airport and to the airport.
the only way to travel. so easy to find your way around and the staff are very friendly and helpful I highly recommend using this service you wont be disappointed
cheap transport. great way to travel into the city, avoiding taxi queues, I think it is way underused for a great system

Quicker than a taxi to and from the Airport!. Fast and efficient! It will get you to the airport or from the airport quicker than a taxi! It also beats really bad traffic in Bangkok during peak hours!
Convenient way to get to airport. very convenient way to get from the main international airport into the city. FYI: the airport rail link ticket is separate from the BTS train ticket.
Can't fault it. Not much to say other than its easy to get to from arrivals, easy to use, cheap and take you to the centre of Bangkok

I don't like to carry my luggage around so much. The Airport Rail works well during the day but it shuts down in the evening. My flight arrived late and so I chose to take a taxi into Bangkok which was quick, the price was reasonable and I got dropped of in front of the hotel door. On my way back, I took the rail but it was more complicated to get to from my Shangri-La Hotel. Not worth the trouble.

Very good for those who travel alone. very easy and fast to travel from the airport to the center of bangkok but if you have heavy or lots of bag its better to use taxi . also if you more than 2 people its cheaper to take taxi

Another mode of transportation from Suwannabhumi airport to downtown. Another mode of transportation from Suwannabhumi airport to Downtown or vice versa. Help saving time and money if you travel alone. It can connect to both BTS (skytrain) and MRT (subway).

Bankgkok Airport rail link. This is by far the more convenient way to get into town without getting caught in Bangkok's famous traffic jams. The rail network is fast and clean and connects to the other rail lines such that one can get to any location with ease.
Please take it !!. Very useful,save the time and money and feel comfortable.The best thing to take ARL is can avoid the traffic jam but not comfortable for the passengers with heavy baggages.
Quickly to your hotel. Airport rail link is a very easy, cheap and quick way to get from the Suvarnabhumi airport to the center of Bangkok and vv.

A great idea...poorly managed. The Airport Rail Link is an idea which has great potential. Sadly, poor management and decisions surrounding its operations hamper its success.Currently, there are no express trains between the airport and Phya Thai station, the connecting station to the Sky Train. All express trains run only to Makkasan, which is right in the middle of traffic central for Bangkok, and which has much less passenger traffic than Phya Thai. Additionally, links to the Sky Train and the Underground are a VERY long walk from Makkasan station. Very poor planning.Furthermore, trains run only between 6am and midnight. Many international flights arrive between 11pm and 1am and depart before 7am, leaving arriving passengers arriving late or departing early with no alternative except to deal with taxis in Bangkok. This is yet another example of poor planning.Express train service has been curtailed as the train operator has no budget to purchase spare parts for upkeep or maintenance of trains, meaning that carriages designated for express service are being pushed into service as local trains as there are local trains out of service due to lack of spare parts. Still more poor planning.This is an excellent service and one which offers great potential. Sadly, poor management is causing passengers to seek other alternatives.

Efficient and affordable . We traveled from our hotel in the city to the airport using this and were very happy with the cost and service. Its by far the easiest and cheapest (and often fastest) way to get to the airport. The maps in the stations are clear to use. If you can navigate the London underground, you'll be fine here...if not you'll probably be fine too.
The best way to travel into Bangkok !. The Airport Rail link is cheap, very clean , modern and quick. And you are sure to avoid the traffic.

Saves time!. If you go by yourself or 1-2 persons then its not only faster but cheaper then a Taxi. It stops at the Skytrain station in Bangkok so if you are staying near the BTS this is the best way to go!

Airport Rail Link. connecting right through the airport very easy and convenientYou need to know the area you want to goRoute Map - Suvarnabhumi airport - Lat Krabang - Ban Thap Chang - Hua Mak - Ramkhamhaeng - Makkasan - Ratchaprarop - Phaya ThaiYou need to know which is the closest place to your destination get down there and take a metered taxi make sure you don't go on fixed rate but meterbeat the traffic ..if you think your city has more traffic than bangkok even if it does not have more traffic than your city it would definitely match your city standards atleast in trafficAirport Rail LinkGo ahead and try it

Nice and interesting way of commuting. I like the experience of being somewhere new and trying to find my way through the city WITHOUT the luxury of a taxi. So i tried the Airport rail link and it was really easy to find yourself around, even without internet on my phone
Better than I expected. Used this when my flight out of Bangkok got cancelled. It was much easier to use than I expected it would be, and was great for getting into downtown!

Incredibly inexpensive. Fast, co0nvenient, icredibly inexpensive.
A bit of a walk at the other end to plug into the BTS Skytrain but very clear direction signs.
We had a choice between 350 baht in a taxi or 45 baht on the train. We took the train and were glad we did.
Forget the taxis.. Read the title. No more needs to be said. This is by far the quickest way to get to central Bangkok.

Easy. This is one easy way to zip from Suvarnabhumi to parts of central Bangkok. Although it ends at Phayathai, you can easily transit to a BTS sky train from there or the underground MRT.Fare is cheaper than taxi and you can get a view of bangkok.Train may get crowded with no place to sit so this is recommended for those travelling light.
Move into Bangkok. The best way to get to the BTS Station, to travel forward and rech your final destination. cheap and fast. better than every other way from the airport.
Convenient way to Airport. Forget about the taxi service, they will only rip you off. This is the best choice to get to the airport / to get to the city from the airport.
Pros and Cons. Pros.Beat the trafficInexpensivePredictable, trains run oftenCons.Hassle with baggageStanding room only during busy timesClass system recognized, considered crude by some people

Cheap Airport Transport. If you have the time and don't mind transferring to and from other trains The Airport Rail Link is a great option. Much more affordable than a taxi but is not as fast. Can get crowded but generally there is space for luggage.
Easy way to the airport. This is an easy way to get to the international airport with connections to the MRT. Worth it especially if you don't have a ton of luggage to carry with you.

Good and convenience way to Bangkok airport(suwanaphum). The is the cheap and convenience way to go to airport from downtown. From 'Sky Train' - Phayathai Station (BTS) to Bangkok airport (Suwannaphum) its take just only 30 minutes. But please note that you should reserve a bit more time for waiting the train come because its schedule for every 15-20 mins for one train move. I would say ; to slow service. but ofcourse better than take taxi to airport.

Use it!. Go by train when you arrive at the airport. It is cheap, easy to understand and not busy. It is located in the basement of the airport. At every stop there is a connection towards to the centre.

Fastest way into the city.. I take this into the city if my flight comes in during the daytime. I jump on a cab to my hotel from Phaya Thai station. I wish they had more escalators at Phaya Thai as I had a larger suitcase. I think service ends at midnight.

Great alternative to waiting in line for taxis. Quick, well temperatured and cheap. In combination with BTS most Hotels can easily be reached after arrival. Only disadvantage is that you may have to carry your luggage some stairs down, but that's usually better than standing in line for 15-30 minutes at 35°C.

Great MRT services.. Travel by airport link train is by far the easiest and cheapest way to go if you are staying in Bangkok city and near to the train station. it is fastest as there will be no traffic jam and they cost only 45 baht if you start from Phaya Thai and 35 bath from Makassan. Makkasan station provides a taxi service counter free of charge at the ground floor of the building. Trip takes around 30 minutes more or least from Phaya Thai
Quick and effortless. Quick and cheap way to get into the city. Use the express service that doesn't stop at all the stations, only at the one in the city. Quick and effortless
great. it's quicker than the taxi and a little cheaper also u get to see other places on the way in. I have used the train from airport with children and suitcases.......
fast, clean and affordable. fast, clean and affordable. this is the probably the best way from airport to central bangkok. its about 40 minutes ride, air-conditioned.
Cheap was to get to the airport. About the cheapest way to get to the airport. It can get a little crowed during rush hours though. You can get to it very easy from the Metro line

Great. Go by train when you arrive at the airport. Approximately 1 euro, easy to understand and not busy. It is located in the basement of the airport. At every stop there is an connection towards the center. There are always taxi's.

Quick and cheap way to get to the Centre. The 28km journey to the city centre takes 30 minutes. It costs 40 baht for the 8 stop journey. Cheaper and quicker than a taxi. The train was not crowded when we used it early in the evening. Trains are clean. IMHO the best way to get to the centre. It also links up with the Metro and Skytrain as you would expect.

nice train but not convenient. Easy to take the train at the Savanabumi airport on the underground, nice staistion.The train is fast in town but on the wrong side where almost no tourist go, then you must change to BTS system witch is not too difficult same level, connected with a bridge, then can go to center town or sukhumvit, but the BTS is almost always quite crowded, especially at rush h, 7am to 9am, 4pm to 8pm.and from BTS you must carry your luggage downstairs about 3 store’s, main stations have electric stairs, but still not convenient at all, especially for elderly people or girls.I think better take a taxi, same price and faster and convenient.Or you must connect to MRT, underground, then you really in a difficult position with heavy luggageCant understand why they make 3 independent systems! And all other ticket as well, there is no ticket available for all 3 systems to use, not very clever I think.

Trip with the group of 10 folks. Airport link is best way to reach airport. As Bangkok traffic is paining, best way is to use this transport for reaching to Bangkok airport and avoid paid of being roads in taxis or autos.

Easy way to Airport. A fast and convenient way to reach the Airport in Bangkok.Advantages1. Avoids traffic snarls.2. Clean, air-conditioned,secure and cheap.3. About 35 mins one way to Airport or back.4. City terminal station Payathai connected to the BTS network.Disadvantages1. Difficult with heavy luggage as sometimes need to climb or descend on normal stairs.2. Does not operate for 24 hours.3. Late night and early morning service not there.4. Only goes to one city centre in Payathai. Areas like Silom, Sathorn etc need to be communicated separately further with taxis.

Very Good If One Avoids Peak Hour Usage. This Link is very good but avoid during peak hour, especially around 5 pm or if you have too much baggage and are transferring to the BTS. Backpackers with their over-sized packs (not sure what they put in them: perhaps everything but the "kitchen sink") create problems when they insist upon wearing their backpacks. If more than one person probably better to line up and take a taxi although that depends where one is going in Bangkok. There is no best time to arrive in Bangkok, although perhaps after 0100 is a good time!

Quick, cheap and easy. A great way to get to/from Bangkok Suvarnabhumi Airport into the city and connect to either the MRT or BTS network. The train ends up on the lower floor of the airport so you can just take the escalator or lift up to departures.Makkassan station is usually the most popular to stop at as it connects to the MRT and only 1 stop to Asoke station, the heart of the Bangkok tourist area.

With a family go taxi. The rail service is clean efficient and reliable the only issue is at some of the stations you might alight is getting a taxi for the final part of the journey. If you are a family with young children a large SUV type taxi can work out cheaper (ensure meter is on) and less stressful, plus for long distance to Pattaya or Hua Hin the max fare they can charge us around 2k baht which makes these long journeys very cheap.
Fast and reliable. One of the best way to escape traffic during rush hour to go to the airport. Clean , reliable,safe. Overall good experience

Best and the fastest way to get to/from the airport. Excellent service, not expensive at all to travel back and forth from the airport and enough room for luggage. The airlink connects to the BTS line at Phia Thai.

Much better than sitting in a cab in rush hour. Much safer than getting a taxi from the airport. Only takes an hour including taking the Skytrain from Phaya Thai to get from the airport to Sukhumvit, all for about BHT 100

easy way to city centre. on the lowest level of the airport building, easy and cheap way to get to the city centre where it connects to the BTS railway systemcan get a little bit crowded but still better than getting stuck in traffic

Fast and Reliable. Just like airport express train in Hong Kong. Convenient mode of transpo to and from Suvarnabhumi BKK airport.
Interchange station is also available at Airport Rail
Unique Expereince. Great unique experience in Bangkok since it really make more convenience for myself and all travelers in making the journey through out the Bangkok town.

Very good choice to travel to the air port. it's really convenient for the tourists and people who want to go to the airport because it's safe your time and taxi scammer. It's taking you from the airport to the city centre. If I have to go to the airport during the service time, I usually prefer to take the train to the airport rather than taxi.

Worth knowing and using.. This is a very convenient way to get to and from the airport. It is worth spending some time to find a hotel near one of the Airport Link stations for your first / last days in the city. The Makasan station is also near the subway line so you would be well-connected to numerous locations.

BKk Airport. huge international airpot with lovely and cheap magic food court.
Love the noodle soup in there and it only costs 45 baht.
Finally a rail link to the airport!. Reasonably fast and cheap. But can get crowded and not the most convenient for those with a lot of luggage.

Easy travel from Suvarnabhumi Airport to the city. Used this on arrival in Thailand and not knowing one end of Bangkok from another found it pretty easy to get close to our hotel. Clean, safe and sufficient. We travelled on this around 10 pm and felt perfectly at ease.

Only way to travel. From the airport it is 7 stops to Phaya Thai station where you can get of and catch the BTS to your next destination,
Very easy to get around as a lot of the stations have lifts or elevators to make it easy to transport your luggage.

Very Convenient and economical. It is the most convenient way to get into Bangkok. You skip all the traffic etc. However , there are 2 types of trains running on the Airport Rail Link. 1) The Express Line which has just 2 stops , at Makassan and Phaya Thai. And 2) The City Line. The city line stops at every station on the route and tends to be slow. And usually its jam packed with commuters.I personally prefer the Express Line as its faster and has less people commuting on it.*You also have direct access to the MRT (metro train) at Makassan
Rapid transport. Fast, comfortable journey. Trains are quite frequent. Does what its supposed to do. Most stations are connected directly to a BTS or MRT line.

Takes you straight to the heart of the City but..... Like their SkyTrain, is an excellent system that takes you right into Bangkok City. Clean and efficient. Be warned, the major drawback is their lack of ramps (in fact, almost non-existent), so be prepared to lug your luggage down the stairs and along broken and narrow pavements, potholds, etc. Having checked out the taxi prices, in our wisdom decided to take the train to our regrets. And the rush hour traffic/commuters does not help. My advise: if you do not wish to lug around your heavy luggage(s), take the taxi.

Quick and quiet transfer to/from downtown. Arriving at Bkk international airport suvarnaburmi and need to go to the city? Use this quick (20') safe and cheap transportation. Access at level -1 in the airport and cross connection very easy to the Mrt subway or Bts subway.All information boards are written in Thaï and English languages.

Airport rail link. Excellent means of getting to / from the city from the airport. You have the choice of an express service (more expensive) or a stopping all stations service shared with the general public. It is only 7 stations to the city and does not take long. A short 50 metre or so walk to then link up with the BTS Skytrain. The Airport Rail link is a "private" service for which you purchase a token for the trip. The BTS Skytrain is totally separate and require you to either purchase a reloadable travel card - refundable 50 baht deposit plus an initial 150 baht load - or pay for each trip as it occurs. Choose depending on the circumstances of your stay.
Clean and fast. Practical train if you need something fast and cheap to go directly to the city. Clean and fast I recommand it.
Best way to go from airport to city. Best way to go from Airport to city and back. Due to the heavy traffic in BKK this is the only way to come to the hotel fast.

easy and cheap option for the commute. I have only taken the link a few times but it is easy, reliable and a fast option for travelers. The link can become crowded and at times I have heard it has been hard to board the train with the amount of people and the trains to have large intervals for arrival and departure times so leave extra time to allow for this in peak hours. Easy way to beat out the heavy traffic and taxi fare.
Great deal with the price and time. The fastest way to get to Bangkok city from Sovanmaphumi Airport is to use this train, quite cheap and take maybe less than 45min to get to the city.
Pleasant ride. Fast and punctual. Pleasant and smooth ride. Spacious and adequate space for luggage. Much preferred to taxis because of the frequent jams.

One of the best forms of transportation in BKK. This is the best way to get to/from the airport avoiding traffic and unscrupulous taxi drivers. My suggestion is to arrive at Phaya Thani and take it all the way to the airport. The ride is about 30.
Great cheap way to get around. Efficient,fast and cheap. Easy to use. Take lift to bottom floor of airport. Staff are there to make it easier for foreigners. Soooo cheap.

Hightly recomment. Airport link is fast and convient… I recommend for everyone to take airport link . Becasue it is cheaper and faster.
Highly Recommend .

Decent option to get to airport if you have access to the skytrain rail links. Got us to the airport with not too much fuss. We 'unfortunately' travelled on the standard line (as I believe there is an 'express' option) so there were a good number of stops along the way for normal residing locals. This made travelling with 2 big travel bags a little uncomfortable for the first legs of the rail trip, as the train got emptier and emptier along the way.
Fast and not to crowded normally.. I'w been travelling with that train quite a few times now. Both ways.And I must say I'm satisfied. The train is clean, and announcing good.

Comfortable & Efficient . The link takes you from the airport to the center of the city. It comfortable and efficient including ticketing and luggage space in the train. Keep change handy as ticketing is fully automated.

Use the airport rail link instead of a taxi!. We used this train twice. In one hour you go from Bangkok city to the airport. No traffic jams! Clean and air conditioned train. Good value for your money!

Best option for traveling to Sukhumvit. Ysed this link a lot of times. Always take de blue city line. Lower costs than taxi or the red express-line. Still within 25 minutes in Makasan. There you can easily take the MRT (1 stop) to Sukhumvit, where a lot of hotels are situated.
The only way to leave or return to the airport. the fastest way into town by far.This is my favourite way to get into BKK and it's crazy traffic - quite and efficient

No alternative. It's supposed to rival the airport train of other cities in the world, but the lackluster service and state of the train is quite apparent. It arrived on time for our airport to city trip which took close to 30 minutes with 7 stops to the last station Phaya Thai. At Phaya Thai, we took a cab from a "guarded" area with a lady security guard taking record of taxis, passenger, destination. Gives you a sense of safety and security. Our destination was suburb of Bangkok, and so this lady guard talked to a taxi driver to take us to our address. Our taxi went passed our destination at 500 TBH, and continued despite our protest that we got passed our destination, so he fianlly rturned around after another 100 TBH. Total 600 TBH.The next day, we took a cab to the same address from the city not far from the Phaya Thai station, and our Taxi fee was only 170 TBH! Now we know why the lady guard is there, not to protect the passengers, but to make sure only her circle of taxi drivers with 'magic meters' that run at 3x the speed of normal taximeters, and unscrupolous drivers get to catch clueless tourists like us.Beware of Taxis, beware of Tok Toks. But no alternative!

Does what it says on the tin. It's a train. It goes to the airport. You can change to BTS. That's pretty much all there is to say. I wish it worked before 6am though as sleeping in the airport is not fun
easy way to/from airport. not much to say apart from its a great alternative to a taxi I(though these are relatively cheap in Bangkok) and good links to the train/tube network in Bangkok
Fastest way to go to the city center from Airport. Airport rail link is connected to the BTS on phaya thai station. Fast and convenient way to go to the city center directly from the airport.

If you want to avoid Bangkok traffic and you are traveling light ,this is the way to go. I booked my stay in Bkk near the MRT so that I could avoid traffic and use this line. From Asoke it was one station to makasan and a 5 minute walk to the connecting Airport link,with clear signs to show you the way. From Asoke to the airport including the change of lines took me 35 minutes. I only had one bag with me making things a lot easier but I did see some people with more luggage although I would imagine that might make the trip less apealing. It also costs a fraction of what a taxi would charge ,I paid a total of 50 baht.

The fastest and most easy to city center from Airport. i have used this line 6 time since i must come back and pick up my friend to hotelcannot imagine what then if Bangkok dont have this line or my friend's landing in Don Muong Airport
almost crowded at all time... Too crowded at daytime, but just 45bath straight to the city center, very affordable, and standard service hours from early morning to midnight..
Life Saver !!!. Got stuck in the jam while going to airport in the cab...one of the locals helped and suggested us to take the airport link !!! Just got in time to catch our flights
Helpful. Use this and it will easy to reach the Suvarnabhumi Airport. Hopefully there will be airport rail link to Don Mueang too.
Quick and easy transport into the City. If you have one or two bags on arrival then this is perfect way of getting into the City,however if you are a family then best go my limousine
Fast method to get into city. Easy to locate at the airport (Basement).. Fastest way to get into Bangkok city avoiding crazy hour traffic jams and cheap too

Perfect. Don't take taxi, this is so much cheaper.. Cost per person, if I remember correctly, is 45BHT. We were 2 so it cost us 90 BAHT + 150 BHT Tuk-tuk to get to our hotel. A taxi for same destination is 600BHT. What a rip off ! Take the sky rail, it's a much nicer view. Remember that if you're a tourist, most thai people will try to rip you off.
Convenient.. Very Convenient and easy to use to and from The Intl. Airport. Clean and cool. About 30 minutes ride to city center. Budget.

Good mode of transport. Had been using the Airport Rail Link as next option to the taxis. A better option if you do not wish to get caught in the crazy infamous traffic jam. There are two type of services available, the Airport Express Link and the Airport CIty Link. Frequency for the Express link are fewer. Is easy to use and convenient as there are stations that are connected to BTS (Phaya Thai) or MrT (Phetchaburi). Do note that the local people also use the airport rail link heavily especially the city link during peak hour from 1700-2000hrs, so do give yourself some time buffer if you are using it to catch your plane. Whole journey from Makkasan station to Suvarnabhumi Airport took around 30minutes.

excellent, clean and efficuent. great affordable system to connect you into Bangkok's train system. no need for a taxi or limo.trains are modern and stations are well equipped with knowledgeable staff

Quickest way into central Bangkok. A quick easy and cheap way to get into central Bangkok. Conveniently links up with BTS at Phaya Thai. Avoids the inevitable traffic jams encountered when travelling by bus or car.
Best mode of transport. Faster way to reach airport from far away area instead of getting stuck in a traffic to catch a flight
Easy to use. All you need is to have your trip well planned, carry the map, and ask the front desk operator for your token to your desired destination, it is really easy....

Train from airport to city. Took train from Suvanabhumi airport (from the basement level) to Makkasan, then changed to the BTS line upstairs (Petchanburi). Then on to Hualamphong, via Sukhumvit, Silom, etc. Good, except for the security checks at each entry point, although necessary I suppose.
The fastest way to get into town. Easy, fast, save and cheap transport into town, access to the bts skytrain for further connections into town

Cheap reliable and fast service to the airport. I rode the train today from the airport to Phaya Thai. I was able to get a seat on the train but it got crowded after the second stop and had people standing, The fare from the airport to Phaya Thai was 45 Baht. My BTS ride from Playa Thai to Saphan Taksin was 41 Baht. The whole trip from the airport cost only 86 THB $2.40. I know of no other city in the world that has a fast rail link to the airport that operates at suck a low cost. For my BTS ride, I bought a rabbit card for fast entry and exit from the system.

Easy to use, convenient, unearthly cheap!!. Only 45 Baht from Phraya Thai BTS Station (last station in the city centre) to SVB Airport. Unbelievable but true. Phraya Thai is just 2 stops from Siam Paragon, and the numerous other shopping areas of central Bangkok. The travelling time is about 45 mins with about 6 stops in between. This should be the preferred transportation from airport to city and vise-versa. Beats the traffic jam, and costly taxi fare.

Fast, Cheap, Easy. I timed it, and it took almost exactly 23 minutes to get from the airport to the Makkasan Station. That's fast.It comes frequently, but it still gets crowded. Even so, highly recommended.

Soo convenient. If your travel with light luggage, I suggest the Airport Rail Link from or to Suvarnabhumi airport from or to Phaya Thai BTS station. So much more convenient and relieable than a taxi. And cheaper too.

Very convenient. Keeping in view the rates of taxis at the airport, airport link is the best option. Just takes 45 thb from airport till the last stop from where you can get bts on wards to siam square or anywhere. Taxis charge 700thb for this 45 thb trip

Great Concept, Questionable Execution. The rail link is great if you are coming from/going to the airport with only hand luggage and traveling solo. The station layouts are not well thought out, and the trains have little space for larger suitcases. Price is right, but unless you live next to one of the stations, you'll incur added inconvenience of having to get a taxi or tuk tuk to your destination.Personally, I only use this service if I am meeting someone at the airport and returning by taxi, or going by taxi and using rail link coming back after dropping off friends.Also, last week (late August) the express was not running.

Good Experience.. It was a very good experience on the train from airport to downtown Bankok. On time. Comfortable. Easy exchange from one train to the other. Staff were very helpfull and happy to do so. Beat getting a taxi and batteling the afternoon peak hour traffic.

Cheap Airport Rail Link (CITY LINE) to Bangkok. The Chaepest way from the Airport is to take the Airport Rail link (City Line) to Phaya Thai Station. Cost is about 120 bath. Here is a row of seats on each side of the Train, so you have plent of Room for your Suitcase. It takes about 30 minutes to Phaya Thai Station. Here You can change and go on the BTS Train to where you want to go, or go to the bottom and take a Taxi to Your Destination.
good transfer from/to airport. very convenient from /to airport. good service . MRT to Pechaburi station then take Airport link at Makkasan. 20 minutes to airport

Cheap and easy to use. Last time I used the rail link was two months ago, from the airport into town. I found it clean, fast, easy to use, and efficient.The service is regular and just can't imagine from the times that I've used it, anyone could find fault with it, unless they had an enormous amount of luggage.
Easy, cheap and fast. Easy, cheap, safe and fast. Excellent frequency. Better than taxi, highly recommended. Go for it, you'll not regret
Best mode of transport for quick transfer from airport to city, inexpensive. Fantastic quick clean service, inexpensive, easy to get a ticket from the machine,and easy mode of transportation

Cheap transportation to reach City. if you are travelling alone, then better take a Airport Rail link to reach city centre. Its cheap, fast, very economical. Catch a train towards Phyao thai to reach city.

Fast and Economical way to reach Swarnabhumi Airport. The highest ticket price is 50 THB from Phaya Thai to Swarnabhumi Airport. Its fast and efficient.
Note : It does not go to Don Muaeng Airport

lucky didnt miss my flight.. when you are late to catch your plane you only have this train.
no traffic no delay relax you will be on time
Would catch it again. Caught the train from the airport to bangkok, Very fast clean and modern. I found it not that costly and very comfortable.

Economical Travel and Time Saving. For any that have attempted to use a taxi during high traffic in Bangkok can tell you that it is ridiculous. The airport rail link for only about $1.25 USD. Though crowded, when one boards at the airport there are plenty of seats available for the trip into the center of the city. From that stop, you can transfer to other BTS trains to take you near your destiny.

Easy to use, don't be afraid. Easy to navigate if you know where you are going, SO very cheap and easy to get around. You can buy tickets off ticket master or use Thai/English machines. Most use token system.

Just great!!!!. It took some time to complete but ever since this train is by for the most convenient way to get from the airport to the city.It's fast, easy to use and cheap.Detailed information can be found in the following link: http://www.bangkok.com/airport-rail-link/

Cheap mode of transport from airport.. Very smooth ride from airport to baiyoke(pratunam). Affordable cost. The train will be packed during peak hour. City line will start as early as 6am. Recommended for tourist who hate traffic jam.
Fast than cab. One of the fast way to come to Bangkok down town from airport. Anyway is quite full on peal hour and there is not handy for people who have big luggages. Cheap and fast than taxi .

Can be great or terrible depending.... If you board at the airport its great since you will definitely get inside and also may have a seat. To the airport is another story unless they have airport passenger only cars. You can easily wait for 3 or more trains at rust hour and the trains intervals are not fast, more like 10, 15 minutes or more. A nightmare without luggage even worse with luggage. Airport express trains stopped running which were good for passengers. There are typically no fans to even recirculate the hot air at stations and it is very hot. Reportedly lack of and or poor managed maintenance has led to many issues. Some stations do have food courts and restaurants. The Ramkanghaeng Station food court has nice Indian Food and inexpensive.

Convenient, inexpensive and easy to use!. I love taking the Airport Rail Link. It is a great way to get to downtown Bangkok. There are no complications, the whole process is simple, quick and effective. I normally take the link to Makkasan station and then transfer to the MRT line and get off at Asok (Sukhumvit) and I am withing walking distance of where I need to go.If you have not yet used the rail link give it a try...
Fantastic. Brilliant service and for 90b for two people from start to terminating station its a real winner. The added security checks were reassuring.

Best economy way to travel inout of Airport. the best way to travel from the airport to the cities, very safe, comfortable and cheap , be prepare an hour for waiting and travelling if you are leaving the contry and need to check in luggages , especially during peak traffic periods .

Cheap and Best!. We finally got a chance to use the Bangkok Airport Rail Link on a weekday morning. We started our journey from Asoke Sky Train station. It was a very quick smooth ride all the way to the Airport. It was in less than one hour we reached the Check in counters at the Airport! We noticed the Security Guard at each of the Airport Rail Link station saluting the trains as they left the station. It was so nice.I wish the Train was available 24 hours!

Clean, fast, cheap. Simply the best way to get from the airport to central Bangkok! To the airport catch from Phraya Thai, to make sure you get a seat. Catching the train is the only way to go, as traffic jams in Bangkok are terrible!

Most reliable transport. This is the fastest and cheapest mode of transport to connect to Bangkok city. It takes less than 30 minutes to reach Central Bangkok from airport by Airport Rail Link. First train starts at 6 in the morning.

Inexpensive, convenient, clean and fast way to the Suvarnphoomi airport from the downtown Bangkok. Inexpensive, convenient, clean and fast way to the Suvarnphoomi airport from the downtown Bangkok. The fare from Ratchasaprong station was just 40 Baht

fast and reliable. The best and the cheapest way to reach the center of the city and the airport without any traffic jams and worries. Usually it takes time and money (you have to pay tolls and to wait since you r in a taxy) and if you take the line you will be relaxed and will reach your destination in time.

Good if it's rush hour. If you are going where the train goes then it is fine otherwise you are better off with a taxi provided it is not rush hour. How do you know it is rush hour? That is a good question, that google maps can help answering.
easy and smooth experience. Very easy to access the center of the city through the airport rail link. will definitely take it again if the taxi queue at arrival is too long

Clean, cheap, fast. This train is awesome. It is so cheap to get to Phaya Thai, which is the end of the line at the city center. The train is air conditioned, clean, spacious, and fast. It takes about 30 mins to each end. I got a little confused when I first got on because at the airport it is called Airport City Link, and thought there was a different train.
