You need some Thai baht if you're just coming off the plane from the airport and never been to Thailand before. You can put bills in the ticket machines. There is a line at the token (train ticket) machines where (sometimes?) a train police man helps you get your token. When you pay your fare, you get a token that you can swipe at the sensor at the little turn stiles to get to the trains, but you have to keep that token because when you get off the train, you have to put the token in the slot of the exit gate.
Convenient way to reach city.. Avoid the q for taxi and try this hassle free transportation @ Suvarnabhumi airport. Just go down to B floor and buy the ticket of 45 Baht.

Cheap and good to the city. Hate taking a cab when you travel light and needs to go to the city hotel. Hate to be in a traffic jam, Airport rail link is the best option. Airport to my hotel in silom including transfer is only 45mins.
It's Clean, fast and easy.
Ready trip. Best and easiest also cheapest and fastest way to get to Airport depending where you are ,train clean and fast , good service

Avoid the traffic. What a great way to get to and from the airport. Bangkok traffic just gets worse and worse. More roads have led to more cars and more time stopped on motorways. The rail link is fast, efficient and a relaxing way to take in the sites. Highly recommended.
Best way to move to and from the city center. By far the fastest and cheapest way to get to the town from the airport. If you dont mind the commuting folks, or the other tourists, its a nice ride.

Wuhu!. Great link to the airport
.no rushhour.
beautiful view (when small enough)
cheap
nice people
very safe
will come again!
A good option if your hotel is near a station. A fairl efficient way of getting to or from the airport. Gets loaded with local commuters during rush hour.

Best way to go to Suvarnabhumi Airport. We had taken this train while going to Suvarnabhumi Airport. Overall very punctual and best part is takes you directly inside the airport and saves a lot of money which otherwise would have been spent on a cab. Since we boarded the train in evening, it was crowded, nevertheless we could travel conveniently with our luggage in the train.

Amazing and quick travel. A very nice, quick and easy transport means. Safe and pleasurable moments while moving... Cosy as well as offering nice views.. a travel by the rail in Bangkok is a trendy way to get around..

Go for it, if you are a littleway out get a tuk tuk then it is really cheap but great quality service. Fantastic easy to use and cheap. They are very clean and the staff (most of them spoke some English) They announce stations in Thai and English. Loved it. Worth printing out both the MTR and sky train maps before you leave.

Fast and cheap. Goid way of getting to the airport FROM BANGKOK TOWN. However, unless you are travelling light or on a strict budget when going from SUVARNABHUMI TO TOWN use the Taxi rank. From the airport is the rare occasions the drivers WILL use the meters when you say as it is controlled by the airports. The fee into Sukhumvit or Pratunam areas is roughly 200thb including tolls and airport fee.

Wonderful!. Trip to Phya Thai station costs ~45Baht. Quick, clean and convenient! Highly recommended if you're travelling with less than 4 persons. Otherwise, it MIGHT be cheaper to get to town via a taxi (if you're splitting the price by 4)
Quick, easy and cheap. Quick, easy and cheap way to get to the airport. It is very busy though so with luggage maybe a little difficult.

Doesnt really do its job. So arrive in Bangkok after a pretty long flight, tired! and think we shall get the airport rail link to the center! easy :) actually not so easy at all, it doesn't go to the center! so we had to get the airport rail link, then the underground and then a tuk tuk!! Its was fast and pretty nice but doesn't link you to the center...

The best way to get to and from BKK/Suvarnabhumi airport. The Airport Rail Link itself is very good, but know that the Express line is closed (or at least it was when we traveled). Also, all the Thai Air International passengers who had the option of checking in their luggage at Makassan should know that this facility is not available anymore.The Airport link itself is fantastic and for a solo traveler or even a couple, the best way to get to and from BKK/Suvarnabhumi airport.

Cheap and easy. I was a little intimidated at the idea of taking public transport into the city from the airport instead of a taxi, but needn't have been. It was incredibly easy to use, easy to tell where you were, fun views (especially as someone who'd never been to Asia before). No worries in the least.
super fast for a solo traveller or 2. what a wonderful way to get to the city, to and from the airport.one of the best in the world.best part is that its very clean and maintained,so cant complain !

Fast and reliable.. Do not even consider using anything else than Airport Rail Link for trips from/to BKK airport. Fast (30 minutes), reliable, and connect directly to SkyTrain. Also, very afordable. AC works overtime in the train :).

Efficient and Cheap travel to Suvarnabhumi!. I love the Airport rail link for its reliability, timeliness, comfort, cleanliness, super views of the city.......and most of all for the reasonably priced fares. While travelling from Silom...i would take the MRT to Petchaburi and transfer to the Makkasan station ( guided throughout by well placed signs) for the airport link. The half hour journey costs just 35THB and the price of my entire journey is less than half the cost of getting a taxi from the airport to the city center (Silom). Would highly reccommend if you are travelling solo or in a small group without too much luggage.
Convenient way to travel to/from airport. Quick and comfortable way to travel about to/from airport. Pity the express not available for quite some time now.

Cheap, easy and efficient way of getting to the city centre. 45B and 30 minutes later, I arrived at Phaya Thai and was a 2 minute walk to my hostel (via a McDonalds for an ice cream: how cultured). Easy to find in the airport although involves a fair bit of walking. Organised queuing system when boarding. Was able to get a seat most times.
Trains are every 10 minutes

What a pain!. I am living near an Airport Link station and using it quiet often. And this train is always, every time of the day crowded and not fun to use.Its not only the 10000000 people its also their luggage when they go to or come from the airport.Sometimes you need to wait for 3 different trains until you can find your way inside, especiallly in the morning.Departure time is every 15 minutes, you cant compare that to the BTS or MRT.
Fuss free. Have used this service a few times to get from the airport to the hotel, fuss free and easy and very quick.

Jump the traffic jam. Very convenient, especially at peak times when the roads from and to the airport are congested. Very clean and very well air conditioned.Furthermore you have a nice view of the city from the elevated rails.

Very passenger friendly !!. Airport Rail Link that connects the main part of the Bangkok City to the SuvarnaBhoomi Airport. This Airport Rail link is very passenger friendly as it can take you to the airport without having to go through the unpredictable traffic in Bangkok City. Always plan to take this airport rail link as it is very easier.

Efficient and Convenient Transportation. Whenever I land at Suvarnabhumi International Airport , I choose to take the airport link to the Siam area where I usually stay . The airport link ends at Phaya Thai station . I exit the airport link , take a short walk through a skywalk and reach the BTS Station of the same name - Phaya Thai.  The airport link station is located at the basement of the airport . There are signs to direct U.S. and it is easy to locate . I just need to buy the ticket in the form of a token on the spot and then board the train . There is signs to show us how to buy the ticket . There is a staff manning the counter , so I was able to make any queries with her. The train comes frequently . The trains are always full , and it shows that many people take the airport link . Unlike the aircon in the regular BTS where air con is cold and very confortable, the airport link is not cold enough . It is very economical especially you travel alone or with another person . I usually bring only a cabin bag to Bangkok , so the airport link suits me very well. If you are in a group of 4 and with big luggage, it may be better to share a taxi . In my opinion , the airport link is one of the better airport transfer I have taken .

Beat the rush hour traffic. Great way to and from the airport to downtown at a cheap price. Only drawback is the seats are small and there is not much space on the train if you are carrying a lot of baggage. Also, when you arrive at the stop downtown there seems to be no logic in where they placed the elevator and the connection to the MRT Makkasan stop (Bangkok's subway). I had to walk about 400 meters with my bags. Great option if you don't have much luggage though.
Great service - fast and reliable. Fantastic service, try to prepare yourself with roller bags as backpacks may be a little difficult on the walk from the BTS metro to the rail link.

Fast, Easy Travel!. I highly recommend taking the Airport Rail Link if you are staying near any BTS/MRT Station. It is a cheap and easy option that takes you from the airport directly to the City Centre. The ride is very pleasant as there are very few stops in between, and to me is the fastest way to get to town.
Fast airport link. Best way to and from the airport at Bangkok. check the train there are 2 different services. Change to the BTS metro to get around the city

If you have only backpack, use it. This train is now only cityline , taking 45 minutes from payathai to BKK, no more express line because of shortage of maintenace budget.it's not convenient if you have big luggage, access to the station is so tough, limited space for small elevators,not easy to carry your luggage , even with wheels to accede the station. Take taxi from the main street,just about 200฿++,as compared with 90฿ but with many efforts. Enjoy your ride to and from airport.
AIRPORT RAIL LINK. Forget to pay for a Taxi if your hotel is near a BTS or MRT station... the Airport Rail link is easy to get, punctual and fast, besides that it cost 90% less than a taxi service

Use it to save money on airport taxi. If you know your destination in Bangkok then you can use Rail Link save good money on Taxis. Be sure about your destination and the closest station otherwise you will end up catching another taxi.

Good if travelling alone. Arrived in to Bangkok and decided to try the Airport Link.I might of been tired from the flight but did not find it the easiest to work out where I needed to get off etc. to the make connection to Asok area.Would defiantly try it again though.

Inconceivably Thaironic. Express? Express?? Experience the perfect example of Thairony and try the express train to downtown Bangkok. Essentially, it's the local commuter train because almost a year ago the Express train mysteriously stopped operating. Very little information as to why. At least when you arrive you can see the vast terminal for airport "check-in" that appears to be another giant waste of money. And which also doesn't work. Still it's an affordable way to get to to town. But you'll be packed in there most times and it's incredibly awkward for luggage luggers.

AIRPORT GETTING THERE FAST. LOVE LOVE LOVE the Airport Rail link. Fast no hassle but if you have a lot of baggage rather use the airport taxi where the fee is 500 baht and you pay the tolls as well which cost approximately 120 baht.

where this train?. I can't find this train. I don't know where the station was and i get bus to get to the airport! I read the map but i cannot understand. I ask the staff at BTS, they said i can used bus. I wanna try this train but i can't.

The best way to commute between the airport and the city. Fast and cheap, not too crowded, and has good connections on the city side. Better than taxi, and you can always take a taxi at the end station, there' even a taxi stand.
Good to try. One of the best way to go to the central of Bangkok. What I really liked was the price. It's not expensive and no need to worry about overcharged from taxi. High recommended!!!

Picking up my kid. Woke up and was waiting exactly at 6 am from BTS NANA, changed the train from PHYA THAI and took AIRPORT LINK to suvarnaphum airport on time for his arrival at 7.00 am from New York via Mumbai. Very reliable and comfortable. Cost be from nana to airport one way was US$ 2.20. (From phya Thai by airport link to the airport cost is US$ 1.30). I could always depending on their services no matter what!!!

Not available during wee hours. :(. Best and probbaly the chepsest mode of transport to reach the city centre from Suvarnbhumi airport..beware its not available during wee hours. Starts at 6 am ans last train I guess is between 2339 to 0000 hrs.

Good Alternative During Rush Hour. If you catch the Airport Express you'll get seats and it'll be a lot faster than the local. The local is not bad though but if you're tired you may have to stand for a while. Taxis (try GrabTaxi app) are still cheap enough in my opinion to be a better option; except during rush hour.
Efficient, fast and reliable. Best way to get to the airport from any location or getting to the metro station (Makasan) from any location you are at. Not to mention, extremely economical
Bullet train. Hassle free journey, ample space for luggage and passengers, brings you straight to the city center in the least possible time. However the frequency between trains should be reduced.
Fast, cheap.. This is such a great way to get to town. It has a very easy access from the Airport. It s cheap compared to Taxis rate to town. Shame it doesnt work all night long.
Good connectivity. Takes you directly inside the Suvarnabhumi airport. A very good and cheap and speedy alternative to Taxis.

Good for Avoiding Morning Traffic. I'll usually opt to take the airport rail link into the city should my flight arrive early in the morning on weekdays to avoid traffic jams. Its a quick short ride. However, depending on where you want to go and you're planning to connect to the BTS to get to your hotel, be prepared for the likelihood of having to lug your luggage down the BTS stairs. But if you're heading to Terminal 21 or its vicinity, you could actually get down at the airport rail link's Makkasan stop and hop onto the MRT since the MRT stations always has escalators (get down at Sukhumvit station for Terminal 21). But its about a 7 minutes sheltered walk to the MRT station.

Fast and efficient!. This is the easiest and fastest way to travel from the airport into the city by avoiding traffic jams along the way. most likely you will be stuck in jams if you were to take a taxi to the city.

Good transportation. Very convernience. The fastest way to reach the city and better that Taxi.It's cheaper than take a taxi from the airport. You have to change the line and Maksan and 1 more that I forgot the name to Asok station.
Infrequent. Train leaves too infrequently go be trully convenient. It's almost never faster than taking a taxi when you include the waiting time for a train. Do check the train schedules before hand
Way to Airport. Airport link is well enough to travel to save time. But, It is only in travels some parts. When you have proper map of Bangkok, you can get easy pass by. Well. Clean and fast.

Take taxi. Long trip to the city but convent at the airport. I would take a taxi next time because once you change trains to the BTS there are a lot of stairs to go up and down with suit cases and it wasn't easy.

It's a good view through airport to city.. IF you take the airport rail link during the daytime, suggest explore the outside view of BKK. You'll realize how well-build of their express way. But the rich and poor disparity is so obvious.

Good Connection. I took the Airport Rail Link Ratchaprop to Phaya Thai Station and change connecting station to various places I want to go, Terminal 21 Shopping Center, Siam Center , for MBK, change to National Stadium . Alot of walking though , the distance to the station are long. Be prepared to wak but you save alot because taxis and tuk tuk charges very high fee. 55
Excellent transport link. Another fantastic service! Simple, quick and cheap to use. The staff are helpful and the train has air con. It can be busy at times.
Best way to move from and to the airport. Best way to go to and from the airport, it s linked with bts line so we couuld reach our hotel.. also it s cheaper than taxis
easy to access. you can access here by the train easy. many directions and support service like mobile or data card. And you can find anyone to ask for help. it a good airport in asia.

Cost saving way to reach airport on time :). You can take this to reach airport within 30 mins from any place by paying less amount than choosing taxi or any other option which is costly .No risk of getting struck in the traffic and missing the flight

Convinient and cheap alternative into the city. The have stopped the DIRECT express service from Suvarnabhumi Aiport to Phaya Thai station, sighting poor response. So now, it stops at every station from then on. Not too bad for the price that they charge. I'm happy with it.

Good Transport. Very economical, fast, easy, clean transportation into Bangkok from airport. Faster than a taxi, or bus. Has stations which are very near BTS stations, so you can get to many places in BKK,
Fastest way to and from Bangkok. Very fast getting from the airport to center of Bangkok. Price is 30 Baht and a taxi would cost at least 500 Baht.
Nice. Convenient , neat , well organized with clear routes.... Cheaper and faster way to get to the airport...

Great during Heavy Traffic Hours. Very clean, efficient and air conditioned. If you are traveling alone with many heavy suitcases I would recommend taking a taxi. I have used this system when going to the airport to meet someone arriving from overseas. They are also building an airport link to the old airport Don Muang but that may only be finished in 2 years.

Need to improve as international level . As I travel two three times in my short stay there is no signal or light indicate to show which next station is coming as compared to delhi airport metro Bangkok metro is far behind in every manner As local government should see that in this metro international people will travel On Bts station names in English. Announcement is also not much audible. Plz look in the matter just see You INDIAN DELHI AIRPORT METRO
Perfect to go to and from the airport. Our hotel was located in Sukhumvit. The fastest way to get there: take the airport rail link to Makassan station and grab a taxi from there. Cheap and fast!

No maintenance. Scary they are 2 years behind maintenance, yes you read it well behind. In a country where everything breaks because of the tropical climate that is scary. If u have a lot of luggage there are no elevators and sometime it is hard to get taxis at certain stations

Excellent travel option from BKK airport. At 45 Baht or just over one Euro, this new train linking the Airport with downtown is both fast and convenient after arriving at BKK. Make sure you get a seat, i.e. do not enter a train that is already crowded as more people will join at next stops.At the last Station, there is a desk assisting you with flagging down a taxi which can be a bit of a challenge depending on the time of the day.

Airport - City- hotel. Yes, the biggest advantage when one travels in Airport Rail Link to city is, it helps you to escape the torture of the road traffic & the killer speed that the taxi takes you on occasional free highways. The Airport Link ends at Phaya Thai. After that one has to change at least 1- 3 trains to reach to wherever your hotel is located. BKK is a tropical climate. Its hot, hotter and if one is coming form a long haul flight or a very short flight, it will be very difficult. Tickets at each station are auto vended. The customer officer are well familiar to handle all kinds of queries.. One should reserve some additional energy to get in and out of trains depending on where your hotel is located and at what time your flight arrives. If your flight is arriving between 8 pm - 6 am, just take the taxi. it will be a breeze & you can catch some good lighting of the City and a power nap as well...

Impressed by the efficiency and connectivity. A great way to travel in between the international airport and the city centre. Helps you to avoid the bad traffic and still cheaper than getting a taxi. You'll usually have a place to seat and this is definitely a time saver. No brainer to use this option unless you are really lazy and have both time and money to burn.

Easy, cheap and efficient!. Highly recommended! Take the skytrain or subway to the nearest Airport Rail link.Maybe if you are travelling with heavy suitcases and you lack muscle strength to carry them up many stairs, you should just take a cab. But otherwise it is brilliant.
Hot but authentic experience. If you take off or land in Don Muang and stay in Centra, this is the way to get the pulse of the city. Very hot but great experience.

Good alternative. The airport rail link is a good alternative to a taxi or private transfer. However, I recommend that you consider what you are carrying. At times the train can be quite full and depending on your destination you may have to change trains. If you are travelling light then this could be a very continent and cost effective way to get from the Airport to your destination and vice a versa. On the other hand, if you have a few bags I recommend that you arrange a transfer or chance a cab on arrival.

Cheap, convenient and easy to use. Ticket machines are in English and easy to use. Cheap, convenient and quick mode of transport into the city. Travelled to Phaya Thai station at 8pm. Plenty of seats and space for luggage. PhayaThai station had a lift to the ground floor so no humping suitcases up and down stairs. Would recommend.

Cheap but uncomfortably crowded. Airport link is a fast and cheap way to get to the airport but is is extremely crowded - even more than BTS in the rush hour. There are mostly locals which use it to get in and out of Bangkok. Do not expect to get a seat - even a place to stand is hard to get.

Fast, cheap and nice view. Don't want to think how and how much? Use this rail. Have an express for higher price or cheaper with several stops. Anyway - very cheap, very fast and while travel you can see Bangkok from 5 floors's height. Pretty nice
Great way to connect. Probably the best, easiest and cheapest airport connection I've experienced in the world so faaaaaar

convenient way to get into Bangkok city center. If you fly into Suvannaphum airport, and don't want to get a taxi into town, airport link is a very good choice. Airport link starts from the airport B-level (signs are shown clearly) and stops at the terminal station Phya Thai. Along the way there are many stops. BTW this is the city line. At Phya Thai station there is elevator for those with luggage or senior people with leg problems. From Phya Thai station one can walk to BTS skytrain that can take you to many other locations.

Fast and Cheap. We used the ARL the second time visiting Bangkok. Very simple to use and there is allot of people willing to help if you do have questions. Will use it again when visiting as it is also cheaper than a cab ride.

Convenient & Low Cost Airport Rail Link. It is very convenient, there are two lines, express and city line. Normally people use city line, 42 BHT for the longest distance (the more shorten, the more lower), to Phyathai, which you can connect to sky train (BTS) to anywhere in Bangkok. It is very effective way, low cost and convenient. From the Suvannabhum airport, go down to B1 level.

Super easy and no evil taxi drivers. I recommend the airport rail. It is so easy and you don't have to deal with sketchy taxi drivers. Taxi drivers love to rip off tourist and the airport rail will get you to most tourist areas of town at a fixed rate. You might need to get a taxi from your rail exit but you avoid the taxi drivers for most of the journey. Metered taxis are cheaper than non-metered and much cheaper than the tuk tuk drivers. Explore the rail in general. It will make your visit better in BKK.

Best Airport Rail ever. I always take Airport Rail from BKK airport to city. It's super convenient and worth taking. only 40 Baht and won't take you too much time. You don't have to bargain with the taxi driver, just drop on the train!!!

Needs more trains. The Airport Rail Link is a great way to get around in areas leading to Suvarnabhumi. It is fast and air conditioned. One negative though is that it needs more cars since it is popular with both tourists and locals going to work.

the only way to go. aside from being cheap, its fast and hassle free. no more getting in a taxi, sitting in traffic and having to be hassled constantly for more money by the taxi conartists of bkk. easy connection to phaya thai bts and the entire bts system. just beware if you are going to the airport, the phaya thai stop can be extremely busy going back to airport since it passes many communities that rely on this to go to from bts but not all the way to airport.

Quick and efficient. A quick and effective way to get to a lot of areas. If your hotel is close to a stop it is much easier than using a bus and generally quicker than a taxi.The downside is that it does not go close enough to the more historic area and touristy part ie Grand palace.

Fantastic and Cheap Connect from Bangkok Airport to Town area. fuss free and clean and gets you to town in 20 mins flat. Two weird things are : 1) why do the security guard always want to spot check the whole train before allowing passengers to board the train? 2) why are there so many stairs and no elevators avaiable for travellers with luggage?
quick cheap and efficient. ideal travel from airport to centre of Bangkok.cheap. quick and convenient.if more than one of you cheaper to get a taxi maybe though.

Fast & Easy. No more expensive than taking the bus, yet it is alot faster. The train gets you from the airport to Bangkok in the quickest speed, has wifi on board and is simple and easy to use. Would recommend for anyone flying into Bangkok International airport.

Clean fast efficient and inexpensive. If you are not to heavily laden with luggage the airport rail link is an excellent option from airport to central Bangkok. In our case we exited at Makasan, changing to the MRT underground which dropped us close to our hotel near the central rail station.Service is clean fast and efficient and not expensive. My journey was 65 baht per person compared with 500 baht I would expect to pay for a taxi.

Convenient service. from the airport, the train link is easy to locate and there are personnel who will assist you along the way. the train is really convenient and it only took at least 30 minutes for us to transfer to the bts going to Siam.

Great for easy airport access from city center. You will have to navigate the Bangkok transit system which requires you to get coins and purchase tickets through efficient machines (both in Thai and in English) while large crowds of commuters compete with you. The good news is that most everyone is very helpful and willing to assist you. You will need to allow plenty of time for transit at BKK, but the SkyTrain airport rail link makes getting there much easier than by taxi. Getting multiple suitcases on and off can be a challenge so travel light :)

Efficient, cost effective.. Very fast, very efficient, very cost effective way to get to/from the Airport.
On departure, you're able to check your luggage in hours ahead of your actual check in time so you'll be able to go out and about without being encumbered by your luggage.

Better way to travel to Bangkok city than in a taxi. For people wanting to travel from Bangkok's main airport (BKK - Suvarnabhumi) to the city it is easier and quicker to take the Airport rail link rather than travel by taxi as the level of traffic has become so heavy in the past couple of years that you can end up sitting a taxi for up to 2 hours. For travel between the two airports it is about the same travel times by taxi or by train/bus/taxi. If you take the Airport train to the city you then need to change to the skytrain to go to Mo Chit and then take a taxi or bus for the 20+ minutes ride from Mo Chit station to Don Mueang airport (DMK).

There are two types of cars on the Airport Link. Aside from the fact that there is a Sunrise Taco franchise at the Petburi underground station on Ratchada road, nothing distracts from the poor planning of its interface with the Makkasan Airport Link station. Be forewarned: it is a long walk. There is no moving walkway, and there should be one. But that aside, there is one other major negative about the Airport Link. When it opened, there were two trains: one that stopped at every station, and one that went direct, non-stop, to the airport. The non-stop train has been cancelled. So you will now stop at every intervening station.When you get on the train, look at the seats. If they are hard plastic benches, you are in the wrong car. Look at the other cars. In the cars designed for luggage, you will find surprisingly comfortable chairs. That is where you want to ride. If you have minimal luggage, I cannot see why anyone would bother waiting in the queue for a taxi at the airport. If you are going to Bangkok, just go to the lower levels and follow the signs for the Airport Link. You can get a Subway sandwich down there. Enjoy.
Inexpensive and fast. This was a fast inexpensive easy way to get to BKK from the airport. Almost empty when we arrived around 9pm and in the city in 15mins
Short stopover. Great for travel to and from airport. Buy a token for 45 Baht for full distance. Tokens are only valid for 3 days so if you are in town for longer wait to buy the return.

Better to take a taxi than this service. I say this because taxis are so cheap in Bangkok and convenient vis a vis this service. So if two or three persons share a taxi, it just makes more commercial sense to take the convenience, brave the traffic than to climb up levels of stair cases with your luggage, jostle for space with city commuters and be subject to the Airport Links poor frequencies.Having said the above, the service is clean and fast...15 minutes from Suvarnabhumi to Makkasan on the express. There are two services...one that stops at every station and another that does not. Be careful which train you take.

Really convenient!. Bangkok it rather big city and it will cost about 200-300 baht to get to the city from the airport by taxi. Airport city link is the best alternative as it costs 20-50 baht ( depends on how far yoy need to go to )and has stations in practically all areas of the city. Though after Link you will have to take a taxi or BTS (some stations have interchange which is very convenient!)

Do this. Absolutely great way to get to the airport. I recommend staying near the Airport Link on your last night. Don't take a taxi to the airport! You'll stress yourself out with the traffic. Do yourself a favor and take this Rail Link.
Good way to reach downtown from Airport and adjoining areas.. Brilliant service, quick intervals, clear navigational maps and good connectivity.But too much of walking.
Airport Rail link experience was very goood. this was one of the best thing happened in bangkok. a rain link direct below the terminal. stright to the city. we saved alot money for that.
quick. pretty quick its 45B per person one way, takes about 20 min, its good to take pics out of the window for your first impression of thailand

Great service to/from BKK-City. Fast and efficient way to get into the core city. 45baht for adults. Get off at certain stations to Transfer to different lines along the route. Station located at bottom floor of BKK.

Beat the traffic into the city. Excellent way to get into Bangkok without the stress of traffic jams. I stayed at the Sukosol (last stop on the Airport rail link). The only disadvantage to taking the Airport Rail Link is that it is hard to find the elevators and escalators. I didn't find them. Pack lightly...there are stairs.

Nice & quick link to airport without traffic. We took airport rail lnk from masakon to AIrport. The travel was excellent. Ofcourse the train was crowded & we had to stand till airport.. The security staff at airport were very supportive & cordial

Airport Rail link. The airport rail link is a very fast way to travel from the airport to the center and vice versa. If you travel by taxi for example it may take you very very long as you probably end up in trafic jams.

CONVENIENCE. Super convenient way to get from SUVANABOON airport into town in around 40 minutes for a fraction of the cost of a taxi, but the best thing is that you never get caught in traffic which is often horrendous in BKK.
Convenient. Connected with Sky Train so it allows not to be stuck in traffic. Very cheap and well kept. We needed to go to Sathorn and it took less than one hour from the airport, including waiting.

Faster with Airport Rail Link takes more security measures. 8 station from airport to downtown last station is Phayathai station after that you can continue travelling with skytrain call BTS, to get in other side of Bangkok , easy and faster ,
But a lots of people on rush hour in the morning and evening

Only if you travel light. The train is Ok and cheap but to get to the center of town you have to change trains and negotiate stairs yes stairs, not escalators! Who designed this?
best for people with light bags only

Convenience, Timing Control. Stay away from the road traffic, Much much better!
Now every time when I have to travel from Suvarnbhumi airport, I will catch taxi to closest this train station. Highly Recommend!

Aiport Rail Link. This is an excellent and not expensive way to get from the aiport to the center of the city. You take the train at section B in the terminal and it cost you 42THB (about 1.15). It is worth it!
The best option to go to Suvarnabhumi. Really cheap: from 40 to 55 baths depending on the destination in Bangkok. It is fast and punctual: less than 30 minutes

Good transportation infrastructure from the airport.. 45B 30 minute ride to connecting train ride into the city, almost not worth getting a taxi from the airport if you know where you are going, this is like the kind of train you could expect in Japan from Narita.
Save money and save time. This Airport Link is very convenience for me save money, save time and very near my place where i am stay. It a short time to the town.
Save time and easy. Good and fast, easy and not expensive, good for visitor and have good experience to go airport, save time and no traffics jams.

Fastest way to airport. The airport Rail link will be your most efficient way to the airport if you are close to a BTS station as we were. With luggage in hand, we boarded our nearby station of Phrom Phong. We stayed at the nearby Double Tree so the walk was less than 5 minutes. Once on we took the BTS to Phaya Thaya where we transfered to the Airport Rail Link. There is an express line which does not stop and arrives about 15 minutes faster than the other option which stops like 3-4 times. The cost differential was minimal so we took the express. The nicest thing is you end up at the airport and avoid all the traffice and congestion which is Bangkok is pretty much all the time. Best way to get to the airport!

Great, cheap way to reach bangkok center from airport. Great way to reach bangkok center from airport,it's fast, clean and much cheaper than a taxi service it was crowded when i used it, but it's part of the fun to mingle with local people

The BEST & FASTEST WAY TO and FROM the Airport. The AIRPORT LINK is the CHEAPEST & FASTEST WAY to get to the City. By taking the CITY LINE For BAHT 45 you will be at the PHAYA THAI Airport Link Station in 28 Minutes (This was my actual travel time). And from the PHAYA THAI or MAKKASAN STATION take the Metro or BTS to your DESTINATION. They also have the Express line which is Faster BAHT 150 but it was unavailable as of JULY 2015.

Airport Rail Link experience. Why take a taxi from Airport when it is so much cheaper and more conv to take airport rail link to key places in Bangkok. No fear of overcharging and all you need is a bit of planning. Moreover, they have annoucement in English too.

Fast and cheap. I usually come to Bangkok with the family, but this time I arrived alone and planned on meeting them a few days later. So instead of the usual car ride I took the train. Its very easy, lots of English signs directing you to the train, easy to but the ticket and no chance of getting the wrong train ( well almost no chance) even after 14 hours of flying.The train is comfy, air conditioned, there were lots of seats and I had my bag at my feet. I got off at Phayathai station with no trouble and went to buy a ticket on the BTS skytrain. A bity tired at this point I bought a ticket, followed the crowd and went to get on the train that looked suspiciously like the the train to the airport. I quickly jumped off and went back down to the exit, explained the error and got a refund with direction to go down another level and get the BTS line. Went to Siam, caught connecting to National; and a quick walk to the hotel.On a GOOD day at the right time it would be about the same time to taxi in to my hotel. At busy times I think the trains would be quicker and 90 BHT Vs 500( incl highway toll road charges) So the trains are great for singles or couples but with a tired family I would use taxi or town car depending on the amount of luggage and kids.

Best way to travel to Suvarnabhumi Airport. Excellent and cheap way to get to the airport. Took about an hour from where we were staying off Suk 11 from door to door. The train lets you off in the bottom floor of the airport and it's very easy to navigate your way up the elevators/escalators to the arrivals area of the airport. Would highly recommend over taking a taxi, especially with the traffic in Bangkok.

Very Convenient & Cheaper alternative to city taxis in busy traffic to & from Suvarnabhumi International Airpor.. The Airport Rail Link is great if you know where you are going and "provided" your not carrying any more than 2 suitcases (and/or Children?) either to & from the airport can be quite frustrating exiting down/up stairs (Note some lifts are available @ most locations for wheel chair and even some locations have escalators @ various stops). Chances are you may have to get a taxi to your hotel/shops as it maybe a 10-mins or longer walk and avoid avoided during peak times like morning (Before 10.00am as most shops open from 10.00am to 10.00pm) & late afternoon after 5.30pm as city people use it to go home via this rail link.
the rail to Bangkok. The fastest way to get into Bangkok. It is clean, easy to understand and allows you to interact with the locals. Took us almost to the door of the hotel.
Good way to get to airport. Dont pay a fortune foe a taxi; this is a good, clean and safe way to travel. Signage is good and unlike many BKK taxi drivers, the driver knows where he is going !

Effective, Clean and User friendly transportation. This public transportation between the bangkok airport and the city centre is efficient and well designed. It is user friendly, cheap and easy to comprehend. Well linked to BTS (skytrain) and MRT.
Quick and convenient.. Quick and convenient way to get to Bangkok. We had to get to Hualampong which required one switchover which was pretty painless.

Great option for tourists. The Airport rail link is very helpful for first time visitors.It takes roughly 30 minutes to connection to BTS line as there are several stops along the way. It seems many commuters use this for work each day. The train was crowded at lunch time but less so for evening arrival. You can purchase tickets at ticket booth or machines. It seems much better than the traffic we passed on the roads.

Very convenient and cheap. These trains are very moderately priced and convenient, as an added bonus many of the stations coenside with the BTS system making getting to many places a breeze and is a far cheaper option than a taxi.
Easy to use.. Easy to use. The ticket machine took notes. You will have to buy separate tickets if you need to transfer to another line.
Easy. Took the train from the airport. Was fast and easy. Really convenient for getting to and fro. The stops were announced as well as displayed.

Fast and efficient for less than 2 people. If you are single or have few bags this is the way to go. The train stops at Phaya thai station - the end of the line. then 2 stops to SIAM where MBK SIAM PARAGON and most shopping is and if going to Sala Daeng or Silom this is also the station to change at. 120 baht does it all. If more than 2 get a taxi unless it is peak hour 4pm onwards then the train is faster. Do not take alot of luggage as there are too many people and no room
Easy to use. Easy to use, just as quick as a taxi and connects to the buses and BTS. I stay in the north of BBK and can ge there in one hour of only $3.00

Great alternative to Bangkok traffic jams. I definitely recommend this train. You don't even half to leave the airport, just walk downstairs. It's very cheap too compared to taxis and airconditioned and quick. Have used it twice now and will again. Can't wait till there is one to Don Muang as well!

Great Value. Easy to use.. We are cheap travelers so instead of paying a taxi to get to the city center (approx 700B) we took the ARL (approx 90B for two of us).The ARL connects easily with the BTS and MRT along the line, so you can basically get anywhere from it.We took it from airport and back. Saved us about 1400B approx i think. It gets a little crowded during peak hours, but we were able to do it with all of our luggage with little problem.

It can be better than fighting traffic, but.... It's a good alternative to taking a taxi. It takes a long time, with a lot of stops along the way. The exchange station with BTS isn't as smooth as you'd expect either. And the hours of operation make it not an option for early morning departures or late arrivals.
Very Modern and Efficient.. The Airport Rail Link is very similar to the BTS Skytrain and travels between the international airport and the BTS. The Rail Link is clean, efficient, quiet and safe.
Great transportation.. Fast, efficient and inexpensive.. I would definitely use this again! It was clean and very easy to navigate as well.

Great. Got this from the airport into the city, was really good and quick journey. Very cheap!However, Bangkok is much bigger than people think! Do check how far your accommodation is from here... their maps are a little disproportionate and it was much further than we thought to walk! ...Backpackers trying to get there for cheaper and being unorganised about it!

Cheap and efficient. If you need to get to the centre of Bangkok use the airport express which interlinks to the MTR at Phaya Thai uou can then get to most places quite easily. Cost is 90 baht for two people (bargain).

Easy peasy way to get to town. This airport rail is so much more efficient than using the metered cab, saved me the trouble of confronting any local cab driver who likes to take the longest route just to earn more money off tourists like me.The express line was not operational today but the city line was just as good, only took 30mins to get to the last stop, Phiya Thai station which connects via a short walkway to the BTS, another 2 stops away where my hotel is. This is the fastest I have reached town in a long time as compared to taking a cab and the usual heavy traffic jam.

Great way to get downtown. Efficient way to get to Bangkok from Suvarnabhumi airport. ARL is connected with Skytrain and Metro (MRT). Sometimes it can be a lot of people on the train, but it's reliable and efficient. I always use it to get into Bangkok.

Do it. It's was easy. Neither my son nor I spoke the language and this was our first visit. Just follow the signs. A few coins and your on. Clean and fast. We went down town got off found a hotel . Same thing back to the airport. Very modern comfortable and [plenty of room. We traveled light found seats and used it to visit different parts of the city . Jump off explore the next part of town. Will do it again. So much cheaper than cabs.

Easiest way to travel from the airport. The best way to travel from Subarnabhumi International Airport to Bangkok Central. After a early morning flight tiring flight this link offers easy access to central bangkok.

Clean and pleasurable service. The trains look new and clean. Also the stations are clean. It's the best way to get in to the city center. There are the station connecting to BTS sky train and MRT subway.
Easy and cheap. 45 bht (~1,2€) from airport to Paya Thai. Ticket machine is easy to use and it's easy to find there. Great way to travel and saves money.

Not much of an attraction but good transport!. An easy, convenient and cheap way to get into the city. Certainly much better than taking the taxi or a bus. Gets you till Phayathai station from where you can take the BTS and go anywhere in Bangkok.

Fast, cheap and clean. The quickest and cheapest way to central Bangkok from BKK airport. Takes you all the way to Phaya Thai station, where your onward journey will be a lot cheaper than from the airport itself.Hopefully they'll extend it further west someday (there are rumours) for those staying in the Khao San area! Also be good to have a link to DMK airport.

Use the Airport rail if arriving between 5pm and 7pm, or spend 2.5 hours in traffic.. Good cheap service to Bangkok with connections to the MRT and BTS. Cost around less than $2 USD one way. Don't bother with taxi if arriving between 5-7pm, traffic is horrible and you will spend 2.5 hours in the car and around 400 Bhat.spend less than 45 min to get to last stop ( Phaya Thai).I work at the airport and use this train a lot when in BKK. Enjoy!!
The best way to get to town. the rail link is easy to find, fast and good connection to other transport. price is reasonable and clean. I will use it again!!

An attraction?! Good transport though!. A good cheap way to get into city. I hadn't been to Bangkok for three years and went to the lower level under the airport looking for buses into town. They don't do them now. So we got the airport link, it was fast and cheap and got us within a cheap taxi ride of the hotel (which due to traffic took ages)
No fuss travel city to airport. Ideal for a quick hassle free trip to the airport, straight into the terminal no hassle. Its what you need at 6am!!! As with most public transport its not expensive.
Time saver. Wish we had used this the first time we arrived, saves so much time as you are not sitting in traffic

Excellent Service and transfer to airport. Excellent way to stay in town and go out to the airport. Cheap / Safe / Fast / A/C . You can transfer to it a various stations . Just go online first and you will be totally comfortable using it.

Great for singles and couples.. Cheap and fast, a great addition to public transport. :)
Airport Rail Link are comprised of 2 lines, non-stop Express services and City Train services. Both lines operate from 06.00 am. – midnight.
Cheap and fast. Fastest way to go from airport to central Bangkok. it avoids traffic jam in bangkok which is not uncommon

Great mode of transportation!. The airport rail link was very accessible. The train station is connected to the airport which makes it very convenient to travellers. The fare is very affordable as compared to using a taxi to get to the airport. Highly recommended.

GOOD BUT CAN BE BETTER. GOOD as station was very near our hotel S sukhumvit suites. but had to wait long time for the express train to arrive so it worked out as the same time as the not express ones i think

ArtBox market. if u travel by this rail.. dont miss one this spot "Artbox bangkok" stop at makkasan station .. there is market lot of them sale local produk.. you can eat n shooping here too. and dont forget to bring umbrella because now raining season here in bangkok.
visit fb for more info "Artboxbangkok"

Fantastic service. Cheap and frequent.. Title says it all. We used it to get to China Town (Praya Thai stop where it terminates then a taxi for 100 baht). Cost of train was 45 baht each, each way. We have also used this train in the past to get to and from our hotel in Suhkumvit via Makasan.

A great addition to public transport. Here is why I love this train. When I land at BKK I get a hotel near this train link. Then I don't have to pay an overpriced taxi fare. Getting from the airport to my hotel is so easy and no traffic to deal with.

Airport Rail Link great for singles and couples.. The airport link is really efficient and easy to use. The only thing to consider is how many people are travelling. For couples or single travellers, it is well worth the cheaper train fare into the city. However, for a family of 5 like ourselves, it works out the same price to catch a cab straight into the city. We have caught the train however, just to see how it went. Remember if you have luggage, that not all stations are easy to travel with suitcases or heavy baggage, with stairs etc. If you have carry on luggage you should be ok.
brilliant. an easy, cheap way to get into the city. we landed in the afternoon, peak hour traffic, so caught the train, so esay, no traffic jams.connected to the BTS to travel to my hotel.
Airport easy way. Nice and easy way to reach BKK airport. Cheap and the best way between. I can recommed it. From 6 am to midnight
Fast and efficient. A fast and efficient way to travel from the airport to the city. It is cheap and sure beats the stress of traffic jams.

Makes Travelling to Bangkok Much Easier. Easy for travellers to do transfers from airport to the city. It is linked to the BTS and MRT train stations and it makes travelling to Bangkok so much easier. It is a smart alternatives to bus and taxi and keeps you on budget.

super convenient. super convenient for your to reach the city center which you dont have to do much walking in the airport. this rail link brings you straight to Phaya Thai for transit. you can the hop onto BTS or bus or whatever your transport maybe.

Highly recommendable. The airport rail link is indeed recommendable, it is the fastest and the cheapest way of getting into the city centre. Numerous stations allow you to exactly plan your itinerary, depending on where you want to go!

Don't even think about a taxi. Super practical way to and from the new airport. Having taken it when I first arrived, I can't think of taking a taxi to the airport anymore. It's fast and comfortable and will get you to central Bangkok, and after an elevator and a bridge you can extend your journey on the subway. And if the subway doesn't get you close enough to your destinatiion you can still connect with the BTS. I took all three when I arrived and "landed" 5 blocks away from my hotel and only spent 100 Baht (thus saving 400 from the usual 500 Baht taxi ride). This being Bagkok, anything is better than ground transportation.

Best transportation from airport to downtown. Though the Express line is suspended, the City line is still fast enough to get us to downtown and no more worries about traffic jam and tricky taxi drivers!

Perfect to be fast. You need to go to the (new) International airport fast? Use the Airport Rail Link. It's very fast, but do yourselves a favor, with no or with little luggage only. It doesn't matter what time of the day (as long as they operating, stop midnight) you're arriving at the airport about 30 minutes after the train leaves the station. It would be perfect, if the train not stop at Makkasan but stop at Sukhumvit (Asoke) station, as there's also a station of the BTS (Skytrain) and the subway, MRT. But still, using this link means, saving a lot of nerves and money!

Easy to get to/from the airport. If one lives near the main station it is a great value
I have taken it a couple of times but I was travelling light
The point is that, afterwards you have to take a cab and, depending on the time of arrival, it would be better to take a cab from the airport
Good and Fast Service. I took it every time from Phay Thaya station, it costs xactly 45 Baht to the airport from there ,,, fast and comfy chairs

Better experience than BTS. The vending machine accept 100 Baht note and it's more convenient for travellers. Meanwhile the airport rail link vending machine provides with multi-tickets function. The stations in between takes approximately 3.5 minutues for one stop.

Excellent option to go to Pratunam area. We reached the airport early in the morning on the last day of our stay in Bangkok, deposited our bag at the left luggage area, and caught the airport rail link to Rathchaprarop station which is very near to Platinum fashion mall, did 7 hours of shopping and returned just in time to check-in my flight. The frequency of the trains is good, slightly crowded, takes 45 mins from airport to the last stop.

Cheap, fast, and reliable.. We have used this service several times ( with and without suitcases), and it does work well. It gets crowded on the train with all the commuters, but just shuffle around and you will be fine. It is faster and much cheaper than a taxi and it feels a bit more adventurous!

The best way to get to airport faster and economic. Highly recommended to reach all places of attraction, shopping areas and street food in Bangkok. This is the most economic way and faster too as the taxis and tuk tuks are a rip off if you are not good at bargaining!

Airport to town. We took this on the way back from our flight from koh samui ,Very clean sooth ride from Airport to town only issue is it has several stops before you reach to the main BTS station in down town. Total travel time from airport to down town is about 45min still better then taking taxi during rush hour which takes longer and more money.

Fast. convenient and lot cheaper than a taxi. Best and cheapest way to get to and from the airport to get into the city or interchange with the BTS. Only problem it does not run between midnight and 6am, but in peak hour it is the fastest way to get to the airport and the cheapest. Not many taxis like putting on the meter going to the airport in peak times.Use it when ever I can

Much better ( and cheaper) than a taxi.. Having suffered at the hands of the airport taxi drivers on a number of occasions ( meter not working/ going a long way round etc) we decided to use the airport rail link to get initially to Phya Thai station. Clean, cheap and easy to use. Cost us about 45 baht each ( ticket machines easy to use and both English and Thai language available).We didn't have any luggage which made it easier although we saw a number of passengers with large suitcases. Trains run frequently so there is never long to wait. Announcements are made in both English and Thai and are visually displayed as well . Was much busier later in the day on our return to the airport but nothing like the London underground at rush hour! The journey from the airport to Phya Thai took about 20 minutes. Would certainly use the rail link again.

Dont bring so many lugage. Make sure if you use this airport Rail Link don't bring so many luggage, if you are transferred from BTS to the Airport Rail Link you have to walk down under the tunnel and quite far. Beside you cant bring trolley with you meet with many people on the que. So make sure you are not bring so many luggage and boxes. Something if you took from the airport if you do bring luggage just switch over to taxi instead.

Great way to get to and from the airport. Firstly its cost - its cheaper than the flag fall on a Bangkok taxi and mostly times its far quicker to get into Bangkok or out to the airport at peak hour.
But it does have its drawbacks especially if you are carrying luggage. Get a taxi when you get off

Easy travel. When we were doing our research on Bangkok we came across the ARL and after reading enough about it we decided that we can definitely use the ARL as opposed to the taxi service.Yes it is way cheaper than booking a private taxi and that really works especially if you are traveling on a budget. It also gave us a first hand experience of Bangkok, it's infrastructure, systems and people on day one itself.We traveled between the Suvarnabhumi Airport and Makkasan. If you know where you want to get off then all you need to do is check the maps which are marked very clearly and in detail.There is no confusion when getting the tokens from the self service machine or looking for which platform you need to be at to board the train in your direction. Everything is well laid out.Getting on and off the train is also very convenient as people are more relaxed and follow a proper queue system. Most of the passengers were busy with their own thing, conversations, cell phones, etc. It is a great way to look at the city from above and the sights are very attractive. I particularly found this entire stretch (sorry do not know the name) that had beautiful homes with red roofs and interspersed with trees. Just made me want to get off and stay there. So, if you can then definitely do this train journey standing and not sitting.The announcements are clear and so there is no chance that you will miss your station. People were polite and didn't really catch anybody staring.If you have too much luggage or too many children (who are already getting tired and cranky) then maybe you can skip this and do it another time.The coaches were very clean and well maintained. You can look up the detailed information on their website: http://www.srtet.co.th/en/or read more about them at: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Airport_Rail_Link_(Bangkok)

smooth and efficient. Love love this airport rail. the fastest way to Bangkok city without the hassle of bad traffic and grabbing a cab. This airport rail is linked to Phaya Thai BTS which took us directly to our hotels. Perfect!!!

Convenient and economical airport transfer. I used the airport rail link from the Suvarnabhumi airport to Phyathai Station, then transferred to taxi to go to the hotel. I did not only save time due to heavy traffic in Bangkok, I also saved money. Besides, I also used the airport rail link to connect to Pratunam market and Platinum Mall via the Rajprapop station, which is just about 10-min walking distance.

Convenience. used this Reil connection to the airport and my experience was great.you can clearly hear all the stops the train is clean and not crowded, but also fast (aproximately 20 minutes from PHA THAI to Airport) and the value for money is fair..around 42 BHT.As compared to road link traffic is so unpredictable in bangkok. With time sensitive airports , you wouldn't want to get into serious pressure and get stressed to getting there on time. Rail connection should be into your Plan A means.Enjoy..

fast and reliable. the best option by far to go to Suvarnabhumi airport... Do not even ATTEMPT to go by road! The traffic snarls in Bangkok are legendary and the last thing you want to experience when you are rushing to catch your plane.
busy, but quick and effective. long queues, was nervous I would miss my flight, but I made it! was extremely crowded, but the Thai people were nice and patient

A peaceful and jam free travel. I was on the trai just before my flight to Yangoon. I was able to reach well in stipulated time. No tension, hurry bury or anxiety about the long stops & traffic jam. I landed well ahead of the time .A great and peacefull to air port
Very nice, clean and good service. It's a very nice and clean. Moreover it's a great facility and service for travelers. It's very convenient for people to go to the airport as well.

A cheap and efficient way to get into Bangkok from the airport.. Although this airport link has been open for a couple of years this is the first time I've used it. I was impressed as the link has interchanges with both the BTS and the MRT. This means that for little money you can reach most parts of the city. I always stay on Sukhumvit so I just changed to the MRT and got off at Sukhumvit station then walked the short distance to soy 15. If you are new to Bangkok I suggest checking a map for the station closest your hotel then catching a taxi (they rarely use the advertised meters so negotiate a price first). Walking long distances with luggage in the Bangkok heat is best left to young backpackers!I'm not sure, but this new link may have made taxi fares more competitive! I always get a taxi back to the airport, because I'm loaded down with purchases. I have paid up to 700BHT in the past, but this time it was only 500BHT and I felt I could have bartered lower!Getting around Bangkok is now better than ever before thanks to this link. If only Melbourne had the same!

Efficient travel. Great service to get to and from airport with links to other train routes. Never have to wait long and a good price that cuts out the necessity for expensive airport taxis. Staff at airport helpful in letting you know what stop to get off.

Fast and economic. It costs only 45 bahts and takes like 30 min to get directly in to the airport It'd very good to avoid traffic and hassle with the cab driver They give you a kind if token. You need to touch it to open the door and keep during the journey.. At exit gates It must be placed in the hole to open the door. They use sucks token and it seemed a bit odd to me :)Strongly recommend. Don't bother using bus or a cab

Easy to use and fast travel to city. However, the trains can get real crowded. We arrived in BKK airport at about 9am local time and the train was pretty crowded. Not so suitable if you have large luggages as there is no designated luggage area. It is basically like a normal BTS train which travels to the airport. Recommended for cheap solution to the city (i think it was 45 baht per pax) but if you're travelling in groups of 4 you should really consider taking a taxi - if it charges by the meter it should not be expensive.

Fast connection to the city for no money!. Where every you go you should take Airport Rail Link to connect to BTS and MRT in BKK. It is cheap and fast and you can go to most places. You can also take the boats on the Klongs to connect to BTS and MRT.

Cost Effective. An efficient and well maintained and run system - what a shame that at the city end one then has to deal with fraudulent taxi drivers who don't want to use the legally required "meter" system so loudly advertise don top of their taxis!

Easy ride. This was an easy connection from the airport, just located a few floors down. It was simple and easy to maneuver to connect to the BTS and then to our destination from there. It takes about 25 minutes to get into central Bangkok, but it was a smooth, hassle free ride.

Best travel to and from the airport. Best way to get from the airport to Bangkok. It is efficient and very clean. It is also way cheaper than taxi a taxi. It is convenient in that it leaves from the basement floor of the airport and runs pretty regularly.
Best way of travelling to airport. Best way to reach airport is to board this one. Economic deal with all the comfort and time saving option of reaching airport.
Easy transport to downtown.. Excellent service into downtown Bangkok. Affordable and comfortable. Easy to access to and from airport.
easy, cheap and clean. It's a really good alternative to reach Svarnabhumi. Really cheap, only 35 baht from Makkasan. And Makkasan is connected to MRT, so its really convenient

QUICK TRAVEL TO THE CITY. Excellent travel connection from the Airport to the city. Fast and efficient. No hussle bussle with the taximen. Easy ticketing and you can plan where to get down for your onward journey. Very quick and fast means of travel to reach the city from the airport

การเดินทางที่แสนสะดวกสบาย Airport rail link to easy. If you want to go to in the city(Bankkok). I recomment Airport rail link, You arrive in Thailand and walk to ground airport and you find airport rail link station in ground airport. At 07.30-09.00 AM to every day I recomment to you is not take away.

Easy way into Bangkok from the airport. Just a few dollars and thirty minutes gets you from the airport to the city center. From there, you can take other mass transit to your destination. Note that transfer may require lifting your bags, as escalators go up and stairs go down. This beats the taxi hassle, which is a problem not so much because of price scams (even with those, the cost will probably be low) but because of traffic and "scenic route" diversions by drivers. Use the train and get right to where you're going.
Very Helpful. It is very helpful to ride airport rail link. you can go to the city easily without traffic. Easy to use, and it is also connected to the BTS. I enjoyed it.
train service. Fast trip into city, yes, go by train. Only about 8 stops from airport to city stop. Yes i do it again.Peter J

Great alternative to Bangkok taxis!. Fast and efficient, and no need to deal with those dangerous taxis and their belligerent drivers. The ticketing system is easy to use and help is at hand if you get stuck
Take the train from airport to city, much better and cheaper than taxi,. Excellent means of travel from Airport to city ie Paya Thai and Ratchaprarop, best way to avoid traffic.

Consider using a Taxi.. We specifically wanted to use the airport rail link at departure, as we had already used various taxi's, the underground, BTS, river taxi and wanted to complete our trip by using the Airport rail link. Fortunately, we gave ourselves plenty of time and took a taxi from our Hotel on Soi 15 to the Makkasan station. We then took the city line to the airport. We found the that the train was FULL of local commuters and we actually struggled to get on board with all our luggage. The train was on time and the local commuters thinned as we neared the airport. If you are in a rush, perhaps try the express line or simply take a taxi to the airport. We enjoyed the experience and watching the outskirts of Bangkok as we rolled by, but it was initially cramped. If you are travelling in a group and with lots of luggage probably best avoided.

Travel fast.. Travelled on the Airport Rail Link several times. Fast, efficient, clean, on time, easy, relaxing as to driving in mega busy Bangkok. Cheap and easy to purchase yellow button ( which is the ticket). Simply - GO GO GO. Luv it.
Easy access. Located only at Suvarnabhumi Airport basement and easily access to town area. They only have 8 stops.

Very convenient way to go to the centre. At first I and my friend feel a bit wary to take this train to the centre of city because we travel with quite heavy luggages. But it is an wonderful experience. We dont meet any problem with this. Even when we change the Link to MRT, this is also convenient with the very good walk way between to stations. You can save a lot of money comparation with taking a taxi from airport to hotel. Highly recommendation!
Reliable and recommended. Leaves frequently, not busy, easy to reach main city. Ideal and saves money compared to taxi but only runs from bkk to central bangkok.

Very clean and safe transport. The aiport rail link is a high speed one stop trip to a transit hub just outside of the downtown it runs on a 20 miute cycle and quickly and silently speeds you to and from the airport. I do believe it should run 24 hours a day with service not end as it now stops at Midnight. It also starts up at 6:00 am but a lower speed local train operates 24 hrs.

Best and most inexpensive way to get to airport. Airport Rail Link is quite convenient and easy to use. The service is very reliable and not expensive. It saves you from having to sit in traffic and dealing with taxi drivers trying to rip you off. The ride is comfortable and arrives there quickly. There are also some station that connect to local BTS & MRT stations

A good alternative to go to the airport. The trip is comfortable as this clearly avoids all the traffic snarl that is seen in all the roads of Bangkok. What is disliked is that it is too slow compared to what you see in MRT of Singapore

nice ride. nice trip here every the time....... cold a/c and a quick trip to and from the city..... rush hour can be a bit like a sardine can but what can you expect in a city of millions of smiling people!!!!

Fastest link between Suvarnabhumi and city. Quick and easy, avoid the taxi and take the airport link direction citycentre. It's simple and cheaper than taxi (45 baht one way app. 45min and the express is 90 baht)

Handy and inexpensive. I would recommend this instead of a taxi. Cheap and easy to use. Easy access to the BTS. The ticketing agents will tell you what stop you should get off at to change over to the BTS.
time to airport. good tranportation, short time- less than 45 minites, easy to access city from Suwannaphumi International Airport(BKK)
Economical.. Fast and economical. Good choice if you are close to one of the stations but for a group of three or more, cost Is about the same for taxi.
Easy Access to BTS. This was easy to use to get to the BTS lines. I'd say just buy the Rabbit Card right away so you don't have to wait in lines using tokens.

Super crowded. I went to the airport on this and it was standing room only. Squeezed in like sardines, just like Japan, the guard was pushing people in. What happened to the Airport Express? Huge empty air conditioned station at Makasan and not in use because the Airport Express has been discontinued for whatever reason. Bring back the Express Train!!!!!!!

Fast and easy to use!. Great way to get to your hotel from airport, plus it is inexpensive! go to lower level of airport, there is the boarding platform. Buy one token depending on where you are going, insert into turnstile and you are all set. You do have to wait to get on train. When train arrives, the police do a check of the train before you can board. Only takes a few minutes. Very easy to use, if you need help just ask, many people will be able to direct you.

Quick and cheap. can be very very crowded at certain times of the day. Fast and efficient service. Not really user friendly if you have a lot of luggage, but for single or couples with one small bag or backpack its great. About 40 baht each
Skip expensive car rentals. If you have a handy luggage, take the airport rail link instead. It's economic, fast, and safe. Perfect alternative to expensive car rentals and Bangkok traffic jams.

Good service. Suvarrnabhumi Airport located at south east Asia bangkok Thailand, is very beautiful,Architect/ structural design is amazing, coupled with friendly immigration & English speaking staffs that smiles at strangers like as if there is no worries in their lives,it has waiting & departure lounge,it has banks readily to attend to your financial transactions and taxi's waiting to take everyone to their final destinations, in summary i had a pleasant experience at Suvarnabhumi Airport Thailandi love Thailand , Land of smiles and beautiful women.

Really helpful. I see that this is really helpful esp if you backpacking and don't have much in name of luggage. It is not advertised much I guess or only in Thai so you will have to kind of ask around to find it. Cheers.

Better alternative to taxi. This was a very convenient and affordable way to the Suvharnabhumi Airport in Bangkok. I saved a lot from the taxi fare. The entire ride was smooth and I got to the airport hours ahead so I had several hours for some duty free shopping.

Timetable is accurate. Trouble Free from Bangkok Taxi. I live near Sukumvit MRT station. Its only 1 stop for me to this place and 35 baht fee to Suvarnbhumi Airport which approxt 37 mins ride on train with good air con and lots of seats

Excellent way of getting to town. Quick, efficient and it beats the traffic Bangkok is famous for. I cant see myself getting from the airport by any other means unless you have heavy luggage or you travel off peak in the morning when traffic is not heavy.

Fastest way to city . This is the fastest and wisest way out of BKK apt to city.easily connected with most of the downtown Metro lines and if u are not having heavy luggages then this is your best way to city rather than taxi in busy BKK traffic.most of the reputed hotels are near metro stations so it easily accessible though this. A must try when u visit BKK.
Super fast!. This type op transportation is just perfect. Get in the train (as many trains are available) and be on time in the city within a limited amount of time.

Quick, fast, convenient. We took the Airport Rail Link from Suvarnbhumi airport which is at the B1 level. Ticket vending machine is easy to operate since you can choose English language n it accepts notes. Frequency of the train is good n the stations are clearly announced while in the train.Not crowded so easy to commute even with your luggage , n you pay a fraction of what you will end up paying if going by a taxi, the maximum fare being 45 bahts which is to the last station of Phayathai.

Cheap alternative to take from airport. You can take their airport rail link from airport to pratunam if you are staying at the area. Very cheap and fast compared to taxi from airport. Try not to take this transport back airport. We nearly couldnt make it as we met their peak hours and the cabins are always full or block.

On The Move - ARL City Line. A great solution I need getting to and from Suvarnabhumi airport. I do not need to worry about dirty cabs, their AC's usually not cold enough in the humid Bangkok weather, expensive cab fare, horrendous traffic jams. Easily accessed from the basement (B floor) of the airport, with signs pointing the way from the upper floors.
Efficient. Does what you expect it to. About 45 minutes from Phaya Thai (the end stop) to the airport at the other end of the line.Good value.
saves lot of time and money. Each time I visit Bangkok I take this train from the airport. This is very convenient and in about 30 minutes you will be in Bangkok.

Efficient, quick and cheap!. We caught the rail link when we arrived in Bangkok - we only had a 10 minute wait - the train was clean and quickly took us to our link with the MRT - impressed! It was also very reasonably priced.

The express service no longer operates!. We've used the airport express rail link regularly, if not very frequently, since it opened. The service was good and it was sensibly priced. This month - May 2015 - the express link had been cancelled and no date was given for its re-introduction. It is perfectly possible to use the stopping/commuter service, but the trains are often full - which is easy to understand - and the journey takes almost thirty minutes, instead of about 15 on the express. The service to the airport is still convenient but it is to be hoped that the express service comes back in some form, and fairly soon.
Convenient and fast. It is a perfect mode of transport to the airport and staff are always there to assist if needed. Clean, easy to navigate, affordable, and fast
Precision. Intersects with the BTS skyrail and a good way to get from the centre of Bangkok to the International airport. excellent value.

A good way to transfer from Suvarnabhumi Airport to town. From Suvarnabhumi Airport to town center with 45baht person. We stop at Phaya Thai Station which is linked to Phaya Thai BTS for a transfer. Most convenient way to beat peak hour traffic and start the Bangkok trip started.
Quick and cheap. Just as the title says, really easy to buy "coins" which you use as a scan for the electronic portals. It's really fast and cheap compared to taking a taxi.
Fastest way from airport. The fastest way to Bangkok, but not to city centre. Than you have to take a bus, or tuktuk to the centre.

excelent mode for traveling to International Airport. The link is the best way to travel between Bangkok and international airport. Anyone traveling with 1 luggage and 1 handbag should only opt for this service.

Quick & Good. From Phaya Thai to Suvabhurmi in only 25 minutes - you can't complain at only 45 THB. As per nearly all public transport in Bangkok it is exceptionally clean and also exceptionally busy.

Fast and and quite cheap rail link. Very cheap and fast way to get to the Bangkok airport, only 80-100 baht per person, it will take you from central Bangkok to the airport in no time. Very spacious trains, very clean and westernised, you will arrive in the airport ground floor, inside the airport, not outside. Extremely convenient and fast

Best way to get into Bangkok. This is the best way to get into Bangkok and probably the quickest and cheapest.
Super clean ..very efficient ..if only public transit systems in other countries were as good as this .

Forget the Taxi's. Don't get a taxi and don't let a travel agent talk you into buying an overpriced transfer. The Airport Rail Link is the fastest way to get into Bangkok and back to the airport. We used the link in June & July for 45 Baht each way per person. The trip took about 30 minutes. The trains are air conditioned and it was easy to get a seat. From the airport you can go straight to Phaya Thai station and connect with the BTS.

Fastest and cheapest way to and fro Airport. Fastest way to get from Suvarnabhumi Airport to down town.45baht and 30mins to Phaya Thai Station which is linked to Phaya Thai BTS.Most convenient way to beat peak hour traffic.
Quick, efficient and comfortable mode of transport from Suvarnabhumi airport to Bangkok City. Faster and cheaper than a taxi to get into Bangkok city! Air-conditioned ride so its comfortable too!
Quick. Taking the rail link is a cheap and quick way to get to the airport. It can get busy at certain times of the day.

Best way to commute to Bangkok. Given Bangkok's traffic is notoriously bad, the best way to commute into town from the main airport - Suvarnabhumi Airport - is the Airport Rail Link. For 45 baths you can get to Phaya Thai station, where you can then get on the BTS - the skytrain that serves most of central Bangkok. The airport rail link is highly recommended as it only takes 30 mins from the airport to the city.
The easiest route to town. Easy to figure out, cheap and fast way to the city center. It took almost to the front door of the hotel.

Quick and well located. Very fast and well located. It was right next door to our hotel at the airport. The vending machines take 100 baht or less, so be sure to have the right change. I enjoyed the views from the train as we travelled into Bangkok. However I do not consider this to be a tourist attractions, Hence the 3 star rating.
Easy trip to town. This is an easy and fast way to get to the city. The last station, Phraya Thai, is only a few stops away from the hotel and shopping areas.

Airconditioned and super fast!. The Express link gets one into BKK city in less than 20mins! It's super fast, faster than getting into the city using taxi!!!One can even avoid the nasty traffic jams in Bangkok!Highly recommended!!

Fast, Easy, cheap great.
