To get to and from the Suvarnbhumi airport In bagkok, the cheapest , fastest way is to take the Airport Rail Link.It starts from the Airport basement level and is very fast.It connects you to the main Bangkok area (Sukhumvit) and from there you can take BTS or MRT to your destination.
Convenient. convenient and cheap for travellers to suvanabhumi airport. easy to use but you need to purchase ticket, you can't use the rabbit card.
Best way to get to city center.. Fast, cheap, comfortable !It leaves from airport and takes 30 minutes to get to center, with 1/10 price of taxi.

Its the best way to commute between airport and Bangkok city!. The hotel where I was staying recommended using rail link to avoid late evening traffic clog of Bangkok city. They suggested that I take a taxi to Phaya Thai station from where the rail link starts. The fare to airport is 45 Baht and it took around 20-30 minutes to reach airport. The train travels overhead and is quiet organized. certainly, better than taking a taxi to the airport. Do remember that the train doesn't operate after 11 PM.
A bit slow. Speed of the train is a bit slow to me, which I think the travelling time could be further reduced by raising the speed.

A wonderful addition to Bangkok's many attractions!. As a long-term visitor to Thailand, I have spent many hours of my life sitting in horrendous traffic jams on my way to the airport, biting my nails with anxiety about missing my flight. The Airport Rail Link has changed all that. As a frequent traveller I chose my current home in Bangkok based on the link and can now leave the house 30 minutes before I want to be standing at check in. No more stress. No more wasted time in traffic. And the in-coming journey is even better, knowing that I can be home within 30 minutes of picking up my bags! Furthermore the service is incredibly cheap (less than £1!), clean, comfortable and reliable. It makes going to Bangkok so much more pleasant that it used to be!
Quicker and cheaper than a taxi. When you arrive at savanapoumi airport just get a lift to the basement and follow the signs for the rail link to Makassan-only 30 baht !
Best way to go to the city. The easiest, convenient, traffic jam free and economy way to go direct to the city from the airport. If you are not a fan of taking taxi, this is your option.

Simply the easiest and fastest way to the airport.... Traffic in Bangkok is a bit crazy so if you don't want to risk missing your flight the best fastest and cheapest way of getting to Suvarnabhumi Airport. You can see timetables using this link http://www.srtet.co.th/en/

Quick, cool, efficient way to travel from the airport. this method of transport sure beats battling traffic in a taxi, it's very cheap, plenty of room for luggage. Just google the nearest stop to your hotel and enjoy the 5 or 10 minutes walk to your hotel taking in Bangkok's culture, noise, smells and fun

FAST AND EASY. Had a night flight out of Bangkok Suvarnabhumi Airport and a whole day to kill so I put my bags in left liuggage and took the Airport Rail Link into Bangkok City Terminal and on to Sukhumvit Road for some shopping.The Airport to city terminal experience was really nice and the train carriages were really clean and fresh I bought a return ticket which cost 300 baht or about £6.00 UK.it was about a 15 minute trip each way and was well worth the price. a taxi would coat about 400 baht each way and you also have to brave the bangkok traffic.Which can be horrendous at times. I would recommend the train as a fast and cheap way to the city.

Cheaper and Faster way to Bangkok City Center from BKK International Airport.. The Airport Rail Link is a good ay to get from BKK (Suvarnabhumi International Airport) to Bangkok City Center and connect with the BTS (Elevated Train) or take a taxi and save the hazel of taxi stand at BKK. This is best if you have little luggage. Apple has an App, Bangkok Transit TH. It will show where the BTS and MRT(Subway) routes go.
Easy and fast. The Airport Rail Link take you to and from the Airport. The Rail link is underneath Bangkok International Airport and can take you into Bangkok city for around 75 Thai baht. Very safe.

Cheap clean and relatively reliable. It's only 45baht (around 85p/$1.3) for a single trip, takes around 25-30 mins but you get to see lovely views of the city and literally save hundreds of baht compared to taxis.

Simple, easy and cost effective. I was a bit nervous about using the Rail Link and connecting to the train, but it was actually really simple. Signs everywhere and you can ask the staff if you're a bit lost. It works out so much cheaper than a taxi if you're travelling alone.

best way to get the city. we loved the link, no worries about traffic, if you go to a city hotel, its better to take the rail link and reach out to the city and you can take a tuk tuk to the hotel if that is far from the station
Convenient. It is very convenient to go to the airport or around. Faster than car when peak hour and it is very cheap. Direct to the airport.

Take the local train. Local train (the one making multiple stops) is only 45 baht to Phaya Thai (terminal station). This does not add a significant amount of delay to your travel time, and is recommended.
Airport rail link. Cheap and clean. It was very easy to understand where to go from the station to the airport. Runs every 20 minutes

Efficient. Used the airport rail link for the first time to return to the airport. Found it to be clean and efficient way to get to the airport. Much faster than taxi during the day and of course much less expensive. Definitely recommend.

Clean, safe, efficient. The Airport Rail Link is a very good line that stays clean, well air conditioned, and on time. When I am in the city, I pick it up at Phraya Thai station and simply ride it all the way. It is a cheap, safe, and efficient way to arrive at the airport.
Best rail in Asia. Cheap, clean, timely transportation to and from the airport. No problems using it, finding it, or paying for it. Nuff said.

Awesome, convenient and cheap as. So very well organized, clean, cheap and safe. Great service to the airport. It does get busy in peak times but you don'[t have to wait long til the next train, Easy to purchase tokens and understand the rail system and stops. Gee Melbournes rail system could learn so much from Bangkoks.

Cheap and fast way of to & fro from Airport. Saves a lot of time and money, specially if you are travelling for Holiday and do not want to spend a lot on taxi you can easily take Airport Link.
The best part is it starts from inside the Airport itself you need not go out.
Very convenient.
super convenient. convenient and quick to get you to the city centre! it is clean, the train has enough space for luggages and it is very cheap!

Convenient. I hate that I am only giving this four stars, but we did not go all the way to airport so I can't really give a full review. We used it to get out of the city to an airport hotel and got off a few stops early. That being said it was excellent. Quick, not crowded, and offers great views of the city as you go. Down side was there weren't any official taxis where we got off and had to walk a kilometre to get one.
Must-use! . The absolute cheapest and quickest way to get into the city. 40-50 bhat into the city. It gets busier as you get further from the airport so best to not have too much luggage.

Much cheaper and economical means of transport to the Airport. The hotel we were staying at asked for 1200 THB, the taxi we came in from Airport to the hotel took 350 (exclusive of toll), but it took me 87 THB to get to the Airport via the BTS (42) and Airport Rail Link (45). Go to Phaya Thai (N2) station of the BTS and then go downstairs and on your East will be the Airport Rail Link. Phaya Thai is the first station of Airport Rail Link but still it will get you there on time, no extra charges, and drops you right inside the Airport.

Great service.. Great system and so cheap but beware the express one does not connect easily to the rest of the Sky Train system. I would recommend getting the slower one for 45 baht that takes you to Phaya Thai and a very short walk to the BTS system.
Airport Rail Link. Fast comfortable and efficient. There are two types of train here. Rapid and normal all at low prices. Cheaper and faster than taxis. Avoid peak times 7-10am and 4-7pm.

"Fastest way to go to international airport". A lot easier and cheaper to go to international (Suvarnabhumi) airport from the city. It might get crowded along the way as people take this to/from work but it's more convenient rather than taking bus or taxi, the traffic here takes forever!

Can be good if your destination is close. Very useful, except if you have loads of luggage, in which case, you end up in a part of Bangkok where you will need to then take a taxi and through the hours of traffic jam before reaching your destination (unless it's close to one of the Airport rail link stations)...
Fastest and cheapest way from airport to center of city. Wow. This was simply the best method of going to airport to center of city in under 30 minutes and only for 45 baht! Take this over any taxi!

Fastest way to get to the city. It's the best way to avoid the traffic. Keep in mind, to go almost anywhere, you have to switch lines at least once. And you can't buy tickets just once to reach your destination which is a bit of an inconvenience when you have luggages.
excellent and cheap. great option for getting into the city from the airport ,and links with the Skytrain and BTS systems for central hotels - not to be used for direct travel to Khao San Road area

Often more convenient and quicker than a taxi. I switched to taking the airport rail link from taking a taxi. It is often gets you to your destination more quickly than a taxi, with good connections to Bangkok's other elevated and subway rail systems.

a choice for new travellers. The Airport Rail Link is convenient, however, it tooks a long time for you from the airport to the city center, about 30-40 minutes. The best advantage of this traffic tool is it's pricing. For new travellers who wanna a self-service travel and want to save money, it must be the best choice.

Great way to take you the city. it was my first time to take this train from the airport, very easy, convenient and most economical way.
Easy to follow directions and really cheaper than taxis.
Announcements made in Thai and English. Passengers well behaved and friendly
Highly recommended
Take the train!. Great way to get into the city, particularly in peak hour when you can sit in traffic for hours without moving.

Best option into Bangkok from the airport. Please AVOID the taxis when coming from the Airport into Bangkok. You will be scammed and you will be stuck in traffic. This is the best option for less than £2. Air conditioning and timely, a pleasure.

smooth and affordable. access is pretty nice it is affordable and just worth the benefit not having to deal with a cab trying to hustle you. It does not have late night service which is a super bummer. It can get crowded easy. Nice new Siemens trains. About 45 min from the bigger international airport to central bangkok

Reliable, predictable, saves money. Get through the passport/carousels/customs hassles then get some local money at the exchange....rip off rates so don't change much...say Aus $50 max will be enough to get tickets from the booth near platforms. Follow the signs to basement...there are 2 choices....express or normal....express wasn't running so we got the other one. No problems...cost 40 bahts per person..about Oz $2.50...bargain. Cases next to you as you head to your stop...all stations called or you can follow the signs on network map above doors...too easy.

Best way to reaching the airport. Love the Airport Rail Link, the best way to reach the airport when you are travelling light, it is fast, has great frequency of trains throughout the day and the quickest way to reach given that the airport is around 25 kms outside the city, the only con is, it not a great way when there is lots of luggage.

Easy way to get to the city from the airport. The Airport Rail Link is a wonderful way to transit from the new airport to the city. There's a stop train and an express train. I've been to BKK several times and never found the express train running. Not sure what the schedule is. But the stop train doesn't take too long. Train connects to other systems like BTS conveniently.

Gala Ride with airport link. Very convenient -clean and fast transport to reach city from Airport.
Even a first time visitor can understand the route with the Map and it cost only THB 45 from Airport to city with 20 minutes great ride.With Bangkok traffic this a boon to tourist

Best way to get to the airport. Easily the best way from pretty much anywhere in Bangkok now to get to the airport. The traffic, even though it is getting better, is still shocking. Transferring from one train to another is easy. The train was always full showing it is popular and so the express trains should be more often.
Easy. An easy way to travel when you know where your going much quicker than a taxi a probably a lot cheaper
Efficient and cheap. Great way to get arpound Bangkok to most major areas. I use this often to go to places within Bangkok and then walk where necessary. Efficient and cheap.

ARL Bangkok. This is a brilliant service, not busy at all as locals feel it's too expensive for them but most European tourists find it reasonable and it links with the sky train so you can get pretty much anywhere in the city

Good, quick and much cheaper than taxi. Learned a bit from the map and you can get to airport quickly, easily and save a lot of taxi fare. You can get to suvarnabhumi airport and there's shuttle bus if you need to travel to DonMuong for your flight.

Cheap and Easy. We caught the Skytrain from the airport to the Baiyoke Skytower Hotel. It only cost 45baht and was much quicker than by road. Would definitely recommend it if your hotel is near a station.
easy to use. All you have to do is work find someone who speaks at least a little English to help you and you will be fine to find your destination
Awesome. Faboulus experience of my life in Bangkok with the family they also love the ride & enjoyed a lot & entire look is also stunning ......!

Airport Breaze. I've use the link many times now, they have stopped the express for reasons unknown, but the regular train is still pretty fast. The train will get very congested once it leaves the airport, the seats are not very comfortable, but it olny costs 45 baht. I go to the end of the line , Phaya Thai, where you can switch to the BTS, which takes me to my stop Ari just a few stations away. Wish they had more eculators going down not just up, when traveling with suitcases it can be a bit difficult.

A very easy way to get quickly to and from the airport. You can either take a traditional metro train (skytrain) with 10 or stops or take the express from downtown to the airport without stops. Either way is inexpensive and most of all quick. On our way back home we stayed at an airport hotel (12 hour layover) and used the skytrain to get into town and back cheaply and with ease.
Great way to go the city center of Bangkok. If you arrive between 6am to midnight then definitely take the Airport Rail Link!It costs 45 baht and takes you to the center in 30 minutes.

Cheap and very convenient to the airport. I usually take a taxi from airport to my hotel. But, while I was in Bangkok, I had to go to the airport from my hotel and asked the hotel staff if train is available to the airport. They told me there and said it is very convenient. Per their advice, I tried the train to the airport and it is true that it is very convenient. I took the sky train from Sukumvit road and then interchanged to the airport train some where near National Stadium. The price is very cheap compared to taxi. Therefore, if you don't have many luggages, I suggest the train from and to airport.
Forget the taxi, take the train. The airport express service is not operation at the moment so no non-stop service is available. Only the multi-stop City Line train to the airport

Very fast and cheap connection compared to taxis. Only 50 Baht and air conditioned. The rails are three stories high on an elevated track. It takes a while to get your baggage up the few steps to the escalators. Not fun with heavy bagges.

Quick and cheap. Clean, neat and modern train. Airport - Makassan (near Sukhumvit area) in only 15 minutes.An officer will guide you to select reliable taxy without any additional charges, and give you a guidance card to report any issues during the visit in Bangkok.

Easy and cheap. Very easy way to get into Bangkok, bit of a walk from the arrivals lounge but good to get the blood flowing in the legs again after a long flight, cost is cheap and trains are clean and tidy
Very useful. Very useful and cheap to go and come back from the airport. It could be very crowded between 5 and 6pm but there is a train every 10 or 15min
Much convenience. Of course this means of transportation provides much convenience for us as visitors to Bangkok's city, mainly to facilitate access to the airport quickly and cheaply.
Take this, don't bother with a taxi!. Taxi wanted $400 baht to get into city, this was $70 baht to the exact same location in same time. Clean and convenient, best way into the city.

Super!. Formerly we took buses and taxis from/to airport. Now convenient by train. And taxis run by LPG, so a big LPG tank is located in the back of the car. No space for your luggage, so better avoid taxis from/to airport if you are not a backpacker.

Cheap and efficient. The fast train has stopped running due to loss making but the commuter train is still running at B45 per trip and take you to the city within 35 mins. If you have small luggage and can manage a couple of staircases, this is an excellent choice.
Taxi fare for the same journey can easily cost you B500.
Airport rail link. best way to move from the airport to bangkok, and it costs even less than taxi or bus, considering also that your avoid the huge traffic of bangkok..

Easy, Cheap & Fast. If you do not have too much baggage is a good choice to use the Airport Rail Link
Good connection with BTS or MRT to your destination.
Brilliant. Clean fast way to travel takes you right into the city would recommend to take the sky train rather then taxis you pay for your trip up front and enough room for luggage

Not Running. When I was in Bangkok in June, 2015, the dedicated Airport train was not running. The local train was still running. It akes about 15 minutes longer, but is also less money, and thus a bit more crowded but goes the same route as the Express did.

cheapest and easiest way to reach the airport. it is the cheapest and the easiest way to reach the airport but you have to plan to reach the airport well in advance of your time as the frequency is only one in 20 mins and there are only 3 wagons so the capacity is far less than expected. If you have more than one piece of luggage not every easy to go around.
I like it . Fist time really scare but again I like it , colder inside very comfortable , better than taxi tuc tuc , don't worry try and u will like it

Quick stop over trip to Bangkok. I had a 9 hour lay over, so used the train to visit bangkok for shopping, this is the quickest, cheapest and quickest way to get to and from Bangkok city centre , it's clean and seating is easy from the airport, the return journey I stood nearly all the way back, like all public transport in Bangkok it's busy, it's got great links to all skytrain and metro links, I would recommend this for visits to Bangkok for stop overs, light travellers or back packers, the taxi into the city was 500 Baht, the train was 45 baht.

Quick stop over trip to Bangkok. I had a 9 hour lay over, so used the train to visit bangkok for shopping, this is the quickest, cheapest and quickest way to get to and from Bangkok city centre , it's clean and seating is easy from the airport, the return journey I stood nearly all the way back, like all public transport in Bangkok it's busy, it's got great links to all skytrain and metro links, I would recommend this for visits to Bangkok for stop overs, light travellers or back packers, the taxi into the city was 500 Baht, the train was 45 baht.

do not accept bicycle. it can be convinient but if you are two or 3 it is cheapper to take a taxi.They do not accept bicycle inside the train so impossible to use it to go in the exellent bicycle track in suvanabhumi :-((

Excellent. was good and cheaper then get a taxi along there way to the airport i could say it even better because is kind of fast and time schedule time by time i always be on time at the airport no worry about traffic jam
Get a Taxi!. Get a taxi, unless your staying on the quiet and souless areas that are located next to the Airport Link. If you want to stay near the Airport Link you are not staying in a good area.

Airport Express Rail. - tried many times only if you are travelling without a huge luggage otherwise, advisable to take cab directly from airport - to take the train service if you arrive around office hours rush back time as being stuck in major/long traffic jam is no joke at all

Quickest way to get to the city. The reason I took this Rail Link from the airport to reach the hotel was because I had a meeting lined up within an hour of landing in Bangkok. It served it's purpose very well, I must say. Though I had to change a line but this is the quickest way to get to the city..

Crowded! Get to the Station Early. We used this service several times going back and forth to the airport as we used Bangkok as a stop-over. It is challenging in peak-time as the train is also a commuter service. When we arrived in Bangkok, 6am on a Monday the train was reasonably quiet, until the 2nd or 3rd stop by which time our bags and ourselves were wedged in! Would recommend you get seats by the door if you can! Returning to the airport on the Wednesday afternoon was even more challenging. Make sure you leave yourself PLENTY of time! When we arrived at the station there were already queues (few travellers) and when the train eventually arrived it was already packed and we couldn't get on. Eventually a second train arrived and we managed to squeeze on (standing room only) - that was around 3.30pm. The commuters are accommodating for travellers with bags - once you get on! However, the airport link train is much better than getting a taxi - the traffic is even less predictable!
Take care with the time. The trains work each 30min. Different from another lines.It can be a problem if you not planning your time to arrive at the airport with safe time.
frequent. very frequent, although busy during morning rush hour. very cheap and faster than taxi's on the ground.

No Fuss - Simple and Direct. We decided to forgo an expensive (relatively speaking) taxi or airport transfer and to take the train. From landing and collecting our bags, it was simple to stroll down to the trains and catch one (35 baht per person) - we transferred at Petchaburi to catch the Metro (as our hotel was close to a metro station). Nice and easy. All signs are in English and in Thai - no problems at all and this was our first time in Bangkok. And so much better than sitting in Bangkok traffic.
the best choice. the best way to go from the airport to town and viceversa. Clean, comfortable, quick and not expensive at all.

Fast, clean, efficient, cheap transport into the city.. Only 150 Baht and 20 mins from the airport to the city. A great option during peak hour travel times to avoid traffic congestion. Warning, travel light or be prepared to lug your suitcase up/down stairs to change to the city BTS line or taxi to your hotel. Ideal if you're staying in the Phaya Thai area.
Perfect way to go city centre!. I go to Bangkok often, and always take the train, so cheap and so much faster (especially rush hour)

So easy. Transfer to hotel in Fortune city in around 45 minutes from collecting luggage and cost less than £2 !
Clear signage throughout the airport easily directs you to the ticket office. Signs and route maps in Thai and English, easy to follow.

Never take a taxi again. The Airport rail link is brilliant. 40 baht to the city center in a clean super fast train. For me traveling to the second last stop was 35 min and then I just had a short 400m walk to the hotle. On our return having a few more bags we took a taxi from the hotel to the station which is also not a problem as taxies take all fair regardless of how short it is. On previous trip I have spent 500/600 baht for a taxi from the airport that took at least an hour. The Airport Rail is the the way to go hands down.

Airport rail shuttle. . Level B of airport. Excellent. 45 bhat per adult to centre of city. Easy to use. Staff were very helpful. told them our hotel and they showed us where to get to.MUCH cheaper than taxi. (airport is a long way from city center).

Fast, convenient & cheap. I suppose it's the most convenient and cheapest way to transport from the airport to the city centre. It's also easy to find the way to the airport rail link, too.When we travelled to Bankok last year, we stayed in Nonthaburi with our friend who is working there. From the airport, we take airport rail link then catch a taxi to come to her house. The staff at the railway station were very helpful and friendly. They try to catch a taxi for us (as we travelled in a group of five, then not many driver agreed to take all of us) and show us the hotline number to inform in case the driver would be overcharging.

Faster and Better Transpotation to Bangkok. Last time i often used taxi from the airport which cost us a lot bath and took 30-40 minutes to get to Bangkok now i could safe money and time with the train.

Fast, convenient, and cheap. Much better than taking a taxi! No more haggling with unreliable drivers or being stuck in traffic. Definitely a great upgrade! Doesn't run 24/7 so you should check your flight times.

Nice and comfortable ride. Although it is not a express train, but the ride and smooth enough to avoid traffic jam in Bangkok.It about 35-40 baht and take about 20-30 minutes ride. Therefore it is worth while to take even though I have to take BTS to transfer over which cost addition of 42 Baht.

Accessible and reliable. I was in transit for 7 hrs and took the airoort rail link to the city. Took me around 40mins to reach Terminal 21 mall in Sukhumvit. This link is the best and fastest access from Suvarnabhumi airport to the city center. Alighted at Makkasan and transferred to BTS going to Sukhumvit from Phetchaburi. If it's your first time in BKK, this link is highly recommended. Cheap and safe too.

Fast and Cheap. I always take the airport link from BKK to Phaya Thai station, thereafter change to BTS to the city. It beats the traffic jam and takes only 30min, excluding waiting time. Moreover, it is only 45 baht. However, on my return journey to airport, I noted there is no escalator at Phaya Thai BTS station. I hence have to carry my heavy luggage down the stairs.

Fast and good. If only there's more escalator or lift for the luggage. There should be a cabin for luggage. The station is not air conditioned and can get quite stuffy. But you will need coins to buy the tickets.
Airport link. It's good way to go to airport, but we got stuck during travel. After small waiting the train continued to move. Always prepare enough extra time :)

Impressive. Had my first ride during my Mac 2015 visit to the airport. Smooth quite ride. Had the pleasure to discover that there are many beautiful mosques along the track.Recently, I tried to take the express train from airport to Makkasan. But the express service was suspended indefinitely.

Ease to the city. The new Airport rail link is easy to access from the arrival hall at the airport, and is incredibly cheap with brilliant air conditioning! The trains run regularly and take just 20 - 30 mins to connect with either MRT or BTS rail networks. Being Bangkok, the carriages can get packed with tourists and communters

a fast way into town in case of traffic jams. only recomended if your final destination is in Makkasan or Payatai or Patumwan Watergate. If you need to change to BTS or Underground then if more than 2 persons a taxi would be cheaper as they increased prices again recently.

Great choice from airport-city. I think this is the best way to go to the airport (Suvanabhumi) because you don't have to be stuck in the traffic or meet a bad taxi drivers and you know it's pretty far from city center to suvarnabhumi airport so I would recommend travellers to take a train from phyathai bts (it's connected to airport rail link) and go to the airport, but one thing I don't really like is the train is quite slow if compare to the bts or mrt but it's the only train to airport anyway

Part of Bangkok's very friendly mass transit system. This is an easy way to get from Suvarnabhumi to town, fast and reasonably low price, The interface between the Airport line and the Sky Train is a bit clumsy with stairs or an elevator (They could not have connected them easier?) but it works well enough.

great ride. We used the train about 4 times. We took a flight from Bangkok to Chiang Mai and to just go for a ride and check the city out. The train was always clean, safe, comfortable, and on time. We rode from the our hotel which was in the shopping or stop A7 to the airport cost if I remember about 40 baht. Well worth the cost.
Transportation. Very good transportation from the airport to bangkok centre and with a standard price - after that it's bargain time
Just 45THb. Best way to get at Airport area, only 45THB from city center , nothing cheaper and better you can found , fastest way of travel in city like bangkok
single traveler!. it is speedy way to transfer from Suvarnabhumi Airport to Bangkok but if you have more than 1 baggage, maybe you have problem with movement!
Good during Peak Travel Times. If your hotel is close to the BTS Line or the Airport Link Line itself this might be a good option for you to skip the peak hour traffic jam.

Extremely Rude Customer Service Personnel At Ticket Counter. My family consisting of me, my wife, 2 young children (4 and 8 years old) and my Mum who is 74 years old went to the ticketing counter at the airport station yesterday at about 3:45 pm to enquire about whether we can purchase tokens for young children and senior, as we saw a sign that says that they are entitled to it. There was this extremely rude male customer service personnel (he was located nearest the ticket vending machines when he was on duty) who barked instructions at me and refused to answer my queries. He told me to look at him and pay up 35 Baht each sternly, even for 2 the children and senior. There was absolutely no service standard at all. I will take a cab next time as the cab drivers I had experienced are helpful, friendly and respectful, unlike this rude customer service personnel. I have not come across such a rude service personnel as him in Thailand in the past dozens of visit I had made. Thai people are generally kind, helpful and responsive. I hope the Airport authorities can look into this case.
Bangkok Rail. One of the better rail systems in the world's major cities. Runs on time, very clean, announcements are clear in English which is always helpful. Prices are quite moderate.

Most reliable way from airport-city. During rush hour, this is the only mode of transportation you should consider getting into the city. A taxi ride from the airport during rush hour can easily run over 2 hours.

Really quick & easy travel into the city centre. Easy cheap travel into the city centre, no hassling with the taxi drivers and super quick, especially if you are staying anywhere near Makkasan or Phaya Thai.

Airport train was packed. We prefer to go to the airport on the rail link as it is so easy.... Usually, that is.Yesterday we were running a little late, but not too much, however, when the train arrived @ Makasan, we couldn't get on due to the numbers already on board.Being travellers we had our baggage & there was a wait of 7 minutes for the next train, which seemed an eternity.Something which seems apparent is the increasing number of Thais using this line to go to & from work - fair enough too.However, the authorities need to review the number of carriages on this line as it doesn't support the number of commuters.Regardless, still the best way to get to the airport.

Good if you are a very light traveller... Saw it develop and build over the years of visiting Bangkok. When it is ready, they gave free or a token fee of tHB10 one way ride,The station locations are okay, but most stations are not inter connected with other rail transits in the city, like the MRT and skytrain. So, this is down side.It is a very good and fast method from Suvarnabhumi International Airport to down town. However, the carriages are narrow. Since Bangkok has many visitors coming in every moment, it gets crowded. So, getting in and out of the carriage would be a problem when you are having a large luggage and other things with you.So, if you are a very light traveller, then this is good

Express Trains are 50-50 - go for the standard. Express trains leave every 30 minutes (that is if they are operating). It is best to take the normal line to Phaya Thai. If you have up to 1 medium suitcase it is then feasible to switch at Phaya Thai to the regular BTS line.
Best for 8-9am and 5-7pm rush hours, especially on arrival into Bangkok.
I dont like taxis. so this is just a dream , and such comfort all the way to the airport , just great , I would say the seats are a little uncomfortable

Most convenient. This rail service connects the city with the airport and I found it the most covenient mode of transport. The signs are easy and one can follow it easily without getting lost. The trains are quite modern and very comfortable and spacious with room for your big luggage bags too.

It used to be good, but now just too damn crowded!. I'll never understand why the folks who run the Airport Rail Link do not discontinue the Express train service and increase the number of cars and runs for the regular train service! The local trains have gotten way too crowded lately!
faster. To airport to playa thai cheap and faster better take airport rail link if u know exxactly where you go

Great way to get from Suvarnabhumi airport into the centre of Bangkok. Quick service and much cheaper than taxis which can be very slow due to traffic - but you may need a taxi when you get into the centre of Bangkok

Quick and clean. No need for taxis. Just take the Train directly to town and then get a taxi to yout hotel or simply take te BTS.
Allways clean and on time.

Great way to get from the airport. Great way to get from the airport to the city. I went to Koh San Road and it saved me lots of money in cab fares. The train doesn't go to Koh San road but it will get you half way so you can then hop in a taxi and save yourself some money. Or ask one of the people who work there to send you in the direction of the free bus that takes you to the palace just round the corner from the koh san area
Airport Rail Link. Easy to get there. It is simple to purchase of the tickets. Accurate, fast, air-conditioned. The best way to get in or out of the city.
Cheap and Fast travel. We took the train from airport and we got right in front of our hotel....it was very convenient even with luggage.

Efficient fast and cheap. It takes about 25 minutes to get to the city.if there are more than two people travelling it is cheaper to take cabThere is a long walk between the the link and the BTSIf you have heavy luggage and you have problems with your back or knees take a taxi. They are cheap an average of 350 to 400 Bhat

Quick and Cheap. This is the best way into Bangkok. Leave the other travellers waiting for a taxi at the airport .take the train to Phaya Thai , which is the last stop .Easy swap here to many train stops . Either then catch a taxi from Phaya Thai or the closest station to where you are going. Faster , cheaper and more interesting .

Best Way to Commute Between Bangkok City Centre and Bangkok International Airport. Airport link train is the best way to commute Between Bangkok City Centre and Bangkok International Airport (Suvarnabhumi Airport), if you want to avoid traffic and tout taxi drivers. The Airport link train station is conveniently located at the level B2 of the arrival hall of Bangkok International Airport. Airport link train runs from 6AM to midnight. Using this train you can come to Phaya Thai Station (in 25 minutes) and then can transfer to any Sky train (within the Phaya Thai Station) to go to the city centre (I mean Chong Nonsi or Bangkok Station) in 15 to 25 minutes. Airport link trains and Sky Trains are modern, safe, clean and spacious to carry luggage. Airport to Phaya Thai Station costs only 42 THB. Phaya Thai to Chong Nonsi Station costs 31 THB. Tickets are sold in vending machines in every station. On the vending machine, ticket price for each destination station is clearly specified. Customer service booths in every station help to convert cash to coin.
Slow and hot. U can expect a very long waiting time and warm platform. But at least this is a cheaper access to the airport

Quick and efficient. If you are travelling light it is the best method of transport between downtown and the airport. It's relatively cheap and quick rather than be in traffic.If you have heavy luggage connecting to the BTS (skytrain) is a little bit hard as there are not escalators or lifts at many of the stations to get to and from the platforms.

Convenient mode of transport. It was a breeze taking the airport link to Ratchaprarop station in less than 30 mins. It costs 40 baht per person. I took the train at around 9am, and the train was crowded. The only inconvenient thing is that you need to move your luggage through the crowd during peak hrs. Walking from Ratchaprarop station to Amari Watergate Hotel was less than 15mins. But it can be challenging if there are a lot of people around the rows of shops that you need to drag your luggage through. For bagpackers, it will not be too difficult to walk through the crowd

fast and certainly reasonable. Once you have sorted the transfer to Skytrain [usually at Praya Thai station}, this is a clearly superior way to the airport than taking ripoff taxis. Bangkok transportation planners made this needlessly complicated with the Skytrain transfer.

Great for Airport to town, but if alone. Its good if you are travelling alone and without luggage and want to save some buck, just take a cab if you are with three people would almost cost the same if your hotel or house is not near the station.
Fast and cheap way to reach airport. cityline is fast and cheap way to reach airport from phaya thai in 40 min at 45 THB. Use it if your hotel is connected to any BTS station on silom line.

easy to town. i like when i come Bangkok to take the Airport Rail Link for going to hotel, i choose my hotel near airport rail link, og the BTS, if stay at hotel near BTS it is just to change at Phaya Thai, price is about 45 bath pr. person and more fast than taxa if you stay in centre.

Fast and cheap but.... Traveling from the airport to Makkasan or Phaya Thai is great even with luggage and you ll get a seat. Too bad the express service is still not running but 30 minutes is still much faster even with the taxi to the hotel.But coming back is another story. It can be VERY crowded. No seats and not fun with luggage but it's still much faster. Cost 45 baht instead of 400 baht. And you miss the wild ride on the freeway.

Fast & clean. Loved the rail link, so new & clean. It's very well run & there's information so you know when the next train will arrive. The token machines are so easy to use, overall a good experience

Saves time from congested roads upon arrival. I take a train from Suvernbhoomi airport which takes me right to the 'Indra Hotel' in Pratunam area. The entire travel takes a few minutes. Travelling by taxi although not very costly, takes a longer time as sometimes the roads are congested
BTS rocks. Beats traffic! Go down to B terminal pay the 45 baht to Phaya Thai. Transfer where ever you need to go. 20 minutes to Phaya Thai
Good and cheap to airport.. I used this train Feb 2015.I taken a taxi everytime to airport.it's fast and easy but expensive.This is good plice. if you don't have many bags,you have to use this train.

Good standard and service, thus really crowded. This is really an excellent mean of transport, very reasonable price and very fast (comparing with the traffic jam on the road most of the time). Huge amount of travellers as well as local people using this route so visitor please make sure you plan enough time.The reason I just vote 4 is only because its escalators were not working the days I used it, so with big/case suit cases, I had to carry them up and down the long stairs, which was really a memorable experience of Thai's shopping.
Easy and Convenient. This was easy, cheap, convenient, and reliable. I used this while getting to and from the airport several times while in Thailand and never had any issues!

Not sure how to review a train line ! but it's quick and easy - comfortable access. Very good and comfortable access to the airport. connected to the sky train and every easy to reach. Much cheaper than a taxy, and hassle-free.

Fast, cheap, easy. If you don't have a mountain of luggage it's best to take the airport rail link; beats taking the taxi and to avoid the traffic jam. Took the rail from the Rajaprapop station to Suvarnabhumi airport; took about 30 minutes and cost only 40 bath.
Excellent Service. Loved It. Its always on time.. Helped us to avoid rush traffic. But they need to spread the link more.
Very convinent. Air port link is always better as it saves huge time and cost is also very reasonable. There is no tension of traffic jam and scope for delay.

Beat the massive trafiic jam!. Given the crazy traffic at times in Bangkok especially during peak hours, taking the airport rail link is almost a good option! For those who would like to use this transport, try to opt for your accommodation to be near Asoke BTS, Terminal 21. The station is located at this area. no need to change train lines as you will be getting on at Sukumvit station which is next to Asoke BTS.

Bit of a crush but the best way to get into the centre from the airport. Quick way to get to and from the airport with good links along the way to all parts of Bangkok. Does get crowded at times and can be hard if you've got a lot of luggage but cheap and convenient.

A great way to start your trip. If you don't have mountains of luggage and a fairly good at negotiating a mapThen the airport rail link is the way to goIt's cheap, Fast and Convenient No Bangkok traffic jamsAnd a great way to see how large and beautiful Bangkok is It's an exciting and overwhelming cite to see Bangkok for the first time and you can't see it any better then this especially for the priceThe train is clean and has Airconditioning and there is always some one ready to help if youbare lost

Fast. Cheap. Easy way to get from the airport to Bangkok and vice versa.. We travelled most days on the airport skytrain whilst in Bangkok. It's fast, clean, efficient, safe and cheap and beats the congestion and pollution of going by road. All the signage is in Thai and English. It's definitely the way to go.

Rail Link. The fastest and most efficient way to go from and to Suvarnabumi Airport. Please notice that this Rail Link does not operate 24 hours. If you have a late flight you might not be able to use this cheap service
very useful and convenient. for 45bahts it takes 20min to get downtown. clean and fast. you can even stop before the end of the line to get closer to your destination.

Great way to get into Bangkok, beat the traffic. There are now 3 trains linking Bangkok to Suvarnabhuni Airport.1 The Suvarnabhuni Airport City Line (SA City Line) THB 15.- THB 45, Runs a stopping service between Phaya Thai Station to Suvarnabhumi Station, with stops at 6 stations on the way, namely Rajaprarop Station, Makkasan Station, Ramkhanhaeng Station, Hua Maak Station, Baan Tubchang Station and Lardkrabang Station; Travelling Time is approximately 30 minutes.You can connect easily with Bangkoks MRt And BTS lines.2. Suvarnabhumi Airport Express-Makkasan (Makkasan Express Line)This journey costs 90bt single fare and takes approx 15 minutes.3. Suvarnabhumi Airport Express – Phaya Thai (Phaya Thai Express Line) Again fare is 90bt single and journey time approx 17 minutes.All lines offer great connections to the MRT and the BTS system. But both MRT and BTS lines are not suitable for conveying large suitcases due to congestion. If spending just a couple of days in Bangkok itself do what I do, leave any large case in the secure left luggage at the airport and just carry small weekend case with essentials with me then no problem using the BTS line to my hotel.

Help desk staff were brilliant. Didn't know where we had to get off as staying in Sukhumvit but asked the ladies at the helpdesk and they were wonderful. They marked on the map exactly where we needed to be - super. The rail link was clean, quick and not at all busy when we took it. We arrived at 9.30am is and were in Sukhumvit , with a change of train by 10.30. Would have struggled without the support from help desk.

Essential to get into Bangkok within an hour. The train is excellent and saves a great deal of time over taxis in Bangkok. It's easy to access from the airport and even travelling with luggage, access via lifts and escalators are no issue.The train takes about 30 minutes to get into Phaya Thai the end of the line. There are various interchanges to Metro and the Skytrain, so I'd always advocate the use of this. It's especially cheap at 35 Bhat per person.

win time and use it. so easy to take the rail link who takes u till the center of BKK,
u escape the crazy traffic in BKK, and cheaper than the taxi from airport. with taxi u have to make queue at airport, with rail link NO

Clean, cheap, quick, Air Conditioned German Technology. This is a German designed and built, modern rail system. The key word is "German quality" - efficient- punctual- cheap- clean- air-conditioned- runs ever 15 minutes. On the other hand if you prefer some adventure and a bit of aggravation, then hire a Tut Tut or a local Taxi for 10 times the price.

Fast and inexpensive trip to the city center. Finding the Rail Link at the airport in Bangkok is easy and access is convenient. The trains run on a regular schedule and transport you from BKK airport to downtown in about 30 minutes. Connections to the BTS and MRT ( Skytrain and underground metro system respectively) are easy and well annotated.Easier than a taxi if you don't have lots of luggage. One suitcase and a carry-on bag, per person, are probably all you want to try managing on the skytrain, though.

Best Transportation for Airport Transfer. You can get the Airport Train from the Phaya Thai Station. Its connect with BTS line so you just get down at Phaya Thai BTS and move to Phaya Thai Airport Rail Link Station. Its just on 1-2Mints walk.As per me this is the best mode of transportation in Bangkok as the road to airport is full of traffic in peak hours.

Easiest way to get to and from the airport to the BTS system. If you are staying BTS station somewhere in Bangkok, the easiest and probably the fastest way to get to and from the airport is via the rail link. It is also the least expensive option. The trains are clean, modern and have sufficient room for people with luggage. The only negative is that it does not run 24 hours a day, which means that if you are on a flight that is arriving or taking off from Midnight to morning, it might not be such a good option.
fast and economical. we got the airport train back to our hotel stop in Nana, it took less than thirty minutes, we flew over the traffic below us - cost approx. $4.00 NZD each in total - brilliant!!

Cheap and easy way !. A good way to get to the city from the airport. You can get away from all the touts and taxi drivers. There are two types of trains, the City Link and Express Link. The Express takes less time and the other one has a few stops and takes about 30 mts to get to the city.This is an ideal way to beat the traffic jams of Bangkok, if you are heading to the airport.
make it easy to arrive to airport suvarnapume and back. like to be connected easy and cheap only 45 baht,on rush hourers very crauded,3 statins in the city can be easly reach every place in city

Go for the Express line train. Took the normal train from the airport to Ratchaprarop station, which was 2 blocks from our hotel. As we returned to the airport during peak times the train was over full so we opted for the express train. For that you have to go one back to Phaya Thai. Was worth the extra rate to go on express. Less people plus place for bagage

excellent way to get out of the airport. excellent way to get out of the airport without having to hire a taxis to go thru the ever congested Bangkok road way. There are 2 trains that serve the city and the airport. The Airport Express is nonstop but less frequent as well as more expensive, whereas the city link runs regularly, less expensive. Even with more stops along the way, the time difference between the two is only a matter of minutes.

Cheaper than a Taxi and no traffic jams. Airport rail link is easy to navigate, you will not get snarled up in any traffic and it's cheap, it also links up with the sky train so you can get pretty much any where.My travel time from the airport to the lower Sukhumvit area was about the same time a Taxi would take when the roads are clear, but only cost me 50 baht, a Taxi would cost about 285 baht.

Quick and easy to use. At the airport, there are agents/security guards?? helping people buy their tickets at the self-serve ticket booths. You put in your money and out comes a plastic coin for entry - hold on to it as you'll need it to leave the destination station. The clean air-conditioned train comes every 15 minutes and you're downtown in half an hour. All the stops are announced and the maps also have the station names spelled out phonetically with the alphabet so it's quite easy to use.
Links to Skytrain etc. Use the Rail link from BKK main airport (not the old one) and it connects into the Skytrain service. Easy, cheap and fast!

Good travel option if traveling to near the rail line. It's an inexpensive and fast way to get from the airport into Bangkok, cheaper than a taxi, which also aren't that expensive (under 100 baht, which is around $3, versus over 200 by taxi). The only catch is that if you're going to somewhere well off the rail line then you'd still need to take a taxi. It connects with the sky-train (stations adjoin) at Phya Thai, so without much for baggage someone could transfer, in theory, but really it makes the most sense if headed to near one of the stations. They had an express version directly from Phya Thai (no stops in the middle) but dropped it last time I was there since the stops don't add that much time, and easier for them to run one train type.

Express to the city. Great way to get to the city fast. Easy to get to, bottom of the airport and you are in town in about 20-25 minutes, as with cab sometimes can take more than an hour, depending on traffic.

Could get cramped but it will get the job done. This is the easiest way to get to Suvarnabhumi from downtown Bangkok. It could get crowded during rush hour and you might find it difficult to find a seat, but it will get you to your destination quicker than a taxi.
bankok trip 1. we used the airport rail link to get to airport on time, no traffic blocks and reaches airport without any delays, loved the system.

Good transportation for roundtrip suvarnabhumi. Why only have on suvarnabhumi airport??Why don mueang airport dont have airport link?Now don mueang aiport is very crowded dan busyNeed many transportation likes airport link

Good option for fast travel into city. Cabs are cheap, but traffic even in the expressways can be a nightmare. This option takes you into the central area, to Praya Thai terminus, where it's an very easy transfer to the skytrain network. ( 45Baht from airport to city)
Clean and quiet. This was clean and quiet, disturbingly not at all like the Bangkok I know. I rode this and then the skytrain a lot, and both were great additions to Bangkok.

A good idea but not realised right. Right now the Thai engineers managed to "kill" most trains. They not even ordered the spare parts to repair. Nearly had to stop the service because not enough trains which are usable. Build b German companies but destroyed by Thai. A problem is also that you arrive in Bangkok with your luggage and there is no taxi, no one who can help. Very nice if tourist are in Bangkok first time and they stay late in evening with luggage on a street and there is no taxi.

Easy fast and cheap. The cheapest form of transport to and from the airport, especially if you are traveling light. I would not reccomend if you have large suitcases etc. One back pack is manageable, otherwise take a taxi.If you get in close to or after midnight take a taxi the train stops around midnight, likewise for any connecting MRT or BTS in the city.

cheap quick connection to the bts/mrt. the airport rail link is on the lowest level at BKK airport, buy a token in the machine or at the counter, waiting time max 15 min travel time 30 minutes to BTS station Phaia Thaya

Save time and money. Ive been using this rail link since 1 year. Not only it takes me to the heart of city faster than other modes but its also way too cheap.A taxi might charge 400 baths to take you to baiyoke sky but this rail road will take you there in just 35 baths and way too faster than those taxi's.

Fast and very convenient. Took the airport express rail link to Makkasan and it was very fast. Got to the city in 15 minutes. Price was inexpensive too compared to getting a cab which might cost more and possibly getting stuck in the Bangkok rush hour jam

Convenient and fast. Bangkok famous for her food, massage and notorious on her bad traffic. The ARL which helped me to have a new image on bkk. Last time been there was 2007, which the traffic jam almost costed me missed my flight. This time my time is well managed and will come here soon!

Excellent start. Great way to get into downtown Bangkok from Suvarnabhumi. Easy access from the basement level. The journey will take you to Phaya Thai, at which you'll need to interchange to a BTS line to your end destination.The Bangkok train system is very easy to use once you get your orientation. The journey from Suvarnabhumi to Phaya Thai takes about 30 minutes, and covers 8 stops (which means you can alight at various stations along the way, and interchange at them, depending on your final destination.A great way to get to/from the airport, and is a more relaxing (and cheaper) journey than a 30 klm taxi ride.
Very good. Very good transport system to the airport terminal used this service very many times reliable reasonably priced and very efficient

what more do u want for 45 thb.. the service is extremely handy and value for money. I paid 45 thb to go from Aport to City Center in 35 minutes. service on time, very clean, not overcrowded and easy to find.

Easy to find in basement of airport down 2 floors escalator. Great easy service -Down the escalator. City line ( Blue ) cheap but slower than the express and a little hotter. 35BAHT to Makkasan about 30 minutes. Buy ticket in English, tap on station you want and it shows you the price...put your coins /notes in( Gives change )I was told there was an easy number 556 bus straight to KhaoSan Road from outside Makkasan station but in reality there wasn't and just a busy dusty main road with only one bus stop which was difficult to find in the heat then displaying no bus numbers.But easy to flag down a green and yellow taxi 100 Baht to KhaoSan from here so all good.I did notice an MRT metro link sign from the walkway at Makkasan station though.

Why use anything else to BKK.. Easy to find and use from BKK for English speaking travelers. Clean, safe, and affordable while avoiding the headache of sitting in traffic. About a 30 minute ride into city center.
Cleanless. It is like a underground but it has been the cleanless underground which we have been. I strong recommend to move in Bangkok.

Super connectivity. Just get on this.
Very few stops (i think only 3-4) and this takes you from Suvarnabhumi to the heart of the city. Helps avoid queue at the taxi and city traffic. Cheap fares ,make sure to get some change as soon as you can from the airport.

Easy way to the city!. It took me 31 or 35 baht from the airport station to Makksan Station and 45 to Phaya Thai Station (Closer to city area). It will be cheaper to go by train if your hotel is near to the station/ 2 or less travellers/ no need to transfer much from airport rail link station to your hotel station as you will have to tap out and walk over to another BTS/ MRT line and re buy the tickets again. Its not worth it. BTS, MRT and their Airport Rail Link are all separated. There will not be any transfer within the line. This is the only thing that is abit troublesome as sometimes you will have to walk quite a distance to reach another from one line to another and sometimes the total fare is even more expensive than cab.

Efficient and easy. We caught the train from MBK to the Chikkachack markets. Very surprised at how clean and comfortable the train was. We managed to get a seat on both ends of our journey, and it was air conditioned. The only downside was that there were no public toilets at any of the train stations. My husband had an upset stomach and urgently needed to use the toilet. The lady at the Train station was very kind and gave him the keys to the staff toilet.
Easiest was to get into the city. This is by far the easiest and very cheap way to get into the city. You do need to do a little research on the best place to stop, but it is easy.

Reliable - cool!!!!. I only used for a one-station hop, several times, but it was not expensive and great to have the air conditioning. Every 15 mins or so, but the wait in the stations can be VERY hot ....

Too easy.... Easy to find ( basement of airport ) and easy to use. Make sure you have some baht - my fare was 35 Baht for about 2/3rds of the way. You can buy ticket at ticket office, they speak English, but you'll need to know which station you want to get off at. FAR FAR FAR better than dealing with Thai taxi drivers and so much quicker during the day. Think Bangkok, think traffic jams....
Straight to Suvarnabhumi Airport!. It's clean, it's fast, and the view of the city from the train is simply magnificent!It's cheap too.
Convenience. Easy to travel with airport rail link but to change to BTS at Phaya Thai to get to your respective hotel. The station staff is helpful.

Fast way to airport. I found it the cheapest and fastest way to get to the airport. I just took a taxi from my hotel in Silom to Makkasan station. From Makkasan in less than 20 minutes I was in the airport. The cost: 30 Bath
convenient for travellers. Clear signages, and improved security by checking the trains at the airport before passengers take the trains into the city.

The Only Way To Fly. If you are going to Suvarnabhumi Airport or leaving, don't mess with the taxis. Take the city line. From the airport to Makasan is 45Baht and you hook up with the subway there. The train is air conditioned and mostly quiet. If is fairly easy to get a seat if you board at the point of depature. Returning to the airport I always go to Phaya Thai to ensure to get a seat. It is a lot easier and takes less time than by taxi. The only way to go.

Airport Rail Link. Fantastic, efficient and inexpensive - our hotel was within a 3 minute walk from the station. The airport is well sign posted so easy to find the station. The stations have escalators so easy for heavy baggage on your way home again after great shopping
Used it four time. I used the airport express many tines and it was defiantly the fastest way in and out of the city. It is also clean since they don't allow food or drink in the cars.

Fast and Cheap. Its better then a taxi which charge you more and make you feel like hack when you are already tired from long flight and you are stuck in traffic only 40B .. PAY LESS AND GO EASY AND FAST

Smooth-Fast-Cheap-No Hassle!. I've used the Airport Rail Link several times now and will use it again ANY time I have to travel to Bangkok.It's faster, (much) cheaper, and more reliable than using the airport taxi's.
Cheap. Quick and very very cheap (I'm coming from London, so you can imagine...). It was like 0.85£, in Euros I guess around 1.20€

wonderful way to travel. Why would you take a bus or taxi through the busy streets when you could just use this wonderful service. Love the way the staff march, stand to attention and salute when each train leaves.
super easy!. Super easy to understand, all announcements in English and Thai. Much easier than sitting in traffic to get to the airport. Quick and easy.

Transport. This is a very efficient service carrying passengers to and from the airport.it will take you to join the underground railway or the Skytrain both of which are excellent to use. They are all very clean and reasonable cheap. The Sky Tain is now getting quite expensive and crowded. I would recommend the Airport Rail Link

Fast, efficient, cheap, clean, and secure.. The airport rail link leaves from the underground level of BKK. It is fast, efficient, cheap, clean, and secure. Before you buy your ticket there is also a 7-11 at this level. Great for topping up your phone, buying a beer (even outside normal sales hours), and grabbing cheap snacks. Once past security, the airport has price jacked everything.

Useful. It's very useful and near my hotel (just 100m walk from my hotel). Clean. I can use it to visit the new airport. From Airport RaiLink i can go anywhere i want with BTS and MRT (interchange station).

Express Train service discontinued. The non-stop express train service from the airport to the city has been discontinued, replaced with stopping at stations, but overall quite fast about half hr to get to the airport.

Easy commute to and from the airport. Convenient and regular, the two lines link up with both the metro and the skytrain depending on which stop you get off at. It takes about 30-40 mins to make the journey depending on which station you are going to.

Better connection to the MRT underground/subway system now. Well signed from the airport and easy to reach at level B. Cheap and regular at 35 baht every 10 minutes or so.
The express service wasn't working but the City line was fast enough if a tad overcrowded.

Excellent traveling. The airport link and the sky train is a very convenient way to travel it can take you every were you wish to go to and it will take you almost exactly where you want to go, the railway stations are also very convenient and easy to find, the train took me to the weekend markets and the night markets, the weekend market is so big that it will take you at least two visits to see everything.
Great public transportation from airport!. It is a clean, cheap and easy way to go to/from the airport to almost anywhere in the city. It does link with BTS and has an average frequency.
Fantastic service. This is the only way to get into Bangkok city and more or less to your hotel, No long traffic jams tolls and stress in get to Hotel, Fast and on time and very very neatand clean
best way to beat the jam. use the airport rail link to get into the heart of Bangkok.it links you to BTS skytrain and underground train station.and it is so cheap!

Super Fast. Short and sweet, Very well signed in Airport, to get to
The Ral lnk comes every short while, and it take approx 25-30 mins to get in to the centre, with out he hussle ofthe traffic,
Cheap as well and stops at al the main areas in BKK,

super fast. i love this airport link as the service is super fast also cheap as hell
recommend to use this service.

Great to get to/from the airport. This link has made my life easier every time I visited Bangkok. At a cheap price, you will be able to get most of the places with the rail link. It's very convenient to get to the city town with it.

Fast & Convenient to/from Airport. This is the best way to beat Bangkok city traffic. Economical and fast it reaches most areas of the city with easy connections. Located on the lower level of the new airport, it saves a lot of time in traffic and much cheaper than a taxi. Get off closest station to your desired area or hotel and then if necessary, take a short cab ride from there.

Fast, cheap and hassle free way to travel. We always like to travel in clean air condition and efficient way to escape the notorious Bangkok traffic jam. No need to sit the taxi for hours after travelling by airplane. A comforting way to start our holidays.
Easy to use. Very fast, no traffic jam or taxi drivers trying to rip you off. A bit hard if you have heavy luggage and you have to carry it down the staircase to get to street leavel

Economical and fast way to reach the city. We used the rail link on arrival to Bangkok was pleasantly surprised with ease of travelling and quick it provides connectivity to the city center. Only negative is its crowded to if you travel during office hours.

Convenient, fast and economical. This is a sure way to beat the Bangkok traffic jam. From the arrival hall, take the travelator one level down. You can buy your ticket from the ticket machine (which has instructions in English) or the ticket office. The airport rail link brings you to Makkasan station for 35baht and the journey takes about 20-30 minutes. There is a link to Petchaburi BTS which brings one to many parts of Sukhumvit along the Sukhumvit line. For visitors staying closer to the river, alight at the Phaya Thai terminal station. This is a fuss-free mode of transport between the airport and the busy city centre. Highly recommended to beat the traffic.
fast and save money. If you are 1 or 2 traveller then its a good way to come to city center fast and save money and then take taxi
Not very convenient. Not convenient for hotels in the Silom/Sathorn area. It does not connect conveniently with the rest of the sky rail system.

Easiet, fastest and cheapest way from Airport to city and back. I think it is most convenient and cheapest mode of transportation from Bangkok airport to city and back. There is connection to BTS skytrain and it's not too crowded as well. I would definitely recommend it to people who are travelling alone because taxi would be 3-4 times more expensive.
Cheap, Best, Convenient. Best and most convenient way to reach Bangkok city from Suvarnabhumi Airport.Carry Thaibhat, money exchanger in side of train station not give good rate.

Convenient Way to Get into Town. The airport Rail Link is easy and convenient, though the express line was not available when I reached Suvarnabhumi, the city link was more than sufficient to reach Phaya Thai station and then move on to wherever you need to go in Bangkok.
Good Value. Good value and regular timetable taking you into Phaya Thai station. But VERY crowded. However you do normally get a seat if you get on at the airport from the lower level floor

Inexpensive transfer and so simple!. Located in the basement floor of Bangkok Airport, and for the equivalent of a couple dollars in cost, this is an easy way to get into the main Sukumvit Area and gain connections with both the Metro and the BTS Skytrain, especially during daytime hours when traffic is unbelievably snarled in the streets. In fact, during the day, I have walked from the Rail Link to Sukumvit with my suitcase in 20 minutes and that was far less than the traffic which was stopped beside me as I walked by!!It is best to go online and download and print out a copy of the rail links with the other rail systems for a good overview and guidance, but then it's pretty simple!I believe it runs from 0600 to midnight only so plan accordingly!The approximate length of trip from one end to the other is 35 minutes.

Excellent way to travel from the airport. Well sign posted in the arrivals terminal, the train leaves from B1 floor. Ticket booths for purchase of tickets - you don't need correct change as change is given. The price depends on your destination but is very reasonable at 45 BHT to Makkosan.
easy way into town, but arrives at a nowhere place.. it gets crowded quickly so grab a seat first, push in if you have to, everyone else does, else you will be standing.

Very efficient and clean!. Have to say this experience made the London Underground look like it was still in the Victorian era. The train is pretty fast but incredibly clean, ok I know the weather is better than ours most of the time but believe me it does rain a lot when it rains but the train still stays clean!The names of the stations was the hardest thing for me to work out even though I knew what I was looking for but they announce each station too as it arrives. So between the map and the announcement you will work it out!Can recommend it and a great way to avoid the heavy Bangkok traffic queues too.
Nice. Really love the sky train. Its fast and cheap. Watch out for rush hour because then it is a bit crazy. I would highly recommend this as a way around town

Cheap and quick way to travel to the city to and from Swarnabhumi. The express train is the best choice straight from Swarnabhumi AP to Makkasan station. unfortunately it seems to be out of service for months now. I have been denied service in March 2015 and May 2015 in two visits now.
cheap and efficient means of transportation. cheap and efficient means of transportation could be better if ticketing machines at station will increase

Easiest way to get to airport. Skip the traffic if you can by taking the airlink. It was the easiest way to get to airport. it literally stops right under the airport so you just go up the escalators to get to the check in desk.

Excellent connectivity. I always take airport rail link from/to suvarnabhumi airport. I always stay at Pratunam. So my nearest metro station to my hotel is ratchaparop. It starts from 6 am. After that frequency and connectivity is very good. Coaches are kept very clean.
Good arrangement!. Better to use taxi to downtown, as traffic jam in Bangkok is normally, you may need more than 1 hour to downtown, if use airport rail, only 45 mins to BTS Siam Station.
Better than the taxi. Runs every half hour from 6am until 11pm. Reliable, clean and on time and just as comfortable as the taxis.

Fastest way to Novotel BKK Ploenchit hotel. Arrived at Suvarnabhumi Airport and tried the airport rail link for the second time. For only 45 THB from airport to phaya thai station, I was able to save money. Never tried taking taxi .

Airport Rail link. Now that the rail link has been extended to the Airport, it really is no longer necessary to haggle with taxi drivers or touts trying to extort as much money as possible from unsuspecting tourists. Now, just go down to the ground floor and follow clearly marked signs to the airport link. This will connect with the other lines on the BTS system and take you to whatever part of the city or its environs that you wish to go to.

Not as good as it should be. When the long awaited link was opened, it had an express service and a stopping service. Now, there is only a stopping service, which gets very full and is not very luggage friendly. The access at most stations is limited in terms of lift and escalator provision. The Thai authorities do not seem to totally commit themselves to public transport, as indicated by a woeful rail system. The airport link needs some investment to restore the express service and improve access and connectivity, so as to provide additional and much needed capacity. It is, of course, very cheap by western standards.

Quickest way Bangkok. Easy Access from the airport, jump in the lift, or get on the escalator, down to the lower ground floor. when the train arrives, EVERYBODY wants to get on at once, with all their belongings, so let them fight it out before you get on. Swift service from airport to bangkok, with connecting stations on route to different parts of the city, connections to the Skytrain and the MRL ( underground system ) along the way, saves taxi fares and toll charges, very efficient service.

Great!. If your hotel is somewher on the way of the airport link - just take it. It's very fast, especially during rush hours faster than a car. And cheaper at the same time. Definatelly we will use it again when in Bangkok.

Cheap and efficient way to get to sukhumvit or Siam. we always stay in sukhumvit and to avoid sitting in a taxi for hours during rush hour we travel from the airport by the rail system, it is cheap and runs regularly
Ok taxis are cheap but as I said this is more to avoid sitting in one for hours which we've done before

Very convinient if you want to go quikly in town. I have used the airport rail Link a few times & must say It is easy, fast & sheap transport to go in town with easy connections to the skytrain & métro. I will use-it again next time. The only small problem do not carry a big luggage.

Take this during traffic hours. Takes about 30 min from the phaya Thai bts connection. Great if you don't want to sit in traffic during peak hours. Can get very busy.
There is a restaurant next to phaya Thai bts that you can see. Decent food but terrible service. I had the pad Thai and it was good, nothing special though.

Clean, cheap and convenient. Easy way to get from the airport, HOWEVER, if you are carrying luggage the lack of escalators to get onto the SKY TRAIN makes life difficult.
We walked down two flights of stairs when we disembarked and hailed a taxi for the rest of the journey.

Easy and cost effective, especially if you don't use the Express. If there are only one or two in your group, this is great value and easy from the Airport. Its much cheaper if you don't take the Express, just fewer stops with Express but its cool and comfortable and not a lot of difference in time.

Where is the Express Train Gone. This just goes from bad to worse, the express originally ran every 30 minutes, then every hour and then not at all. It is normally quicker and easier to get a taxi, I live next door to the Airport link and I don't use it.

Zip in to the city.. Very cheap and efficient way from the airport to the city. Takes you to a good central point and then you can either change to the Skytrain or catch a taxi to your destination. Its quick, which with Bangkok traffic, if a great option.
Super Good. Best mode of transport to get to Bangkok Airport from Sukhumvit Line. I have always preferred this mode during the days as traffic in Bangkok can get very bad sometimes.

Excellent train service every 20 minutes, but, avoid rush hour to airport. When going back to the airport the tarin's can become packed at rush hour so allow extra time to return to the airport. you may not get on the first train that arrives at Makkasan. I recommend you avoid rush hour at rush hour time 4.30 to 6.30pm
fast & cheap. the fastest and cheapest way to get to the airport; with excellent connection to skytrain and metro services.

Its okay but gets busy. Definitely a fast way into Bangkok, better if you dont have a lot of suitcases though, unfortunately the trains are too small and everyone uses them for normal transport so they get packed. but good from the airport and beats getting ripped off by nasty taxi drivers.

Taxi alternative. If you're travelling from Suvarnabhumi Airport in Bangkok into the CBD and you gave a case and it's morning or Kate in the afternoon, grab the Airport Rail Link ( the express) and be in town in 20 minutes. Taxis at those times can be held up in massive traffic hames and can turn a 25 minute trip into an hour or more.

It was too congested and wait time was killing. Its not the dedicated metro to the Airport.It passes through the city and carries most of the city population. After the last city station, the passenger going to Airport to just 10.It is cheap but not very comfortable

Not bad for a single traveller getting out to airport. I sued this rail link and it was pretty good only point of note is that they DONT have exppress link wiht no stops this stopped sometime last year so the rail link into town has arond 6 stops eventually stopping at Phay Thai BTS and then easy too link to Sukhumvit Link etc only takes around 25-30 minutes to get into town from airport for a cost of 45baht pretty good value provided you dont have lots of lugggage

A must on a Friday or Saturday evening. Usually I arrive in Bangkok from Tokyo on the Sunday or Monday evening at midnightAt this time there is no traffic and after over 22 hours of travel from Florida I'm not really in the mood to take a train since a taxi will cost with tip included around 400.- Bath (12.-)But, if you arrive around 5:00pm and specially on a weekend ( as I did last week from Male ) you should take the train, it will be much much faster. The signs are not as clear as the hong kong train and not as clean but it's safe, plenty of trains and cleanish enough. When you arrive in Bangkok you can take the Subway ( get ready to walk a little bit with luggage,after 20 hours it's a little bit much for me ) or you can take a taxi to bring you were you are suppose to go ( that's me ). But again if you have a lot of bags the transfer can be ......challenging !!
convienent. With the airport rail link you can connect along the route and change to BTS or Metro lines. Cut short of time and cheaper than taxi. The train are well kept and clean.

Convenient and Economical way to get to the city from the airport/vice versa. Arriving at Suwarnabhumi Airport and you want to go directly to the city center of Bangkok, the most convenient and economical way is the new Airport Rail Link.
Good and quick way of travel. Its one of the cheapest, fastest and quickest way of reaching to city from airport if you dont have much luggage.

Great way to travel. The airport link is both a great way to get from downtown Bangkok to the airport, it is also an ideal way to travel to the outer areas of Bangkok such as Latkrabang. Big thumbs up. Comfortable, easy, affordable.
Speed to airport. Easy and cheap way to travel to the international airport of Bangkok and not expensive compared to taxi rates
Better option than the bus. This is the better option than riding buses or taxi from airport to downtown area. Cheapest and fast.

Effective service. Good connectivity, although personally I find the interiors a bit cramped especially if you have a bag or two. Plus early mornings the staff seemed a little grouchy towards tourists so make sure you have change and know a little bit of Thai.
Cheap and f. The fastest and absolute cheapest way to get to Bangkok, with connections to the BTS and cheap taxi meters in the city is the way to do it.

Saved lot of time. I took city line from airport which stop at every station at costed me 40Bhat for Makkasan station. I get down at Makkasan and from there a Taxi to Sukhumvit Soi 3 which costed me another 50 Bhat.
