I could have taken train till payathai and from there BTS to NANA but since I was travelling in peak Hours at 7 In evening its not easy to get In BTS at payathai with luggage. That's why i preferred to take taxi from Makkasan

I would definitelly catch the rail link again. Train was clean, affordable and super quick to the city. Would definitely travel this way over a cab! There were protests on during our stay so catching a cab would have taken longer and cost more.

Easy to use to get to the city centre. On the basement floor of Suvarnaphum airport you buy your ticket to , for most people, Makassan station. From there you can take a taxi to your hotel. TIP. Near the entrance of the airport rail link you find a few moneychangers.(superrich / Value Plus).They offer better option in exchange than the official banks

Fast and convenient. Best for schedules download the free App. Low fares, forget taxis!I liked the friendly staff at each stations, dislike that some trains can be pretty jammed ,specially if you have bulky luggage
Accessible and affordable . When we came here at Bangkok it easy for us to reached our hotel in just airport rail way link thru our hotel. Very clean and organized.

Airport Rail Link to Ratchaprarop Station/ Pratunam. I used to take the taxi or ask the hotel to arrange airport transfer to Pratunam. Taking taxi means being caught in the traffic. The airport transfer arrange by hotel means waiting for all passengers to arrive before they would depart from airport. I remembered spending 2 hours just waiting at the airport. But taking the Airport trail link to Pratunam is fast and convenient especially if you stay in hotels that are walking distance from Ratchaprarop station. And there are plenty of hotels to choose from. Also Ratchaprarop station is near to Pratunam Market. And you can transfer from the airport rail link at Phayathai Station for BTS Sukhumvit (Sky Train ) or Phetchaburi station for MRT (blue line).
Convenient. If you are staying in areas like Sukhumvit etc, taking Airport link is good. Taxi takes long time from airport and they charge as per their wish most of the time.

Cheap and Fast. One of the easiest mode of transport from Airport to Downtown.
I could use airport rail link if I happen to touch down BKK during peak hours.
Cheap fare.

Fast and efficent. If you travel light and in a small group, it maybe better to use the airport express to get to town, and transfer to the local train called BTS. As you will not be sure how bad the jam will be once inside the city.

Very good train. Not very convenient connections. The train in itself is very good. The problem is its interface with city internal transportations. It you wnat to transfer to the undergroung or the sky train, you have to exit the station then go to other station. Also it is not a combined ticket.If you are on a budget, by all means use it. If you arrive at traffick peak hours (like Friday afternoon) or at times when there is a long line to get a taxi and you have a small amount of lugagge, by all means, use it.

fast efficient friendly and THE ONLY way to get to Bangkok centre quickly. Only after you been on the train, and then (try) and be driven in BK do you realise how good the train is!Ticket assistants there on hand to help buy the ?20Bhatt 50p?) single tickets.its just works, and works well.

The obvious option. Cheap, clean, fast. You can get the link straight from the basement of the airport and it connects you to the main BTS lines. A good idea to get a travel card if you are staying in Bangkok for any length of time. Why would you get a taxi?
Convenient. The Express line is down, had to go station by station. Got a bit lost looking for where it was located in Suvarnabhumi. Quite convenient though.
Fast, Easy, and Convenient. Just like the title says. This will take you all the way to the Sky Train and you can get any where you want from there.

Great from the Airport to town. maybe I got this wrong but it it is the airport rail link then take it. I usually shy away from taking public transportation the first time I am somewhere new but this one is easy, one stop and the onto the subway and you are in Sukhomvit. If there is traffic, and there always is the train takes 25 minutes, Cab an hour

Can't fault this service. I have used this on numerous occasions and it has always been punctual and accommodating. I will continue to use this service every time I visit Bangkok.

Economic way to get into Bangkok from the Airport, (when not too loaded with luggage!). This is not really an attraction as such, as essentially it's a public transportation system, but maybe a decent ride 'out of town', if looking to fill an hour or two, on a quiet day. Travel in Bangkok from Suvarnabhumi (BKK) airport on the City Line (or return) is fairly straightforward, but is not without its pitfalls for the unwary. The Train Station is located on the lower level of the main terminal building.Whilst inherently simple once familiar with it, I strongly suggest that people do some research online before taking it on. This link might be of help:http://www.transitbangkok.com/lines/Suvarnabhumi%20International%20Airport/Airport%20Link%20City%20Line There are ticket machines, plus manned ticket kiosks. I personally find that the ticket kiosk is often easier and quicker, as queues can build up whilst people come to grips with a new and unfamiliar ticket dispensing machine.A ticket comes in the form of a small coloured disk, that can be tapped onto the barrier mechanism to open the gate, and likewise deposited into a slot at the end of the journey again to open the gate to let you out. There are also wider manually operated gates with station staff to help those people with large suitcases etc. Please be sure to know which station you want to leave the train. There are 8 stations end to end, but if going into central Bangkok you will most likely want: 'Makkasan' if connecting onto the linked MRT(Subway)Station at 'Petchaburi' and the Subway network,OR quite likely going through to the final stop at 'Phaya Thai' if then connecting onto the BTS (Skytrain) network.Regretfully I've heard people asking the ticket clerks 'which stop is closest to ????? Hotel' and this is usually quite beyond the average language understanding, or similarly the hotel location expectation of knowledge of the rail clerks.I think its helpful to understand that the fully elevated line runs to the North of the main city area, rather than through the middle of the city. So know which station you want beforehand. If you are at all unsure, I would strongly suggest that you take a public taxi instead.The train journey takes 30 minutes end to end. The trains themselves are purpose designed for the job they do and each carriage has an empty if non-racked area for cases and luggage. The consensus is that you stay with you baggage, rather than walk away to find a seat elsewhere.At the airport end, there are elevators (lifts) and escalators, to assist in the easy movement of heavy baggage, but be warned, that at many other stations there are precious few elevators, with only stairways as an alternative, so consider how much baggage you have and how heavy it all is, before taking the City Line train option.My final thought is that many Thai people now also use this rail service for their daily commute into the city, so early morning and early evening trains, can be very busy indeed. Please note too, that the consumption of foods and drinks are not allowed whilst travelling on the trains.Similarly, it is considered good manners to allow people off the trains first, through the centre of the doors and then enter the trains via either side of the doors, and not 'jump the queue' by walking through the centre area.NB: centre = center depending on country!! Quick, clean cost-effective and efficient, but please do consider the amount/weight of baggage that you have with you, before deciding to buy a ticket.Enjoy!

Great way of getting around ..,just pay attention . Pay attention when getting on this at the central station in Siam. It's a bit confusing.,quick and efficient when traveling alone. When two or more people probably better to take a taxi.
Excellent service. The easiest and the cheapest way to get connected to the city. A great initiative by the Thais. You can connect to the Metro and the BTS from this link.

Excellent service. Quick and easy access to the main airport. Clean and efficient service from the city to the airport.Be aware that this service is for the New Bangkok airport Suvarnabhumi (BKK) which is located in Racha Thewa in Bang Phli, Samut Prakan, about 25 kilometres (16 mi) east of downtown Bangkok and which services most International flights.However, be aware that it is one of two international airports serving Bangkok. The other Don Muang (DMK) is 25Km (16miles) north of Bangkok that provides mainly internal flights within Thailand but also offers International flights for AirAsia, Malaysia AirAsia, Thai AirAsia and Indonesia AirAsia.Transport to/from Don Mueang Airport is best done by taxi or bus although non-air conditioned trains do run directly to the Bangkok Railway Station at Hua Lamphong. Examples of distances and costs areSuvarnabhumi Airport - 50km – Taxi 45 mins. - 2 hrs THB 400, Bus 1 - 2 hrs. Bus No. 554 & 555 THB 25.Central Bangkok (Siam Area) 23 km Taxi 30 mins. - 1 hr THB 250. Bus No. 29 THB 20.Mo Chit (for connection to BTS & MRT) 14 km Taxi 30 - 45 mins THB 150Hua Lamphong 25 km Taxi 30 mins. - 1 hr. Taxi THB 200
Fast and cheap. 100 m away from Pratunam (my Hotel), running every 15 minutes, fast, no traffic jam, very cheap, no dislike

Clean and cheap. It is realy good way how to get to airport, everything is labeled and there is also staff to help you with buying tickets or get through the turnstiles. The train is fast and offers great views of Bangkok.

Probably the best way to get to the airport!. Cheap, fast and convenient way to get from the airport to the city center. If you're a backpacker I'm sure you'll choose it to get to/from Suvarnabhumi :-)

Economic and secure way to get to the airport. I thought the Airport Rail Link was a great deal! For only 45 bath, it brings you from the centre of Bangkok ( Phaya Thai station) to the airport. Minor downsides: it was very hot on the platform at Phaya Thai, and the train gets very busy in between the departure station and the airport. But for 45 bath, you can't complain.

Fast, conveneint but seats are very slim.. It's a great means of trasnport, if your getting to the airport on time might be hampered by the often crazy Bangkok traffic. It takes 26 minutes from Phaya Thai BTS and only costs 45 Baht o/w. We took it around rush hour, 8.45-9 coming in trains were quite full bopt not so going out. Certainly recommened for single travellers and those that don't want to have to worry about traffic jams...
Really Good,, Try It,,, Safe and Secure,,,. Try to avoid rush hour morning and evening only because crowded but still not awful by any means.. Read the signs….

cheap and fast. stable timetable and get you to airport without traffic jam problemthe fare is much cheaper than taxi which only cost you about 45 baht from city to airport.but most of the BTS stations not with elevator so you may need to carry luggage up and down by your own.hope this would be improve later on...
The way to go!. The train link was busy on our way back to the Airport but the transport was quick, efficient and clean and at c£1 one way, an absolute bargain.

very convenient and practical. its a practical way to get in to the city without any hassle and bargaining with the taxi drivers in Bkk. Just try to come early especially when you are not coming from the first station if your flight is around 10 PM. You wouldn't want to be caught in the crowd during the rush hour and you wont get enough space for your luggage

should not be called airport rail link. it was a nice travel experience last time when the airport express is still operating, u pay more but u reach ariport faster and less crowded.now when its not operating anymore u were left with the normal airport rail link which stops in a few locations..where most of the local utilize the train too..so best advice is not to take it when its peak hour time, it'll be damn crowded with people getting home from office, and believe me..its getting harder with the luggage that we carries, as some of them would rush out or in of the train and bang ur luggage here and there. definitely not a pleasant experience...holding ur luggage in one hand and trying to find something to grab on to keep your balance.

Good way to avoid traffics. It's faster to use airport link when there are a lot of traffics in Bangkok. At almost all time, there are traffic jams!But if you have many big luggages and travelling with many people, it's better to use Thai taxi.Cost of Airport Link isn't cheap and some station you need to do a lot of walking to reach the main road.If you want to use Taxi from Airport, please contact the airport where to get taxi because some taxi driver may rip you off.

Connects Suvarnabhumi to downtown within a breeze. - Heavy-luggage travellers: special lane and elevator are available for you at every Airport Rail Link station.- Affordable price for such distance that will take you 1000baht or so if you choose to travel by taxi.

Brilliant service. ALWAYS use this service when we are in BKK. Fast, efficient and CHEAP!!! Why bother with BKK traffic jams and often unreliable taxi drivers when this service gets you from Suvarnabhumi Airport to the middle of town in under 20 minutes. The ONLY down side is the frequency, miss one and you wait 30 minutes for the next one.

Easy. Easy to use, fast and efficient. No complaints whatsoever in this service. The cheapest way into bangkok and puts you right on the BTS line to get you wherever you need to get to next. Runs until just after midnight.

Great if you are solo traveller. Excellent service and punctuality. Not crowded except in mornings, when some school kids get onto the train in some stations. Adequate space for baggageIf solo traveller, best way to get into town: economical and fast. If more than 2 are travelling, taxi is cheaper.
Convenient way to and fro airport. Nice and convenient way to travel to and fro airport. The train is quite comfotable and the route covers through major parts of city.

easy and fast .. If hotel is near station , better than take a taxi . Only the platform is too hot . Easy for interchange with sky train or under underground . But underground need to walk about 8 mins.

Avoid traffic jam and save money. Similar to sky train but deserving New airport. This is a great, fast, cheap way to get to airport if you do not have too much luggages. If you travel alone or in couple, you also save a few hundreds BAHTS compared with taxi while saving substantial amount of time at rush hours. A bit complicated for full family trip with young children or if you are loaded with large bagages. It is my understanding that the express line has been put out of service probably for the same reason it was express, lol(not deserving enough stations to make it profitable??).

Cheap access to airport.. Easily accessible via taxi, Skytrain or subway, this is a GREAT way to get to the airport, if you are not traveling with more than one suitcase. Inexpensive, clean, and quick. Has to be the best deal in Bangkok, or at least second best after a traditional Thai Massage...

City to Airport..fast and cheap. best commute from airport from the city.. starts from 6am till midnight an fare not at all expensive compared to taxi..terminating at Paya Thai u get metro connectivity from there to other parts of the city

Rapid and economical way to Suvarnabhumi Airport. I recently used Airport Rail Link from Phaya Thai Terminal to Suvarnabhumi Airport. The fare is cheaper comparing to taking a taxi all the way through. In stead of approx. Baht 300, I paid Baht 55+45 (taxi from home to Phaya Thai Terminal plus rail link fare). It's only one third of what I normally spent!!! Another advantageous point was the shortened travel time from around 1 hour to half an hour. It's great!

Perfect for getting into the city. I only had 6 hours to have very brief look around the city , but I was advised not to get a taxi but to get the city train into town .Good air com in the train carriages it only cost 45 bh for the trip , at each station the people are lined up to get on and off the train unlike the multi people scrum we have in the UK.Great service , quick , the best way to travel.
No Express Service. This was a great help for getting to and from the city. Very reasonable price, although when I visited, the express service wasn't running so the train became quite busy.
very good. We liked this mode of transport ,once you get the hang of it ,the whole net work is easy to use and very cost effective. Good find,

An efficient way to get into Central Bangkok.. Goes from Bangkok Airport (Basement level) to Phayathai station where you can link with the Skytrain system. 25 minute journey for less than £1 !! The link is only two years old so very modern and efficient.

great way to great around. great way to get from the airport to downtown, i think it was 45 mins or so from airport to downtown, and they use to have a express train to down town. many great stops all along the way. train get crowded during the moring and rush hour in the evening. trains are very clean and pretty fast.

Beat the traffic, the cost, the JAM. Thanks to tripadvisor, we discovered the best way to go from airport to town. We arrived at around 6pm, midst of rush hour traffic. Direction to rail is clear. Cost THB 90 and 30 min from airport to Phayathai station. The waiting time could be 15 min. But still better than stuck in a parking lot called the highway and pay THB450 for a taxi. The only downside is if you have lots or big luggage, there is only stairs and no escalator or elevators up and down the station so could be challenging. The link to BTS at Phayathai is a 3 min walk. Great great great.

Easiest way to the City. It's my favorite ways to get into town asI usually stay in hotels near the train stations. Taking the normal on is enough as we don't really needs th Express Link as it osts3times ore and on10 min difference.. But then to each its own.

City Line!. Really good mode of transport from Airport! My hotel was in Sukhumvit Soi 4, Nana Station on BTS Line, So went to Airport CITY LINE Station below SuvarnaBhumi to PhayaThai Station. From PhayaThai there is BTS to Nana! Loved it and would highly recommend it. Paid 50Baht to Phayathai (Non-ExpressFare I Think) and another 20-30 Baht to Nana on BTS.

save a bundle of money. this is the easiest way to get to the airport--and most cost effective.
the train is clean and it is fascinating to check out the people, and the stops along the way.
Quick !. Straight out of the airport .Very fast .Very clean and on time .Always busy and safe too .Watch the locals on their phones !

very efficient. Part of the problem with travelling around Bangkok is the traffic and a lack of an integrated transport system. The Sky train and the airport link are fast and efficient although crowed at peak timesYou will pay 48 baht to travel by the train from the airport with most travellers coming to the end of the line at Phaya Thai and changing to the skytrain or a taxi from thereThe system is easy to navigate and most employees speak at least some English degree and are happy to helpThere is no rail link that takes you to the Grand Palace area where a number of sites are located that you will want to visit. The big issue here then is that of unmetered taxis with taxi drivers wanting to potential customers to pay way over the cost of a metered fareExpect to pay 500 baht for a taxi from the airport to Sukhumvit

Very useful system. This is a very effective and cheap system. My only caveat is that, depending on the number of people going, and where you are heading (or heading out of) in Bangkok, it can be more cost-effective to take a taxi. From most places near Sukhumvit, you can get a taxi to Suvarnabhumi Airport for a total of under 400B including tolls, and depending on the time of day the taxi trip can be under 30 minutes. Taking a taxi relieves you of the need to do the hiking with luggage that you have to do to get to the Link from the BTS or MRT systems.

Same Same. Not enough carriages so most people need to stand for the whole trip in both directions. Escalators that have stairs leading to them makes so much sense when the main users would have a large and heavy suit case. Elevator was also out of action at the first station when coming back to the airport.

Quick & Convenient. Quick, cheap, comfy & convenient. As BKK is located outside the city, the airport link is the best way to get there from the city. It is well connected to all BTS stations. Of course, having less luggage makes the travel more enjoyable.

easy and very convinient. It is a very easy and fast way of reaching to Bangkok from airport. get a ticket from ticket machine for 40 baht per person and in half hour you are in the city. Just plan to get off in a station which is convinient to your adress.

Fast, cheap and easy. Beware the taxis after. We used this after our flight from the USA. It got us downtown very quickly from where we hailed a taxi. It was fast and cheap. The only problem we could find was that it was not more extensive, or link to the other rail lines.Also beware of taxis waiting outside the station for tourists, our driver took us on a big S to our hotel and charged us at least double, instead hail a taxi or tuk tuk from the road.
Rail airport link. great service. Cost less than $2 to get right into the City. You just need to be sure that you know which station to get off at!!

Cheap travel...but. This is a good way to get from the airport to Bangkok city centre. Compared to English public transport it's incredibly cheap (one person can travel into the centre for about £1) and easy to transfer between trains if you're used to travelling on similar city transport systems. My issue with operation is that it's not particularly fast and trains do not run as frequently as they could. Trains were often very busy due to the gap between services. When you're used to London Underground services running every couple of minutes this service comes across as restricted...but great value for money.

Good if you are in the vicinity of rail link. Rail link is a good concept, and it provides a 15 minute fast access to SubarnBhumi airport.The waiting time is max 15 minutes.Little deserted area, so please take reliable taxi drop here
Great. The Airport Rail Link is great if you live close to it's stations (which I do). Otherwise go for a cab.

Easy travel. When you arrive in Bangkok and get through immigration, the rail travel signs are easy to see and follow. Once in the station, a map shows the stations and how much is the fair. Use either a ticket machine or go to the ticket window for token purchase. The trains are very clean and very frequent. It's just as easy to reverse the journey using a combo of MRT/BTS when you are ready to leave.

Good when running. We found this service to be quite good, although the express service was suspended when we were there. We used the local train which follows the same path as the express, but stops at each station. Connects well with the Skytrain. The being searched at each station you enter can be annoying.

Easy to transfer into the city. We were able to transfer easily from the airport through to the Central Railway Station (Hua Lamphong Station). It takes around 40 minutes but at least you know that you won't get stuck in Bangkok peak hour traffic. We arrived at the airport at 1725, with around an hour to clear customs and were departing on an overnight train from Hua Lamphong at 2000, which we made in plenty of time. We did transfer at Makksaan to the MRT in order to complete this trip, but again everyone was so helpful with one of the Security guards actually walking us through to the platform so that we didn't go astray.
Best way how to go to international airport. Is the best way how to go move from/to internation airport, 45 BHT and you go from Suvarnabhumi Airport till Phaya Thai that is directly connect to BTS.

Forget taxis. I used the Airport Rail Link for the first time when I visited Bangkok in March 2015. Fast, clean, cheap and convenient. What more can you ask for?Get the map at the airport, get the Airport Link to the nearest connecting station on the Underground, Skytrain or whatever and save yourself time, trouble an hassle.Thank you Bangkok!
poor management. this is operated by RAilway Thailand which is inferior to BTS system in Bangkok, needs upgrade and improvements
Cost effective. Great way to get to and from the airport unless it is rush hour or you have a lot of luggage. Then take a cab. Meter cab is about 300 tbt plus 75 tbt toll or about 12 bucks.

The best way to get to the Suvarnabhumi Airport :). From the MRT underneath the main Hua Lamphong train station, it's just seven stations to the Phetchaburi station, then walk about ten minutes to outside and along the overhead connecting ramp to the rail link station bound for the Suvarnabhumi Airport, then just take the City Line train to the airport which stops at like five stations along the way and takes about a half hour (there's supposedly an Express Line too which goes straight to the Airport without stopping at any station along the way but which costs more and will make a difference of only about 15 minutes compared to the regular City Line). So, it cost me a total of only about 60 or 70 baht (about 30 baht for the MRT from Hua Lamphong to Phetchaburi, then another 30 or 35 baht from the link station right beside Phetchaburi to the Airport with the rail link,) compared to hundreds of bhat that would have cost me if I had instead gone by cab or tuk-tuk! The time it takes will also be just about an hour from the time you get on the MRT at Hua Lamphong (about 15 minutes to Phetchaburi, then about 10 minutes to get to the rail link platform and buy a ticket, then about a half hour to the Airport itself).But, keep in mind that this airport rail link is only for the Suvarnabhumi Airport to the east of Bangkok, and NOT for the Don Mueang Airport in the north, to which the best way will be to take the train from the main Hua Lamphong station for about 45 minutes to an hour for just about 15 or 20 baht.
easy. The link runs all day , very cheap and clean and safe , made it so easy to access the city and avoid the traffic .

Convenient.. I arrived in Bangkok from Krabi at around 8pm, and I was carrying a 30kg luggage and a backpack. I wanted to save money, so instead of getting a taxi, I chose to take this; after a day of walking, standing and sitting, at least I didn't have to worry about traffic jams or giving directions for a guesthouse to a driver. Good thing that where I was going to stay at (I'm so lucky that I had a friend waiting) was right by one of the BTS main stops (Asok), so I could just take the airport link to the end, and hop on the BTS at that stop all the way to Asok. Additionally, the staff are quite helpful and really friendly.Easy peasy. (P.S. I also like trains, and since they made it so simple yet efficient here, that's always a plus for me!)

fastest way to reach the airport. Saves a lot of time in traffic. excellent transport to reach the airport. Takes only 25 minutes to reach the airport whereas the taxi can take more than one hour also depending on the traffic
cheap and efficient. easy, cheap and fast, no traffic jams to contend with. staff and general public are friendly and very helpful

Good way to get to the airport. Bangkok is always crowded and it may take like forever if you catch a cab. This train is not so fast but it comes and goes on time, cheap, clean, and you don't have to worry about traffic jams at all.

10 Day trip to Thailand to visit former students and experience the demonstrations during January 2014. Trip to airport on last day of our travels in Thailand were unique and circumstantial. All was good. Rushed as it is just 20 minutes from airport. NOTE: Visited January 2014

Easy & affordable. Finding the railway at the airport is easy. Lots of signs and when you enter the rail area they also have an information desk that can guide you to the area you are going. All stops are announced in English too!I will defenately use the rail again.

Easiest way to access central BKK from the airport. If you're not travelling with infants and have only one or two suitcases, strongly recommend taking the Airport Link instead of a taxi to Suvarnabhumi Airport. You'll avoid the traffic jams and will reach the airport within 30 minutes.

Great Way into City. Cheap and good way to get from airport into heart of Bangkok. This is so easy to find at the airport and use it is not worth paying the extra for a taxi. Plenty of space to take suitcases and all ticket machines work in English as well as Thai. Approx £1 for a person to get from airport to Bangkok, and from there easy access to Underground or Skytrain.

great for tourists. I used this from the airport to the city then changed to the BTS to get to my hotel.This is good value for money, clean, very clear on what stations it is passing and where you need to get offwould absolutely use this airport link again
take for ever. The train doesn't come as often as BTS. It's also very crowded during rush hour. Not only traveller use them. A lot of Thais use it as a daily transportation as well.
Wonderful way to reach Airport on time!. Normally Bkk traffic is very bad during Weekdays and the best way to reach Airport on time is to use Airport Link.Always on time and very good service.

Sure beats the traffic. The rail link is an inexpensive and convenient way to get to the Suvarnabhumi airport. Interestingly, from where I was staying the rail link is just as quick as a taxi. While perhaps using the metro is slightly more of a hassle when transporting luggage, taxis are small and often cannot accommodate much more than two large bags.

Quick and efficient. We utilized the rail link to our hotel on Sukhumvit Road (Park Plaza), It may take a few minutes for newbies to figure out all the transfers, but there are information booths that will gladly help get you on the right track.

The best way from/to airport. Operates between 0600-0000 hrs from Suvarnabhumi Airport to Asoke via Makassan i.e. starts from east of bangkok (suvarnbhumi airport) to the centre of town and should be every travellers ntural choice coz of the convenience.My advice chuck the Taxi and take the Airport Rail Link..have fun
Fantastic!. Wow, how had we coped before this was built?! So easy to use from start to finish and really cheap. I will never again use a taxi from the airport!
Fast way to city. Really good way from airport to city or otherway around,much cheeper and faster than those greedy bangkok taxidrivers.Good links to MTR and BTS.
Convenient. It is a very convenient way of transportation if you are coming in and out of bangkok, very economical and efficient.

Kickass!!!. Travel from the Airport to anywhere in the main city for a really low cost by the Airport Rail Link. Reading the maps is super fun and figure out your way around the city. Make sure to travel with bags that have rollers coz its easier to get in and out of the train. Not very crowded, Super clean and Super efficient !!! Would recommend this to anyone on a budget trip.

Modern service. Good, clean, European standard trains. This is by far the best means of transport to and from the airport. The only irritation is the long walk from the city terminal to the local BTS station. Surely, given that many people will be trailing/carrying baggage, escalators could have been used for parts of the journey. Watching people struggling with large cases I couldn't help but wonder.Far better than taking a taxi. Cheaper, cleaner and quicker.

Sooo Easy. If nothing else...Bangkok has a brilliant Skytrain and rail system. No matter what, when you catch the trains in Bangkok, you get up close to everyone (they are more than packed). Having said that, I still wouldn't use any other form of transport here if the rail system was available. Great value.

An alternative way to Suwannaphum airport. The rail link will get you reasonably close to the airport at a very economical price. But if you have luggage, it may not be your best choice. Long walk to the terminal on both ends. On the other hand, the taxi service at the airport is terrible these days.

Convinient to travel to BKK city. When you want to travel to BKK / Airport its the fastest way to travel. This train is also know as BTS. Runs from 0600 - midnight. Most economic way to travel to Airport.
Very convenient. a convenient and inexpensive way to travel from the airport. Not expensive, and much better than dealing with rude taxi drivers!

affordable and efficient. best way to go to and from airport to the downtown of Bangkok, you will avoiding Bangkok traffic jam and it took only 20 minutes best way comparing taxi and other transportation method
Great cheap way to get from airport to city.. Great cheap way to get from airport to city. I cant remember how much but a few dollars Australian. Excellent value.

Best Airport commute ever. This train connects directly with the BTS system. Instead of paying $15 - $20 for a long taxi ride in traffic, you can ride the airport link and BTS for about $4 and get there quicker

Really Easy. It's nice that this link is now available and I think it's so much easier than a taxi (and takes less time too). I took it in both directions this trip to Bangkok and it couldn't have been easier.
nice one. I always love the airport link there. its clean, easy to access and use :-) the direction is pretty clear for me. that's what traveler need

Pack Light. Easy and convenient way to get into bangkok from the airport, only draw back is the stairs you need to negotiate especially once you cross over to the sky train and get to your final station. Pack light or have a strong back and you will save some baht.

Getting around fast and with no stress. An amazing affordable service that spares you the annoying traffic jams. If I did not look around me and see so many Thai's I would think I was somewhere in Europe! Very clean and well maintained shuttle service with clear English announcements. People respect queues and will offer seats to those in need.
cheap. A fast way to get to the airport , and very fast and efficient , trains run every few minutes , vey clean and cheap.

Best way into Bangkok. If the traffic is bad it can take easily take over an hour into Bangkok.
Take the airport link to the stop nearest to your hotel, then a taxi from there.
A little bit cheaper and sitting in traffic jam after traffic jam drives me crazy.

You get there but take the time. The Airport Link (stop train) works ok but because the City Express (non stop) is out of service the train is full all the time and not handy if one has baggage. One has to change over at Phaya Thai station to get on to the Sukhumvit and later Silom line at Siam if one is heading that way. Take the time using this service, not recommendable with the Express Service in the sick booth.

Great Service and Value. One of the best and cheapest airport link train in SEA. Overall great. I took the train from Suvarnabhumi and stopped at Phaya Thai, and enjoyed my ride all along... Directions are clear both in Thai and English, and train is clean...

Easy alternative to get from the airport to the city. Pro- Not depending on traffic- 2 lines - normal and express (which only stops at certain stations)- no hassle with taxi drivers (fare, smelly car, loud radio etc.) etc.Con- Timing unreliable (on certain days, express trains have no commuted at all etc.) - Hence, on way TO THE AIRPORT - only use if enough time at hand- Getting from station to your final destination can be a bit cumbersome on a hot day with lots of luggage (getting MRT from Makkasan is easy)Bottom line: I use the airport link anytime I can just for the peace of mind. However, getting TO THE AIRPORT, I still rely on taxis quite frequently...

Fast and Convenient Transportation. The airport rail link is a cheap and convenient way to travel between Suvarnabhumi Airport and downtown. The express line has not been in operation for a while, but the regular Cityline will get you downtown to Phaya Thai Station in 30 minutes for just 45 Baht.If you are traveling with heavy bags I'd recommend getting on at the back of the train at the airport. Getting off at Phaya Thai you will be close to the elevator and won't have to deal with the stairs. There is an elevator at each level if you don't want to haul bags down the stairs. You might have to look around to find them though. They are not well marked. When transferring to the BTS make sure you enter the gate where the escalators are located if you want to avoid the stairs again.
Do not take a cab to the airport. Take the train, it is the only way to get to the airport and not miss your flight. The cabs can't skip all the Bangkok traffic, but the train can!

PLan for this and you will save money and time. I tried this and it was great, saved money and time, if you come in to Bangkok though at some strange hour like 2 AM its closed anyway, but it only saves you time and money when rush hour is on in the morning or afternoon.
Connections. Stairs and stairs,when it runs.Full work just to get in and out with bags.At the Bangkok end there is a climb to connect to the city's Skytrain.

The Way to Beat Bangkok traffic. The Link takes all the hassle out of having to get to Suvarnabhumi International Airport. You miss all the traffic and arrive at the station with no hassle. The journey will take no more than 30 minutes and is stress free. You arrive under the terminal itself. Also the link between the Airport Rail Link and the Skytrain and Underground is simple and easy to use.

Check for scheduled maintenance before you leave. It's hardly an inconvenience, if you have arrived in Bangkok from afar, to spend an extra 30m on the normal skytrain as opposed to the express. We had planned on using the rail link express but it wasn't working during our visit. If it's really important to you to get down town fast then grab a taxi - 400THB to Silom Square as at November 2014.

BARGAIN. This system works and works well, not only that but it also houses the best money exchange facility just by the booths where you buy your tokens. We travelled from BKK airport to the end of the line with a full complement of luggage nada it was a breeze, for not much money. If you head downstairs from arrivals you will see the signs for the train link, City Link. The passengers wait patiently and guards clear the train before signalling you to board. NB there is a ticket booth who understood my English. At the terminus there were steps and lifts to street level where you can get a taxi, which is a whole other story. The money exchange is Superrich a better rate than the banks in the airport.
30min to pratunam. yeap just like the title... we were on backpacks and it didnt trouble much at alll.... just too good... feels just right travelling at home with we were on ARL

cheap reliable easy. The best way to get into Bangkok quickly. On arriving at the airport keep going down until you to the railway, just follow the signs. Trains are every 5 minutes, it's only about 25 bht to Makasan station a .midpoint link in the network for local trains through Bangkok. Buy a token you need it to open the turnstile , swipe on entry put in slot when leaving. Trains are clean, fast (20 minutes to city) and stations are announced in English and shown on the flat screen monitors in each carriage.

Good way to travel from the airport. Despite visiting BKK so many times, I have not use this mode of transport. The reason is I usually travel with friends or family to BKK.Once you reach Suvarnabhumi Airport, go all the way down to the basement. Just look for the sign to direct you there. It is real easy to find.The entrance of the train station in the airport is very wide and look up for the signs. You can’t miss it.You will need to purchase a ticket. At the time of my arrival in BKK, the Express Line is not operational and only the City Line is running. I heard that they have some spare parts issue on the Express Line.The fare to Makassan is THB35. Just queue up at the vending machine so remember to have some Thai Baht with you by then.There is also a staff that will help some “lost sheep” to navigate the vending machine.You will get a yellow token to use to enter the station.The ARL is actually quite heavily utilised. It is good that the government is willing to build this rail line to ease the public transport congestion in the airport.The ride is smooth and I think I only took 20mins to reach Makassan station.Once you reach Makassan station, many passengers will walk to Petchaburi MRT station. When the ARL is just built, passengers will need to drag their luggage across the road to reach the MRT station.With the linkway bridge built, this got a little easier and safer.I then took the MRT to Asok station and walk to my hotel in Sukhumvit Soi 9.ARL will be good if your hotel is near to MRT/BTS station, you do not have many luggage and you have 3 person or more.A taxi ride from the airport to BKK central usually cost about THB400 or less and it is a door to door service but you will need to walk with your luggage using the ARL.

Easy way to get to the airport at an inexpensive cost. Our luggage was lost and we had to go back to the airport to retrieve it since the airline would not deliver to our hotel. It was very easy to follow the airport link from the Skytrain. Inexpensive. It took approximately 30 minutes or so from central Bangkok and it drops you off right in the middle of the airport. For those who do not want to spend 400-500 Baht on a taxi, I would definitely recommend.
Cheap way to travel to/from the airport. Cheap, clean and convienient alternative to a taxi to travel to/from the airport ! Connection to other public transport.

Train from the airport. Easy to use, staff there to help in using the ticket machine which gives you a coin like token to use on the gates, easy. About 25 mins to the city (end of the line) and at least two stations connect with the BTR above ground railway.I wish other city airport trains were as cheap (less that AU$2 one way!)Not real easy to manage suitcases although, particularly in the morning rush hour. One the other hand if you take a taxi the rush hour is very slow traffic. So, the train is probably the better of two evils. Our of rush hour I would always take the train.

Cheap and Fast. You don't need to take a taxi for Suvarnabhumi Airport. Only 45 Baht. If you prefer express train, less than 30 minutes.We took a taxi from Sathon to Phayathai and paid 150 Baht.Other link options:Subway Link:Phetchaburi station for MRT (subway) Blue lineSky Train:Phayathai Station for BTS Sukhumvit line.

Easier to use Cash to buy tickets. Having this is like godsend cos it connects the airport and the city without the need to experience the traffic jams of Bangkok ( I assure all that you rather not try)The biggest problem is the long queues to buy a ticket at the airport station then the self serve machines don't take foreign credit cards. So for a fast way to get the ticket is use cash at the self serve machines that are usually empty of queues.

Cheap and Quick. Discovered it on this trip and thoroughly enjoyed the trip. One thing though, if you need to connect with the BTS, at some point, you'll have to climb down some stairs and having to carry a heavy suitcase if not easy. Perhaps BTS could consider this and improve some of its stations to consider tourists or locals carrying heavy parcels.

Nice access to the airport. If you are looking for a direct route - link to the airport - and if you are travelling light ( carry on in specific) this is the way to go. We have even take golf clubs along which still is quite convenient. The pricing is not bad - the train is clean and still quite new. Worth giving a try at least once to truly be able to make a comparison to other modes of transportation.

Fantastic and cheap. We've been using the ARL since its connection and highly recommend this to be the only way to travel from and to the Airport. It cost us 70 bht yesterday for 2 tickets to the airport from Makasan and less than 30 min.There is connections to BTS /MRT via Makasan and PhayThai. You can even download the app for these to make your travels easier.
Cheap transport to airport. Very good transport by train, you can get from centrer to airport for 30 minutes. It costs just 45 BTH.

Excellent service to Reach Bangkok city. Most cost-effective and time-saving way to reach Bangkok city from Suvarnabhumi Airport.It took around 35 baht from airport to Makassan on the city line. Expressline was out of service .Simply the best commuting experience inn Bangkok.

Quick, reasonably priced way to get into town. You cannot use a credit card to buy a ticket, or even better a reloadable pass for the train and the skytrain, and buses. So stop at an ATM and get some Bahts first. All of them are going to charge you a fee of 180 baht, which is more than $5 US, so maybe get more cash than you otherwise might, to keep from paying that fee over and over.Just stay on to the end, and it drops you off at the Phaya Thai station where you can change to the SkyTrain.

Don't get a taxi, use the Rail Link! . Don't forget, please give a 'helpful vote' if this helped you! This was our first time traveling to Bangkok and as we went to Phuket, we ended up with four trips to and from the airport. In a taxi this can take anywhere from an hour to two hours, sat in traffic, hot, sweaty and considerably less well off when you arrive due to the base rate of this journey being 500 bht. When returning we used the Airport rail link and would always use this in future. It's so easy, you can get to it from all over the city, and it's only one line so no confusion. Plus at 45 bht, it was cheaper AND we got there in less time. Plus it's air conditioned and there is plenty of room for bags. Would highly recommend. Just ensure you find out what station is nearest to your hotel the first time you arrive.
Express rail link - Was out of service. The airport rail link is currently out off service, therefore, we were forced to use the BTS which can get very crowded during peak hours.

Very comfortable. if you have took a Baiyok sky - take a airport rail link
Dislike just one moment - it is approx 400 meters to the hotel ;)

Disgusted!. I was totally disgusted with this service. Treated literally like cattle, the moment the train came into the station, it was like we had 10 seconds to get on and off before the platform staff blew their whistles and we were pushed and shoved in like animals! Apart from that, it's a good link to have to the centre of Bangkok, just extremely badly treated as customers. I cannot for the life of me understand why the rush!

If you are young and your budget is small. If you are young and after a 10 houre flight you arte still up heaving your bags to the rail link then you are doing the right thing. Clean, quick and very affordable.If however you are the kind of person who wants to get into a taxi and end up right ibfront of your hotel for less than 400Baht for a 45 minutes trip from the airport to the major hotels then you are unlikely to use the rail link.

safest and fastest. the best thing happen to Bangkok transportation - its best for travelers to reach the city - escaping the taxi scams, traffic snarls and GPS confusionconnected to intracity SKy train or MRT at key locations - this takes less than an hour to reach any major location within Bangkok. great for female travelers , new comers and family -- so therefore everybody

Efficient & Economical. Easy and quick way to get to Downtown without the jams. Flight arrived at 5 pm and was at hotel in about 45 minutes. Would have taken longer if I had gone my usual route by taxi and cost 5 times more.
very efficient.. It was easy, cheap and direct. Much cheaper than a taxi. Fast transport, and no traffic jams. I only had one suitcase, and lots of time, so not a problem.

Tops. On arrival in Bangkok, I ventured to the rail system from the airport to the city, I usually take the taxi option instead, I was suprised the fare was very very good, but you need to expect that the train can fill up quickly and some passengers have no patience, just be careful.The trip itself was quick, you will require to make a change of stations but this is not a major hassle, don't have to much luggage or heavy luggage as you will be the one who will need to carry it up and down the stairs .I will only travel this way from now on.

Very nice, takes only 20 minutes. Get down at BTS Phayathai, take Airport rail link (45 baht) & reach airport in 20 minutes. comfortable, fast, cheap what else you need. servive every 15-18 minutes (NO service between 00:00 - 06:00)
Fast, efficient and cost economy. It was about $50 one-way to the city - Cost effectiveEfficient - experienced no traffic congestionFast - no traffic james

Convenient and cheap!. Never knew it could be so quick and easy to get from A to B especially while in another country. If you're a new traveller and a little shy and intimidated about haggling for a ride this is perfect! For 40 baht per person it took us from the airport to where the main shopping malls are (MBK, Siam Paragon, Festival Central, etc) in about 15 minutes. This is the second last stop on the line, whole thing takes about 20 minutes. Depending on the time of day the Skytrain can get quite crowded but what isn't in Thailand!

QUICK &EASY. i had to meet friends at the airport, so i needed to take the airport rail link.in each direction. So from Pathay Thai to airport cost 90 BAHT each way . Just get on, get off so easy and simple and time efficient .

Great if you need to be quick at the airport. This is some Skytrain too with a big part in the sky and a little part under the ground and is the quickest way to travel to the airport. the full track will bring you to the airport in less as 20 minutes.
The only way to get to & from the airport. Beats a taxi hands down. Quick, efficient, convenient, air conditioned and cheap. Station inside the airport terminal and station in the middle of town

Airport Rail - the only way to travel from the airport to the city. It is so cheap at approximately $2.50 one way, clean and quick. It only opened a couple of years ago, in December 2011 I think, and takes about 20 mins to travel to and from the airport instead of an hour in a taxi ($6) due to the heavy traffic. Even if you get the train for part of the journey, then a taxi, it is worth it especially after a long and tiring plane trip.

Brilliant train service. Incredibly helpful staff for first time travellers. Very easy to navigate. New train carriages, inexpensive, frequent, clean, air conditioned. The platform at the airport station is also air conditioned.

Great option to get from airport. If you are heading downtown get the express, its much quicker. The train is safe, quick and a fun adventure. Its very reasonable, though cabs this year were only about $10-15 dollars from BKK. The train is faster, but consider getting from the station to where you are heading.

Covenient. This airport link has been open for a couple of years now. It's the best way to travel from the city to the airport as there are no worries about the traffic jams. The fare costs approx £2 per person each way and the distance is approx 20km. Seating is a bit limited, but there is plenty of room for luggage.

Cheap ride into the city . 45 baht to the last station Phaya Thai, about 30 minute ride. I prefer this over a taxi ride any day. The ticket you get is a yellow coin that you scan and at the end you insert it before exiting the gate, pretty neat.

Convenient, quick and cheap access the airport. Use it over taxis during rush hour for a quicker way to get to the airport. Connects to the BTS line and taxis can take you to one of the Rail Link stop instead of driving you to the airport in case of traffic (a common occurrence).

Connecting BTS and Suvarnabhumi. Airport rail link is very much useful, It is from Phaya thai to Suvarnabhumi. From Phaya thai BTS we can move to other pasts of city such as siam, sukhumvit etc.
Lookforward for next ARL to connect Don muang airport as well. :-)

fast!. This flyover requires a 70baht toll but its takes us less than 30mins in total to reach the DMK airport from Pratunam area! (no more terrible traffic jams that need 3 hours from city centre to airport like before)

Cheap and efficient. The Airport Link is excellent here and super affordable!
It's easy to get to the airport (Suvarnabhumi only) and very quick and efficient. I was thoroughly impressed with the train system here.

express not working. since dec. 2014 the airport express raillink is not working, no sign, nothing! and this in a city like bangkok.
one has to take the publik raillink, which takes 45 min. to the city and is mostly crowded.
the express train took 15min. only to phya thai station in the center.

Simple.. We had a twelve hour stopover in Bangkok having arrived from Krabi in the morning. We decided to take the ARL downtown. The station is simple to navigate to in the basement of the terminal - just go down. All instructions for the ticket machines are in English, or use the counter service. There are ARL staff at every point you may make a mistake, or require assistance. It is a simple token system,choose one of seven stations insert money and receive token, the rest is simple. The fast service was off on the day we travelled so had to use the 30 minute service to Phaya Thai station (45bht). This was the nearest for the Khao San Road (40 minuets onward by taxi). Clean air conditioned train.

Easy to access from City Centre and fast!. Bangkok is a huge city; the airport rail really makes a difference in getting to town or to airport. From city Centre it's about a half an hour ride to Airport Terminal and it cost about 35 Thai Baht which is cheap for an airport ride, compared to other town's world wide. Don't take the Taxi, take the airport express train, it's fast, cheap and easy to access with Elevators to Tracks(in case you'd have many suitcases). Clean trains too, with view over Bangkok as they are build like Skytrain above the streets
Cheap to travel from Airport to City. Starts from 6AM to 12 midnight. Good for airport transfers. 40-50 THB to the city.....................

excelent if your near the stations. I would recomend using the airport rail link if your hotel is near the BtS stations or subway, but if you are late for a flight, dont even think of it unless there is an accident on the highway.

So Quiet & Plush. Disliked nothing. Get the little gold coin that you swipe and then drop into dispenser at the end of your ride. Super comfy seats and an interesting view of the city. I rode at 6:30 am so the train was very empty and peaceful until we got closer to the city.

best economy way to get from and to the airport. This is the best economic way to get from and to the airport if travel light (not really good for big suitcases). The ticket costs around 150th and the trip takes around 20 min. There are many signs so it is easy to use.

Good transportation between airport and city. For Bangkok, Useing Airport rail link is the best way and save money and tme for going to heart of city. Suggestion is staying near airport rail link station as Pratunam because from here you can walk from station, walking around varieties of shopping centre and local restaurant or take many bus to famous places of bangkok. Important is there are many level hotel from budget to top !.
Easy travel.. The airport rail link is fast and efficient and extremely cheap. Straight into the City Centre and good connections to the BTS system. Much better and a lot cheaper than a taxi.

Great way to get to BKK. I remember not so many years ago paying a taxi driver an exorbitant amount to battle Bangkok's infamous traffic jams to get to the airport. Now, it's a simple matter of paying 45 baht and traveling half an hour in a comfortable, air-conditioned train and there you are. It will be great as they expand their subway lines to cover all of Bangkok - it really has made a huge difference in ease of travel.

No need for a taxi. the Sky train has a direct link to the rail link to the airport. Just get the sky train to Phaya Thai station (N2) and then change to the direct rail link to Suvambhumi international airport. No traffic jams and a lovely relaxed, clean and safe journey direct into the airport for less than £1 Stirling. Just try it.

What a shame they canceled the express train!. What a shame they canceled the express line train, from Airport to town a non stop line before took you in 25min downtown.Now we take the normal line with stop overs and it take 38 min above..Otherwise its a easy way transportation from Suvanabhumi International Bangkok Airport.

Quick, Cheap and Efficient. Although the fast, non stop service from Suvarnabhumi airport to Bangkok no longer runs this "stopping" commuter train is still great for the average traveler taking just 30 minutes and costing 45 baht one way. Purchase a token at the machine or from cashier. Place it on the touch pad at the entrance barriers (like the oyster card at the London Underground) and you will be let in. At the end of your journey drop the token in the slot at the exit barriers and you will be let out. The trains are fiercely air conditioned and can get quite crowded meaning you may have to stand for your entire journey. Access is easy at the airport through lifts and ramps. At Phaya Thai (for the BTS Skytrain) there are escalators and lifts too. Makkasan station for access to the MRT (underground).Families and those with lots of luggage may find it to be cheaper or more convenient using a taxi.Trains are reliable and run frequently between 06.00 and midnight.
general. very effficient. If you are a light traveler, you must take this service as it is very cheap and fast, clean etc.

Perfect to go to the city or back to airport. It's cheap and convenient. I recommend this transport when you arrive or when you go back. Try to find seat faster as the airport train can stop to all station between airport and the final station

Good way to go to the center but not with much luggage or weelchair . This is a good way to go central Bangkok with out much luggage. Also not for Wheelchair people. The most of the stations not have a lift. It's a easy way to travel in Bangkok. First look the end station the you no the way to go. Also there much places to change to the underground train. But take a taxi also a good way. But always use the taxi meter. Tell this before go in the taxi and also when stay in the taxi and the taxi driver not use the meter tell him you take another taxi. Be not afraid about this. The no the Ger a lot of problems when the take you as black taxi. When traveling with more people is the taxi the cheapest way.

A Great and a Cheap Way to Get to Bangkok. Since Bangkok has tons of traffic during all hours of the day it is a great idea to use the Airport Rail to get into the city. It is easy to find, as the entrance to the Rail Link is inside the Airport, level B. The ticket machines have English instructions. Most of the time the Airport Rail Link is quite crowded though, as there are many travelers who use it to go to or from the city, so I wouldn't suggest choosing this option of travel if carrying several large and heavy bags. Other than that I think it is a great option to get into the city.
Too many stops!. Absolutely packed most of the time....and there are too many stops to make it a quick route to the airport
Cheap and Easy. There are constantly trains coming and going from the airport which means little waiting time. It's cheap and easy, which makes it the best way to get to the city.

So quick. So easy. So affordable.. Connecting directly to the Sky Train system and so easily accessible from town and the airport itself, this is the only logical way to travel to and from BKK. It's a great feeling to watch the slews of traffic stuck in gridlock while your air conditioned train effortlessly whisks past them.

Only Way To Travel To & From Airport. Excellent value (much cheaper) and faster than screwing around with taxi's. It connects with other rail systems so you can go just about anywhere (or at least get close) in the city from the airport.

Very convenient. A neat, clean, and efficient metro rail service from the airport to downtown. Some of the stations are rather oddly laid out, but it's a really excellent way to get from the airport if you don't have a lot of luggage.

Best way to the city. The "express" was not in operation but the rail link does the same with a few more stops. It's easy and very inexpensive and avoids all the traffic. It connects with the BTS line.

A lifesaver. Morning evening flights which land in Bangkok avoid the rush take the link it will drop you in the heart of the city take a cab ride you will save 45 mins the traffic specially now the Chinese new year is killing worth spending 100 baths rather than spending 700 paying toll and wasting time in traffic
fast and cheap. If you do not use the express train this is a very cheap way to come into town from the airport. It is also fast, even if you do not use the express train.
Cheap and efficient!. Honestly a great way to avoid the traffic and get to the airport in approx. 30 minutes. Very cheap to use as well.
Easy to navigate. very helpful agents. I liked the machines that took paper baht best even though the lines were longer.
Red Line. nice metro of Bangkok. 80 bhaat return ticket. Direct expree line to airport. I enjoyed my travel in metro. its quick & convenient way of travel
airport rail link. its an excellent service at an affordable price all that you have to do is explore this wonderful convinience as bkk is always suffers with long traffic jams

FAST & CHEAP. For up to two or three people, this is the easiest and fastest way to get into the city and the Skylink/Subway/Metro system in Bangkok. The entrance is on the lowest floor of the terminal so if you need a ride from the airport into town, this is worth trying.
Take day ticket. To avoid or reduce the problems with the TukTuk and Taxi's , it looks that today they all are cheating an asking abnormal prices. The Skytrain is a very good option

Nothing but the best transportation in Bangkok. Employees are really friendly and eager to help.
Fares are cheap, security tight, connects to almost all major points.... and best of all, it avoids all the road JAMS in Bangkok!
What more to say! Best way to travel fast and cheap without having to worry!

Very good shuttle, easy to use. On the City Line, it took half an hour from the airport to the end of the line in town, very cheap, and from there there is an official taxi rank (makes you feel safer) which cost only 150 baht (£3) to our hotel near the Kho San Road. Staff are around to help you get tickets and give advice. Easy and cheap.

Fast easy and cheap. Do I need to say more? It's a piece of cake even unprepared , easy to find easy to use clean and most important you don't get stuck in traffic! In 20 min you are in Bangkok and nice views towards arrival I would add a star here!

A good way to get to the BTS connection from the airport... It made it easy to get to the BTS connection via the rail link. I was so happy not to need a taxi and all of the possible scenarios that it entails. A set price for transportation is the only way to go in Thailand, otherwise you may have to spend a lot of wasted time negotiating prices or dealing with dishonest taxi drivers, which seem to be all around in Bangkok..

A new option to get to the city.. Been in Bangkok a few times now but this was the first time I have used the new rail link. Very similar to the KL EXPRES from Kuala Lumpur & probably cheaper. Great way to get in & out from the airport. Connects with BTS.
Easy to use. We travelled from airport to hotel for only 40 Bath per person. Easy to use as long as you do your homework before hand and know which stop you need to get off.

Cut down your taxi costs and save time. It is unlikely to take you straight to where you want to go, but you can get into town quickly and cheaply with this train from the bottom level at the airport.At two recent visits in January and February 2015, I found the Express Line out of order. Still, the slower City Line--which runs the same route but with more stops--is a good complement to taxi if you can find a station close to your destination.A taxi from the train station does not carry the mandatory 50B airport charge. Many taxi drivers will ask you to pay a high flat fee rather than using the meter. I have found that firmly and politely insisting on the meter--and if necessary mention the Tourist Police--has given me much cheaper rides.

Needs some pride.... The Airport Rail Link is a fantastic step forward for Bangkok's public transport system, but nobody seems to take pride in its operations. Unlike the BTS and MRT networks, the ARL lacks identity and dedication to service.The Makasan station is such a depressing experience that I choose to travel from Asoke to Piyah Thai to catch the City Link or, when it is running, Express train, rather than take the short MRT trip to Makasarn.It doesn't need cheaper fares or cleaner carriages. It doesn't need much done with the scheduling. It doesn't need better uniforms or better trained staff. It needs a smoother passage from Customs to the station at the airport end, and could do with better promotion on aircraft, in Immigration and through Customs.. It would be best if one prepaid card, even if it was an ARL card, could get one from one's home station to the airport, without having to cue up for a ticket every time. Most important if all it needs a culture change - pride amongst the staff that, for many, they are Thailand's first ambassadors to tourists and the first to welcome home weary travelers - with a smile!Electronic boards at strategic points at the key connecting stations, and at the airport, showing the next departure times (in real time) would be helpful to all.I love the service - it could just be so, so much better.
Very easy to use and beats the traffic. Easy access to the centre of Bangkok from BKK airport in under 30 minutes. The taxis must hate this service!
most convenient way. running from 6 am-12 midnight for a mere 35 baht you can go to the heart of Bangkok in 22 min. no traffic, no haggling with taxi drivers.
Downtown - Airport. 45 THB/person from downtown (Phaya Thai) to Int. Airport in 25 minutes. very easy, clean and safe. Better than taxi at 600 THB !!

Great connection. A very convenient, smoothly transportation between Downtown Bangkok and Bangkok's main International Airport terminal. It was opened not long ago and it was clean, efficient and smooth. Before the opening of the Airport Rail Link, the transportation are usually bus or taxis. Taxis are still the terrible transportation option in Thailand.

fast clean and efficient. this is a great cheap clean way to get to and from the airport. it arrives on time every time. Leaves Bangkok international airport and arrives at phya thai bts. From here you can catch a sky train to wherever you want.
bangkok. convenient, cheap compare to taxi, safe and clean. it was a good deal for me. you should go with it instead of taxi.

Fast, cheap and convenient. Very fast and convenient high speed rail link to the airport. Its also very inexpensive compared to a taxi or to the comparatively over priced BTS. Only draw-back is that for 90% of visitors to Bangkok you have to change trains to the BTS or MRT to reach your hotel. Not ideal for large heavy suitcases because of stairs on BTS / MRT. Take a cab instead.

The fastest and cheapest way. It is the fastest, cheapest, and easiest way to get to the airport from downtown, about 30 minutes. If you want to take a taxi, it takes about an hour, even more during rush hour, and it cost three times as much as Rail link.
Excellent. save time and money get the airport rail link just 45 baht and 40 minutes where a taxi can cost you 10 times that and more plus traffic is horrendous especially in the evening rush hour

fast (~30-40min), cheap (45 BAT), convenient. We used the airport rail link between the international airport and the terminus Phaya Thai. Ticket for 1 person was 45 BAT and we reached the international airport in about 30/40 min, very nice trip: not crowded, clean, modern car.

Does the job. If your hotel is close to the link, use it to get to the airport. The process of ticket buying and getting on/to the train was a little confusing so give yourself a little more time just in case.

Save Time and Money. The Airport Rail Link is a really great transport from airport to downtown Bangkok. Can save time due to the traffic in Bangkok is really horrible. Can save money due to avoiding traffic jam and taxis.
It's cheap, fast and with air-condition.

Best way to move. Fast, cheap and with air conditioned. And you can avoid the taxi cues. If you're hotel is not near any station, you can always get to the closer station and get a taxi / tuk tuk / bus from there.

VERY CONVENIENT !. It startes at 2010. Works very good and its the fastest possibility, and cheapest, to go downtown, with enough place for Luggage.
try it!

The most Old thing in New Mass transportation. Airport rail link start to operate since 2010 , it is a new system, but the first time i saw the train , the train it was so terrible very old. It just new system and cars come so it should be new because it a new thing , interior inside quite narrow , it is not design for mass transportation to airport bcoz the passenger fare traveler go to airport will come with luggage , but no space for luggage. in the peak time,No space event finger area. For the station, Some stations easy to access such like Phayathai ( linked with Phayathai BTS ) or Ratchaparop( located on Main road ) Some station located in deep long street some station have to go from the main roade around 1 KM,. and the road so dark and Under develope . Event the station in the city Makkasan station , i really dont understand that located far from main road around 500 meter also dark and nothing there. actaully the land all the station belong to State of railway also. we still cannot fine the reason also. It seem all design for all system it is not user, User dont have any chance to put idea what we want , it is the mass transportation , it would bring us for the convenience. In my idea Maybe they under Thai railway so they have old style for make station. if you have chance to take our airport link , you can see and check Makkasan station or Hua mark station. Anyway , it still good and convenience to travel from city to airport better fight with TAXI.
Should be more passengers. When the rail link links to other Bangkok route outside bound is will be more passengers which the business need for better income.

Good connection. It is a good link between Bangkok city center and the Airport. There is a 30 min ride from the Airport to Phaya Thai and costs 45THB.During the rush hours the train can be really crowded.
Fantastically cheap and good. For a few bahts you can get from Bangkok Airport right into the centre of Bangkok and onwards to other parts of Bangkok using the Metro and/or the Skytrain.

Very convenient and cheap for commuting between cities in Bangkok and Suvannabhumi Airport. Thanks to all Thais and foreigners who used the link for their disciplines to make the rail link very clean and organized. The "express" airport rail link has, however, stopped it's services for sometimes now, therefore, the normal airport rail link is very crowded during rush hours as it stops at all stops along the way !! As a result, prepare time well for going to the airport !!

Very convenient Link to Airport. From our hotel to the airport it was so easy. We just climbed up the train station and voila, we are on our way to the Suvarnabhumi airport. The nice thing is the airport actually is connected to the Sky train's exit and you don't have problems carrying your luggage.

Traumatic experience.. Before considering taking this from the airport, I strongly suggest you make sure the place you are going to is on the same line. Because if it's not and you have to change, it is a hellish experience that you certainly don't want after any kind of flight.- There are no elevators so you have to carry your baggage down steps.- The train is often full with non airport travellers as it stops at a few places, meaning it's often standing room only.- if you do have to change lines, the ticket people speak poor English and cannot help you. Plus the maps are confusing as are the signs to where you have to go.All in all as such even though myself and a friend did this with a Thai national - the grief involved made me wish I had just sat in a Taxi and accepted the traffic.Very very unlikely to do again, and then only if hand luggage only.

Faster and cheaper than taxi for BKK (Suvarnabhumi) airport. Definitely great option to get to the airport from Phaya Thai Skytrain stop.The journey from Phaya Thai takes about 30mins and costs 45THB (as of Feb 2015). It is recommended to get on at this station, so you can grab a seat for the ride - especially in the rush hours.The other options is Airport Express which is little faster having only 2 stops instead of 7 stops that slow down the journey. The Airport Express supposedly costs double the price 90THB per person.
Quick & efficient. A good cheap alternative to a taxi for going into the city. A little crowded but the staff are friendly and helpful. We had to change lines and we accomplished it with no problems.

fast and easy. We stayed transit-overnight close to Bangkok airport, took the airport link to Sukumvit, spend the evening and back to the hotel. Very clean ans easy quick way to downtown, without to look ornegotiate for taxi, no traffic, no road toll. Good experience.

airport rail link efficiency. I took this rail link a few time. The big advantage is that you do not need to deal with the taxi at either the airport or the hotel. You just take the rail link, then take the BTS to the station close to your hotel. Most good hotel have a "tuk-tuk" free of charge to take you to the hotel, thus no walking. The only problem is the stairs. At some station, there is no escalator, thus you need to carry the luggage either up or down, and it is annoying. I wish they had escalator on all of those.

Taxi from Airport. Two prices from Airport....they will first give you the large car price...ask for the smaller wich is our standared size and fine for 2 with cases" OR " go to the Departure floor and pick up a Taxi from someone just arriving.....should not do but !!!!!

Travel light on airport link. I travelled via airport link several times while living in BKK. When picking up visitors from the airport by myself, it was the cheapest way to get there from Sukhumvit 59 ( Thong Lo) where I lived . In rush hour it was the fastest. It is however, always a 35 minute journey from Sukhumvit terminal. The train has almost always been full when I travelled it, even after 9 pm. With the crowd, you will probably be standing with your luggage, the whole time. The train makes quite a few stops. Apparently there is an express one, but I never was able to time my rides on express schedule. If you are travelling with someone else the cost will be about the same as a taxi, except in rush hour, when every road, bus, train and BTS train will be packed very tightly with passengers. NOTE: there are very long walks to and from the train both directions. Some elevators available but often long waits for them in busy airport. Be forewarned..do not overload yourself with luggage.
The easiest way to the city. It takes only 25 mins to go to city where it connects with the skytrain. Especially useful during traffic hours. Trains are every 12 minutes.

Fast and Efficient. The only way to get to downtown Bangkok and beat the crazy traffic. Very easy to board from Bangkok Suvarnabhumi International airport .he Airport Link's City Line will run every 15 minutes and the Express Line every 30 minutes. Both lines operate from 6am to midnight. The trains have a maximum speed of 160 kilometres per hour. The City Line will make eight stops across the capital, starting at Phaya Thai, before heading to the airport. The trains take 30 minutes from Phaya Thai to Suvarnabhumi. Passengers using the City Line pay a flat rate of 15 baht for a trip during the promotion period. Fares will range from 15 baht to 45 baht, depending on the distance travelled. Simple connection to the BTS transit system at Phaya Thai station. Much cheaper and quicker than a taxi. Way to go!

Great idea poor execution. Quick way to get into the centre of Bangkok, but the main terminal station in town has poor onward journey options. When we tried the airport link, the journey to the centre itself was smooth, fast and what is to be expected from a airport transfer, but when you get out at the other end, it seems the project is poorly thought out. The main terminal in the city is practically inaccessible by car, in fact the roads leading into the station are so congested that it takes 2 or 3 times as long to get tot the station than it would take to take a taxi direct to the airport. If you would like to get there by public transport the only option is by Subway, which will take you to Petchaburi station where you then have to log your luggage on a poorly constructed footbridge.Why not have a tunnel into the MRT station where passenger can stroll in the cool air, and conveniently take a lift up into the railway link station area? I will not be using this service again, unless access to the station is greatly improved. If you like people watching and don't mind spending the extra time - then this may be an option for you.

Fast and convenient. Being right at the terminal makes this an easy option. I guess you need to know where you are going as it is likely that your hotel/ residence may not be close to your exit station. There you might have to take a taxi to get to your hotel. At least you are in the city and missed any possible traffic jam on the freeway

Rail Link. Had two great trips on the rail link in BKK, very safe,quick and a great ride. People who fly in and out of BKK now have discovered the rail link and there are many people with huge bags traveling on it now even though it is not recommended for that purpose.
Airport Express. better taking the city link, it runs more frequently and is cheaper, takes only slightly longer than the airport express

Not so good anymore. The Airport Rail Link was always needed but it has been poorly implemented. For example, while it does connect to the Phaya Thai BTS (Skytrain) station it is an awkward situation that normally finds passengers huffing and puffing their bags up and down flights of stairs at the train station. Once aboard however the Airport Express would whisk you comfortably to the airport in 15 minutes flat - nonstop. I said "would" because the Express has been cancelled (forever it seems).
