Now one must jostle with commuters on the slower City Line. At 30 minutes, the time is ok but the journey is not. Ascending the train at Phaya Thai (the terminus) is almost dangerous as the narrow platform becomes extremely crowded as the minutes tick by until the next train arrives. With no safety barrier between you and the tracks, and poorly designed, the passengers coming from the airport (or any other stop along the way) alight onto the same platform (e.g. exit the same door you will enter) causing an even greater jam of people and then all head to the same escalator or stairs. I now avoid the train altogether and once again take meter taxis to the airport. Safer and much more comfortable - and quite cheap average 300 baht all up.

The most convenient way to get from the airport to downtown. A great, straight forward way of getting to downtown. Unfortunately the last few stops have not been built as of yet, to be able to access the river front, Khaosan area. From Playa Thai u have 2 hire a cab or tuk-tuk, weird combo... the express train is not running for months now, I guess for lack of interest, it was always running with a minimal capacity. The regular line is incredibly crowded from the third station on.

Efficient, clean and cheap form of travel. The last time I stayed in Bangkok and left the Suvarnabhumi Airport, my friend wanted to try alternative travel to the taxi, which is always a rip off with most drivers charging Baht 370 or more to get into Bangkok. So we tried the Airport Rail Link. The station is on the lower floor to the arrivals floor. There are plenty of signs to guide you. If you ask one of the spruikers however, they will convince you to use a limousine, 'very cheap now, just for you today only'. Don't fall for this one as it doesn't really turn out cheap at all with all the add on's. But, once, do it just for fun, no matter the cost. Anyway, back to the train. Finally found the station without too much trouble, ticket machines and station underground, with the cost of the tickets not expensive at all to travel to Bangkok. The trains run very regularly, about a 15 minute wait between each. Going on board with suitcases, you have to struggle with other travellers also coming on board with their luggage and traverse all those obstacles lying on the floor before you find your corner. Usually you have to stand, which I did not this occasion all the way into Bangkok. The train was fast, clean and well air conditioned. The trouble was knowing where to go when you arrived in Bangkok, which being the first time my friend and I had no idea. We got off at a station which sounded familiar but was still some kilometres from our hotel. I wanted to find the station which had the cross over to the Skytrain, but couldn't find it. Ended up getting a taxi from the station to the hotel. Lugging suitcases along stairs and escalators wasn't my idea of fun. Next time will get the taxi from the airport and pay the extra Baht cost for the comfort of not having to lug around luggage across town. But for the cost conscious the train is a good alternative. You may have better luck finding the station where you switch stations to the Skytrain than I did.

Always busy but easy to travel to Ramkamhaeng. Poorly planned with Makassan Station being a good point but for those who are staying around Ramkamhaeng area and need to travel to Central Bangkok with the BTS connection in Phiyathai, this is the fastest mode of transport. And.. the toilets at Airport Link Ramkamhaeng Station is fully airconditioned and very modern..

Express train currently not working. The train is quick and simple to use... but currently the express train is not working meaning the service is slower than advertised.Having said that it can be convenient (depending upon where you are travelling in BKK)

Great alternative of taxi. For only few buck your faster and cheaper in town! Even you need other side close to the river you can jump from that to the sky train. Because its fast n cheap its quite busy that is the only down side especially office start and end hours. But still better to been packed for around 30 minutes then get stugged in traffic for two hours with way more expansive then the fast train! Well done government!

Fastest way to bkk and cheap. i usually get a taxi but tried this and now will always use it to get into town. Fast and cheap links up with other service at Phaya Thai so you can get right into Sukhumvit and to your hotel, with more money in yr pocket to spend on other things.

Perfect airport transportation in Bangkok. to go and from the BKK (Suvarnabhumi Airport) this is best transportation..the location is under the airport so just take the escalator and follow the sign airport rail link its easy..its fast and cheap fos sure!

Best transportation from Suvarnabhumi. It was super fast transportation from Suvarnabhumi airport to the city. It didn't packed like BTS (or maybe because I took a night trip), it was comfortable to travel with. Even when I took a baggage.

Perfect way to get to the airport if you don't have much luggage. I use it a lot when I'm meeting someone from the airport - we then come back to the centre in a local taxi with all the luggage.. It will take a bit longer than a taxi but that depends on the traffic...but its a lot cheaper.
Gets Right Into Airport. Easy to use...and gets you right into the airport and easy to understand the systemHighly Recommended

Fast and comfort. The Bangkok Rail Link only cost you 45 THB from the airport to the Phaya Thai Station, the trip around 30 minutes. The seats also comfort for the passenger who travel some hours in the plant. You could change the BTS or get a taxi to you hotel easily.
Quickest Way to get to the Airport!!!. Economical...efficient...well connected...crowded depending on the hour of the day...but definitely the best way to commute!!!
Easy to Access. Airport link is the cheapest and fastest way of transportation for Suvarnabhumi Airport. I wish there is something like that for Don Mueang as well.

fastest way to the city. If you are not carrying lot of luggage, Airport link works well. At about 45 THB, the train take you right to center of city in about 30 minutes. Its a good link to lot of hotels along the line. However for 4 people, it may make sense to take a taxi.

Very user friendly. Great product, very clean and provides easy in and out to the airport from downtown. Highly recommend it. Ties into the rest of the train system which is just fantastic in Bangkok. Far better than sitting for hours in traffic.

Quickest way to town. All airports should have a rail link direct to the city centre, Bangkok does and it is the quickest way to get out of the traffic jams that often build up in the city. The 30 minute journey is cheap, 45bt for the trip to interline with the sky train line. It is also air conditioned to be almost cold.

Fast & Efficient. Great way to travel long distances. Our hotel was located near Ratchaprarop and this train was an excellent medium to travel to & fro to the airport. The security and safety is also looked into carefully. Amazing work on the cleanliness and directions as well!

Fast and Cheap Way to Connect. This is definitely a fast and cheap way to connect between Suvarnbhumi Airport and the City. Beats all the traffic congestion you are likely to face if you travel by a vehicle. For just 45 baht, I got to Phaya Thai BTS from the airport in less than 30 min using the City Line.

Great service.. A complete escape from bkk traffic. Thanks for station 🚉 RACHPAROP. It connects to city center Pratunam, platinum shopping 🏬 malls and more..
This time a new hotel 🏨 is very budget friendly - The Bangkokians Garden 🏡 home.

It's Excellent If you book hotel nearby airport train station.. To avoid the Bangkok's heavy traffic,This Airport link train is excellent.You can just catch a train from Rajprarop Station or Phayathai Station Direct to the Airport.

Public transport at its best. Cheap, fast, safe, clean and easy to use...Bangkok can be proud of having such a prime example of airport city center transit facilities. If you are staying somewhere near a train station downtown, this is definitely the way to go. It is easy to find hotels near a train station, for example there are lots of good hotels (Amari, Novotel...) within 10 min walking distance to Ratcha Prarop station. Even during the times of road blockades in early 2014I found it safe and reliable to use the airport link.

most convenient. it connects to suvarnbhumi airport to phaya thaivery cheap mode of transport from airport to city2 types of trains , 1 airport city line which halts at all stations2 airport express takes u to city without halts

Nowhere else!!!. This train made our way from the airport to city center completelt quick and easy. Definitely worth for a value and quite safe as well. I wonder if this train could be built in other cities?

The best way to and from the airport.. The Link takes you from the Suvarnabhumi airport to the city center in about 30 minutes, at high speed. It is located above the city traffic, at around 15 meters above ground. The cost from the airport to the Sukhumvit area is 35 Bht.

Brilliant rail link to the city. . My wife and I used the rail link to get us from the airport to Bangkok earlier this week. It is so easy to use being at the basement of the airport. Trains are easy to board and run on time. You're straight into the city in a few minutes where you can link up with the BTS and MRT. Very good. Very cheap.

Quick way to get from Airport to City Centre. Only use this if hotel etc is within few hundred metres of station drop otherwise it is still cheaper approx 300THB to 500THB MAX to get anywhere in Bangkok from Airport
Only way to travel. I have always taken the train to get to my hotel in Sukhumvit. Way quicker than by car. Ridiculously cheap and easy to navigate

Don't bother with taxis. The train system is easy to use and clean. If you are landing in Bangkok during rush hours, do not bother with getting a taxi, just hop on the airport rail into the city. All announcements are in english and Thai so you will not miss your stop. Transferring over to other trains IF you need to is super easy with the help of the information desks at all the stops. Cost from Airport to city is 35tbh per person then an additional 15tbh if you use another train line. The cost for a cab from the airport to downtown could be as much as 600tbh during traffic.
Cheap n convenient. If u don't have much luggage, I'd suggest u to take the airport link at least upon arrival into the city. Cheap n convenient.

Inexpensive way to get into the city. This train is clean, fast and depending on time you ride crowded. We arrived in Bangkok on a Saturday afternoon and riding this was a snap. The next two times we rode it to and from the airport it was crowded and we had to stand with our bags. Still it is way more economical than a cab and much faster as you don't get stuck in traffic.

How it's done. Airports are always removed from city centers, Bangkok shows how it's done by providing a convenient rail line directly into the city. Forget taxis which are going to be slow in Bangkok traffic, just hop on the train and ride it to playathai

Confusion about the rail link. The fast link is suspended. The local trains run on the same track and are pretty efficient. The airport is easy to navigate but the Bangkok urban light rail is limited and it is far too easy to find yourself a mile form your hotel, spend an hour in a taxi going nowhere or battling with suitcases up and down crowded staircases and taking your life in your hands to cross roads filled with mad traffic- watch out for the motorbikes using the wrong side of the road!
Fast connection to city. 45 baht bring you downtown. Fast and reliable, easy to access from airport (just follow the signs). Well connected to MRT in Bkk.

EASY BANGKOK. The easiest and cheapest way to go from Suvarnabhumi airport to Bangkok downtown.At the very convenient price of 30THB or a little bit more if your station is after Makkasan.The train stops are conveniently located so that there are intersections with bts, MRT and railway.Trains, stations and everything are really clean and well maintained.Once on the train don't throw your ticket away because, like everywhere in Thai, you'll need it to exit.

beats taking the taxi !. I'm a true fan of the Airport Link as a means of traveling to and from the airport. The main reason is that there is no uncertainty about the commute time or the price. Plus you don't have to worry about the traffic or unscrupulous taxi drivers. The commute will always take approx 30 min or so from Phaya Thai station. I've had some horrendous experiences in the past with taxi cab drivers and I try to avoid them at all cost. There is simply never any drama associated with taking the Airport Link to and from the airport and I love that. I just wish the Airport Link was available for travel 24/7 vs. 6am to 12am. Also, the Airport Link can be very crowded sometimes but I can usually find a seat so it's still a comfortable experience. Plus you can't beat the price which is significantly less than taking the taxi. Finally, the Airport Link never gives you any attitude unlike Bangkok taxi drivers !

Easy way to and from airport. Taking the Airport Rail Link is really the easiest way to get from downtown Bangkok to the airport. The cost is 45 baht which is so inexpensive. If you are traveling light, this is the best, most cost effective way to do it. BTS connects with the downtown Air Rail terminal, very easy to figure out.

Cheap and reliable way to beat the crazy traffic. With its connection to BTS, this has quickly became our only mode to and fro airport and city center. It's cheap, it's good, it's clean and a great start to experience Bangkok, be among the locals.

Easy and fast. Easy and fast way to travel through Bangkok and/or to the International AirPort. The traffic can be horrible so when we have the chance, we chose to go with the AirPort link. Affordable but not sure to give everyone a seat to sit. The end station is phaya thai where You can change to skytrain (BTS) or taxi.

Won't take you directly to your hotel, but will probably get you there faster.. Comment to the Thai government: if you want to make Thailand a more friendly place, stop the apparent requirement that every taxi and tuk tuk driver be a scam artist or just a plain thief. Do you get the idea that I don't like dealing with taxi drivers in Bangkok? It's true. If you find a good one (and they do exist, or so I hear!), get their card and call them directly for service! Until then, do not even think about leaving the Suvarnabhumi Airport by taxi. Head down to the basement, pop some coins into the machine, and get your ticket to the city center and lose the headaches (at least for a little bit). Since the train does get used by normal commuters, as well, it will tend to get more and more crowded as you approach the last stop, but I had no problems getting off and changing to the BTS even though I was wheeling a couple of unwieldy bags.45 baht, no haggling, no having taxi drivers stop by a suit store so they can get 5 liters of free gas, etc.. Loved it, and the smooth ride.

Excellent. If you are staying in the city then take the airport link and then connect to an MRT station to get to your destination. The cost is approx 50 Baht for the full trip. Im went from Suvarnabumi airport station to Makassan station and paid 35 Baht. And ont he trip back I went from Ratchatwei station to Airport and paid 45 Baht. Clean and fast... take just 1/2 to the airport. There is currently no express. So I took the regular train. I dont know when the express will start. Some of the bogies have luggage racks so you can keep your suitcases.

fast way to enter city. The direct rail network from airport is good if you are landing during the traffic hrs, The express service takes you to connecting station in 15 minutes and the other one takes 30 minutes. Went last week to bangkok the express service was not working.. than also made sense to use airport rail link
Best option. I think the sky train is the best option by far. Having taken a taxi and the sky train, the train wins hands down on price, comfort and no need to deal with a dodgy taxi driver.

Not what it was supposed to be. It's OK, but they seem to have suspended the non-stop trains and all trains stop at every station.. no big deal time-wise but gets very crowded at around 7-9 in the morning with many people travelling into the city. Not great if you have to maneouver luggage around. Also not a great taxi service from Makasan. Probably better going to Phaya Thai and getting the BTS from there, since there's security checks for passengers using the MRT (Underground Train). It's cheap though.

Easy with no traffic. My friend was like - let's take the train , but I really wanted to be more comfortable and take the taxi. So we end up taking the taxi on our way back to the airport and it took us 20 minutes longer that the train, which we took on the way getting to the city. Cheaper too. Next time , I would be using the train again, it's just faster!

No traffic. Avoid traffic and get to the city from the airport fast and cheap. Easy to follow signs in the airport. If your hotel is close to the Sky Train it is an easy transfer from the Rail link to the Sky Train.
Easy access. Airport rail link provides easy access to & from Suvarnabhumi airport. The service available from 06:00 till midnight which connects to downtown Bangkok.
Easy to use. Its easy to use ,such a blessing in this chaotic city , its clean and cheap comparatively ....Its quick , it will take you to the airport without any hassle at all.

May be better than taxi. When we arrived to Bangkok we took a taxi. On the wat back we used Airport Rail Link.
And it is fast (no traffic jams), cheap (45 bhat + bts price to interchange station) and definetly comfortable way to get to/from Airport.

Fast and cold. fast and cheap way to go everywhere in Bangkok, easy interchange to Metro MRT or BTS.
Just keep your eyes in your belongings, sometimes is so crowded and there are some pick pockets like any big city in the world.

Fast and cheap airport-downtown transport. The Airport Rail Link is a very convenient, fast and cheap way to get to the airport from downtown Bangkok and vice versa. There are 2 lines - the City Line and the Express Line. The City Line has 8 stops (including the airport) and its last staion is Phaya Thai. It costs between 15 and 45 baht, depending on the station you want to hop off at. It took about 30 minutes to my station - Makkasan. The Express Line costs 150 baht and has a direct route from the airport to Makkasan station. If you have a lot of luggage, keep in mind that the City Line, which I used, can be quite squeezy because it is usually used by the local people who work close to its stations.

Faster means of travelling. Except the sound that the door makes when shutting (I got startled the first time hearing the loud noise) rest all is good. Its fast, clean and almost convenient. Not as good looking as the BTS though. I had used it from Phayathai station to Ladkrabang station .. 80 baht it was then. Its quite on time, time displayed in the schedules. Avoid office hours to avoid crowd!

Not just to airport, but also convenient for BTS or MRT interchange. My hostel nearby to an airport rail link station, it's so convenient for me to interchange to BTS or MRT line to visit Bangkok attractions.
Fast!. Best way to get to Bangkok center from Suvarnabhumi airport. Can be a little crowded, but still is better than taxi in big traffic.

Excellent way of getting to the city but... Superb way of avoiding traffic and getting to the city centre in 30mins from the airport but some stations do not have lifts/elevators/escalators (you get the picture). It seems only the bigger main stations(Phaya Thai?) have lifts (am not sure). Something to note if you have bulky luggage on arrival. No taxi stands too...... I alighted at Ratchapraprop.
Very fast and cheap. The best thing though is it removes the hassle. No more taxi drivers who don't want to put on the meter, have no change, can't find the hotel or generally want to overcharge.

Use selectively, primarily to beat traffic. . Well, all modes of transport are cheap in Bangkok. So a taxi is totally affordable. But what can be a huge headache is the peak hour traffic. It can be really nasty. Distance till Siam Discovery can take upto two hours. So the best way to beat it is by taking the Airport rail link.For the off peak hours, I would still suggest that you take the taxi. It is personal, and will not have the crowds of the Rail.So, if you are getting late or don't want to be stuck in the peak hour traffic, take this mode of commute.

Only slow trains. They use to have 2 possibility to get from and to the airport Suvanarbhumi, the fast train and the normal train, the fast train was excellent and very fast and only 90 bath. But a while ago they stopped the fast train, it's only the normal/slow one now. It real takes for ever and gets so crowded that you can hardly stand there and if you have luggage, it's extra hard. To get in the city or to the airport, you have to change at paya thai station and they have no escalator there only stairs, so again with luggage is difficult.

Probably the best way to get to the city center.. Airport link train is always my favorite option to get to the city center upon arriving to Bangkok. Its very easy and the quickest way without any hustle and bustle. After clearing immigration, claiming the luggage & customs just follow the exit sign and then you would see Airport Link Rail sign it will direct you to the basement where the ticket counters are. There are 2 services Express Line & City Lines. Express line would cost you around 150 baht and drop you at Makkasan station in just 15 minutes while the City Line would cost you just 45 baht and drops you at Phaya Thai station in 30 minutes.From Phaya Thai (BTS station) you could continue your journey to the nearest BTS station to your hotel. But since I always prefer to stay around Khaosan road, I would get off at Phaya Thai Station and from there, I would take a taxi which cost around 80 baht to Rambuttari road. The same way you can take the Airport link to get to airport, Its very easy and convenient way to reach to airport which being stuck in the traffic jam which is a common sight in Bangkok.

This is a terrific train for commuters, but for iar passengers, NOT. For people working and living along the line this is an excellent choose of transportation. Well, the only choose in the afternoonI visited my friend and it took me 10 minutes to get there 6 o'clock in the evening, otherwise that would have been 2 hours in a carBut to go there to get on a flight. NO WAY! It was so crowded and it was impossible to get on board. 2 Backpackers hardly made it on board, as their backpacks hardly made it onboard as the train was full, very full. And these two were the only air passengers that I could seeImagine this after a 12 hours flight! Taxi, about 10 US Dollars to the city, well, if we can afford to fly we can afford to take a taxi. And even better alternative after arriving from a long flight is to book a AOT limousine at the luggage claim area. That is 40, well, less than 40 Dollars and you get whisked out to the car outside the custom. Very convenient and no need to go through the hassle in the taxi queue or to think about any road tolls

Cheap and Best!!. Pros: 1) Convenience2) No traffic Jams3) Cheap4) Self Explanatory once you step into the station5) No chance getting cheated by Taxi Drivers6) Directly you will be dropped in airport.Cons:1) If you have more luggage like more than 3 bags per person, then it may be difficult.

Fabulous trip into the city. We rode the airport rail link for the first time yesterday and were completely satisfied. To ride from the airport to the final stop in the city is 45 baht--a fraction of the cost of a taxi. We didn't have luggage with us and thought to ourselves that the ride would be complicated with luggage, but there were many riding with luggage. Along the route are metro stations that link to the BTS stations giving you lots if options are getting around Bangkok. Follow the signs at the airport for rail link which is on the bottom floor marked B. Grab a free map of the transit system on that floor. Excellent ride for an excellent price!

Quick and Easy to the Bangkok Airport. We were staying at the President Palace Hotel near Nana Station on the Skytrain line. There were 3 of us and a taxi would have cost approx. 600 Baht. My kids who are used to taking the Sky train at home (Vancouver) were eager to try the sky train so off we went, One thing you must do if carrying suitcases is to look for the escalators taking you up to the station from the street or down to the street. There is usually only one set of each while there may be two or more stairs. From Nana station, it was a short ride to the juncture point to transfer to the Airport Rail line. Buying tickets for the Sky train is very easy. Get a map from your hotel and find out where you are getting on and what station you need to get off to get the attraction or point you are going. At the station, the yellow dot tells you where you are. Look for the dot where you want to get off and that corresponds to a number. Go to the ticket machine - you need coins so if you don't have any, you have to line up at the coin change booth to get some. Back to the ticket dispensing machine. Look for the point where you get off and it has a number. Push that number on the machine and the same number is how much you have to pay to get there. Put coins in and watch the printout tell you how much more you have to put in. Get the ticket and go to the wicket. Put the ticket in, take it with you as you need it to get out. At the exit wicket, put it into the machine and if you have paid the correct amount, the gate will open and the ticket will stay in the machine. At the juncture to the airport rail system, you need to exit and buy another ticket. For us, the total cost for 3 was approx. 45 baht each from the juncture and 31 from Nana station to the juncture (Phaya Thai). Total cost - 226 Baht. If you have suitcases, I suggest you get on at either the first or last train since they tend to be less crowded. It's very quick, especially the Airport Rail Line. If you are aways from the closest station, you can always take a tuk tuk to the station. Its a great way to see the city on the way out since you are elevated and you can avoid being stuck in traffic in the city.

Rail link. Dont bother with taxi's from the airport you will sit in so much traffic, just get the train to down town, then pick up the Sky-train or MRT. l went from the airport to Makkasan.You can pick up the subway from here, but be aware the subway gets very busy if you have large bags. It cost 30 baht l think, which is so cheap.
Cheap & Easy. This is the way to get to the airport or to come into the city from the airport. Have used it a couple of times to meet people and bring them in and really works well

Best way to enter the city. If you are not in a hurry, i will recommend you to catch the city line which costs 45 bath to reach the final Phaya thai. The trip will take less than 30 minutes with 6 stops. From here you will get BTS to other destinations. The express line charges 90 bath for the same distance but it reaches faster.
convenient and affordable. it's convenient, clean, fast, reliable and affordable, in fact cheap! you dont really have to worry even if you have big luggages.

Great ride if you travel light!!. The airport train is a very reasonable way to get into the city. Fast clean and quite convenient. The problem is when you switch to the Bts metro. Lugging bags is a bit of an issue. If you are 3 people the cab may well be cheaper!!Take the free sim cards (Dtac) usually distributed to get connected in Thailand. Fone first!!

Airport Rail Link. This is a useful and efficient service from the airport into the city. It costs 45 baht to travel from Suvarnibhumi airport to Phaya Thai where it connects with the BTS. The journey takes about 25 min. It is certainly cheaper than taking a taxi from the airport but of course unlike the taxi it does not take you straight to your hotel; if your hotel is near a BTS station that is no problem. The facilities at the terminal station are not great, in that there is only one small elevator and no downward escalators so if you are travelling with very heavy luggage this might not be the best option.

Economical and Convenient. I hadn't realized this airport rail link existed until I tried to find an alternative to taking a taxi. The hotel I was staying at had a pick-up service for about 1,600 baht. Hiring a similar car at the airport would cost just under 1,000 baht. The rail link turned out to be 45 baht (the express was not in service that day) from the airport to Phaya Thai Station. The ticket machine did not take large bills, so I had to go to the window to buy a ticket. The ride was smooth, silent, and had great air conditioning. Phaya Thai Station had an elevator to take to the BTS station level. If you don't have much luggage, and what you have is light enough to carry when there are no escalators or elevators at the stations you may go on to, the rail link is economical and convenient.

Easy commuting. If your hotel is close to any of the Skytrain or Metro stations, this is a recommendable way to get from the airport. In rush hour it is way quicker and very easy access to many hotels in central Bangkok.

Great system. Very efficient service. A bit daunting first of all but when you get used to it works really well for getting on and off at various places and the Thai people are very helpful if y do get a bit lost. Try it for the experience, for the fun and for getting around.

Cheap & Quick. Think we paid about 80p to get from the airport to downtown Bangkok. There are 2 lines, one direct into city centre and one that stops along the way, the direct line wasn't open when we went. Great value, nice clean new carriages

Great service into the centre of Bangkok. We used the train as an alternative to getting a taxi into the centre of Bangkok. It is quicker and is less expensive. Once in Bangkok there are great connections to the sky trainsWell worth it !

Avail Airport rail link to avoid traffic. The connectivity is super. Our hotel was at Sukhumvit. So to reach there we took a airport link train till Makasan and from there took a cab to our hotel. It took only half n hour for us to reach hotel during the busy day at Bangkok.

Fastest way to Bangkok. The one thing I hate about Bangkok is the traffic jams. I honestly think this airport link is a great asset. It only takes 30 mins to reach the city center from the airport. If you take a taxi in, it takes an hour maybe two. Well yeah, it is crowded during peak hours but if you get on it the right time, there'll be seats.
Fast and convenient. Used the city line to and from the airport, cheap and fast. Unfortunately the red express line was not working, not sure why.
Easy. Easy to get from airport to centre of bangkok clean train only problem at busy times you are squashed like a sardine
Fast and Economical. If you don't have too much luggage, this is a great way to get to and from the airport. Clean and not too crowded and you don't have to worry about a taxi scam.
Cheap fast and to downtown Bangkok. check your hotel location maybe it's closed to one of the stations of the airport link. The time to downtown Bangkok is about 20 min, and about thb 60.

Airport Rail Link is an excellent mode of transport which connects Suvarnabhoom Intl Airport..... Airport Rail Link is an excellent mode of transport which connects Suvarnabhoom Intl Airport to all the major destinations in bangkok city. Its very affordable as compared to metered cabs. There are 2 routes, one is the express line and the other is the city line. Express route is non stop to Makassan and the other one stops at all stns. I had opted to stay at NASA Vegas hotel which is directly connected to Ramkhamhaeng ARL.Its the best...

The Engineers for the Train ( Siemens ) are needed to re-School !. Even the Airport Link Web-Site is trying to explain the Door Operation for the Train - Why it is this and that? It is a Joke! Only train in this whole wide world DO this Shutting ! Another thing is the Customer Service Mind is not in their Thinking Process, among all the public transportation !! No Elevator for Customer to use - especially Airport Link which everyone has Luggages with them. I used it ONCE and that is! Limosine to the Airport for 1,000 Bahts is spent and it is better than support the Organization that does not has a Brain to think!

Fast n Easy!. Convenient from the Airport for BTS. Look for exits to MTS.Pretty long wait times between trains but connects Bangkok pretty well.Recommend taking a 1 Day Pass and travelling to the places adjoining the BTS.
very good option. a excellent alternative to taxi. It is very easy to use and the connection with the metro BTS is easy too. Very clean and safe for a ridiculous price
Fantastic. It depends of your destination and how much luggage you have, but it's fast, clean, reliable. You can't ask for more, really. It saves you time and hassle.

Easy way of getting around. I really enjoyed using the rail link.... good way of seeing the outer part of Bangkok and being overwhelmed by the skyline buildings (and the contrast with the old and sometimes ram-shackled buildings right next to them). Really easy to use. Work out what station you have to get off in order to get to your hotel. You may then need to utilise a tut tut or taxi to get you from the train station to your hotel. Was much less stressful than being in crazy Bangkok traffic for the whole duration of the journey from the airport to hotel.
fast and cheap to join BKK. with less than 1Euro you can join BKK and then choose between skytrain or metro according to your destination. Great!
Fast and cheap. Fastest and easiest way to get to the city centre. For just 35 baht you are in the city centre within 20 minutes. Trains are cool and clean but can get crowded during the route.

Great. very cheap and fast way to go from airport to city and reverse. The express line is faster but the regular line has more frequent routes so i suggest you take the first there is available, no need to wait much.
straight into the airport. So simple and cheap to use and takes you straight to or from the airport without any hassle and never have to wait more then a few minutes all for a max of 45 baht.

very convenient. It was only 45 bahts from the airport to Praya Thai, it took about 30 minutes. Make sure that you take a seat. It's not only used by tourists by local too so it gets quite crowed. If you don't get a seat, you will most probably blocked someone somehow.

Sometimes quicker than a taxi. Clean, easy to use and cheap and more reliable than trying to find a taxi sometimes. I use this train when travelling to the airport on my own. If there are 2 or 3 of you, then you're possibly better off in a taxi, providing that you don't have too much luggage and you can get a taxi to take you on a busy Friday night. I love Bangkok and lived here for 3.5 years, but one thing that really irritates me is that the taxis won't necessarily take you to where you want to go. It depends on how busy it is, whether or not it's raining, how they feel, etc........... No such worries with the Airport Rail Link.

Great, affordable way to get from BKK to downtown Bangkok. This elevated railway from BKK (Suvarnabhumi International Airport) to downtown Bangkok did not exist during my last visit to Bangkok almost 8-9 years ago. It only cost THB 90 for a single ride (about US$2.75) and THB 150 (~US$4.60) for a round-trip fare. I was able to connect with the subway at one of the stations (Makkasan), but you can also connect with the Sky Train as well.
Good if you have no luggagej. Clean easy cheap, but if you have luggage and you are 2 or more heading for sukhumvit..stick to the public taxis at airport
Easy to use. Cheap & easy to use. We travelled to Ratchaprarop Station in 25 mins. Look up the timetable on the web before you travel.

Fast and convenient. The easiest and the cheapest way to travel to Central Bangkok is taking the Airport Rail from Suvarnabhoomi Airport. It is definitely the fastest way to get to the city especially if you travelling in the peak hours of morning or evening, when the traffic jams can go for miles.

Bangkok Suvarnabhumi Airport [BKK] Rail Link plus tips for >< Don Muang Airport. An alternative to taxi's but not the total answer depending on whereabouts in bangkok you need to go to. At Suvarnabhumi Airport you need to go past level 1 where the taxi's are to the basement level for the train station. There is a mini-market down there and some cafe's/restaurants & toilets too as alternative to the crowded ones in the higher levels of the terminal. The positives - its 45 Baht for the stopping train which takes 30 minutes to reach the end of the line, trains every 15 minutes. There are 2 connections points with Bangkok Metro/Skylink system, at Makkasan station a connection to the MRT underground and at the end of the line a connection to the Green BTS line at Phaya Thai station. In the case of the latter its a c 400 metre walk over a connecting skybridge to the BTS station ticket office & escalators. Trains can get pretty busy during peak periods, not just at airport but builds up with commuters from surburban stations as they get on heading for the city centre and also in terms of the Bangkok BTS/MTR you probably want to avoid trying to be on these say at rush hour peaks say 0730-0930 and 1600-1800 unless travelling North out of Bangkok centre on these lines.If you've got a lot of luggage then the train might not be a good idea as you've got to get your luggage on [ no dedicated storage facility on board ] and then off and to a taxi rank at your stop. Probably OK for backpackers and those with a wheeled case but if have 2 suitcases I'd re-consider using it. Don't forget to consider buying your Rabbit rover card card for BTS if its worthwhile for you at the BTS station. Check whether you'll use the MTR system enough to justify their travel card as a lot of MTR doesn't go near tourist area's. ( NB if travelling on MTR and paying cash you get a round token to use for gates its a bit fiddly so don't lose it / plus big queues build up at the cash machines for the tokens and thus 2 good reasosn for getting an MTR travel card ! ]Alternative to the rail are the airport taxi's which should always be on the meter and at the end a 50 baht surcharge is added [ not shown on meter ] plus the driver may ask for the toll money at toll gates en route which could be as much as 75 baht depending on routes taken. On edrawback of a lot of the taxis is that they have limited boot space - often they open it and what with the spare tyre, oil cans and other kit they can squeeze in 1 large suitcase.If you have a bit of luggage it might be worthwhile indicating you'd prefer one of the larger taxi's which have better boot space but also more seat room to store items in side the car.Another alternative is the AOT [Airports] Limo service - not cheap but very comfy and stylish & for those on an expense budget [ or one that gets past the boss! ]So to sum up - I'd use Airport rail if have say 1 suitcase and a backpack to/from airportIf visitng airport to meet someone or check on flights/buy ticketsPreferably outside rush hoursBut I'd check how close my final destination would be to the stations on the airport link/BTS/MTR stationsOtherwise - use taxi'sIf have lots of luggageIf your destination is a fair distance from BTS/MTR downtownIts the rush hour - may as well relax in back of taxi than stuck on a train/BTS platformNB If Headign for Don Muang Airport from SuvarnabhumiCheck out the direction connection coach service between the 2 airports.If Heading to Don Muang Airport from townRail link is not that reliable - don't trust it if going for a flight.Best option is BTS / MTR to Mo Chit / Chatuchak ParkTake taxi from main taxi rank there [ loads of taxi's ]About c 120-150 Baht to Airport depeneding on trafficThere is a bus from Mo Chit, I'm afraid I've only caught it coming from Don Muang but sometimes thats faster as airport taxi Q can be so longIf getting taxi from Don Muang sometimes easier to ask them to take you to Mo Chit BTS and then you continue on BTS...driver won't be unhappy as he gets back to Don Muang pretty quick for another fare - allow a bit more in this direction say 150-200 Baht because of traffic.I can't remember the bus fare but it's cheap maybe c30 BahtOther alterantive coming into Bangkok from Don Muang is the train - connected to airport by a walk way and basically all trains on the main line stop so plenty of choice & cheap far too - cheaper than the taxi. Takes you to Hua Lamphong main station which is on the MTR.

airport rail is great if convenient. You need to stay near the rail to use the rail as travelling with baggage is not easy. Bangkok is a busy place. Most reasonable accommodation places will come and collect you for about $20-30 AUD depending on if you share the cost, so why bother about the hastle of lugging luggage on and off trains unless you have little luggage. Their transport system is fabulous compared to Adelaide

Super easy to use.. Very convenient for getting into the city. Take half an hour max. Very cheap and no chance of getting stuck in traffic in a taxi. But can be very busy at rush hour and in the evenings,

One of the best rail links in the world. The first time I flew in Bkk the rail link to the new and current airport had not been completed. The trip into the center of a strange city by public was a nightmare. Not only does, or at least at time did, have the slowest moving city traffic in the world there were also no announcement in English. The ride took 90 minutes and I got off near the victory monument. I was lost, confused and frustrated. That's all in the past now. The modern rail link is fast and cheap. You can get from the airport to the city in 25 minutes and for around $1. Forget taking a bus or a tax! The rail link loses one point for not running 24 hours. Flight do land and take off outside the operational time of the rail link, so if you're on a red eye you will need to take a taxi to the airport.
plan more time. We got to the station and the express was not running that day so had to take the airport rail which stops many stops. Do give yourself more time when you travel in BKK.
Punctual. It's cheap and punctual. So no need to worry about the traffict jams that sometimes happens in Bangkok.

great alternative to taxi's. i have used the airport rail link on two occasions , once on my way home and another time on my way into bangkok after landing , i would recommend it if you have arrived and want to an alternative to using a taxi and aren't familiar with how a taxi-meter system works also if you don't have a good command of the thai language ,also if you have a good idea where your hotel is based or if you have travelled to thailand on numerous occassions and you know the layout of the city , the language barrier shouldn't be a problem because the staff all speak english , this is the same for the skytrain which you will have to change to when the rail link comes to the terminal , it is easy to get onto the airport rail link you go down to the ground floor in the airport and it is easy enough to find and use , please note there are 2 rail link lines an express line with no stops that goes straight to the airport and the other line which stops at a few different places , please make sure you allow plenty of time if you are going to the airport , i used it once in the past because it was cheap and no bangkok traffic , buying a ticket is easy and there are plenty of polite , helpful staff on hand to help you should you have a problem

Take the Airport Rail Link!!!. After passing through passport control, get some bahts and your luggage and head for the lowest level to take the Airport Rail Link. It is clean, safe, and FASTEST way to get into town. You can connect to MRT/BTS and or take a cab once in the city. Everything they say about Bangkok traffic is true...a cab takes forever (they aren't that expensive, and they are metered...the problem is sitting in all the traffic). I was alone, first time in Asia and I had no trouble navigating. Why doesn't JFK build one???

Cheap, fast way to airport. This is the third time we have used this efficient way to get to BKK, when departing Thailand. You need to get yourself to BTS Phayathai, where you get the link for 45B. The link is separate from the BTS but in a connected area. We usually find accomodation near a BTS station so that it is handy for our departure. At the station you buy your token at a machine then proceed to the platform downstairs. You can take the fast train or the slightly slower one that stops at all the stations. There is not a big difference in time so just catch whichever one arrives first. The main link runs 2 minutes past the hour. At the airport you will arrive at the bottom floor so proceed to the fourth floor for departure check in. If you are arriving, go downstairs and find the CityLine. There will be signs. As in the reverse, the train will end at BTS Phayathai where you can then exit to taxi to your accomodation or stay upstairs and use the BTS. We find it is a very easy, efficient and cheap way to get to and from BKK.

And more convenience.. I didnt realise this would be a seperate review, but there are 2 trains an hour, the high speed ones dont seem to run so often, but my trip from the airport takes around 20 mins to Makkassan, very handy, the only negative is when you miss a train, it can be a wait til the next one, but for the price who can complain.
Easy and affordable. If you are travelling on your own or with some one else ,the best and quickest way in to bkk ,is the airportlink very good price clean and fast

Cheaper than taking a taxi if you are staying near to the line of skytrain or metro. The Airport Rail Link is the way to get from the new Bangkok airport if your destination is near to the line or on the Skytrain or metro. Beware though it does not operate that frequently, and that travel with large heavy bags is really a no no. This is because you will find that it is quite llikely you have to carry all your stuff up and down stairs.

Good but not if you have large bags. The concept is good but no one seems to have thought out clearly what a person with large bags would do in terms of climbing stairs etc. (and I see the same problem in other places like Seoul also). Probably they think backpackers should use these trains! Secondly a journey fro Swarnabhumi airport to say Ploenchit takes about 45 minutes not including the time to get from the station to your hotel. In off peak times i have done this from hotel to airport in 30 minutes- maximum even in peak times is 50-55 minutes, So in terms of saving time this is not such a great advantage. Lastly, of course you still need a taxi to get from the BTS station to your hotel so you need to add that to you costs (again I have done the airport journey for 280 bhath and adding all the costs here you will save about 150 bhath).Still convenient if you don have bags (or just small bags) and are travelling peak time)

Avoid the hassles. i started paying t 35 baht in the skytrain only recently... I thought that the best way in was always the taxi.... I was wrong ... Fast, efficient, clean and time saving, the Airport train links nicely to the MRT and a few stations later you are at the heart of sukhumvit.So for less hassle and a fraction of the cost... I recommend you head above the traffic for the 18 minute ride to the heart of Bangkok.
Use It!. Cheap, fast, easy way to town from Suvarnabhumi. If you can, use it. A rather long walk from main BTS station.

Handy, Fast, & Reasonably Priced. If you don't live near, or are staying near, an entrance to a toll road, then this is a great way to get to Suvarnabhumi. It's quite fast and cheaper than a cab. But if there are a few of you, and getting to this stop is a hassle, I still find metered cabs on the highway to be the easiest way to get to Suvarnabhumi. Also keep in mind that this is just called the Airport Rail Link, but it only serves Suvarnabhumi. And low-cost flights are now leaving out of Don Muang, which this doesn't go to. But neither do the Sky Train or MRT. Mostly just keep in mind which airport it is you're heading to.

Fast and Efficient - But not the best design. From the airport into the heart of Bangkok this is cheap, fast and safe.I always take the Airport Rail Link from Suvarnabhumi Airport to Makkasan. (cost Bt 35 - $1)From Makkasan I can either take a taxi - or walk for 5 minutes to catch the Bangkok Metro (MRT)The downside.Trains are not very regular.15 - 20 minutes between trains.Trains get very crowded very quickly - if you are in the middle of the train with your luggage, I suggest that you move to the door the stop before.In my experience, taxi drivers don't like taking me to Makkansan Station, when trying to get the train back to the airport. They would rather take you to the airport themselves.Other than that, unbeatable value.Where else can you get an airport train for $1 that takes you to the heart of the city in 20 minutes.Hong Kong is $20.
It doesn't get any better. Most cities would die for such a service, a fast quiet well-kempt service into town. Clean efficient and welcomed. Thanks Bangkok
BEST TO THE CITY. The airport rail link is the best way to get to the city from the Suvernabumi airport.This is the best way to beat the traffic and cost.Then you can take the skytrain to your hotel.
Great way to avoid traffic. It is such easy way to get to the city. At the railway exit there are security guys that call a taxi for you and make sure the taxi uses a meter.
Way better then a taxi.... If your hotel/hostel are close to the BTS or MRT this is the way to go, avoid a taxi and hop on a great, air conditioned train to/from the airport...

Good to travel after flight. Its always better to travel by the Airport Rail Link than to travel by road. You escape the traffic. Very good service. Didn`t get the free internet hours along with the ticket as mentioned on sign board.

Pitiful experience, take a residents advice.. Please everyone, take my advice and TAKE THE TAXI. This airport rain line is pitiful and not worth the time and money. Here's why. First you must schlep all the way down to the ground floor at the airport, walk over to the rail line, buy a ticket, and ride a crowded, narrow train. It rocks back and forth. Makes about 8 stops before reaching downtown Bangkok. Since Bangkok does not have an extensive mass transit system, locals use the rail link to get back and forth to work and school. There is no place to place your bags. Crowded, crowded, crowded. If you have anything bigger than a carry on and traveling with another person or more, take the taxi. Once into Bangkok, you need to carry your bags down a flight of stairs, walk over to the BTS Skytrian, unless your hotel is right there which is unlikely. Buy a ticket and lug our stuff upstairs to the train, which is also very crowded. Then when you get to your stop, you need to carry your luggage back down 2 flights of stairs and also to roll your luggage to the hotel. And who knows how far that is. The airport link cost 45 baht, the skytrain will be about 45 baht, so if 2 or more are traveling, you can take a taxi from door to door for just a little bit more money. I am a resident of Bangkok, not a tourists and have been on the airport link many times, so please do not be fooled by tourist reviews who think this is great. It is not.

Easy to use and get around. After you spend 5min getting climatised to the airport and the bangkok way of doing things you will find out the sky train and standard rail to be quite good.Just be wary about directions, distances and where is a good place to go. we lost a lot of time going to places and misdirections. People here gladly tell you what they feel like. "Just down the road" may infact be 5km away.

Fast!. Its only about £8 by taxi to Central Bangkok but for a different experience try the train to airport link. One train goes direct from Hakkasan station, the other line stops at numerous statios. Good way to see the streets of Bangkok as you travel over head. Also very cheap.

Very convenient. There is not so much to say. The BTS is the most convenient way to travel around Bangkok. No traffic jam, no overcharging taxi drivers... It is clean and has a good frequency. The staff is used dealing with tourists and will usually be able to communicate in english. It gets very crowded during rush hour so you might experience some difficulties entering and leaving it while dragging a huge suitcase and backpack. Despite being the fastest way to go to the airport, keep in mind that the BTS can also have technical problems and delays.I could not use the Airport Express as it was out of order for the entire duration of my stay.

Wouldn't allow my bicycle. I rode my bicycle to the Ramkhumheng station with the intend to take my bike to the green trail at the airport. The authorities wouldn't allow the bike on board, unless it folded in half. They didn't seem to worry about any thing else such as a a greasy chain ( mine was very clean ). The train was not full at the time of my arrival. The authority that refused my bike did so in a friendly way. I think they should reconsider their policy however, as the sky train will allow bicycles. It is a great service other wise.
airport link.. Easy straight forward safe cheap. Our hotel was just out side station. The Sukosol. This station Phayathai you is a good crossover station to other lines to go around city.

Fast and Cheap. Bangkok rail system is one of the most comprehensive network in SEA and this is one of few interconnected.As at December 2014, Only 'Intercity' available as 'The Express' is down for maintenance.

Great rail link!. We used the Airport Rail link to get to and from the airport. It was wonderfully convenient and reliable. We stayed at a hostel at the end of the rail link...which increased the convenience!

Simple, clean and efficient. If your fight arrives with tons of other flights and the queue of the taxi seems to be for forever, this is an efficient, cheap and easy way to get into the city, just be careful if you travel with dozens of bags of heavy luggage...
Best travel within bkk. BTS is a superb way to travel within centric bangkok. Fast. Efficient and effective in all ways. Recommended to be on time and makes the best of Banfkok.

good value. pros:
Avoids traffic jams and having to deal with sometimes not so honest taxi drivers.
con:
Did not extend out to the Old City where we stayed or to several other tourist sites.

Ghastly ! Why bother. How is this an attraction ?? It's an overcrowded train ... Get a taxi or limo they are so cheap and your not huffing and puffing up silly stairs with hieroglyphic tickets ... What a pain

Oh WOW, Why can't we have one of these in Sydney!!!!!!. This is the best thing for transporting huge volumes of people I'v ever seen. Wow, it just works great and absolute value for money.The train is at the new International Airport, pronounced suwannapoo, but not spelt like that. Cost 45thb to use, from airport to end of the line, how cool is that. No more getting my head bashed in from taxi drivers offering to extract as much money from me as possible to take me to Bangkok CBD!!! The system that hooks into this train runs right through Bangkok and once your shown how to use it, it's very easy and convenient. Also, there are people to assist you. Safe and very inexpensive to use. You'll be hooked like most of the Thai people who use it daily.

Economical, Efficient and Clean. An economical, efficient and clean mode of transport if we don't have many luggages to travel to and from Suvarnabhumi airport/city centre. Travelling time around 25 mins. The trains are clean and the ride is comfortable.

A fast and cheap way into town. We chose our hotel so that we could use this link. It was very good. We fairly easily found out how to use the ticket system and it was certainly the cheapest way into the city from the airport which is a distance of 28km. The only fault was a lot of stairs to negotiate with our cases.
excellent n fast. this connection from airport to city is 30 minitues to siam and best and fastest you could reach the city and at lower costs then a taxi

saved my flight. Airport Rail Link (City Line) is perfect way to travel both ways as it covers 28kms from Phaya Thai in about 30 minutes for a mere 45 BAHT. There are no traffic jams, signals, toll gates or cab driver scams. It runs pretty much on time with a minimal delay (2-3 minutes). I took the train at 9PM from Phaya Thai for 10:15PM flight (lesson learnt for next time) and was lucky enough to be in time. There is ample space on board to keep heavy luggage and stand comfortably too. Great job.

Don't use if you have luggage.. We travelled from Suvarnabhumi airport to Paya Tai, relatively inexpensive, but the trains are packed (we used them 3x) this is okay if you have hand luggage, but is not much fun with fully loaded back packs... for a nominal fee more you can travel by taxi which takes you directly to your destination.

Unreliable and difficult to access onward transportation. Arriving from the airport to any station attracts sharks - beware. Access to other public transport difficult and confusing. AOT car the best option.

save time in traffic. perfect way to travel to the airport if you dont have much luggage. it just takes 25 minutes to the international airport whereas the taxi can take more than one hour depending on the traffic. I always use this to get to and from the airport to city

Great way into the city. Airport Rail Link is a great way into the city, without having to deal with shady cab drivers or parking lot traffic. The trains get very full, however. Not for the claustrophobes!

efficient and cheap. Its an efficient , cheap and quick way to get to central Bangkok...from the very bottom of the airport you can choose between express and normal train...the express one is about 3 to 4 euros and takes about 20 minutes to get to the final station which connects with the skytrain.

Fast and convenient way to centre. We had about 7 hours between arrival by domestic flight and international departure, and we planned to use the time for dining in Bangkok. After storing the laggage in the room "Left laggage" near gates Q in departure hall we went down to take a taxi (about 500 bahts). It was after 18.00 and there was a huge line for taxi. So rail link was the best option. City Link price is 45 baht per person and it brings you to final ("terminal") station near the centre. We waited for the train about 10 minutes and the trip took 30 minutes. It was dark and we mostly watched lighted skyscrapers around the elevated railway. I think it is much better in the daytime. The bad thing was that we found no taxi stand on the exit. Few taxi drivers which stopped at the street refused to go to Machalai district we wanted (I think because of short distance and small price). So we had to use tuk-tuk (150 bahts) to get to the restaraunt area. After awalk and dining we returned to airport by taxi (400B from the city). So if you have time and no laggage it is a good option.

Only way for one or two.. We always take this on time, predictable and clean train. If you are more than two then a taxi may be better. The fare to Phaya Thai terminus is 45 Baht and then you have to add a BTS ticket(s) or a taxi. Getting to Bangkok centre can take an age in a taxi, and if you are unfortunate enough to be in rush hour traffic then be prepared to wait...like really wait! A taxi should be about 250 Baht to Sukhumvit. There is 50 Baht charged by the airport that is not shown on the taxi meter. Remember you have to add the tolls. So on balance we will always take the train. And as you are at the start you should get a seat for the 45 minute trip.
marj. It is clean and efficient and runs a regular and fsast service , best way to get to the city center from the airport , priced well .
Easy, quick and good value. Used the raillink to and from Bangkok city. Very easy system and they also announce each station in English.Time from airport to the end station was 30-40 minutes.

Easy to do.. We travelled during rush hour and it was fine. There is space to fit your luggage and sit comfortably. We bought a yellow coin, touched in for our first entry then put in the hole when we got to the airport. Very simple to go up the escalators to the departure lounge, or wait for the lift if you want.
Early flight. If you leave at 7 or earlier the airport link may not give you adequate time. It's worked wonderfully for me as a solo travel. I wouldn't suggest for a group as cabs are so cheap.

"Predictable and easy transportation to the city". On our return from a short journey to Cambodia, my wife and I decided to try out the airpori link rail service. On exit from the customs into the arrival hall the direction to the underground platform is clearly marked. If you are able to manuver the amount of luggage you are carrying easily, this is the best way to reach different parts of the city without getting caught in the unpredictable traffic on the roads and at a fraction of the cost of taking the cab. We can reach the station using escalators moving from one level to the other. On reaching the station there is a reception desk where staff greeted us with the usual Thai warmth and smile. They informed us that the express train was not functioning and that we can take the regular train which goes from the Airport to Phayathai which iis centrally located. We bought our tickets from the vending machine (a member of staff was nearby to help if required). Trains arrive at frequent intervels and very clean and tidy.There was no problem finding a seat near the exit with enough room for our luggage nearby. As we proceed the train gets busy but not overcrouded. We changed at Makkasan, 5 stops away from the airport and walked to Petchabury, a MRT station nearby. the 5 minutes walks took us through a sky bridge over the road and down the escalators to the MRT platform. We bought our tickets for MRT and proceeded to our destination. Between us we had a medium sized suitcase on wheels, back pack and a handbag. We had no issues with the journey which took one hour door to door, including 10 minutes walk at our destination.
time saving transport to the airport. Its an excellent way to travel to the airport. Bangkok traffic is really crazy but this train makes you reach airport within 25 minutes.Really practical.

Excellent... Suvarnabhumi airport is nearly 25-30 kms away from bangkok city. But if you are connected on BTS then you can board this train from Phayathai which is on BTS and in 45TBH (in Dec 2014) you can reach to the lowest level of airport in just 20-25 mins. Wonderful facility.

Ease of Use. From the airport with your "lightweight" luggages, you can easily avail yourselves of this mode of transport (even if there are a few of you that you would expect a cab to be convenient). This method of transport is much faster and avoids traffic jams when you arrive in the earlier part of the morning! Look into choosing accommodation near the BTS.

Express line out of order but still a good choice. Only 1 us to makasan station then up and change to silom road or wherever you have to go for another dollar. Better than a cab...and safer :)Safe ,fast and slightly airconditioned

Convenient. Why fight the Bangkok traffic? Take the airport rail link as it is cheap and hassle free. Often time if you're taking a cab back to the airport, the driver will not use the meter & instead give you a surprise fare upon arrival. The couple downsides on Airport Rail Link is (1) Express Train is currently not runnng (As of Jan. 2015) due to government corruption & mainteance problems (2) Avoid rush hours when you can.

One of the best way to travel to and from airport. We used Rail Link service to travel to the airport and it’s an awesome service 15minutes and you inside the airport terminal. Whereas taxi would have taken roughly around 45min-60min depending on traffic.

Easy to access many parts of BKK with this Link. Used to take cabs from the airport to the hotels on my many previous trips to BKK. This Train Link makes many parts of BKK more accessible from the airport. Very cheap too.

brisk walk. only about a 10 minute walk, altho with luggage make sure u get a cab...be careful with $$ tho...make sure u agree on price b4 or have the driver turn on meter because they will all try to cheat you.

Excellent value. After many times in Bangkok we used this link for the first time having watched it being built over the years. It;s a perfect way to get into the city and saves the angst of the traffic queues into the city. Highly recommended unless you have vast amounts of baggage when it would probably be better to use another form of transport.

Fast, economical and easy. Took the City Rail (Blue Line) to Praya Thai. Simple, fast only 45 Baht single. Made mistake of taking a taxi to guesthouse (180 Baht). Should have taken the Skytrain from Praya Thai (42 Baht). .

Easy to use, only 45 baht a person. We tried the airport rail link without bags, just to know for the future when we come back. Easy to use, not expensive.Very busy, both ways. If you have a big luggage maybe not so advisable.

The fastest and cheapest way to reach airport and city centre. Best mode of transport to move around the City and reach airport. The Metro Link is free of rush and quite easily accessible from the City Centre near Indira Market.
Why Taxi. cheap , frequent , fast , clean this is the most practical way to travel between the airport and city , link with MTR will get you close to where you are wanting to go

Comfortable journey. Airport link is best, comfortable and cheap means of travelling from Suvarnabhumi airport to many interesting places available 0600 hrs to 2400 hrs in Bsngkok. If at ease and not in hurry, I recommend all travellors to travel by airport link and enjoy. I travelled from airport to silom by airport link via Phayathai and then changed to bts silom line
Good Connectivity to parts of Bangkok. Well laid out connections for travelers within Bangkok city. It is quite safe and very well exploited mode of travel

Efficient and best way from Airport to Bangkok City. Very good experience travel on the Airport rail link, with no jammed comfort, and you can stop at Makkasan to change to MRT, you can take MRT to Sukhumvit BTS sky train, so choose your hotel wisely, take a hotel with minimum walking from MRT or BTS. Then you can save your times and bit the traffic jammed when travel with taxi.
Easy to use. Don't bother with the taxi especially if you can manage with your luggage. It is convenient, easy to use and much much cheaper.

The Greatest Transportation in Thailand. Great people, great ( and cheap ) way of going from Marriot Vacation Club , Sathorn road ,to the airport. On our first day in Bangkok , my teachers ( 5 teachers from SMFI Paranaque) and I went By taxi from the airport to hotel. We paid 500 baht plus toll and taxes of another 200 baht. It's also very convenient since it was very early in the morning and we know nothing about Bangkok. But once we exhausted our money for taxis, we resorted to using the different railway stations. And it turned out cheaper. It cost only 15 baht to get from one station to another. And surprise ! Only 45 baht from Phaya tai to the airport- and at a much shorter time, too.The people are very friendly. If you get lost, somebody will help u. Ticket office staff speak English, some instructions are in English and try to get hotel staff write down, in Thai script, the places you are going to. Bangkok is a beautiful place and see most of it using their trains.

The way to go. Taking the airport link to the city is certainly worth considering during traffic hours and rain!
the switch to the MRT (subway) at Macasan station is quite a walk,... now they installed the connection bridge,... before you had to walk unpaved sidewalk with suitcases making it quite a challenge,...

Best way to reach Downtown. The rail link station is located at level B1 in suvarnabhumi airport. We had to reach Phaya Thai station as it was the nearest to our hotel. We took the 8:20 am train to Phaya Thai. The train was already full with people at the airport even though that was the 1st station. And it only started getting more crowded. We were 3 of us with 6 bags, so we stood in the end of the carriage where there were no seats (it was also the only place left when we entered the carriage). That is the best place to stand if you have luggage like ours so that you dont come in the way of people getting in and out. Most of the people got off at makassan station. We reached phaya thai station in 30 mins, which is the scheduled travel time. At the train station there were taxis available.The ticket cost us 45 baht per person and is the best mode of transport during the rush hours and also the cheapest if you are travelling to downtown.

Convenient but crowded. We took the City Line (the blue one) to Phayathai where conveniently links with the Sky train. As the City Line is a commuter train, there are many passengers. In general it's a perfect form of transportation to travel from the city centre to the airport: fast, cheap and frequent.
old train. takes half an hour from Payathai to the Suvannabhumi airport. the train is very old and loud when stopping.

Why no escalators. We took the airport link into Bangkok as the queue for taxis was so long. As generally with Bangkok Airport, everything is big and far, as is the station. It is very easy to use the link and it is a fast and cheap way into central Bangkok. The only problem is that at the terminus you have to lug your bags down stairs and then lug them up again to connect with the BTR, could someone not have thought of escalators, I would hate to do this in summer.

Easy way to avoid traffic. Its always easy to travel by Rail link for airport to save time and money too. No tension of traffic too. The train is also very fast and connects airport sooner than a taxi or a hired car.

Convenient way to get into BKK from Suwannaphum. If travelling alone or with only one other, it's the most economical way to get to BKK from SIA. It can get a little crowded though, especially when you have lots of luggage.
Great service. Better and quicker than taxi. Fast and efficient. Tickets available at basement level of airport. About a quarter the cost of a taxi.

Responsibility of a traveler. Well, sometimes people make a review because it is too good to be missed or sometimes it is so bad that it is so bad that you would wish the other people don't repeat your mistake and this is a review of the later.OK, I visit Bangkok so often that some part of the city I probably can walk blindfolded (plus a stick) - but - be realistic, taxi or limo in Bangkok is not expensive and do yourself a favor. The Airport link is a bad joke, even for people like me that always travel light, and for those travel with large checked luggage, please avoid it.

cost saving. Took train to Phaya Thai only cost 90 baht by City Line, as express line is not in operation. The passenger standing area is narrow; bulky luggage is not suitable for the train as it will block the walk way with luggage on each side.

Rail link. Excellent way to get into Bangkok . 2 trams one goes non stop although at the moment it has work done on it . The other has several stops so a little slower ,both terminate at monorail connection .

Brilliant way to get around Bangkik. The rail link in Bangkok is one of the best I have been on. The trains are clean and run on time. The maps are clear and the cost is low compared to catching cabs etc.. I find the traffic chaotic in Bangkok however the trains are a much easier option.

Very cheap and convenient. The Express seems to have been cancelled. But The City Line is cheap and fast enough - just 5 stops from the airport and costing just 45 Baht perhaps the cheapest airport train service in the world. Much better than going by taxi and fighting the traffic jams.

Airport Rail Link. Located at B2 of the airport, it is a convenient way of travelling to the hotel if your hotel is near the BTS. Need to change at Phaya Thai (mostly) to connect to the BTS. The express train broke down on my visit so took the normal one. About 35 minutes ride from the airport to Phaya Thai. Only 45bath. Clean and convenient.Take a deep breath and exhale if you see passengers piling their luggages/bags on the seats....most inconsiderate for some of these people. The thai people don't do that. Will be good to show some respective and civic mindedness when in someone else's land.

Easy!. The Airport railway is the easiest and cheapest way to travel from the Airport to BKK City and the other way around. We stayed in the Eastin Grand Hotel Sathorn (very nice hotel) and it took us about 20 minutes (90 Baht) to get there. Good solution for people who do not want to spend so much money for a taxi or tuktuk.
good transportation. You can go to Suvanaphum airport conveniently by taking this rail link. There are many stations for u to choose from for example Phrayathai (first station) ^^

BKK to Downtown. The rail link is very convenient and easy to understand and be a big help if you do not want to spend too much on the taxi ride to the airport and also to escape the traffic of Bangkok.

Perfect form of transportation. Perfect form of transportation, very fast and reliable. It's unfortunate that the express line is out of order, yet the remaining line is also a quick way to get to the center of Bangkok. For about BHT45 you go to the last stop.

Could have been so much better.... This was meant well but executed horribly, expect not enough space inside the train, the lift and stairs where there should have been escalators. Few seats and extended waiting times. Limited information and difficult access from the MRT.Of course Taxi mafia when you finally get down.I could save you a good deal of time though if you get there as the train arrive...And some money if you arrive at rush hour. Hopefully in the future it will get better.

Easy, clean, fun. The Thai police, security, traffic controllers, ticket people.... everybody, tries to make sure you get on the right bus, train, plane, etc. they are really nice and helpful. So taking the airport train was a breeze!
Clean, fast, cheap. Everything a modern link should be - the railway system works well and you never wait long for a train.

Important transportation in Bangkok . Airport rail link is one of the important transportation in Bangkok. It runs from airport to Payathai station and it's important for daily commute like me. I would suggest visitors to avoid taking trains in office hours and try to take express train for airport transfer rather than public transfer train.Currently the train operating hours are adequate but the frequency is not. So, I hope to see improvement in this area though it's quite difficult for airport express and Normal train to Co-exist on same track.
so quick. it is definitely the best way to get to the airport. very fast, reliable and cheap! air conditioned and clean!

super convenient. i use this to receive people a the airport. Its also a great way to reach the city if travelling light or going to a hotel/condo which is right by the bts line. Its not the best option for travellers with heavy or many luggages as there are stairs leading to the station and seats are not always available on the train.

Efficient Service. The Airport link train service in Bangkok is very inexpensive, efficient and stress free. We chose this route not because of cost but because the roads in Bangkok are so congested that this was by far the most time saving way to travel. The Station inside the airport was well signposted and easy to find and leaflets provided showing the various stops and routes.Taxi service was available from local stations then to the hotel. The trains were very smooth and afforded a good view of the City. Most impressed and a good way to avoid the busy roads.

Nice price. The airport link fees was cheap, I just paid 35 Thai Baht for my single trip. I disliked the airport link was too limited space for passengers. No enought space to keep the luggages and belongings.
Super clean!. This, like the BTS, is very clean, safe, and reasonably priced.My only complaint is that I wish that the trains were more frequent.

Very convenient for the weary traveler. This links the main airport to the city center. My first visit to Bangkok, this wasn't available so I had to arrange a limousine or taxi. Having the airport rail link easier for travelers to go to the airport. However, I arrived Bangkok in the early morning so it was really empty, if you flight is in the popular time slot, expect the train to be crowded. If you have a lot of luggages, it might be better to take the taxi for convenience.
get on. it was very good to catch this train i recomend it to people who are interested in savinf money for other things

Busy train. Took the airport rail link to pick up somebody from airport. A lot of people into only two wagons. Works if you are close to the train station. For 2 people from the airport I would take a

Faster, cheaper and easier than a taxi!. If you are thinking of taking the Airport Rail Link, I say go for it! We took a taxi to Bangkok and were stuck in traffic for what felt like hours. We decided to to the Airport Rail Link on our way back and found it to be a much more pleasant experience. So easy, and if you feel unsure of what to do the people at the information booths are very helpful.

A quick way to get into Bangkok. There are two lines operating - the city line, which stops at all stations, and the express line which has limited stops. You can take both from the lowest floor from Suvarnabhumi airport. Getting to the concourse is no hassle and straightforward. The express line was out of service when I visited, but that's no problem as the city line is cheaper and not much slower than the express line. It would take about 30 minutes to reach the last stop and there are several stops where you can connect to the BTS and MRT systems. Mind you, the city line train does not have much space to keep baggage, so if you have 5 or 6 huge suitcases, a cab maybe a better option. The total cost from Suvarnabhumi airport to Phaya Thai were the line ends is 45 baht per person, so its cheap for solo travellers or possibly groups with upto 4 members. Otherwise, it maybe cheaper to go by taxi which is more convenient and cheaper as taxi charges will be about 300 baht. The only advantage is that the train is faster compared to the traffic ridden streets of Bangkok, where even a five hour time advantage can vanish and you find yourself running around the huge hallways of Suvarnabhumi airport trying to find your flight!
