Bangkok Airport Rail Link. It is the fastest and less expensive way to reach the city of Bangkok from Sivurnabhumi Airport, since the fare is approx. US$ 1.50 each trip, and takes exactly 30 minutes. Only carry-on luggage is recommended, due to the number of passengers. Highly recommended.

Quick & simple way to get into the city. If you don't want to deal with taxi's & the fluctuating fares prices that tend to occur, then the airport link is perfect. It is quick and connects up with the other lines so your can reach hotels/the airport with ease.

Easy Peasy. A great way to get from the airport. As long as you know your stop but all is explained well. Gets crowded and if you have a suitcase make sure you are by the door so you can get off easily.

We were delighted to discover the train system. If you haven't tried this train, give it a go, make the effort to find your way to it, it is cheap, safe and easy. Take it to the nearest stop to your hotel ,then get a taxi if needed.

If you want to Khao San Road.... exit at "Phaya Thai Station" and you have to pay about 120bath for a TukTuk, what could be really nice after a long flight...So you get in the mood of Thailand and you can enjoy the climate!

Take it to reach centre faster. ARL is a good way to reach Phaya Thai on the main BTS line. Unfortunately the express airport link has been suspended so you will have to endure 7 stops of the ARL but this is still good time management as you will avoid incoming Bangkok trafic.

quick, cheap, clean. Traffic in Bangkok is horrendous!!! If you book a hotel not too far from one of the airport link stations you can walk to and from or get a cheap taxi. Only cost me 40bht on the train each way. You'll save money and a lot of time.
Efficient. Takes you to city centre in a jiffy. No need to waste time in taxi or bus. It takes about 45 minutes to reach in the heart of the city.

Best Mode of Transport away from Airport. I took airport rail link in the basement which is a fast reliable service without a hassle.It cost 45 Baht in City line from Swarnabumi to PayaThai. A taxi will charge you ten times more!.

Fast link to Airport. The Airport Rail Link transports you to the Airport in no time.
Some of the BTS stations do not have elevators or escalators for travelers with big luggage accessing the skytrain.

Cheap and fast way to get to the city. At 45 baht per way, the airport rail link is definitely the choice of transport from the international airport, although I'm not sure why they took away the express line. However if you have lots of luggage or traveling with kids, then you may want to take a cab to your hotel when you reach Paya Thai BTS as the BTS stations do not have down-riding escalators.
convenient. Easy to use and convenient to get to and from Suvarnabhumi. Connects with BTS at Phaya Thai so it is easy to get around.
eay. The rail link is the best way to get to the city , very efficient and fast and avoids the terrible traffic .

Way to go!. How can anyone visit Bangkok and not take advantage of one of the most efficient mass transits in the world? Clean, comfortable, good announcements for stations! The one deficiency is that it does not go to the BMK (Don Mueang airport) but does go to the newer airport.

Cheap and quick. AirconditionedCheapQuickReliableIf you're going from Bangkok Suvarnabhumi to KhaoSan Road. Don't get a taxi. It will cost you about 400 baht in a taxi and take around 45 min. Instead, take the train to Phaya Thai train station for 40 baht and then take a taxi (with the meter on) to KhaoSan Road. It will take around the same amount of time but come in at half the price.
Great and reliable service. easy to use and really fast! staff is helpfull and friendly. easy to use from and to the airport. cheap and fast option for transportation

Surprisingly modern. The airportlink from the main airport is suprisingly very modern similar to the ones you find in London or any other European City. It is very cheap too. I did not pay more than 50 Bath. However the way to the main trains station (City Centre) is quite long, about 45 minutes and the trains are croweded so you won´t find a place to sit easily. Anyway you still have to take a Tuk Tuk from the Trains Station, which is the last stop of this train. I am not really sure how much the taxi from the airport is, but is probably better to catch a cab from the airport as most turist do. (There was not any european in the train except me :))

fantastic. very good service ( City Line the express line doesn't work) on time , and fantastic to avoid traffic and taxis in BKK.It stop at MRT or Sky train so you can go wherever you want in BKK.Fantastic !

Save money and time. Liked
- Save money and time
Disliked
- But damn crowded as some of the local also taking to other place.

Wow. Perfect way to go to the airport ,fast and cheap no hassles whatsoever ,Bangkok puts a lot of western cities to shame the way it moves people around ,just look at Sydney ..what a joke that place is

Fast, Efficient and Inexpensive. You can travel very cheaply to or from the airport to the Payathai station, which interchanges with the Skytrain. From there, Bangkok is open to you. The journey takes about 30 minutes and frequency is regular. It is a much cheaper option than taking a taxi however be aware that, if you have large amounts of luggage, you may struggle once you get to the Skytrain, which is almost always very busy

Airport Rail Link - a difficult choise. Using the airport Rail Link is ok, the problem comes at the end of your trip, especially when you are carrying a lot of luggage.Most of the stations have only 1 elevator (waiting) and the real hassle is the Taxi at the end of your trip. Many times they don't want to take you, especially when they have to go to the Prathu - Nam Area where we live. So it is one of these things whether you take a taxi right away from the airport or not. Without luggage it is fantastic !!
Best way 2 travel. Airport Rail Link is best way to travel , fast and easy. can avoid heavy traffic jams and saves lot of time

Efficient and easy to use. We used the Sky Train whenever we could during our stay in Bangkok. It was super easy and convenient if you're familiar with other tube lines. We took the Airport Rail Link to the airport from our hotel. We left from the National Stadium at 9am and were at the airport after about an hour. There is an express line but it wasn't running so we just took the regular one.
so easy. it just seem to work as it should cheap and efficient what else is there to say its a rail link runs every few mins into the city beats the hell out of the dodgy taxis

great in concept but lacks in execution. I can see how this works from the airport to downtown but the other way is terrible. I wanted to avoid the crazy Bkk traffic trying to get to the airport so I tried the airport rail link. I took a taxi to the station. I then proceeded to wait on an non air conditioned platform for 25 minutes waiting on a train. It was unbearably warm wait. So much that I had to change clothes when I got to airport. It is a big miss not to have an air conditioned place to wait for the train. Will not do it again from Bkk to airport. Rather sit in traffic

Use it Friday night if you go to town without any bag. It took a long, long, long time to finish. I mean to get some trains running on the track. It finally opened a couple of years ago. There are two types of trains going into Suvarnabhumi airport on the same track. A non stop one and a slower one.A taxi into BKK will run you meter : around 200 B (+ or - depending on traffic), plus 50 B surcharge + toll if any 75 B soon to go up. The Express will cost you over 100 Baht and, like just about every train will drop you off at the train station from where you will need to take a train - underground MRT APat Makhasan or sky train - BTS at Phaya Thai or a taxi or both..Alternatively you take the regular train to town. Price varies on destination but is a fraction of the Express.Now when you off load you have escalators at Makhasan and steps at Phaya Thai. Not convenient with luggage. A walk and another queue to buy your ticket. The only time it is worth it is Friday nights from 5 to 9 when traffic from the airport to BKK and in town is horrendous.But there again, not easy if you have suitcases.Last, but not least, the airline check in ( like in Hong Kong) does not operate... So really, not much benefit except if you have spent all your money and need to go to or from the airport. Sure is better and faster than walking.

Fast and efficient.. You can't beat this rail link to the airport for convenience. The cost is unbelievable compared to most cities. Accessible from the BTS Sky Train, it's super convenient. Air conditioned. Clean. Fast.
Locate this place. Your travelling between air port and central of Bangkok goes a lot quicker than take a TukTuk or a hustling taxidriver.Comfortable and quick

Fast, Convenient, Value for Money. Fastest and most reliable way to get into heart of Bangkok. Its excellent value for money and runs all-day. Definitely recommended if you are travelling in peak periods when traffic on road can just come to a halt.

Best way to get downtown. If you know just a little bit about the MRT in Bangkok you will want to be sure and use this cheap, efficient, and fast mode of travel to downtown. But plan to pull your luggage to the transfer station.

Good Transport system. Airport Rail Link is a very good transport system in Thailand. It is a express train. It connects the Airport and the City. We can join with the BTS & MRT subway train systems at two locations through this Airport Reail Link. I preferred to visit Thailand mainly because of their transport system in the city. It takes about 30 mnts to go to Thailand city. Trains are available every 30 mnts from early morning to midnight. Train comes to inside the Airport. We could easily find the station at the Swarnabumi Airport. Sign boards are available. Nice train. Less people. Save money. Very good option for transportation.
Easy and Cheap. from the airport to my hotel 45 min and about $2took train from BKK (follow signs) to Makasan transfer to MRThelpful people or use machines (coins)
Convenient and cheap. Very convenient and cheap way to go airport which is only 45baht, can drop by Siam Paragon using BTs for some souvenirs as just 2 next the station.
Easy and inexpensive. This is definitely the best way to travel into Bangkok. Whatever you do don't take a taxi or you will be sitting in traffic for hours!
A good service. So easy to take the train. the first time I visited Bangkok I took a cab and it took 2 hour to get into the centre, but the train is so easy and quick

fast and good way to go to bkk. the train is fast with no stops from bkk airport to city and have another one with many stops...The price is really good considering many things, and it pass by every 30 minutes (as I recall it)For 1 or 2 persons it would be much cheaper than taxi and faster in many times
Convenient and a lot more economical than taking a taxi.. Sometimes the train gets too crowded and this will be a problem if you're traveling with large/heavy luggage.

Great way to beat Bangkok traffic. Fast, on time, and great way to beat busy Bangkok traffic during peak traffic periods. Early in the morning or late at night though (assuming no traffic), taxi still quicker.

Easy to access. The airport rail link is affordable, understandable and easy to use. It moves about 160kmph and it is in use from 6am until midnight. It is clean and there is security around at all times. Just ensure that you know the name of the station near your destination and if in doubt ask. You may get an English speaking teller!

Good and convienent to travel. The Airport rail link is good fro travelers in bangkok. You can take the rail link fro the basement of airport itself for most of the places in city, which is very economical and time saving since the city is having very high traffic, particularly at time of office hours.
fast but crowded. it is the cheapest and fastest way to get from airport to city. but with more people trying to save money and use the airport rail, it is getting really crowded.
Great place to start your Bangkok trip. Choose this link if you don't have too much luggage. You will save lot of money and time that you would otherwise spend on taxi.

Love the train. Airport to Makkasan 25 minutes, not a single red light along the way. Drops you off at the MRT (Tube) where you can hail a cab for the last part of the journey or jump on the tube. Cheap as chips and always on time. You cannot say that about an airport taxi who will regularly drop you off ‘near’ to your destination – as much as two hours later and with you now lost because when he tells you its near he means he has no idea.

Great Link if you have NO LUGGAGE and enjoy adventure !. The Airport Rail Link is an inexpensive way for back packers to get in and out of the city quickly and inexpensive. A one way local ticket which makes various stops is 50 baht, less then 2 dollars US and the Express ticket that takes you from the City to the airport in 20 minutes is 70 baht, about 70 cents more. I don't understand why anyone would take a local link. The problem with the Airport Link is that it brings you to this huge station which has no direct access to the BTS Sky train. You need to leave the Air Link station and then go up stairs to get access to the BTS to the rest of the city, I addition because the Air Link station leaves you in a desolate section of the city, if you don't use the BTS Sky link in is nearly impossible to get a taxi around the area of the Airport Rail Link Station. But when my friend and I had just a roller bag to to to Singapore for the weekend. We used the BTS to the Airport Link and we saved about 20 dollars US in taxi fare, plus the Rail link is faster during rush hours. My suggestion is use a taxi at the airport. For 300-400 baht you can get any where in the city with your luggage. 10-15 dollars US. Avoid the Rail link unless you enjoy adventure.
Fast and cheap. As the title says, fast and cheap, and a interesting alternative for a long taxi drive in a traffic congested Bangkok, especially when you need to be in downtown.

Lifts and escalators needed at other connecting stations. Tried this for the first time. Love it for the reliability of the service and not being at mercy of taxi drivers who always refuse to turn on meter for tourist. However, the connecting stations after the airport rail need to have escalators and lifts. We travelled to National Stadium station and found that there are no escalators for lifts when we change train at Siam station and when we alighted at National Stadium.

Very fast and cheap. It was a very comfortable ride to the airport. Take the non-express train because it is so much cheaper than the express train. It is very convenient because you avoid the monstrous traffic.

Easy to use and gets you in to town quick. Well sign posted when you arrive go threw immigration walk threw nothing to declare turn right walk past people picking up tourist you will see escalators go down two floors turn right and the office is there also you can use money pick your station pop your cash threw the slot take ticket don't get the one that stops every station get the Airport express hope this helps

Crowded and expensive. Its not worth the effort. Its crowded. You have to stand in long queue to enter the train and then you are sandwiched. If you have kids, please opt for taxi. I really struggled with my one year old. No one gives up their seat for mother and infant.
Excellent service. Airport link by far is one of the best logistics Bangkok has. Convenient even for travelers with more than just a back pack.
Sky train BTS. We spend 5 days In Bangkok and we took the Sky train several Times. The train has air conditionate and the price one Way is around 40 Bath. This is the Brest transport In town.

Easy to use, much faster and cheaper than by taxi to go to downtown. It's really convenient for most tourists and local people travelling between airport and downtown. Much cheaper than go by taxi. Really recommend taking airport rail link when travelling in traffic peak hours.

Bangkok airport rail link... very good, could be much better. The Suvarnabhumi airport rail link promised to be an exciting new way to get in and out of Bangkok, when it eventually, finally came on line. True, it is a major step forward from taxies and traffic jams. It's a cheap, quick and comfortable way to get from the airport to, at its final station Phya Thai which connects to the main BTS line that straddles Sukhumvit. Or Makkasan, the station before. All good, thank you. One wonders why it's restricted to 3 or 4 carriages, because it's nearly always full to overflowing. More carriages equals more comfortable travel, I would have thought. It appears as though budget cuts might have kicked in by the end of the planning of the project. As a frequent Bangkok visitor, it was noticed that the infrastructure was set in place for YEARS before the trains actually started running. Anyway, on balance, it's good and useful. It might be nice if it ran 24 hours in stead of 18. Thank you.

Fast, safe and cheap. But I wish they can design better with more escalators. Sometimes too many people try to get out and get in so too crowded on a small platform. And it's quite hot in the summer. But in general, it's very fast, safe and so cheap to go to airport.

Fast & Efficient. Fast and easy transportation mode to get to the city. Very clean and spacious. Had a nice time looking out the clean window to get a good view of the city surroundings. Took us about 35mins to get to Ratchaprarop Station .

If you are solo and want to avoid BKK traffic.. It is worth to use the airport link if you wanna avoid the traffic. only down side is not operating after midnight. Anyway, traffic is better in late night...

useful and cheap rates to go to airport n back. so long as u have not much luggage n travelling alone. easy access via cab to any of the stations and go up the escalator , buy your token at an atm n you are on. may get crowded periodically, luggage has no storage facility on train so keep that in mind

trip to air port. if you didnt bring so many travel bags then it is better to use airport rail link to go to the airport. it is save your time and money because on office hour bangkok's traffics are very busy, if use taxi you will be trapped in a traffic jam for hours and miss the plane, so count your estimate time longer when use a taxi to the airport.

Missing link. Having a rail link is a great idea. I have been coming to Bangkok for much longer than this rail link is around so it's a welcome addition. It's really odd that they won't use the express train. This local is PACKED leaving town at some parts of the day and after the last stop before the airport you see who would like the express. A lot of people are still on. The last time I used this leaving town people actually couldn't get on at some stops. Too full! If you are in town get off at Markkasan and see the brand new station completely ready to accept the express. On the sign it says cancelled. Who cancels a project after it is complete? The Land of Smiles! That's who!
Quick and efficient. Definitely the best and quickest way to travel into the centre of Bangkok with links to the sky train.

Cheap alternative to get to city. Train is clean and transport fast to get to phaya thai. There will be helpful officers who can advise you on the ticket price and the correct platform to board. Just note that you will need coins to purchase the tickets.

Efficient and easy. Loved the efficiency of the airport rail when i arrived in Bangkok. Very fast and not too crowded. The only draw back is if one has a lot of luggage. I only had one bag so it was not a problem. I will definately use this again if i need to go to the airport in the middle of the day instead of going through all the traffic.

Good Connection. The train station is spacious and clean. The fares are cheap and reasonable. The best way to connect to Prathunam area like Platinum Fashion Mall with about 10 minutes walking distance. The waiting time is a bit longer compared to Skytrain and Metrolink where you could wait above 16 minutes for the next train.
Quick Way to get around. A very fast and cheap way to get around, especially if you arrive during rush hour. The train is only 20 minutes from Suvarnabhumi Airport to Payathai Station.
An amazing way. Found this was so great for the distance from the airport to the BKK center.it was cheap and fast but it is a bit inconvenient if you travel with many bags :)
Easy way in and out of Bangkok. It seems that the express line has stopped, the city line is just 35 baht to the airport. Fast and cheap!
Speedy link into BKK. It's around 55 bahts a ticket (just over £1 ish) and take 30 minutes to get to Siem (centre BKK).Compared to London where the same ticket costs around 20 times the amount....!

Best way to and from the airport. apart from rush hour this is a restful and inexpensive way to get to the airport. I recently was on my way home from BKK during morning rush hour and was stunned by the crowds. It would appear that many people catch the outbound train, stay on board at BKK for their journey into the city. This way they get a seat and can actually get on the train. I was not able to get a seat due to the number of people who did not disembark at the airport ( this is the last stop) and was squeezed like never before by the crush of folks boarding the triain. There are seven stations on this route. Many had to wait for the next train, which must be a problem as trains are only once every 20 or 30 minutes, whereas the BTS ( Skytrain) is literally every three minutes. Hence the squeeze i.e. People needing to be on time for work. It beats a taxi, especially during rush hours. Its 40 Baht, about $1.30 and takes about 30 minutes.

Very helpful staff. While coming from airport to city we forgot our bagpack on the train shelf. By the time we realized the train had left, we informed the security and they had the train checked at its destination, our bags were found and returned to us.

Quick & Convenient Ride to City. Fastest way to reach city and most cost effective way if you do not have much luggage to carry. Do expect it crowded, Locals are very friendly if they find any one with kids they offer their seats.

Very poor. The express line was good, but since that is now cancelled I wouldn't bother taking the city line. It's now 15 minutes from train to train and you are forced onto the long city line. It takes 25 minutes now to get to makasan station (was around 10) and in far less comfort. The best part? They won't tell you there is no more rail link until you get to the airport! Wonderful! Do yourself a favor and just take a taxi!

Fast reliable and cheap. Connecting Bangkok Airport with Centre. The price is 15b + 5 bath for every stop or 45bath all the way to the centre. Safe and modern way to travel to and from airport without worries about traffic jam. Run from 6 - 24h.

VERY GOOD. This rail link to the city center is the best way to avoid the traffic jam of Bangkok.This is the fastest and cheap way to go to the city or get to the airport its clean.You tranfer to the metro rail link and go to the different part of the city center

Excellent transportation. Airport link is an excellent transportation to the city, from the airport in Bangkok. It's fast good and very low priced. The end station at Phayai Thai connect with the Skytrain also.
easy and quick. This is a great way to get to the airport especially during high traffic times. it is fast and comfortable and keeps you from sitting in traffic worrying about when you'll get there

Really efficient. In my opinion the best way to and fro from the airport to the city. Cost effective and easy to use. It helps you avoid all the city traffic and let you relax and not worry about reaching the airport in time.

quicker option. the non-stop is quicker but if you want a cheaper and laid back travel choose the city line. The Airport link express takes directly to the departure area. If you are go green freak and backpacker go for it.

Mediocre instead of excellent.. The Airport Rail Link in Bangkok should be an excellent mode of transportation for travelers from Bangkok to Suvannaphum Airport. The whole project was loosely structured by the previous government with a lot of grand ideas. The only problem is that they did not connect all the dots in order to make the concept work. The whole idea is to bring passengers from and to the city to and from airport in a holistic way which mean their hotel or home. The missing link is the difficulty in getting-in and getting-out from the Airport Rail Link Bangkok Station. The time wasted in the traffic jam around the station discouraged most passengers. Hence the Airport Rail Link Bangkok Station is almost like a ghost station since it started. Hope one day something can be done to make use of the rail link.

Quickest Way to Get to Bangkok. The Airport Rail Link is the quickest way to get in and out of Bangkok. The BTS can be caught from the Airport Rail Link, and a cheap taxi ride can be acquired to get to your hotel. However, a metered taxi must be found, or a negotiated rate. If you don't know what you're doing, the taxi drivers will try to charge you six times more than the ride should cost, which would negate any savings made from catching the cheap Airport Rail Link. A ride into Bangkok takes about 25 minutes. When I went back to the airport and took a taxi, it was 1 hour and 20 minutes.

Cheap and Quick Way to Reach Your Hotel from Airport. I took the Airport Rail Line from my hotel besides BTS Siam to the Airport. It was my first time trying this method of travel. I usually take the meter taxis to and fro the airport.The transfer station is BTS Phaya Thai. From BTS Phaya Thai to the airport, it only cost THB45 and 30 minutes of journey time. This is in contrast to about THB350 (based on meter fare and highway toll charges) if you take the taxi from the airport to the hotel and more than 60 minutes of journey time with traffic jams.PLEASE DO NOT TAKE TAXIS WHOSE DRIVERS DO NOT TURN ON THEIR METERS AND CHARGE YOU A FLAT RATE OF THB500.The Airport Rail Line is certainly the best mode of transport from airport to your hotel as it is so cheap, fast and without jams.

Update. Anyway I've been to BKK before but this is the only time when the express train is not in service which starts from the airport to Makassan station (1st stop) if I remember correctly.Anyway I've asked around and it seems the express train service is being terminated indefinitely. Regardless if it's true or not, traveling by train to the city is definitely faster, cheaper and safer than taxi

Excellent way to get around town. The sky train is an overhead very modern train system that is affordable, air conditioned and fast compared to local traffic. Use it to get yourself into an area then complete your journey locally with taxi Tuk Tuk or scooter ride service.

MRT is the best. Did everything by Skytrain. It´s easy to go everywhere but the historic part of the city. We got in Bangkok and took the Airport Rail link to our hotel, it was really easy to find everything.
Quick and cheap. Easy walk from arrivals to station, easy ticketing, regular trains, smooth ac travel to a large station with access to transport. Couldn't be better.
Convenient and cheap way to town. Convenient and cheap way to town. 45baht. It is very crowd in the morning (airport to town) and in the evening (town to airport). Not sure other timing.
ZIP to your destination. Convenient and the best. This takes you into the heart of bangkok, and MOST likely you will have to change trains to get to your destination

your choice of no hassle. The airport link train , is absolutely the best way to get to and from the city, no waiting in a taxi with traffic , like myself i am happy to use the taxis but i like to be moving , so the airport link is far cheaper far quicker, and you have the option of going express for a little more money, When the summer is here and the air con engulfs you on the train you will be ,very happy you made that choice, Once at Phaya thai station a quick trip down the stairs or escalator and you then can jump on to the sky train , just as cheap to where ever you are staying..SO airport, down to the first floor follow the people , change for notes at the station or use the counter , get your disc and scan it over the disc machine walk through, i have used this service so many times , i think your choice will be the same,

If the express line had been operational I would rate 'excellent'. The only disappointment we had was that the express line was not operating on the day we traveled so the train we took stopped at all stations into the city. Despite that it was still a faster journey than by road and much less expensive. The ticketing arrangements are easy and as with the other Skytrain services, the facilities and equipment are clean and appear well maintained

Super speedy!. This is the first time I took the airport rail and I am impressed! It barely took me 30 minutes to reach my destination which is the second last stop of the line. I would definitely use the rail again when I visit BKK next year.

Airport Link Bangkok. This is a great way to get into the city if you are a solo traveler. However if there are 3 or 4 it is more cost effective to use a taxi. Many Thais use this as their daily transport and there are not always seats available. The last time there were four tourists with their bags occupying 8 seats and they would not budge. It is not 'handicapped' friendly.

快速方便的快線. 從素灣納普機場直接可以坐到市區很快，這次去曼谷搭機場快線乘客不少是通勤上班上課的市民，所以比較容易擁擠，行李太多去機場可能會不方便Write a ReviewYou're almost finished. Please update the areas marked in red before submitting.– Reviews must be at least 200 characters.Write a ReviewYou're almost finished. Please update the areas marked in red before submitting.– Reviews must be at least 200 characters.

Uncomfortable for big luggage. Airport Rail Link must convenient for travellers who go to airport. But it terrible, no elevator , no escalator , no travellator , no lockers , sometimes have to wait for 20 -30 minutes. So hot at platform.Not join with MRT , BTS in same card.Good point is cheaper than taxi a bit but you still have to take taxi to station !!!???

Convenience without the hassle. Great way in and out of the city from the ariport. No hassle and really cheap. Only thing is that it can get crowded at times. But that is the price you pay for the great value.

Bangkok Airport Connection. Fairly regular, efficient and cheap, not quite as near to the City of Bangkok as you might think (in terms of how long the journey takes) - make sure you leave in good time to get your flight!

Cuts the guesswork to get to the airport. Trains run on schedule to the new airport. You are dropped off on the lower level. The walk isn't far to the main airport terminal. Price for the trip is cheap.

on time. efficient ( but at times the fast train does not operate).If you want to take the train into town, you need to take the esclater to the basement level, follow the signs.. the staff at the ticket counter are helpful.
trips to downtown. Very convenient, fast and affordable transportation system, 4 trains per hour, very punctual. They could add another carriage though, to increase seating capacity

A time saver. We took the Airport Rail Link from the airport to connect to a train that goes to the downtown area. The frequency of trains in the airport link is about 1 train in 15 mins. However, the wait will be worth it because Bangkok's traffic is crazy throughout the day.

Reliable and easy. Clean, reliable, easy and cheap.Only bad point is that it stops running between midnight and 6am. The link takes you right into the city avoiding all the road traffic. So easy to plan and time your journey.the express service costs a bit more but is really fast.I use the link whenever I can and prefer it to a taxi any day.
Handy way to get in and out of BKK. Very clean with good air-con, about 40 baht from the centre of the city to the International terminal.
Very eay transit system. I'm a dummy, lol, but my friend and I were able to easily navigate the system. The cleanliness will make you proud

Only way to travel!. Amazingly easy to use. Never really got super busy even in peak times, Commuters/travellers are all well disciplined- as before you get on the train you que in an orderly line!10/10 for cleanliness, an all trains are air conditioned. Definitely cheaper- and a lot safer than the taxis n Tuk Tuks going around - you have to try one though!

most convenient way for getting to City from Airport. on our way back from Phuket, we took the airport Rail link to the city and it was so convenient. for $80 baht for two people, we were able to reach city center near our hotel in 25 minutes. I got off Phloem chit station and walked reached my hotel in less than 10 minutes. i didn't realise the true value of rail link until last day when despite a bad feeling, I took a taxi to the airport instead of rail link and it took me over 2 hours to reach the airport, I almost missed my flight and was the last person to board the place. If you intend to travel from airport to city or from city to airport, This is the best way for you to travel.

Helpful Transportation against Taxi Touts. After having ARL.. I can now travel to Rajaprarop (Pratunam) from Suvarnabhumi. It's cheap for only THB40 per way from the airport. Plus it's also connected to BTS Phaya Thai and MRT Petchaburi Station. The downside is it can be overcrowded during rush hours and sometimes you have to wait more than 10 minutes unlike the bTS that it's frequent. Hopefully they would be able to extend the line up to Don Mueang in the future.

best and most useful. This train, as its "cousin" BTS , is a part of the fantastic mass transportation system of Bangkok . Clean , sharp , just at one of the main center of the town and connected to the overall lines of MRT and BTS , this train will allow everybody to jump in town quickly and cheap without mentioning that it is also stopping by some areas of the town almost impossible to reach by taxi ( Ramkhameng / Hua Mak , just to say some ) easily and conveniently . A good , net and clean streamline for any kind of travellers , to blame the lack of access everywhere for wheel chairs ( only some station ) , it is a pity but unfortunately Thailand and Bangkok especially really misses the accessibility for this kind of service.

Cheaper than a Taxi - but take a Taxi!. Had a run out to the airport with my son and his girlfriend to see them off, as they only came for a week.In hindsight should have taken a taxi, not overly expensive if your just travelling either singly or a couple, (couple of pounds each) or on a very tight budget, but the trains arrive only every 30 minutes, the station is bloody hot evening time, and can be quite crowded, so be prepared to be stood up for the journey, not great if you've got a few bags with you!As said previously, take a taxi, aircon all the way! There is aircon in the train, but really - take a Taxi-Meter.
efficient. The best way to get int o the city , avoids the traffic and is very quick . It has a regular service and you dont have to wait long for a train .

The Fastest Mode of Transport in Bangkok. Frequent, Fastest way to get to/from city center to Suvarnabhoomi International Airport. It takes less than 30 minutes this way. Do not think of going by Taxi or Bus as it may take hours due to the always traffic jam in roads of Bangkok

Fast and cheap. This is a nice alternative to the Taxi´s - that do not always find their way around and the bad traffic in Bangkok. But of course your hotel should be close to the Airport Link (or the BTS good connection). If you travel with lots of luggage maybe not best choice.
Quick and cheap. Used this a few times, on time, cheap, safe and quick. Would never consider a taxi, this is much better and easy from the airport
Fast and good travel. Great way to reach your destination safer and faster. It is a bit crowded but quite effective and hence a good choice of commute when going to and fro the BKK airport.

Useful. Used it for the first time this year. It was punctual, fast and comfortable. I was staying in Siam Square so it was very convenient for this part of town due to BTS connection. If I was staying in Banglamphu I would still use a taxi.

Amazing Thailand (but not in a good way). When it works, the Airport Rail Link is fine. But due to gross management incompetence, the operator failed to contract for major maintenance on a timely basis, with the result that there is a reduced schedule which is likely to remain in effect for a year or more.

ARL by any means far exceeds expectations. Once you get through the prompt process of the cordial immigrations people of the Thai nation you must ensure to use the speedy, air conditioned train service into the inner city via the network of transfers to your preferred destination. Prior planning and preparation allows you the freedom with patience in mind to not allow your first initial introduction to Thailand's welcome to international visitors be a negative one. Be prepared to have small change such as the relevant Thai baht and 20bht notes to make the transition go smooth. Take note of all the English translation freely available and give courtesy acknowledgement to the local people with humility. Wait time is minimal at any of the stations and a viewing screen informs you of the next available service no more than 5 - 7 minutes. Adjust to peak periods when there maybe full carriages, this is NOT a negative aspect as they have a large population. The local people love and respect there silence as a appreciation of there environment and do not interrupt visitors, no barging or aggressive nature exists.

The intervals could be better. Overcrowded like all public Transport facilities in Bangkok. Shorter Intervalls would offer more comfort to the travellers. But quick, within 30 Minutes you get to the Airport. You are very lucky if you get a free seat there.But it is more reliable if you Need to arrive to the Airport just in time than by taxi that cannot escape the traffic jam

Not the best. At the time of traveling (November 2014) the express had been canceled and crossed off all litriture in the stations so the regular train does the job.Nothing much wrong with the train itself but its too short, fat too many people use it and not just from the airport & stops in total. If you have ever seen Japanese video of people being pushed onto trains well it happens here, heaven help you if you have luggage!Still probably better than the alternative,

Good but slow and not well integrated. The line is somehow very convenient at the airport but it is not well integrated to the other lines. I had to change in Makasan and it looked a bit far from there to the metro station so if you have too much luggage it can be quite hard to get around. The lines are not integrated so if you have to take other lines you will have to buy different ticket every single time.

Cheap and convenience. Avoid traffic jam or being treated by taxi-driver. The best way is to take airport rail to and fro between Airport and Downtown. It takes appr. 25 - 30 mins (excl. waiting time) from airport to Phaya Thai. The train schedule is abt 10-12 mins. I think it is acceptable coz the waiting time for BTS is abt. 6 mins in non-peak hrs.

Works efficiently. I used it from Suvarnabhumi Airport to Ratchaprarop (Pratunam) and return back to the airport few days later too.Generally, coming from the Airport is easier and less tense as there are no rush factors and more transportations are available. Naturally you do not feel that stressed and you are able to enter the train and there you go to your destinations. On my return trip, it was 1545H Bangkok Time at Pratunam and I was supposed to check in at 1740H. As it was a weekend, getting a taxi or shuttle service may prove futile as the jam outside is really bad. So I went for the ARL instead. I missed the one from Ratchaprarop ARL to the airport as it is too packed to accommodate even one thin fellow in the train cubicles. Out of desperation, I went to take to the next station, Phaya Thai, which is the terminal station of the entire ARL line and from there, bounced back to Ratchaprarop and Suvarnabhumi airport. You will be surpised that some of the trains have highrail like seats. Transportation costs are saved and prevent Taxi drivers from quoting us ridiculous prices. BKK is made easier to travel with ARL, BTS and MRT.
Cheap & easy. We caught the train rather than pay for a taxi, right into the heart. Safe & interesting way to travel.

Great Choice. This Is A Very Great Choice Who Doesn't Have Much Luggage. It's Very Fast And Comfortable Except The Doors Are Being Closed So Loud. The Only Negative Thing is If You Miss The Train For City Line, You my Have To Wait For Another One Around 12 Minutes. And The Waiting Area In Other Station (Except The Airport) is Very Hot Since It Is Like Semi Indoor-Outdoor. Overall, Very Great Choice For Avoiding Traffic In BKK

Great if have only hancarriage and new feeder MRT station.. Good train service and now feeds to and from Pechburi MRT station making it very convenient if dont have bags.Taxis don't like dropping people off there, as they want the full ride to the airport.Not convenient to get a taxi there to elsewhere on arrival with exit road not allowing a right turn, so adds time and cost driving away from your destination.For solo traveller with no or limited bags its fast and very affordable.

Fast and cheap. I took the airport rail for a few times when I was staying at Baiyoke Sky hotel. The service was fast and cost very cheap, cabins were cleaned and plenty of space within. However, if you are not staying at a nearby hotel, the roads beneath the rail can be rather challenging. Most of the roads have pockets of pots and holes making it rather different to push your trolley bags, unless you only have hand carried or backpack, it will be very difficult to travel across anywhere. There are no proper roads or transportation (eg taxi stand) for proper pick up and drop off. It will be rather dangerous to stand at the roadsides with all your bags trying to flag down a cab esp during peak hours.
Great but.... This is very useful and very cheap, but if you're 4 people with hefty baggae, it's often easier to get a taxi as long as they're on the METER!

Fast and comfortable. It take you from airport to final destination only for 20 minutes. So it won't be problem if you can't get a sit there. I liked how everything is organized. And it's not very crowdy.
jia. An easy quick way to get to the centre from the airport if you dont have to lot of luggages , very clean and safe and runs all the time often .

Just very convenience. This train made Bangkok even a better city to visit, you only need 15 minutes to be in the airport from Bangkok citycenter, looks impossible i a city with this crazy traffic jams! As well the price is pretty nice...

Fast and easy. Very nice transportation to the city in Bangkok
just pay about 50 Baht and jump on the train 25 minutes later you are there
Clean and fast, maybe to crowdy sometimes but its ok,

Fantastic. Aircon , quick and 10th of the price of a cab to get you to Makkasan which if you are staying in the sukumvit area it's great. Meter cab to you hotel from there and you will be at the hotel for less than 90 baht. If there are 3 or 4 of you a cab is better value but single travellers it's the best way to and from the airport.

No hassles. For one or two people this is the way to travel from the airport to down town Bangkok. For more people you might as well take a taxi but take into account the traffic jams. Foir us Airport link in combination with BTS worked very well.

Great, clean, modern service.. Great way to travel across the city, away from the airport. Cheap but quality transport. Particularly nice to see are the smart train guards who salute the train and passengers as it departs the platform.I would use this to beat the taxi queues at the airport, even if it is to then hail a cab at the next stop. It also beats the chaotic traffic jams that Bangkok is known for.

Very Convenient. This is the easiest and best way to do away with traffic jam during peak hours. This link is connected to other line like the BTS station which can take you to many attractive destinations around Bangkok.

Convenients, better than BTS . The most convenient transport from the airport. On times and always fast. Carry luggage will not be a problem since elevation/lifts are available for up and down at all stations (BTS have only up elevators and you have to carry your heavy luggage through the stairs). Prefer express line but express depart every 1 hours so city line is much quicker.

Convenient. Cheap and quick way to get into the city area, but closes at midnight and not open until 6am. Travel by rail to lower Sukhumvit 76baht, same by metered taxi 350/400, rip off cab's 700/1000

Easy and time saving way of communication.. Prices are reasonable, but most important thing is you can save time and save money as well. Taxi charges for halt also, which make your trip expansive. So if you have sky train line on your way then please opt it.

Fast and cheap. For me, this is the best way to get to the city from the airport. You will not be locked up in the traffic jam quite common in Bangkok. From the end station at Phaya Thai, its just 5 minutes walk to the sky train
very convenient for single traveler. cheap and convenient for solo travelers.last station is Phayathai which is in the middle of the city and also connect to BTS kytrain.

It's like metro but a bit higher. A very quick and easy transport from BKK airport to city. You can avoid all the traffic to and from the airport. Getting off on the last stop you can get a taxi or other train to the place you want to go

THE BEST transport from the airport to downtown. Since the first day they operated the rail link getting from the airport to downtown became super easy, fast and cheap.
Easy access on the lower level at the airport and excellent connections at various key places once you get downtown.
rail it or road it. Good fast and cheap but beware the many many steps if you are dragging a heavy suitcase.....if so take a cab

So so. The idea behind this is great. But if you travel with a lot of luggage it can be difficult. because you take teh MRT or BTS to get to the Airport Rail Link. And BTS or MRT in Bangkok can be crowded , depending on the time of the.

Sky train Rocks. I had my two grown up daughters over for a visit and took them by taxi to the airport to travel home normally I would use my car but as I planned to go into town to see some friends and have a beer or three it was not on. Having said goodbye to my girls I had a little difficulty in locating the station maybe me? I have a card to travel the Skytrain so I do not know the price but as I looked out of the window as the traffic built up the closer we got to Bangkok it is a no brainer if you do not have luggage. it is also a no brainer if you are on a budget or pressed for time, great ride

wife and daughter love it. its the 1st time my wife take a trip with this Railway.. and they just love it, since it on time, clean, and fast lol. we take a trip from our hotel to MBK with this.. from Don Mueang we took a bus to the nearest Railway Station. and its very simple to pay.. every station have its own code for you to pay, my suggestion, prepare coins lol
Fast and Cheap!. Fast and cheap to reach my hotel in Nana.Need to change to BTS system to my hotel.Can be crowded as it is not a direct airport link but halfway they also have stop for passenger.

Fast link to nowhere. OK as a fast link to Makkasan, but you either need to take a taxi from here, or transfer to the underground MTR. Better to take the slower stopping city line to Praya Thai and take the elevated BTS to go go wherever - it's cheaper

easy train to get into town. cheap, fast, easy, highly recommended.... it is a train there is nothing more to say, but I need to write more to post this so I will say again it is a good and fast train it meets all your needs!
polite staff. The staff there were polite and have a pleasant smile. They offered some help when taking it for the first time. The ticketing staff too, was helpful when confirming the station for us.

Very Efficient way to get to city even with luggage. During our previous trips we used taxi from airport. This time we tried Airport rail link to and fro Makkasan station and were pleasantly surprised by its efficiency.
Very convenient even with luggage and small children. Fast, clean, easy to get tickets and very cheap!!
Must use when in Bangkok.
A great and convince ride from the airport. The ride from the airport was very convince and problem free. The ride into the city was much faster than taking the taxi or private car.
Convenient but crowdy. Very convenient buy also lots of passenger when we took it at around 1500
Quick easy and cheap. Get your bearings in airport then go buy your ticket, board the train and less than 20 minutes later you are linking up with MRT or BTS in centre ig Bangkok, great

Very convenience. Get the airport rail link and enter the city in a breeze. It is fast and cheap. We hope in the future there will be a linking from Don Muang Airport as well instead of only from Suvarnabhumi Airport.
Excellent link to the city. 20 minutes and $1-50 - excellent! The most efficient and safest way to get to Bangkok. Taxi drivers drive too fast.

AIRPORT RAIL LINK. The Airport Rail Link connects Suvarnabhumi International Airport to Phaya Thai Station from where you could travel into the city either by Sky Train or ake a taxi. The trains go right into the airport and are convenient for travellers with light lugguage. Fares are around 1.25US$ for a single ticket journey.Frequency is good.

Better to take than a taxi from Airport. Fast, cheap transport from airport to BKK!! There's no point to take a taxi from there and wait in traffic to get to your destination. By airport link you'll be in 30 min on Phaya Thai station and from there you can take a taxi :) E.G About 200-300 BHT to get to Khaosan Rd.

The nonstop hi-speed rail is discontinued. Only the normal BTS line is operational but it is still miles quicker and cheaper than a taxi
As an example I paid from the airport to MBK 1000 Bath by taxi and back on same route to airport 42 Baht
I will keep on using the Airport link from now on

it gets you to the airport, slowly and painfully. Despite this is the newest train line in Bangkok, the train looks oldest and exhausted. A trip from downtown to the airport will take you 30 minutes in a cramp space in rush hour. This is what happen when you let the gov run the train
Hard time with luggage . I had hard time to ride it with my luggage! No space to hold it! It's cheap and convenient to go from airport to downtown city!

Frequent and efficient trains from the airport. The Airport rail link got us from the airport to a station close to our hotel much quicker and much cheaper than a taxi. The difficulty was once we got off the train as we battled to find transport from the platform to the hotel so ended up carrying our heavy luggage the rest of the way by foot.

But it goes to nowhere. The train is fine, except that the express trains are off and you need to sue the all stations trains. These can be crowed to overflowing in the peak hours and there is no room for luggage and that does not mix well with commuters.The main terminal is at Markasan which is very hard to get out of as the taxis avoid it due to traffic in the area. They have a taxi stand ..but no taxis most of the time. Stay on the train to the end of the line where it intersects with the BTS Sky Train ... same luggage problem, but you are moving.Another problem is the lack of lifts and escalators that start after 10 stairs . This makes bags hard. Seems they were saving money.Also your BTS Rabbit card does not work on the airport link !

Not for airport travellers with big luggage. Arrived in Bangkok Friday afternoon so thought this would be a smarter option than taxi. Boarding was okay but we had 2 large suitcases and had to travel to the 2nd last station. Did not think it would get so crowded but it did. I think if we had smaller luggage I would try again. Also tried to get to the airport via rail link but was too crowded to even board, even on a Tuesday night.
Rail Link. The rail link is great, easy to use and quick. The downside - carrying suitcases up stairs and crowding at peak times. The up side - cheap, cheap, cheap

Very convenient. airport rail link is really convenient and saves a lot of time and money. It takes you to the heart of the city in a matter of 20 mints. At bht 45 (as Nov 14) from connecting stations you may use metro lines to reach your destination. Very good commuting way during rash hours.
Very good MRT. Clean , fast , comfortable , especially you are first timer visitor to bangkok , don't forget get the map at information desk
Great way in to the City.. Easy and simple to use, Cheap compared to taxis. Most stations have escalators, you might have to carry bags down some stairs.Staff helpful and willing to give directions.

too crowded in the peak hours. This airport to city link is a cheaper and easier way to reach central bangkok and connect with the BTS system. The trains are cozy with dedicated luggage shelves. It also beats the traffic during peak hours and ensures time. When we were returning back to suvarnabhumi airport from chaya phrai it was so crowded that i almost suffocated. it got worse as more people kept getting into the train.I will recommend it to use it from the airport but not to the airport from the city esp if you have children and large luggages.
the best. Avoid grid lock, take this method of transport - so quick! Taxi to it if you have to and then take it. AC on it :)

Cheap quick way to airport from central Bangkok. MRT to markkasan 10min walk by new airport walk link no crossing roads like before to then a fast trip to airport under 30 mins word of warning like other city's like my own London rush hour the trains are full un like London the fares are less £2 to the airport!!!

good and cheap way to the airport. Of course the airport rail link is often the best way to go to the airport or to go into the city. No traffic jam! But the big issue is if you arrive with luggage at your final station, the will be often no taxi. you have to use stairs.
Best way to get out of the airport. Runs on time, good value for money. Clean and gives a good view of Bangkok. Take the day pass as soon as you get to a metro station.

Convenient if you are in the right part of town. Handy, fast and cheap but lugging bags up 6 flights of stairs to get to the right stop on the skytrain isn't the best way to start or end your holiday.

The most sorry excuse for an Airport Link in Asia. The Airport link is the most frustrating, laborious and uncomfortable way to get to the airport that Bangkok has to offer. It doesn't help that through 'curious' reasons, there have been issues with the tracks meaning that the actual express train has been canceled and all passengers must take the regular long rail route. The platform is squelching hot - even if the temperature isn't that hot away from the platform. There is no air-conditioning and the platforms are packed with no breeze, full of sweaty, smelly commuters. It wasn't possible to get a space next to a bar to hold let alone a seat. It didn't really matter though as my hands were pinned to my sides due to the crush on the train. The driving was erratic and we all fell on top of each other several times during the journey due to heavy breaking. The trains are second hand and look it. All in all, a big fail for Thailand.

Why bother?. Getting a taxi to Makkasan is nearly impossible - getting one back from there is even worse. In fact, I could have taken a taxi from the airport and made it home quicker. Taking a taxi is much easier.
fast. Fast wat from airport to center of BangkokOnly 20 minutes and you on Paya Thai BTS stationCheap, less then 2 USD for one way ride

Ease of access & avoids the massive jam. Airport Rail Link connects travelers touching down from the airport straight to the heart of Bangkok. The price of taking the airport rail is so affordable & the most important thing is, travelers gets to avoid the massive traffic jams at all times & ease of connection to their local BTS to get to their preferred destination. It is definately the best mode of transport as compared to the taxi!
easy ,fast & cheap !. we got this in rush hour after a 6 am landing and it was still more pleasant than London in rush hour !
Great!. So cheap, and easy! Connected directly from the airport made a quick transition to the BTS and to my hotel. Provided a nice little view of the city and outskirts on our way in.

The best and fastest. Absolutely the best and fastest way from the airport into the city, and back. i will ans do highly recommend this service, I think a lot of other so-called mega cities should take a good hard look at this amazing transport system

Best way out from airport !!! So much better than taxi !!!. We use this airport rail link from Suwarnabhumi airport to pratunam.It is in the basement of the airport and you only need to get on to few escalators to go down.Always follow the sign boards, so you wont miss it.At the time we arrived there were not much crowd in the subway station.There were officers down there to help us get the tickets.You just have to press the destination on the machine and insert the money.You will get a token as you,r ticket.Keep it safe until you reach your destination, they check it out there!All the timings of airport rail link & stations are available on internet,so if you can have a look beforehand,it would be much easier. The rail is comfortable and they announce the up coming station in English,so you will not miss your destination.

Amazing, clean, cheap. I really cannot fault this mode of transport as Bangkok continues to enter the 21st Century. Extremely tidy trains..absolutely no grime, these floors are bleached with a toothbrush every night for this standard. Only 45 Baht from the airport to the city and vice versa. Around 4 or 5 trains an hour and take about 40 minutes. Air conditioning set at 23.9c when I used it yesterday (November). Best part...watch the guard as he stands to attention and salutes you and the train as it pulls out of the station...superb!

Efficient, effective and inexpensive. My wife and i have been to Bangkok on a number of occasions and have always prebooked a taxi for our airport return. On our last spontaneuous visit (we cut our vacation to Hua Hin short) we had a little time to investigate other options. We caught the train from one of the stations linking the city to the airport and it was a revelation. I forget how much it cost now (it was only a couple of £), but returned us to the airport in 45mins taking just 4 stops en route. We'll be using it for City transfers in the future.

way better than the taxi crooks. Simple and efficient and lets you avoid the impossibly annoying crooks in the cabs and tuktuks who are constantly trying to 'take you for a ride' or screw you into private long-tail boat rides or the like or simply refusing to take you where you want

Way to beat the traffic to downtown BKK. Regardless of where your hotel is in downtown Bangkok, the airport rail link is the best way to there. Once you are in the city, you can take a taxi to your hotel. The overall cost is much cheaper. If you are a light traveler, this is the best way to get from the airport to downtown. It is at the first floor of the airport (a little long to walk) and a little confusing to get the ticket and which one to take. Take the regular one because it takes you to the end station near Siam Square.

Great but beware during rush hour. I used the city line from Ratchaprarop station to BKK airport. Since I was on the first train (6:03 AM), it worked fine and I was seated. However, the night before, I wanted to use this line to go to Makkasan and at 18:30, it was packed. A lot of people including me couldn't get on the train.So, if you are going to the airport at non-rush hours, it's a clean, convenient, cheap, comfortable way to travel. However, if you need to ride it between 7-9 AM and 5-7 PM then you might end up missing your flight.The ticket machines are different than other train lines and they do accept 20-50-100 Baht bills as well. The trip cost was 40 Baht from Ratchaprarop to BKK and took about 27 minutes.
The best choice into downtown. 之前從機場要進到曼谷市區搭計程車最大的問題是""司機不跳錶""他們總有一堆的理由，最多的就是~~塞車~~，但有了 Airport Rail Link 真的是既方便有便宜，現在已經是我進出機場的最佳選擇。
Excellent transportation. Excellent way for travellers to get to and from the airport to the city. Busy at times but clean and comfortable

Excellent Railway service. Airport Railway Link is perfect, fast, cheap and a safe way to go quickly from the airport to Bangkok City.Easy access to everything. No hustlers, polite staff and cheap tickets....

Gotta be fit. The rail link to the Airport is great - fast and inexpensive - IF you are physically fit. But do not use if you cannot carry luggage up and down flights of stairs (no lifts) or drag it to your hotel down the crowded street.

Super fast, cheap, clean and easy. Highly recommended! We took the skytrain many times due to it's speed( compared to horrendously gridlocked traffic), ease and low price (compared to taxis). The airport link skytrain combines and compounds all these wonderful advantages; saving you even more time and money that the average skytrain trip. From arrivals in suvarnabhumi, go down and down til the basement( it's clearly signposted) and buy a ticket to the very central Phaya Thai for 45baht..you can change there to the main skytrain route to other parts of bangkok or take a taxi.Highly recomended!

Can not fault it. Having the train link coming straight from the airport makes it easy and cheep to get douwn town. I sl links up the the mts and bts linesTicket is east with ticket dispensing machines in english and English voice alerts on the train telling you the next approaching station
wow- big improvement. with traffic now at a crawl most of the day something had to be done- easy to use and fully A/C'd trains- a great thing in this hot city

The best way to travel in Bangkok !. This is the fastest, cheapest & a very safety way to move yourself in the city of Bangkok ! It cost you only 130 Thai Baht for a full day, from 6 am till 12 pm.The trains are coming every 3 minutes at peak times and they have ... aircon inside ;-)

Good way to avoid taxi touts - but not if you have luggage.. The train runs about every 20 minutes. It stops quite a few times en route to central Bangkok and the doors close with a terrible 'clunk' every time. But it takes about 30 minutes to get to the end of the line. Unfortunately you are not done yet, you need to get to another station to get another train to the city centre. If you have bags, I'm sorry for you. It's the same site but a long walk. And you can't get a through ticket when you start your trip. You have to queue up with your baggage to get change and then again to get a ticket. But having said all that it's faster than by taxi and you avoid the taxi drivers who decline to use the meter. But if you are going to a hotel, get a taxi from the airport. It should be no more than 500 baht. (£10). The train is about 100 baht, (£2). But considering to get to a hotel you have to change trains, then get a taxi from the centre, you're probably better off getting a taxi to start with. Just insist on the meter. And make sure you get a taxi from OUTSIDE the terminal. These taxis are controlled. Inside the terminal touts will offer you taxis, limousine service, express service et al. The prices are horrendous. After a long flight they hope you will be glad to accept their offer. Don't. Just walk outside the terminal and get a taxi there. The train runs from underneath the airport.

Best way to travel in BKK. Easy to travel even for a new person. It's clean and cheap. You can travel most of the places using this Airport Rail Link. No Taxi Scams, just take a ticket and get in. You are safe even in odd hours
Convinient. When arriving to Bangkok via the Airport, this is by far the easiest way to get to the city. Cheap and fast. It connects with the skytrain and the metro.

Cheap and fast.. A cheap and fast way to reach city from airport especially if you travelling alone or as a couple. Anything more than three person can consider a taxi.Easy transfer to BTS station at Paya Thai. Not recommended for transfer to MRT as the security at the MRT need you to open your luggage before entering. Can be a hassle if you not travelling light.

worst airport link in Asia, if not the planet. get on in the middle of nowhere. haul your luggage up many stairs. trains frequently delayed due to being broken down. cant count on a schedule. A mess...but no doubt someone made huge benefits!

Fantastic, cheap, efficient & fast.. We caught the Airport Rail Link from the airport into the city. It was very efficient, clean and fast. Cheap as chips, about 45 baht pp. It took about 25 minutes into the heart of Bangkok. I can definitely recommend, although if you have a lot of luggage it would probably be better to get a taxi.
Excellent Piece of Infrastructure. Great way of getting out of the Airport hassle free and you can access most parts of the city using the air conditioned skytrain system.

Good or bad depends on your plans.. Taking the airport link is either a good idea or a bad idea. First off it is very inexpensive if you are traveling alone and have few bags that are easy to lug around. However it also requires that your final destination in near one of the stops of the various rail options in Bangkok as they all inter connect.A plus is it does get you past the bulk of Bangkok’s notorious traffic. The down side is the monster traffic is only for a few kilometers and likely near your destination. If you are not certain about the traffic, real time updates can be found on Google Maps and other apps helping your decisions. Assuming you would look at savings, taking a metered taxi to the Nana area may cost you about 300 Baht total . Where taking the Airport link would cost about 75 Baht total (per person) using the BTS Skytrain and the Airport link together to get you in the neighborhood. Personally I would take a metered taxi and get delivered to the lobby of my hotel as after a long flight cramped up in a seat for endless hours extra effort is not appealing. That sounds a whole lot better as opposed to becoming a pack mule with my bags on the Airport link and hoofing the last leg to where I would stay.So know where you are going and know how far you need to walk is the basic consideration to using the link.

Cheaper way to travel. Can get very busy as the city line is used by residents to commute. If you have large bags the stations and crowds may make it difficult to use the train. Cheaper and faster than other forms of transport in the city, 45 Baht for a transfer from the airport to the last stop on the at Phya Thai station.
Very convenient. Quick reliable cheap and clean. What more can you ask for. Access to so many stations in prime locations.best way to get to and from the airport
nice. fast way to reach bkk from airport now only one line no longer 2 line take to Phayatai and change to BTS or Makassan For MRT

Fast and safe. I took the train from the airport to Phaya Thai which is fairly central. It is fast, clean and I felt quite safe having all my belongings on me. I have been ripped off my taxis on previous visits in the past so this is a great improvement.

Polite local people. I am amazed at how polite the local people are to the kids under 6 or 7 years old. They will always yield seats for them. You can see from their face that they really love children.

Best mode for Airpot. I have many times travel thru ARL...always find it convenient specially with family & time worthy keeping in view the traffic in Bangkok. It connect all major areas which are known for tourists.I recommend to prefer it always instead of taxi...enjoy..!!!
convenient. conveniently to town centre. avoid road traffic jam with taxi. comfortable and spacious cabin. best transportation from airport.

Easy and fast. The best and easy way to get around the city use the btk!!
Anyone can use very simple
Clean and fast
Connectivity at its best. Super awesome service.... Hats off..... Lets learn some good things from you...... Liked their quick service. Every 15 minutes. There is nothing that we disliked.

Avoid "rush hour" to make your trip "happy hour". The Airport Rail Link is the best way to enter central Bangkok for international travelers, as well as the local resident. During the rush hour, I always see the travelers with a big luggage packed with massive passengers (with an unhappy mood). I understand they may be tried, sleepy, thirsty, hungry or others from a long trip on board! My recommendation is that if you did not rush to go to town, avoid using the rail during 7.00-9.00 am. There are lots of good coffee shops and restaurants at the airport for refreshing. Take it easy, it takes only 5-7 stops or around 30 mins to reach the city.
Very convenient!. Just so convenient that you go down the basement of the airport take the link and presto you're in the city center.

Easy and good to get Bangkok from the Airport. Interesting and cheap way to travel to and from Bangkok centre! When arrived to the Airport in Bangkok this is a fast and good value option to get the centre of Bangkok!

Express train was out of service, otherwise okay. I wanted the express to Makasaan but a sign said it was out of service on Nov 9 2014. The local train is okay but gets too crowded when carrying a suitcase. It was only 35 baht. You can buy tickets in a machine or at a counter. I connected to the MRT subway, a short walk on a walkway. This service beats the taxis and traffic. It is very easy to use the machines and maps.

Packed during rush hours. I recently took the city line from Phaya Thai on a weekday at about 6:30pm. The platform was jammed with commuter passengers awaiting the next train. It was a real crush getting on (and off) the train. If travelling with baggage to the airport then it would have been a nightmare and some passengers were definitely struggling.Personally I never use the train for the airport though it can be useful for other destinations without baggage. The frequency of trains is too low at only 1 train every 30 minutes on the city line. Transfers to/from the MRT and BTS are not always easy (especially at Makkasan). A taxi direct from/to the airport is always much more comfortable and relaxed.

About time!. This link has cut the journey time and cost into Bangkok. No hassles with taxis and expensive rides. The journey time is about 30-40 mins, and the city line costs 45 baht. It can get very crowded at times, so a seat is not guaranteed and this service stops at every station. The express line is more expensive (I think 150 baht), but only stops at a few stations. Some stations have escalators going up, but none going down, meaning you have to carry your bags down. The Airport Link connects to the BTS (Skytrain) so very easy to get about the city.
Great, easy and cheap way to get into the center of BKK. Finally a good alternative for the taxi's to get into the centre of Bangkok, although travelling with a lot of bags still requires one.

Economical, fast, but no lift (found?).... The Airport Link is the cheapest way to get to town in Bangkok. In the daytime, it is often also the fastest, given the traffic jams on the highways and the secondary roads. The trains are swift, comfy, and there is room for luggage close to the seat you occupy. The only drawback: there are some stairs to be conquered, with luggage, in Paya Thai station, when you want to transfer to the Sky Train or other transport. I may not have found the lift, but am relatively sure there is none.

Convenient and easy. From Hualamphorn MRT station, I took the train to Phetchaburi for 29 bahts and from Phetchaburi I alighted and walked to Makssan air rail station and took the train to Suvarnaburmi airport. I paid 35 bahts for the journey. The whole journey costs me only 64 bahts. It is cheap and convenient. The only set back is at Makassan station where I have to wait for about 15 mins for the train as there was a huge crowd and the first train that arrived was also crowded and cannot accommodate. I waited for the second train which was totally empty. The express train was canceled until further notice. I believed it was due to the costly fare and poor response from commuters. In Singapore, the train is card accessed but here in Bangkok a coin like disc is issued and used for train access. I was quite worried that I have a hole in my pants' pocket resulting in the disc dropped out from my possession or accidently slipped out of my hand into the drain or gutters. Nevertheless, the disc is made of plastic and very light. I found it quite convenient and user friendly. If you have problems with the machines, just buy the tickets at the counter. The counter girls are friendly and helpful.
Fast and effective. A cheap and good choice for traveling from the airport to city center.Easy to find and short distance from the airport gates to the station

It's USELESS!!!. The State Railway of Thailand (SRT) should improve it now. Because it use to have 2 types of train but now it has only City Line Train, which is very slow and congested. Tourists and people who want to go to Suvarnabhumi Airport should use the Express Line Train to save their time. If the SRT won't bring the Express Line back, I recommend you to use Taxi instead.
Transport from airport to city. airport link the speed so slow long waiting time they should increse more trian for taxi the car very dirty and old

The best way to get to city center. This is the best way to reach the city center even with your luggage. You can start from the airport and arrive right in front of city center near payathai. You can find a number of cheap hotels and Payathai.

Great Service, but be clear what you getting onto. I use the Airport Rail Link on a regular basis as it is the cheapest and fastest way to get to the Savarnabhumi Airport especially when there is heavy traffic. When departing form the Airport it is important to know which train you are catching as there are three different options. The most frequent is the train that connects to the BTS Sky Train Station at Phya Thai, this train stops at all stations - slower, but sure. The next is the Express that stops short of Phya Thai Sky Train Station but connects to the MRT (Underground) and the third is the Express that goes to Phya Thai, this is the fastest way to get into Bangkok. If you are uncertain which one you are catching, just ask at the ticket office and they will advise you. The express trains leave on the half hour so that is an indication as to which train you are on. (On the hour and on the half hour)

Airport rail link. I frequently use the airport rail link. It is much cheaper than taxis and easy to use but some people may find it inconvenient. The real problem is that it is managed by the Thai State Railways who are extremely inefficient and not a patch on the other subway and skytrain services in Bangkok which are well run. However you can change to these other services at interchange stations when you get into the city. If you have a lot of luggage it is not convenient, but that also applies for a number of other cities in the world.
Easy to use. So easy to use. only 35 baht. Cheaper option than taxi if travelling on your own. Easy access to skytrain.

Cheap and worry-free but can be improved. Very convenient and quick way to get to the heart of Bangkok from the airport. Goodbye to getting stuck in traffic jams or quarrels with taxi drivers that want to scam you.Problem is1) The frequency of train services can be quite low, especially if you are not dropping off at Phaya Thai2) The train is ridiculously packed during peak hour, barely any space to breathe3) Somehow the stations have very few escalators and accessible elevators, shouldn't they be expecting people with large suitcases taking this line?

Absolutely useless - take a taxi instead. It is slow if you get on the wrong train that stops on all the stops into town.Very few lifts down at the end stations, no escalators going down.How do they think we are coming from the airport, with just a little handbag??
good, reliable, clean, safe and cheap. we could not get a taxi - long queue, so tried the train. Very cheap, clean and safe. Might be hard to get a taxi once in the city though.
So easy. If I return to bangkok I will not be using a racial, this is a superb way of getting into the city and so cheap, 100 baht

only thb35 to go to airport from hotel. very inexpensive
easy to use
but need to exit station before re-entering
better than waiting in a traffic jam

Express service suspended. Although the express service has been suspended indefinitely, this is the most efficient and cheapest way of getting out of the airport. Around 150 baht (£3) from airport to Makkasan.
Excellent Service. This is the best way to avoid massive traffic inside the city center. There are so many connection station other than the Payathai and so comfortable service.

Fast, cheap, comfy. Fast- about 30min from centre to airport, good connection with Skytrain. Cheap- 45 bath. Comfortable- we went about 9 pm and It wasn´t crowded at all. We had enough room for our luggage and place where to sit. Good night city view!
I wouldn ´t go by taxi anymore!

The Way to Travel. Modern Bangkok travel- avoid the problems of traffic be at airport from anywhere along the BTS System in less than an hour all effortlessly... look out from the Airport Link-- ad simply wonder at why motorists are all snarled up in their cars

Interesting. We took the Airport Rail Link from Suvarnabhumi airport to Phaya Thai - the last station. It costs 49 baht per person. The feeling is very interesting, you can see buildings with colorful from the window of ARL and the bustling city.

price and convenient. Fare reasonable, frequency should be closer as the train was very crowded. Convenient
Lesser stop. Station stop better to be link to shopping mall

Crowdy. I have taken the ARL several times from Paha Thai station, both to the airport and to other stations. The train is full most of the time, so its a nightmare to take it with luggage during the rush hours. But the alternative is taxi and that can also take long time if you dont pay extra and drive the express toll road.

Quickest & economical way to city center from airport. We used the rail link from the airport to the city center and it is the quickest as well as economical way as it is 40 bhat per person compared to taci which 800-1000 bhat. Moreover, taxi takes an hour during rush hour where as it 20 odd mins by train
