Easy and convenient. The Airport Rail Link is such an easy mode of transportation from Suvarnabhumi airport into Bangkok. It is located floor B1 of the airport and there is someone at the ticket machine to guide you if needed. Fast and efficient.

beat the traffic n Fast. Fastest way to the city centre as it arrives two stops away from central SIAM. Journey is less than 30 min n u can choose to get off at makkasan which is a stone or two throw from terminal21. If u have not been to bkk, the traffic is a nightmare worst than Freddy

just a commuter service. the original Airport Express, two trains an hour non stop into town, has been completely withdrawn. So there's now just a 20 minute interval local train, which can be very crowded indeed.....Taxis from BKK are fixed fare of 500 THB, about $15, and if you've got luggage are a better bet.If the traffic is OK it will take maybe 45 mins, but up to double if it's peak time and there's jams everywhere.

Awesome, fexible and accurate. This the best way to travel from airport to anypoint in the city. It lies just beneath the airport terminal so you need not walk more to reach to the station. from there you can reach any place. it doesnt cost more than 35B and train frequency is almost 20mins each

Not worthy for investment. The government invested so much to make it happen. But it didn't work well. First, no elevator for the big-lugguage tourist, pity for them. Second, the train looks older than BTS and the doors shut with banging noise.

Best way to travel from Airport to Bangkok in peak hours. One of the best ways to travel from Airport to Bangkok (or other way) in peak hours. Costs 35B and takes about 30 mins. Trains run every 20 mins during day time. Please remember that in the city line seat in the coach is not guaranteed, unless your are at the first station. However people are kind enough to offer a seat to the needy.

Easy, cheap and clean. Fantastic service allowing easy access from the airport into the city. Fortunately for us our hostel was right off the MRT which again was easy to transfer to from the Airport Rail Link. Very cheap considering the prices of many cities airport rail links and a very quick transit into the centre of bangkok.
Very near to sky train. It reach next to sky train station, but you need to come out from it and walk for 5min to reach the sky train station.

Best way to airport. If you ever need to make it to the airport during heavy traffic rush hour, try this BTS style train. Can ride the express for a slightly more expensive fare or normal train. From station near Asoke to airport in just about 15-20 minutes(express!!)
Easy to take. Directions from airport to hotel were fairly easy to follow, as long as you take an overview of a basic rail and road map prior to departing
Very convenient. Very convenient if your destination is on the rail link. You can take the rail link from the airport and it works out to be very reasonable as compared to taxi.

Cheap and fast service. It's a fast and direct train to Suvarnabhumi airport from Makkasan airport rail link station. Perhaps it's because there are no amenities or shops at the station, not even a water fountain, and getting a taxi from the station isn't easy. But if you just want it to go from there to the airport quickly, it would serve the purpose.

Considerable. not the best option for family travel and you still to connect with metro to be able to get to where you want. Carrying 6 suitcases was not ideal for busy public train. might work for someone that travel light.

excellent way to travel to airport. you can save a lot pof traffic time if you are going to the airport by using airport link express. The ticket is very cheap and it takes just iunder 30 minutes to travel to the airport.

Convenient and Economical. A pretty easy way to get from Airport to sukhumvit area. Cabin design a little awkward especially the support pole. Can be quite crowded as the train also serves major towns that is outside BKK city
Excellent service. You can save time as well as money using airport rail link very excellent service joining all important places........

Give it a pass!. If you are looking for some transportation that is slower, more inconvenient and more expensive than a taxi, just use it, especially if you are not traveling alone.
Seriously now, give it a miss and Grab a cab!

So easy and yet difficult. Airport rail link is fast and economical for budget travellers. Most importantly, you can avoid all the traffic jam in which you can save alot of travelling time. However, in my recent visit, the express airport rail link was not functioning and end up taking the city link train. My advice to those rushing for time, do check the airport rail link's website to see whether there are any broke down so that you could take a taxi from the airport.
easy to access airport. Easy to access to airport, no need to bargain for taxi ride. But can get very crowded during rush hours, try to avoid those timing.

cheap and efficient. Direct into the city from the airport and cheap.
1 hr max don't bother with expensive taxis and traffic jams

I enjoed it. Contemporary and inspiring.. Very convenient and affordable way to get to the city. You can enjoy wonderful views of Bangkok from the window while getting to the city, which is really inspiring. It is clean and nice to ride in.
So easy. We flew from Phuket to Bangkok it was so easy to get the rail link then we took sky train absolutely beautiful.well worth the effort.

Cut out the traffic. Could be better presented. First time I tried it I had to look around so directions at that time were poor.
Good value for money to get you into the city and access to the BTS for the rest of your journey without being stuck on the freeway or the airport taxi hastle
Cheap Airport transfer. Frequent schedule easy connection at Paya Thai to BTS sky train. Not suitable for travelers with lots of luggage
mandy. A very efficient service , gets you to the center of bangkok quickly and cheaply , much better than taking a taxi , avoids traffic jams .
first time. Very convenient & beats all the traffic jams to get you to the centre of town. Down side: local taxis don't want to take you from your hotel to the Airport Rail link station!!!

best transpostation transfer to Airport. only 45 batt /person from Pyathai to International airport and take 30 min to reach .better that you take taxi cost about 700batt and sometime will stuck into traffic jam.I would recommend you to take taxi to any Airport link station and transfer to airport by train to avoid traffic jam
Efficient. Hassle free travel from the airport (Suvarnabhumi) to our hotel which was close to National Stadium BTS station.

Cheap. This rail link is the easiest and cheapest way to get from the airport into bangkok. Look on the map first to work out which stop is nearest your hotel or if you have to swap onto the skytrain. Its easy to understand, very cheap and fast.

No seats, only standing. service is terrible, you have to wait entering the train after arriving, because they need to "clean" it. So that means, that all seats are already taken when it is your turn to go in. Before there was an express line, but that one has been cancelled, so now stop at 7 station before you arrive at the BTS station. Alleys are full with luggage and passengers, very uncomfortable and very unpleasant staff, who only speak thai and are not all all prepared to assist you. Forget it!!!

Quick hassle free ride into Bangkok. Pros- This link connects you from the airport to central Bangkok BTS rail system for 45baht! Saves you time and money from riding on taxis in the traffic. From the MRT you can also connect to the MRT. Cons- Dragging your bags up and down stairs and escalators connecting to conyence systems. Eventually you probabnly will need a taxi to your final destination. Either way airconditioning is provide! Enjpoy.

Faster than a taxi. Before arriving, ask your hotel which rail link station is the nearest to your hotel. Traffic in Bangkok is crazy and you probably don't want to waiste your time sitting in a taxi that is stuck in a traffic jam. At the exit of the rail link stations you can easily find a taxi that will take you to your hotel for a fair price.
only to use in traffic hours. As we were 4 people . and each tickets is 45 baht depends on location , we realized to use taxi as it was much cheaper BUT much easy way to use during traffic hours ..
travel by airport Rail link. It is nice to travel by express train from airport to Bangkok city, cheaper, time saving and relaxing.

Perfect if you stay in the city center!. Clean, fast, reliable, the airport link is a very good way if you stay close one of the station or near to a BTS station since there is a connecting station between both train systems. Good way to avoid traffic. If you stay a bit outside Bangkok or reach outside peak hours however, taxis are still a good options as they will (should) take you directly to your place.
The cheapest transportation via Airport. I think this is the cheapest way to travel via airport, but you have to carry the luggage up and down in the escalator.

Best way to travel to City centre from airport. This is the best way to travel to city centre from Airport . Just 40-45 min by airlink .if you take the taxi or bus would take you 1.5-2hrs to arrive in town. Because Bangkok traffic very bad . And never be on time as the airlink or BTSPrice might be just a bit expensive but a lots better for travel by bus or texi

The Linkway to the Cities. The train service serves as a major reduction in travelling time! one way to avoid the daily Traffic jams in peak hours. It's really cheap to take a train to the cities as compared to the cab rides.

efficient service. The best way to come in town. The journey is long almost 40 minutes and the price is very cheap, around 45 baht. From the last stop is possible to reach everywhere in city by sky train or by taxi.

Convenient if you live near the stations. I live along the route taken but for any further distances probably a taxi is just as good, especially if you have more than 2 people, the cost may even be cheaper by taxi.
Long waits for the trains too and often no seating because of overcrowding.

Works great, cannot imagine going by car. Yes, the train WILL get crowded. But, when you fly past the miles and miles of traffic, you will be happier you carrier your luggage and squeezed on the train. Actually, the train is not that bad leaving the airport station, but as you move forwards Bangkok, it will get MORE and MORE crowded. Still, unless you are coming in LATE and night or very early in the morning, USE THE TRAIN! The traffic in Bangkok is horrible. I spent 1 hour in a Tuk Tuk just to go 4 miles during rush hour. It is terrible - train is modern, but crowded, but you will be thankful you used it!

The fast way to the airport!. The train to/from the airport is excellent. Cheap, fast, frequent - highly recommended. It is not an express service at the moment, but good enough. Arrive early if you're heading to the airport to make sure you can get on the train, which can become crowded at times.

This makes travelling in Bangkok so much faster. As Taxi and Tuk Tuks get stuck in the allways big traffic, the skytrain combinations is so much quicker and easier to use. And the price really reduces the travel expenses. It is cheap to travel in Thailand, but when you come to Bangkok it is well worth taking a look at the map and using the skytrain - you will save a lot of time.From the airport to Rhamkamhaeng was faster then taxi from Rhamkamhaeng and 10 blocks down the road.Price is only 30 baht.

Easy travelling. Trains run frequently, they are very clean, run on time and very cheap...and don't get stuck in the traffic! A very helpful staff at the ticket machines will,help you through with suitcases or if you need assistance with getting your ticket they will show how.
Airport Rail Link. It is fast and it is inexpensive.The train was modern. The only way it could be better is if it had more connection points to the BTS or subway system.
Fast to city. Best way to go into town when its trafficjam, BUT they dont start before 6 or 7 in morning so if you arrive early flight take a taxi because there is no traffic then.
Now it's just one line..... Now The airport link only the city line runs service from 6-24. Cheap and easy to and from Bangkok center.

Great. The skytrain from the airport is great. It is great when you have no suitcases with you. It is cheap and it is very fast. But when we did it the first time with all our luggage it was a big disaster. So go by skytrain when you are backpakking or when you only have a trolley.
Why even bother.... Nope, Nope. Nope...Take a taxi, seriously its not worth the hassle to take the train.Taxi costs less than 350 baht incl. highway tax. and is much faster.Not recommended....

So easy to use. We arrived at the airport and just followed the signs for the rail link. Staff at the station confirmed where we had to change and away we went. A quick cheap effective way to get to the City.

Fastest way to airport. If you are almost run out of time for your flight, Airport Rail Link is your savior.
However, if you have plenty of time, I would like to recommend you to take public buses to airport. Experience the hectic and busy Bangkok City while on-the-way to airport. Sanambin is mean "airport" in Thai language.
Quick and easy. Cheap, easy and beats the traffic. Buy a Nancy Chandler map and you won't go wrong finding your way around bangkok

cheap and fast. we caught a taxi from the airport on the first night - cost us 900baht and the driver was all over the road. Took around 40 mins to get to the hotel. On leaving bangkok we used the rail link - took about 25 mins to get to the airport and cost us 120baht. Train link wins hands down.
Recommended. A fast and cheap way to travel between airport and city centre. However, if you are heavy on luggage, take a taxi.
Super easy!. Took this to the Sukhumvit area, transfered to the BTS and got off 2 blocks away from my hotel, cost me 80 baht!
Cheap & punctual. Best way to get into central Bangkok from the airport, that simple. Fares are cheap and the air conditioned carriages are kept clean and tidy.

love the raillink. I love the raillink! It is a nice way to get to the city, without having to hassle with a taxi.In my opinion the ARL is the quickest, cheapest option to go to town. So if you EITHER want to go fast, OR cheaply,: the Raillink is the way to go.From Phaya Tahi you can go by BTW to other places, or by bus to the old town...
fast and cheap. best way to go from airport to city center it is cheap and quick and you do not need to bother with bangkok jam
Quick and easy. Recommend this air train to avoid Bangkok traffic. We stayed at airport for several nights and used it to go into the city.

Quick and direct to airport. My flight was on Monday and the traffic of Bangkok is bad on Friday.I've pick up my suit at Emporium Armani and Andy recommend me to take a train to airport which is five minutes drive from tailor.Within half an hour I'm in the airport.save time and safe money.

It works and cheaper than a cab for us. Our first cab ride was a rip off, We took the train back to the airport and it worked out great once you figure out how to get your tickets and it is a little confusing changing trains at the station but it's all part of the adventure....Right?
Great way to get around. Fast, cheap and reliable. Puts the British transport system to shame. Definitely the way forward for any country that has the brains, bottle and finance to take it on. :)
easy access and user friendly. cheap and cheerful but best of all, no traffic jam - even in Bangkok !! Cost only 45 Baht one way and easy transfer to BTS at Phyra Thai station

What a waste of resources and time. First of all the frequency of the Express Train, they changed it and bnow most People tend to miss the expresse Connection to town. Now we must use the slow Train to town which is horrible. Not enough seats very difficult with luggage etc. If you arrive after a 12 hour flight you do not wish to wait for 59 minutes or so for the express link...... If you do not have enough passengers do not lessen the frequency but increase it and advertise it. Then more and more travellers will enjoy it.
Early Flight?. Hotel staff says train start at 6am. As my flight is early morning, I had no other way to take taxi to Airport.

Changing........... Excellent when I used it, as best option from Swampy to downtown IMHO. ALTHOUGH..............having maintenance problems and service iffy. at present half the available trains are down for service, and other half are questionable to say the least.keep you ear to the news for future updates.
convenient trasportation tool. It is really a convenient transportation tool which you can take via switch at a BTS station, we lived in the hotel near Nana station, it is realy very good.

convenient and no traffic jams. this is the ultimate way to get into Bangkok from the airport. it joins the underground rail network, and therefore can connect to the bts. the greatest is this completely avoids the dreaded Bangkok traffic jam

Express line is great but not the normal line. Express line is superb in terms of convenient and time. The train is quite clean and a/c is cool. After stopping express line operation, i found that normal line is really not a choice to airport anymore. Too many stops and too many people commute and too crowded.

Handy, fast, but only if you travel alone and only to some city areas. There are 2 kind of trains, the red and fast ones stop only at a couple of stations; the blues trains are cheaper and stop at every station. To me the blue trains are already fast enough.When you have a lot of luggage or if you do not travel alone, then a taxi is a better option, however a bit slower. If your destination or your point of departure to the airport is near to an Airport Rail Link station, these trains can be fast and convenient. However if it is rather far from a station, then you need another kind of transport to get there, so a taxi from or to the airport will surely be more comfortable, equal or so in price and probably if you count it all, also faster.

Its cheap and clean. Its a brilliant way to travel from or to the Airport...cheap and clean. Not too much seating however...stand and sway with the train. .Carry your own bags ,but there are escalators or sloping walkways so no problems. And the staff at the final station Phaya Thai are very helpful.

Fast and good. Went there in February 2012. We decided to try the airport rail link for the first time. We usually will take taxi from airport to hotel but since our hotel is near the rail link station so we decided to try. It was very good and fast. There is 2 type. One is stop at every stations while the other will only stop at certain station. We tried the both and see when going to hotel and returing to airport. Both are good just that the certain stop rail will cost more. But if you have young children taking a taxi is still more convenient.
Very convenient. The express was not running, think they have stopped it as they were losing money.The non stop airlink is crowded but convienient for 45 baht

Absolutely fastest way to central Bangkok. For B45, you get to central Bangkok at Phaya Thai Station which connects to the BTS too.Yes taxis are cheap too but once you get stuck on the highways you'll want to take the link and save over half the time.

The fastest and easiest way to go downtown. With the Airport Rail Link from the airport to Phaya Thai station, which takes about 30 minutes, you have access to all the BTS Skytrain stations. It really is not only the fastest and easiest way to get into the city of Bangkok, it's probably also the most inexpensive way, as long as you are alone and don't have too much luggage. At the interchange station Phaya Thai you'll find elevators, but most of the BTS Skytrain stations don't provide this facility, which means you have to carry your luggage down the stairs.
Quick and cheap . Quick and cheap, for memory it took half an hour to get into the city. Gets super busy at some stops so be Prepared to smell some armpits!!!

efficient and clean. The express was not running on the day but the airport rail link was and to me was efficient and clean, although took 40 min when I think should have taken 20 min with the express. The cost was a fraction at 40 THB.

Very Quick and cheap... I always try to get a hotel near the Airport Link line as it's by far the quickest and cheapest way to travel to and from the airport. It links up to the BTS and the Metro also so you can use it to travel to most places. Beats sitting in a taxi in BKK traffic for hours..
Unreal. Worst part is the lack of lifts when you have luggage. We took the Rail Link from the airport, and caught a cab to the airport
Acessible, fast and cheap. This service train is very convenient. This joins the main BTS and MTR link in Bangkok. However, this link is not available for people who are using the Don Mueng Airport.

good from airport to town. no traffic jam price okay. only negativ - it ends at payathai station and there is no direct connection to the BTS sktrain. you have to take a 10 minutes walk with your suitcase to reach the skytrain.
take the city train, and save $$$. It only takes 10 minutes longer, and might be quicker if one is ready to depart. Fast clean...sometimes crowded.

Great service, fast and cheap. Great service, fast and cheap. Quicker & cheaper than a taxi and best way to get into central BKK. Even if you are unsure as to your accommodation location just jump on the train to get into central BKK and then either ask for directions or grab a taxi for a short ride to your accommodation.

Quick, efficient and cost effective!. Checked by security befor passengers allowed on, then it is a a swift 30ish minutes to the town centre. So easy and so so cheap. Just a shame it doesn't go any closer to Khao San road but still was invaluable and clean and air conditioned.
Does the job. cheap, quick, on time, air conditionned, by far, the best way to reach Central Bangkok! Many thai, so nice way to mix with local culture!
fast, convenient and cheap. nothing to dislike, great service to the airport, something to see because you are up high and very easy to use.
Rail Link from airport. The rail link was a great way to quickly get into central BKK. I would use it again but not with heaps of shopping!

quick and efficient. like: how easy it is to get from airport to the city.
dislike: not sure when the 'express line' is available.

A Cheap and Very Efficient Way to Get To The Heart of Bangkok. Couldn't be simpler. Directly under the Airport Terminal, and about 25 minutes to the Bangkok Terminal to connect to the BST. There used to be a non stop service but this appears to have been discontinued, even so, you will get on and off at the start and finish so little mucking about once you are on. Whilst you travel take a look at the roads that parallel the train, consider the traffic crawling along or stationary and give yourself a pat on the back for being so clever ;-)

Handy to miss city traffic. The airport rail link is a handy form of transport to miss out on traffic jams, even if you aren't staying in the city centre, you can then take the BTS to the area you need to be.
full train. everytime i want to going up is always full so i must the second train. but the train is clean and fast

An easy way to the city. The easiest way to get to the city of Bangkok other than using a taxi or hire car is Bangkok Airport Link, if you to come through the Suvarnabhumi airport. You Arriving at the airport, after going through immigration and baggage claim, go to the underground, using the escalator two floors down. Ticket prices for the City Line are 15 to 45 Baht and 150 Baht for the Express Line. The disadvantage is too long waiting for the next train to come, we waited 30 minutes waiting for the train to come, added with a trip to the city center 30 minutes because we chose the City Line so we spend less than 1 hour to get to Phaya Thai Station. The Airport Rail Link connects you to the BTS Skytrain and the MRT underground. If you fly lightweight, this facility could be your choice to go to town with views of the city.

Easy trip into the city center.. You can take the fast train and more expensive or the cheap train at 45 THB. The cheaper train is almost as quick as the express train due to the fact you do not have to wait as long to catch the actual train. Very convenient if you want to connect to the BTS or Mrt Makkasan interchange and do not have much luggage.

Excellent transport from Airport. The airport rail link is an excellent way of getting from the airport to the city. It's fast and low priced. Most of the time a taxi will cost 5-10 times as much and take at least twice as long time to reach the destination. The airport link is also connected with BTS Skytrain at the end station. And BTS is connected with MRT subway. So you can reach any destination in the city center. The train is clean and cool from nice aircon.
Easy to use. Easy to find in airport and connects with both in town lines. Don't pay extra for taxi with this option available. Runs till midnight

Fast - comfortable - cheap - on time. I travel all the week, all the time I took the airport link.You can save time during the rush hour. Very easy to take it from airport to the city.Very good priceDuring the last months it start to become very busy.Anyway also for tourists it's the best way to reach the city from the airport.

Efficient BTS. It is so easy and hassle free and you need not worry about toll charges and the exorbitant taxi fare that is around 400Bahts some r 450Bahts! The lack o communication make you worry about your ride even before you can enjoy the trip.Don't miss your hassle free ride into the city O! no traffic jam!

Takes a bit of time to figure out but worth it.. I took a cab from the airport and I had problems with knowing where to pick this up in Bangkok, but the trip from the airport is a breeze. Figure this out and take it all the time. The exception being is when you have a huge pile of useless luggage that you can not get up the escalators to the train. Next time reduce your luggage (via Rick Steves books) and take the train.
Efficient and cheap. Efficient, cheap and avoids traffic to get to Suvarnabhumi in 30 min on train from Phaya Thai. No easy with luggage but ok with a rollon.

Inconvenient white elephant!. The Airport Rail Link sounds like a great idea for side-stepping Bangkok's notorious traffic snarls. And, indeed, it is very fast, clean, and cheap during the actual 20-30-minute ride. But that's only part of the story. The Air Rail Link terminal doesn't connect directly to other mass transportation. Instead, passengers are dumped at a relatively isolated terminal not very close to most people's final destinations. In most cases, passengers will then have to find their way down to the taxi stands and contend with often cranky and abusive taxi drivers (seems the ones around the Airport Rail Link terminal are among the worst in Bangkok). By the time passengers lug their bags around and get a taxi (plus waiting for the train at the airport) and make their way to their final destinations, they probably won't really saved much time or money, if any.Moreover, the terminal is not particularly "people friendly" with few lifts and the neighborhood around the terminal building is a bit dodgy (I would not comfortably hang out there, especially in the evenings). Finally, the trains themselves don't have luggage racks so you have to constantly juggle yourself and control of your bags.Unless you're going to a destination quite close to the Airport Rail Link Terminal, do yourself a favor and just take a taxi!

Convenient, fast - but can get crowded. Took the City airport rail link to/from Suvarnabhumi airport to Phaya Thai for BTS interchange (or Makkasan for MRT interchange). Cost 45Bahts each and took about 20 minutes. One time use tokens were easy to get from ticket vending machines that accepted 100, 50, 20 Baht notes. Best way to reach airport in predictable time. But gets really crowded during peak times. No luggage racks - so mind that large pull-man or baby stroller.

Ok but. Gave this service a try for the first time from the airport. The service was good and on time but very crowded however we were in peakhour at 5.30pm. We were travelling onto to Banglamphu which is 6 kilns past the last stop Phaya Thai. We then had to get a taxi which took about 15 mins at the rank to get one as no driver wanted such a show fare at that time. In the end the whole trip to the hotel took just over an hour which is he same that in normally takes in a taxi at that time, however it was a good experience that we have ticked off.We won't do it again as it was difficult with bags due to the crowds however if you are out of peak hour or are only going to the inner city it may be better

Excellent! So convenient!. We usually travel in a group of 4 so we usually take a cab as it's more economical but when we picked our holiday apartment with direct access to the Airport Rail Link, we were sold! It was a breeze buying a ticket from the airport. Signage is clear. Just ask the counter staff when buying the tickets (which is a coin token) if you have questions. Most convenient was on our return trip to the Airport. We didn't have to pre-book a cab and we didn't have to worry if the ride would turn up because the Rail Link was dependably on time! Great alternative to cabbing in Bangkok!

Cheap Travel. Cheapest and quickest way to get into the city. Very easy to use. Gets a bit crowded at peak times especially if you have luggage but worth the squash. Its not for long as the locals get off out of the tourist areas. There is a non stop train much quicker and one that stops (cheaper). We took the train that stops as the route meant we didn't have to swop trains with all our luggage. If you don't have luggage think the non stop will be a lot quieter and a better option.
Good way to get to town. Cheap transport to and from the airport. 35 Baht (about A$1.30) as opposed to 350 Baht by taxiRegular service. Cheap taxis once you're in the city.

Depending on where you are going.... Really comes down to if you are staying close to anywhere on the city links. If you are, it is fast, cheap and clean. If you have to take this and then get a taxi for where you are going, might not be worth the trouble.If you are up to see a great view of the city and have a backpack, go for it!
Cool, efficient, good value. Air cone was a relief, and it's easy to use. Only up to 45BHT for a trip, so good value. Vending machines have an 'English' option if the ticket queue is too long.
A little cheaper than taxis. If you are going far is quicker than taxi. But too much waiting for train for short distances. That about sums it up.

Cheap, yet a bit inconvenient way to airport. The Airport Rail Link is another part of Bankok's already great public transportation system.... and much cheaper than taking a limo or taxi. For travellers with lots of luggage it will be dificult when trying to connect with the BTS at Priya Thai BTS Station.

Airport Rail Link. convenient, user friendly and inexpensive. Very helpful staff at the stations who helped us with ticketing and directions. Signage for exits could have been better but was not a major issue

Connectivity is key to tourism in Bangkok!. The minute we arrived, we head to the train station just below the airport. Cost only $2 to get to central part of town. Very convenient and quick. From the central station A7, it takes us 10 minutes to get to our hotel. Really easy and safe.Take the rail if you do not have too many baggage. Just ask for directions as Thai people are very friendly. land of the SMILES!get a local map and check out the MRT..it takes you to most attractions.
only for light travellers. Not a seemless travel to BTS which does not have lifts or escalator for travellers with heavy luggage.

So easy to find and great value. Airport rail link is so easy to find and great value, Rail link drops you off at the intersection with the Sky-train and is far more quicker than getting a taxi with the state of the traffic in Bangkok most of the time.

Very Fast ,Comfortable and Cheap.. When I reached Bangkok I took the taxi from Suvarnabhumi to Sukumvit which costed me 350 Baht (incl. expressway toll). [During rush hour time you can be asked to pay 500 Baht flat rate for the same!!]. Plus it takes long if you are stuck in traffic. On the way back to the Airport I decided to take the Airport Rail Link. The Airport Link starts from BTS Phaya Thai on the green line. You don't have to worry about ,'how will i get through the automatic gates if I have luggage?'. The staff is very helpful at all the stations.{they open the manual door to let you pass}. The connection at BTS Phaya Thai is very convenient and passenger friendly (you don't have to walk long distances). The cost of the ticket is 45 Baht. (my trip from BTS Nana to Phaya Thai costed me 25 Baht). The Airport Link drops you right at the terminal - level = -1.So its very convenient and will save you a lot of money. If you are four people - it won't make a lot of difference in terms of cost but a lot in terms of time if its peak traffic time.

I always take this service upon arrival. Airport Rail Link was established on June 2010. It has been a great help to avoid the traffic jam and the quickest way to reach to your hotel after a long flight. There are 2 services, the Express Line and the City Line. The Express line is a direct service which would drop you at BTS (Sky train station) while the City Line stops at every station on its rout and BTS ( Phaya Thai station) is the last stop of the City Line. Some people who have too much luggage might not find if comfortable as its not easy to drag your luggage around.If you are going to airport then there is a check in facility at the first stop. At Makkasan station for Express Line and at Phaya Thai station for City Line, so you can drop your luggage there and reach at the counter at the airport to get your boarding card.... its very easy...

Fastest & Cheapest way to the airport. A ride from Makkasan station (next to Petchburi MRT station) to Suvarnabhumi Airport only costs 35 baht. Takes about 30 minutes with a few stops in between to get to the airport. Beware of rush hours though, as it can get VERY crowded and you may have to miss the first 2 rounds of the train due to long queue and crowd. Train is clean and has got good air conditioning.
Easy and Very Convenient. I have taken Airport link couple of times and wish we could have something similar in other Asian countries.

Quick and easy. This link is cheap and takes you right to the train station beneath the airport. Trains run on schedule and are clean and fast. Several stations to board from the inner city and outer suburbs. Nice view of the city and surrounds along the way. Most locals will understand English is you need to ask a questions.

Brilliant for us... do your research first. I thought the Airport link was easy and great value. It was relliable and made our journey to and from the airport almost effortless. It was busyer in the morning but by no means uncomfortable, if you have luiggage you should be in the standing section anyway and you can always sit on your bags! Get a trolley at the airport and take the lift to the station, there is only a small amount of steps to the platform and most other stations have escalators out. You can't expect the line to go every where you want it to so do some reasearch before you book a place to stay, For us it was easy, we took the airport link then shared a taxi with another couple near to our hotel which was not expensive. When we went back to bangkok we chose a hotel within walking distance to the airport link station but also close to other attractions we wanted.. If you choose any old hotel/hostel before you check where the airport link stations and what other transport is around no wonder people find it hard! Besides traffic, this is a really easy city to get around with or without luggage. You really don't need to take much with you especially if your only going for a couple of weeks just pack light and take a large rucksack rather than a suitcase, laundry services will wash your things in less than 24hrs! Although I reccomend buying a cheap suitcase out there if you want to go home with tons of shopping... it's never as bad lugging things around when you leave and you'd be supprised what you can fit on a tuktuk.

No Problem. Hopped off plane, got suitcase, followed signs to train, paid a couple of baht (remember it can cost up to 1600 baht for a private car from the airport to Sukhumvit, Riverside, Patpong or other central locations), waited 5 or 10 mins on train. Yes the express no longer runs but Bangkok traffic still does. Relax enjoy the view. There is a bit of bag carrying up and down some stairs so if you cant handle that get a cab.Safe travels

A cheap and maybe quick way to the city. This rail will take you through the outskirts of bangkok and will finally end at the Phaya Thai BTS. The Express line was not functioning during my visit. The city line only costed 45 THB from the airport to Phaya Thai.
Beware it's waste your Time!. A lot of problem waiting for you.The Express Line, direct link from Phayathai to Airport is stoped.
quick and easy to use. Be prepared to be squashed and stand at peak times, also if you have a seat make sure you offer it up to appropriate people - handicapped, pregnant, aged, monks etc

Is this an airport link? really ?. No direct link to phayathai from the airport. The train stops everywhere and is quickly crowded.Station have no escalators . Either you take the small lift and wait a while or go for the stairs which is very uncomfortable when you have luggages.....

Havnt got it right yet. Good quick way to get to airport from city during rush hours which seems all day now. Only down side is if you have luggage and take express to Macasan there are very few taxis about and large suitcases sometimes not allowed on metro station nearby. If you go onto link up with Skytrain ...NO lifts! All a bit typical Thai sadly.
no problems. a great fast way to get from bkk to Bangkok city centre , clean, fast , efficient ,and very regular .
good. It is a very good public transportation which we can easily access between the airport and city center. But it is a bit slow. The Express Link should be resumed.
Good & Fast!. Good, cheap & fast way of travelling from airport to the city area. There is no problem even I'm travelling with my 70 years old mum & 5 years old niece. The staffs are very helpful.

Slow. I've been on this Airport Link several times, and have been happy with the service. However, recently they have been experience lots of problems and the service has gotten much slower. I read in the news that the management will fix their problems by the end of this month. Let's see...

Easy way to get to the airport. But where is express train?. I have never been able to catch express train as they only run it one per hour... Also, heard a rumor that there is no express train in service. The regular train are okay, and will get you to airport in 30 minutes from downtown Bangkok but could get very crowded.
Saving time. I can save time if I have to go to airport price is cheap beat the traffic but evening time is little too much rush. But still ok
easy travel back to BKK airport. so cheap and comfortable. dont be scared to use this transport to find other parts of the city. if you get lost - ask someone who looks official

So easy to use. On arriving by taxi at the Makassan large railway terminal solely for the airport trains it was most obvious how spacious everything is with hardly any persons around apart from staff.Easily bought two tickets from ticket counter where clear signs about purchase in English. Similarly I have previously used the self-service machines where it was easy in English.Plenty of room at barriers when wheeling large suitcase.Plenty of clean large lifts.Good TV monitor information signs both on the platform and in train.Adequate seating and luggage space on clean train carriage.Most convenient platform location for getting straight up to departures concourse at airport.Saved the uncertainty of taxis being caught in traffic jams on expressway.
A standard Airport connection.. Straight to City Centre. One train change. One flight of stairs to be walked in entire journey. Total time 75 mins.

Excellent way to travel from Airport to city.. Stayed at KC Place at Rathaprarop and found this mode of transportation to be most appropriate, took 20 mins to travel to nearest station and 5 mins walk to hotel.Ratchaprarop station also has Indra Square and Baiyoke Sky Hotel in very close vicinityIt is excellent way to avoid rush hour traffic and save some taxi money. It took 40 bhat per person to travel from airport to Ratchaprarop.

it is ok, looks like delhi metro but costlier than delhi metro. we got the train from airport and travelled to another point.loved it,loved the ride, it is like riding delhi metro in bangkok with paying some extra money
Airport rail link. Great to be able to go downtown directly from airport by public transport. Cheap and efficient. Connects to metro at Makassan.

Economical but a little inconvenient. We have a condo near Makhasan Station and occasionally take the train to or from Suvarnhabumi airport when we travel.Almost everyone takes the City Line which is less than half the cost of express that onlt takes you to a couple stations I believe. Why they even run the express is a mystery to me. Hours of the train are approximately 6am to midnite so depends on when you arrive or depart as to whether train is option. Depending on direction you are traveling from Makhasan taxis are either easy or a big hassle. For instance our condo is just over 1000 meters from the station but to get to it taxis cannot turn right on Asok so have to take a long expensive ride through traffic. Usually if we are coming from the airport we just take a metered airport taxi. Going to the airport for us it's a better option.

Fastest access to city. This airport link is very easy, convenient and fastest way to access the city. Only takes half hour to reach the city and cheaper than a taxi. Last stop at Phaya Thai station which you can interchange with BTS or taxi.

Easy ride to the city. The airport express is a quick and cheap way to get to the city centre, especially useful when traffic is heavy in Bangkok... Which is often... Catch the city train as it's much cheaper and is not much slower. You can change very easily onto the BTS at Phaya Thai but need a separate ticket for BTS.
A very convenient way to get to the city. It was very easy to get the train from the Airport.The travel time is about half an hour and you could avoid the traffic congestion.
Very convenient. This is a great service between 6am and Midnight. Less than 50b per person and takes you from the airport straight to the city. Much cheaper and easier than a taxi.

Efficient way to get to city. Train cabin is clean. Schedule is always on time. Quick and comfortable ride to and from city. Phayathai station links with BTS which gives travellers great convienence way for transit. Fare is way more than worthy at 45Baht to get you all the way to the city.
Excellent Rail link. Best way to visit SIAM from Airport. It was reasonable. Taxi was costly , like 500 bhat. but from rail link it took me 80bhat

Quick way to reach city. Quick and cheap way to reach city if you travel in small group of not more than 3 persons. For group of 4 persons, cheaper to get a taxi unless you want to avoid the traffic jam hours.

Awesome Transportation. This is a great way to get around parts of Bangkok that are not along the BTS route. And if you are new in Bangkok, it is great to stay along the airport link until you get situated. We used the link every day when we first moved to Bangkok. The schedule does change but they post the schedule for weekdays and weekends.

Very convenient. If you have planned nicely or know your way this is a very reasonable mode of transport. I dont remember name of a hotel which is just right next to a station can be Ok for a short visit.
Easiest and cheapest way to the airport. It gets the job done.However, I think BTS is a much better train ... both inside the train and train platform.

Delayed for about 20mins. I had taken the Airport Rail Link a couple of times and was fine with it. Just that this time, I had decided to check in early at the airport. Luckily, I got still got to the airport with time to spare. Just that the train seemed to have lost power and the operator announced that he got to reset the train. And we had to do with out air-conditioning for around 10 mins. Some tourists were anxious, maybe they were already tight with their time. But at least it was operational again. At that time, it was peak hour as people are leaving work for home. If they were to leave the train and take other mode of transport, good luck haha.

Skip the traffic. For about 45 baht, you can sit back (if you're lucky enough to find a seat) and enjoy the air conditioned railway to downtown Bangkok. Ive been stuck in traffic before and it was the absolute worst. It made LA traffic seem like it was nothing. I literally stood still in a taxi for 40 minutes. I even felt bad that the taxi was kept in idle that long just for air conditioning. This railway is quick, smooth, and takes you all over Bangkok.

Express ...only till Makasan. My previous trips...the express rail link brought me to Phaya Thai...apparently now this option starts and ends at M. from the airport. Most passengers will have to opt for the 45 THB 6 stops journey to PT.
BKK Rail link. It was a quick, cool, hassle free ride to the airport from City center. No worries about BKK's infamous traffic jams.

cheap yet will carry you conveniently. very cheap! i cant believe it. well maybe because everything in singapore where im from is expensive. spacious sitting arrangement and got big spaces for your luggages too. and mostly, can bring you to you r destination fast and away from bangkok's super heavy traffic.

Economical.... Just experience the Bangkok traffic once...then you will realize the importance of this rail link. I am sure the first timers will become mad after experiencing the Bangkok's traffic. there are places, where the traffic will move 2k.m per hour. No exaggeration...it's my experience. Once your immigration is done, collect the baggage and come out. You will find clear suggestions and directions to access the rail link in the airport. It costs around 45 bahts to travel to central areas of Bangkok and it is deadly fast. Of course it is AC train, so that you can enjoy the train in the Bangkok's hot weather.

Cheap & efficient. Jam-free, fuss-free and extremely comfortable. This is the best mode of transit if you want to get into the city center or vise versa. It is especially good if you are catching a flight because it allows you to plan your time more efficiently without having to worry about traffic. Very clean with super cooling air conditioning.

BKK airport express service not available use city line (same stations) cheaper and just few minutes longer. just as a FYI the airport express service which runs non stop from BKK airport (Suvanhabumi) to Makassan does not exist at this time. The trains have been taken out of service for maintanance !!you can get the city line, which runs on the same track, stops at a few stations and at one third of the price of the express. takes around 10 minutes longer to get to Makassan ...

The Most Excellent, airport rail link ever.. It very easy to find this from Suvabarnhumi airport Go to basement, and buy a token to get on the rail link. Very clean and cooler with A/C very easy to follow and twenty minutes to get to the other end. Very Simple. Lots of people use this and having suitcases. Also very safe with Rail Warden watching at every station., Cost 45 Bahts. Less than one pound.,
Brillant - wish we had one in Belfast. Very cheap - 45 THB one way. Takes about 40 minutes to the airport and connects to the skyrail. Plenty of seats and space for luggage. Very easy to nagivate.
Easiest way to travel to the airport. Easiest way to travel from the airport into central Bangkok. Traffic in Bangkok is terrible so the rail link is a great way to travel.
Instruction is not clear. A little bit unsure on the route map, this is the only thing I want to say! How may words you expect me to write? Why 50? Please cut this down.

Quick Access. Yep, I used the airport rail link several times, no problems. Purchasing the tickets was easy, either in the airport or at one of the kiosks. It gets you to your destination quickly and basically provides you with a means to connect to public transportation in the core of the city. No problems and I don't speak any Thai. Wizardofwhere.com
Tourist pass $10 all day ticket. Great value for you money you can go everywhere only problem you pay $20 then you return you ticket at the end of your journey and get ten $10 back.
Economical. If you want to save time and money and is eco lover . The link is for you and the best part is at each station there is Taxi pick up point.

Forget the traffic. You can seriously spend well over 90 minutes getting into Bangkok so if you are staying anywhere near a BTS station get the Airport Link and then jump on the BTS. It is clean, safe and always on time!

Fast and save. Definitely the fastest and most reliable way to get from the airport to the city center and vice versa. It is not cheap, but cheaper than a taxi and way more reliable concerning timing.

Only for Backpackers. Make sure you can carry your luggage up or down long flights of stairs.
There is no escalator from the street level.
Otherwise the service is a great way to avoid the typical bangkok taxi driver faux friendliness.

Easy - just do it. Trains are an awesome cheap and easy way to get around. My advice is to make sure you have plenty of time to get to and from each place before your flight. Even though this train goes in one straight line...there were still people struggling...? It's a good way to get a grasp on the "day to say" living of the locals and to also feel like you have "beaten the tourist route" of easier traveling.
fast and efficient!. easy and fast! Easy to find from airport and by far the cheapest option. Easy to find accomodation close to one of the links

Best access to suvarnabhum. This msut be the best access to airport otherwise the Bangkok trafiic can be nasty at times. The airport express train should be caught otherwise the other train stops at multiple stations.
Only Way. I love this Airport link. I used Taxis for a long time until I got sick of either them driving too fast or the traffic was too slow. Super easy to get all over Bangkok by rail.

45 bhat from swampy to downtown. And people still complain. Wow...
FYI the train is in the bottom floor of the airport and goes as far as Phaya Thai Bts. This review was rejected because it has less than one hundred characters. Hold on, lemme hit submit again....

Fast and efficient. We used the airport rail link to get to our hotel in the city of Bangkok.It is fast, efficient and easy to use.The only issue I would say is that once you get to the main metro lines, if you need to change lines it can be a bit time consuming climbing stairs and escalators etc. We also had to open our bags for security.For elderly people, I'd say pay for a taxi. If you're you g and carrying light bags, give this a go.
efficient. a very easy way to get to the city centre , very cheap about 300 baht and quick , well maintained and safe to go on .
good way to travel. clean,fast,cheap,beats a taxi cab,great way to get round.get you to down Bangkok.easy to use,see you in bangkok

Easy, cheap and quick. For us it is the best way to and from the airport. No traffic jam. The trains are ponctial, quick and regularly going. They access to the hotels and you can be sure to arrive at time at the airport.
train ride. awesome train to be in. nice, clean and spacious. walkway well ventilated. There's always an interesting place in every stop.

Great, easy to reach, cheap train service. Plus it's a scenic route, on an elevated train, thru 'slice of life' Bangkok neighborhoods. Take the train to the airport and can even change to a bus to Pattaya from there!
fast and easy. Quick and effortless only if your not carrying too much luggage. Clean and is a direct link to bbks sky link train.

Makes life easy. Don't remember anything negative it was all good. Easiest thing to do is buy a ticket from the staff at the booth rather than try to battle the machines. Info on the trains is in Thai and English, the service is great.
Cheap easy fast. We use the airport link often. Even when we have to stay in bangkok ok for several hours, we jump on the train and head to the city to eat. Very cheap.

Fast and convenient. The fastest and most convinient way to get from the Airport to the city. You can choose between two lines. The City Line with multiple stops for 45 THB or the Express Line goes direct for 90 THB

good solution for reaching a center. It not work after midnight up to 6 o'clock in the morning. Because of intercontinental flights it will be good if staff of Airport Rail Link open few nights rides.
Smooth journey. Quite easy to hop onto the train from our hotel -Pathuwan Princess. Surprisingly, it is clean and the air-conditioning is effective.

Great Way To Arrive in The City. We took the Rail link as it stopped close to our Hotel. Its a great service, clean & AC'ed. As soon as the doors opened & we got out we were hit by the Bangkok heat & the smell of spicy chicken grilling. A pretty perfect start to our visit. Down some stairs, grab some chicken & jump into a TukTuk. Great stuff!

Quick and Easy Train to/from Airport. Easy access to the train from both airport and city terminals. Good connectivity with the mass transit system (BTS) in Bangkok. Can be crowded on the commuter service as the ticket is cheap !

Convenient for Central Bangkok. The airport link runs between Phayathai in Central Bangkok and the airport. It is frequent, reliable and only 30 minutes to town. From Phayathai a transfer to the Skytrain will get you to Siam Square, Silom and the Sukhumvit area. The fare is 45 baht (less than 1 pound) each way and must be bought before boarding, from machines which accept both notes and coins. The downside is that some Skytrain stations don't seem to have escalators or lifts so you might have to carry your own suitcase up and down several flights of stairs. Also not very convenient if you are not staying close to the Skytrain or underground Metro lines.
good way to travel to airport. This ttrain takes very short time. Very clean. Fast way to get to the airport. Ticket also very cheap.

OK if your are travelling light. Took the BTS from Nana to Phaya Thai to get the Airport Link . You would not want to be doing this trip with a lot of luggage, lot of steps to go up and down, very crowed on the BTS and a long walk from the BTS station to the Airport link. I used the city link which took about 1/2 hour to get to the airport. I think it was 76 Baht total cost from Nana to the airport. Taxi drivers were asking 500 Baht.

Great link to the Airport from the City. I took this train service on my way back to the Airport from the city. While a normal taxi charges around THB 400 from Sukhumvit Area, the link would only cost you around THB 60 from same place. You have to get to Phaya Thai BTS Station to interchange with the airport link. From Phaya Thai it costs THB 45 and takes about some 25-30 minutes. It is a very effective and efficient way to get to the airport from the busy city. Not to mention that a taxi could get stuck in a traffic and may result in missing the flights. So why take risk when such a wonderful option is available?
Fast but. A fast way to travel from sukhmvit area to the airport, however the interchange in between is long and energy consuming as you have to walk and carry your luagge for some time
Save Your Money Take The Link. I wish more cities had such a outstanding rail and subway system such as Bangkok. Save the 300- 800 THB and take the train its the only way to get to Shwanabum.

Good, cheap but a walk from arrivals. The Airport Rail Link is a good system to get from or to the airport. From its last station, you will find a direct connection to the BTS Sikhumvit and Silom lines. The only downside is that you will have to leave the carts some way before actually getting to the trains. If you carry heavy luggage, that's a problem.

Good way into Bangkok. A good alternative to reach Bangkok city center during rush hours. We opt to go by train back to the airport one change in between which is quite a long walk but 35 min and we reached the airport, ok

Okay if you travel light. rail link is convenient, cheap and fast to central Bangkok from Suvarnabhumi Airport. But no escalators or elevators down two or three long flights of stair. If you have luggage, take a taxi or hire a private car to get to the city. I use the rail link and other trains for quick getting around.

Quick way into BKK. The airport link is okay, if you know ur way about Bangkok and have a good idea where you are going. If you have a lot of luggage or heavy luggage, it can be awkward. As you need to use the lift at most of the stations.
bai. This is a great service , mucheasier than bus or taxi , very cheap as well , only takes about 40 minutes to get to the city .

Very easy and safe. This is a great way to get to the airport, the cost is minimal and offers a direct service there. Depending where you get in the train you might have to change once but other than that it is fast, clean safe and very easily navigated. Trust me you don't want to be stuck in the traffic in Bangkok.
Easy. Quick and easy, air con , only 30 minutes from Ratchaparop station to airport. Trains run regularly.

Best way to travel between Airport and City Centre . Simple! Get on the ARL and it takes you straight into Bangkok. Its cheap its comfy and its easy. If you can get the express one though as its much quicker!
Fast and convenient. Easy and fast way to get to the airport without getting stuck in trafic, convenient if you do not have too much luggage.

Very convenient when travelling light. A very convenient, inexpencive and fast option to get to Sky Train in the center of Bangkok. But then you might still need to take a taxi to get to your final destination, unless you are familiar with the bus routes.

Easy access to prayha Thai station one stop from the hotel. Express train now cancelled but the all stops train is still great , only 45 baht one way . Get off at prayha Thai station and take one stop to ratchewhi station and hotel is only 30 m from step of station .

Easy Access. Since our hotel located in Sukhumvit Road, it is very easy to use this kind of transport. Saving our money and time. We also easily connected to town. Most of our destination is within the reach of MRT. So, it's very easy and comfortable access to Bangkok (Suvarnabhumi) Airport. The train is also compatible for people with disability.

Best Way To Get from Airport to City Centre. Don't get a taxi from the airport... Not as quick or not as cheap. 45 baht (€1.25) to get to Phaya Thai and about €2 then in a metered taxi from there to Grand Palace or Kho San Road.
Extremely clean method of transport too.
mrt rail. We travelled on the rail from our hotel in Suriwonge rd to Siam paragon in 10 minutes Our return trip in a taxi was 40 minutes and triple the price .the rail is quick and on time .
Fast and cheap. take this from airport to city to avoid the traffic jam during peak hours and is way cheaper if you take a taxi
Fast. Easy to work out how to use. Carriages are clean and cooling. Can get full very quickly and seats are hard to come by but there's plenty of standing room and hand rails to hold onto.

Only got half way. This line gets really packed after the airport. I felt bad our suitcases were taking up room. The train started to smell like burning halfway through the trip so we were all offloaded, had to wait for other trains to take us which were all full, so we dragged our luggage down to the street to get a taxi. I could see it would be a great service if we made it though!

Efficient and Cheap Service. Bangkok Airport Rail link is a very cheap and convenient mode of transportation between Bangkok City and Suvarnabhumi International Airport provided one is travelling light. Though no problem in carriage of luggage till Airport Platform but on reaching Phaya Thai Station in Bangkok, trains have to be changed and shifting of heavy luggage is a problem which is further compounded in case you have to exit the station or any other station of Bangkok Metro as rarely you would find electric escalators for exiting from the platform / metro station; in case of heavy luggage don’t rely on Airport Rail Link and go for metered Taxi but having said that Bangkok Airport Rail link is an efficient yet cheap mode of transportation between the airport and Bangkok City and I prefer Blue Colour MRT as it costs 45 THB and travelling time till the terminal station Phaya Thai is around 35 – 40 minutes while Red Colour MRT costs a lot more and time difference is hardly 15 minutes.

Use this on Friday evening. In case your flight is scheduled on Friday evening, make sure you travel by Airport city link to avoid heavy traffic. Very good service. Changeover at Phayathai BTS to connect to Airport city link

Fast and Reliable. International travelers can take this as a fast and cheaper alternative to taxis. The schedule is reliable and the service is efficient. It takes you right into the heart of Bangkok and makes your onward journey easier.
It could not be easier.. The rail link takes one into the heart of Bangkok to great hotels, shopping and attractions. It also hooks up to the BTS which will take you all over the city.

Perfect & Quick. When arriving at Suvarnabhumi International Airport, this is by far the quickest and safest way to get to the centre of Bangkok. It is clean, safe and hassle free. Just follow the signs from the arrival hall and you will easily reach the basement floor from where the Phaya Thai train link departs / arrives. It cost only THB45 per person and the duration is approximately 30 minutes. Of course also easy and quick if you have to travel from the city to the airport. Very tourist friendly and highly recommended!

boy do they need a link to the subway!!!!. this complex is HUGE but in the end you have to drag your luggage across a muddy trail to get to the subway station... very poor planning and the Taxi's are rude and rare...

The Best & Cheapest Way To Get Into Bangkok. The is definately the way to go if needing to go into Bangkok from the airport or vice versa. It is very reasonable and pretty quick, depending on the time of day. They even have an express train that leaves at different times during the day. If you are traveling on a budget and not in a big hurry, this is the way to get into the city or back to Suvarnabhumi Airport.

High Speed, clean and safe.. Once you have cleared customs, take a escalator or lift to the 1st floor, you will see a Kiosk. You need to use the Right Hand Side of the Kiosk.Ask for a Ticket to Praya Thai, this will take to you the Sky Train interlink for onward travel to a station near your hotel.There are two trains, the Express and the Local Train as I call it.The Express train will transport you from Bangkok Airport to Bangkok City at High Speed, in a very clear and air conditioned manner. The Local Train, will do the same, but there are 7 stops.There are usually plenty of seats, I have travelled on both trains 4 times and have found no need to queue for a taxi anymore, unless you are going to Pattaya.If you are going to Pattaya, then do not use this Airport link as it takes you in the opposite direction and no where near Pattaya, you need a taxi, maybe things will change in the future.The Airport Link is welcome addition to a truly inspiring and transformational city.
Do it. This is the best way to get to your hotel. Cost 45 baht per person and takes 30 minutes. Links to the bts which will take you near to most central hotels

Fast, convenient, comparatively cheap.. It's probably the best and most easy way to get from the airport to the city centre. Even if you have never been to Bangkok before you will be able to use it as everything is well-explained and well-signposted. There is a direct connection to the Skytrain which is just as convenient as the ARL.

Fast Efficient and economical way to get to Suvarnabhumi. Fast and Efficient although it took some time for the train to arrive and when it did, it was quite full so I had to stand for the entire 40 minute ride

A good idea, badly executed.. In my view, the airport rail link has both good and bad features.The good are that it's cheap and is not a terribly long journey.The bad - it's not particularly comfortable. The non-express train just has plastic bench seats and no dedicated luggage area. It's basically a commuter train that also goes to the airport.The stations are an absolute joke. They were obviously designed by an architect who had never travelled anywhere. At Phayathai station for example (the end of the line), there is one lift only and hardly any escalators! You have to basically carry your bags up and down. Moronic.Makkasan station, originally designed to be like the superb Central station in Hong Kong, where you check your bags in before you board the Airport link train, receive your boarding pass, then never have to worry about your bags again - is a total failure and a joke. It is a huge white elephant, stuck in the middle of nowhere.After a while, they extended the Express train to go to Phayathai as well as to Makkasan. That made sense. Now, however, this train has been cancelled for ONE YEAR for maintenance!As the Express trains only seemed to run every hour anyway, you just had to be lucky to get one - otherwise it's quicker to get the "city line" than to wait for an Express.Go online to try to find a timetable and you will find different timetables which aren't the same!Today in the Bangkok Post (Aug 20, 2014), the SRT Chairman admitted that "some sections of the airport rail link are damaged" and that he has assigned crews to fix them!!!! Have they heard about regular, scheduled maintenance? It's not a concept widely understood in Thailand - especially with respect to transport infrastructure.There is now a direct physical link to the BTS station at Phayathai and to the MRT at Makkasan - albeit with a long walk.It's definitely a cheaper and potentially quicker way to get connected to the BTS / MRT system than a cab - but the whole system is badly designed and if there is a group, you certainly need to consider the convenience of a cab.

Great way to travel. Got tired of paying for taxi to Sukumvhit every time I go to Bangkok. This time I took the train to Makassan station. Awesome, hassle free trip for 35 bhat. Than caught MRT to Sukumvhit for 16 bhat. Than walked 3 minutes to my hotel on Soi 21.Total travel time around 30 minutes. This is the way to go. Also, don't have to sit in traffic for an hour.

What's not to like?. Air con, 20 min journey, ideal location for sukhumvit travellers.Best bit - 35thb a ticket. Complete avoidance of the bangkok taxi drivers, most of which are only out to try and scam the foreigners.
Quiet and cheap. Works well, cheap and clean, really good aircon to keep you Kool. Easy to buy tickets at the airport and when we used it at nite was not packed so got a seat easily
The only way from the Airport. Its the best way to beat the traffic and its cheap, fast and always on time as for the BTS and the MRT

Cheap, clean, fast, safe. My title says it all: cheap, clean, safe, safe. Takes about 30 minutes to downtown Bangkok. Express is even faster! Great view of the city. Best ride ever!No need to search/bargain with taxi drivers refusing to turn on their meters targeting tourists. Do not use taxis without a meter. I was scammed... So take care!

most convenient. Its the most convenient way for a transfer mode to suwarnabhumi airport,Save you a lot of time and money too,Its feed back is shut down after midnight and not operated from all areas.But service is good and in every 5/10min you will find them so no need to hurry for missing one.

A breeze to ride on the airport rail. It was a breeze to ride on the airport city rail. We boarded the airport rail from Suvarnabhumi airport to Makkasan. We alighted here and walked for about 10mins towards Petchaburi MRT via a skyway. We got off at the next station, Sukhumvit. The total fare was 60 Baht and total time taken from airport to our hotel was under 1hr. It was a smooth ride without any traffic jam.

Cheap, fast transit to most of the city. -A/C that will chill you very well (because you'll likely be sweating profusely). -Easy access points above the bustling streets.-Every 10 minutes or so another train comes.-Don't try to get them after midnight...they shut down. Yeah I know right? BKK is a nightlife city and the best transit in the city shuts down so that cab drivers can make all the money.

saves a lot of time. roads are deadly occupied by traffic. On the other hand you could easily reach airport in an hour from one corner of the city. while the road may take 3 hrs. It leaves you inside of airport.

The fast way to travel to town. This service takes you from the airport directly to town, the trains are air-conditioned, have TV and comfortable seating, the service is very economical, it only costs 35 Baht to take you to Makkasan where you can connect to the MRT underground of 50 Baht to take you Phaya Thai where you can connect with the Sky train, the Airport Link has ample space in each carriage for your luggage, it is truly great value for the money when you consider it only takes less than 30 minutes to get you to the centre of Bangkok
Nice. This is a very efficient rail service especially for tourist. Very commuter-friendly and stations are near establishments.

The best connection to city center. Fast, clean, cheap, not overcrowded connection to Phaya Thai, where you can take a taxi, hop on a bus or BTS. For those who prefer public transport, the most recommended choice.

Curtailed service on the more expensive express train. It seems that the Express is running less and less -- perhaps because of the big price discrepancy with the local train (which stops at numerous stations between Makkasan and BKK. The express is much better for those with suitcases. However, if there is not a long wait for the next train this is the fastest way to get between central Bangkok and the main international airport.

A Model For All Large Cities To Follow. One of the world's most efficient, user-friendly, cost-effective and pleasant modes of transport. This is the best way to get to/from the airport. The PA system announces each stop clearly and the electronic board also indicates each stop in both Thai and English. While the rail link does not go all the way into the center of Bangkok, there are plenty of places the link reaches and combined with the metro (MRT), it is fairly easy to reach one of the rail link's stations.

cheap and easy. its an easy and cheap way from the bangkok airport to the city. Easy to find in the airport, but no public bus or skytrain in the city station. taxis drivers dont want switch on the meter and the fix price is much to high.
Bangkok rail link. Great way to get downtown from the airport and inexpensive. However if you have a few suitcases it can be a bit awkward.
Good & Price worthy. Very good to travel and avoid heavvy traffic of Bangkok.Easy access to airport in a very good time span in affordable price.

The airport rail link is not good. We didn't want to go to the main station so we left the train at Makasan. But there were no taxis waiting and we had to wait for a long time before one came along. On a subsequent trip we just took a taxi from the airport.The airport rail link is a great concept but the sub-structure is not well thought out - where are the taxis, check in facilities etc.

Airport Rail Link. Used Express line and City line both.Absurdly as it is useful, because it come directly inside the airport, 2-5 min from check-ins and 5 min from binary of BTS of PayaThai.Price is not expensive for Express line, very cheap for City Line.

It's not that daunting!. Taxis are usually easy and not that expensive to go most places in Bangkok, but if you like public transportation like I do, the Airport Rail Link is a good, inexpensive way to get to places that are near to the BTS and/or MRT. Just know which station you need to get to and follow the signs leading down to the bottom level and the Rail Link. You can only buy tickets here for stops along the Rail Link, then if you transfer to the BTS at Phaya Thai or the MRT at Makkasan then purchase those tickets there. There is an express train from the airport to Makkasan but I could never see the value in that. Enjoy getting immersed into the fantastic Thai life if not too tired and it's not too late and you don't have too much luggage. They do stop running late at night, be sure to check.

fastest way to airport. It is very convenient if you have small luggage, as you probably have to take the stairs. only about 30 mins by rapid train. much cheaper than a taxi which can cost you upto 400 baht including toll way pass.

Good rail system. It's connected to everywhere you want to go! It may be confusing at first, since you're not used to it. But you will find travelling by train could be much better than taking a taxi.
quick. its amazing how one used to take hours to get to the city and now it is only 30 mins. smooth and quick. easy to use with directions provided.

Safe, Fast, Cheap and Comfortable. When a transport is modern, in very good conditions and also safe , fast , very cheap(unless you only do one or two stops because the price it's the always the same) and comfortable you must give 5stars.

Fast, reliable and easy to navigate.. We had a hotel close to a Skytrain (BTS) station. The BTS trains and other public transportations link at Phaya That station (which is the final stop), and crossing over to these are easy. It is much quicker than a taxi (Bangkok traffic is horrendous) and much cheaper. You also get to see a some of the city from the windows. Frequent departures in both directions.

Cheap, easy, fast and efficient. Arriving in Bangkok for the first time we found this an easy way to get into the city and then change onto the BTS skytrain to get to our hotel. N worries about being ripped off by taxis or about getting stuck in the famous Bangkok traffic!
Would use again!. Used the City Line one way and the Express back. Both good and if you have the time, the city line is a lot cheaper.

A very fast way to come from a-b during rush hour. I really enjoy it to take the Skytrain. If you know the city and the map of the Skytrain then It's a very fast way to come around in the city. The ticket vending machines cannot rip you of like a taxi driver. It's a little bit expensive and I think, that's the reason that the temperature inside the Skytrain is freezing!
good transportation. excellent service, a bit crowded but fast and reliablethe train is clean and the time schedule is good,.

if you fly with Thai: check in here. Amazing, in the years since it started most tourists do njot realize the advatage of the railway link. Most important: At Makkasan is a check in. I checked in there for my late evening flight in the afternoon. I was the ONLY person. So had not to wait and got quit of my luggage and had myboarding card. So i could the rest of the day relax and had no long ques in the evening but went from my taxi straight to the immigration! (Have heard Railway link is under reconstruction now. But perhaps the check in still works. Just check if you can use it!

Pyathai. Very nice airport link form the international airport to pyathai station, from here you can take the skytrain to all directions where you want to be. Very good for the backpackers and the people how come often in Bangkok
Max 2 persons otherwise take a taxi. Expensive when you're with a family, better take a taxi.Traveling to the airport and beat rush hour better take the train to avoid traffic jam.

Very efficient service. . We can not speak highly enough of this system. Very well sign posted throughout the airport. Easy ticket facilities to use. Very frequent service. Clean, tidy and not too busy even at rush hour. A security check was made every time it arrived at the airport which made you feel safe.Only 45 baht each from airport to the last stop... Amazing value!!
Fast and efficient service. The airport rail link provides a fast and efficient service into central Bangkok. A great alternative to taxi service if you have minimal luggage.
Good alternative to taxi. Cheap and fast way to get into the city. The Airport Rail runs frequently and connects directly to the Bangkok Skytrain.

Excellent frequency, great connectivity, fast and cheap, too!. A real relief and a surefire way to avoid BKK traffic jams while getting into the heart of the city - I travel to BKK often on business and this has saved me not only money but also tons of time, especially during the recent periods of unrest when entire roads were blocked off.

A cheap , clean , comfortable option. Coming from Samui with only one bag, didn't want to spend much, that was a great option. The train has many stops but if you are not in a hurry than it gives you a chance to see Bangkok and enjoy the air conditioned ride above the city. Mind , last stop is where we needed to take a taxi to our destination, there is an "assigned" area to take the taxi with 2 official train workers, helping you to get a taxi. Ours was an out of town driver who did not how to get to our hotel( the "Mandarin-can you believe it?)so all the time and money we saved went down the drain. You might as well pick a taxi in the street. You might encounter some steps on some of the stops so if you have a lot of luggage maybe you better of with a taxi

fast mode of transportation. airport rail link always my choice for going from suvarnabhumi airport to bangkok city center (phaya thai station) for 45 THB , fast , safe , comfortable with scenic view of bangkok always love it

The best way to get into town. This is probably the best way to get into town, if where every you are going to has a BTS station. The only other alternative is to get on over priced taxis at airports, or possibly get stuck in the traffic jam.

BEST WAY TO TRANSFER FROM AIRPORT TO BANGKOK. This was the first time we have used the BTS to get from Suvarnabhumi Aiport into Bangkok City and will never catch a Taxi again. Just try and make sure you choose a hotel which is close to the City Line on the BTS. We stayed at the Baiyoke Sky (fabulous hotel).
