We caught the BTS Sky train, which leaves from inside the Airport very regularly and took us approximately 25 minutes to get to the Ratchaprarop Station, which is the second last station on the line and it cost us Thb40 each...compared to anything up to Thb700 in a Taxi which takes over an hour or more in traffic.

Airport to Chatrium Riverside. This is the cheapest and fastest way to get to the hotel. the train takes you from the airport to a station about 1 km from the hotel, as you get off the train, walk towards the river for about 3 minutes and the hotel boat will take you directly to the hotel dock
finally. After many years, finally i had the chance to try it. Great service. BTS standard. in 20 minutes u are downtown (for 35 bath) avoiding the taxi scums and the traffic jam. Love it

Easy ride to the airport. The Airport Rail Link is a very useful way of getting to the airport. Even with suitcases it is quite easy to manage. Just be sure to follow all the signs to make sure you get to the station from Phaya Thai. Lifts will also help you.

first and cheap. I always use Airport Link and BTS train to go to hotel when I travel to Bangkok and arrive before 11:00 at night. It's first and cheap. you should use these when you stay hotel near BTS station and when you come to Thai by personal vacation.

Great choice during traffic. Too bad that it is not really connected to an MRT or BTS. you have to walk from another station (Petchaburri) to the Airport raillink staion. If you have luggage better avoid the hassle and take a taxi (not during rush hour thoug) and pay 250-300 THB.

An excellent way to travel to Bangkok from city.. this is an excellent mode of travel from Bangkok airport to city.. the fare upto Phon Thai station is 45 bath for normal train, and higher fare(donot remember now) for direct train, however i would recommend to go with normal train, it makes only 5-7min difference. From Phon Thai station one can get connections to other MRT stations easily.I found this link much easier to use than taxis, if you want to go to center of bangkok- say Sukhumvit, then with taxis you may end up in traffic jams, this is not with the rail link.this link is less costly too..
Too crowded. took this rail link from airport to go to pratunam.it is little bit crowded since everyone use this train to go to their destination.

Airport Rail Link. A fast and easy transport to leave the airport to town area. Everyday at 6pm, at the waiting area to board the train. Station will play Thailand Nation Song, the thai really respect. Every thai will stand at attention. Normally i will travel from Airport to Pratunam area via this cheap and under 30 min. Avoid peak hrs if you are taking non express train.

Save Money and use the train. We only discovered in 2013 how convenient the train is to get to our hotel. We stayed in the Baitoke Sky hotel and we took the trai it cost us 40 baht one way where a taxy would cost about 700 to 1000 baht. It was only a 10min walk to the hotel. Just see how far you are from the station and hop on its worth it.
Great service. I took it fairly late at night. Finding the express line was a Lyle difficult as the signage was confusing. But once on it it simple, fast and efficient.
Convenient. This is a very useful way for us to visit many famous attractions in Banhkok in the fastest way. Not only cheap but also very fast.

Fast, cheap and easy way to and from BKK airport.. Instead of buying the Express Route tickets (Phayathai-Suvarnabhumi or Makkasan-Suvarnabhumi) for 150 Baht we opted for the SA City Line (stops at 6 stations before arriving at the airport) for 45 Baht. The 18 or 15 minute non-stop service is ideal for those who wants less travel time, who wants to avoid the city commuters and who is carrying tons of luggage. But for those people like us who isn't in a hurry, loves the commute and is carrying a reasonable amount of luggage, the SA City Line is good enough. The trains are big enough so you can stand side by side with your luggage.
Excellent service to the city.. Always on time, fast, clean and cheap. The train links up with the Skytrain in the city. From here you can get pretty much everywhere.

Really easy. Ok, you buy a token at the airport 45 Baht.Only the stopping all stations line runs despite all the brochures but thats fine.Takes you into the city area where you can connect to other transport services.Would never use a taxi againHelp desks located at station in Airport terminal.

Perfect escape. The ease and affordability of this service. Can be crowded but still beats traffic in a taxi. We were lucky to get on at the first station of departure and it was still standing room only. It only takes 30 minutes. Seats became available.

Cheap way to town. Great to get into town if you don't mind changing the train with quiet a long walk in between, don't forget the heat in Bangkok. However its a fast and efficient way to get into the heart if Bangkok. I actually went by taxi but my friend took the link and bts to sukhumvit, well he was there faster then me.

Long journey, but easy AC fast rail transfer. We were really tired after a long journey and it was tempting to jump into a taxi, but the rail link is very easy to navigate. It's cheap (45THB each -£1), air-conditioned and not at the mercy of traffic (a reliable half hour journey) We easily caught a taxi at the other end to our hotel

Connectivity between Town & Airport. It is now so easy to save time between Airport and town but only hassle is need to walk a distance to get on and get out. Not so welcoming and can be better to make the moving around experientially pleasant.

Boon for Solo travellers. 20 mins and you are in Suvarnabhoomi Airport. What else you want when the traffic in Bangkok is crawling and require 1.5 hrs to reach airport from city centre. Cost is THB 40 where as taxi will take min THB 150 from city centre. Stunning looks, user friendly rail system, courteous staff. However travelling with huge luggage is difficult and thus its better if its less or light baggage.

Great idea, but poor access and taxi availability from the Makkasan terminus. This is not a bad value and a great idea. The signage is poor. The Makkasan station offers poor taxi access (taxis do not wish to serve passengers from this station, so you must walk across the road , albeit with a quite new flyover it has become more safe) and the staff have poor English skills and are unresponsive. It is much better than a taxi; at least, you are not cheated nor :taken for a ride".
Convenient. Faster than a taxi for the location we were in (Makkan), clean, great views, cheap, safe, reliable, easy.
City Line Only. The Express line has been closed for some time, but the City Line runs 4 times an hour. Bt45 from the airport to Phaya Thai, 35 to Makkasan.

Very easy, but. Rail Link from the Airport to Phaya Thai is a winner and very fast and cheap, BUT the airport staff need to be better informed. In very good English, a staff member told me the line no longer went all the way to Phaya Thai, which I knew was wrong. On the Express Line, you do have to change at Makkasan, and that adds a few minutes and changing platforms. But the end of the line is definitely not closed,

Quick and Easy. By far the quickest way to get between the airport and city centre. Traffic is pretty crazy in Bangkok so a taxi ride can take a long time. If there isn't a station close to your hotel it would probably still be a lot quicker to use the train and then take a taxi from the station.

Above average public transportation. If you are traveling outside of peak hours and on a real budget it is cheap and clean. Timing it right to catch the express train instead of the local can be a challenge (local is cheaper and takes twice as long). Trains run about every fifteen minutes or so and the local run takes about 45 minutes to go from the Racthathawie BTS station to the airport. Traveling with luggage during rush hour or other high traffic times can be a pain. I have used it to get to the airport to meet incoming people and when I have returned to Bangkok only traveling with a carry on.
Convenient. It was so much easier than catching a cab! We used it to and from the main Bangkok airport, and found it fairly easy to navigate.

Unbelievable deal ... but .... make sure you are either just out of gorilla training (strength / flexibility to haul luggage) or ...carry one suitcase and one bag ... do not take a lot ... lots of up and down steps and hauling luggage (like Tokyo Station ... kinda) ... but no better deal for transportation to & from Suvarnabhumi than this ...

"THE" way to go from the airport to the city and back. Forget about taxis and limo's. Take the express (take the faster one) and you will be in the center of Bangkok in less than 20 minutes at the price of 80BHT.
Fast and reliable.. Wonderful cheap way to go to the city center. However, if you are 4 people, and have to take MRT or BTS after the Airport Rail Link, a taxi will be more cost efficent.

No Better Option. There's no better way to and from the airport. The express train is only good if you time it right. Their definition of express is one or two trains per hour. The express train is more comfortable and more like a real airport connection. The City Line is more of an urban rail line and is used by many locals as public transit, so the trains can be crowded, and there is no room for luggage. If you can time it right, go for the express.
Best way to travel. Fast, takes you straight to your international terminal and reasonably priced.Plenty of room for luggage and the platforms are well signposted.

Excellent. Try this on the way from the Airport to your hotel, if your hotel isnt in some remote location. The train is located just on the ground floor of the airport and is so easy. Their trains are so clean and modern and the train ticketer are a great help if you have the full address of where you want to go. If you dont want to do it just to save money do it for the experience. We got to Bangkok International Suvarnabhumi Airport in the morning, exchange currency then took the train to Islom, our hotel was about a 5min walk.

Best hassle free way into city. Best option from and to airport connects to MRT and MRT connects at some stations to Skytrain system. Signage is great in dual language - English and Thai, easy to follow. No waiting in congested traffic.

Easy. This was an easy trip, with staff speaking English, and offering help. Thirty minutes to the last city stop, we had a seat , but after a few stations the train got full, some people were standing.Staff on arrival were also very helpful, and we got a taxi to our hotel.

Affordable ride but where is express train?. The ride from downtown Bangkok (mukkasan station) to the airport only take about 30 minutes and only cost about $1. However, if you are looking for express train, you will be very disappointed as it only has 1 express train every hour now I believe...
quick and easy. much underused rapid train travel from the airport to the heart of bangkok with no traffic jams. cheap and may still nean a taxi to your hotel but great none the less

The best way to get in and out. The Airport Rail Link is by far the best and the fastest and paineless way to get in and out of town. The traffic in Bangkok is unreal! Avoid taxis and buses at all costs.Talking either the express or local line to "Makkasan", you'll will connect safely trough an upper bridge into "Phetchaburi MRT" station from there you can figure your way to your final destination pretty easily.
Excellent. Great rail system! Easy and economical, English wording Acong with Thai make it easy. Easy connection to the City.
Quick, easy access to and from the City and Airport. Can be busy and overcrowded, but easily managed. Its only 45 Baht to / from the airport. All up it took us around 30 minutes per direction.
CLUTCH. makes life easy. Fast, clean, air conditioned, cheap. Use it- but try to get on at the first stop, otherwise you may not get a seat

To BKK city centre. We took the airport rail link from Suvarnabhumi International Airport to Phaya Thai station for just 45 bahts per person. It took us 30mins, cutting through major jams which Bangkok is notorious for. There's a walkway to BTS Phaya Thai station which make the ease of transfer between airport rail link and BTS a breeze.
easiness. a great facility between the airport and the city center especially where there is too much traffic and over heat.

Cheap but poorly located.. We were staying in a hotel not far from its terminus, but for those who aren't, you have to alight and catch the local train into Bangkok. OK for us as it was fast, clean spacious and cheap, but very empty!
Express link at Makkasan station is the way to go!. The express link is very comfortable with cushioned seats. It's not crowded. I think I paid 90 baht. Will arrive at the airport in 15 minutes.
Very good means of transport. Very convenient and cheap to move in Bangkok. Especially, it has a direct connection to my hotel there
efficient way to get to central Bangkok. fast, cheap, clean, and easy to use. I always use it and stay at a hotel nearby so it is a breeze to get to airport!

Easy way to the city and BKK!. One train stops only between the airport and the downtown depot, while the other stops at a few places in between.
Nice trains and a comfortable way to get there or back.

Best way to the airport during rush hour. This is the best way to get to/from the airport, especially if your hotel (or your home) is close to the BTS line that connects to the Airport Rail Link. Not only is it inexpensive, but its just 30 mins and reliable. A taxi could take 2 hours or more during rush hour (taxi early morning and late evening is more like 30 mins). Its a pity the airport link express now doesn't run all the way to the BTS - though the local train does.

The easiest way to get into the city. Who has been traveling to Bangkok already knows the annoying traffic jams all around town. With the Airport Rail Link you can easily avoid most of this and just take the Skytrain to or at least to a location near your hotel. If you choose your hotel to be near a Skytrain station, you will never be wrong, because this makes traveling and moving around town a lot easier. Fares are very moderate and also taking luggage on the Skytrains is not a big thing, as you have elevators or escalators at every station.

Fast & efficient. Clean & efficient but if your arriving for the first time with a lot of luggage, children & duty free you'll find a taxi easier - I use it only when returning to the airport when leaving (less luggage to man handle).

Fast and efficient. The fastest and best way to get out of the airport.
Make sure your destination is near one of the stops or the stops connect to one of Bangkok's other public transport systems.
Public transport is world class

Never again. not even close to the Hong Kong service, arriving in the middle of nowhere and then waiting forever for a taxi and spending even more time in traffic jams does not seem like a well thought travel experience!
Quickest way into city. First time in Bangkok, but so simple to use, and a very quick & easy way to get into the city, even with cases.

good product but terminal points are not so accessible to city centre. Price is similar to a metered taxi from Asok BTS. If you are two or more travelling get a metered taxi. Cost of travel to Asoke area is halved per person.

Big and somewhat confusing.. Not really much to say here. The stations can be spacious, such as Makkasan and Phaya Thai. The signage is lacking and can be confusing to find out where the trains are, even for a local Bangkokian like myself. That said, the stations and trains are efficient. I prefer the express trains, it's cleaner, faster, has seating guaranteed, and worth the extra cost. The local train is similar to a larger version of the BTS line; so seating is not guaranteed and there are more stops.

The only way airport to BBK.. What a great service this is. Direct into BBK, no fuss, no messing about. One price for all, that in its self makes a change. Linking into other train services in BBK it is quick, clean and efficient. A win win for all.

Easy to use, clean and safe. I boarded the Airport Rail Link at the BKK airport. It was easy to find in the airport by following the signs. Purchasing a ticket was easy and there was an employee there to help answer questions. The train was clean and safe and I made it into Bangkok quickly. If you can take this instead of taking a taxi, I would recommend it. The traffic was terrible when I arrived in Bangkok and the ARL got me into Bangkok without hassle. I took a short and inexpensive taxi to my hotel at the end of the line.
Excellent Service. Love the speed it gets you into town (as long as your destination is close by a station, which mine is!). Shame it get's so busy from the 2nd and 3rd stations into town.
fantastic. if you pick a hotel close to transit routes, simply only way to get to and from airports as long as you do not get in or out too late.

easy, inexpensive and fast. easy to use but packed with commuters in the morning from the stations after airport station. End station is dirctly linked to BTS taking you to most of the city centre and beyond

Bangkok Airport-Transfer review - Impressive. This years 2014 i have been to Bangkok, Thailandi used the Bangkok Airport Transfer serviced by searched from Google and found this companya bit scare to do the payment with this website as first time lolbut Luckily this company is real (Thx God)we have booked for 3 of us and the drive came on time also our name picking at the airportThe driver looks really kind but his English is not that good but still ok for communicated and he was trying to chat with us with us not sure his name is but would be great to compliment him if the owner see this review :) Love this company and will use it again for surehttp://bangkokairport-transfer.com/
Easy way to travel. This really is the easiest way to travel to and from the airport to Bangkok. It is so much faster getting into Bangkok than sitting in the notoriously bad Bangkok traffic.
Good and Excellent Air port Linking Communicater. We arrived Bkk and too the Aurport Rail.Link to downtown city in the night,it is good and convinient!

Cheap, fast, reliable. We didn't take the taxi from Suvarnabumi Airport to Bangkok downtown. For 35thb /pers and in 25 minutes the Airport Rail link is at Mahakasan Station close from the place where we wanted to go. Try it, you will not regret!

Great way to get out of Suvarnabhumi airport. If you want to avoid taxi and Bangkok traffic jam, use Rail Link going from (or to) Suvarnabhumi (BKK) airport.Use express train if possible. It is super convenient. There are 2 express lines: Makkasan and Phaya Thai. I used express train to Phaya Thai (that gets you to the BTS Sukhuvmit lane), and then, either by taxi or BTS (if it's peek traffic hour take BTS). However: Phaya Thai express is currently (form April 2014) under renovation, so you can only take City Train, which is slow and has many stops. Use taxi if you have luggage. Once Phaya Thai express is back, use it instead. It is fast and convenient to get you to area around Sukhuvmit (for example: between Phaya Thai BTS and Nana, there are only 4 stops). If you are going towards Makkasan (and can use MRT) use it!

Useful transportation. We use it everyday when visited Thailand. It was really useful and fast. The only thing I think it's disadvantage is it will cost you a long trip even you drop at one of its destination.
Great service and value. Took this train from the BKK airport into the city. Nice and clean train and very quiet. Saved me money and time vs taking a taxi into the city. 5 Star Train Service !

Great way to get to Bangkok city fromAirport. I travelled to Bangkok after a long time and was pleasantly surprised to see Airport Rail link.It is clean and fast as compared to all the motorways, and cheap too.

Fast, easy and air con!. What isn't to like? A fast easy mode of transport to the heart of Bangkok or to the airport. Saves the hassle of taxis! Cost no more than 50bht and all you have to do is sit and wait for you stop. Much better than a taxi!
Great way to get to the airport. I liked the convience of it and use it through links from BTS. I wish it was all the same so I could use my Rabbit Card. Always timely and clean.
Great!. A really easy way to get to or from the airport. It takes about 30 minutes to get to Makkasan Station from where you can get on the metro or in a cab.

Best way to and from the airport. At 45THB this is the fastest and most convenient way to travel from directly within the airport terminal to central Bangkok and back. For first time visitors, take the blue line and you'll immediately be immersed amongst the locals, which is always a treat when visiting a new city.

User friendly train. This is such an easy public transport system to use.Simply look at the map for your destination station which will then have the cost of your journey next to it.Pay that amount into a ticket machine and you are given a plastic token allowing you to make your journey.....simple.I wish the train system here in Melbourne were as easy to use.Very user friendly.

This is hands down the fastest way into the city.. Very cheap fast way into the city. You can take the city route which has about 5 stops or express all the way to the end. There are kiosks and a service desk at every station. Get with your hotel and ask if there is a station close so you can plan which stop to get off on. Taxis and tuk tuks are at every station if your destination is to far. We have used this service many times and it is the best, fastest, safest, & cheapest way to and from the airport.
Great train system. We took the railway just to one end of the system & back its cheap clean & air-conditioned,use the detailed maps to help you find your way.

The Only Way to GO !!!!!. Stay in Sukhumvit. 50 bht taxi ride to sky train. None stop 15 -20 min service from Phetchaburi station to airport for 80 bht. No worries about being late, no crashes, no motorway night mares. The station is world class, security staff and easy to understand instructions. For me it is the only way to det to the airport.
easy, quick, cheap. Great way to travel to and from the Survarnabhumi Airport and Bangkok city. This along with the BTS is a great form of transport

Excellent, convenient and great value. Can only recommend it to anyone, whether living in Thailand or simply just visiting. Living on Sukhumvit, this link simply connects me in the fastest way with the International Airport.

Hidden gem!. I never thought to catch the train, then we were like, hey? lets try it. it only cost about $5 Australian, so heaps cheaper than a taxi. It was clean and only took about half an hour into the city! I recommend it, just make sure you have lots of 10 baht coins to pay for your ticket.

great service and good value for money. We visited bangkok in June and used the airport link twice. It is the best value airport link I've used. I would definitely recommend this to a friend.
Thailand is the best :)
big time saving. I travelled from the airport to the hotel and then back to the airport by Airport link. Its cheap and very quick. you will save a lot of time in Bangkok traffic. Highly recommended.

good way. fast secure way to go downtown, and air conditioned!
you can find machines to buy tickets or a desk to sell it
Clean fast and efficient. Used this method on my last trip. Well worth it, faster than taxi and did not struggle with my luggage. I will certainly use it again
Cheap, clean & fast. Service is convenient, cheap, clean and fast. The signs from airport to the station are well marked, and staff always helpful.

Easy travel. Give all those taxi touts a miss and go down to the lower level of the airport to catch the airport link train (it is well signposted) Travel is a fraction of the cost of a taxi and no sitting in the Bangkok traffic congestion, the line links up to the skytrain rail line and the metropolitan line for onward travel.

cheap and fast. i used it from phaya thai station to suvarna bhumi airport only cost 45 baht compared with taxi meter when i was arrived from airport to phaya thai road 450 baht but use it if you bring small or medium luggage and not too many luggage , because it is public transportation though

Your best travel option to and from Suvarnabumi Airport. Easily located at the basement of the airport, it is conveniently linked to the BTS Phaya Thai Station. It costs 45 baht from the airport to Phaya Thai (and vice versa), travel time is approximately 30 minutes. Tokens can be obtained from machines or from the counter at the stations. The coaches are clean and air-conditioned, travel is smooth. It can be a bit crowded during rush hour as it stops at other locations. There is an Express service plying Makkasan to Suvarnabhumi Airport (and vice versa) for 150 Baht per trip. Makkasan Airport Link station is also linked to the MRT line via a long covered walkway to Petchaburi MRT station.You can always get a taxi, but if you want to save yourself from fare haggling and the awkward getting lost in Bangkok with a driver who cannot always understand you, then take this train.
Best method of getting there. The Airport Link train is fast comfortable and cheap. No matter how much baggage you are carrying it cannot be beaten. I will be using this service every time.
fast. If you are near the link, by all means take it. If not, a taxi is very affordable. The train station is 2 floors below the check in area and closes around 2300.

Fast and easy. Just walk down and down. The the rail link at the lowest level. Take the local train. It's near as fast as the express and runs much more often. When you get off, be sure your cab is charging you with the meter. They all offer fixed prices that are 2-3 times the metered price. You may have to try several cabs,

cheap and FAST. At 45 Baht from Phaya Thai Station this service is one of the best in Bangkok. From Morchit Bus Station take Bus 136, from Khao San Road take Bus 59. Trains run every 20 minutes and start at 6am until 12am.
Cheap & fast. Its convenient to travel- a fast & clean transportation, . 45bahts per pax & can reach most of the destination (major malls) its cost THB Bahts500 for taxi with toll fee.

Great system. Great to use to and from the airport, also around the city. It's fast and very cheap. If you can use it to get to your destination I would in most cases it would be much faster. It's clean
Easy access. When flying out from BKK on a night flight I stored my bags at the airport (100 THB/piece) and took the train in to the city where I went shopping. Simply and easy access
Easy to get by. I love this mode of travel. No hassle .No dislikes fares are cheap .Will use it again .always on time and safe to travel
easy going. great to jump on for trips in the city.. clean, cheap and well organized... find your way around in all directions!

Great value. There are 2 links to choose from. One link gets you there in 15 mins, express travel 150bahtThe other link takes you 30 mins, stopping all stations, 45 baht.The trains leave every 15 mins and deliver you into the airport.The amount of traffic on the roads of Bangkok, is the only thing you have to worry about stopping you from catching your plane on time.
Use it. 35 Baht from the airport to Makassan and 16 Baht on the metro to our hotel each is way better than the 800 Baht taxi or 1500 Baht limo services.

so easy to use. It's so nice to be able to get off of your flight, walk through the airport and boad the subway to whatever destination your going to. Everything is well labeled and to make it more comfortable the trains have a.c.

Great. Definitely use if you want to save money and time. It will take you into Bangkok, from their you can take the BTS, Subway, taxi, or whatever. The system is clean, safe and efficient. Just don't talk loud. You will notice that the train is quiet, except for foreigners. Only caveat, the system only runs from 6 am to midnight. If you get in after 11 pm, take a taxi. The airport is huge with 5 levels. FIND THE TAXI LEVEL! If you don't, you're screwed. A taxi will cost between $15 - $20 US. A limo $65 US. I screwed up last time got in at 3 am, hadn't slept for 45 hours and paid the price! Train or taxi, not limo.
Nearest. The tour places are very nearest to the airport and the MTR.So, its very easy to the travellers to enjoy it.

Avoid the Traffic. I'll start off with the good points for the Airport Rail Link, the two biggest positives are that you completely skip all the traffic (which depending on the time of day, can be really bad!). So this is bar far the quickest option at getting into central Bangkok. There are two types of Airport Rail Link, the City Line & Express Line. The City Line will stop at each station along the way (7 stops) and will take a little bit longer but is only 45 baht (one way). The Express Line goes straight from Phaya Thai to Suvarnabhumi Airport and is 90 baht (one way). The Express Line takes about 15 mins for a journey. The other major difference about the two lines is that the Express Line has racks / spaces for luggage so if you are traveling with a lot of baggage then the Express Line would be more convenient.The frequency of these lines tends to change every few months so the best way to keep up to date on departure times in to download the Airport Rail Link app from App Store / Google Play Store.Getting into and around Bangkok from the Airport Rail Link is rather straight forward. Get off at Phaya Thai and the BTS station (SkyTrain) is attached to the last stop of the Airport Rail link - about 5 mins walk. If you need to get the MRT (metro) you can either get off at Makkasan (second last stop of Airport Rail Link - will need to take City Line to get off here), and walk to Phetchaburi MRT - although this isn't the most pleasant of walks, particularly in BKK heat. There is a second option that's a bit longer to get on the MRT. Get off at Phaya Thai and get on the BTS (SkyTrain) and take this to Asoke BTS stop - there is another MRT stop at this interchange station - Sukhumvit MRT stop. This will only be convenient if it isn't busy on the SkyTrain (rush hour etc..)Which leads me into my negatives about the Airport Rail Link - it can be busy. If you are taking the City Line and its busy and you have a lot of luggage - this isn't going to be a pleasant experience. Likewise using the BTS (SkyTrain) to get to/from the Airport Rail Link is awful when you have baggage and its rush hour...

Smooth trip from city to airport and vice versa. More expensive than other ticket prices (about 90baht one-way) but its interior is different from the ordinary train around the city as its seats are facing each other and is more spacious. It's really fast and comfortable and world-class. (August 2012)
JUST DO IT. The only way to travel to or from the Airport!!! UNLESS you arrive after their opening hours,its the BEST and CHEAPEST way to and from the Airport!

Cheap and efficient. Quick and easy way to get to Central Bangkok, no need for a taxi or expensive transfers. Good way to see the city on the way as well. It may be a bit confusing though as there are quite a few branches and map is difficult to read sometimes
Cheap, easy and fast. Easy to find at the airport we took the cheap train into the city which was fast and cost around 35 baht. Nothing to complain about and will use again.
Easy. Great way to get into the city and your hotel.Then onto the BTs and go elsewhere.What a fantastic system.

Easy and fast!!. We didn't use a tax between the hotel and airport this time.Just used the airport rail link and changed BTS to get to the hotel where was near Nana station.The rail Link is fantastic! We got to the Bangkok airport around 5pm. First plan was to catch a taxi to get to the hotel. However, considering the traffic in Bangkok. Then decide to go PLAN B which worked so well!!

Great if you dont have luggage. It is a fine service, clean efficient fast and cheaper than alternatives. But, and it is HUGE but, do not do this if you have heavy bags. It is not the train, it is what happens when you get into central BKK. Town is HOT and HUMID. If you have anythign more than a overnight bag you are going to suffer. Take a public taxi. They charge 400/450 from the airport to most of BKK. They will take you to the door of your hotel and there the staff will help with the bags. You'll take longer to get into the city than the train, maybe 10 to 15 min more, but you will arrive in much better condition than lugging a large bag through the sweltering heat.

Great Value - Quick - Avoid Traffic. Depending on when you arrive into Bangkok, consider the Rail Link. It's a great way to avoid ungodly traffice, it's cheap, and it gets you close to where you can then take a taxi or tuk-tuk to where you need to go. I always use it when leaving BKK.

Easy transfer. For once we where traveling light so decided to try the airport link. Very easy and cheap if your having a hotel close to BTS or MRT. Might be a hassle in the rush our with your luggage etc.

Fast and cheap. I used the Airport link to get from and to the airport. It was so convenient. I arrived early in the morning so it did get a little crowded but it's nothing I couldn't handle. The trains are very quite and they are air conditioned which is welcome after walking in the humidity. I also felt very safe, no different than taking the metro in any other modern city. It was also cheap. It cost me 47 baht which is about $1.50. Would prefer this to a taxi, and during rush hour it's faster than taxi as well.
QUICK. This is the best way to airport much cheaper and avoid the Bangkok traffic jams or taxi scams. Brings you directly to the airport.

the only way to travel airport to city. We caught the express to makassan from the terminal - 45 baht I think - $1.50 - by my watch about 18 mins non stop. I saw someone else review this service as slow but I think they may have caught the city line by mistake which also runs to airport stopping at every station whereas the express in non-stop - (see our return details below). Then taxi 30 mins for 2km to our hotel!!returning to the airport at the end of our stay, our concierge briefed the taxi driver to take us to makassan - it was rush hour - 40 mins later he dropped us at a station and drove off - it was not Makassan but ratchaprarop and it was a 45 minute trip to the airport, so be sure you go to makassan.
Easy and cheaper. This way is cheaper than taxi and no traffic jam.From airport to Phayatai is 45B. And you can switch to BTS at Phayatai.I always use this way.

Huge time saving. I travelled from city to the airport using the Airport Link and would not regret. I saved a lot of time as the Bangkok road are always full of traffic. Its the best way to travel to the airport
Fast and clean. Tried it for the first time June 13th and it was great, quick, efficient. 30 minutes to Asok station on the MRT line.

Great way to save some taxi money. Best way to save some money that you will pay to taxi. Very convenient to connect to Skytrain. I would recommend staying somewhere close to the skytrain or the rail link for easy connectivity.
Useful and user-friendly. Cuts the travel time into Bangkok and is easy to use.Not so easy to buy tickets and definitely NOT handicap accesible

reliable and cheap. Avoid the rip off taxis and take the airport rail link, costs about 40B, unbeatable value! If you're going to Khaosan, just take the rail link to the last stop and get a meter taxi from there.

Cheap. 50 Baht 3 stops to Patpong market,less than a quid!! One way,couple of Irish bars by market ok. Loads of fake handbags T shirts and pretty much anything else on offer. Need a broad mind as all sorts of tings offer from hawkers trying to get you in girlie bars!!
Better way to travel to city. Jam free and convenience. Unfortunately aircon was not cool enough in the afternoon. Frequency of the xpress line is not high enough.

We'll connected. Best way to travel from suvarnabhoomi airport . It is well connected to all the location in bangkok. There are at least 100 hotels in a walking distance from various BRT stations. You have a check in counter for thai airways at makasan station.
Slow!. I was had experience last month about Thailand Airport Link, it's very nice train but look like a little old style.

Very Easy. We used the airport rail link to return from Bangkok to the airport on our way home. We rode the BTS Skytrain to Phaya Thai and it's a short walk to the airport rail link station. 45 baht per adult for the trip and about 30 minutes. This sure beats the cab ride not just for price but for time, In Bangkok the trip to the airport could vary between 40 minutes and 90 minutes depending on the time you travel and the amount of traffic. Using the MRT or BTS Skytrain and the airport rail link guarantees a smooth trip to the airport. However, be aware that during peak times (7-9am, 4-7pm) the BTS Skytrain can be packed to the rafters so getting on is a problem even without luggage.

Phaya thai changes. The airport speed train is temporarily NOT going to Phaya thai station. The speed train only goes to city centre. It also only runs once an hour, so I am not sure how reliable it is. I took the airport regular train into Phaya thai station and it was 30 minutes, reliable and seemed to be the only train running - I never saw the speed train.
Its fast and cheap. When I arrived at Bangkok airport , I took Airport link to my hotel. It cost us around 180 bhat for two. Where hotel was offering a Taxi for 1600 bhat/

Bangkok Airport Rail Link schedule. I have been a user of the Airport Rail Link since the inception and will use each time I arrive for my short stays in Bangkok each month. My one criticism is the ludicrous time table that was recently imposed. There is an hours wait between each Express to Mahakan, this for a train that takes 17 minutes for the journey. Sadly it is based on no particular reasoning only a 'management decision'.It isn't to much of a problem to ride the City Line, which does get crowded dependent on the time of day, but I happily pay the extra charge for the Express, more speed and comfort and the basic reason for the Airport Rail Link in the first place. The express trains should god back to the old schedule!
Airport Link. This is very convenient for travelers who don't have much luggage. But you need to go to Pratunam to get too. But if this link is extended to more places its very easy.

Good but not completed infrastructure. The best idea to transfer to BTS system.
Didn't like : A bit to tricky.
Better. Than use the can or the bus, BKK is not made for surface traffic.

Save your money and use the Airport Rail. Was able to get to the Airport with no trouble at all from the Asoke Station (Sukhumvit Line). From there are quick ride to Phaya Thai Station (34 Bhat) and then a 30m ride to Suvarnabhumi Airport (50 Bhat) Roughly $3CAD for the entire trip. Quick, Clean and Easy... Save your money and use the rail!
Perfect!. Cheap way to get out of airport. You can easily change to Skytrain, which takes you around BKK easily>

Very convenient. Take your bag from the belt and head down to airport link station. In 25 minutes you will be at an MRT/BTS station and from there you can go wherever you want.Ofcourse you need to know where you are going and that can be a challenge sometimes.This is a good option IF you know exactly where you are going (or if you have a card of the place in Thai so you can use to get a taxi from a different location then the airport) and you need to skip traffic or save some baht.There is also option of checking in and luggage drop from the main station (if you are going to the airport) I think but never tried it.
Very good. This is the perfect solution for escape the traffic jam. This is clean and fast. Perfect to go to the airport.

Fastest and Most Affordable way to the city. I arrived at Suvurnabhumi airport and went directly to the Airport Rail Link station to the city. I chose City Terminal (Makkasan) station since my hotel is closer to this station. I would have preferred the Direct Express Train with no stopovers ( which will take only 15 minutes to the Makasan Station at a higher fare of 150 baht) but I was told that the next trip will still take an hour to wait. So I ended up with the 6-stop overs Commuter Train for 30 minutes at 35 baht. Not that I mind the fare and time difference, but I find the commuter train a bit crowded. However, I do think trains are still the fastest and most affordable way to commute within a city and I'm thankful that Bangkok has opened this service line, which is convenient for tourists like me, who are the easy preys for inflated fare charges from wayward taxi drivers of Bangkok. The city terminal was really spacious, complete with health, security and safety facilities. However, I find the terminal taxis disappointing with their high metered fares. I ended up with the metered terminal taxi at 200 baht against the regular taxis at 80 baht to my hotel near Phleon Chit. I had to shell out another 50 baht for toll fees since the driver decided to use the expressway to avoid the rush hour traffic.

Airport RailLink Bangkok, Thailand. Easy access. Great price. Frequent runs. Takes you only to Phaya Thai BTS Station. Last train 11:30 pm. If late at night and BTS is closed you have to grab a taxi. Express Train (no stops) in repair for one year so not available.
Best way to travel to the city.. it is well connected through Phya Thai station. Its fastest and cheapest way to travel to city of bangkok

very convenient. Very nice and convenient service. Easy and cheap to come to the city from BKK airport even with a lot of luggage. At least one should definitely come to Makkasan with airport city line (cheaper than express line and not worth paying the extra high price for express line if you are not in real hurry) and there is very efficient and transparent taxi service to any where in the city. This way you also save the 50baht airport toll fees, which you need to pay if you take a taxi from the airport itself.But consider taking a taxi all the way to the airport while taking the return flight from Bangkok. This way, you do not need to pay airport toll and it's not worth to get off at Makkasan and take airport link to Bkk, specially at night, when you are tired after your trip in bangkok. The difference in price is not much so just enjoy your taxi ride all the way to BKK.

Exactly what it says on the tin!. After around 15 hours of travelling, we arrived in Bangkok tired, hungry and rather sweaty. We easily found the airport rail link, and purchased tickets from the ticket machine with ease. The train arrived promptly and was clean and well air-conditioned. Announcements were in both Thai and English. If your accommodation is near an airport rail link station, definitely give the higher priced taxis (and the Bangkok traffic) a miss!

A Great Example of Thai Corruption. The people who planned this should be publicly executed. The main station is located in an area which was already plagued by the worse traffic in Bangkok (and that is saying a lot). Though it was originally said that you would be able to check your luggage for your airline at the main station, this has been cancelled. Someone got paid off a lot of Baht. That is the only reason for locating the station here.
rail link to recommend. the rail link to town from the airport is really a recommended alternative to the taxis, which sometime drive you to some restaurant or store you don't like to visit.

A cheap way of getting closer to the city.. I hadn't used this on my previous visits, preferring to get a cab to my hotel from the airport. My flight arrived early and I had a short wait until the first train left. 15 minutes after leaving I was getting off at Makkasan Station saving considerable time and money.The Airport Link is actually two services sharing the same tracks and stations. The Express train (red and white) only runs between Makkasan and Suvarnbhumi Airport without stopping. The local line (blue and white) runs between Playa Thai (interchange with BTS) and Suvarnbhumi and stops at all stations in between. Arriving passengers are encouraged to use the former.In operation it's a cross between BTS an MRT, with the stations above ground on more than one level, but with payment by one trip tokens bought from a machine with instructions in Thai and English. Access is by escalator and lift but the platforms are open so are not air con.Criticisms? A few, while the Express trains are fast, they're not frequent one every 45 minutes is usual. The hub station at Makkasan while being modern and spacious (lots of walking) is nowhere near the middle of town. There is an MRT station nearby, but I took a taxi and had to wait while one was called. Also no one uses it, I can't remember the last time I took a train that had so few people on it, When I left I had to use a local line train (which was reasonably busy) because if I'd waited for an Express I would have missed my flight.
Fantastic. No stress, really easy to reach, really cheap and comfortable. For each visitor to Bangkok that don't have any kind of transfer, this is the best means to get to the city.
Fantastic and Cheap. Easy to access and a 20 minute ride to Airport. Ticket from Ratchaprarop Station ( Pratunam Area ) is 40 Baht, No traffic hassles and comfortable ride.Anthony

Easy to use. The train is clean and easy to navigate. it is in the lower floor of the airport and well signed. No problem to get ou large roller bags on and off. The Rail Link connects to the BTS at the terminus station Phaya Thai. This puts you near the Siam shopping and entertainment area. The SRTconnects at the Makkasan Station. The SRT gives you access to all the hotels and shopping on the central Sukimvit Road area. It costs 45Baht to go from the airport to the Phaya Thai stop. 22baht to go to the Makkasan stop. The train runs from 6AM to Midnight so plan accordingly. There is an very good information booth in the airport station with handy maps to all the mass transit trains.

Phiya Thai Station. I am surprised that the service from Phiya Thai station has been suspended and there is no official notice or announcements..... was trying to get on the airport rail link to go to the airport at one evening, only the city line is running......

super easy, super cheap. Myself and my fiance used the airport link to get to makkasan station to link up with the MRT line to get us to hua lamphong station where our hotel was located and we were very impressed with how easy, cheap and stress free it was. At the airport, you head all the way to the ground floor/basement, use the ticketing machine to purchase a little plastic token and off you go!! The machines are in english and easy to use, its clean and safe, the staff are really helpful (opening the disabled access gates for us as i was lugging 2 cases of luggage weighing 20kg each with me........which i wouldnt advise unless you are fairly fit as its mostly escalators and only the odd lift and its alot of 'upping and downing'), its nice and cool which was a great relief to escape the thai heat for a while and you also get a great view of the city (including the traffic you have missed, tee hee) as you whizz along!! It was that easy, we also used it to return to the airport after our stay was over

Good, but Depending. If you have more than one bag it will be combersome depending on where your trying to get to. To make some connections you have to walk. The taxi service at the airport is reasonably price and no walking. Go to the first floor where they have public metered taxi's. You get a slip with the driver's info from the dispatcher and the fare is very inexpensive. Don't take taxi's asking to take you to town for 1500-2500 baht. Rip-off. the metered taxi will cost around 400 baht, maybe less depending on where you are going.

Brilliant alternative for airport visitors. First impressions of a country tend to linger, and so few will complain about a low-cost alternative to the eternal hassle of trying to secure a taxi at Suvannaphuum Airport, and then struggling through Bangkok's notorious traffic to get to downtown.With the Airport Link, you are guaranteed to be in downtown in 45 minutes, in comfort and safety.The Airport Link is fast, air-conditioned, relatively inexpensive and clean, but it requires the traveller to know a little bit about Bangkok, as the only two viable places to get off are Makkasan or Phaya Thai (the end of the line, and linked to the BTS).The escalator/elevator system is not brilliant, so elderly people or those who are carrying 30kg of carved wooden souvenirs may find it challenging, but for the majority it represents the easiest and most hassle-free way of getting into central Bangkok.Note: The Airport Link was originally conceived as a kind of express service for tourists, so there might be people prepared to sell $5 'Express' tickets rather than the $2 normal tickets.Much better to get some Thai 10-baht coins or 20-baht notes and use the vending machines.

better than taxi. very comfort and traffic free, clean station and train, suvarnabhumi station are in the basement.
it is better to use airport rail link if you catch a flight in busy traffic hours..

Boom... Airport to City in 30-45mins. When i first travelled to Bangkok.. The Skytrain was still under construction ... Now.. i couldn't imagine travelling into the city any other way..first time travellers will find it super easy to purchase and understand tickets and destinations, and the price @ either 45 or 90 baht (saves 15mins on the journey) .. means its the most cost effective way and easiest way to land smack bang in the middle of town

No escalators or elevators in some stations!. Really easy way in and out of the city and what I always use when over but just to keep in mind carrying luggage up & down flights of stairs at some stations is far from easy! :)
very fast and easy to take. I use it to go downtown to suk11. Easy to find in the airport. No stop, just 1 change for the bts and very cheep. Fast arrival in my hotel after a long flight.

Best way to avoid traffic jam to downtown. Highly recommend this efficient and cost-effective means of transportation. With only 45 bahts in 30 minutes' ride, you could get to downtown so easy.RELIABLE FAST CHEAP

can interchange to bts and mrt. I touched down at Suvarnabhumi Airport. Look for the sign of airport rail link. It only cost 40baht for single journey to Sukhumvit area. It is very convenient, fast and cheap.

A fraction of the cost of a taxi, and quicker. The airport rail link takes around 35 minutes to reach the Praya Thai BTS station (less if you get off at one of the closer stations), and cost 45 baht. A taxi on the other hand will cost 400 to 500 baht to Sukhumvit, and depending on the traffic, will often take close to an hour.

Train transport. The train to this hotel from the airport was made by two very easy train rides. The station is a 2 minute walk from the hotel. The trains are clean and the trip was not all that long. I found the Thai people very helpful when I was unsure of where I was going but I did note that the Thai's are a shy people.

THE way to get into Bangkok from BKK Airport. Save your money- take the Rail Link from the basement of BKK airport. A great way to immerse yourself in the city off the bat. Affordable and efficient- great view along the way on the elevated rail. Staff at the entrance can assist you with determining fares- the link only runs 2-3 times an hour but we were directed onto a local train that seemed just as fast and were on our way easily enough. Note for early flights the BTS doesn't start running until 5 or 6 am so you'll need to cab to BKK if you have an early departure from Bangkok.

Great way to travel in Bangkok. I used the link a few times, it is super efficient. I downloaded the Aiirport Link App, which is free, and takes all mystery out of train arrivals and departures. It gets very crowded at rush hour but otherwise is quite comfortable. It links very conveniently with the metro and bus systems.

Cheap and good. Great way to arrive and depart from our hotel! The train departs from the basement of the airport terminal and we arrived at our hotel in Sukhumvit area after a short transfer to BTS skytrain at Makassan. It's not difficult to work out the system as the station staff cxan converse in basic English. Total cost - 50 baht per person and best of all, we are not stuck in the nasty Bangkok traffic jam if travelling by taxi. However, a taxi may be a better option if:- there are 3-4 people in a group (you don't save much by train)- you have lots of heavy luggage (there's 10 mins of walking between connecting stations at Makassan)- your hotel is a long walk from the station (taxi provides doorstep service)
efficient and cost effective. Efficient service, from 06h00 to midnight. Spares one from traffic and congestion on roads.Cost effective
easy access. easy access & cheap.comfortable and easy to get around for first timers also.better to avoid the expensive limo transfers

Fast, cheap and safe!. Don't take a taxi, get on the Rail which will take you to the nearest BTS- an airconditioned ride for just a few dollars. If you have luggage it WILL be a problem since you must change and cross over to the BTS which is kind of a hassel. Good thing- no way to get scammed. Just buy a ticket from the downstairs terminal at the airport (Suvarnabhumi Airport), and get on! Taxi drivers at the airport will sometimes scam tourists that have just arrived.
Easiest way to travel from airport - city. Takes only an hour to get from Bangkok city to the airport and no need to worry about the big Bangkok Jam when you have a plane to catch.
awesome trains. Connects to major areas with connections to the BTS and other trains in Bkk.Took the cityline since we needed to change trains at Makkasan station.
Quick and cheap. This is definitely the best way to get to the city from the airport. The train is fast and air-conditioned.
Use it!. It is the easiest, most economical and definitely most environmentally sound way to get to the airport. It is either glide over the city, or sit in a taxi in traffic jams and foul air.

Faster. 2 Types of trains.1. City link ( Stopping All Stations )2. Airport link ( Nonstop one end to other )I been to City Link ( Blue color ) .Faster but not good for heavy luggage, short distance and more than 1 Pax. If traveling more than 1 person better go by Taxi door to door, No Train from mid night till 5 am. I been to Ramkhamhaeng Station . Ramkhamhaeng Station is too high and long walk for a taxi at the main road ( Soi Ramkhamhaeng ). If you are traveling without any baggage its ok.
Cheap and best mode of transport. This is the cheapest and fastest mode of transport from Suvarnabhumi Airport. It costs 4 baht per person from Airport to Phaya Thai. Time taken is 30 mins approx.

Express Line suspended since 14th April 2014. I went on to the Bangkok Airport Train website before my trip and found information and time table for the Express Line. So on arrival at Bangkok I walked to the ticket counter but found the service had been suspended (indefinitely) for a month already. You can however still take the City Link which is the slower and cheaper option (45 Baht and takes 30mins to downtown).Although I did later manage to find their suspension notice after searching for it online. They could have put it somewhere more obvious for people to see, and definitely on the timetable/information page in BOLD or something.
Very clean and efficient. On time from the airport. No delays. No litter and fully air conditioned. A very nice and easy way to get into town from the airport.
Only way to get to get to Airport. Dont sit in the traffic, this is the only way to make sure you do not miss your flight. At 90 THB from Makkasan Station ...a steal.
Avoids the Traffic. Clean and efficient. Avoids the traffic and great view of Bangkok. Make sure you follow the guard's instructions at the airport
easy access to the city. You have fast, cheap and easy access to the city with the rail link. No need for taxi. In a few minutes you are at the city center.
Don't waste money on taxis. taxis are expensive, the train system is so easy to use, it goes into the city for very little cost, spend time beforehand organising yourself and reap the rewards.
very efficient. The express train station is very easy to find either inside the airport or to get back to it from Bangkok; In the meantime the service is great and the cost makes it very valuable

Inexpensive way to beat the lod thip (traffic jams). Traffic is brutal on good days in Bangkok, and those days are rare. Accordingly taxi rides can be interminable. Worse some taxis are reluctant to go, because regulations have changed and only authorized cabs can pick up fares. This week I had to pay 500 B to go to the airport. Link is clean and efficient. It connects with Sukhumvit BTS at Phaya Thai station. You can also pick the train up at Makkasan station near Asoke. Airport to Phaya Thai is 40 Baht (current rate 32 = $1).
Very convenient. We took the airport rail link to Makkasan. 35 baht per person. Clean and convenient. Most of all, you won't have to deal with the traffic.

Bangkok - Airport Rail Link - Cheap quick and efficient.. Twice we used the rail link to get into the centre from the airport and twice we found it easy, very clean and comfortable. We took the slightly slower blue line the first time and departed at Phaya Thai station and then took a taxi to our hotel. The train took just twenty minutes and was a superb way to enter Bangkok for the first time. It is elevated and you get to see quite a bit of the city as you get closer to the centre ( though the rail link stops a bit short of the centre ). The second time we used the line we took the express link and got off at Makassan. This was the red line direct one stop route which took less than fifteen minutes. A little further from the centre than Phaya Thai Station but there's not a great deal of difference. In both regards you can also link with the MRT system, but as we were heading for the Khao San Road area again we just jumped in a taxi and 300 baht later we were where we wanted to be. All in all the Rail Link is excellent. Extremely modern and efficient, clean and very comfortable. It does finish running at 12 midnight so we couldn't use it to get back to the airport for our 3.00 am flight but by that time the roads were fairly clear and we just jumped in a taxi.

cheap, fast, clean, easy. cost - not more than usd2 to get into town (WHAT?!?!?!)
very clean and very frequent.
stops are also easy to access @ Makassan which leads you to Sukhuvit MRT and then to Asok BTS - all these travel in 35mins (train dependant)
Cheapest way from airport to downtown. Take the blue line for 35baht per head only from airport to Makkasan, then you can interchange to MRT which is very convenient.

Efficient. Don't waste money on taxi, Rail Link is cheap and fast. You can get it in the airport and leaves you in the touristic area. Only issue is it closes 12:00AM and most of international flights arrive late in the night.

Great way to get into the city. We were able to transfer from plane to train quite easily through an underground path to the airport rail link. This connects you directly to a few stops on their MRT, and straight into the city. Great option!
Very good service. We used this from the airport to get to the train station and it is a very good swift and easy to use service along with being very clean we would use this again when in thailand .

Good but sometime too crowded. It's really cheap and fast to get to the city or to the airport, but sometime it can be really crowded when you have a really big and many lagguage it's really hard to be in that train. the ticket cost around 30-40 baht per person, I recommande to wait for a Express Line where it run from the airport to almost at the last station without stopping in any station :) Faster and less crowded :)

Life made easy. It was always a trial getting from the airport to central Bangkok, but now it is so easy and very cheep. The connection on to the other bts lines is easy. Just don't sit in the traffic
Fast. . This is the fastest way to get to central Bangkok. It's cheap and the train runs above ground so you can get your first and last looks around BKK.

Fastest way to reach the airport. I used different ways of transport to goto the airport as I was travelling between Bangkok and few other cities for my business. If you dont have luiggage with you, the airport link is the best and fastest way to get to the Airport. It just takes about 25 minutes and you save all the traffic.

Fast from A to B. Fully air-conditioned transport to downtown Bangkok, on fair intervals.Somehow it is not yet discovered by everybody as most of the time there are seats available. You have to go to the basement of the airport for the connection. The surroundings are so depressing that you are happy when the train leaves the platform. Do check the itinerary for the first and last train. The only thing is that you are not allowed to bring the airport trolleys to the platform and I have not found an escalator or elevator.
Well worth it.. Took the ARL to return to the airport, easy as, cost 135 baht and took about 30 minutes from inner city.

Cheap and easy. We caught the Airport Rail Link (city line) from Phaya Thai to Suvarnambhurri airport. Total cost per person was 45 baht per person for a 45 minute ride in a clean, safe and airconditioned train. Would definitely recommend this as a way to and from the airport. When we first arrived we paid over $100 AUD for airport travel and on the way back to the airport we paid just over $4.50 AUD for the 3 of us!

Very convenient. The airport rail link is a very convenient mode of transport from the airport to the Bangkok city area. The fare is very reasonable and my family and I had a comfortable and quick transfer to our hotel area in Rachaprarop station.

Great!. Avoid cheating Thailand taxi by using this train. If ur hotel is located around BTS station or somewhere close to BTS station, u should take the airport raillink to Phayathai station as it has a connection to BTS station. And no needs to take the express one, just normal ticket - 45 thb or around 1.5$ with around 30 mins.
Sky Train is amazing. Great cheap and efficient way to get to and from the airport! Very impressed!You can use connecting lines to get to a lot of other locations in Bangkok

Fast way to Central Bangkok. I had used this service again during my trip in Bangkok and I think this is the best transportation from Bangkok Suwannaphumi International Airport to Central Bangkok.So when you landed at Bangkok Suwannaphumi International Airport please go down to B Level and choos station that you want to go such as Makkasan Station that you can catch MRT Petchburi to go to Sukhumvit or Ladprao or Phayathai Station that you can catch BTS Phayathai to Mochit or Siam CenterSo you can save your money for taxi ans use not more than 50 THB for 1 way from or to Bangkok Suwannaphumi International Airport Eventhough you have a bag that you can go through the train with comfortable way and elevator.

Crammed in rush hours. Wasriginally built for tourists coming and going to the airport. Problem is if you have a large bag you may not be able to get on due to all the ;local workers using it instead. Choose your time wisely.
Skip the taxi. Spent 70thb from airport to my hotel destination. On way from my hotel back to airport this shuttle was not yet operating as it was 3:30am so I had to take a taxi for 440thb!

Fast, efficient, clean and cheap. What's not to like? A taxi trip to my hotel took over an hour and cost 400 baht with the airport surcharge and tolls. The airport sky train was about 60 baht and took around 45 minutes. There were demonstrations and riots during my Bangkok stay. Demonstrators closed roads and interchanges which make traffic even worse that it typically is in Bangkok. The sky train helped you by pass all of that congestion.Is it easy? Well sorta. I'm not intuitive about mass transit. Several people had to help me on my journey but they did. Just look confused and someone is bound to help you. If not pull out a map and lint to where you want to go and even if they don't speak English they will help you or find someone who can. That's been my experience throughout Thailand.
Fast and cheap. From 06.00-24.00 the Airport Rail Link is a great way to get from Suvarnabhumi to Phaya Thai, for only 45 baht.

fast way to get into city or the airport. Its a good way to travel between Bangkok city and the internationa aiport, especially if you have no luggage. You will save a lot of time as Bangkok traffic is always bad. I used it for both ways and saved a lot of time
works perfectly. the service is cheap and simply great. please be prepared for long walks if you need to connect to the metro or sky train

Time and Money savier...... One of the best way to travel to and from airport. We used Rail Link service to travel from Makkasen to the airport and it’s an awesome service 15minutes and you inside the airport terminal. Whereas taxi would have taken roughly around 45min-60min depending on traffic.The stations are clean and signboards are decent enough for one to make its way. Though it seems like it’s not fully operational.Ticket wending machines are user friendly. The token are dispensed for the fare purchased. Frequency is excellent. Time displayed for the next arrival train is accurate.We made the right decision not to travel by Taxi and opted for Airport Rail. Its inexpensive, save a lot of money and a lot of time!
Value for money. the easiest way to get into the centre of Bangkok. 17 mins, once you are on the train to the middle of paradise

ARL. The airport rail link is quite convenient to travel from the airport to the city center. But its too bad that it doesn't connect between Suvarnabhumi airport to Don muang airport. Me and my friends stayed in a hotel near to one of the ARL stops and it was convenient everyday to hop in the ARL and connect to other MRT stations.

WHO NEEDS A TAXI?. If you're traveling light, there's no reason to pay 30 bucks for taxi from the airport into town. After arrival at Suvarnabhumi airport, head to the lower level (ask the friendly, English speaking young lady at information desk for more specific directions if necessary). Go to the ticket counter next to the train entrance and pay around 35 baht (about a dollars) for a small token to your intended stop. (Makkasan Station, third stop from the end of the line, is centrally located and connects with MTR, the Bangkok subway, just one stop away from the main thoroughfare Sukhumvit station). Really, no need to wait for the "express train" that goes straight to Makkasan. The regular train, which leaves every 15 minutes or so, gets you there pronto.It affords a great welcoming view of the city from above, as opposed the infernal, traffic-congested stop-and-go of a taxi.Unless you have tons of luggage, Airport Rail Link is the only way to go.
FAST. It's very fast and cheap and easy for go another station or another place in Bangkok but if out from the airport can't take big bag with you.
Fast & Convenient. It is a direct link from the airport to the city areas, and also to where our hotel is. Cheap & Convenient.

Smart and cheap way to head to centre. Followed the instructions as posted in TripAdvisor forum.Fast and efficient way to travel to city center from the airport. Bangkok's weather is very hot with high humidity and is definitely overcrowded. My advice is to travel with minimal luggage else you will be regretting it when the sun hits you.
finally. finally a cheap, fast connection to the city avoiding the taxi cheating and the traffic jam. not packed, clean. connection with MRT and BTS. Love it

Great way to travel as a tourist. We were in Bangkok for 1 day as we were traveling through. We took a hotel van to the airport and then travelled on the airport rail link to get to the river market. We took 3 connections to get there and then finally a water taxi. The system to purchase the rail token was very easy to understand and the transfer map was very helpful. The token purchase was very inexpensive. If we had tried to take a taxi or other transportation, I believe we wouldn't have made it in twice the amount of time & probably would have ended up lost & ripped off in the middle of Bangkok. Definitely go prepared with where you plan to stop and switch trains, because the transition is crowded and happens fast. Definitely the way to travel - cheap, fast & easy to understand!

An efficient and cheap way to get to and from the airport. Very clean and fast and reasonable priced way to travel,to go to and from the airport from central Bangkok. Can say it's easy if you have lots of luggage but doable! Give u a bit of done of the outer Bangkok villages....should at least try it once! Bests the traffic jams as well!

Fine until you get to the main station. The airport rail link is a fine idea however when you reach the main station it's nearly impossible to get a taxi to take you to your hotel. condo, etc...The taxis are reluctant to come there as they see the link as competition. The express train is fast and clean. The local which runs more frequently makes a few stops but takes only 10 min or so longer. However, during the rush hours its very crowded! Hard to manage with bags when it's jammed with local commuters. The train is a good option if you're heading into Sukhumvit and traveling lightly. You can now take a walkway to the MRT (underground station) instead of leaving the station and going down an access road and crossing train tracks on foot to reach the MRT. With large bags it's still a pain though....

Forget the Taxis. Afraid to get ripped of by the taxis? Just take the City Line to Phaya Thai and take the BTS from there. Only 45 Baht, and 30mins take you in the city centre. I much prefer to mingle with the city and get a feeling of the people living there, rather than isolating myself in a taxi.

Fast, cheap and very easy to use. We found this train trip from the airport to Phaya Thai to be very cheap and easy to use! The express line from the airport to Phaya Thai is out for about a year but you can travel on the city line and it only takes 30mins to Phaya Thai. For 45baht its a bargain!
Quick efficient and much cheaper than taxi. Forget the Bangkok traffic and jump on the Airport Rail Link. In no time you can be at Phaya Thai and straight on to the Skytrain and no ripoff taxi fares.
Fast. This is a cheap and fast way to get to your hotel from the airport, just make sure that your hotel is close to this line or to a croosing with the MRT
The only way to go. Very few pay the extra for the Express so it is quieter, but the Cityline trains run more frequently and one experiences more of the real Thailand and its people.

Modern, fast, easy. But won't get you to the Old City.. Close but so far. You'll save money taking this easy and quick route to near central Bangkok, but if you're like most you'll have to then get off at the last stop and grab a taxi. We did and asked for a metered one. Even though we knew about where we were, the old man then zoomed onto an expressway and took us across the river. When I told him to stop and turn around (too late of course) he did, and stopped to ask a cop for directions to Democracy Square that was photocopied and written in Thai just for him (meter running of course). He stretched a $2.25 ride to $2.80 that way. Funny thing is, he ended up with $0.55 for his joyride, and missed a tip that would've been at least $1 per bag plus 15% for the ride. Until you've had at least a few days to adjust to them, don't set yourself up to take a taxi in Bangkok.Don't use a metered cab in Bangkok at all if you can avoid it. Have your hotel set you up with a cab at a price that the hotel thinks is fair. Same at the airport.

Direct access to Bangkok City. Tip: don't use the 150baht Express Service - just use the ARL regular city run at 45 baht. It's makes 3 or 4 extra stops and takes 15 minutes longer. In my view not worth paying 3 times over the normal price to save 15 minutes.Apart from that, it's a great, inexpensive and hassle free way to get from Suvarnabhumi airport into town (Phayathai station).

just take a taxi. if you're traveling alone, and so long as your hotel is right near the link station, then it might be worth it. Otherwise, it's not. A taxi is around 400. Then the extra bts costs to get to your hotel (or a taxi), and many of the bts stations don't have escalators or elevators, so you're pulling your luggage up and down busy long flights of stairs. The rail link is losing money because most people just don't see the value.Two people might save 50 baht a piece.Three, even less.
suspended service. be informed that Airport-Phayathai express route has been temporaliry suspended its service stated from 13 April 2014.
Easy and connects to the BTS trains. Cost only 45 baht from the airport to Phaya Thai Station that connects to the BTS. No traffics jams and cost less than taking a taxi
Very easy!. Very clean, easy to use and a great way to get to the airport! It is cheaper than a cab and you don't have to worry about getting stuck in traffic!

First time to use the airport link !. Simple to use, very easy to use and very reasonable cost.Unusual ticketing system where you purchase a token at almost each changeover station rather than just one ticket from A to B.Very easy to use though so I would use it again .
Does the job. Go all the way to Phaya Thai to link up with the BTS..,avoid Makkassan as no BTS and even taxis are hard to come by.
I'll never take the airport taxis again. Such a simple and cheap way even with a suitcase to avoid traffic and get into town and back to the airport.

perfect connection between Suvarnabhumi airport and city. Frequent service for a cheap price.. no trafic jam, cheap and good. Just a very short walk from the Luggage claim to the Sky train : convenient and no problem with trafic jams or waiting for taxis.
excellent way to get to the airport, cheap and fast. very efficient way to get to the airportcheap and cleanvery courteous staffgood idea to buildvery comfortable

saves so much stress. The new link from airport to city is so easy and if you've been to Bangkok before and used the sky train you'll know what I'm talking about it cheap fast direct no fuss no hassle and beats sitting in a taxi. The train is very well air conditioned and comfortable with plenty of room for luggage. There are staff on hand at the airport station always willing to help you buy tickets and assist where they can. The Thai people always smile and it spreads like an infection that by time you go you'll want to return

Its so good and cheap that you really should not take those cabs that only want to con your money!!. Awesome! We took a train from novotel to phaya thai.. asked the friendly security officer and the counter staff and all it cost was 90B and a very short waiting time and we hopped on to a super clean and spacious train that brought us to the airport, in literally 18 mins flat. We then walked to the departure hall to check in. point to point was just about 1 hour.. You need not worry about cabs cheating your money as they are mostly not too honest. you need not get fed up over jams that is all over bangkok. its truly a good and easy way to travel to & fro from the airport! no more cabs for me in bangkok!!

Alternative to taxi. At 45 baht a great comfortable & easy way to get to the airport. We preffered this as we didn't get an asleep behind the wheel, going 120kph overtired Thai taxi driver.( Great peace of mind if you have kids )

Quick and very clean. Cheap price. Speedy link to downtown. Easy to get to from airport arrivals (go down one lift). Takes you direct into town. Very clean and safe service. You need to know where you intend to stop, as we found it hard to get a taxi that would take all our luggage when we arrived at the terminus. They have 2 types of link - a fast non stop link and a cheaper link that has about 6 or so stops, so a little slower. Both are fine. A yellow/pink taxi (not a VIP taxi - simply one from the taxi rank) from the airport to downtown Bangkok is about 350 BHT on the meter (maybe £6) so its just as easy to go by taxi - unless you arrive in rush hour when taking the train will prove a MUCH faster transfer

comfortable..cheap.. and fast !!. it is simply THE BEST way to reach town and get back to airport! no traffic no problems, the terminal is at the basement of the airport, u can get the ticket from the self machine located at the entrance , price extremely good ! !!!

Its an Embarrassment. And airport link is such a good idea and anybody who ever landed, or better even, left from Hong Kong with their train, knows how beautifully it could be.Unfortunately is Thailands' counterpart exactly the opposite. First the trains leave to the most odd times and the express runs only every 30 minutes. Even more funny, the express from Payathai that passes Makkasan (the main station), doesn't even bother to stop, hence the long waits in between. The if you actually take it form the airport and you arrive at Makkasan you first need to be lucky to get a taxi and if you do, the taxi has only one way to leave the station. And that way is not towards the city centre. So you probably have to spend another 20-60 minutes in the cap after getting out. I took it in total 3 times and every time it took me twice the time it would have take if I would have gone straight by cap. And I live just 20 minutes walk away from the main station!!! Its an embarrassment for thailand and a pity for all tax payers.

Very convenient way to travel to the airport. Very convenient and inexpensive way to travel to the airport from the center of the city. Very similar to the Heathrow Express in London but 10 times cheaper.

Fast way to travel from airport to the city.. To be honest i was a little bit skeptical to use The Airport Rail Link. But now i highly recommend it! Its cheap, its fast and if theres something you dont understand or unsure off, the helpful staff will help u.

As good as it gets. We've done a lot of traveling and one of our biggest pet peeves is the fact that public transport at airports and train stations, i.e.by taxi, bus, or van, have you at their mercy. Which generally means that it costs an arm and a leg to get a ride into town. The Airport Rail Link in Bangkok is the exception, being easy to find and board, fast and efficient, and basically dirt cheap compared to other means of transport. It is also air conditioned, which can be a lifesaver in the Bangkok heat. We have taken the rail link several times and have always enjoyed the experience. Highly recommended even if it doesn't go directly to your destination, as it saves both time and money over any other ride from the airport. Simply ride to the closest station and catch a short ride to your destination.

Airport Rail LInk. A great way to get into the city from the airport. Excellent timekeeping and only 30bht. Getting on and off the link no problem. For those with a bit of luggage, there are lifts at your destination to get you to road level.
