Clean and In time. Clean and in time. Nothing to complain about this. It arranges schedule so good. I always use Airport Rail Link to go straight into Bangkok center.

This is the way to travel to and from the airport.. Hopefully you arrive at a time when the train is working. Hours are 6am to 12am. If you will stay in Khao San, then take airport link to Makassan, then MRT to Hua Lampong (which is the train station you will travel from for train rides). Hua Lampong is close to Khao San. Or pay at least 350Baht for taxi from airport. But you're bound to be stuck in traffic.
Fast & Efficient. Took about 17 mins direct to city from the airport level B2. Beats taking a taxi which charges exorbitant rates coming out of the airport!
Quick and Simple. Very fast, simple to use, convenient. It starts in airport terminal and goes direct to centre of city. There are two services, one stopping at 4 or 5 stations, the other non stop.

High Speed Train into the City. Excellent train and stations. Spotless, comfortable, cheap and fast. Bit odd when you get to Makasan as the station is a bit far from the main road. There was large buggy to transfer you to the road but not so far that you could not walk if carrying light luggage.Not too far to the MRT station that can take you just about everywhere with the BTS connections.Highly recommended.

Every 15-30 minutes. I've been on the Makasan train a few times now and they come every 15-30 minutes. If you miss-time, you are stuck waiting for some time. And may as well get a taxi direct to the airport. So only use this service if your timings align well. It's nicely air conditioned (on the chilly side) and never busy so very leisurely and no stress about getting stuck in traffic.
Fast and cheap. It cuts out Bkk's horrid traffic and is very cheap. What else would you want, aside from taking the tollway. It has an express train to the airport once or twice an hour too.

Why cant we build rail systems in the UK like this.. We took the rail link from Bangkok airport to the city centre.20km rail ride for 80pence each, amazing value.You could eat your dinner off the floors of this train, it is so clean and user friendly, no graffiti, no chewing gum, no filth on the floors, just brilliant.Beware though for the shock of Bangkok when you get off the train.

Good in Parts. There are 2 services. The City Line, which stops everywhere, takes about 30mins from end to end (Airport to Phaya Thai) and is about every 15-20 mins for 45 baht. They can get crowded and not a lot of luggage room but they get the job done, air conditioned and no traffic jams!The Express line is a weird mess. Trains 1 an hour between the Airport and either Makkasan or Phaya Thai BUT NOT BOTH. Why not just have a single service stopping at Makkasan and then on to Phaya Thai keeping everyone happy??? The timings between them are odd as well. They are comfortable, uncrowded trains though and are worth the 90 baht if you get your timings right.BUT WATCH OUT. The Phaya Thai to Airport line is now out of service (or at least within the next few days) for 1 year to renovate the trains. Really!!! Quite laughable really.
Nice ride!. Nice ride and cheap one i guest! This is the easiest and the best transportation to the Suvarnabhumi airport..

Great way to get to and fro. The Airport Rail Link is a highly convenient and economical mode of transport -- if you are travelling light. At Phya Thai BTS, when you change from the Airport Rail Link to the Skytrain, make sure you use the entry point that gives access to the escalator, otherwise you will have to climb with your luggage. Ask the BTS staff to guide you to the escalator. A lot cheaper and quicker -- and more enjoyable -- than cabs to get to the city from the airport.

Excellent, fast and cheap. This is a great way to get downtown without all of the traffic. It only cost 45 RMB to get down to where we swapped and got the BTS. Really efficient, clean and well worth using. Would definitely use this again instead of the clogged traffic ways.

dont use this. Went from the airport to Makassan station and had to wait almost 2 hours for a taxi
Do not use this link

Best way to get from airport to the City. Clean, fast, wonferful. It's the best way to get from the airport to the city and vice versa. You may want to use City Line which stops at more stations (more convenient for some locations) and also cost much less (however the overall cost is about USD 2,5 so not much anyway).

Great service. The trains are frequent, quick and cheap (B45) - beats the taxis and limos hands down. Getting your luggage from the BTS sky train can be a bit of a hassle - there are only stairs getting down at Phayathai BTS - but I now always use the airport train.
great service and very affordable. the airport rail link links up with the sky train system which let you get to most places quickly and cheaply in Bangkok

Most efficient transport to and from the airport. In a nutshell, it is cheap, fast , comfortable, and hassle-free. Considering Bangkok's traffic condition and the protest situation, it is the best bet to avoid delay in travel plans. I have personally used it every time I visited Bangkok and so far, it has not let me down. It would have been perfect if there were shorter intervals between each Express Service, especially during peak periods. 30 minutes between trains are simply too long. That said, it is a minor inconvenience considering they also provide the Cityline Commuter Service. The difference is that this train stops at every station between the airport and the city. Hence the doubling in travel time to 30min. The plus side to taking this train though is it is much cheaper, from THB15 to THB45, depending on where you get off, compared to the Express Service's THB150. Point to note: the Express Service is a non-stop service all the way to the final station located in the city. Station name is called Phaya Thai and it is conveniently linked to BTS Skytrain service, which affords passengers connectivity to various parts of the city, including major shopping areas.The Cityline also allows passengers convenience to get off at another interchange station called Makkasan, which is linked to another transit service known as MRT, and this too, provides ease of access to parts of the city.Chris Lee
Quck & Easy from Airport to Bangkok. Clean quick and easy way to get to Bangkok city, maybe 20 mins from airport and cost 90Baht ($3.30) one way for the express.

Smart. a smart way to travel to and from the airport. The express train is not as regular as the city line but both are convent, connecting to the MRT and the BTS at PayaThai.The express takes 15 minutes to PayaThai(150B) and the City Line 30 minutes to PayaThai (45B)Located on the lowest level of the Suvarnabhumi airport
I have used this many times. Very efficient,clean and safe and cheap.No problems at all, it is a very good way to go to the airport

Fast and Convenient. Being a student in Thailand means a lot of travelling to other countries near by. The rail link is super quick and easy to use and has saved me a lot of money. Cheaper and faster than using a taxi.

Airport to downtown Bangkok in 20 minutes!. This is simply the best option to travel to/from Bangkok's Suvarnabhumi airport if you don't carry big or plenty of luggages as it is fast, cheap and connects to Bangkok's BTS (elevated rail) and MRT (subway) systems.

Does exactly what it's meant to do. Fast, efficient, reliable, clean. That's how it's always been for me. You've got an express and standard option, so be sure to know which station you are due, to be sure you don't miss your stop as the express skips several.
Only way to get to and from the airport. If your hotel is close to a Sky Train, or MRT then use this train, we used the general service not the express, and was only about 50 baht each and was great.
GREAT. This is a GREAT new way to get to/from the airport! It sure beats all the Bangkok traffic and delays.
great!. Perfect, quick, aircon'd and cheap way from getting from the airport to the city! Very easy to use and enough stops located along the route to get close to where you want to go.

Not Really an Attraction, but still Convenient. This is a great way to get from Suvarnabhumi Airport into the city. It cost me 45 baht to get to Phayathai station to connect to the BTS. I was at my hostel in no time. It is well-signed at the airport so you shouldn't miss it. The rail link connects to both the MRT and BTS so you should be able to get to your accommodation cheaply, quickly and hastle-free. There were also staff on hand at the airport station offering information to people catching the rail link. This is definitely a convenient way of getting into Bangkok city from BKK airport.

The best way to and fro the Airport. Excerpt from my website www.sagarsonker.com/travel/thailand The best thing about TripAdvisor is that they allow links to my website. On my website, you will find photos, videos, and detailed information that I update continuously.Affordable, fast, convenient, connected! It's the easiest way to reach (for me) the BTS Skytrain (Phaya Thai) from where I catch the BTS Skytrain to other parts of the city, especially the hotels that I book nearby the BTS Skytrain. One way ticket costs 45 Baht, and it's a nice journey.When going away from the airport, it's an exciting feeling. When going towards the airport, one does feel nostalgic remembering the beautiful time one had in Bangkok.I'm awaiting to go back to Bangkok :) <3

Clean and fast. This is my first time to use the Airport Rail Link in Bangkok. All my previous visits was always have a taxi to take me from airport to hotel, since its not an expensive anyway. But this is a good value to try, and the seat is spacious, clean and comfort. You can bring all your luggage along with you. Have a try!
Nice Train. Nice Airport Rail Link and Fast, Good transportation in Bangkok when compared with taxi and tuk tuk (expensive)

Convenient. If you do not have to many bags with you this is the way to go. Nothing like a easy comfortable and hassle free way to get to the airport. If you have bags then i guess not the best way. But otherwise it takes out all the negotiation process with cab ddrives which always is pain for me.
effortless and good. excellent addition to the city... nice and easy way to ease on in.. and good connection at makassan and end terminal for the bts/mrt... well worth it....

Fastest and sure shot way to reach town from airport. This service is not as efficient as HongKong express, but great to take a sure shot and economic transport to city. Take the train to Makkasan and change there to come to Pechburi station and take MRT to Sukhumvit.If taking a taxi from airport, do not agree to taxi drivers request to go without meter. They would threaten that the meter would be 500 Baht and he would take you for 450, but in reality, even after paying the tolls, you may save 125-150Baht (so around 300 Baht by meter to anywhere in Sukhumvit soi 11/ 28).

Great way to beat the traffic. Very quick journey to the city centre and very good value for money. Connects to the BTS which is less than 100m away, much better alternative to taking a taxi or car transfer which could result in sitting in one on Bangkok's infamous traffic jams

Fast and easy transit to town. If you ignore the fact that the process of purchasing the tickets and knowing which train to board is a little confusing given signs aren't very clear, the train ride itself is fine. We got on the non-express train despite requesting for the express when purchasing tickets at the counter. Ultimately, no regrets since the express train only comes around at 30min intervals. The non-express train resembles any regular subway train and thus has no racks for luggage so beware if you have lots of baggage that this may not be the most convenient option. Consider leaving your bags in the airport. It's not expensive at 45THB/person into town. We took it to the last stop (Phaya Thai) which took around 20min tops. From there, transfered to the BTS skytrain. The transfer is similarly confusing with minimal signs telling you which direction to go (There are signs, but they are hand drawn, small and hung from railings). Note, there are no escalators at the BTS station so you'd have to walk up lugging all your bags. That wasn't too pleasant.
very easy to get to the center with Airport rail link. very easy to get to the airport rail link station and the price is cheap, if you take taxi you shall pay much more
Very convenient. The Airport Rail Link comes frequently, is very affordable and avoids all traffic on the way to the airport. It was a quick and comfortable ride.
Very fast - wow.. If you want to go fast from the airport to town? This is it. But the train dont stops on the way. High prize - but also high speed.

quick, cheap, efficent. usually get a taxi but decided to get skytrain , very cheap, very clean and efficient ,helpful staff directing you where to go and which train, disable friendly, cool and hassle free

The way to go if you need to get to or from the main airport.. Forget the taxis, traffic and hassel. This rail link puts you right into the airport from Payah Thai (spelling?)station with about 6 stops where you can pick it up if your hotel is further outside of downtown. You can connect to it from the MRT (Subway) or BTS (elevated) trains. Well worth the 40 or so baht. Trip from PT about 40 minutes or less.

Quick way. I visit Bangkok since 2008 and it is much better to take a train than a coach. Cheaper, faster and better. From 6.15am till in the night you can take a train. No worry, if you arrive in the morning hours, you can meet some travellers and have pleasant conversation at Bangkok airport!

Super easy, best value. No reason to take a bus or taxi or hotel shuttle. This is fast and the signs are all in English. The airport signs are clear too and everyone speaks English. We arrived at BKK at night and were in our hotel within 30 minutes.

Very easy accses to destinations around bkk. There is a free application of the sky train and MTR lines that cover the city of BKK you can download to your cellphone very easy to use, we use the rail link from the airport for the first time and it was an amazing experience traveling with our 3 year old son you get special privelige from the employess of the train station they were very helpufull guiding us to our destination. You need to always have coins to buy your tickets and save travel time trying to get change but if you want to travel to more than a few places you can buy a multiple ride ticket.It is a very efficient public travel system as you know traffic is very heavy in some areas so my advice jump in the sky train or MTR to your nearest destination then walk or jump in a tuk tuk or taxi rto your location .
What transports systems should be like in the UK. A excellent and frequent service. Does not open until 6am so be aware if you have an early return to the airport.

Clean and Efficient. Direct link from airport to Bangkok. Check which station in Bangkok you need to exit as it may be better to use the city line which stops more frequently but is slower.Sit near door as if it gets busy it can be a bit tricky getting your cases through the packed carriage.Very cheap get tickets (which are tokens) from vending machine, they have English instructions and are easy to follow.

Easy to get into Bangkok. Follow the signs to the lower level of Suvarnabhumi Airport. Once you get to the bottom floor follow the signs to the entrance way to the trains. There are 2 trains. One is City and one is Express. The city trains make a few stops along the way and the express train goes straight through. They both terminate at the BTS Station Phaya Thai. If you are going to the MRT then you need to take the city line and get off a Makkasan Station and walk down to the subway (MRT). At the airport entrance to the trains there are two sides with a pay booth at each. Look up and there is a sign telling you the length of wait for both trains. It may be quicker to jump on the city train instead of the express train if the Express has a long wait. First we went on the city side to the right, they said you should go to the express side. We walk around the booth. They said 40 minutes for the express city is only 10 minutes. Back around again. They must have been chuckling a bit. No problem ride was great. One other poster said you cannot bring luggage on the MRT we each had large packpack and no one bothered us. So maybe beware.

Excellent. Really good - much much better than the old taxi or bus way into town.V good value. The city line is fine except in rush hour; the express line is a bit faster but less crowded and a little more expensive.The only downside is that it does not link well to the BTS at Phaya Thai - or it might do but I always take the wrong exit and have to go to pavement level. Taxis are relatively cheap but I like to take this into town as a way of acclimatising.

Easy to use, but difficult to get an explanation the first time you get there.. Cheap and clean to European standards.Unfortunately few of the people in the ticket offices spreak any English and impossible to buy an combination ticket with the metro... You will attract much more tourists by speaking at least one more language.

Cheap and convenient. No better way to get to Bangkok city, it is cheap and very convenient!It takes a while to get used to 'Thai English' but essential information is there and relatively clear.Make sure to keep the token, or else you won't be able to leave the station! The automated ticket machines do accept banknotes, unlike the ones for the regular tube, so save all your coins in Bangkok!The lifts in the stations are tiny, enough for two passengers and a suitcase each - get ready to carry your items up the stairs, unless the escalators are working.From Phaya Thai you can either connect somewhere or get a taxi to your destination, saving a lot of money and time in the crazy traffic!

Works well, fast, many available.. Its a good way to get into town if your flight arrives during a peak traffic hour and is cheap and air-conditioned. Trains are very clean and run often. A good option for budget travelers. You will probably need to interchange to the BTS for the main downtown areas but its signposted in English and reasonably easy to navigate.

A good transportation. It is a good transportation providing easy access from the airport to many stops in the city. But it should have to connect to many skytrain stations that would be good for travelers to access to their distinations.

Fast and cheap to go from Bangkok to Suvarnabhumi Airport. It costs 45 THB to bring you from Phaya Thai to Suvarnabhumi Airport, and it takes around half an hour. Runs from from 6am to 12am. Phaya Thai SRT station is connected with Phaya Thai BTS (SkyTrain) station. So you can quickly leave or reach Bangkok.

Easy, efficient, bilingual information and maps. Cheaper than a taxi with no traffic jams. Clean, safe, timely, and user friendly. connection for the BTS was problem free. When in Bangkok, I will always use the Airport rail link and BTS!

A good option to get into town. This is probably the best way to get into town. One must purchase a token (currently 45baht) to travel between the airport and Phaya Thai. I could not find a timetable, but trains seem to run approx every 15min and the journey takes 30min. A short walk then brings you to the Sky Train. Buy a "rabbit" card for this. It works well!Two disadvantages are that the trains tend to get crowded and when you wait for the train downtown (to go back to the airport) its hot - the station is not air conditioned

Good for solo travellers. Beats taking a taxi especially if your hotel is not far from a BTS station. However, the waiting area for the train back to the airport can get uncomfortable on a warm day as it is not air conditioned.

use this not the taxi. excellent way of getting from the airport into town. 30 mins to Phaya Thai for 45 baht each. you can change to BTS (Sky Train) at Phaya Thai. OK maybe if you have lots of luggage a taxi may be preferable but traffic is awful in the city.

Much easier than online directions would indicate. I read a lot about the Airport Link online before traveling, and was entirely confused. The key points to keep in mind are: there are several SEPARATE transit trains (Airport Link, SkyTrain and the subway); there are connecting stops, but not seamless connections (altho relatively fool-proof); train transit won't work if you're leaving early early in the morning or leaving the airport later than about 11:00 pm; there's no train transit around the Khao San Road area; it's really easy to figure out how to use the train-transit system and where to go once you're at the station, as long as you know which station you'll want to end up at.

Easy to use and efficient. Very easy to find at the airport and easy to use. Ticket machines take coins and notes and issue a token for travel. Connects with the main Skytrain system. Trains every 10 mins or so.

Is it worth the effort. Its a good way to get into Bangkok. as long as your place to stay is near the station...if not, you are into getting a taxi. Might just as well get one at the pre-pay counter at the airport. Look up the airport on the internet and find transport into town. gives the taxi fairs. Dont forget, no meter dont ride..
Best transport option. for 130 baht you can get an all day pass which allows you to travel until 12pm when the service closes

easy to use. The Airport Rail was very straight forward and easy to use. The trains are air conditioned and very clean. They have a map above the doors to show which stops are next also with a tannoy informing of the stop and next stop approaching in english.

A winner all the time. This is a must, if you can. It saves all the trouble trying to get a cab ( on the meter) from the airport. Prices range from 15-45 baht on the city line (from start to finish 30 min) to 150 baht on the express line (which takes 20 mins). No brainer for me
Too easy!. The trains were clean, efficient and easy to use! Staff at the stations are very helpful if you get a bit lost!

An excellent choice to get from and to the airport. The cheapest and probably also the fastest way to get to the airport. It cost us only 40 baht (we went from the second or third farthest away station), which is by far cheaper than with a taxi. Of course, it depends on where you stay - we stayed quite close to one of the stations.

Convenient and easy to get into town. Really like cities that has train stations from the airport to the city. Easy to understand and figure out how their rail system works. Just take note which station is nearest to your destination. Not expensive too and its user friendly. Better than taking the taxi.

Smooth and cool. I usually take the airport link to Makkasan when heading for a hotel in the Sukhumvit area, especially if a weekday and rush hour. If you are 3-4 persons, you'll not save any money compared to taxi. Always been plenty of space for luggage and not many passengers. Easy to reach from the airports basement floor. It is just 4-5 minutes difference between the normal and express train, so just go for whichever is next. Be ware that you're not allowed to bring suitcases on the subway, but no problem on the rail link.
cheap and fast. Best way to get from international airport to the city, clean, comfortable and very fast it is also easy to work out how to travel.
Fast efficient and clean. We got into the centre of Bangkok for around $3 without the traffic jams or hassles. Trains are fast, efficient and clean.
Smart & Clean link to the centre of town. No traffic no, hold ups, just a simple ride to the city centre.It's clean and efficient straight from the Airport

Make sure you know what you are doing!. We should have know better after several recent visits, but we took the Makkasan Express from the Airport after being assured that there was an easy connection to the MRT - unlike previous years. However, this is not so, and we had to walk up and down lots of steps and negotiate a busy road with our luggage to get to Petchaburi MRT Station for our onward journey to Hau Lamphong Station. If you don't know Bangkok take a taxi on your first visit.

Quickest way to and from airport. In Bangkok recently for the first time and caught up with a friend there who met me at the airport and showed me this train as the best means to get to and from the city.The express train is located at the bottom floor of the airport and once I discovered it i used it as the only means to get to the airport.The express train is a fantastic facility very under used and of high quality. For the six times that I used to get to and from the airport there was hardly anyone on it. The quality of the train is high and once it gets rolling your at your destination within 15 minutes. There is a non express option which will take longer as it has more stops.Certainly beats taxis and gridlock on roads but does run on the hour so you need to make allowance for the timetable but bits punctual.Unless you know about it you won't find it and default to taxis.At other end hop into take to hotel or use the BTS.Wonderful facility and don't know why it isn't used more.
Easy and very convenient. its the easiest and most convenient, cost effective way to get to the city from the airport and back.

Good way to travel from the Air port to the main City. It is a Good mode of transport available from the Air port to the main city and vice verse. There are two types of trains. One the express line(Blue color) and the City Line(Red) All from Suwarnabhumi airport to Phaya Thai. From there you can take a bus or another train.It is quick and comfortable. I prefer the City line. around 15 Bhat - 45 Bhat per person. Express line will cost around 90 Bhat one way.Phaya Thai Station to Suvarnabhumi Station, stops at 6 stations on the way, namely Rajaprarop Station, Makkasan Station, Ramkhanhaeng Station, Hua Maak Station, Baan Tubchang Station and Lardkrabang Station; Travelling Time 30 minutes.Travelling Time from Phaya Thai Station to Suvarnabhumi Airport Station about 17 minutes in the express line.
On time and very comfortable. We used the city line - from airport to bts and also on return journey. It was as expected. Good modern and comfortable and very cheap if you are 1 or 2 people.

why doesn't everyone use this. after years and years of getting the taxi then to be told there was going to be a rail link ,i thought "at last" . only to keep putting it off. you get off the plane pick your bags up walk toward the hordes of taxi guys and you just give in "yes" it they take you right to were you wish to go and "yes you don't need to walk down another 3 level to get to the station and "yes" on a busy day you will be in close proximity to another human beings . but this is Bangkok population a lot ! and once you get off the airport train and either have to get a connection BTS train or end up on the street after your stop it can be a bit intimidating looking like a right tourist while thousands of people just rushing around . But this time i thought "stuff it" am going to give this my best shot i had a idea were i wanted to go and as i waked up to the ticket office i actually started to panic , i mean all i was doing was getting on a god dam train right! well first the woman behind the glass screen was not a smiler which put me a ease right away NOT! i open my map i had and pointed to my final destination ."ALL THE WAY" was the reply i smiled and handed over a nice crisp 500bhat note expecting some change and she passed it back to me with a plastic coin went to the automated barriers and swiped my plastic coin and through i went. No going back now i thought the train came i got on and the lady was announcing the stops in thai and english,whit the wall chart much like the design of the London underground i plotted my journey it was a that point i took a look and the change i was given 50bhat that's what this ride was costing me a whole 50bhat i was smiling like an idiot as the train reached the furthest point i got off asked the station attendant haw to get to my final stop and was told to go down one level and take the BTS i thought should i just get a taxi now or chance my luck again and thought how happy i would be if i actually made it to my place just using public transport go i did it ,down one level you walk up to a machine and to hit a button were i hold was my stop and it load you the cost 30bhat amazing ! got on now this time i was in which the general public so a lot more people all busy on there phone looking up at me and problem thinking " tourist " but i did it got of at my stop got a final tuk tuk ride "could have walked it" so in short it was clean safe fast or and bloody cheap as chips i will never get a taxi again
very convenient. it brought me straight to my hotel from the airport and connects buses at the airport to the outer cities.
Public transport. Bts skytrain is a life saver regards travelling around Bangkok without it, it would take you a lot longer to reach your destination in the fast & furious traffic of Bangkok !

Convenient. Used to be taking cab from the hotel to the airport but due to road block, I decided to try the airport rail. To my surprise, is quite easy and convenient to use to take it to the airport. Not only is faster, the price is also reasonable. Will consider it the next time i visit Bangkok.

excellent service. Arriving at International airport go to underfllor and get the train,You can choose the express paying less than 4 $ USA or the normal one paying less than 2$. it will leave you near tha the central hotels, the last station is Pahya thai, close to Patchbouri rd.
Cheap, fast, safe and comfortable!. One should definitely go for Airport Rail Link, Taxi from Airport to city center is too expensive not to mention the traffic jam.

Amazing. Used this link several times during a trip to Thailand. I was just amazed by it, the efficiency, the speed and the reliability is miles ahead of any rail transport links we have here in the UK!! It's cheap, wonderfully air conditioned, and the announcements were in English, making it really easy to identify stops. Definitely beats a bumpy tuktuk in Bangkok rush hour!

efficient. a good way to reach the city from the airport. One may embark from the airport basement, and reach the main city in 30 minutes or less. It is better to take the train that stops at all stations instead of the one stop train.

Good transport, shame about stairs with heavy luggage. if you are going to use this, there are changes required and not all stations have lifts or escalators. there were four of us and we decided that it was not too much more to go in a taxi as their fares have gone down since the airport link gave travellers a choice

Airport train Bangkok. The Airport train from Bangkok Airport to the City takes about 35 minutes, costs about 35 Baht one way, and is quiet and comfortable. At the two city stops you can either transfer to the underground at Makassan (then one stop south to Asoke on Sukhumvit Road where you can change to the Skytrain), or to the Skytrain at Paya Thai.Do not worry about getting an express as the normal train is just as good and only stops at about six stops anyway.
Easy Link. The rail link is so easy, except if u have alot of luggage ugh!!Use it if u have 1 small carry on.Its hard to haul all your bags and get on the sky train.
Convenient and easy to use. This is one good part of the Bangkok rail infrastructure. its easy to use to get to and from the airport and city.

Fast and Easy.. The Express line is quick and easy. A 25 minute ride from the Airport to Downtown. Other lines connect to the line. Make sure you download a MTR map before you arrive to make your connection to your hotels. We didn't and ended up paying a taxi 1000 baht to get us to the hotel(should have cost us 200..sigh we were tourists).

Avoid traffice and Convenience. Cannot complain more with the Bangkok traffic. No baggage imitation sign so good for travelling with family. Also save time for 45 mins compare with taxi from downtown. Would be perfect if a train can leave every 5 mins.

Great Alternative. Quick, very cheap, clean, and leaves on time. Express trains are even quicker, but they do cost quite a bit more. About 150THB, but still a fair value for a quick trip which involves no traffic.
Nice!. A very fast and efficient way to go into city. At least it help to avoid traffic jam when taking taxi or transfer to hotels. Plus it is cheap in ticket too.

Cheap, convenient, fast. The Airport Rail Link provides a reliable, cheap way (no getting ripped off by taxi drivers! - it was less than USD 5 per person) to get from Suvarnabhumi Airport into the city and change to the BTS Sky Train or other connection to get to your hotel (and back).The Express that I took (to Phaya Thai) runs every half hour and takes about 20 minutes. This is especially useful to avoid the traffic jams in Bangkok (during rush hour or during protests). The other one runs to Makkasan Station and you can find details here: http://bangkokairporttrain.com/time-table-route.html.

Simple to use. For 50 baht an opportunity to travel on a modern railway into the centre of Bangkok without any traffic concerns.
Signage at airport is very good
Wow. England look and learn, what more can I say. Clean, quick,safe,and always on time. Easy to use and stress free,

Airport transit. Quick and easy way to get from downtown to the airport. Easy, convenient, clean, and safe. Cheap. Even with baggage this rail link is easy to use. And at the airport, getting from the train to the arrivals/departures area was a breeze.
Good alternative to using taxi. If you want a cheap and speedy alternative to taking the taxi, then go for the rail link. It is easy to use, very airconditioned and speedy.

THE ONLY WAY TO GO. My first visit to Bangkok almost 20 years ago, I took a taxi from the airport to my hotel on Sukhumvit. It took forever. Later I used the airport buses which do not run (to the best of my knowledge) from the "new" airport. This ground transportation always ultimately sat in the legendary traffic jams of Bangkok. (It is possible that if I had made those journeys at 02:00 in the morning I wouldn't have had to sit in the jams, but it never happened like that) The world is a much better place now that they have completed the airport link. The train is clean, fast, and efficient, however the traveler with a suitcase has to get same on and off the train, and in and out of train stations. When I am more than 80 years old, I probably will no longer use the train, but until then it is for me the only way to go.The wise traveller will choose his hotel so that it is near an MRT or BTS station, thus affording him quick access from the hotel lobby to the Airport Rail Link, and minimizing the suitcase carrying.The only negative (other than the suitcase thing above) is the fact that the connection to the MRT is about a 5 minute walk. Previously you had to go down and cross busy streets to get from one to the other. Today there is a long ramp which takes you over the busy streets and makes life a bit easier. I cannot comment on the connection with the BTS ("Skytrain") as I did not use it.

Very good alternative way to go to town.. Very convenient, reliable and cheap. We don't need to worry about cheated taxi driver when we use Airport Rail Link. It connected to BTS at Phayathai station.and MRT at Makkasan station. Then you can reach all places in BKK fast and cheap.Tips : It's more convenient to buy BTS or MRT card to avoid long quque in rush hour.

Best way to get into the middle of BKK.. Good: Cheap (much cheaper than any other method of transport from airport), easily signposted in airport, convenient, lots of trains.Bad: No trains running through the night.

Very very convenient. Our hotel was right on the skytrain, so access was pretty good- 2 women had 1 big suitcase and 2 carry on. Loved the speed and comfort- no traffic considerations. Con- no down escalator from the connecting train, and could not find a train schedule anywhere. Luckily we arrived exactly as the train was leaving for the airport- 40 mins from MBK to the airport!!!!!!!!!

Unexpectedly convenient!. We had never taken public transit from an airport before, but I knew we were traveling during rush hour, so we decided to give it a try. We were so pleasantly surprised! The train was not crowded at all, so having our luggage with us was no issue and we had comfortable seats the whole time. We took the express train (280B) to the end of the line, which brings you to the middle of the city. We then transferred to the BTS - BTS was a little harder with the luggage, but if you don't have a ton, you'll be fine. Airport taxis can be expensive depending on how far you have to go and if you're able to get a metered cab so this is a nice option to get you in to the heart of the city and avoid traffic.

Ratchaprarop station. We used the airport link to go up to Makkasan and then switched to the MRT. A lot of travelers had got on to it to go to the Suvarnabhumi airport. We didn't actually use it to go to the airport but I can vouch its good, reliable and it exists! Ratchaprarop is very centrally located and can be easily reached from anywhere. Its near the Pratunam market. Walking distance in fact.
convenient access to town area. With frequency of 15mins, it is a good and cheap option to get into town, esp. With Bangkok's traffic conditions, it means 0 jam situation!

best and cheapest way to get to the airport. Easy to use, cheapest and fastest way to get to the airport from city or vice versa. there are 2 airport rail links. One is the City line (which have 5 or 6 stops in between Phaya Thai to the airport, 45Baht per person). The other one is the Express line (which has no stops in between, 120B per person)

Cheap and fast. Cheap, fast and reliable way from BKK to city. I see no alternatives to do this way. Comfortable interchange with MRT. Bangkok's buses are, practically, only for locals because of routes and stops signed only in thai, so railway transportations in Bangkok is the most appropriate transport for budget tourists.
Easy. Easy, fast, cheap. Can not ask for more. Traveling light, it is great. Lots of baggage, take a taxi.

Rapid transport. A good way to travel for the first time traveler to Bangkok if you don't mind walking a bit ( A bit of Google search is required to locate your hotel). You can hop on to the MRT or SRT to get to your final place. Its rapid fast, convenient and way less expensive than the taxis ( Taxis may swindle you up to 1500 Bhat were as you will be paying 45 Bhat only to the last stop). Signs and displays are informative and easy. Also avoids traffic congestion to and from the airport.
Fast convenient link. A little confusing at first but quite easy & inexpensive.Not so good if you have lots of luggage.Traffic busting

Fast and comfortable. There are 2 options......one seems to be a stopping service that takes a bit longer and runs to the Makkasan train station. We took this one which was fast cheap and comfortable. Once at Makkasan we proceeded to a desk with 2 ladies organising taxis. The other service is express and runs directly to the Skytrain station ...Praya Raya......

Easy and fast to get to town - and not expensive. Had to meet a friend in town and since I was staying near the airport, I took the hotel shuttle to the airport and the railway link to town area, where I could connect to the mRT to Lad Prao. Definitely a faster way of transport than a taxi during rush hour - and also not so costly. For the way back I did the same procedure, it took about 40 minutes to get back to the airport.
cheap, clean, efficient. The easiest, fastest and cheapest way to get to Bangkok from the airport.Very frequent and clockwork regular. Change to the metro lines at Siam Square.

Fast and comfortable. When we first arrived in Bangkok we were met at the airport by a taxi but when we came back after our side trip to Cambodia, we came back into the city on the rails. It was fast and not crowded, took us directly to the sky train which dropped us at the river so we could take the tourist boat to our hotel. It was serene -- although it would not have been so easy if we had been lugging along a lot of luggage.
Great service and very comfortable!. great way to travel to/from the airport. Airconditioned and very comfortable! Worth using it rather than taxis!

Good!. This is a nice way to get away and to the airport. A key thing to remember is that there are is the airport link and the city link. The airport link is non stop to one of two stations, while the city link stops many times before its final destination. The ride on the Airport Link is nice, as most people use the City Link. Its quick!

Rapidest Airport transfer method. Absolutely it is the cleanest and rapidest and cheppest way of city and airport transfer,but there is a small problem:you should walk long distance in the airport and at the last station to reach and get-out of the train,may be big problem if you carry big bag.

Fast but still not convenient. I have no idea why you would connect a rail link to surely one the busiest Asian airports and then have the main city terminus in the middle of nowhere under a motorway with no connection to the sky train and underground - leaving you to dodge traffic while lugging suitcases. Next time Bangkok airports trust gets together please visit Hong Kong before planning anything to do with airports, trains, underground walkways, etc, etc

great, fast and cheap!. What some travellers and especially first time Bangkok tourists don't know: there is a rail link at the bottom floor of the airport, which connects to Phaya Thai MRT/BTS station for 45 Baht.Use that one instead of a Taxi as it is much cheaper and often even faster depending on your hotels location.
Handy airport train. Nice way to move downtown after the flight. The ticket cannot be connected to metro or skytrain journeys, unluckily.

Easy link to the city. Costs less than a pound.If you are going into the city take the rail link to Phaya Thai and then the BTS skytrain to your destination,all clearly marked and much quicker and cheaper than a taxi.

Best way to get to the city centre. The first time we went to Bangkok we avoided the BTS for some reason. I wish we hadn't, it's cheap and simple to use. Also, with the aircon, it's great if you just want to just cool down.

The best way to get from the airport.. Although you will find many adverts for the link calling it the Skytrain you will not find it named as such at the airport. Take the escalators to the very bottom of the airport and follow the red and blue train signs. Once at the station, the left side train, RED, is the express which takes will take 15 minutes to the City Air Terminal (Makkasan) train station. This service connects to the city's mass transit subway system. The train on the right, BLUE, is the stopping train which takes you to Phaya Thai. You will need to buy a token at the airport, single only, and swipe it a the turnstiles. It can take 30 minutes to get from the Phaya Thai to the airport and gets very crowded at peak times. Make sure you leave in plenty of time if you want to get to the airport as you will have to wait for the next one if there is no room for you to get on with luggage.

Very efficient. The train is a big plus while traveling from the airport. I can't imagine going by taxi ever again. The information desk staff are less than helpful and a bit disinterested. There are two trains and we found out the hard way to take the express, regardless of the instructions of the help desk and signage.

Good without luggage.. I was travelling alone with a large suitcase and shoulder bag. I tried a dummy run a couple of days before my flight home. I have absolutely no complaints about the efficiency and speed of the train, however, I decided that a taxi, on the express way, was the easiest and safest form of transport to the airport. The taxi service is a little more expensive but I travelled in comfort and had no worries about pick pockets or the aggravation of carrying and moving my luggage around. If I had been travelling in a group or with family I would have taken the train.

Wxcellent way of traveling to the Airport. If you are in a rush, done think of taking a taxi in a city like Bangkok. High chances that you will miss your flight as no predictions about traffic in this city. With Airport Link, you can be sure that you are at the airport within 25 minutes you are on the train. Frequency is good as it runs every 15 minutes

Easy to use. Train system in Bangkok is relatively easy to use and convenient. Took the non express train as we were early and it's a bit cheaper. The taxis are more expensive and with the protests going on right now in Bangkok, not as reliable.

Excellent value and quick to the centre of Bankok. In the past I always had to get a taxi into the centre of Bangkok which was often time consuming and a little expensive. However, since they have built the rail link, all that has changed. It is quick and cheap, air conditioned, and you get to see the surrounding countryside.

Simple and easy!. We went from Asok to Praya Mai (spelling?), then immediately boarded the non express train to the airport. For less than $5 for 2, it was great. Good air conditioning, not overcrowded on a Sunday afternoon, and great value. We only had to carry our luggage down 1 set of stairs on the entire trip. Were escalators up at every stop. We had 4 rolling pieces and no problems.

Disastrous. Schedule incomprehensible, leaves you in the middle of nowhere, with no taxis and a long walk to the MRT subway. Advertised checkin service only available for Thai Airways flights. Its quick and clean once you get on the train, but the wait was at least 45 minutes.

Very fast and effiecient. Made use of the airport rail link to get to the airport for our return flight home. As we were staying in Sukhumvit, it was extremely handy to get to the airport rail link as it was only one stop away from us on the BTS. The airport rail link journey only takes 15 mins to get to the airport as its a direct non-stop service, however it only runs every 30-45mins so if you miss one, you have to wait a while for the next. However it was great, as it's quicker and cheaper than taking a taxi and you're guaranteed not to be stuck in traffic which is always crazy in Bangkok! As it's an express train and costs a little more than the standard train, it was practically empty which was great especially when you have your baggage with you. Would definitely recommend and will be taking this mode of transport the next time I'm visiting in Bangkok.
fast and cheap way to the city. must be the fastest way to get into the city, and for the distance remarkably cheap.air con lots of room for suitcases and clean.
Fast and inexpensive option. The Airport Rail Link is a fast and inexpensive option for getting to and from the airport, with connections to Metro lines that got us to and from our hotel.

Use this! It's SO convenient.. Make your trip from Bangkok airport into the city on the Rail Link and avoid all of the hassle of the traffic jams below this elevated railway.The Express service is non-stop into the city, but runs less frequently than the cheaper regular multi-stop service. Both are excellent and for us the regular service took us a little further into the city which made it easier to connect with our next link to the hotel.The carriages are clean, bright and wonderfully air conditioned! A pleasure to use (I wish that British railways were like this.... Dream on....)

Easy transport from the BKK International Airport. I have never seen such convenience at any airport in any country I have visited. You can literally not step out of the airport terminal, catch this link and transfer to a BTS in the blink of an eye. It's clean , convenient and cheap!!

Best way to the airport. Wish it ran 24 hours to earn 5 stars, but this is the best way to Suvarnabhumi Airport. It's cheap and doesn't contribute to the pollution or congestion on Bangkok's roads. Takes about 30 minutes to the airport from Phaya Thai BTS. Maybe a bit longer if you have to wait for an arriving train. Also, needs a better connection to the MRT subway, but I hear they are working on it.

Best with light luggage. This is the option you should take to get into town. So quick and in no time if your hotel is right next to the sky train station. The train is clean, new and smooth and runs at a very reasonable price.

Unkwon cheap way of getting into Bangkok. It is on the B level in the airport and easy to access; the train brings you to Phaya Thai from where you can take the BTS to the center of Bangkok; For only 45 bath (+- 1€). Airconditioning on board and all stations are anounced so missing yor station is not possible if that would be before Phaya Thai. Enjoy it
Quicker than a Taxi. Gets you into the city very quickly and links up with the Sky Train and MRT. Great value for money, fast and efficient service. Very clean.
Check time of last train. As far as I am aware the last train is before mid-night for all those travellers arriving late - make sure you check before travel.

fast and convenient. if you want to avoid traffic jam, i think this can be another option. we paid 45 bath/person from suvarnabhumi airport to phayathai (last stop). and we take bts to siam because our hotel in siam area (you need to buy new ticket).they provide lift if you can't find escalator so i don't find any difficulty with 2 heavy, large baggage. airport rail link is convenient, but bts is very crowded, lucky we just have to move 1-2 stop.go to B floor to take airport rail link, if u don't have coins to buy ticket, go to the locket and you can get your ticket from there. airport rail link have schedule operation.the train is clean and look modern.

If you know where your hotel is.... ...this is the way to go. For 45 Baht (compared to 350 plus 75 toll for a taxi) you get to the city fast. If you have heavy baggage and have to change to another line you should reconsider, however. The different lines should have an agreement so only one fare has to be paid. The way it is now one has to pay for each segment separately.
Don't waste time with taxis!. Very easy to navigate, and really clean. TVs on some that show commercials. Unsure of operating hours.

Bangkok's Airport Rail Link. If you are travelling 'light' the Airport Rail Link is a quick and convenient way of getting to Suvarnabhumi Airport. Easiest way is if you are close to the BTS, get the Skytrain to Phyathai Stn and change there onto the Airport Link line. The fare ONE WAY is 45 Baht. There are 6 stops before the Airport. You can also catch an EXPRESS service from Makkasan Stn.(Fare 35 Baht) The Airport station platform is underground, you just take the lift or walkway up to the level you want.
Great way to get into the city. Definitely the way to go to beat out the traffic jams when traveling to and fro from the city and the airport.

Perfect transportation. Even taxis are cheap in Bangkok, this is the perfect transportation to the city, at a very affordable price.The trains run frequently and have a lot of space including for luggage.The only negative point of this transportation is that for most airport link stations you will have to go down by stairs, No elevator or escalator to go down to street level.If you don't want or can't take the stairs just go to Makasan and ride a taxi for the rest of your journey in the city.
Fast and cheap. There is 2 kind of train so choose the 150 baht train it just take 15 minutes instead 30 minutes with many stops,

An economic way of getting into the city from the airport. And it's quiet! It's devoid of loud speakers and televisions, unlike all the rest of the trains in Bangkok. Fast and reliable. I hope they suss out their escalator situation in Phaya Thai though. Getting down the steps in those crowds with a suitcase is a bit treacherous.

Quick and easy. Used this in November to meet a friend from the airport, ticketing and access very quick and easy and cheap. Train was however very busy and I did have to stand most of the way (not too much of a hardship for such a relatively short time).

Cheapest & fastest way from Suvarnabhumi airport to the city centre.. This train cost just 50thb each from the INTERNATIONAL Suvarnabumi airport to the city centre so this is the cheapest way and also good to avoid the traffic rush on the highways by taxis. Even it is also true that if you are carry big luggage than could be a bit uncomfortable.

Excellent connection between Bangkok and Suvarnabhumi Airport... The Rail link is really good with regular trains and stops along the way arriving at Phaya Thai taking about 20 minutes. Trains leave ever 15 minutes so never a long wait.

Good if you have little baggage. I used the train to return to Bangkok after seeing off friends at the airport. It would be completely impracticable if I had had baggage to handle. The end station of the express line at Makkasan has no good facilities for passengers with baggage and taxi service is limited. Therefore I continued on the local line to the end station at Phayathai, from where it is a short walk across the concourse to the Skytrain (again difficult with baggage). If you arrive with baggage, I believe that the meter taxi direct from the airport to your destination is still the best solution..

Perfect to reach the city centre. If you arrive at the airport, don't even think about searching a taxi overthere, just research where your hostel is in town and take the railway to the city centre. Taxis are available at every stop to reach your final destination. Buying a ticket is no problem. Automats are in English.

Out of Airport and into Town. Dont feel worried about arriving at the HUGE airport and not knowing what to do - people both will guide and assist but signs are in English as well as Thai...just take it slowly and make sure you are going the right way :)

Save your money and avoid the taxis. The Airport link takes you from the airport to most places in the city. It stops at Phaya Thai, but you can get a metered taxi from there if you are closer to the river. It is 65 THB for a 20 min ride from Airport to Phaya Thai which is about $2 US. Most Shuttle buses run about 150 THB and taxis are 200-300 THB.

Economical and fast. There are two services: City and Express. The Express service seems impractical unless you have a lot of luggage, because it is less frequent than the City line, more expensive, and a longer walk to reach the entrance than the City line (at least at the Makkasan station). On the City line there is no overhead space or special storage areas for luggage.

Wish all cities had this!. This is such a great connivence. I was visiting some friends in BKK but instead of making them go all the way to the airport and deal with all that traffic they told me a station to get off at and were waiting for me there. It was easy to find and cheap. Convenient for em and the people picking me up.

Beats the traffic. I took the train for the first time because of the political riots in the streets, I will take it every time from now on, THB 45 one way, clean, efficient, easy to navigate. Very good. So thanks political protestors, you have made me discover a btter form of transport, sorry taxi drivers

Fast and cheap. This is the best way into downtown Bangkok. Our hotel....Grande Terminal 21 was connected to it by the MRT. If you need to be at the airport earlier that 6am this will not get you there on time as the first train is at 6am from the center of Bangkok. There is a city line and a direct line....we took took the direct line. Be prepared to walk as the MRT does not actually connect to it at a change over station.

We never use the roads in Bangkok. Take this train to Phraya Thai, then jump on the Sky train to take you to Siam area or down to the river and then get the ferry back up to Than Tian, Khao San road etc. A lot less stressful than sitting in traffic and breathing smog! The cost is about 10% of the Airport train in Sydney and as it's the first stop you can get a seat, unlike Sydney!

So easy to get in to Bangkok. If you want an east way in to Bangkok without using taxis this is the way. From the Airport it is well signed and as long as you have a hotel which is close to a sky Train station this is a great way to get in to town for half the price of a taxi.The Public transport system in Bangkok is so easy and so cheap and much quicker than taxis.

Convenient. A great way to travel from the airport (BKK) to the city. We took the express train and it only took about 17 minutes to get from BKK to Phaya Thai. On our way back, we took the City Line train which took about 30 minutes. It was also good.
fast connection to Suvarnabhumi Airport. travel relaxed to the new airport in Bangkok. did it several times and never regret it. only disadvantage is, earliest start at 6am , latest at 11:51pm.

Good way to tavel to - from airport for light traveller. Good way to travel to from Bangkok airport best if yr travelling light as trains can get crowded during peak hours. Great value for money compared with Taxi fare to town. Trains stop around Midnight.

Great way to travel to airport. Wish we had this at home...great an convenient way to travel to the airport without dealing with the very very heavy traffic at loo cost red line on airport link is express ( no stops) (90 bahts per person i think per way)blue city line has stops (45 bahts per pers one way) can buy at counters with minimum difficulty at machines you have to be used to them or try to get help ;)

Excellent way to travel to airport. It's an cel lent way to travel to airport as you save a lot of time from the busy traffic of Bangkok streets. However, you need to be careful with the luggage as that can be a little complicated to get to the trains by stairs if you have a lot of luggage. It just takes less than 30 minutes to reach the airport and reasonably cheap prices. If you have limited luggage, then this is the best option specially on the weekends when Bangkok roads are awfully busy

THE only way to travel to the airport!. Bangkok traffic is basically gridlock, stand still gridlock. It can take an hour to get to the airport if you are lucky. The Skytrain airport connection is easy to use and cheap.

Good transit for light traveller and on a budget only.... If you are alone or a group and have two luggages or more w/ spinners on them and with carryon, I say just grab a taxi in the airport it is not that expensive as long as you requested the to use the meter, stay away from taxi drivers that will not use meter though. But, if you still want to ride the MTR use the elevators and not the people movers or escalator. You will have a hard time holding those spinners luggage from staying put while you go down. Each stop stations are inter-connected by above the street bridge but be aware there are no elevators in the train station ( if there is ask for it, as I did not see one) and the stairs steps are narrow in width and kinda steep. I saw at least three tourists with luggage in tow slipped and fall on these stairs and it was not a good sight.

The best way to get from and to the airport. This service is extremely convenient. In 25 minutes you are at the airport from downtown. It is far quicker and far cheaper than a taxi. Unless you have a large amount of luggage, don't even think about using a taxi. Does not run after midnight, if you arrive later, unfortunately you'll have to use other modes of transport.

Best way to town. Taxi cabs are all about making a buck. With the recent protests in Bangkok, this seemed like the more logical way to get to/from the airport. For 45baht (about us$1.50) you can take a direct shot with a few stops straight to the terminal or phaya thai station. From there, you can continue with the sky train or take a METERED cab. If the taxi says the meter is broken, either agree on a fair price (which you'll likely still get ripped off on) or move on to the next cab

An easy way to the airport. You could take a cab to the airport, but if you don't have a lot of luggage, the rail link is an easy option. For about $1.50, the train goes from central Bangkok directly (with very few stops) to the airport. It is both cheap and efficient. However, it is not meant for people with tons of luggage.

Sure beats a taxi. Used this on way back from Sukhumvit area to Airport.First time user so was not sure where to exactly go so missed a connection.However. would definitely use next time now familiar with the right stations to depart from.Sure beats sitting in traffic in a taxi and cheaper !

Best way to go to the airport. The airport rail link from Bangkok city center to Suvarnabhumi Airport is very convenient. You just need to take the Sky train to Phaya Thai station and from there take the sky train all the way to the airport. The trip takes 30 minutes and there's also a faster alternative which takes 15 minutes. You will reach the airport faster than a taxi and it will be much cheaper as well. A taxi costs around 400 THB and the train is 45 THB/person (fast train 150 THB/person). In addition to that, my experience is that you always need to argue a bit with the taxi driver and you never know if he will take the nearest road or try to rip you off...I will for sure use the train if I would return to Bangkok.

easy to use, easy to find. I had no problems using the Airport Rail Link and it turned out to be easy to use and find, there are signs at Bangkok Airport telling you were to find it, once your there, buy a ticket, then head off to were you need to go, pretty simple.

A lot better than ripped off taxi at the airport. I personally dislike taxi at suvannabhumi airport, so airport link is a lot better choice. It's clean,convenient and very reasonable price. The only problem is the connection with local metro might take a lot of walk up and downs.. probably because the connecting walkway was built after .. and doesn't really fit perfectly.. It's good if you are on 4 wheelers or light travellers. Feel a lot better than a taxi , i guarantee you.

Disabled unfriendly. The train is confusing and worse when you get to city link. You have to walk up/down stairs which is bad for disabled people. You will stand on train as Thais know nothing about disabled people

Easy and helpful airport staff. The BKK airport staff were there at everypoint guiding us. Train was clean, affordable and super quick to the city. Would definitely travel this way over a cab! There were protests on during our stay so catching a cab would have taken longer and cost more. I would definitelly catch the rail link again.
advanced, clean and fast... the best way to get out of the airport and to. save money. save time(traffic) and get to see the first glimpse of bangko

cheap and easy way to get from the airport. WOW! This airport rail link was very impressive. it's cheap and quick and easy to use. You connect to the bts skytrain or to the underground system, so you can get to the main parts of town easily. i wouldnt recommend this if you have a lot of luggage. it runs from 6 am to midnight.

Fast, efficient and inexpensive way to get from airport ot downtown Bangkok. There are two lines. The red/express goes as far as Makasann Station in about 10 minues, while the blue line takes 25 minutes or so and goes two stations further to end at Phaya Thai Station, which connects to the BTS skytrain.Both run frequently from approx. 6:35am until midnight, are clean and inexpensive. Easy to find in the lower level of the airport -- follow the signs. Buy a token at the window.
Get the Express train. Pay the extra $2 and get the express. Less people on the train comfy seats and its is 15 minutes trip.
Easy!!!. Very easy and practical, way better than discuss for hours with Taxi drivers to put the meter and take you to town!

Ok but. Its a good way into the city but then it gets a bit tough as the in town airport terminal could be a lot more user friendly. You will probably have to catch a cab from the in town terminal so maybe catch a metered taxi from the airport? Do not under any circumstances take an AOT limousine from the airport, they are heavily touted and are an absolute rip off.

Nice ride. Bring something to read or play your favorite mobile app game as the ride from Phaya Thai to the airport is about 30 minutes. Don't do like me and catch this train at 11:30p. You will not make the connection to the BTS before it closes at midnight. Other than the transportation needing to stay open later, this is still a good way to get to and from the airport. No taxis to try to rip you off.
its worth it. given bkk traffic and especially at certain times taking the airport link is really worth it...its just a ride to Petchaburi station (MRT)and walk 250 mts...easy

always use this. excellent, brings you around central bangkok and among all entertainment areas and major hotels
similar concept to KL but less confusing
always use this to their airport though it does not travel to don muang airport

Cheap, fast, convenient.. Super inexpensive and if you have decent enough transit taking skill it's very convenient. The transfer at Makkasan for the MRT is a bit of a hike but it lets you access the city very quickly. Beats dealing with cabbies.

Bit inconvenient. We used this to reach airport as we feared jam due to on going unrest. The trains are only one in an hour.
There is no escalator to this link when one arrives by BTS with luggage.
If you are more than 2 persons you will not save much except travel time.

Simple mode of transport to get back and forth the airport. Nothing difficult using the service, trains arrive and depart almost every 5-10 minutes. A Token for travel is obtainable from the kiosk and is used for admittance through the turnstyles at to the platform. The locations of the different stops are clearly indicated within the compartment. As long as you know the district of where your hotel is located you will have no problems as to what station to get off.

Excellent!. Really good! It's affordable, comfortable, fast, air conditioned, and very easy to use. Two stops worth noting are Makhasan for the MRT and Praya Thai for the skytrain. The service is reliable and safe! I strongly recommend using this rather than a taxi or bus as it is far faster and safer than road transport! If you're heading to Khao San Road area, get off at Makhasan and catch the MRT to Hua Lumphong, then either walk or take a taxi from there. Fastest, cheapest, and safest method!

boon if you wish to time your trip to the airport. bangkok traffic is extremely uncertain and planning you trip to the airport (suvarnabhmi) is a game of chance.the airport rail link cuts out the guessing. the trains depart at very regular intervals and the travel time is under 30 minutes from the phaya thai to the airport station.the fare is bahts 45 and there are many ticket vending machines. specific amount is change is not essential as the machines return the change with your tickets.the ticket is a plastic tockem which you tap on the machine to access the train platform and drop in the slot at the terminal machines.those are the benefits.it would become an excellent facility if:1. seemless ticketing can be arranged in conjuction with the BTS and the MRT. ( buying your tickets for the latter trains is an additional process).2. make the phaya thai BTS station more user friendly with provision of elevators or escalators so that baggage can be handled more conveniently. elderly are severely handicapped under the existing conditions as you have to carry all you bags down the steps leading to the rail link station.this is an excellent begining for the airport transportation. an extension to Hua Lum Phong ( the main railway station) could also be considered.

So easy. Either the fast link or the slightly slower link, this is such an easy way to get to/from the centre, and so affordable.Tip: study the skytrain map to avoid confusion after a long flight! You'll need coins for the skytrain tickets which can be exchanged at a separate booth.
Pretty hectic. The system inside the airport was great but my stop at makasan was not so smooty. :( maybe picked a bad day

Regular and reliable.. My husband and I used this service and were really glad we did. It is not expensive to use and it is reliable, clean and cool and it has regular trains to take you from the airport.

Melbourne could learn something from this. Easy to find, easy to use, punctual and efficient. It can get crowded at peak times as commuters use the line to get to work. You can connect to the sky rail and underground network
Convenient. Especially when you have been walking the entire day, it helps to catch the train and its frequent of course

Fast, easy but connection to MRT line is too far. If you travel without too many lugage, this train is the best way to bring you to the city. It is clean, easy and fast. However, when you depart from Makassan station, you need to walk quite - or I can say very - far to the MRT downton line. You also need to walk far to the road side for a taxi.

Easy and clean. Great way to get to the city, we did not understand how to find the link but all staff at airport are helpful and will point you in the right direction. Once you get on the train and on arrival at the skytrain it is all very clear and easy to use.

It just works. You take all your possessions to the train station, enter in your stop at the ticket machine. The ticket machine gives you a token. Proceed towards the turnstiles and touch the magnetic token on the front of the turnstiles. Wait for your train and finally get off at your stop. really simple really convenient. Who this service is not for;People with lots of suitcasesPeople who can't carry their luggage upstairs or downstairsPeople who need assistance. Alternative is take a taxi or private bus
Perfect!. Fast, clean, comfortable, made to be easy to use by foreigners and with support staff well trained. The ticket value is very good for the service offered.

Top knotch. We landed in Bangkok a couple of hours late after being delayed in New Delhi airport due to the "Indian way", then the experience change in BKK. Everything followed a logical process including finding the airport city link clearly marked. Ticket booth easy to find, and clear pricing and instructions, failing that a security guard made sure you got what you needed. Easy access to platform, a minute or two wait for train, train kept you informed where you were and 25 mins you are in the city. Then you are on your own, to travel either on the sky train or to hire taxi on the street, we arrived 10 o clock at night so we had to tackle the taxi mafia. The link is excellent!
Generally easy but.... This is a good system but check stations carefully to alight and ask for directions if unsure. We got off one stop early and it was difficult to get back on the line.

convienent but slow.... Its very easy to take the train from the airport but depending on where you are going in Bangkok it can be a hassle once you are in the station where you have to change train. But if you live very close to the station its very easy to use.But the trouble with a family's suitcases are in my opionon too much trouble i will suggest a taxi from the airport (meter) which will take you exactly to your hotel for around 3-400 thb.

Execellent. If your on a Budget then get the Sky Train into the Middle of Bangkok it takes about 20 minutes from the Airport to Phaya Thia and costs about 45 bht each.Just remember to keep hold of your token or you carn't get out of the train station.

Quick and easy. the traffic in bangkok can be slow at the best of times so i decided to use the airport link to get close to the hotel. 40 baht for the train and 50 baht for the taxi at the other end to get to the hotel total travel time 35 mins

Straight forward link to the city. Easy to access. Connects to the MRT and BTS which is like the London tube system but is above ground. You will need change which you can get from the information desks

Easy and convenient. For a fraction of the price of a taxi and also for convenience and speed I can recommend that you try the airport rail link, it gets you to any areas in Thailand and is easy to use.

Good way to get into Bangkok city. The train is a pretty good option if you don't have much luggage, but if you do have suitcases, consider taking a cab. The trainstation are not well equipped for disabled or moving bulky luggage and the cab will still be very cheap.

Works well, if you don't have too much luggage. It was great previously when I used it (without luggage) to visit central BK from an airport hotel, but arriving this latest time at BKK with luggage it would have been a struggle to get to my hotel, so took a taxi.

Above It All. Bangkok traffic frightens me...both in quantity of drivers and the quality of their recklessness. Now you have a choice to the airport, spend $2.50 and spend one hour on the Skytrain or spend $20 and take your chances
Airport to Patthai to Asoke or Nana and you are now in the middle of Bangkok. Its that simple

dont miss your flight !. If you want to be sure not to miss your flight this might be the best option available in bkk.. you never know in traffic.. but the airport rail link is fast.. dependable.. and economic
quick way to reach the city. Liked the frequency of the trains. Speed and accuracy. Unlike the fare. But over all enjoyed the ride.

Efficient, affordable travel via airport rail link .. If you are a single traveller, its a cost efficient way to connect to the Suvanabhumi airport in Bangkok. It is cheap to take the City Link via Makassan station if you have time to spare costing only 35 Baht compare to Express airport rail link. The down side is that it has quite a few stops before arriving.On my return trip to Bangkok, connected on the airport rail link half an hour prior to midnight. It was just as efficient and fast. The only disadvantage is that the taxi stand area under the arriving Makassan station is rather dark and uninviting. Unknowingly I was waiting for my ride at the taxi stand when I was informed by the security staff of a free service to call for taxi and they record the taxi number plate and inform the driver of your destination ! No signs in English to inform arriving passengers. Have seen other passengers lugging their luggage to the main road which is quite a distant away.Surrounding areas of the Makkassan Station looks desolated and uninviting for first timers. Could be clearer with signage and up keep of the surrounding of the station. While traveling in the direction from Rachada to Asoke Road to Makkasan station is confusing as no clear directions leading to the entrance are available unless you have previously traveled.

Thanks for the airport rail link, we don't need to use tricky Taxi!. Thai people love Money as Chinese do."Thai people are very nice and they are smily", it was 10 years ago.Nowadays they don't smile often and try to get as much money as possible from foreigners.Taxi and Tuk Tuk drivers are typically money lover and if they know you are foreigner and do not know the city well, they will ask you much more than normal prices.Thanks for the airport rail link, we don't need to pay extra!

Extremely convenient. the airport rail link runs from 6h00 till 24h00; is always perfectly on time; offers you 2 types of services (the express line connects you in 20 minutes to the city centre/Airport) and the regular city line in 30 minutes and runs every 12 minutes. It takes you into the heart of Bnagkok shopping and hotels area (Pratunam and Sukhumvit areas) and the fare is just brilliant (45 THB for regular and 90 THB for the express line).

Safer than a taxi. It's cheap, safe and runs frequently. Our hotel was a block or two away, so we hopped on a tuk-tuk for 100 baht and it dropped us off right in front of the station. It was clean and fairly comfortable and took all of 20 minutes to get to the airport. It cost much less than a cab, took less time and we weren't worried if we'd make it there alive or uninjured.I wanted to slap myself for not trying this sooner.

Poor signage, lack of escalators and infrequent trains. The Airport Link is a great idea but it is let down by poor signage (a lot of which still seems to be temporary) and hardly any lifts or escalators which is unforgivable when most of the passengers are expected to come from the airport loaded with luggage. The City Line service, which stops at several stations on the way to the airport, comes every 15 minutes which is OK but nowhere near as frequent as the BTS Skytrain. The Express service leaves every half hour which is very inconvenient, plus it's overpriced at 100 Baht to go to the airport. Overall, if you live near a station along the line it's OK to use the City line to commute to other places along the line, but I'd only use it to go to the airport if I was travelling alone with very light luggage, or if I was travelling there with no bags, e.g. to meet someone there,

Use it every time. I use the cheap city line that departs every 15 minutes , never bother with the makkasan express. This timeI exited at the Ratchaprarop station in the pratunam area. WIthout too much heat and luggage you can easily walk to most hotels there, Brilliant.

Good option for avoiding traffic. If you don't have much luggage and/or wish to avoid the traffic, this is a good option. If only Jakarta and other cities had a link like this! Not overpriced like Sydney.

Some tips on what to do when you get to the Airport. OK so you are through customs, immigration and security and you have luggage on a trolley (Free at Suvarnabhumi) airport.Do not wait for the lifts to the lowest floor as they are few and the queues to use them usually long at peak times.Use the travelators and get to the lowest level and follow the signs to the "City Line" "Airport Rail Link". Use the toilets at the airport before boarding as there are non on the train system.You get to a pay kiosk (English spoken) and buy a token (round plastic disc) which you insert in the barrier. If however you have LOADS of luggage, the train police will allow you through the barrier and you take yet another lift down onto the platform. You should arrive knowing what station you want to disembark from however the end of the line is Phayathai and there you insert your token or again go to the train police, SMILE and get let through a barrier again, take the stair or a lift down to an underpass (still above ground level) and walk the 200 metres or so to "PHAYATHAI" station on the BTS. Here you reverse the procedure to enter the BTS network proper but the system for purchasing tickets is different so read the SKYTRAIN section of Trip Advisor.Trains are cheaper than taxis and trains are well air-conditioned.Now if you are elderly or infirm this mode of transport is not for you and you younger people with so much baggage that you cannot organise it's transit on your own,.... this is where we recommend you take a taxi.By the way, we never see the point of taking the EXPRESS train to the airport as it costs significantly more but is not significantly faster.
