The non-express are white and yellow flag. Most tourist gets on at the Tha Sathon pier (Central). 2 minutes walk from the Saphan Taskin BTS station. They always try to sell you the one day unlimited ride tickets, unless you will be made 4 stops including the return, which is unlikely for most people, buy the single trip ticket instead.

great value for money. This is one of the Bangkok attractions were you do not need to pay more than the locals. If you have time buy a ticket (approx 20 eurocents) and enjoy the boat trip for more than an hour. You will see less turistic places which worth a visit.

A voyage of fun and full of memories. this was a nice experience to enjoy the river ride in Boat still in 2016 the essence of history is still there its a real site for tourists who love nature and history at same time.
Good to get around especially in traffic hours.. One has to know how to use it. Easily interconnected with BTS skytrain. Very convenient to get around in..
Good way to get up and down the rover. We brought the day pass. Staff were helpful and the longest we waited for a pickup was 20min. Despite lots of stops, travel is quite quick.

Great experience. My family took me to the boat as we need to go to Wat Arun. After we waked to Pra athit pier to get the ferry. There was massive people traveled along the different boat and it was hectic but really interested to try. When we traveled pass maharaj hospital area. Boats are along the river and we can see the traffic on the water. Such a great experience to see and we would love to do it again.

Great inexpensive way to see main sites. We stayed at the Sheraton Royal Orchid hotel- right on Pier 3 stop of Chao Praya Express. It was our primary mode of transport for 4 days. Very cheap-14Bht--not even a 1usd, boats run every 15 minutes and stop at all the must see places-Wat Pho, Grand Palace, Chinatown, short walk from Khao San Road.Absolutely best way to travel around the city as you don't need to deal with taxi and tuk-tuk drivers trying to rip you off.

Must do. Nothing fancy about taking the local boat but if you are a real traveller who likes to spend time with the locals and get a genuine feel for the local life this is a must do experience. See most of Bangkok's major sites from the water and watch the tug boats float by. The ride is about 50 cents. Great way to experience the city. I recommend going just before sundown to watch the sun set over the city. Plus, its busy with commuters so you can get a vibe for day to day life.
Beautiful view. cheap boat ride with a beautiful view of the river and Wat arun. Definitely you cannot miss ding while in Bangkok.

Use the regular services - not the "Chao Phrya tourust Boat".. The Chao Phrya River Is a busy and fascinating waterway and in Bangkok many of the things tourists want to see are beside it or close to it, and it's sensible to use the network of public transport boats - effectively river buses - to get to them. So why not the waterborne version of the “hop on, hop off” open top bus tours you find in so many cities? That’s what the Chao Phrya Tourist Boat is – a river bus (like many that ply regular service on the river) that calls at the piers where there’s something of tourist interest, with a day ticket (and a helpful little brochure, and a live guide).But in practice it gave us a frustrating day. Getting off and sightseeing was no problem, but it was really annoying to stand waiting for a pick-up only to see the boat sail past, not once but twice! It appears that unless there’s someone on the boat who wants to get off at that pier then the boat doesn’t stop. Eventually we made our way to another pier where one of the big attractions meant the boat was bound to have someone to let off.Frustrating, annoying and time-wasting, all in the heat and humidity of Bangkok. My advice – check with the tourist literature or your hotel concierge which boats (water buses) of the regular network serve the pier you want to go to and go that way instead. It’ll be cheaper too.
Avoid the traffic. Avoid the traffic and enjoy the views. It's also very cheap get a day pass and you can travel on it all day. Really convenient
great way to visit. fast, confortable, and cool atmosphere.... such a nice way of locomotion...and cheap. great view ... bring your camera
ferry.... good to cross the river ...cheaper faster mode of transport. easy access. it takes just few minutes to cross the river.
Why get the tourist boat. Get the orange flag boats , frequent, fast enough and really cheap 14 baht from the bts to the grand palace - does the job without any frills

Its an ideal way to avoid traffic jams in Bangkok and the scenery is beautiful along the river. From the Navalai (hotel) pier you can get to the Oriental ( hotel) pier in about 20 min. On your way you have a nice view of the Wat Arun especially by sunset, the Royal Palace and the very modern buildings in Bangkok. It only cost you 15THB if you take the watertaxi with orange flag.

DO THIS - if you want see a lot of Bangkok on a budget. Travel like the locals. Get an idea/map of the different piers the express boat visits (make sure it's the express because there are many other boats, and make sure the one you get on is facing in the right direction) and just hop on and off. A one-way ride (to any destination, however far) costs 14baht as of May 2016 (that's 28p in GBP!) and you can travel for miles. I am so glad my hotel was close to the river (Khao San area) and that I discovered this service. Just be quick when hopping on and off because they don't hang about, and then they zig-zag from one side of the river to the other.Seriously folks, look into this as a brilliant alternative to Taxis and those (best to avoid completely) tuk tuks.

Only travel if you want to rough it out the local way.. We took the public boat ride from the Orient stop to the Grand Palace. The locals want to get money out of you so dont give you correct information on the Public boats. He was trying to push us to a seperate boat for THB 800. Luckily the public boat came in 10 min and the price for THB 12 only. Very crowded and no place to sit. But its was a good experience.

Great way to visit the Wat Pho, Wat Arun and Grand Palace!. Take the BTS to the Saphan Taksin stop if you want to take the water taxi to visit some of the main tourist attractions in Bangkok.You'll notice reviews telling you not to the the tourist (blue flag) boat which will cost you 40 THB/person/ride, but if memory serves me correctly, they also have an alternative day pass for 150 THB. In reality, this is not that pricey. The luxury of the BLUE tourist express boat is that there is an English recording telling you about the different attractions during your ride. However, wanting to feel more like one of the locals my husband and I opted for the ORANGE FLAG boat which was only 14 THB per person per ride. Ultimately, both boats lead to the same stops. If you want to visit the major tourist sites, then get off at the N8 Tha Tien stop where you will be right next to Wat Pho. The Grand Palace is within walking distance, so you won't need to board the express boat again to get there.Additionally, this stop/pier is also the one you want to use to take a ferry boat across the river to visit Wat Arun for 3 THB/person.That being said you really only need one roundtrip unless you intend to make other stops.
An Evening in Chao Praya. Dinner Cruise on Chao Praya was a mediocre one. The food on the boat is low in quality & it should be a one time affair only.

Take the orange boats!. Pay only bht14 per trip instead of bht40 on that tourist boat! If you plan to make only a few stops to visit the wats/temples, just take the local ferry (orange boats)The queues are at same place..normally with more ppl queuing as the tourist boats lets you thru a different lane..don't be swayed by blue uniformed guides guiding you to buy tourist tickets bht150 per day or bht40 per trip..just join the queue to take orange ferries.We used both and both as effective..but one is without explanation. You must know where to get off..see the maps!

Take the local boat, NOT TOURIST ONE. The blue flagged boat is the tourist boat and costs 40baht while the orange flagged boat only costs 14baht. The latter is simply the best way to get up and down the river in the massive city. We travelled all the way from one end to the other and is absolutely worth the money.

Alternative way to see the city.. Having been to Bangkok at least 20 times, it was a pleasure to see the city from the boat. Gives you a real alternative view of the city. Very chilled and peaceful, away from the craziness that is Bangkok.

on a hot day it's a nice variety to spend 1 day on the river. leaving the bts or taxi on sathorn pier and buy a ticket for just 150,-thb, with this you can drive up the river, there are 13 stations where you can leave, make a walk around or enjoy your lunch, the jump in the next boat and go on, the most interesting places for me on the trip are the grand palace, wat pho and china town, but you can see a lot more - try and enjoy

Cheap & effective! . I dont think there could be an easier way see the sights in Bangkok. The express boat was such a cheap and easy way to make your way up the river- especially with the breeze!! My one recommendation would be to get the single ticket at 40bht rather than the unlimited stop offs at 150bht as we found that you end up taking a different route back after doing what you were wanting to do.
go on it for a whiz experiance. Great sights to see travelling on the boat don't expect a luxury cabin cruiser but well worth the ride going again in a few days time

Relaxing river transportation/trip with great views of Bangkok.. The Express Boat is an easy way to make several stops in Bangkok as a tourist. As well, it is a relaxing ride. Make it one of your stops in Bangkok.

Not the best part of our trip to Bangkok!. Traveling by boat on the Chao Phraya is always challenging because it's not easy to get on the boat from the piers which are several feet above the boats (no gang plank). The day we took this boat there was a small fire in the engine so we had to wait in the heat for another boat to pick us up. Unavoidable but unpleasant nevertheless.

AMAZING RIDE. Not a just a an easy mode of transport to get to most attractions but also a really beautiful boat ride up and down the river. 14 Bhat takes you all the way to the end . What a gorgeous ride!
Fabulous Transportation.. you looking for cheap, fast and good view to travel many place in bangkok?better take Chao Praya Express !

Best way to see sights in Bangkok. Simply start your day with the route map of the Express Boat route and plan what are you going to see.. I decided to take the North route ( there is a south route also, but North more popular amongst the tourist.. I was staying at nearby Silom, you may take the BTS and get down at Saphan Taksin in Silom line..Below is the Central Pier.. Stand in the que and get into a ferry.. Ticket is sold in the boat itself...Piers are on the both side of the river... There is an announcement of the same of the pier in the boat.. fare is only THB10 to THB15 , depending on distance... purchase a ticket , get down , see the place , come back , take another ferry...make sure you take the return ferry by 7 pm , else please enquire about the last ferry... Most importantly , you will feel like a Bangkokian , while travelling by the ferry,...excellent experience..

Take the orange boat. There are a few different lines. We recommend the orange express line. It is only 14THB per trip. Don't bother with the tourist boat (blue) - its 40THB per trip and only covers half the distance. Orange is the way to go. We took the ferry each way to the end of the route and were able to see a lot of Bangkok landmarks together with a random collection of houses and saw a bit of how the locals live. All the way to the North (station 30) we recommend to get out and have a walk along the market street (cheapest everything we have found in Bangkok) and an excellent cheap bakery on the left hand side. Some stops along the way they have catfish feeding which is an unexpected sight to see (stop 30 and 15, maybe others too).
See sight and learn Bangkok History. Chao Phraya Express Boat has a good service, I can see the enrichment city beside the river and listen the tour guide to learn the historic.

Great Service. Used the express boat at Saphin Taskin (outside bts train station). 40 baht each way , Takes you down river towards grand palace , wat poo etc . I used it twice to get to khoa san road . Pleasant journey .

Cheapest , Fastest and Best way to travel in Bangkok. Awesome !!! There are Boats that Travel Regularly. Beautiful Sightseeing via Boat, Completely skips traffic and a Awesome Experience. Best part its Cheapest to travel and Fastest.Must Ride when in Bangkok.
The quickest way around. Our friend offered to take us around Bangkok and becuase of the traffic he said the easiest way would be using BTS and then the boat . It's fast and cheap means of transport.

best way to see bangkok. this is one of the best ways to see the city in a different way. no traffic jam and a cool breeze. costs only 15 thai baht and you can go all the way. tourist boat is more expensive but not necessary to take that.
Easy to use.... This is the only way to go! We use the boat & BTS every time we visit Bangkok. It is easy to use, cheap & a great way to see life along the river.

Good means of transport. Good fast means of transport to reach city centre . Best means to travel if want to commute to the temples - WatPho & Grand palace. Natural A/C in hot bangkok. Trip costs 15 THB fixed.

Beware of high charges only for tourists-ALWAYS BARGAIN!. Overall you can enjoy many sights in just an hour getting on this boat but sometimes the guide on boat is unable to explain about or describe those sights.

The BEST way to get around Bangkok. It's not a cheap ferry ride (Bht40.00 for a ticket/Bht150.00 for a day pass) compared to local standards but it's worth it for the service, convenience and charm. I started at the Saphan Taksin Station next to the Shangri-La Hotel, and used it to visit Khao San Road, the Wat Pho, Chinatown, and River City. The sights along the river are worth the ride in itself. Make sure to look for the light blue flag and attendants in light blue shirts at the stations (they are excellent when it comes to advice). Just make sure to get on and off quickly; the station stops are FAST. I recommend this for people who have limited time in BKK.

one of the best things i did in bangkok!. LOVED it! it was really nice to sit on a boat with the locals and plan my own trip for the day, and hopping on and off the different stops. Only 14 to 15 baht per ride, really cheap way to get around! plus it's nice to have the breeze when the weather's so hot:)There's no need to take the tourist boat, which costs 40baht one way. The orange flag local boats go to all the locations as well! Have fun:) Tip: If you're coming bk to central pier at night after 5pm, just queue for the free boat to asiatique, saves you time on your travels:)

You should only pay 3 baht! Yes ONLY 3 baht.. The local express boat is at Ta Tien Pier. Don't be fooled by the other boats as they charge up to 400 baht! Take the road to Ta Tien pier all the way to the end. Turn right and head up the stairs past the street food. A lady in a small glass "box" will ask for 3 baht. Pay and pass her to the boat. The ride is less than 2 minutes.

Can be experienced once. The express boat covers a good number of tourist attractions. It is novel to go from one place to other in a boat instead taking a bus/mrt. For this reason, we need to give it a go. I planned to go to Grand palace in this express boat. I stayed at Sukhmvit, so I had to take MRT then switch to BTS and then take Express boat and walk. Overall it took much longer time and money compared to taking a metered taxi :-) But the experience was different. It was 40 Baht one way. Just browse about the route before you attempt as sometimes the staff speak little English and it might be tiring to resort to sign language..

Refreshing on a hot day!. Loved this boat tour. We hired our own private boat for just a little bit more. It was well worth it. The tempature was super hot this day and humid so this was such a refreshing thing to do and the sights along the river really give you a feel of the way of life and how people live. Highly recommend!

Get on board quickly! :). We tried all the possible means of transport in Thailand.Express boat is quite nice, you can view the city from a different perspective. It is used by locals as a bus.Quite cheap and fast, although it takes a while to understand how the lines work, where they stop and how much they cost. We missed our first one as we were thinking 5 seconds too long, while the boat moored to the pier. The staff is doing everything so quickly and moves on so fast, you need to be fast and furious to get on-board. ;)

Perfect for fast journeys through the city. If you need to get from A to B there is no better choice in Bangkok than taking a river or canal boat as otherwise you will just hit traffic. Hop on and enjoy the breeze.By the way: The different lines and directions are shown by flags on the boat - red line, green line, orange line and so on.Also you don't need a ticket in advance. Get on the boat and pay the (very small) fee to the ferry men.

Easy access to Grand palace. Boat service is very good service on the bangkok main river (king river). Easily available, however they first prefer for the blue flag line which cost more than the regular orange flag boat would recommend to peoples who don't mind walking

Great way to see the sights on the river and best way to get to the Grand Place and Wat Arun.. There are two boats. The tourist boat pre-paid(more expensive) ticket and the local orange flag boat cost 20 Baht per journey payable on the boat - I always use this one

More expansive rail would be a better option. Using the express boat is actually quite necessary to get to a lot of places conveniently, integrating with the Sathorn BTS station. I would personally prefer the subway system to cover more area - BTS maybe although some areas would suffer. You couldn't run a skytrain over top of Khao San Rd for example. Or could you?
Nice way to get around Bangkok. Good way to transport yourself and at the same time get some nice views of the city and some temples.

Cheap Fun Trip. Great way to see the heart of Bangkok from the river. Local boat costs about 50 cents and a fun experience riding past tug boats, traveling with the locals and seeing many of Bangkok's major tourist sites from the water. A definite must do.

Excellent way to Visit Wat Arun, Wat Pho and Grand Palace and a Number of other Destinations. The BTS Skytrain is great to get around Bangkok. However, the major issue is the haphazard way in which things have been developed. Single Pass should be usable across BTS, MRT, BRT, RailLink and Ferries. If that were possible it would be a delightful experience. You needs 1, 5 and 10 THB coins to buy machines from Vending machines. If...
Nice for Chao Praya site seeing.. A kind of fun taking the boat along Choapraya river and you can also go to many famous tourist area : Grand Palace, many beautiful temple.

Travel like a local. this is the proper way for people to feel how to travel like a travelthere are different kinds of boats operated by chao praya river express, each with different flags and with different pricingthere are 4 different coloured flag which u can check at their websiteits not worth to get the unlimited daily pass which is 150baht now which previously is just 120bahtsingle trip is still the same 40bahti gave 4 star because i feel cheatedafter i purchased the unlimited pass at sathorn pier, we all got on a boat which doesn't have announcement whatsoeveronly on the other boat trip, i notice we didn't board a tourist boat on the beginning which mean this pass can be used on every kind of boat the chao praya express boat offerssince the maximum fare they can charge one way trip is 40 baht which is for the tourist boat(others are cheaper), i'd recommend ppl to pay per trip to whichever place they wanna go, its more economical this way

A trip through the heart of Bangkok. Visitors please do take a express boat ride on the Chao Phraya river which divides Bangkok city. During the boat ride you can see the diversity and rich cultural heritage of Bangkok as you wil pass many Buddhist temples as well as the Grand Palace. The boat ride also takes you to the floating market which is a must for shoppers of artifacts and offers a range of fresh fruits. The trip duration is half a day. There are boat cruises at night offering a package with dinner to see the night skyline of vibrant Bangkok city also.
Good way to see life along the river.. I went up and down the river a couple of times - always a good, efficient service. The commentary was useful and sometimes amusing.
relaxing trip. nice to have a relaxing journey on the river. A must for photoraphers who want to get good shots especially during sunset

Great way to travel.. For those looking to escape the heat of the Bangkok day, the river taxis offer naturally cool river to some to the most popular tourist (must see ) site in Bangkok. They 500 Baht all day tickets but the best value is purchasing one way tickets at 20 baht. Most hotel have maps of the stops and the colors of the boats and their schedule.

Don't trust the price!. Okay so the trip was not bad but what did put me off is the price haggling,they started with 2000 Bahts per person and when started walking away it ended up at 1300 and when I was in the boat I found out the other couple paid 1000 baht??? It got me very angry and it simply unfair! No matter how much I tried to explain to the tour leader that this is wrong they simply became deaf!! So the trip is nice but dangerous of course because of the long tail boats, they are not safe!!

Fantastic and inexpensive way to see the river. The Express Boat is used by locals and tourists alike, which is always a good sign. You can buy tickets (all less than 50 baht) from the pier or on the ferry. While there are different ferries with different routes, there is good information at the pier and on the boats. They don't linger at any stop, though, so be prepared to jump off quickly!
Fast travel. Going on a boat on Chao River is not only a impressive experiance its also a very quick way to travel in Bangkok and to avoid traffic.

Boating in Bangkok. One of the many ways to explore Bangkok and to avoid the bustling traffic jams of the city. No queue and they have a lot of boats available to hop on. Just prepare your baht and satang.

Explore Bangkok on the water. Perfect means of transport- many stops close to points of interest, a fresh breeze. If you like being on the water- use the ferries! Also connecting to BTS (eg at Central Station/ Silom)Unfortunately they stop working early afternoon...

easy to use. A great way to see Bangkok from the water and not expensive.It is easy to find the stops along the river as most maps have it marked on them,it is alos a nice way to see the whole of the river for a very low price.I liked it as you could look at all the main temples etc from the water,it is also cool and the staff are fun. A must for all to do
when in Bangkok, use the River boats, great experience......... Traffic in Bangkok is a nightmare, so suggest you use the river boats always, there fast (very fast), certainly cheap.......

Great experience to see the river. It's was a great experience to see Chao Phraya River without paying too much.Just take stop at Saphan Thaksin BTS for the boat pier and pay only 28 baht for an hour boat ride.The boat will have many stop in case you want to drop off. At the last station, you can buy some food to feed fishes in the river as photo shown.You will be surprise such lots of fishes in the river!
Cheapest sightseeing tour. Take a tour from Saphan Taksin pier to the Maharat pier.You can chosse to sometimes get off the boat to make some visit and take the boat again.
Simple, inexpensive and safe way to experience Chao Phraya. Finding the routes can be a little challenging for the new visitor to Bkk. Else, it is good for backpacking travel.
8 Nights in Bangkok and More Nights in the Future. Another great way to travel around Bangkok to avoid traffic. It is better to have coins so you can easily pay the attendant in the boat.

You can take the boat from the Central pier and get idly lost on a pier hopping day. The boat officials are very friendly and this is an ideal option to simply loose yourself into the bustling activities on the river and keep watching the either side of the river and just hop around wherever you feel like.The piers on the right side of the Chao Praya river are dotted by Chinese eateries which you can never miss.A sure shot activity which no one should miss.
Fun way to travel. Boats are used like buses, the river is a great way to see BangkokExpress boat is very good to get from a-b
Travel like a local. Cheap way of getting across the river, is very busy at rush hour, but a great experience. Just be quick getting on and off

Enjoy sight seeing with a very cheap price!. It's a great way to experience the local thai daily life's style. You will enjoy the view a long the Jao Praya river and there are many attraction place on the way that you can stop by with a very cheap price.

Fun River Crossing. You could say the Express Boat from the market/dock to the west of Wat Pho is fun, adventurous, exciting or a number of other adjectives, but the simple fact is this is the only way you are getting across the river. I could not find a single taxi driver to take me via street roads. Everyone wanted to drop me off at the market/pier, which was fine.Cost of 3 THB is almost laughable, but I guess they have to charge something. Unless you time your arrival and departure just right, you will wait 15 - 20 minutes on either side of the river. So the name Express Boat is a bit misleading, but it was an experience.
Free trip to Asiatique. My friend and I spent the evening at Asiatique. In order to get there you have to take a boat trip there. There is a free boat ride from 4 pm onwards. We had a fun experience.
Chao Phraya Express Boat. A bit pricey for tourists. However, the staff are good and instructions are clear non-Thai speakers to get off at their destinations.

It was fun!. It is a great, inexpensive way to explore lots of places along the river. On our way back we rode over the wrong boat but people helped us and they didnt charge us. It was a rainy evening and river was not calm.
A highly recommended. A great way to travel in Bangkok and see the views. You get opportunity to mix with the locals and experience a Thai way of traveling. Very cheap.

Nice view of Bangkok. To take the express boat as a day tour is quite entertaining.
You just have to get ride till the end stop and back at a very cheap rate.

Fun way to explore the Chao Phraya river. We bought an all day pass. $150 baht per person, you can hop on and off any of the ferries, including the slightly more modern tourist ferry. It is a great, inexpensive way to explore lots of places along the river. You are given a map with your ticket showing where to get off for all the popular attractions. You must be quick and line up at the back of the ferry when your stop is nearby. It is a bit daunting at first but becomes fun when you get the hang of it. We rode all the way to the end of the line for a bit of respite from the hustle and bustle. It was really interesting seeing parts of the river we had not ventured to before.
40 bath. 40 bath from saphan thaksin to grand palace its faster and cheaper than bus or taxythe view was great

Bestest cheap fun in Bangkok!!. Go to any of the public river piers and pay 350 Baht each for a day pass with unlimited travel on the river taxis/express boats. We travelled as far as we could upriver then returned via a stop off at Ta Tien pier for Wat Pho. On a hot day it was wonderful but make sure you get a seat on the shady side. You will get a little wet but hey its 38Degrees!!!
fast!. Get to the other side quickly and cheaply! runs all day and not a long wait as the crossing is not a long crossing. its of local people use it and school children.

Great mode of transportation to tourist sites in Bangkok. This is a great mode of transportation in Bangkok. We took the riverboats everywhere from the Thaksin pier. It goes to all of the tourist sites. Some of the boat operators offer tours. You can expect to pay around 1000-2000+ Bhat for a tour. Also, they only take cash. And yes you can haggle with them for the price. Don't pay the first asking price.

Best way to the tempel area. If you travel from Saphan Thaksin pier to Tha Tien pier you are literally at the doorstep to What Pho and the reclining Buddha, en route there you will pass by Wat Arun and see a glimpse of the river ife in Bangkok-and all this for only 14 baht!
Summer Holidays. Nice experience to have for people who have not enjoyed water transport. reasonable fares to travel distances and one can buy the tickets on the Boat

We did it. Interesting transportation.. We took the Express Boat one time to the Grand Palace and to see the Reclining Buddha. It was not near our hotel so we had to cab and walk to get to it. May have used it more if it were more convenient. You must pay attention to where you are going. They make an announcement quickly and you must move to the rear of the boat and be ready when it "bumps" onto the dock. Seriously it is stopped on some tires hung on a dock and as soon as movement seems to slow, it is out of there again. Pay attention. It was crowded and hard to hear the announcer. We enjoyed doing it once.

Excellent way to travel round Bangkok. Our hotel was next to Pier N13 so we used the boats all the time. Good service from early in the morning until early evening. Tickets cost 14 bahts. Maps are available on their website. Great fun and you see all the riverside sights.

A River Ride Experience Worth the Money. Travelling to the palace or the temples the CP Express Boat service takes you there at ease. Plus if you have an all day valid pass, you can take a relaxing ride till the last station and come back to the first all relaxing with the ride.

Speedy river travel,. We frequently caught this boat outside our hotel( Royal Orchid Sheraton). It is a cheap, frequent service. A great way to get about. The boats tend to be crowded and you have to jump on and off smartly as they don't stop long! They call out the stopping places, which the other boats often do not.

Cheap and fun way to travel, unless you get on the wrong boat.. This fleet of boats plies up and down the river, stopping at piers and taking on and dropping off passengers, just like a bus. They have several different lines of boats running, all distinguished by colored flags. It can be inexpensive to travel on: from the BTS station at Central pier to Tah Tien pier (Wat Pho) is 14 baht on the right boat. Inexpensive, that is, unless you get ripped off. This company will gladly rip you off for the mistake of asking them simple questions, like, "is this the right boat?" Or "how do I buy a ticket to such and such pier?" If you don't know and have to ask, you're a tourist and will get raked over the coals like oneInformation at central pier is deliberately scarce, and seemingly designed to get tourists onto a Blue flag "tourist boat" which costs 40 baht instead of 14, the only differences being that the tourist boat makes fewer stops at piers, and has an English-speaking announcer with a microphone pointing out tourist attractions along the river. It can get confusing with flag colors and the service charts for the boats and which ones stop where, but if you ask anyone working there, you will be directed, not to the cheapest way up the river, but directly to the 40 baht boat. They will print you a ticket that says "40 baht, blue flag boat." It might as well say "sucker" I suggest you take an orange flag boat, as they seem to stop at every pier. This is the real commuter boat, and is the one that will take you for a fraction of the blue flag boat's fare. What you do is just jump on the boat (make sure it's going your way) and pay the attendant when he comes around later. The 26 baht difference may not be much, but it will buy you a cold drink, or a snack, at your destination.Either boat offers an interesting look at the river life of Bangkok, and would be worth doing even at 40 baht. I just get the feeling that they take heavy advantage of confused and lost tourists here in a way that's kind of deliberately unfair, or else I would rate them higher.
Good ride. Nice way to see Bangkok by river. Go north on the river to see small houses and life outside the busy city.
one of those happy memories. this is one of those places where even years later I'm so happy I went there. Good food and good friends made this an attraction to remember

Best way to see the river. The express boat (orange flag) is the best albeit slow way to explore the river. The longest trip that you can take lasts about one hour but it covres the whole Bangkok part of the river for a meagre 30 baht.

Go local, take the orange flag boat instead of the blue flag boat for tourist. The orange flag boat stops at every station all the way to stop no. 30, Nonthabury, all for the same price of 14 Baht. This option is good if you know exactly where you are going, and if you can cope with a crowd. Many locals use the orange flag boat to commute and during rush hour the boats can be really overcrowded. Ideally chose a time to travel other than the usual rush hours.The blue flag boat for tourists is mostly not as crowded, and takes you less than halfway up to stop no. 13 for the cost of 40 Baht. A local tourist guide will point out some sites and buildings of interest in few and often difficult to understand words via a noisy loudspeaker. Either way, a trip with any of the Chaopraya Express Boats is a worthwhile experience, and a preferred means of getting to places along the river without being stuck in traffic jams.Important: I always sit on the aisle seats to avoid an occasional spray of river water, and like most locals, on the shady side of the boat, Enjoy!

The best means of transport in Bangkok. The Express boats sail between a fair amount of piers along the Chao Praya river. They tend to get overcrowded during rush hour. It is a nice and cheap experience and they never get stuck in traffic jams.

Great way to avoid the traffic.. One of the best ways to get around certain areas of Bangkok and as such it is always a mixture of genuine locals getting to and from work/markets and the more adventurous tourist. Some find the boats a little old or over-crowded at peak times but i love using them to get around especially to some of the temples.Really cheap and you can get a day pass as well, often use it to get to the flower market. Recommended

Total trap. Super expensive (800 bht) if compared to the boat locals use in the same river to move (14~20).The boat cruise is a trap. Everybody wants to push you this, but it's definitely not worth.We paid for a long tail boat and they have put us in a crowdy common boat in the end. Ridiculous.

Excellent service and very cheap. For getting around Bangkok the two best things you can do are use the express boat and the skytrain. The latter is relatively expensive but you can travel very quickly on the boat for just a few baht. It's worth going along for the ride just to see a different side of the city.Don't either buy a day pass, you would need to make at least ten long journeys to make it worth while or buy a pass for the tourist boat that stops at many of the same piers, use the boat the Thais use, it's cheaper and far more fun.
Excellent View. We start when the Chao Phraya River pier for few Pix. Excellent views and peacefull surroundings. They have multiple cruises for 2 hours.
It's a lot like a circus ride with no disclaimer. You may get wet! You will get a nice view of the city great way to get around it's fast fun and no an everyday ride!

Maybe the best thing to do in BKK. Just sitting there riding up and down the river was perhaps our favorite thing to do in the city. A tip: don't worry about the flags or the prices - just get on and go. I think I was only charged twice out of all the times I rode, and it was about 50 cents.
amazing. you travel across chao praya river to visit a lot of places like temples , chinatown, mall etc! try it!

An authentic view from the river. We took the orange flagged express boat which was full of a mixture of tourists and locals. Very full in fact but they load and unload very efficiently. It's a great way to experience the river and to get to the many attractions en route.
Be ready to JUMP!. Most fun activity in Bangkok. But you have to hang on tight and be ready to jump when it arrives at the dock. Very cheap. Very crowded. Very local.

Chao Phraya Boat Ride. The Express Boat is popular, however, the boats u see that are larger and take locals to and from work and about every day are the most seeked boats on the river and are less expensive. Always sit either in the front or the midddle...NOT THE REAR closer to the motor.

It's an experience!. Bangkok is not the easiest city to get around by public transport, so this river service which stops at various piers along the main central stretch within the city is rather handy.The boats are old bangers and they do get very crowded, with many people standing. I assume it is legal and safe. But for the 40 Baht flat fare (with day rover tickets available) it is a value for money way to see the many city attractions adjacent to the river.The staff could do with some customer service skills, particularly as they bark at people to make room to cram more people on the boat. Still sometimes, cats do have to be herded.
Not to be missed: this is Bangkok!. Such a pleasure to sail on the Chao Praya, pay tribute to the Wat Arun or visit the temples , all this for ten for twenty bahts. Go!

Fun and different way to see certain parts of the city. I really enjoyed riding the express boats, it was hassle free and you only pay upto 15 Baht, which you pay once you are on the boat (seated or standing). Also, if you need to cross the river, there is a cross river boat for 3 baht at the stops needed.I really enjoyed travelling this way and would do it again.
Great way to see the city. Very affordable and pleasant way to travel and explore this fascinating city.I always use it to get about and enjoy the experience
Great afternoon ride!. We hopped on this near the what po and then traveled to central location. The price is right and it was easy to use. You see the city from a new perspective.

Easy way to visit most important items along the river.. Easy way to visit several touristic items along the river. 150 bath for one day pass. Ther are 9 stops along the river.You can visit : Wat Arun, Wat Pho, Royal Palace, China town etc.

Great way to see some of the Main attractions along the Chao Phraya. These "Long Boat" tours along the river are inexpensive(negotiable), and lets you see many main attractions in Bangkok.I would recommend this tour to all "first timers" to BKK !!
Cheapest and best option. Take orange flag for 14 THB/person and roam around. All major attractions like Grand Palace, Wat Pho, Wat Arun and Chinatown etc. are connected.

These boats are dangerous. In many ways these boats are actually quite good. Despite being more expensive than the regular boats they are very much less crowded and to my mind worth paying the extra THB25 for, but I have given them the lowest rating because they are potentially dangerous with the drivers more intent on keeping to a schedule than providing a safe service. We had two incidents in two days. On the first my wife and I were leaving the boat, and after I stepped ashore the boat started totake off just as my wife began to step ashore. On the second we were waiting on the pontoon waiting for the boat, but as soon as all the passengers exited, the boat took off before we could step aboard leaving us stranded and waiting another 30 minutes for the next boat.These boats are a good way of getting to the major tourist sites along the river, but they need to make major improvements in terms of health and safety.
Inexpensive way to travel. The express boats can be very crowded, especially between Central Pier and N9 (for the Grand Palace) but they are a great way to travel and see some of the sights

Cheap and efficient. If you're staying near the river then the express boat is an ideal way to get around the main sights of the city, the boats depart regularly in both directions from over a dozen piers spread along the river and placed near to main roads or attractions. the tickets are cheap and you can get a day pass which makes hopping on and off even easier. Its vastly preferable to trying to walk in 34 degree heat or, worse still, endure Bangkok traffic!
brilliant form of transport to visit tourist attractions. Cheap single or return journey. Good value day ticket available hop on hop off. Great way to see Bangkok from river.

Buy a day pass and wander around all the sites near the river. This is such a wonderful way to explore Bangkok! If you are near a sky train(BTS) station you can take it right to the express boat station.

Long boats chaos prays river. Take sun lotion with you .You will be whisked at speed down the Klongs ,which is what the Thais call it . There are plenty of places to stop of at shops along the river to buy souvenirs . There you will see how the Thai people live on the river .If you like reptiles you can stop at the snake farm .There is also other places where you can visit long the way . Check with boat man , it ,s awhile since I did this trip.

A blast to ride!. Riding this boat was like riding the NYC subway only on water and with a lot more natural light. Jumping on and catching it to the old city was a blast and catching it back down was a nice reprieve from the slow traffic that Bangkok is notorious for. I highly recommend making use of it.

An interesting way to travel in Bangkok. The Express Boat is a convenient way to visit the temples and other attractions along the Chao Phraya river. It is a good bargain, and travelling along the river offers views of a great variety of riverine commerce and daily life. Getting on and off is relatively safe, but important to pay attention. It helps to know where you want to disembark.

Take the boat!. Our favorite means of transportation while in Bangkok, and a great opportunity to rub shoulders with the locals. Don't expect any luxury, these boats are loud and the seats are not exactly comfortable, but they are fast, super cheap and a lot of fun to ride. We used them to go north to Chinatown and the temples, and south to Asiatique. Nice view of the city, and it felt so good to get away from the traffic and enjoy the (seemingly) fresher air on the water.
Frightening. Very scary experience, be careful getting on and off boats. Health and Safety does not exist, you are herded along like cattle

Great way to get around and sightsee. Found this by accident when exploring. Was staying near Thewes Pier and used it to get to Grand Palace, Chinatown and Wat Arun. Fare is only 10-20 baht. Keep receipt in case they ask you to pay again. Need to be quick getting on and off. But not dangerous. Usually only saw locals using it and the occasional savvy tourist. Don't bother with the tourist boat. It covers the same length of river as the express boat. Was also standing room only when I took it. But the ride is fast so you aren't standing long.

great and cheap way to get around. never getting bored with the river express boat, fast and great way to get around. Lots of stops so always getting around. Even when you are not going somewhere you can enjoy a trip on the river boat!
Excellent way of transport. Excellent way of transport to see all the important sights of Bangkok. Cheap and fast. Sometimes a bit crowded.

Cheap and Easy way to get around. costs about 30baht if I remember correctly which is less than £1. We used it to get to Wat Pho and China Town from the BTS. It offers nice views along the way and is a cheap and easy way to get to the sights on the other side of the river. Just be careful and cound the stops they don't call them out so keep count and eyes peeled

A great way to get around. The river taxis are a fantastic way to explore the areas around the city, and get a feel for the day to day life of a commuter in Bangkok.There are plenty of stations to stop at and if you get the 1-day pass which will cost you 150 baht, you just jump on and off as you feel like it. If you get on the BTS Silom line jump off at Saphan Taksin and walk towards the river where you will find a river taxi pier. It's a great place to start as you will see a lot from here and you can jump off for The Grant Palace or Wat Pho.

Use them to go to Grand palace. Took it to go to Grand Palace after changing once from the BTS nearby. The boat are huge and have announcer telling about the attractions nearby as they pass through each stop. They tell you where to get down to reach a particular attraction and the English is pretty good.

Perfect way to move around, Orange Flag boat. It's an adventure to hop on/off at the docks that serve downtown attractions and if you stay in the back you can catch a breeze to cool down and take pictures. Yes, yes it's exceptionally crowded but what isn't in Bangkok. No point in taking the blue boat unless you need that kind of hand-holding. It costs so much less than the blue boat and stops more places. Print a good map off of the internet before you go!

Not only good for sightseeing. A good, fast and cheap public transportation for every destination for example Chinatown, Wat Phra Kaeo and as a nice Sightseeing Tour along the river.Don´t take the expensive tourist boat. Be very careful when you go on and leave the boat.

Fast and cheap!. Very fast docking, getting on and leaving. Not to be confused with the tourist boat which is more expensive. This is the local transportation on the river and very cheap. Having coins available helps. During peak times standing room only.

チャオプラヤー ツーリスト ボート 値上げで40バーツに. またまたチャオプラヤー ツーリスト ボートの運賃が値上げされた。2016年3月1日時点で40バーツだ。タイの友人によるとしばらく前かららしい。数年前に20バーツだったことと比べると倍になってしまった。運賃回収を二人のスタッフでしている場合、支払い後にもう１人のスタッフから運賃を求められることがある。運賃の券は薄く小さくて、すぐどこかにやってしまうが、降りるまでしっかり持っておこう。ただボートは以前に比べて、座席数も増え、座り安くなった気がする。揺れは相変わらず以前のまま。CHAO PHRAYA TOURIST BOAT raised the fare again. It's 40 Barts in correct as of 1 March 2016. According to Thai friend, it's done a long time ago. It used to be only 20 Barts several years ago. Now price is 2 times!In the case that two staffs collect the fare, another staff might ask you to pay again after you have paid. We need to show the receipt to make sure. The receipt is very very small and thin, but we make an effort not to lose it until getting off the boat.

Better jump fast!. This is a great way to get to places along the river. Not sure but it seems like they have changed a few of the stops. There are many tourist spots that are quite easy to get to along the river. I went to the Siriraj Medical Museum. It is quite easy from there to take the boat to get back into the middle of town.

Lots of ferries !. I previously posted about the ferries on the River review ( as if we could actually rate the river aside from "big" & lots of crazzzeee fish ) ,And I'm not sure which boat they mean as 'express' but after reviewing the basics , I went with the Orange flag boats .They run All week ( some run only weekdays ) & it went farther than the more costly tourist boat ( Blue flag ) .These are much easier to board than the Khlong / canal boats .I've even seen people dragging large & small luggage on the orange flag !Personally , I would Not take more than a carry on size bag on the ferry .With my luck , one of the waves would bump the boat while I was boarding & my luggage would end up floating down the river .
good time. don t miss it you can find the dinghy at many placesWe were at the thai market and at the end we find it

Cheated in ticket box , NOT enough life belts. The system, of who get into which boat, is not to see trough, the boat suddenly took a lot of passengers from an other boat on, so we were way to overloaded, not enough life belts, an old man stole my child's!!!, and the strange stoned or Sick guy in the ticket boot at tre river city cheated .The onely good thing to say, was we reached our destination.

Pictoresque and effective. Before going on the boat, you ask yourself a lot of questions.... do not worry, go on the boat: the stops are clearly indicated, the ticket is done on board (13Bht), if in doubt ask, somebody will understand and answer. Be prepared for crowded situation in rish hours.
Nice cool boat ride. Amazing experience to ride & experience the river. The structures on both sides of the river are just fabulous.
A must do. If you're new to BKK and have not taken this form of transportation you must do it - best on weekends but fun anytime.

Excellent way to get around. We used this boat many times when in Bangkok to get around the sights. it was cheap and convenient, although you did feel like they were herding as many cows onto the boat as possible. lots of people were standing but when you had a seat with a view it was very nice. Very quick to get around as well. Look out for the boats with the different flag colours as they determine the stops they go to.
Crowded but effective. The staff is very helpful about schedules and ticket purchases. Very convenient to get to and from attractions and hotels.

Express Boat: No. Why rush a great trip? From Stop #1 to stop #30 only takes about 1 hour with all the sights and sounds of the river along the way. (Orange Flag Boat). For 13 Baht ($0.37) enjoy the trip. Get off the boat wherever on the return trip. Palace (Stop #9) or Wat Pho (Stop #8)

Best way to see the city at a leisurely pace. Cheap and easy way to get along the riverside and visit the old parts of the city and temples. We paid 15Thb for approximately 45 minutes down from Saphin Taksin pier to Nonthaburi. Great value for money.

A cool experience. This is not for the the people that's fan of taxis. But if you want to experience how the locals' traveling, this is the way. Even though I don't know a word thai and I've never been in Thailand before, I managed to understand the whole thing and travelled with it many times. I enjoyed the experience. And damn it was cheap! I gasped at the price!

Fresh air. Reliable and cheap way to see an different view from the river to the city. Easy to access for example by BTS station Saphan Taksin, cost 20 bht/person one-way ticket. We sailed from Saphan Taksin to Wat Soi Thong and then tooked a taxi to BTS Mo Chit. An different side of big city has seen.

Just do it!. Want to get upstream or downstream quickly? Want to feel a breeze in your hair? Just jump on the Chao Phraya Expess boat, even for a couple of stops, to experience it. It's all happening on the river - little shuttle boats from the fancy hotels depositing guests on the other side of the river, local transport across the river, commercial barges underway. Go and see it!
cheap way to travel. Excellent service, well signed so you know where you are going. A day pass is good value - cheaper that taxi or tut tut.
Very good for travel in Bangkok. It's a unique and amazing experience for travellers to explore different places in Bangkok to avoid traffic jams.

What fun!. We took the express ferry (cost of 13 baht!) from the area of the National Museum and National Theater to Saphon Taksin. It was really fun getting on this crowded colorful boat to get from one end of the city to the other on the river. Just be careful not to be caught by all the people trying to sell you longboat rides instead. Look for the orange flagged boat!

screaming and yelling, shouting and impolite behaviour! TO AVOID. There are many shuttle boats along the Chao Phraya but the orange flagged (cheap) vessels are a disgrace for this sort of transport. Staff is simply rude, uneducated, ans shouting all the time. The organization of this mass transport urgently needs a total overhaul, if not, abolishment. Unsafe and a clear invitation for a serious deadly accident. Where this staff has got its education and training is unknown but so far a disgrace for the tourism!

Cheap and efficient way to travel. An interesting and cheap way to travel along the river, avoiding all the traffic jam. It gets quite busy at certain times but it works well. One of the person on board gave information along the way.

Exciting way to get around Bangkok. This is the best way to see some parts of Bangkok. Cheap and Fast way to get to Chinatown, Little India and the Backpacker areas. I would recommend just riding it to the end for a relaxing ride to see the outskirts of Bangkok.

Chai Phraya Express boat.. Plying the spectcular Chao Phraya river flowing though Bangkok, the express riverboats are perhaps the best way to see the city from the water, have a meal and experience the pulse and rhythm of river.

you have to do this once in your lifetime. A nice, sheep way to explore a part of the Chao Phraya river is to go by boat. More than 30 piers help you to get on the river.
For a few Bath you can stay more than one hour on a boat on this river.

Best way of transport!. Take THE " orange flag boats" its THE same route als THE Blue flag Boat for Tourist but much cheaper!
Easy way of transport to THE city without trafic jam!
Be careful. It is a good experience. Just that try not to stand beside the river, because we got splash from the river and got whole body wet.

Fast Way to Avoid Traffic Queues. We were I admit glad to have our guide with us negotiating the tickets and platforms as it was all a little hectic and confusing. This was the speedy way and cheap to ensure we arrive early for our visit to the Grand palace. We didn't by the river pass as we were only making one, one way trip The boats are regular and even if the queue looks long, dont panic as you will be amazed how many people will step onto each boat. Be prepared to stand unless you are prepared to wait at the front for the next boat and even then theres still no guarantee. So hang on and enjoy the ride, bonus to stand by a window as the breeze is lovely and the views superb.

One of several ferry companies.. Do a bit of research first and decide where you want to go. There are 5 riverboat lines, each one covering different routes, different sides of the river, and different times. Select which boat line you need, wait on the pier and pay either on the boat or before you board. Very cheap way to travel and easy to use once you get the hang of it!.

Take the orange flag boat, NOT the tourist boat!. Don't let yourself diverted to the tourist boat (blue flag), which costs three times the price than e.g. the orange flag boat. The orange flag boat has a much longer route, going all the way up North. Depending on the direction (up or down the river) the entire trip takes more than an hour and costs only 13 Bhat. On Friday noon, I easily found a seat while later in the afternoon it got a bit more crowded with many people having to stand.

Great cheap way to see bangkok. This is a great way to see Bangkok. I would recommend you buy a day ticket ( quite cheap) and pop on and off as you like. There is a great breeze on the boats even on the hottest days.

A no-brainer. Have you seen the Bangkok traffic? Who wouldn't prefer a quick cruise on the river (for roughly 30 cents) to sitting in a taxi or a tuk-tuk (or worse, behind a tuk-tuk) for an hour?If you have time, just ride to the end of the line for an interesting look at local life, too.
A bit hairy getting on and off it. It was an interesting trip up the river to see the Grand Palace. The boat was quite crowded and I felt nervous getting off it! You had to be quite quick.

Convenient and interesting. A great way to travel in Bangkok as you can also do a bit of sightseeing. It is just a bit difficult to determine which boat you should go on, but other than that excellent!

From Saphan Thaksin to Nonthaburi. For taxi service, this is a good deal faster than road taxi if you are traveling from Saphan Thaksin area to Nonthaburi, as the locals all know. But it can get wet, and on rare occasions, the yahoo cowboy conductors can be reckless, leaving the pier as someone is ascending/ descending. Certainly worth the experience if you are a tourist!

Wonderful Trip!. I took a BTS train to the Saphan Taksin BTS station on Sunday, 2/14/2016. I was in the line 40 minutes for a 13 baht and 90-passenger Chao Phraya Express Boat at the central pier. The 40 baht, 150-passenger, nice, large, and tourist boats ran more often. Most tourists went on the tourist boat. The 13-baht boat travel time to Tha Chang was about 20 minutes. It was a great way to see the Chao Phraya River and travel to the Grand Palace. There were nice hotels and shopping centers along the river.

Another way to get around. I highly recommend that everyone who visits Bangkok does at least one trip on an Chao Praya Express Boat, it's such a great way of getting from south to north (or vice versa). There are actually two main services and I'll try and explain the differences.The Orange flag boat uses the smaller of the vessels, has one aisle, is cheaper (B13), is more frequent, is used by most locals and is always full or nearly so.The Blue flag (or Tourist boat) uses the larger type vessel , has two aisles, an announcer explaining the sights (and the pier names), is more expensive (B40), is less frequent (every 30 mins), used mostly by tourists and you can often get a seat.I usually use the Blue flag for trips from Sahan Taksin (Central Pier) to Phra Athrit for access to Khao San Road area, it's a long trip to stand up all the way. I don't advise getting the river pass (B150) unless you intend to visit lots of different places in one day.Please note that the piers can be confusing if you're not used to them, you need to know which direction you want to go and which boat you want to get on. English or Thai is really needed if you want to ask anyone a question, also the turn round times (especially for the orange flag boats) is surprisingly fast.

Cheap and efficient. With each trip on the orange-flagged boats costing only 17 baht, it's a very cheap way to explore the sights close to the river in Bangkok. The boats run frequently and if you avoid peak times, it's generally not too crowded. I wouldn't bother about the 150 baht all-day tourist boats as I've done these in the past and never hopped on and off often enough to justify the cost. It's so much cheaper to travel with the local express boats, especially if you have to buy tickets for a family. The express boats stop at the same stops as the tourist boats, and you can use your GPS or online maps to find out where you need to get off. You can often see the sights - such as the Grand Palace - from the boat, so you know where to alight.
Great way to travel. A great way to travel in Bangkok, the boats run up and down the river, letting passengers off at strategic sightseeing venues. Good for people watching. The piers are fun too!

You can see Bangkok without taking a boat on the river”. Honestly, don't waste your money on this, and if you wish to realy do it but a short ticket for $10 bart, Don't bother with the day pass. As unless you want to hop on and off more than 15 times the are fleecing your money. Every destination along the river is a tourist trap.The boat advertises that they have English speaking guides. However there "english" is so poor that they might as well be speaking thai, Because it is guaranteed that you will not be able to understand them.

Ferry Boats on the river. These express boats are a boon for all....locals and tourists. It takes you alond both banks of the river and its a cheap way to get to your destination. The boats are neither clean nor luxorious...but they certainly do their job. You can reach China town within minutes and The Palaces are worth the ride. Every pier has some food available...better stuff if you walk a little further.

Great alternative to cars and trains. We took the Express Boat from the pier nearest to China town up the river to The Grand Palace and Wat Pho. There are various types of boat you can read about online but most tourists end up on the tourist boat. I couldn't see any other way to take a boat other than this anyway. Especially if you don't speak Thai. The ticket table was clearly marked, the staff spoke English and were very helpful. Once the boat arrived, they escort you to it and help you on board. The boat has an announcer giving some information about things as you pass them but it's barely comprehensible. Just listen out for the pier that you want to get off at.On the way onto the pier there was some young chap who tried to tell us the boat was too busy, the Wat will be too busy now, it's not worth going etc. I am fairly sure he was leading up to offering to take up somewhere but I didn't give him the chance. You get some good views from the boat and see Bangkok in a different light. It can be nice having the wind in your hair too, rather than the BTS aircon.
Frequent boats but very crowded. They can handle a lot of people and we didn't have to wait long for a boat, but they fill them to the max and we had to stand as there were not enough seats.

Excellent way to see Bangkok palace and temples. If you want to have a cool breeze with excellent view of Bangkok palaces and temples, this is an ideal way. Chao Phraya Express boat offers variety of services - ranging from tourist boats to low priced no flag boats. My personal suggestion is to take the orange flagged ones (cost just THB15 for the whole trip of nearly an hour) from Oriental Pier (near Mandarin hotel - not well marked, need to check with locals the way) which terminates at Nondabauri. After Tier N8, you can see Wat Arun on the left, Temple of Reclining Buddha on the right and at the next pier,the Grand Palace.

Train and Boat. By using the Skytrain and the Express boat we were able to go from Sukhumvit Soi11 to Khoa San Road and spent the day sightseeing, then later on doing it in reverse. Great way to get around the city and avoid the traffic congestion.
Easy to move thr river up and down. We purchased one day ticket and it was worth to spend. We did not need to wait to buy another ticket. It was easy ride to get where-ever we wanted.

The Exclusive Experience in Siam. There are many cruise companies for express boat and I chose the one recommended by the hotel staff. The trip is about 2 hours and with buffet dinner. There's ladyboy show with singing and dancing and you might really think they are much more sexy than your wife, haha.
Great way to see sights. The boats run up and down the river, letting passengers off at strategic sightseeing venues. A great way to see some of the most important temples.

Helps navigate the river. The docks are called out along the route. Makes it easy to get off in the right place. Stops like the Flower Market, Chinatown and the Grand Palace are called out in enough time to exit at your stop.

Good value way to see the river.. A trip on the tourist or express boat on the Chao Prayer river is a must do in Bangkok. Get on at the main terminal and the staff will tell you which flag to look for. Blue flag is the tourist boat with enthusiastic if almost unintelligible commentary. We went up and back on the late afternoon boat and they took us for free down to the riverside night market.

You can't see Bangkok without taking a boat on the river. We got a great view of Bangkok from a new perspective, and even saw a fish feeding area. This is one of the must dos so try not to miss. There are many style of boats so you have a choice, and also many different routs so should fit all budgets.
Great View. Great view from the tower. You can get by boat and climb the steep stairs to the top and you get to a wonderfull place to take pictures from above
Evening in Bangkok!. Boat Cruise and dinner a great way to spend the evening! Takes about three hours on the whole, but time well spent!
cheap and fun. The best way to get around the city - taker the boat for next too nothing cost wise and see the main sights off the city

Classic Way to be around in BKK. It is a nice way to commute around Bangkok using Chao phraya Express Boat. It is cheap and fun but well you need to spend a bit of time as I am sure you need to connect it with other kinds of transportation.
It is a perfect way to commute on an easy day in Bangkok
Fantastic tour. The cheapest way to see Bangkok from the river; 13 baht for almost 2 hours of fun, good scenery, interaction with people, but you have to be quick when you board !

One of the easiest ways to move around the city. Forget tuk-tuks and taxis. Get yourself over to the river (easy from most of the main tourist destinations) and take the Express. It's very inexpensive and moves you through town when town is at a dead stop. It's the way the locals travel.

Pile Aboard and Avoid Traffic. The Public ferry boat is a good choice for getting up to the Grand Palace. Be forewarned if you travel by tuk-tuk that you get dropped off at the ferry dock, not a private long tail dock where they ask $15-20 USD to take you on a tour. Skytrain has an easy transfer point to the ferry. Best if you can acquire or bring a map of the stops so you are prepared. The cost is less than a dollar and be prepared to swim through hoards of people getting on and off depending on the time of day. It is quite doable and satisfying experience to travel by river.

Best transport around. Cheap way to get around Bangkok. And the best. Fast, coolest spot in town with the breeze up. Most rides only 13 baht, maybe equal to .33 USD! I think you can get an all day pass, very cheap.  Usually you just board the boat pointing in the direction you wish to ride. They collect on the boat. The stop only briefly, so get on quickly as soon as it docks. It will be off again before you know it! Ride to the end or get off along the way. Smaller crossing ferries are also used. Great for accessing grand palace, wat pho, wat arun, wang lang market, etc. One afternoon I just rode it all the way to the end, trying vatious markets along the way. Beats traffic everytime, and more scenic

Good and relaxing transportation with nice views. We stayed in the Shangri La and used the boat to go to the Grand Palace and the Wats. Nice views from the river and not expensive. Too bad it stops early (around 7 pm).

Know what you are paying for. We did the unlimited day trip for 150 baht. It is the best way to see the temples. For the budget traveller, there is a public boat for 14 baht that we took on the other days we travelled on the river. It is pretty much the exact same thing minus one stop.
quick way to get around. its a quick and handy way to get around.last boats are around 19:00 so keep that in mind.watch your step when u get on!

Crowed with many people standing.. The boat was large and had lots of seating, but was loaded beyond seating capacity with standees. The commentary was hard to hear and somewhat confusing. Be assured that cruise that starts at Tha Sathon (central pier) does terminate at Tha Chang the closest dock to the Grand Palace. The cost was 40 baht oneway, a very fair price.
Amazing place. Very beautiful cultural Thai Temper. Tourists can travel by cars or by boats. See amazing Thai temper. Recommend

Another choice for traveller. Even I'm Thai but it's not that often that I'll travel by boat.
I took the chaophraya express boat as a tourist. Experiences very good feeling with beautiful scenes and not hot at all (no air-con).
And it is fast. No traffic jam ^^
Cheap, Wonderful sightseeing. this is one of the must do activity when visiting bangkok. There are so many sight seeing and can only be seen by boat so a must try .
Bring your tennis shoes! Beautiful site. A must see in Bangkok! We had lunch across the water. It was a great backdrop for lunch! We went with Tours with Tong! Check them out!!

A great way to see Bangkok. Paid 140Baht for a day pass. It didn't stop at every pier but it did often enough to make every thing easily accessible. A boat came along every 30 minutes and very close to the time table.
The boat was comfortable and most times I could find a seat.
A great way to spend a day.

Sightseeing tour. We wanted to visit the most important monuments in Bangkok center without paying so many money in organised tours. So we took the Skytrain from our hotel to the central pier and with this boats we traveled across the river. We got out and on many times until we saw almost everything important and of course until we were exhausted. For 300 Bhat for both of us, is worth it!

Excellent way to travel. An experience you shouldn't miss and a very good way to see the city. The river is the life blood of BKK and its a convenient way to get from A to B without the trauma of the road traffic.Good to join the locals to going about their daily commute too.

Easiest way to get around to the sights. The express boat, also called the tourist ferry, is the best way to get around the sites near the river. From the Grand Palace to Asiatique is an easy and inexpensive trip. From midtown take the BTS to Sapan Taksin then get the Blue flag ferry to your destination.

SUPER cheap!. Super cheap (like $.20Au or something per person) and can take you right up the river. Also much more fun to travel by boat, nice and cruise and plenty of temples and sights to view along the way. A cheap way to sight see that takes you to top attraction areas :)

Nice experience. For me Bangkok is a very special place, and one of the reasons for this is Bangkok's means of transport. This one is pretty touristic even though sometimes it's very hard to buy a ticket if you don't know basic thai. Nevertheless, I adore this boats. Authentic and pretty, they have a special place in my heart. In fact, they are suitable for everyone starting from families with small children to lonely explorers, who will enjoy the view. I would definitely recommend it for everyone, but you should be prepared to get wet and happy :) Not for those who are scared of ruining their fancy look!

A great way to get around Bangkok. We used the express boat to get to Chinatown. For 13 baht each ( less than $1 Australian) you experience life alongside the locals. The 'conductors' are amazing when using their whistles to guide the drivers.

Best Way To Avoid Traffic Jams. This type of transport have good integration with other type of public transport at Bangkok. It is great to experience different type of public transport.The boat is just average, hence is worth the fares. The staff only speaks limited English so you better know when to jump in or out the boat. The river is not clean but at least there are no unpleasant smell from the river.There are different flags on the boat, the blue flags only stops at certain pier so it is faster to get to your destination and the fare is more expensive.But it is time saving if your destinations are near the river.

A cheap and convenience way to travel in Bangkok. The boat get you from one attraction to another along the Chao Phraya river without fighting with Bangkok traffic. It's fun and economical commute to both locals and tourists.

Choa Phraya Express Boats (don't take the blue line!). I like going by these express boats. There are the yellow, orange and blue line (look at the flags). The blue line is a touristic one. I would like to recommend a trip with with the orange line, not only the common trips to go to different temples, no...take the orange flaged boat to the terminus station. It'll take about 45 min. You will see nice bridges and find some nice scenes to take pictures from. Get off at terminus, buy some fish food...you will see why...there are a huge amount of fish. Feeding them will bring luck. Have fun :-)
Cheap and fast. You can get in many attraction points using the boat. Taking into consideration the hot weather and sun, a boat trip can cool you off a little bit

Great way to get around the city.. Cheap and an easy way to get around the city. Some of the previous reviews are confusing the cross-river ferries, tourist boats and dinner cruises with the express boats. The express boats take you quickly up and down the river, if you need to be on the other side there's usually a cross-river ferry available.

a great travel option; more about clarifying which boat is which. Some of these reviews aren't really talking about the Express boat, which should refer to one of four different lines along the river, the one with the orange flag. They all run along the same river, so different boats could get you different places, but this title could be misleading if a review describes something else. A short run-down:-the flag is on the boat is orange, and it makes most main pier stops, but not as many as some other boats, it skips some smaller piers. a sign at the pier will review where it stops, or if you have access to Google Maps that will say it too, it just might be clearer if you search "pier" to bring up the red dots.-the cost is 15 baht per trip, which you pay on the boat. one review here said there's an option for 150 baht per day pass but I'm not sure about that. since that's 10 trips it almost doesn't make sense anyway, no way to get on the boat that many times and do anything but ride it back and forth all day.-it can be crowded, the main complaint, it just depends on the time of day, or luck of the draw, really. I've been on the boat for a dozen trips or so and it's rarely so crowded that would be an issue, but I've seen it happen a couple times.-the "tourist boat" is the main alternative, apparently with the main difference that people speak English on that one, and are better about announcing stops, and it costs 40 baht instead of 15 for the same thing. the Express boat seems to run about every 15 minutes so it seems like timing isn't much of an issue; I'm not so sure about the tourist boat (or which color flag it has on it). -there are signs at every stop on the piers but the boats just stop and go again so you sort of need to know where you want to go. Google Maps makes it easy because you are looking at a map with you on it (the blue dot), or you could just do it the old fashioned way and know where you are going. the attendants are unlikely to speak English but stop names (piers) and main areas they would know.-the Asiatique free shuttle leaves from the Sathorn main pier, the Southern end of the route, so you need to go to there and queue up again if you want to go there.-the route officially shuts down at 7:30, but maybe better to not plan on using it after 7 since that's going to vary by when the last boat happens by.
Great Way to Travel. We used the Chao Express Boat whilst staying at the Chatrium Hotel in Bangkok and found it really easy to get around and to attractions.
Awfull. Crowded,dirty,staff are yelling on people who are trying to find some air. Humidity is unbearable. Better pay more for tourist boat.
Chao Phraya Express Boat. Was easy to find, tickets were reasonably priced. Waiting times were reasonably short. A lot quicker to get to some places then using some other form of transportation.
Great way to travel. A fast and easy way to travel on the Chao Praya. It is really unexpensive and the boats arrive often.
Fast and easy. Just go for it, it's fast and easy to use and cheap. Popular among locals and tourists. Explore the small water ways and jump wherever you local but try to keep update where you are.
you should have this trip. for about 80bath round trip, you can have a pretty good idea about what Bangkok is its river front part; try to get the trip around sunshine!

E-ticket ride across the river. We moved with the masses to board this water-taxi with a sea of other tourists. The boat is jam packed and you just hope it doesn't capsize during the 5min ride to the other side of the river.

Interesting Dinner. Having a dinner in the boat was very interesting, they took us around the chao praya river and the view was amazing. The food was good but somehow we have to "fight" it against other visitor since some of them are taking the food like there's no tomorrow.

The eastern venice in south east Asia. I've had an experience for using the express boat. it was a good experience and the price is very cheap. Nevertheless, it's not in a service at evening after 7 pm.
Good Service - reasonable price. This river is used as a waterway in the city. This is the tourist boat. There is also another set of boats used by the locals to move around within the city.

Good mode of inner Bangkok travel. An easy way, especially given its sky train link, to see many of the sights of Bangkok.
Day tickets are 150 baht on a hop on hop off basis and single trips 40 baht.

amazing Bankok boat feeling. Very nice way to see city around. Nice experience in river with fast motor boat, possibility to see city from another view point. Liked everything. Dislike - dirty water in Chao Praya river.

A good experience. It's very entertaining . Live shows are good. I was a bit disappointed with the food,I don't think it worth the price . The scenery was absolutely awesome . We sat on the dock while we ate, really breathtaking site . A good way to spend your night.

Not really worth it. Take a trip on the river. It is fascinating. It is also a go do way to get from one end of town to another. But the express boat costs 40 baht - or you can get a day ticket for 150 baht, hopping on and off as you please. But you can also get the public river boats for just 13 baht a journey and experience more of the life that locals do.

Travel like a local 40 baht for tourists. Take a ride with locals, monks, tourists and the like along the river. We went to the grand palace one morning and paid only 20 baht but rest of rip were charged 40 each trip. Not sure how it all works but a speedy fun way to navigate the city on th river!

Interesting travelling up the river. We used the Express boat a few times during our stay. I think they run about every 15 or 30 minutes, so you could have a long, hot wait if you miss one, as we did. But it's an interesting ride for 40 THB (80p Sterling), and gets you around quicker than a taxi or tuktuk if it goes where you want to.We decided we didn't need a day pass for 150 THB - there weren't that many trips we needed during daylight hours in one day.

Excellent way around to a limited set of places. The express boat is a great way to get around to some places you may want to visit as a tourist (Royal Palace, Chinatown, Khao San Road), but is far more popular with the locals for their daily commute. The boats are not as frequent as the skytrain and underground, but the wait is worth it.Don't expect a seat at peak hours, but you can expect fresh air on a hot day and some amazing views of Bangkok's riverside for a cheap price.

Very helpful!. If you want to visit the famous Wats without stressing yourself with some ugh! notorious Bangkok cab and tuktuk drivers, then you must try the boats at the Sathorn Pier. Minimally priced and you get the actual local allure of Bangkok!
