Express Boat Travel. Using the Chao Phraya is a great way to get through Bangkok very cheaply. It is a great way to see parts of the city that you would never see from the roadways. It can be very crowded during peak times as many locals use it to get to and from work. Pick your time and have a great experience. I suggest going all the way to Nontraburi. Here you can walk around and explore the local markets before heading back. A good way to spend a day in Bangkok.

Not good enough. Me and family go to the chao praya using this boat with blue flag.After we go to Wat pho temple of reclining Buddha.Very crowded and undisciplined.The food around the chao praya river is not good enough.They're selling fake prawns. Crispy rice with sauce hmm..

the best way to get around on the river ......... The traffic in Bangkok is not for the faint hearted and getting to your destination can take considerable time. The Skytrain has made travelling easier and the Express boats are fun to get to your destination by boat. The stops tend to be close to shopping centres, attractions, Skytrain stations. The boats get packed, jump on, a conductor will come to give you a ticket.

Economical and picturesque transport. For a few baht, the boat gives a pleasant river trip to Nonthaburi, just into the next province, and easy access to many of the famous and traditional tourist sites. The boats can get crowded so you get the best seats (instead of standing) by joining the boat at Saphan Taksin or beyond most of the tourist stops.
Chao Phraya Express. We used ti to the Grand Place it was packed and so was the grand Place at least two hours wait to get in

Good and cheap. Best and fastest way to get around in Bangkok (as long as the things you want to visit are near the river). You'll be mingling with locals and some adventures strangers like you. "Normal" tourist take the Chao Phraya Tourist Boat. But the express boat is much more fun. Just get ready at time before you want to leave the boat as the stops are very short and you must be ready in time to jump of the boat :)

Terrible experience agresive personal. Chao Praya Tourist boat hop on hop off day pass is a great way to see Bangkok’s river life & tourist attractions that is true and it is affordable too.There are different operators red flag and Blue flag (witch also appear on the boats).We used the Blue Flag operator and they were good but you are treated like cattle they should learn how to treat tourists. But never the less it was a great experience.On the 30th of December we bought a ticket for 150 Bath ea. (blue flag). We toured the whole afternoon visiting all the attractions.At 18h00 we returned to the Pier (China City or Asiatique Pier) as to be in time. They never pitched -up. We sat there until ±19h40.The Blue flag boat operator never pitched-apothem the Red flag boat came to pick us up.Now: We were tired, it is hot and missed other appointments. The boat were totally overloaded and 30% of tourist on the boat could not get a seet.Apart that it was overloaded they had no safety jackets for most of the tourists.They were angry because they had to pick-up "forgotten" tourist from there opposition company (blue flag).The man anchoring the boat at various piers shouted and screamed at tourists. The boat’s captain speed at a very high speed and we felt very uncomfortable and unsafe.I asked him for a safety jacket and he shouted at tourists again..I then said to him not to treat tourist in that manner it is very rude and we are not cattle. He shouted at me and threatened to hit me with the anchor rope. I told him that I will report him and if he threatened me again will end upon swimming in the Chao Praya river .He calmed down bur were very agressive.He then talked to other staff who then treated me like dirt. The tourist on the boat was very unhappy about his aggressive behaviour. Earlier I saw a Russian tourist arguing with the same company from our boat the previous day and now I understand his concern as well now it was also late and the boat were very overcrowded. Thai Tourism should look into this matter as I hear horrible stories about similar fairy tourist boats.
Fast and cheap. Fast and cheap way to get around. Easy access to many of the tourist sites. Many locals ride this. Often times it is pretty crowded and you have to stand up.

depends on point of view. Essentially, it is a boat that takes you more directly to and from certain piers located along the river. We took it several times on one day and it was full / standing room only each time. If you can get a seat with a view of the river, and can just sit and relax and watch things go by, it is fine. No matter where we got on or off, we had to stand the majority of the time, so it was hard to see without bending over, and each time the boat stopped, we had to press ourselves to the walls to allow 40 or 50 people to exit and enter via the narrow walk ways. It would be better I think if they limited the number of people to the number of seats. I saw some of the regular boat taxis going by and most of them were actually less packed than the Express Boat. There is an announcer letting you know what is coming up next, but the boat is very loud, so it was not always easy to hear what was being said. However, it does take you directly and clearly to within walking distance of many of the places you may wish you visit. And the buying of the ticket, loading, offloading etc. is easy. After you finish looking at the attraction, you just head back to the pier and wait for the next boat going your way. And, you just get on and off as you wish all day. And, some may find it an interesting experience. That said, having used the service once, I am not sure whether I would use it again or not. Next time, I think we might just take a taxi, or a combo of skytrain and taxi. There is the road traffic, but I think overall it might be simpler.
pwaceful way to travel. avoid the traffic and hope aboard the express boats to arrive refreshed. Just check which route you are after and check you are on the right one

Very convenient. We used the Chao Phraya Express Boat service to visit the Grand Palace and Wat Arun across it and it was quite convenient than using a taxi or tuktuk service.The ticket price is low which makes it very convenient plus there are boats one after another so time is saved too. However, boats near 7:00 pm might be super late as we had to wait for over 30 minutes one our way back, for the boat going to the Central pier from Tha Tien Pier.

Boat criuse to Ayuttahya. The pickup from my hotel was 6:30 am and the bus went along all over town picking up passengers for the crew and reached the docks at 8 am. Was finally in the boat at around 8:30 am. The cruise itself was good and there was a seat for vegetarians, but nothing much in the menu. The cruise went smoothly and is a memorable one and I would advise everyone to try it.

Local way to travel the river. Pier to Pier travel is cheap and good. Experience Local travel first hand. Good way to travel during non peak hours. 15 bhat point to point.Note the colored lines with boats flying the colored flag. (which pier boat stops at is based on color and hence is faster way to get to a specific pier )

Fascinating and cheap. Used the river boat to get around Bangkok, its great to watch the coming and going, no health and safety here, boat stops, one rope line, all on or off and then the boat goes again, cost the three of us 42 Baht (84p) to travel from end of Bangkok to the other, it is also a great way to see Bangkok as you travel along you see the 5 Star hotels surrounded by wooden shacks that look like they could fall into the river at any time, we loved it and would recommend anybody visiting Bangkok to try it and see some the real city.

Awesome. The tourist-only boat cost 40 baht slightly expensive than the regular one There's an English-speaking guide that will tell you about the various landmarks around the vicinity of the river as well as those attractions at each pier.Highly recommended. Although finding each pier can be a chore given Bangkok's city layout.
Unique experience. Liked the Bangkok river side view from this boat,temples & star hotels can be seen from the boat,enjoyed the water transportation.

Try it!. Great way to see Bangkok that you will not see from the main roads....obviously! But you will see and wonder how the heck the people live in such run down "houses" right on the river edge.A trip to the "other" side of Bangkok is well worth it. Get off at the pier by the Siriraj hospital and walk through the market and the area.It is a good way to get around and you have the skytrain at Taksin bridge.

A Nice experience. I combined the Express Boat with the sky train (BTS) to visit the Grand Palace and What Pho in Bangkok. I found it very convenient and cheap, though it sometimes gets very crowded, especially during rush hours.

Cheap and local. you can spend 40baht on the tourist boat or simply jump on the overcrowded but similar Chao Phraya Express. Good fun at 16baht and it takes you close to most attractions besides the big shopping malls

Could spend all day going up and down the river. The best way to get to the tourist hotspots without getting too hot. This boat is very efficient and is a great way to see locals going about their business too.
Yet Another Nice Attraction in Bangkok. On our ferry trip, we stopped here for a visit. Come early in the morning to beat the herds of visitors if you are visiting in the high season.
Fantastic way to get around. A must if you visit Bangkok. Go from Khao San Road to Silom. Connect to SkyTrain. Easy to get around.
A memorable cruise. We had an excellent express night cruise on the river Chao Phraya.The food served is quite tasty with lot of options. Excellent view of city central attractions.
Water bus on the river. Great way to travel fast from one destination to another on the riverbanks! Payment on board (cashier comes to you).

An interesting experience. After you alight at the BTS station and walk to the pier, if you look remotely like a tourist, you will be approached by guides selling you tickets for the tourist boat. We had wanted to take the local boat but couldn't find the correct pier so we had to settle for the tourist boat. It costs 40baht each way but you can also buy a whole day ticket at 120baht and hop on and off as you wish. I'd definitely try the whole day hop on hop off option the next round as there are lots of attractions that I'd like to stop by and visit. But as this was just a quickie sunset cruise that we were looking for, we bought the 1 way ticket. It's amazing to just cruise along the river and see the development to the shores. The old and the new. Definitely worth the trip.

Cheap efficient and overcrowded!. Start your journey at the main stop, although there are a couple before, but the Skytrain stop at Saphan Taksin is the most convenient to start your journey. Rush on and claim a seat if you don't relish standing. Get a map if you can. There are stops all along with the main tourist ones being close to Chinatown, The Grand Palace, Wat Arun. You may wish to plan your journey so you know which number stop to get off as the boat only stops momentarily so it is not recommended for the disabled or elderly people that are slow! There are different flags for different boats/destinations but as a tourist the only one you'll probably see will have an orange flag. The fare for any destination is 15 Baht (about 30p Stg) The longest journey takes about an hour. It is worthwhile going the distance as there is a big market at the terminal along with more river fish than you can shake a stick at! You can even buy stale bread there to make them even fatter! There is also a Tourist Boat that goes to the stop closest to the Kaosan Road area. I think it costs about 40Baht is less crowded, gives you longer to get on and off but has the most appalling commentary that depending on the guide is either basic or completely unintelligible! It gets VERY crowded at times, quite often MOST of the time, unless you are going to the route end. If someone falls overboard, it happens once in a while, take care because everyone will rush to the side that the victim has fallen from with no regard whether or not the craft will remain upright! I give it 'good' rather than 'excellent' because of those sort of factors. Knowing where you are going helps as no announcements are made on the Express boats, unlike the tourist boat. The boats run about every 20 minutes whilst the tourist boat runs less frequently. You need to be aware of what times these craft finish for the day. DO NOT miss this experience, even if you just go for the journey, but it's good to get to places that taxis will get stuck in traffic finding. It's basic, crowded, tatty and great fun! Don't miss it.

cheap and cheerful. get on with the locals 14 bahts each, get shouted at by the conductor to "move along the Bus"
great fun cheap transport see all the sights from the river.

Family Adventure. It's very efficient and reasonable price. It's quite frequent and convenient to quite a lot of popular site. It's well connected with skytrain. Except at the central pier where you pay at the booth, you pay on the boat if you board from most of the piers. It can get quite crowded at the piers and people may rush to get the boat without queuing probably. Not too good for people with disability.

Boat to Wat Arun. Travelled from Silom via BTS to saphan thaksin station then used chao phraya boat to Wat Arun which costs 40 baht to number 8 station then another small boat which will take you to the other side of the river where Wat Arun is, costs 2.5 baht.comfortable journey on both boats.

different boats - different prices - different timetables - different piers. There is the tourist (express) boat that only runs 9.30 a.m. to 4 p.m. and costs 150 Baht for the whole day, meaning you can hop on and off.There is the orange flag 'public' boat that is much cheaper, 14 Baht per trip, no matter how long. It runs 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. between Wat Rajsingkorn and Nonthaburi. It stops at every pier. Good for Wat Arun, Wat Pho and Banglamphu.

Slow but it gets you there. The boat is slow, but you get to enjoy the view of the river and the cities. We brought the whole day pass 150B, it is cheaper with the one day pass. The water route include Grand Palace, Wat Arun, Wat Pho, etc.

Cheapish way to see Bangkok by river. An all-day ticket on the Chao Phraya Express Boat costs 150 baht per person. We used it as a cheapish way to get a feel for Bangkok and stay cool on our first day. the company doesn't tell you, however, that it's also used as a ferry service by locals, so the boat we boarded went up-river to about pier 30 and then we came down again (on what seemed to be an express boat). This all took about two-and-half hours. We had no idea when or how the boat would turn around, so we just stayed on for the ride. The company gives you an excellent booklet/map but it stops at about pier 9, so we just stayed on for the ride and saw lots of riverside, suburban Bangkok, which was interesting, if unexplained (because it's really a ferry service which makes lots of money charging tourists much higher prices for a seemingly economical all-day ticket). At Pier 30 we all got off and five minutes later got on another boat that went down-river, stopping less frequently. It was an enjoyable, if slow, way to spend our first afternoon in Bangkok, and at least it didn't entail schlepping around interminable shopping malls and markets ...

Good transport. If you like to see various tourist attractions beside the water, take the public transport boatservice. Don t use tourist boats, they charge you high too much and not as pleasant. The boattrip is an attraction of itself. You can leave the boat at various stops.
Great. id use this everyday great to see the sights of the locals and let me tell you there,s plenty to see LOVE IT
unique experience of sighteeing. it is a simple boat. you pay amount of money and can get on and off in various piers. it is quite unique experience and tiring as well.

Makes it easy to get around. This makes it easy to get around and it allows you to see some of Bangkok from the river. However, they don't do a good job of letting you know what each stop is, so you have to pay close attention each time the boat stops.

Good transportation. Took the river express boat to the Grand Palace. Confusing at first because you are told to "stand over there". Where is over there??? The boat is not fancy at all. People run to get seats. It is a nice relaxing way to see sights and to figure out where you should tour next. It is super cheap. It was much easier going to the palace than returning. Returning was a major stop and you also are not given directions. Luckily found English speaking tourist who had taken it before and they gave directions. There were way to many crammed on this boat, we were shoulder to shoulder. I was grateful when my stop came. If you can deal with crowds, it is a nice way to see the river side of the city
Chao Phraya River. available many boats service for one hour and can see many budha temples and restaurants river sides

Great way to get around. On this boat you can get around all day for only 150 baht, you get a free booklet with info about each of the 8 stops. You get on and off where ever you want. Goes every half hour. Great street food everywhere along the way!
excellent river transport. An excellent river transport system like dream..just get down from the skytrain and take the boat from the pier ,
Convenient way to travel from Saphan Taksin to River City area. In a city clogged often with traffic, this way to travel is really fast and recommended. Timing is flexible - prepare to wait.
Easy to use for English speakers!. Staff speaks English. Friendly and eager to help tourists. Can see Wat Aran from water. Fun experience. Took it fromSaphran Taksin to Wat Pho
Great water taxi. Inexpensive way to travel the river with the locals. Various boats stop at various piers. Never ending action on the river to watch as you travel.

A bargain over tourist boats and beats traffic jams on city streets. Express boats offer frequent fast travel and are easy to use...and fun. We loved the river views of bridges, temples, high rise buildings, as well as other craft on the river.

Good transportation way, water scene route.. Cut out the traffic jam by travelling with boat. Just to remind, for your own safety, should walk inside and hold the bar. If you can read the pier name, just remember the Number. That's all. Try to stand next to the edge and enjoy the Chaopraya banks. Very beautiful.

best way to avoid traffic jam. the price is beyond reasonable and best way to reach main attractions such as wat arun- grand palace even khao san road (with 10 min. walking) avoid peak hours however it is not easy to find a seat in general.

Use this - not the tourist boat. The express boats are infinitely cheaper than the tourist boat. While the tourist boat does allow unlimited stops, the express boats typically cost about 15 baht per person. The express boats tend to be about as fast as the tourist boat. Only the orange express line runs on weekends during daylight hours, but my sister and I used to it to get around for a few cents. Weekday service runs later and is more complete. Look for the colour of the flag on the back of the boat to determine the route. Stations all contain maps. The only downside is that stops are generalliy not announced, so you do need a map. However, the ticket lady on our boat did loudly announce the Wat Po stop for the ubiquitous tourists on board.

Not for the faint of heart .... The express boats look like eels and travel and full-throttle all over the river. It is both exhilarating and just plain dangerous -- they obviously don't have an OSHA -- but it's fun! Be careful of the landings ... It's a poor country and they can't afford landings that provide smooth transit for fat American and European passengers.

Great cheap way to get around town!. Overall, this is the best way we found to travel around Bangkok. We found ourselves on a couple different boats one cost 14 baht and the other 40 baht, but you can also buy a one day pass for cheap! The ride was just like being on a tour boat as you pass many landmarks, which the staff pointed out to us! Easy way to get to most places including the Grand palace and it is right next to the Skytrain!
Great way to get around!. 150 baht for a day pass. 40 baht for a one-way ticket. Lots of interesting stops (piers) that lead to many other attractions. Must use!

Best way to get around Bangkok. This "tourist" ferry is much more expensive than the "public" ferries. By expensive I mean about $1.25 US one way or $4.20 to ride all day long. We always found a seat, unlike the cheaper ferries used by the locals. There is some narration but it can be hard to understand. Only wish would be that it stopped at more of the piers.

Amazing scenic way to move along the river in Bangkok,,,,!!!!. I just love these river boats to travel within inner Bangkok.....yes, it's crowded and a bit of a frenzy at times, but the river views and temple views are breathtaking and it is easy to get to all the riverside destinations, specially in the old city very quickly....plus U get to see the local life and changing light along the river ...it is truly beautiful and the boats, wow, it is incredibly cheap....it can be a bit confusing so do keep in mind the pier you are ongoing to and keep a eye on it, or better yet, count how many stops it will be.... piers are varied from crumbling to getting a bit more fancy and renovated...you can go to so many greet destinations, flower market, china town, grand palace, the various wats, Khao San and Banglampoo to name a few places...enjoy it.,,,!!! Sawasdeeka..

Exciting, crowded, could be dangerous, not for the faint of heart. The ride in itself is an experience. You will have to hustle to get on and off the boat. If you have mobility problems - this is NOT for you. Doing this ride during rush hour defeats the purpose of having an enjoyable boat ride. You will be looking at the armpit of the person next to you.After rush hour you just might be able to take some photos of the river scenery - the rickety houses built on stilts on the Chao Phraya river itself, the longtail boats trailing fantails of river water behind them as they speed along the river with semi-frightened tourists, the barges towed up and down the river carrying rice or aggregate for construction, the temples and bridges along the river.If I were to recommend a ride, I would take one from Taksin Bridge and get off at Tha Chang terminal just off the Temple of the Emerald Buddha - Grand Palace complex. The entrance to the Grand Palace will be just a couple of hundred meters away.Taking this ride on a rainy day is going to be a downer. Best time to take this ride is between November and February. It is going to be hot and humid. Expect to mix it up with lots of people - both local and tourists like yourself.This is a much better and perhaps infinitely cheaper way of taking a river ride on the Chao Phraya River. Please avoid touts who "offer" touristy river trips. Those are rip-offs to be avoided at ALL COST.
Chao Phraya River Express. Excellent for sightseeing and watching the delights of Bangkok slip by while cruising the river. Reasonably priced and an unforgettable experience - highly recommended !

Nr 1 travel method in Bangkok. I get excited every time I get to the Chao Phraya river because I am only moments away from boarding the river taxi which will take you to numerous piers up and down the river where you are able to visit some of the best sites in Bangkok City. The boats are generally overloaded but who cares this is Bangkok its all part of the fun. Shouting, whistles blowing, barging hustle and bustle all add to the river boat fun. Between each pier stop off there are sights to see on each side of the river plus all the different sized boats and barges going about their duties criss crossing as if there were no river rules to abide by. The ferry prices are cheap and you can buy a ticket from the central pier which allows you to ride the river all day long from dawn to dusk.Do not visit Bangkok and miss a Chao Phraya River Taxi ride there is nothing like it.

Crowded but great way to get around the city. With limited public transport options around the Khao San Rd area, I found the Express Boat a really good way to get around and connect to other parts of the city. Through the boat you can connect to the train line and then change to connect to the airport.

Tourist designated Chao Phraya Express Boat. A slightly manic trip on the tourist designated Chao Phraya Express Boat with great scenery, and this was areal experience rather than a timid relaxing trip along Thailands' most famous river.Very enthusiastic crew, especially the multilingual guide who organised us and all nationalities very efficiently.Getting on and off the craft would be a problem for anyone with a disability, as the boat literally stops for a minute at most of the nine stops. Fascinating journey though.
OK.... but. .... you can see the same things from the public ferries at a fraction on the cost. If you want more personal service and all, then invest in the express boat.

Cheap, Fast and Fun. As I mentioned in one of my other reviews, in my view the best way to explore and enjoy Chao Phraya River is by getting on one of the Express Boats and to spend a few hours on them going up and down the river, taking in some very interesting sites on the way.

Not my favorite transportation. These boats are usually over-crowded. the piers could use some improvement and can even be a bit dangerous. You have to hop a bit from the boat to the pier. Older people or those with leg problems might have a difficult time. The boats themselves are decent and its fun to cruise along the river. But this is more for transportation than sight-seeing. Seems like they are slowly improving some of the piers, so I may review again in the future.

Good to use at day time not in the evening. During day time it was fine to use this boat the guide was not always understandable but you can always ask someone else on the boat.You can pay for a single trip or a day pass.But we had a bad experience taking this boat in the evening when visiting china town.They were speeding much faster then during day time, and in such a rush when stopping in the harbor on the different stops. You almost had to jump off with quite a gap and the boat pounding on the harbor and then speeding towards the next stop.Also they charged much more then day time and i dont know if we got cheated by this guy but i think so and he gave us to little exchange back when paying for the overpriced ticket price.When we were waiting for the boat at the stop near china town they first told us there were not any more boats and suddenly they told us to come back and there would be a last boat and that speeding boat came.We will not use this boat service in the evening again.
Nice Journey!!. We took the boat and had a great view of Bangkok from the river. Myself and my friend very much enjoyed the ride.

Cheap and easy. We used the ferry more than once between Orient Pier and Flower Market/Chinatown.Each time when we arrived at the jetty the attendant told us "Coming in 25 to 30 minutes, but longtail boat available now". Each time, the ferry arrived in about 10 minutes.Apart from the cheap cost, a cool way to see parts of Bangkok.

The real feel of Bangkok. Do not take the many touristic boats that are always swarming at the jetty, but do take the Express, which is the regular public transportation via river. It is crowded, but fun!

Brilliant - nearly as cheap as the water taxi and much more comfortable!. Brilliant - nearly as cheap as the water taxi and much more comfortable! Goes to most of the main attractions or just ride the boat for fun!

Nice trip, guide ununderstandable. Yes it is a nice way to look at the river and also to go from A to B. But the guide speaking English, supposedly giving explanations about the buildings, the history, etc. Was ununderstandable!

Good way to travel!. When everything else stands still the boat always works. Sometimes it is a lot of people on them but it is always a way to get on.
Doesn`t go to late in the evening though - as I can understand the latest one goes from Saphan Taksin approximately 20.00 in the evening (on holidays I do not know at all?)

Nothing can beat the skyline !!!. If you are in Bangkok you gotta go on this. Take BTS skytrain and get down at Saphan Taksin sattion, exit no 2 leads you to government operated ferries. The best view of the skyline is in the evening .

Easy way t get along the river. Ridden many times, easy way to get form one place to the other song the river. If you the stop you want is on the route, definitely take the Tourist Express Boat instead.

We were lost then found salvation. After the reclining Buddha, we decided to walk toward the river where we found amongst all of the old buildings a new wharf type building, it had nice shops coffee shops and a KFC. Modern and clean. After we had eaten something we hopped on an express boat, easy to get your ticket cheap and ( NO TRAFFIC ) we found this was a great way to travel to different locations and at the central stop it meets the BTS Sky train. Convenient easy and you get to see Bangkok from the river which is most enjoyable.
Travel by Boat. Great cheap way to travel to destinations nearby the Choa Phraya River. It helps to have small baht coins or notes to pay the fare

Good way to avoid Bangkok traffic for major attractions. Used Chao Phraya express boat for visiting Wat Pho , Wat Arun etc. Took the boat from Saphan Taksin BTS (Sathorn Pier) to Tha Tien Pier. Very interesting and fast way to travel to these attractions. The boats also take you to other areas along the river (see website for route map)Please use the Orange flag boat.They will push you to take the tourist boat tickets but the orange flag boat is really good. Orange flag ticket costs 14 THB for any distance where as Tourist boat is 40 THB . Also, the frequency of Orange flag boat is higher (every 20 mins) than tourist boat (30 min) . You can purchase the tickets while on the boat.

Great Way to escape bad traffic and make a good connection in Old Town of BKK. For me, it's very convenient way to travel around Old Town of BKK and can get good connections to other places and other roads in Bangkok, especially in Old Town and those tourist-spots. The best way, please check the map or ask the map. There are different rate and routes, please check flag's colors (head of each boat): Orange, Yellow, Green or no flag. However, there is Chaopraya Tourist Boat or Blue flag (CTB) rate costs 40 Baht for one way. You can get at the pier or on boat. Route is between Phra Arthit pier and Sathorn pier and along this route, you will meet many main attraction of BKK, and can hop in, hop off, connect to other roads or even walk..around. I love the boat way so much... escape the bad traffic at Old town of BKK where there are many small roads network.

Fast and cheaper than the taxi!. Great way to cross the Chao Phraya river and it is much cheaper and quicker than using the taxi. Several express boat stops are available to use, depending which attraction you want to visit.

Very good way to see key spots in old Bangkok. Take a full day ticket for unlimited ride.. keeping hopping in and out for all important attractions like, grand palace, wat arun, reclining buddha and finally go to asiatic village for a nice evening..

birthday celebration. worth the longish wait at the docks for Sabai Cruise. Private rental for my sister's birthday celebration with music and party themes. Even though it rained throughout our 3 hour cruise we enjoyed the night-time ride along the river with all the amazing lit-up views of temples and bridges on the banks of the river. Highly recommended.

Overrated. I would say don't bother riding the tourist boat, while we aren't super interested in the attractions along the stations. Be prepared to have an alternative if it rains because most attractions have no shelter from the boat stations.

Great way to ride river. This is a great and cheap way to see the sites along the river.It is breezy and relaxing.It's fun to ride to the end of the line, there is a nice village with a really nice market daily. You can ride cyclos (a cart chair pulled by a bike).Stroll thru the market, foods and interesting goods to buy.
Great way to get around the city. What a great way to get from one end of the city to the other! Faster than a tuk-tuk, easy to jump on and jump off at any river stop, priced just right.

Nice view and food. Although it was raining at the beginning of the cruise, in the middle of the trip I could go out and enjoyed the view. Nice river side view, great dinner, and good song performer (although I expected I would watch dance performance).

A great day out. This is one of those "must do" things in Bangkok. For 150 baht you get a ticket which enables you to get on or off the boat at all of the stops it makes on the river which means that you can see many of the highlights of the city plus the pleasure of being on the river itself. And there's a boat every half hour which means you are able to plan your day. I do this every time I'm in Bangkok and always enjoy the experience regardless of the weather.If it's any help 150 baht is worth $6 Australian. Can't beat that for value.
very good. we visited temple along the route and well as the flower market and an elegant shopping mall where we had coffee.
Fun on the river!. Getting around Bangkok by boat was great! We visited Temples and saw the city in a whole new way! It was quite an adventure and easy to get to ! So much fun! Do it!

Good experience. It is amazing to see how they use the river as a means of transport. There are different types of boats-orange-blue etc. Take anyone, there is not much difference, the tickets are cheal. Hop on hop off option is available with full day ticket. You can feed fishes at some piers. Local vendors sell bread there. It is a good experience for kids.
Chao Phraya Express boat in Bangkok. The river boat is an excellent water taxi in Bangkok. You can go from one end of the city to the other cheaply and quicker than most local transportation.
Inexpensive way to navigate the waterways. Might be faster and more fun to take the long-tail boats if just sight seeing. Express boat is like a commuter boat with many stops, but very affordable

Best way to get around the city. Let's face it, the centre of bangkok is a huge traffic jam, these boats cost peanuts and are super efficient and give you a different perspective of the buildings of Bangkok

Cheap, efficient and fun. Great to get out in the river and have a new perspective of this great city.
The central pier at Sathorn connects conveniently to the BTS at Saphon Taksin.
I took the Orange flagged line which was cheaper than the 'tourist boat' to get to the same destinations.

Cheap option for riding the river. Riding the ferries can be a little confusing it this took all the drama our of it. We bought an all day 'pass' which was quite cheap and it became virtually a hop on hop off ride. The experience is really fun, we got wet a little bit, got roused on for being too slow by the ferry hand, met some nice people and saw some great parts of Bangkok. Some of the river cruises charge 10 times more then you pay on this so it is a very good option.
useful. cheap and useful way to commute and reach the other part of the city.. well managed too. ticket costs 14 baht only

Busy Chao Phraya. We caught the express boat from near the Royal Palace to the Pak Klong Market and Chinatown. We waited about 25 minutes for our boat, the boats are color coded, the orange boat, our boat stops at the stop nearest the market. Chinatown is also a short walk from the market. The ride was interesting and is a must, it only costs 10B and numerous stops have interesting things to see. We met a young Thai gal who spoke very good English, she did a student exchange in Canada, and she was delightful.

Economical and fun way to explore Bangkok. The Chao Praya Express Boat is a good alternative to visit few of the city's attractions by boat. Very economical and at the same time different experience from the hustle and bustle Bangkok has to offer. River is very dirty. The express water taxi comes with commentary of the attractions nearby.

Cheapest Tourist attraction I have enjoyed. One up from the local ferries, offering comfy seats and a talk by a 'volunteer' tour guide. Great way to explore Bangkok - ghet to Khao San road from Sathorn BTS in about 25min. relaxing cruis watching the sights as you pass - highly recommended way to travel

One of the best ways to travel in BK. Ideal for going up and down the river and for visiting the temples and palace situated along the banks of the river. Can get busy and you'll get to see monks travelling on them too.

Easy and inexpensive. The Express boats are the easiest, safest and least expensive way to travel on the river. Plenty of great sightseeing and points of interest along the way. Stop off at the flower markets any number of temples, the grand palace or ride to the end and enjoy a local market that rarely sees Europeans. A much better way to see the city than taking taxis.
Use it as much as possible. Even if you do not go express the river boat gets you all up and down the artery of the city. Cheap and fun

Still the best and fastest transport option but spoiled by tourist boats. Taking the boat on the Chao Praya still is a must see for visitors of Bangkok. Fresh air, great views and no traffic jams make this one of the best ways to get around if you happen to plan to go where the boats go or just want to try your luck. There are interchanges with the BTS and stops at major attractions like the Grand Palace. The only downside is that the piers are now also used for tourist boats in numbers by far superseding the normal express boats so finding the real boats and avoiding the ticket hustlers has become a bit of a challenge compared to the good old times. Also the flag system indicating which boat goes and stops where is rather complicated so I would advise patience and if you miss your stop, well, you are still in central Bangkok so a short walk or taxi ride will get you to a BTS station, your hotel or wherever you wanna go. Tip: avoid the rush hours when people go to work or back home from work. At that time it will be crowded and less comfortable.
Fast Travel Across Town. A way very mant Thais commute. Awesome fast cheap. As it proceeds quickly up or down river, it crosses back and forth. You GOT to try this!

Great day out. It's a great day out if you buy the all day ticket which allows you to hop on and hop off at a selected number of stops. 150 baht for all day travel in either direction. 40 baht for a single journey. This service, the blue line, has the highest complement of life savers per passenger. Worth considering.

Ridiculously crowded. Great way to get around metro Bangkok- but unsafe, smelly and unreliable- but cheap! Board at the main terminal at the end of the BTS- be prepared to wait i long lines- take the free shuttle to Asiatique instead,

Convenient and fun. One of the best way to avoid traffic in busting Bangkok is to travel by boat in Chao Phraya River. It is fast and fun to look at way of how people live along the river. Amazingly beautiful and relaxing with no sweat.
public boat mainly used by thai commuters. Great experience for only a few bhat. Jus hop on and enjoy the trip. Stay on till the end and get on the next boat back.

Very cheap way to see many attractions of Bangkok. First of all, you have to go by BTS (railway) to Satun station. This is beside one of the departure places. Then buy the ticket for Baht 150 (say € 3,90) and you may consider your ticket as a hop-on hop-off ticket. You can visit easily Wat Phra Keow and the Grand Palace, Wat Arun, Khao San Road, China Town, etc.
Great experience, rude staff. Very cheap way to get up and down the river with the locals. Staff are rude but they are like that for everyone! Can be queues at peak times.
Best way to go places. For instance going to Wat Pho. When very hot it is also a good way to cool down. Very inexpensive, and good foto ops.
Great way to see sights along the river. This boat is easy to find and convenient to many of Bangkok's major attractions. A flat-rate day ticket you can use freely.
Cheap and a wonderful, fun way to get around. Tickets are cheap, the routes are straight forward. Great views of Bangkok and you get a lovely and most welcomed breeze too.

River Freedom. If you want the rollicking, freedom feeling of breaking free of streets and vehicles, jump on this boat. The open air, sights, bobbing of the water, and excitement of what's around the next corner, take this very cheap priced form of local transport.

Quickest way to go to certain parts in Bangkok. There are different express boats (orange, green, yellow and no flag and the Chao Phraya Tourist Boat)
It’s really convenient, quick and cheap.

Awful staff. I've taken the River Express for decades. I'll give it 1 star due to recent poor treatment from the staff.Small female with a bull horn put it right in my ear and screamed at me in Thai. My wife is Thai and it seems she was yelling at me to move inward. But there was absolutely NO room to shove further in. My wife was shocked by this woman as well. Your mileage may vary. It's still an interesting way to travel out of Koh Ratnakosin (Grand Palace & Khao San Roda area) and into the Sky Train stop at Saphan Taksin.

Good way to see most of the attractions . For a 150 baht you get unlimited service for the day. It's the tourist boat that takes you to most of attraction. The tour guide on board will point out historical building & when to get off for most of the main tourist attractions. Just remember to head to the back of the boat when you want to get off. If you're planning to visit Wat Arun after visiting the Wat Pho (Temple of the Reclining Buddha) you have to take another boat pay 3 baht to get across the river is not part of the Chao Phraya Express boat.If you choose to go only one tourist attraction it's 40 baht each way. So I think it's a better deal paying 150 baht that way you can visit different tourist attractions. The boat runs every 30 minutes from Sathorn Pier from 9:30am to 4pm just check with the tour guide when the last boat is.The pier is located at the back of the BTS Saphan Taksin.
A great way to see the city with an alternative route. Cheap and an easy way to get around the city. Admire the buildings along the fiver. A great way to watch the world pass by...

EXPRESS IS THE OPERATIVE WORD. Express is sort of an understatement, there are a number of small V8 powered surfboards to found up the klongs used mainly be the locals to move rapidly around Bangkok waterways, with a 2" water clearance & speeds to as high as the driver thinks he can go before his passengers jump or fall out. The drivers think it's a huge joke to watch white knuckled foreigners, wet hair streaming out behind, unable to utter a word. There's never a day in Thailand where you can;t get a laugh.

Fun way to get around. This is an enjoyable way to get around to the main sites in Bangkok. Something different from getting into a boring air-conditioned taxi and enjoy the river breeze as the boat trundle alongs the river
great transportation. WE took the Orange express boat back from Wat Po.very crowded and never found anyone to pay!! they stop at often and it is a great way to see from the river..loved it..

More fun than the BTS.... We essentially used the orange flag boat at 14 Baht per voyage, our hotel was close to the Central Pier (Saphan Taksin), so the was very easy for us to use. We went to the Grand Palace, Wat Pho and China Town on different days using the boats. We got in the wrong way once and stayed to the end of the line, a low cost river tour ... hehe Time passes very fast, we would of also liked to try the tourist boat, but suddenly we were out of time and had to leave. Maybe next time.

Alternative travel. I like the express boat as it makes getting around this area of Bangkok easy. But be aware of your destination, I missed mine because I wasn't quick enough to get to back of boat, I was the only one departing and they didn't stop. A nice way to spend an hour.

Convent way to travel in BKK. Very convenient way to travel in BKK and visit some of the tourist places. Make sure to take the boats with the Orange flag, those are not specifically for tourists and are less expensive. You can pay for the ticket when on board.
Chao Praya. If want going to wat arun we have to crossing chao praya river, with this boat. its like crossing boat, and only take 5-10 minute for crossing the river

Interesting experience. very interesting experience for a person like me from a country without big river in the busy city center. Most of the piers are old and not very clean and busy but the network is really amazing!

A surprisingly efficient and entertaining way to travel around Bangkok.. We stumbled upon this express boat after touring Wat Pho and for only 3 dollars we were able to take the boat back to our hotel. The boat was clean, comfortable and safe. But it really is a hop on and hop off setup. They pull up to a dock and you have to be ready to get on and off. They are efficient and borderline impatient about being quick. We enjoyed it. And we got a free tour of the river. The driver even announced attractions along the way. It was a fun way to get from Point A to Point B.

Pay attention to the flag colors. Look at the maps at each pier. Stations are marked by colored flags (orange, blue, white). It can get confusing as to which boat you are paying for because the Tourist boat people are always soliciting you as are other private boats. Skip all of those and head to the boat directly since you pay, usually 15bht, on the boat. Don't let the official looking staff of other companies persuade you to get on their boat- unless that is what you want. The Tourist boat, for example, only goes to Station 13, so if you want to venture out further north, the express boat is the one to take. And the tourist boat is 150bht.

Average experience. The Santhorn Pier is close to BTS Saphan Taksin, so the service is easily accessible. But we made a mistake by buying the All-Day Boat Pass for 150 Baht. It appears that among all the piers, the tourist flow is only limited to Pier No.8 (Wat Pho or Reclining Buddha and Wat Arun) and Pier No.9 (Grand Palace). If you visit only these two piers and then come back to Saphan Taksin, you just buy individual tickets for each journey. It turns out that starting from Santhorn Pier is a good experience, but while coming back you don't get a seat due to overcrowding. Still, it is an economical option to visit most famous places of Bangkok on your own and hence quite popular among the tourists.

Best way to see the river and its banks or to go to some remote places. The express boats are a the best way to discover the Chao Phraya River and its banks. Taking any line from start to finish will only cost you a handful of Baht and the views are amazing. They are also great to reach places which are not accessible via BTS or MRT, such as Chinatown. They are fast (although the tourist boat is quieter) so hold on tight, keep an eye on your belongings at all times and make sure you know where to get (jump) off promptly.

Many piers, most economical. This is fastest way to travel to some attractions like Grand palace which is difficult to do by road because of traffic jams. They are quiet frequent. Ride also gives beautiful views of the city.

Cheap & Easy. We used the boat to visit the Grand Palace.It was cheap & easy to use. A great way to see the river. If you have the time it's worth buying the day ticket. You can use it unlimited and get on/off at any of the stops.

Quick and Easy Service. We used this to get around parts of the city, a great taxi service with a difference. Quick to get from point to point, out in the air and free to look at the views as you travel along. Very cheap too. Boarding and leaving are a bit precarious as the boat just pulls alongside the pier and you have to jump on/off, so need to be a bit nimble footed.

Fun ride on Chao Praya. The boat is driven by a hand held (on a wand) V* Chevy engine which provides lots of power. Big waves slap the side and wet you. Fun to bounce through the waves like jet ski haha

it was a good experience. I have traveled couple of times in last 1 year, this is slightly costlier than the normal boats. this is good for those tourist who are travelling for the first time. the officials explain about various piers and their significance throughout the journey, so the officials actually act as a guide to the tourist and assist them in visiting these areas.

Zippadidooda. What a brilliant way to experience life on Bangkok's Chao Prayha River.The red and cream coloured boats ply the river to the north and south extremities of The city's environs.They criss cross from bank to bank, stopping (barely) for passengers to get on and off. Every notable attraction and worthy site is visible as the boats speed along.The tiny prices charged is incredible value for money, the boat allowing you as it does to visit more places in a day than by any other means.Travel by this method is my number one recommendation.
Good experience. Express boat is cheap and efficient. Many colour flagged boats available. Go for yellow or tourist boats.
Ok type. We took his boat to visit Wat Arun Temple. It is nice , but the water of the river was dirty.You can find small shops around the harbour.

Boat trip is always on my Bangkok itiinerary. I always make sure I include a boat trip whenever I go to Bangkok. Several times I have been up to Nonthaburi, but I have also travelled to the terminus in the opposite direction. It's a great way to travel and yes there are still lots of people living along the river banks.

Good way to see a bit of Bangkok on the river.. A great way to travel up the river and see different sites and river life along the way, from people living on the river, to beautiful temples, old buildings and modern malls with coffee shops. Avoid the traffic and see things that can only be seen from the river in a relaxed manner. You can get a ticket for unlimited use for the day and stop at different piers along the way. There is a live commentary along the way and telling you which stops are coming up. The only problem with this was that the accent with our commentator was so strong it was very hard to understand and I am use to Asian accents. The only other complaint, which is minor, is that it stops too early in the evening. Highly recommended if you want to see the sites in the vicinity of the river.

Different views of the city. In my opinion it is great idea to discover Bangkok by boat.cooltour.I like y express boat because traffic is flow and less air pollution. Beside this, you can enjoy Bangkok attractive spot such as Temple of dawn. it is good experience to you should try once.

Connecting Sky Train with the river.. Best way to connect the BTS train with the Grand Palace etcThe river is filthy however the boat is efficient - if you have time, stop at every stop, there is something to do at each of them.We used it to visit the Grand Palace.

Great service. It was a great experience seeing the sights from the river, well recommended.
Its an easy way to get around Bangkok.

Must do for a great river boat ride and great Bangkok skyline views. Very affordable way to do a boat cruise and get nice views of the Bangkok evening/ night time skyline.
Also, a fast way to commute if you are going somewhere along the river.

See Bangkok attractive place at good price. I love travel by express boat because traffic is flow and less air pollution. Beside this, you can enjoy Bangkok attractive spot such as Temple of dawn, The Grand Palcace by the river also. If you are travelor who want to travel with tour guide, you can ask for information at Sathorn pier.
Different views of the city. Travelled up the river to The Grand Palace by river boat. These well used vessels are clean and you get the added value of guided commentary along the way.
you should try!!. well at least you should tried oncwhen you visit thailand...its a good experience to used this boat at river..for me??its new experience
Easy and Cheap. A easy cheap way to get around most of the major attractions in Bangkok only downside that it stops running around 1930 although that may have been the time of year

Enjoyment on River. I think it was an excellent idea to take the Express Boat to see other side of Bangkok. Pleasant breeze though with heavily packed with people of all walks of life. Foreigners and locals, both take the boat either to go to other side, or enjoy a boat ride, to go to different temples or hotels. Many people take it to avoid the rush hours on the street also. I enjoyed the beauty of both sides of rivers, the high rising posh buildings or shabby old houses, temples, people, markets, in day light and also at night time. The views are great. Certainly a worth try to feel the vibe of the country.

Comfortable. The express boats are the best way to go around in Bangkok. Rather take the boat than the taxi's through the Bangkok Traffic. Beautiful views, fast and comfortable. Only draw back would be they on´t sell any refreshments.

Well Worth Using. For all it's positives the sky train won't get you to main attractions of the flower market, reclining Buddha or Grand Palace. What is does do is offer you a way to get to Saphan Taksin station where a couple of flights of steps take you to the central pier and the 'express river boat' service. It is not geared up for tourists, do not end up on a tourist tour boat unless that is what you want, look for the bustling orange flagged 'buses' that speed up, tie up briefly while passengers jump on and off and then speed off again. On board the standard ticket is 14 baht for a single journey, sold by a conductor who works her way through the single cabin. Central pier is easy to spot as a destination, some of the others are not so easy but if you get the right pier all the central attractions will be a short walk from one of the ferry stops. The journey itself is a great way to see the heart of Bangkok. Once we cracked how to use it, we loved it.

Excellent mean to bypass rush hours traffic. The Chaopraya river is the life vein of Bangkok. Full off commuter and cargo boats it provides variety of transportation means. The express boats are actually river taxis. For 14 Baht you can go from Ko kret island in the north to Saphan Taksin bridge and connect with the sky train. The boats stop at Kaosan Rd, Pinklao bridge, Grand Palace, Yodpiman river walk/flower market, China town, and more. A trip that is an attraction of itself
Go Sail Bangkok. A must take. It is really cheap and especially if it is a shared ferry to cross the river, it costs only 3 bahts. You should use this to explore another side of Bangkok.
Excellent getaway from City Chaos inside City!!!. Nearly 2 hr Long tail Boat ride taken in Choa Phraya river. Excellent experience for village atmosphere and temples around!!!

Exotic Transport Tourist Must-Try. Boat transportation in our home country is rare. Therefore, we decided to take Chao Phraya Express Boat instead of MRT to get to Khao San Road-N13, Phra Arthit pier. And it only costs us THB14 per one way ticket. It is indeed a very relaxing yet exotic ferry ride!　Recommend to have a ride on late afternoon to avoid sunburn and can view sunset as well.
Taxi Boat. Taxi boat with a special route for tourists, for just 40 BHT you can see and stop at some of the major atraction of Bangkok

Great way to see Bangkok, by water. Great way to see Bangkok by way of water. Stops at major attraction such as the Grand Palace, Wat Pho, and Wat Arun. Also from Sathon Pier, where the express boat starts, you can take the complimentary shuttle boat to Asiatique Waterfront market, shopping complex, and amusement park.
Use it it's great. We used the boat a couple of times to visit sites based on the river and also china town it was very reasonable and punctual

Relaxing boat ride... Very inexpensive way to travel up and down the river, many stops along the way. A little chaotic at times, but a very fun activity. There is food located near by at many of the stops.
Good value. You can get on and off as many times as you like 150baht for all day pass. Bait us clean and comfortable and person tells you what is at each peer
Great way to kill a few hours. We had a great few hours riding on the boat from Central to Nonthaburi - 28 baht return each - BEST VALUE!

By far the fastest and cheapest transportation . The most important thing is not to be lured on a private longboat at the pier, but just to relax and wait for the next blue or orange flag boat that runs in the right direction. Let people alight, enter and wait for the conductor to come to you to buy your ticket. Often crowded and hectic, but fast and really cheap.

an excellent way to see Bangkok from the river. The orange flag express boat takes you right up to Nonthaburi (a journey which lasts an hour) for just a few baht. it is a great way to experience the hustle and bustle of this vibrant town from the river. If you aren't travelling to Nonthaburi and want to get off at a stop en route to explore, make sure you tell the ticket collector where you want to get off as the boat doesn't always stop at every stop. I think it's better value than booking an organised river trip which is more expensive

Fast and cheap. Find out your nearest pier and take it to go to Grand Palace, fastest way to getting there and also much cheaper compared to taking your own boat and even cheaper than the low seating tourist boats.
Full ride!. I rather take the Tourist boat... You get a seat that way and able to enjoy the ride.This boat is always jam packed. Stick your stomach in!

The best and unique travel experience in Bangkok. It's the best way to go to Grand Palace or Khaosan rd. The price is 45THB per trip(I'm not quite sure) It's a bit expensive than bus but I think it is worth to try.

Nice touristic trip but be aware of the Chao Phraya waters !!!. Funniest, fastest and cheapest way to get around touristic attractions in Bangkok. Beware of the Chao Phraya waters though, it contains so much Enterococcus faecalis bacteria per cubic milliliter you better avoid even touching or being touched (sprinkled) by it. The fumes expelled by old diesel & gas engine boats and are also obnoxious, a health hazard.
Cheap as chips!. I had such fun traveling up and down on this boat, it gets very crowed but is cheap as chips! Its a very easy way to travel and you get to see some fabulous sights!

The ultimate water taxi. The express boat is well worthwhile and we travelled many times to different destinations. Always a full house and multicultural. The majority of travellers were extremely courteous and polite and would give up their seat to older travellers irrespective of nationality. An exciting and inexpensive way to travel.
Best local way to explore Bangkok. The cheapest way to gain most local experience transport in Bangkok. It allows you to enjoy the view along both sides of the river. Never hesitate to hop on!

Quick way to get round Bangkok. It's an excellent way to get round Bangkok, it's also a lot quicker than by road. The tickets are relatively cheap and it's interesting to see all the different boats on the river.
:). this is along way from our hotel but the view is nice especially a night when nearing the asiatique marketits free so no hassle in getting the tickets

Good way to get up the river, but not a great trip. As an actual tour, this would be pretty disappointing. The boats are very crowded with people standing in the aisles even, so it can be pretty difficult to see anything well. But can be a good transportation option. We took the BTS Skytrain to the pier and took the boat up to the Grand Palace. Definitely more interesting to go that way than a taxi!

See the major Bangkok sights by river boat!. This is a great way to get around - however there are different rates / tariffs for locals and tourists. You buy a voucher for unlimited trips for the day and can get off to see the sights that you want at your own leisure - most major attractions are accessible from the river

Worth exploring. We got a reasonably priced all day ticket which meant we could explore all eight piers the service stopped at and their surrounding areas. The guide was funny and informative. The boat was easy to use and there was a regular service so we didn't have to wait too long on one coming.
Super Cheap And Convenient. This was a very quick and super cheap way to get around. It has drop offs close to major tourist attractions.
Go cool. A very quick and pleasant way to see something of the old way of going around Bangkok. and a cool breeze off the water as well.

Don't miss it. We visited Bangkok at Feb 2015 and took the Chao Phraya Express Boot trip along the river Mae Nam sight seeing. You can hop on hop off at 9 piers to tour around the river side view points like China Town, Great Palace etc.. Price was cheap and with the English speech guide to introduce the temples and place of interest
The flow: wow!. So lovely and free sensation to roam through the river admiring both sides, recognizing landmarks, or just flowing with the river and the city.
Like a carnival ride. For most westerners, boat rides on the river might make your hair stand up however, they never touch each other.
Experience the boat ride.. In Bangkok, Chao Phraya River is well utilized as a mode of transportation for people. I like the view of Wat Arun during sunset at Chao Phraya River.

short break in bangkok. Good for a short break, fantastic shopping and restaurants, generally value for money. check internet for best deals on hotels, good time to visit now as tourists numbers are down and the £ is up on the Baht, restaurants and bars offering deals on meals and drinks.
Quick transport for a group. One of the quickest transportation to go to one of the temple. Make sure that you negotiate with the agent to get cheaper price. Best if you are going in a group.
Fast and Good. Been there once and got robbed so this time too the expressed boat. Yes, it was little expensive, but it was fast and the easiest way to get to your destination.

Feels like a local! Love it. An interesting way of exploring the river, along with the locals. I was concern about the actual capacity of the boat as passengers keep boarding the boat... is there a limit? The second concern is that payment collection was not well managed... it makes me worry about the sustainability of this service... it is so cheap at 15bath.. and still not everyone is paying even if one really want to pay.
Interesting trip. Take the express boat up and down the river. Very nice trip (value for money). See the travelers on the boat and enjoy the views.
cheap and nice. love riding the boat. super cheap and convenient. easy and fast way to go grand palace from city area but beware to those scam around the pier.

up and down Chao Phaya. I really like riding on Chao Phaya river. there are many stops along the way and we actually had some fantastic photowalk piers and schedules.Highly recommended if you have a chance.

Best choice of transportation if you want to visit the areas next to the river. It's basically a water taxi in Bangkok. The best way to move around in Bangkok is the BTS, but it doesn't take you everywhere you want to go. So the express boat on the river is great way to visit different areas of the city next to the river like Asiatique night market, Wat Pho or China town. It's very cheap and convenient. The boats are big, so the waiting time for the boat is usually not more than 10 minutes.

Wat Arun and express boat trip. Express boats are crazy fast way to get up or down of the Chao Phraya river. I'd recommend to visit at least one "Wat" or in English called Buddhist temple calle "Wat Arun". If you plan to make longer round trip you can visit small floating market and have couple breaks between your trip. Just ask around of tourist trips or get your own personal boat to make trip on your own.

Fun on the Chao Phraya Commuter Boats. Taking a commuter boat up and down the Chao Praya is a great way to get to know the city and the river better; there are more than thirty piers in all, so it's quite a big system. (I'm talking the COMMUTER boat, not the TOURIST boat. The tourist boat is a lot more expensive and has a tour guide with a mike, which I consider obnoxious. Local commuter boats have no flags; express commuter boats have different colored flags for different routes, and the tourist boat, should you wish to avoid it, has a blue flag.)The easiest way to start is at Sathorn pier, which is a five minute walk from the Saphan Taksin stop on the BTS Silom Line (there are signs). Because not all routes go to all piers, it's best to know which pier you want to go to; Sathorn is pier "CEN Sathon," but the piers upstream and north are N1 - N33; and downstream and south S1 - S4. If you don't have Nancy Chandler's map, or a good transit map, there's a map at the pier that shows the routes and the flag color-codings. Once you know your destination, you can go to the ticket booth and purchase a (remarkably cheap) ticket. I generally go north to N13, Phra Athit. So now the fun begins! The Chao Praya is very much a working river, so you will see barges with little living quarters pulled by tugboats, "long tail" boats speeding along, barges going across the river, say to a temple, instead of up or down, hotel boats, as well as dinner and excursion boats. Generally there will be a scrum waiting for a boat to arrive; and sometimes there will be more than one line, so make sure to ask the "head mistress" of the line if you're in the right one. (Saying the name of your destination, like "Phra Athit," will be sufficient, and she will chivvy you into the right line if you're in the wrong one.) At last boat -- hopefully yours, and going in the right direction -- arrives! The process is carried out with great elan, even by Thai standards: The driver thumps the boat against the pier, a crewman leaps off, trailing a rope, and loops the rope round a piling, tightens it to draw the boat close, and then throws down the gangplank, onto which the crowd will surge, and then seek out seats on the boat. (At rush hour, you may end up standing.) You don't hand your ticket to anyone; a conductor rattling a cylindrical money box will walk through the boat and collect the tickets; and you can buy a ticket from her if you missed out at the ticket booth on the pier.)At this point, it's best to look out and fix some landmarks in your mind so that when you come back, you get off at the right pier! (All the piers have good signage, "N1" and so forth, but they are easy to miss if the boat is crowded and you can't a good view; and the unboarding/boarding process is very swift, so you don't want to be seated, deep in the boat, when you start trying to figure out where you really are.)The boats are festooned with Buddhist amulets, inside and out, and are very close to the water, which is breezy and fresh, especially when your boat crosses the wake of another boat, and things get excitingly choppy. (I have never been splashed, regardless, but I believe being splashed by the Chao Praya is comparatively safe, unlike being splashed by khlong water, which can be medically hazardous!) You will see gaudy hotels and vulgar condo buildings, but also wats, the Grand Palace, various naval facilities, riverside parks, restaurants, old-fashioned neighborhoods that just happen to touch on the river, restaurants, hospitals, universities... And of course since you are on a commuter boat, no tourists, and no English -- how pleasant! -- but working people, aunties with shopping bags, students, monks... Working Bangkok generally, going to or from home.And I like Phra Athit as a destination, even if it does have the disadvantage of being adjacent to the backpacker heaven of Khao San road, because there are some good restaurants there, and because the Old Fort is a good place to stroll, and very photogenic. Phra Athit road also has some lovely old-fashioned teak shophouses.* * *Oh, and the lines run from 6:00AM to 19:30PM, so you might want to plan for an early dinner if you plan to travel back down to Sathorn pier.

Exciting Ride. This is a good trip and fast to take you up the Chaopraya River. One thing though, either keep your mouth shut or have one of those mouth cups because sometime the water can splash in your mouth.

Cheap and scenic. This is a fun and cheap way to travel up and down the river to places located by it ... old Bangkok was oriented around the river front. Fun just to ride the boat up to the end of the line for the view, and then return.
tourist express boat. The tourist express boat is convenient and inexpensive. But the commentary is barely audible and heavily accented -> thus generally useless!

lovely trip with boat. lovely trip with boat , i enjoy the fresh windy , but you should go in the evening, it will more beautiful . In the day time we have plently of time to visit many temple & pagoda around the river.
Explore Bangkok on a boat. Dont go with the tourist boat, just buy a ticket and hop on the line service boat, get off on every stop and explore Bangkok.
Efficient But Crowded. The boats are very crowded, but it's a cheap and easy way to get up or down the Chao Praya. I always use it to get to the Bangkok Flower Market.
Beat the heat. The river ferry is the best way to get around town, cheap, cool and breezy and no traffic. Get away from it all and ride the boat from one end of the city for easy budget entertainment

Cheap and quick. The boat takes you to one stop or to the very end for 14Baht. Becareful you don't get on the tourist boat which is 150 Baht. Avoid the long boat which is 1000 Baht. Move to the back of the boat before your stop because the boat can become crowded. It may be really difficult to squeeze through the crowd. There are loud whistles to communicate with the Captian by the crew in the very back. Sometimes smoke and nasty water sprays into the boat---yet I rate this a 5 because it is very cheap and efficient. Sometimes the peirs are very hard to find because they are hidden deep inside markets. I suggest that when you make it to the street turn aroundd and memorize where you exited. Sometimes the pier is through a beautiful large arch, that may be without a sign. Some of the peirs are next to temples. I used the boat system every day.
Explore the city by water. fast, frequent, no fuss, a perfect way to explore the city travelling by water, can be crowded, but the entire city is crowded...

Perfect. The express boats are the best way to go around in Bangkok. Skip long Taxi rides if you can and take the boat. Airy, nice views of the suroundings, fast and comfortable. Take the boat up norths or south to the end. Then you get a very very cheep cruise on Chao Praya. After Rama VII there are no tourists only locals. Only draw back would be thay they don´t sell any refreshments.

A quick and enjoyable ride. When I arrived at the Sathorn pier I wanted to purchase a 15 baht ticket on the Orange Line boat but was charged 40 baht for a tourist ticket. That took me up to Wat Pho. From there, the frerry across to Wat Arun was a ridiculous 3 baht (8 cents). After returning to the Wat Pho pier, I just missed an Orange Line boat, but another one arrived in 10 minutes and I hopped on for the ride back to Sathorn. The ride was quick and there was a cool breeze coming off the river. It was certainly better than taking a taxi through Bangkok's notorious traffic jams. When you buy your ticket, make sure you specify that you want the Orange Line, so you don't get over charged.

A good experience. Most tourists like to take tourist boat, but the service comes with a guide. If you don't need a guide to explain here and there I would say let's take the express boat at any pier by yourself. It's fun though. Also you can see a lot more than tourist boat.

A cheap and fast way to travel in Bangkok. The fares on the express boats are slightly higher but overall the costs of public transport in Bangkok are ridiculously cheap! The river boats are a great way to travel as they avoid all the congested traffic on the roads. The express boats have limited stops so check that the boat will stop at the area that you want before boarding. Fares are collected on the boat most of the time although at peak hours or at some stops you can buy your ticket before you board.

Excellent way to show visitor friends. This transportation is cheap and convenient for hopping around temple along the river. Also local market at the end of temples trip was so good for handmade stuffs and street food.

Good way for Temple Visits and to Explore the Riverside. We were already at Sapan Takshin BTS station for our cooking school so we went to Sathorn Pier ( walking distance) connected to BTS. We were told to get onto orange flag boats which cost 15 bht per person one way. But when we went there, we only found the counter of Chao Phraya Tourist Express boat ( blue flag) which costs 40 bht per person one way. It was still quite cheap & convenient to explore the riverside area, visit the Grand Palace and many famous Wats , chinatown , asiatique,and even just to ride around. We sat on the front deck of the long boat and enjoyed the view. We then got down at 8th stop Tha Tien to explore the above. and then came back also on the same route. While coming back we sat inside and the continuous announcements in all languages were at times annoying but that was helpful info for some definitely.
Cheap and Time -saving. To avoid notorious traffic jam in Bangkok, the boat is clever choice who want to visit King palace, Wat Poh, War arun andthe other sightseeing spots along Chao Phraya river.

Good value but limited range. For a very reasonable price, you can purchase a day ticket to hop on and off these river boats as many times as you like, but plan your trip first, you could conceivably be better off buying single trips instead. The shortcomings are that the day ends around 19:00 and the selection of stops only covers a limited number of piers on the river and none on the, arguably more interesting, khlongs. In addition, some of the boats had endless unintelligible announcements, which were likely well intentioned, but of no use if you can't understand them.
Cheap and relaxing. We rode the boat just to look around. The ride is cheap, convenient and fun! There are many impressive buildings and houses along the river. A good alternative ride to take!
Good way to explore Bangkok"s riverside. Good way of transportation on the river, but staff is rude and unfriendly. Typically Thai style when many tourists are around.

KLONGS AND RIVER. BEST absolute best way to travel - when I visit Nonthaburi it takes about 45 minutes and is such a refreshing trip with the wind in your hair (be careful not to get water splashed on your mouth though :-) ) If you know BKK well the river and klongs are easy to negotiate and very cheap
Good Way to Sightsee in Bangkok. This is basically a water taxi that stops at all the tourist stops. It's really convenient and pretty cheap, especially if you see several things in a day.
Quick ride (an alternative to cabbing it out). Opt for this to get to the temples -- it's a fun way to get across the other side and experience a quick boat ride.

River boats. Best way to travel around and go shopping and see some things off the beaten path. Very reasonable in price and lots and of fun. There are some very beautiful houses on the river and just sitting back and looking at everything was a blast

Boat on the River Chao Phraya.. There are lots of boats to choose from, apart from the boutique bamboo clad ferry boats crossing from River City and other places, to restaurants the other side. The Chao Phraya Express boat as a restaurant boat plies the river in the evenings, bedecked with picturesque fairly lights all over, and offering a choice of menus, for a delightful and relaxing romantic cruise on this wide and bustling river, interspersed with tug boats with long wires hauling up to 3 huge barges at a time, slowly up and downstream all through the day and night! You pass by all the famous temples in Bangkok with wonderful views from the river.

Good and cheap. Good for travel on the river, fast enough, busiest especially in the morning and afternoon but more faster then taxi from Khao San road to Sathorn ( Taksin ) from you can take the Skytrain. Also you can stop to visit some tourist attractions.

Express Boat on the Kings River. A must do activity while in Bangkok. Best to take the Express boat till one end and from there to the other. Takes you about 3 hours but you have seen the whole river. You can also hop off and on while visiting Wat Arun, Grand Palace etc make sure you do it all the way from Asiatique till Nonthaburi Pier. Even nice during sunset time.

Access Bangkok's famous attractions. A great way to to see the city via it's river. The Chao Phraya Tourist Boat services the 8 piers so you can access Bangkok's famous attractions. A single trip is 40 baht. Highly recommended.
Cheap and fun. Take the boat with the orange flag, not the tourist blue one, then for THB 15 you get the authentic, in your face, Health and Safety deficient transport. Its quick! Hold tight!

Good for short river trip. Very good for short river trip (about 1 hour return). Not expensive, comfortable enough, Engl.guide. Daily tickets are available, so you can sail up and down the river escaping heat and traffic jams all day long :-)

Boat Ticket. There is a boat service every 30 minute each station in total 9station. you can get daily past price 150THB or one way ticket around 20THB. start your day here at 930am and the last boat at around 1840. or visit website at www.chaophrayatouristboat.com

Water perspective on Bangkok. boat edition of the hop on hop off bus. Nice and easy. Buy only a day pass if you intend to do more trips than appr 4 times the single journey price. Single journey are easily to combine with other means of transportation.
Best way to get around Bangkok. Marked with orange flags, these boats were our favorite way of getting around, especially on extra hot days! Between 9-15 baht per person, depending on how far you go.

Best public transit!. Buy your ticket onboard for just 15 Baht and ride with the locals -- and a few tourists. Avoid the tourist boats which cost much more, but go the same places. Check to make sure you are on the right boat; they are differentiated by colored flags. You probably want the orange flagged boat, which stops at all the major sites. Watch your step when you board and exit!

a great way to get around Bangkok, inexpensive, nice. I recently took the local ferries for the first time here. The express boats are really just one "route" along the same path, up and down the Chao Phya river, along the Bangkok side of that river.
